attractions.name: Banteay Srei
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Cambodia, Siem Reap, Siem Reap, Banteay Srei
reviews: The smallest, but amazing temple among other temples of Angkor Watt complex. Stone carvings are breathtaking. We included the visit of this temple with the trip to National Park. I recommend to go there early in the morning at 8 am, to have time to enjoy that beauty without crowds of tourists. they arrive there at around 8:30. No need to pay additional fee, your ticket for Angkor complex is active there. If you have one more day in Siem Reap - visit this place and you will not regret:)
There are no words to describe how big and magnificent this temple is! It is very impressive and huge! I am happy to have seen it!
Also know as pink temple, build in 12 century and the stone carbing are perfect. incredibel place and witnes of the Kmer empire beauty
Simply beautiful and rich. You must stop here and take close looks at the temples, the craft is totally out of this world...
History buried in the forest. Worth going. Not as crowd as other tourist sites and you can walk freely around.

attractions.name: Bayon Temple
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Cambodia, Siem Reap, Siem Reap, Bayon Temple
attractions.address: Angkor Thom, Angkor Archeological Park, Krong Siem Reap 17000
reviews: This is one of the most impressive of the astonishingly beautiful complex of temples that surround Siem Reap. It’s very close to Angkor Wat but very different. It’s also quite a small temple but full of atmosphere. I visited it twice as I purchased a (non particularly cheap) 3 days ticket and the second time it was almost the sunset and I found that it’s particularly beautiful in this kind of light. If you happen to visit Siem Reap don’t miss it, if you’re considering a trip there, this is one more reason to go. :)

Another name is the temple with faces. A little bit old and despite of the fact that it needs renovation, it’s still beautiful and worth visiting. While there, remember to take a pic while kissing the Buddha.

The Bayon Temple. The temple with the faces! Such a beautiful place! Remember to take a pic while kissing the buddha . At the West gate you can also check out the bridge with the Gods of Love on one side and the gods of evil on the other side. So many riches in this place. I had an amazing time!

This is one of they most amazing Temple in Siem Reap, Cambodia. If you want to do the tour i recommend a small tour for the first day because it's include all the amazing Temple. i don't recommend to rent a motorbike, the traffic is not good.

There was something new and fascinating to see everywhere you looked. The temple was different and more beautiful from every angle. The little nooks and crannies and thounsands of faces was something to behold. It was a beautiful place to be in the cool of the afternoon.

reviews: It has been very very old and can not be fixed up , people say it will disappear soon . I just can not believe my eyes , while I am always thinking who and how they made it happen in those old days , must be the God .

The so-called Bengmi Lei, in Cambodian, means the Lotus Pond, the name of the temple named after the Lotus, a Hindu temple dedicated to Shiva. The mysterious ancient temple was completely submerged in the forest because of natural and man-made disasters.

Beng Mealea is located 40 km east of Angkor Wat, Cambodia because of the farthest out circle, so few people come. Some people may feel that the repetition with Taplung Temple is not going to go! But! It was definitely an unexpected surprise! The architecture is symbiotic with the branches and more primitive than Taplung! The empty scene is easy to get the photos you want!
The most primitive of the Angkor remains preserved in the state of discovery, which is the most attractive place, all feel so primitive and magnificent landscape, very good.

The Khmer word for "beautiful lotus pond" is the idea of the Block. Here you can see the undiscovered Angkor, under the shadow of mottled trees, the collapsed temples, scattered stones, a ruined scene.

attractions.name: Tonle Sap Lake
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Cambodia, Siem Reap, Siem Reap, Tonle Sap Lake
reviews: The lake tour was fine, relaxing. It takes more than an hour to get there and the tour around the lake it's not that long, around 2 hours or 3. Watching the floating village and its people was amazing. The sunrise was not that special that day thou and the water is not green anymore, it's actually brown.

Cambodian style is the purest experience in capturing the silhouette of the water home at sunset in the lake of Donglisa, and taking pictures of the original human landscapes of the water home, church, school, market, Khmer people who live by the water, children who play with the water.

There is a sight called "floating village" in the lake, and in the rainy season, the water will not pass the wooden house, many Cambodian children are raised in such an environment, there are still many Vietnamese living here, Cambodia, Vietnam can not go back.

Lake tonleisa, also known as lake phnom penh, is located in the northern part of cambodia, and is located in the heart of cambodia, is the largest freshwater lake in south-east asia. The lakeside plain is flat and wide, 500km long and 110km wide, northwest to southeast, across Cambodia, and Phnom Penh and the Mekong River across Cambodia. It is like a huge green jade, set in the Cambodian land, for the Khmer nation development and prosperity provided a solid resource security, is the Cambodian people "Lake of Life".

The largest freshwater lake in Southeast Asia is flat, broad, 500 km long and 110 km wide, northwest to southeast, across Cambodia, in Phnom Penh city and across the Cambodia Mekong River. It is Cambodian people's "Lake of Life". She is also known as the "famous overseas" water home, a large number of stateless refugees who have lived in temporary shelters on the lake for decades. Some Cambodians, however, believe that they are deliberately staying here in case Vietnam is going to invade Cambodia in the future. The numbers are hard to measure, and they live a breathtakingly hard life, for both war and any reason.

attractions.name: Ta Prohm
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Cambodia, Siem Reap, Siem Reap, Ta Prohm
reviews: Ta Prohm . Dubbed the Tomb Raider temple  . Constructed in 1186 as one of the first buildings in Jayavarman VII’. Ta Prohm sits on Angkor’s small circuit, to reach Ta Prohm is about 5 min tuktuk ride from angkok wat . the famous Tomb Raider tree can be found in the central sanctuary. the narrow walkways and corridors inside Ta Prohm can get crowded and frustrating to navigate as crowd tend to flock there at the same time
best temple in the world with biggest tree and wonderfull
yes，deserived worth to visit here to find the mytery smile of angkor
Very old and big trees. The temple and trees are becoming one over thousand years. Lara Croft: Tomb Raider is filmed here.

The Taplun Temple, a monastery built by the Seventh King for his mother, is characterized by a fusion of buildings and trees, which are entangled in giant slab-root trees, with giant roots clinging to brick walls, and a vicissitudes of history.

This is one of the most incredible places I have ever travelled to. We arranged a sunrise tour and arrived at the temple at 5:00am. The temple grounds are still in magnificent condition and the enormity of the temple itself is far greater than you’re expecting. You truly feel like you’ve gone back in time. Pure magic!
the experience is breathtaking and  will you wonder how they built this temple out of hardship and love. thanks trip for helping me do the booking.
absolutely beautiful.. i strongly reccomend the 3 day pass and go to the farthest temples where there are less tourists and the most magical temples.

Dumaguete is located on Negros Island, the fifth largest island in the Philippines. The city is small, but there are many universities such as the oldest American university in Asia, as well as state universities, so it is called the "University Town". Dumaguete is not only idyllic and leisurely, but also has a strong book atmosphere. The fireworks and paradise on earth are perfectly combined in this small city, and a large number of Westerners have settled here. In addition, Dumaguete is very close to APO Island, Sumilon Island, and beaches that can "dance" with whale sharks, and can be reached by boat. There is an airport in the area, so Dumaguete has become a lot of tourists. The transit hub for island hopping tours, so the supporting facilities on the island are relatively complete and urbanized. In the city center, the semi-underground supermarket should be the largest supermarket in Dumaguete, with complete goods and strong popularity, and there are people coming and going every day. , The scale is large enough, locals also buy things here, the price is affordable, it is a good place for many international tourists to supplement their purchases before transit. There are not many scenic spots in Dumaguete City. If you have time, you can take a walk in the university in the city, learn about the local humanities, climb up to see the full view of Dumaguete City, and see the beautiful sunrise and sunset 😄, the surrounding island scenery The beautiful, clear water and white sand, the underwater scenery is beautiful, the coral group and various marine life form a colorful picture, which is breathtaking. Dumaguete is small, but it has a strong sense of freshness. In general, Dumaguete City is still a little bookish in the Philippines, although it is a little different from the bookish imagination... 😂See the world as you want😜👍

Siliman University is another learning institution located in the Visayas region of the Philippines. Like the University of Santo Tomas in Manila with the longest history in Asia, Siliman University is also the oldest American academic school in the Philippines. It was established in 1901 by the Presbyterian Board of Foreign mission. The American missionary named it after the famous New York philanthropist Dr. Hillice Brinsmade Silliman (Hillice Brinsmade Silliman). There are not only many diligent students on the campus, but also lush green trees everywhere and beautiful ocean views. This is a well-known and respected educational institution in the Philippines. It offers courses in almost every subject. Be sure to visit this well-preserved school, which was founded by the first Americans. It is located on the campus, facing Riesal Avenue and the sea. This is a model of colonial architecture.

1. There are not many scenic spots to see in Dumaguete, here is one; 2. In the university, there is only one exhibition hall in a teaching building; 3. The exhibits include ancient ceramics (there are actually Longquan kilns and blue and white porcelain from the Ming Dynasty), Ancient farm tools, ancient artworks, and a small part of ore gems; 4. Tickets are 50P

The university is built by the sea, a famous university in the Philippines. I mortgaged my ID when I went in, otherwise I wouldn’t be allowed to visit. Not as large as a Chinese university, the overall area is similar to that of domestic high schools!

reviews: The Oslob sharks are hand-fed, and this essentially guarantees they will show up to thrill guests, who can snap close-range photos.
must be there early to see the whale shark. affordable price also. might take a long time to travel depends on where u r coming from
Unbelievable experience, I needed to wait for a couple of hours but it was worth it. Those giants were really awesome! I definitely recommend everybody to experience it!!!

best experience in the Philippines! this is something you can not and should not miss. book at a good hotel so that you can be on the  first boat in the morning to swim with the whale sharks. we really enjoyed this activity. there were 4 whale sharks that morning and they swam very close to us. an unforgettable experience. take a bus from Cebu city or moalboal and go to oslob and to this activity the next morning!

we went there early in the morning around 6am and we were among the first to hop on the boat. There's a sudden scary feeling when you see these beautiful creatures but it's worth it. anyone traveling to Philippines should do snorkling with these shark whales. i highly recommend it.  - from Nepal

reviews: I think this church is very special. It is a church that puts religious and secular figures together, and they are side by side. However, this church has a very long history and the locals also value this church very much.

This church is very solemn. He does not have a particularly dazzling appearance, nor is it built to be particularly tall. He leaves the largest space for the hall. There are also very many people inside. There are many locals.

This old church has always been very prestigious in the local area. When I went there that day, I didn’t know if it was in time for a festival. The church was crowded with people inside and out. It seemed to be under maintenance. It was magnificent.

This is a church with a strong sense of history. There were many tourists who came to visit, but he himself came to this church to pray for a lot of people. He said that this church was left by the colonists at that time.

This church can be regarded as a local religious center, but when I went there, I didn't see many people in the afternoon. The size of the entire church is medium. There are statues of Catherine and Mary inside.

Such a good place to be in a life time! Its worth to go there, recommend to stay there for 1-2 nights to discover the way of life there.

I was on a boat trip in a day time (around 15 minutes). Usually in the morning there a not so many people. But it's good to experience in evening time too, cause the city lights look fabulous when it gets darker. There are lot of waterfalls and a small nice island on the river. It took like 2 hours to walk around.
Very short boat ride but very expensive ! Lots ppl queuing for it too.

Phoenix Old City 54 The night on both sides of the Li River, is a place where the wind blows drunken visitors. The wide river, full of river water; the curved board bridge, high and low jump rock; The rows of houses built by mountains, the red and green lights along the river banks, beautiful as a picture, like a poem. Here, modern and ancient interweave, sad and noisy interweave, elegant and country interweave, serenity and quaint interweave.

Phoenix Ancient City 51, the quiet flow of the Lijiang River, floating a sparkling glittering river lights, stars, drifting with the waves. Most of these river lights are made of color paper, red, pink, white. Some are set up as lotus throne, some make a catfish jump dragon door, some make "colored lamps to celebrate", some are called "unicorn". A wandering in the riverside visitors, spend a, two yuan, light beautiful river lights, carefully with both hands, gently into the water, silently make a wish in the heart, wish the family peace, filial happiness, hope for a smooth job, hope for social peace. More young couples, lit a river lamp, made a millennium wish, the sea withered stone rotten, never change heart. Phoenix ancient city, leaving people many romantic good words.

I had a feeling of transferring into that time. There were not many people, The house is clean. This family was really rich for that time!
Nothing much to know for a foreigner ! But so many Chinese packed in the small house !

The buildings with the charm of the ancient city are mainly on the south bank of Henan, and the former residence of the second brother is also on the south bank. Compared with the buildings next to the river such as Xiong Xiling's former residence and the Yang family's ancestral hall, the former residence of the second brother is relatively far from the riverside and closer to the Ximen Tower. There is an antique wooden sign when it is about to arrive

Shen Congwen’s former residence is one of the nine scenic spots in the ancient city of Phoenix. It is very interesting, has learned relevant historical knowledge, has a strong cultural heritage, has long knowledge, and is highly cost-effective. It is worth recommending to everyone, great.

The former residence of Shen Congwen is the place where Mr. Shen Congwen was born. It is a courtyard house with strong Xiangxi characteristics. This is a small courtyard with the architectural style of Ming and Qing Dynasties. Mr. Shen Congwen spent his childhood and adolescence here. It attracts countless literature lovers to worship every year. It is one of the most attractive cultural landscapes in Phoenix.

attractions.name: Miaoren Valley
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Hunan, Xiangxi, Fenghuang, Miaoren Valley
attractions.address: Miaoren Valley Scenic Spot, Shanjiang Town, Fenghuang County, Xiangxi Tujia and Miao Autonomous Prefecture
reviews: The Miaoren Valley has wonderful natural landscapes and well-preserved ancient Miao villages. The narrow and narrow valleys in the valleys in the caves, and the caves in the valleys are like a maze, better than a fairyland. The Miaoren Valley has strong ethnic customs and retains the most primitive and simple customs of the Phoenix Miao people.

Miaorengu Miao Village is located in Shanjiang Town, Fenghuang County, Hunan Province, only 2 kilometers away from Shanjiang Town. It is 18 kilometers away from the ancient city of Phoenix and covers an area of 4 square kilometers. The Miaoren Valley is recognized by experts and scholars at home and abroad as China's "living fossil of the Miao nationality" because of its wonderful natural landscape and well-preserved ancient Miao village.

The Miaoren Valley has wonderful natural landscapes and well-preserved ancient Miao villages. The narrow and narrow valleys in the valleys in the caves, and the caves in the valleys are like a maze, better than a fairyland. The Miaoren Valley has strong ethnic customs and retains the most primitive and simple customs of the Phoenix Miao people.

There is a bandit cave, and you have to take a boat to go there and come back by boat. People in the past may be smart, and a bandit cave is built anywhere, so you can't find it. But it's really tiring to climb up, the scenery is good.
Not suitable for taking children. I took my children and fell on the mountain and injured. The scenery is general, which is low in play and low in cost, and it needs to be improved.

attractions.name: Southern Great Wall
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Hunan, Xiangxi, Fenghuang, Southern Great Wall
reviews: transportation As it's been mentioned by other travellers, it's quite easy to get there by bus from Fenghuang city or Tongren (the Wall is between the cities). But it won't be so easy to get back from the Wall as it was in my case I've visited this "Great Wall" in the last day of my Tongren journey. So after this place I was thinking this would be easy to get to the airport. So naive I was. No buses, no taxi drivers around. I walked to the highway and wanted to hail one of the passing by cars. Spent around 40 minutes on the road side without any result. Locals didn't even know there was an airport in Tongren, they thought if its name is Fenghuang (Eng. Phoenix) airport then it should be nearby the Fenghuang city, which in the opposite direction from where it actually was. So I gave up asking local people on how to get out of that place, just started hailing the cars. Finally I got a family who wanted to help, but they also didn't know they had an airport in their city. They gave me a lift, though they used an online navigator to get to the right place. So be prepared for this kind of things when you're going to that Wall. P.S. it is not so spectacular as an original Great Wall of China. It will take up to 20-30 minutes to explore all the available surroundings. It will cost you 40 RMB and a lot of stress on how to find a way back to the city.

Hunan Great Wall of South China. The Southern Great Wall, also known as the border wall of the Miao border, is an ancient Chinese military defense project and a product of the Ming and Qing dynasties' protection of the southern Miao people. Now it has been renovated and turned into a tourist attraction, but very few people come here to visit. It may be a taste of the majestic and continuous extension of the Great Wall in the North. In contrast, this is only a miniature version, but it can also show its magnificence. .​​​
Well worth the visit, very fun place.
Good, it's quite special, you can go to Phoenix to go shopping.
The Great Wall is very short and not too many, it is simply weak compared to the Great Wall of the Ming Dynasty

reviews: Ha-ha!  The perfect place to play!  Take a walk, do not hesitate! Located in the middle of the city passing trough the river it allows you to feel the spirit of Feng Huang Ancient City! So many perfect shots could be made from this point! By the way, this is also test for his much alcohol did everyone take))))  come back here at night and you will see what I mean)))) Feel the river,  feel the city!
It is a row of stones that lead to the right in the Lijiang River. Same play, same play, is the best place to see the night scene.

The Tuojiang River is the mother river of the ancient city of Phoenix. It flows slowly around the city wall and forms the characteristics of the ancient city with the stilts on both sides. Tuojiang Jumping Rock is a landmark attraction in the ancient city, a must-visit place, if you don't go, you would be embarrassed to say that you have been to Phoenix, facing the North Gate Tower. There are two rows of jumping rocks, one is high and the other is short. People must step on the rocks and cross the river one by one to get the name. And standing in the middle of the jumping rock is the best spot for shooting Tuojiang and Fenghuang. There are so many people on holidays, it is best not to rush to the crowd, otherwise jumping from rock to river. The number of people wearing Miao costumes standing on the jumping rock and taking pictures is the most. There are renting clothes on both sides. It is recommended to negotiate the time and price first. It is best to rent out your own photos. If you are taking pictures, the lessor should generally persuade you to wash it out. , The price will be very expensive. On the bank of the Tuojiang River, especially in the early morning, there are many women washing clothes with a wooden racket in their hands. This is a good opportunity for photography enthusiasts.

Tuojiang Jumping Rock is one of the landmark attractions of the ancient city of Phoenix. It is actually a rock pier built on the Tuojiang River. It was built during the Kangxi period of the Qing Dynasty. It used to be one of the main passages in and out of the ancient city of Phoenix. Now it has become a scenic line. If you go up on holidays, it is really hard to move. At this time, you should choose to experience the quiet Tuojiang River and the ancient city in the early morning when there are few people, and then rush to take a cruise when the Tuojiang River Rafting Pier starts to operate to avoid long queues.
It is a unique passage connecting the two banks of the independent block stones. Standing on the jumping rock, behind the vast Lijiang River, the scenery is excellent.
The river is blue, the green hills are green, the stilts on both sides of the bank stand down, the beautiful scenery

The building is especially beautiful in night with lite illumination. Fenghuang Gu Cheng, I'm missing you

The name is the art gallery, is actually occupying the perfect landscape position, through the big floor-to-ceiling windows to look out the scenery of the place, phoenix out of the film excellent location. Exhibit Content: Called the Art Gallery, I think there is a bit of art exhibition, in fact there is nothing, only rows of invincible river view windows for tourists to enjoy and take pictures. Highlights of the exhibition: This row of windows sits west to east, the whole Lijiang River has a panoramic view, the two sides of the hanging building is built according to the water, scales, neat and not original customs, beautiful wheels and ~ tips: there is a long bench in front of the window, can sit can lie, side body niece sits the best, someone in the painting and Lijiang dance sense, It's so beautiful. Make sure you take a picture of it.

Lying on the Lijiang River, the Hongqiao Tower rises with its spectacular and beautiful, which is actually a overlapping landscape, from the bottom up, from ancient and now through more than 600 years of history.

The Hongqiao lies on the Tuojiang River in the ancient city of Phoenix. It is also the center of the ancient city. It has a history of more than 600 years. The bridge is built on two floors and now there are many shopping spots. Tickets are not required for the first floor of Hongqiao, the second floor of the Hongqiao Art Building is within 148 yuan of the Phoenix Ancient Town pass, and the upper second floor is for ticket checking. It is within walking distance of the ancient city. There is a parking lot next to Hongqiao, where you can take a battery car for 1 yuan. It is the most convenient means of transportation in and out of the ancient city.

It is most recommended to go to the bridge to see the night scene at night. There are many stilts around. The two banks of the Tuojiang River are picturesque and the view is very good. There are many tourists here after 11pm. On both sides of the first floor of Hongqiao are basically small stalls selling tourist goods. I don’t feel that there is anything particularly eye-catching, and the price is also expensive. There are many special products in the ancient city of Phoenix. There are three best currencies to buy Miao silver jewelry, especially not too expensive of. The Biancheng International Youth Hostel where we live is on Hongqiao Middle Road, a 5-minute walk from Hongqiao. The upper part of the Hongqiao Bridge is not big, but it is a great location to photograph the ancient city of Phoenix and Tuojiang. Sitting on it and watching the stilted buildings along the coast and the boats coming and going up and down on the Tuojiang River is also a good experience.
Nice attraction to take beautiful pictures

attractions.name: John Flynn Place Museum & Fred McKay Art Gallery
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, Australia, Queensland, Cloncurry Shire, Cloncurry, John Flynn Place Museum & Fred McKay Art Gallery

attractions.name: Dinosaur Stampede at Lark Quarry Conservation Park
Great Salt Lake
attractions.loc_tags: North America, United States, Utah, Salt Lake County, Salt Lake City, Great Salt Lake
reviews: The famous American city of Salt Lake City has a very famous tourist attraction, the Great Salt Lake. Many tourists come from far away. Come and see!

Salt Lake City is a shining metropolis. Temple Square is not only the heart of the city, but also the world center of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints. End your day at Temple Square at the Joseph Smith Memorial. After exploring the luxurious golden interiors, you can go to the top floor and sit down to enjoy the most beautiful views of the city.

Great Salt Lake Great Salt Lake, Utah. I finally saw its true colors today. Near the shore is a riverbed covered with white flowers and salt, and from a distance is a blue lake, a very peculiar landscape. The white salt under the blue sky, the lake water and the snow-capped mountains in the distance set against each other, forming a beautiful picture... Later, I drove more than 60 miles to Antelope Island, a small island in the Great Salt Lake. It can be seen that the "big" of the Great Salt Lake is not out of thin air. From.

The Great Salt Lake in Utah is the only place to go to Yellowstone Park. No matter how rushed, stop for a while and look at it. There is a lesson in our middle school English textbook: local locusts, seagulls come to rescue people. Right here! This is August 2014 and we rushed to Yellowstone Park early in the morning. This sunrise is beautiful!

The Great Salt Lake, although the area of the lake is gradually decreasing throughout the year, is still the largest salt lake in the Western Hemisphere. Salt Lake City, the capital of Utah, which is 70 kilometers away, is also named after her. Due to the vast saline-alkali land, barren hills and swamps by the lake, tourist facilities are difficult to be in place, resulting in not many tourists, but the endless lake is indeed shocking.

attractions.name: Salt Lake Temple
attractions.loc_tags: North America, United States, Utah, Salt Lake County, Salt Lake City, Salt Lake Temple
attractions.address: 50 N West Temple, Salt Lake City, UT 84150
reviews: Beautiful place to visit, especially during the holidays.  The entire square is wonderful and so are the people!

"The Temple Square, a group of buildings belonging to the headquarters of the Church of the Late Saints of Jesus Christ (Mormon Church) in the Salt Lake City Center, Utah, includes the Salt Lake City Temple, Salt Lake City Chapel, Salt Lake City Gathering Hall, the Seagull Monument and two visitor centers, covering a 10-acre area." The Salt Lake City Temple is the largest Mormon temple in the world. Temple Square is the hottest tourist attraction in Utah, attracting 3-5 million visitors a year, more than the Grand Canyon and Yellowstone Park, and 5.3 million in 2005 in five Utah national parks.

It is a gothic style elegant and simple large building, spire column, very magnificent, tower-shaped gate by four columns connected, the top of the door stood to see an eagle statue, the surrounding buildings also have strong religious meaning.

Salt Lake City Party Hall is the most beautiful and colorful building on the Temple Square, built in 1877. Today, the Hall often holds free concerts of famous artists from home and abroad on weekends. Salt Lake City Temple Salt Lake City Temple is the largest of more than 130 temples in the world of the late Christian Church of Saints, because of its Mormon headquarters and its historical significance, every year there are many followers from all over the world.

The Salt Lake Temple (Salt Lake Temple) is the largest and most famous of more than 130 temples in the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints in the world. It is a 10-acre (40,000 square meter) temple in Salt Lake City, Utah The core of the square. Because it is located at the headquarters of the Mormon Church and its historical significance. Every year there are many believers from all over the world.

attractions.name: Utah State Capitol Building
attractions.loc_tags: North America, United States, Utah, Salt Lake County, Salt Lake City, Utah State Capitol Building
attractions.address: 350 North State Street, 120 State Capitol, Salt Lake City, Utah 84114
reviews: Great experience!  On top of the hill with good views.  It is open for public daily.

The Utah State Government Building is majestic and is a landmark building in Salt Lake City. The area is very large, and there is a large lawn in front. On the day I went, I saw a pair of foreigners taking wedding photos.
Inside the building, there are marble walls, floors, stairs, and columns. There are complicated paintings on the dome. There are many sculptures in the corners of the hall... No wonder this is known as the most luxurious and spectacular state government in the United States.

The Utah State Government Building is a landmark in Salt Lake City. It was built in 1906 based on the Washington Capitol Building.
The exterior is elegant and solemn, and the interior is even more magnificent, with a wide lobby, beautiful dome, and rich collections, like a veritable art palace~

I have visited the Utah State Capitol for many, many years, first as a tourist, then as a site visit with the children, and then as a citizen to vote on the Utah legislature. It has never disappointed here. Visitors only learn about the history of the Utah State Capitol through the murals and sculptures that surround the building, including the ceiling and dome. If you are lucky enough to be in the town during the six weeks of the Legislative Council meeting, that is, from January 25, 2016 to March 10, 2016, you should go to the Council to observe. If you are a photographer, you must take a lot of pictures of marble halls, rooms, paintings, and take pictures of the scenery overlooking the entire Salt Lake Valley from east to south.

Salt Lake City. The state government is very similar to Capitol Hill, with a statue in one corner depicting the migration process of Mormonism. Imagine that Brigham Young led 70,000 followers across two states, came here, and established Salt Lake City on the edge of the desolate Great Salt Lake. It is really not an easy task.

attractions.name: Temple Square
attractions.loc_tags: North America, United States, Utah, Salt Lake County, Salt Lake City, Temple Square
attractions.address: 50 W North Temple, Salt Lake City, UT 84150-9709
reviews: We brought a 14-year-old international exchange student from Japan. Temple Square is the most popular tourist attraction in Utah. So we think it is an important stop. We told the Japanese-speaking missionary to plan a 15-minute sightseeing tour for our atheist students. We walked to the auditorium, the shrine, and then to the visitor center to the north, where we saw the statue of Jesus Christ and listened to the narration in Japanese. He was quiet at first, but ended up asking a lot of questions about God and Mormon temples. We ended up staying for almost 3 hours. The missionaries were very kind, and they also translated non-religious issues for us. They provided us with good advice on buying souvenirs and so on. The trees are lush and the flowers are blooming. There are also people in their 30s who appreciate architecture over there.

Temple Square is the most holy place in Utah, and it is also a holy place for local Mormonism. It is a place to communicate with God. There are many Mormon missionaries here to spread the gospel. Let us visit with wisdom and kindness!

Salt Lake City. Temple Square is a famous attraction in Salt Lake City and a Mormon church. There are two entrances, north and south. It is recommended to take pictures at the east pool. There are many volunteers here. There are volunteers in Chinese who can introduce you to the history of the church and Mormonism in Chinese.

Temple Square is a group of buildings belonging to the headquarters of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints (Mormon) in the center of Salt Lake City, Utah. It includes the Salt Lake City Temple, Salt Lake City Chapel, Salt Lake City Meeting Hall, Seagull Monument and Two A visitor center, covering 10 acres, surrounded by walls.

Many tulips are planted in the Temple Square in Salt Lake City, which are dotted with other flowers and dotted with the Temple Square. This is the world center of Mormonism. There are conference centers, office buildings, management buildings, concert halls, memorial halls, etc. around the square. Any building is guided and explained by Mormon missionaries or volunteers. Yes. It takes a long time to walk around.

attractions.name: This is the Place Heritage Park
attractions.loc_tags: North America, United States, Utah, Salt Lake County, Salt Lake City, This is the Place Heritage Park
attractions.address: 2601 E Sunnyside Ave, Salt Lake City, UT 84108-1453
reviews: The views are amazing and well worth a visit!
The views are really good and well worth a visit.

This is our first stop in Salt Lake City. We have friends who have lived in this area for many years. This is where the first Mormon settlers arrived. There are many monuments describing this period of history, and there is also a visitor center with short films about this period of history.
It's pretty good, there are not many people, come and have a look.

I have spent almost 5 years next to this heritage park, from being single to getting married until my daughter is 6 years old. I can’t remember how many times I have been here. If there is a paradise, this is probably it. Full of memories

attractions.name: The Tabernacle
attractions.loc_tags: North America, United States, Utah, Salt Lake County, Salt Lake City, The Tabernacle
attractions.address: 50 E North Temple, (at the Temple Square Tabernacle), Salt Lake City, UT 84150-9001
reviews: Enjoyed the recital at noon.  You can walk around and across to the temple square for pictures.

worth going. Some volunteers explained that volunteers from Hong Kong and the Philippines used English and Chinese to explain how to become a religious cult. Mormonism is not a cult. The Hong Kong girl wept emotionally. Hear the organ playing. The voice feels very deep, melodious and holy

Amazing architecture is also a super feat in terms of design and construction. Very beautiful place. Be sure to watch the demonstration of the needle landing in the choir hall. During my visit, the temple was closed to the public, but I originally wanted to visit it.

The Great Chapel is in the Temple Square. The most worth seeing is the 12th largest organ performance in the world. The feeling of playing with more than 16,000 organ pipes is super explosive. There is no microphone in the chapel, and the unique sound transmission effect is directly praised.

The Salt Lake City Chapel is a large circular single-story building. The ceiling is supported by 44 sandstone pillars. It has a history of 150 years. It has 8,000 seats and can accommodate 12,000 people. On the choir of the Great Chapel is the largest pipe organ in the world. It consists of 11,000 tubes of various sizes and is four stories high. The Mormon Church Choir sings hymns under the accompaniment of this pipe organ. The sound is beautiful, and the reverberation is around the beam! It’s a pity that I went in twice and didn’t see the Cultist concert

attractions.name: Antelope Island State Park
attractions.loc_tags: North America, United States, Utah, Salt Lake County, Salt Lake City, Antelope Island State Park
reviews: One of the many state parks, not so well known and nice views

Antelope Canyon is located in the small town of Page, on the border of Arizona and Utah. It is called about eight hours from Los Angeles, six hours from Salt Lake City, and four hours from Las Vegas. It looks like a wild land, but there is a cave inside. Another amazing attraction. The only way to get here is to drive. If you do not plan to rent a car, you can consider joining a one-day or two-day tour from Las Vegas.

It is very close to Salt Lake City and is part of the Great Salt Lake. The park is quite large and sparsely populated. The cruise ship seems to be not open yet; it is more suitable for foreigners to walk and hike. However, there are a large number of worms gathered in the grass on the roadside and the shore. When people get off the car, they are surrounded by worms. As soon as the car stops, the worms will stick up. If you want to go down and take pictures, you have to risk your life.

Antelope Island State Park, Salt Lake City is not too far away. The scenery in the park is simply beautiful. The point is that there is no one. We walked in a team for a whole day. Although the people were tired, the scenery was definitely worth it.
Because I like Salt Lake City more here, I also want to see Salt Lake City in the snow in winter.

attractions.name: Natural History Museum of Utah
attractions.loc_tags: North America, United States, Utah, Salt Lake County, Salt Lake City, Natural History Museum of Utah
attractions.address: 301 Wakara Way, Salt Lake City, UT 84108
reviews: When I went to SLC to visit my children, I had the opportunity to visit the museum. This is one of the best natural history museums I have seen so far and I highly recommend it. There are many interesting exhibitions (my favorite is a movie about DNA viewed through an electron microscope. You can associate every subject. Children have many opportunities to explore the entire museum. You must visit, I dare Guarantee you will like it.

The museum itself is very beautiful. It was built at the foot of the mountain and built on the mountain. It blends with the surrounding environment very well. It is quite good. I can also go hiking here. The museum is also worth visiting.

The main exhibits in this museum are some ancient creatures, which may still be a little small, but there are still a lot of ancient animal specimens on display, which is a complement to the larger museum.

A very lively and fun natural history museum. This museum contains specimens and skeleton fossils of various animals that are the most representative of various periods on the earth. You can learn a lot of new knowledge here.
This museum can be regarded as a very good natural history museum. Although its scale may not be that big, it may be regarded as a special museum if you are interested in dinosaurs.

attractions.name: Family History Library
attractions.loc_tags: North America, United States, Utah, Salt Lake County, Salt Lake City, Family History Library
attractions.address: 35 North West Temple Street, Salt Lake City, UT 84150-9710
reviews: Wonderful place. Ignited a real interest in my family history. Loads of help and no pushing of LDS beliefs at all.

The genealogy library is full of computers. It was established by the local Mormon Church. Here you can find the genealogy and personal stories of many people in the world. Children also like a few software to draw their heads and record their own stories. Here I set up Family tree
It's worth a visit, it's fun to get to know your family

The genealogy library is a very long museum. There are a lot of genealogy collections for visitors to visit. The entire library is also open to the public for free, and the entire space is also very spacious.
It feels like a very special library. After visiting the church, it is very close to the church, but because we may not be particularly interested in this purely literal thing, we didn't go in.

attractions.name: Pearl Harbor
attractions.loc_tags: North America, United States, Hawaii, Honolulu, Pearl Harbor
attractions.open_status: Pearl Harbor is open all day. Pearl Harbor Visitor Center is open from 7:00-17:00, closed on Thanksgiving, Christmas and New Year's Day.
reviews: Its all about the history and a monument respecting those American soldiers who died during the attack of Japan in WWII

We did the trolley hop on hop off to get to the Pearl Harbor. We only have limited time so we were not able to go to the submarine and the other sights. But it was quite impressive and full of information. Not to be missed when visiting Honolulu!
Historical site which lots of interesting exhibits from the Pacific War/WW2, and not to be missed USS Arizona Memorial, the battleship USS Missouri.
Overall good tour n reasonable price tour.
Arrive early in the morning in order to get free parking and a free tour.  Look online for directions.

attractions.name: Hanauma Bay
attractions.loc_tags: North America, United States, Hawaii, Honolulu, Hanauma Bay
attractions.open_status: November-March: Wednesday-Monday 6:00-18:00, April-October: Wednesday-Monday 6:00-19:00, the second and fourth Saturdays of each month 6:00-22 :00
reviews: beautiful bay preserve all kinds of tropical fishes.Worthy to visit one in a lifetime

Dinosaur Bay is the favorite place for tourists to go scuba diving in Hawaii. The water is shallow, the waves are small, the fish are large, the scenery is beautiful, there are various natural coral reefs and tropical fish. Dinosaur Bay is a regional beach park and a state underwater park. Dinosaur Bay is currently one of the most popular attractions on Oahu Island in Hawaii, especially during the summer season, where parking is not available until 9am. Dinosaur Bay is named for looking like a sleeping dinosaur from a distance, a sea of life, one of Hawaii's best swimming and snorkeling sites.

Going to the beautiful dinosaur bay in the morning, breathing fresh air, feeling the harmony of human and nature everywhere, watching the sunset on the beach in the evening, I just remembered that this trip is an island tour, no arrangements tomorrow, a leisure day.
This is a popular snorkeling sanctuary, Chinese people are called Ta dinosaur Bay, initially do not know why, but after checking Google maps, it became enlightened, hahaha, it is really very image.
So many colorful fish! Great snorkeling, from what I can tell. I think there's a lot of variety and colorful fish, I even saw a turtle!

attractions.name: Kualoa Ranch
attractions.loc_tags: North America, United States, Hawaii, Honolulu, Kualoa Ranch
attractions.open_status: 7:30-18:00 (Monday-Sunday), please arrive at the ranch before 8:00.
reviews: Its an amazing place where you can live your own Jurassic park story with all those moments which made u excited while watching this epic movie series
one of my best experience!
it's so cool

If you come in the spring, try to do your activity early in the morning to avoid being outdoors when it gets hot. Our horseback riding session started at 8am and the weather was perfect. Our group was small -- only 5 of us, and our guide was really nice. We got to ride through areas of the ranch where Jumanji, Lost, Kong Skull Island, Jurassic Park, and other movies were filmed! You can't bring bags with you on horseback, so if you're doing that, you'll have to rent a locker for $5 or lock your stuff in the trunk of your car.They also have ATVing, ziplining, and bus tour activities!
Movie buff...See Where Jurassic World, Godzilla, Skull Island & Jurassic Park were Filmed! Hawaii Tours & Activities

attractions.name: Diamond Head
attractions.loc_tags: North America, United States, Hawaii, Honolulu, Diamond Head
attractions.address: Diamond Head Road, Honolulu, Oahu, HI
reviews: Diamond Head is another Diamond in the jewel of Hawaii, its basically a few miles hike with beautiful sceneries. You can take a bus to reach here and start your journey by walking
Diamond is a great place to get in a couple hour hike and awesome views of the ocean and city. The hike is not difficult. has pavement and stairs.
Great walk up diamond head.  You can get the trolly from Waikiki to the entrance of a hike.  beautiful views that make the hike worthwhile.  Small admission fee ($1)
Diamond Head is worth a visit. An easy walk up you will be rewarded with great views of the ocean and towards Waikiki.
The hike up the moutain was great! Its a nicr and east climb and your reward when you get up there is a great view of the sea and Honololulu.

attractions.name: Dole Plantation
attractions.loc_tags: North America, United States, Hawaii, Honolulu, Dole Plantation
reviews: I always thought that the Dole Plantation had an admission fee, so I was surprised to find out it was free. We parked in the large lot and walked into the souvenir shop. Tip: don't go too crazy because many of the items you can find at the local grocery store for cheaper. Some items are exclusive to the plantation. We had to get a Dole Whip of course...a $7 soft serve though...ouch...we wanted to get another one, but it just costs too much for what you get. We enjoyed our soft serve outside and walked around the garden. You can put in some quarters to get some fish food and feed the koi in the pond. If you want to take the kids on the Dole train, there's an additional fee.
Great place the pineapple ice cream is great the train ride is informative and they have a pineapple cutting demo every 30 min or so
Touristy place but kind of a must if you’re visiting. Make sure to try the dole whip!
I love this place. Very spiritual with pearls beads and outdoor garden.

Love to visit this attraction. Great for children of all ages and adults too! Enjoy a relaxing 20 minute train ride around the property or go through the World's Largest Maze! There's a wonderful gift shop so much more!

attractions.name: Nu'uanu Pali Lookout
attractions.loc_tags: North America, United States, Hawaii, Honolulu, Nu'uanu Pali Lookout
reviews: Great lookout point, beautiful view. Several hikes lead to here including Old Pali road.
Easy to get to lookout with a beautiful view.  Great for the entire family from the toddlers to the grand parents.

An amazing lookout! It is so beautiful and windy up here! Just pay for parking and you could literally spend all day here! We wanted to but had to use a restroom after an hour.. but a must checkout! Amazing after a hike!
Beautiful views and photos to be taken. A very historical place to visit. Parking is not the best, and you have to pay for it. No hiking involved.
Amazing lookout! Beware: it gets VERY windy. Parking is cheap, and free if you're military.

attractions.name: Missouri Battleship Memorial
attractions.loc_tags: North America, United States, Hawaii, Honolulu, Missouri Battleship Memorial
attractions.open_status: 7:00-16:00 June 1st - August 31st Summer Memorial Hall is open daily from 8:00-17:00, the last bus into Missouri is 15:00, Thanksgiving, Christmas, New Year 1 Closed on the 1st of January
reviews: worthy to visit to know WWII history
This memorial was fascinating and very well done! I loved seeing how a ship works as well as learning about the history of WWII.
Part of the tour when you visit Pearl Harbor, this memorial ship is very interesting to explore.  If you enjoy history, this is a must in Oahu.

This historical battleship is best known as the place where Japan surrendered but there's so much more to see.  Try your best the schedule the USS Memorial at the beginning or end of your stay so you won't feel rush here.
The bloodiest war in human history was brought to an end on this amazing ship.

attractions.name: USS Arizona Memorial
attractions.loc_tags: North America, United States, Hawaii, Honolulu, USS Arizona Memorial
attractions.open_status: Memorial Hall Monday-Sunday 7:00-17:00, Thanksgiving Day, Christmas, New Year's Day Closed; ferry 8:00-15:00, every 15 minutes.
reviews: A great experience and opportunity to learn about important historical events in America's history as a world power. A humbling experience to visit the site where so many lost their lives on that fateful day. Plan to go early and research other Pearl Harbor options online to determine if you wish to visit other sites in addition to the Arizona Memorial. Visit www.LoveHawaiiVillas.com for more information.
Well worth it, even if you are not American.  It's an important historical site
What a great place to go if you are looking to spend the day with family and learn about Pearl Harbor! Definitely check it out if you can!
Arrive early if you want to get tickets to the Arizona. Before you go to the memorial they'll show you a 25 minute documentary... bring tissues.

A great place to learn about what transpired here back in 1941. There's a video that you watch that gives a brief history of the events leading up to the attack, after the video then you get to board the boats and ferry on over to the Arizona. Be sure to get their early for tickets on weekends because they don't last long. If you don't get there in time for a ticket there are other available sights such as the Bowfin tour, there's a museum, and the Mighty Mo tour on ford island too.

attractions.name: Iolani Palace
attractions.loc_tags: North America, United States, Hawaii, Honolulu, Iolani Palace
reviews: Raining?  Too bad.  Take a tour of the only royal palace on U.S. soil.  Find out what Hawaii was before we grabbed it.
Learn about Hawaiian Royalty and see the Iolani Palace that was ahead of its time.  See the gifts given to the King and Queen from all over the world.
Historically a beautiful place to see how they lived and what happened to the queen while she was held captive in her own room.
The only palace in the United States!  Go for the tour. ..it's worth it!  Learn about the history and culture of Hawaii!

A very informative tour and experience. There's a guided tour and audio tour option available for purchase. Guided tours were only offered on a select few days and hours, audio tours not so much. I thought it was a bit pricey for the tours ($22 guided, $15 audio) but that's just me. All in all, beautiful palace and rich history!

attractions.name: Wat Phra That
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Thailand, Chiang Mai, Chiang Mai, Wat Phra That
attractions.address: 9 Group9 Tambon Su Thep, Amphoe Mueang Chiang Mai, Chang Wat Chiang Mai 50200
reviews: You’ve never been to Chian Mai unless you visited this beautiful and stunning place. It never failed to amazed me and took my breathe away. The gorgeous Chiang Mai city view is superb, the Buddhist temple experienced is beyond, the weather is so perfect, side trips were awesome, it’s very unforgettable. I should've done this the first time I came to Chiang Mai.

Wat Phra Tat Chiang Mai is a Theravada Buddhist temple (wat) in Chiang Mai Province, Thailand.The temple is often referred to as "Doi Suthep" although this is actually the name of the mountain where it's located.
Overlooking the city from its mountain throne, Wat Phra That Doi Suthep is one of northern Thailand's most sacred temples.

Overall cheap trip, nice trip, you can take local transport near from chiang mai university only 80baths roundtrip. Enterance ticket is 30bath. good place for photography and to know temple building culture in thailand(chiang mai).
this is one of significant pagoda for Chiang Mai. It likes a symbol of city. Great place to visit a golden building local at a really top of the mountain.

attractions.name: The Chiang Mai Night Safari
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Thailand, Chiang Mai, Hang Dong, Nong Kwai, The Chiang Mai Night Safari
attractions.address: 33 Moo 12, Tambon Nongkwaii Hangdong District, Chiang Mai 50230
reviews: Chiang Mai Night Safari · Savanna Safari (open 18:00-23:00): A journey through the wild African savannas where you can watch animal all over the planet.Do careful not to feed them while you on tram and don't get on board or get off the tram!
Chiang Mai Night Safari is believed to be the first nocturnal zoo in Thailand and is opened back then on February 6, 2006
aweskme, highly recommended! purchase tickets with transportation foe the convenience. the animals really cone up close!

I highly recommend the Chiang Mai Night Safari zoo to you! You can see, feed and touch some animals during your visit. Giraffes feeding is one of the most exciting and interesting part - please take good care of your bananas, otherwise you will lose the chance to feed them
Good

attractions.name: Tha Phae Gate
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Thailand, Chiang Mai, Chiang Mai, Tha Phae Gate
attractions.address: Thapae Rd, Chang Khlan Sub-district, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50200
reviews: Phae Gate was a fortress back then on 13th century.Known as a site for many community events, this preserved city gate dates back to ancient times.
Phae Gate is an epicenter for Chiang Mai tourism, boasting multitude of hotels, bars, restaurants, cafes, and massage.

The Phae Gate is easy to go. which is located in old town. There is the great place to visit for the traveller who likes the history of Thailand. Also, there has lots of restaurants and cafe near the gate. People can enjoy the time during the trip.

Tha Phae Gate is a focal meeting place for most tourists with pigeons being the number 1 attraction for photos being taken and at different times of the year live entertainment is worth a visit even during covid 19times but unfortunately now many rough sleepers
Historical site which situated in the city central, separated two main streets, walked around to experience the ambient...

attractions.name: Chiang Mai University
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Thailand, Chiang Mai, Chiang Mai, Chiang Mai University
attractions.address: 239, Huay Kaew Road, Muang District, Chiang Mai
reviews: Chiang Mai University aims to be a 'Green and Healthy University' , a society of Lanna Cultural conservation and developing sustainable economy. They provide multiple courses for their people to explore and learn.
Chiang Mai University was founded in January 1964, in a Royal Charter granted by His Majesty King Bhumibol Adulyadej.

I studied at CMU a few years ago, and it is a huge and beautiful university. There are many places to explore by using the free purple shuttles and there is a lot of cheap and good food in the cafeterias.

I studied here for my summers during undergrad and yes I've gone back because my family lives in Thailand. I loved the University. It's huge, but they have many pretty places to see and EAT! If you like nature and cooler weather and need to study abroad - CMU is the best place.

Founded in 1964, Chiang Mai University is the only national university in the city and one of the most beautiful universities in Thailand. The campus has lush green space and great scenery. The most famous one is Jingxin Lake, which reflects the scenery of Suthep Mountain, which is beautiful and picturesque. Because Chiang Mai University has adopted control measures for tourist sightseeing, tourists need to take the school’s sightseeing bus at the main entrance of the university, which departs every 30 minutes, and will stop at the Buddhist building and Jingxin Lake.

attractions.name: Wat Chedi Luang
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Thailand, Chiang Mai, Chiang Mai, Wat Chedi Luang
attractions.address: 103 Prapokkloa Rd, Tambon Si Phum, Mueang Chiang Mai District, Chiang Mai 50200
reviews: Wat Chedi Luang's massive chedi (pagoda) was built sometime between 1385 and 1402, during the reign of King Saen Muang Ma.
Wat Chedi Luang is a Buddhist temple in the historic centre of Chiang Mai, Thailand.The current temple grounds were originally made up of three temples.
A nice change in the style of Thai temples. Not as bright, gold or boisterous as the ones in the major cities but definitely has its own charm
I love chiang mai.. Like air fresh n elephant..

attractions.name: Doi Suthep
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Thailand, Chiang Mai, Chiang Mai, Doi Suthep
reviews: Rising 1676 metres above the city of Chiang Mai, Doi Suthep is one of the most revered religious destinations in Thailand.
Doi Suthep, is a mountain west of Chiang Mai, Thailand. It is 1,676 metres in elevation and is one of the twin peaks of a granite mountain.The other peak is known as Doi Pui and is slightly higher.

"Sutie" means "Xianyou" in Thai, and the locals also call this mountain "Yuxianshan" or "Huixianshan". Located in the western outskirts of the ancient city of Chiang Mai, at an altitude of 1667 meters, it is a famous Buddhist holy land in Thailand. The mountain is full of five-colored roses, the top of the mountain is surrounded by white clouds, and the climate is cool, which is very suitable for summer leisure. There are 300 steps to reach the observation deck on the top of the mountain, with a panoramic view of the downtown area of Chiang Mai, which is a natural observation deck in Chiang Mai. The famous Ssangyong Temple is built on the mountain, as well as the Phu Ping Palace, the summer residence of the King of Thailand.

We don't spend much time wandering in Chiang Mai city, and the sights we went to are also good, but Doi Suthep is highly recommended. Doi Suthep Mountain is the closest mountain to Chiang Mai. It is only 15 kilometers away from the ancient city of Chiang Mai to the iconic building of Doi Suthep Mountain. However, it has to go through many detours. You can charter a car or use a double car to go up the mountain. More dizzy, we went up the mountain in a double car. Suthep Mountain is 1,676 meters above sea level. It is named after a hermit. It is a mountain with many tourists and dense forests. Tickets are free. The temples on the mountain are sold separately, but they are not expensive. The slopes are full of colored roses. White clouds and beautiful scenery. Walk 300 steps to reach the observation deck on the top of the mountain. You can have a panoramic view of the downtown area of Chiang Mai. It is a natural observation deck in Chiang Mai.

Suthep Mountain itself is worth visiting. In addition, there is a very important Ssangyong Temple on the mountain. The uphill is from the large steps with dragon-shaped sculptures on both sides. The surrounding natural environment is good and the trees are lush.

Changkang Road night market every night will have, although the number and scale of the weekend night market is small, but very has its own characteristics, to Chiang Mai, basically have to go to Changkang Road night market to go shopping.

There are two relatively large night markets in Chiang Mai. One is the night market on weekdays, which is the Changkang night market we go to. It is open every day. The Changkang night market is very large. If you can’t catch up with the weekend night market, it’s actually enough for you to visit. As long as you arrive at the Changkang Night Market, you will find that it is more than just a night market, but a street shop that can’t be seen from both sides of the road, and there will be night markets of various sizes on both sides of the road. Markets, such as the Haystack Night Market, are also in this Changkang Road Night Market. There are also various fish spa shops and Massage shops in the night market.

There are a lot of literary and artistic shops, cafes, small bars, and art and fashion shops, and many of them are opened by artists and star performers. The literary and artistic scenes are fresh and very suitable for taking pictures.

Nimman Road, also called Nimman Road or Nimman Hamming Road, netizens jokingly call this road "Your mother calls you road", but it is not so much a road, as a few crossing streets, it is quiet and interesting. Various small shops and cafes gather here, each with its bright and eye-catching signs, and various cartoon dolls as the shop image.

attractions.name: Lila Thai Massage(Prapokkloa Branch)
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Thailand, Chiang Mai, Chiang Mai, Lila Thai Massage(Prapokkloa Branch)
attractions.address: 100 Rajchavithi Road | Sriphum subdistrict, Chiang Mai
reviews: Thailand is a country renowned for their massages, so it is no wonder that spas line the streets of the northern city of Chiang Mai is all over the places.

When you come to Chiang Mai, you must experience the horse-killing chicken-Lila Thai massage (women's prison massage), not far from the Moon Huanglong Hotel where we stayed. Let's make an appointment first. After participating in the jungle leap, we will come back at 9pm. The service staff can speak simple Chinese and there is no obstacle to making an appointment. I went there twice during my stay in Chiang Mai. The first time I did a full-body massage with 300 plants, and the second time my companion chose a foot massage. Generally speaking, the attitude is gentle, the massage is professional, the environment is relaxing, and the experience is good. After the massage, there are tea and snacks.

Exprisoers and women's prison are two families. The former is a female prisoner who has been released, and the latter is still serving his sentence. The former is 250 an hour and 500 two hours, and the latter is 200 an hour and 400 two hours. The former has many branches, while the latter has only one store, and the charging locations are all female prison guards. The navigator did not locate the latter, and I asked the driver of Shuangtiao for the way he had passed. It turned out that it was referring to ex. When I walked back, I suddenly saw the prison. It's really hot. Arrived at 8:15 this morning, there is no queue, and there are three seats left. It will be full at about ten. The women’s prison massage restaurant is very cheap, cheaper than the night market, the food is delicious, and the presentation is also very good. In short, I am still satisfied with it. But I don’t like Chiang Mai anymore. The visa on arrival is clearly free, and the staff has to ask for 200 baht, which is a handling fee, but in fact it is a tip. If you don’t give it, let’s fill out an “interview form” and rely on me to travel and interview, so I’ll die. She said that her handling fee was not clearly marked, and she said, "I ask you to fill it out! I ask you to fill it out!" That face was as black as her dead. No visa if you don't give money! Another thing that pitted this person was that the rented car was parked illegally on the red and white lines, and the tires of the car were locked. The traffic police came and asked him for 1,000 baht, and then said he would give him 500 baht to do it, and then let it go. It felt like trying to pit the Chinese. , I gave him the money, but I didn’t have any proof. I don’t know if there were any moths when changing cars! Before I came, many people told me that the people in the Buddhist country of Thailand are simple and kind. Hehe, no longer come to Thailand in this life. The prices are ridiculously high, 60 baht per kilogram of cabbage, 7.5 per kilogram of cabbage, no one buys 0.99 cabbage in my family. . . For 40 baht a kilo of oranges, 5 yuan a catty, haha 3 yuan for my family. 40 baht a piece of ice cream, 10 yuan, my family's three yuan ice cream is very delicious. Alas, Thailand has already reached this point, and the Chinese should not come to help the poor. China is the poorest one.

If you want to massage, you have to make an appointment. Every day, the appointments are full. You must abide by the rules and regulations inside. The consumption is a bit mandatory. You need to take a taxi to get in. It is not allowed to take pictures indoors. The technique is traditional Thai massage, which is not expensive at all. , The service is good, the water is still very diligent, you can choose the length of the massage, the supporting facilities are good, and you can have a meal after you press it, which is very convenient.

Chiang Mai’s massage is a must go, the general shop is as you enter and press ~ 200 plants per hour for a foot bath, less than 40 yuan, absolute enjoyment. That is, because of the increased publicity in the women’s prison, all Chinese are queuing. The price ranges from low to high. I made a coconut oil set meal, one hour of coconut mud to exfoliate the whole body, one hour of coconut oil massage, it is completely sweet, I really want to take a bite by myself, it is comfortable, the price is 900, only 180RMB, It’s in the ancient city, just press

attractions.name: Koh Larn

reviews: Ko Lan is a small Thai island off the coast of Pattaya, in the Gulf of Thailand. It’s known for its beaches, set against a backdrop of wooded hills. In the north, Ta Waen Beach is dotted with restaurants and shops. A large, stingray-shaped building dominates Samae Beach’s north end.The beach is famed for its clear water and sunset views. Small monkeys inhabit the hills around coral-ringed Nual Beach, in the south.
The place is not crowded unlike other beaches. Best place to choose with Family and Friends if you prefer being exclusive.
there's lots of good beaches and places for the girls to take selfies.recommended

this island is the perfect getaway from crazy pattaya. its absolutely beautiful with lots of nature to explore. you can take a short hike up to the windmill viewpoint and catch views of the beautiful beach and the bustling city of pattaya. theres also countless beaches to explore from, and the option for many water sports. you can rent a motorbike for 300baht/day and roam around the entire island.

attractions.address: 436/49 Mu 9 Beach Road 1 Alley, Nong Prue, Bang Lamung, 20150, Chonburi
reviews: Teddy Bear Museum Pattaya is the first and only museum in Southeast Asia. It is the new Teddy Bear Museum just opened back then on 2013. Operation hours from 10:30am to 0700pm daily.
very fun to visit this place because have more zone for take a photo i like it.

Teddy Bear Museum is a great place to visit no matter if you are traveling with kids or not. We, as adults, enjoyed seeing cute teddy bears in all shapes and sizes. Visit there was like a travel back in time and making our childhood dreams come true. We loved it!
This place is great for taking kids, take pictures

The Pattaya Teddy Bear Museum is the first and only Teddy Bear Museum in Southeast Asia. Unlike any other place in the world, this new museum will give visitors happiness and impression. Enjoy taking pictures with more than one thousand teddy bear dolls. The bear dolls range from small to large, and the costume of each bear will be the same as the concept of each region. The museum has a total of twelve areas: 1. Inca area 2． Dinosaur area 3. Fossil area 4. Africa area 5. Thailand area 6. Seabed area 7. Eskimo area 8. Santa Claus City 9. The universe area 10. Fairy tale area 11. China 12. European area. Visitors can experience the cuteness of teddy bears, whether they hold or touch it. The temperature, brightness and sound effects have been adjusted to make you feel like you are in a real teddy bear world. Every weekend there will be special performances of teddy bears in the fairy tale area. The museum has many highlights. There are many beautiful corners in various areas where you can take photos and collect photos, especially in the fairy tale area because there are so many places to rest and there are slides for children to play. There are also tree houses, four-dimensional pools and other buildings that leave a good impression on visitors to the Teddy Bear Museum. Opening hours: 09:00-22:00 (January 1st-December 31st, Monday-Sunday) Ticket guide: Adults 250 baht, children 150 baht. Time reference: 1-3 hours
