The most important building for Tibetan culture and politics, where both branches were combined into ruling under 5th Dalai Lama.

attractions.name: Jokhang Temple
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Tibet, Lhasa, Jokhang Temple
attractions.address: Barkhor Street, Chengguan District, Lhasa City
reviews: Jokhang Temple, also known as "Zulakan" and "Kakang" (Tibetan means Buddha Hall), is located in the center of the old city of Lhasa, is a Tibetan Buddhist temple. It was built in memory of the Princess of the Shozan Ganbu in Tibet. The original name of the temple "Jaisa" became the name of the city, and evolved into today's "Lhasa". Therefore, people often say "First there is Jokhang Temple, then there is Lhasa City." After the construction of Jokhang Temple, after the Yuan, Ming and Qing Dynasty, after repeated modification and expansion, only to form the present scale. The Jokhang Temple, which has been around for over 1300 years, has a supreme position in Tibetan Buddhism. It is the most glorious building in Tibet during the Tubo period, the earliest civil structure in Tibet, and has created the Tibetan-style higashiwa-style temples and city-style rules. The temple is full of incense and incense, and the oil lamps are bright. The biggest look of the Jokhang Temple is the 12-year-old Shakamoni statue brought by Princess Wencheng when he entered the temple. Lhasa is called the "holy land" because of the Buddha statue. On the third floor platform, here is a great place to look out over the Potala Palace, overlooking the Jokhang Temple Square. From the Jokhang Temple, just happened to see the Tibetan people who hiccup on the roof, the Tibetan people put together the simple labor of building houses as a happy form, singing and dancing.

Jokhang Temple is in Bakuo Street, with a strong humanistic atmosphere and a long history and culture. A must-do card in Lhasa, Tibet. Trip.com has temporarily booked tickets with tour guides to explain, and the ticket is issued at a fast pace. It is available on the same day. To tell the truth, because the Potala Palace in front of the car smart audio guide will be slightly misplaced for the location of the explanation of the mist in the clouds. So the Jokhang Temple I bought this ticket with a guide to explain, otherwise I can't understand the back stories. The guide commentary was very good and meticulous, the people were also very humorous and funny, and very happy.

One of the oldest streets in the world, the pilgrimage point of Tibetan Buddhism, where countless worshippers make daily pilgrimages and tourists punch in the card, the Jokhang Temple is built in three styles of Indo/Nepal/Tibetan style, very ornate and spectacular

Jokhang Temple is located in the center of Lhasa's old city. It is a Tibetan Buddhist temple, also known as Zulakang and Khuakang, which means Buddha Hall in Tibetan. Jokhang Temple is built by Tibetan King Songzanganbu and is known as a "holy land" in Lhasa.

The frescoes in the main hall are mostly by Tibetan and Nepalese artisans, with various altar city designs, changes and thousands of painted Buddhist statues. The frescoes in the northwest corner of the corridor of the middle building still retain the style of the Tang Dynasty~ Like it~

attractions.name: Namtso
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Tibet, Lhasa, Dangxiong, Namtso
attractions.address: Namtso National Park, Dangxiong County, Lhasa City
reviews: Namcuozun magic place, every day will have a completely different scene, the scenery changes, walking in it, can experience "different days across the mountains, a day has four seasons" the wonderful feeling. When coming or blue sky and white clouds, wind and sun, walking is white snow, as if came to the fairy tale world. This beautiful snow and ice world, not knowing where is the sky, where is the ground, and where is the mountain. We drove through this fairy tale of snow world, the sky has returned to the original appearance, still so beautiful. Good-bye! Beautiful and magical Namco!

Damei Tibet is about the highest saltwater lake in the world in winter, the lake surface is more than 4,700 meters above sea level, like jade. Standing on the hilltop beside Namco in the morning, when the sun rises, you will be shocked by the beauty in front of you, that golden ray of light intakes your eyes, the blue lake in the breeze ripples, sit quietly, look far away, Let me be in this blue world.

Nearer and closer to the core of Namco, a stone carved on the roadside "far-looking turtle", looking out, there is a really thick and honest turtle climbing in the distance. At this time, the sky with the head up to look at the clouds feel stretching out the hand can touch the same, some like a continuous peak, like a swift river, like a powerful lion, like a galloping horse, a thousand positions.

As one of the three sacred lakes in Tibet, Namco is one of the most stunning and not to be missed in Tibet. The beauty of Namco is sacred. It is more like a blue sea than a lake. It is very convenient to go to Namtso. Due to the high altitude, it is easy to produce high reverse. It is best not to drive by yourself. You can report a local day trip, the price is not expensive, so it is more safe.

According to legend, "Namtso is the daughter of emperor Shitian and the wife of Nianqing Tanggula". Nianqing Tanggula and Namtso are the most remarkable lakes in Tibet, and they set off each other to create a beautiful scenery. In May, many areas have been spring, but the snow and ice in Namco have not melted completely, the grassland in northern Tibet still does not have green, this adds a little more vicissitudes. The holy lake had a lot of people who meditated and prayed for the blessings in the morning, as the ice cracked, the rainbow climbed into the sky, a more beautiful spring in Namco.

attractions.name: Norbulingka
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Tibet, Lhasa, Norbulingka
attractions.address: Luodui East Road, Chengguan District, Lhasa City
reviews: "The Summer Palace of the Rulers, the Summer Palace of Lhasa", commonly known as the Summer Palace of Lhasa, is located in the western suburbs of Lhasa, Tibetan meaning "baby garden", for the successive Tibetan high-rise summer palace. Loblinka has doors on all sides, the east is the main gate of the garden. After the security check, we walked slowly into the garden, a typical Tibetan style of garden, but other places can not see the style of garden and design. Roblinka is divided into palace area, palace front area, forest area 3 most. The eastern palace front area includes the former park before the entrance and the three-tiered pavilion of Weizhen; the central part of the palace area is the core part of the park; and the western part is a forest area characterized by natural jungle wildness. The forest area, which covers about half of the garden, is also very diverse, with not only the usual local flowers and trees, but also the odd plants from the Himalayas, and the valuable flowers transplanted from the Mainland or imported from abroad. The main buildings in the palace area include the golden chapter, kokyoin, and the chapter of yonehisa, which was newly built in 1954 years. A tour of the park is really big, it has the characteristics of the Tibet plateau, and it draws from the traditional methods of the inland Jiangnan gardens. This large garden of Eden is really the essence of the Tibetan garden, it is indeed the Potala Palace in Lhasa. The most visited scenic spot outside the temple is the Zhao Temple. Here, you seem to be in a garden in the south of the Yangtze River, but the breath will make you understand that you are in the Tibetan Plateau of Lhasa. Please slow down and listen to the story of Loblinka! Tourist Tips: Luobulinka Tickets: 80 yuan in peak season and 60 yuan in off-season; 10 yuan for park tickets (free during the "winter tour of Tibet" activity); Open time: summer time 9:00-18:00; winter time 9:30-17:30; Traffic: The fastest taxi to; or [Luobulinka] Station or [Museum] Station. Travel guide: The whole Loblinka tour takes about 3 hours, and there are Tibetan opera performances in the park at 11:00. "In summer, the Loblinka is full of grass and lush, which is the best season for gardening and also the best time to catch the Sledon Festival, since the most lively season in Loblinka is the annual Sledon Festival in Tibet, where the Tibetan opera genres are gathered to hold major performances." In Lhasa, the people went to Loblinka with their families, put up tents, put on good wine and food, and danced and sang for a week.

At noon, we walked in the garden. There were very few tourists, and the passenger flow of the Potala Palace was almost a world away. It’s very good. Let’s enjoy this special garden slowly. ✌🏻 The characteristic Tibetan garden, the whole park The color saturation of the palace is very high, golden, red, and green. The palace is not luxurious, but very solemn. Occasionally I saw a few Tibetans walking quietly by turning the small scripture tube... When I walked inside, I suddenly found that there is a zoo 😂 ticket for another 10 yuan, and I really love small animals. Quite simple in a small zoo, there are black bears, raccoons, monkeys, and swans. What excites me most is seeing a huge elk. It was a little excited to see me and thought someone would come. After feeding it, I didn't expect that I didn't bring anything to eat😷

It is worth a visit here. In the western suburbs of Lhasa, there is a large palace garden with lush trees and flowers-Norbulingka. "Robu" means "baby" and "linka" means "garden". Therefore, Norbulingka is known as the "Baby Garden".

I went in October, and it happened to be free of charge for tourist attractions in Tibet, so I went in with my ID card. What a pity during the epidemic? Anyway, there are basically no people inside, and many places are closed. I remember that I visited once during the Xuedon Festival that year. There were Tibetan operas inside, which was very lively.

[Norbulingka] Norbulingka means "baby garden". It is the villa garden of the seventh to fourteenth lamas. It was built during the period of the seventh Lama Gesang Gyatso. It was used by the lamas to escape the summer heat. "Gong" is mainly composed of three palaces, "Gesang Pozhang", "Golden Pozhang" and "Dadden Mingjiu Pozhang". There are many towering trees and exotic flowers in the Norbulingka, which are cool in summer. It is the most famous royal garden in Tibet. A place of great significance, the Jokhang Temple has been burned several times in the history. Most of the existing buildings of the Jokhang Temple were later rebuilt. Only the bottom temple is an early building. The 10 pillars in the temple are faintly visible from the Tubo heritage: the lotus is carved on it. , And carved with flowers, cirrus clouds, jewels, and six-character mantra. On the third floor of the main building of the Jokhang Temple, the ground floor is divided into three parts: the gate court, the scripture hall, and the Buddhist hall. attractions.name: Namtso Lake National Park
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Tibet, Lhasa, Dangxiong, Namtso Lake National Park
reviews: Namtso, located in the central part of Tibet Autonomous Region, is the second largest lake in Tibet and the third largest salt water lake in China. The lake is 4718 meters above sea level. The name Namtso is Tibetan and the Mongolian name is the Tenggeli Sea. It is one of the three sacred lakes in Tibet. Namcuo is the first god lake of the ancient elephant, Buddhism and Fat Buddhism, one of the famous Buddhist holy places. We came to the viewing platform of Qingtang Gula Mountain in Namcuo to see the white snow, Yunshu Yunjuan. Standing on the lake side of the lake overlooking the lake on the other side of the main peak of Nianqing Tanggula, snowy mountains, white clouds, blue lake water, really beautiful.

Namtso is the highest lake in the world, with an altitude of 4718 meters. It is the second largest lake in Tibet. It is also the third largest saltwater lake in China, second only to Qinghai Lake and Selincuo. Mapang Yumso, Namtso and Yamdrok are the three holy lakes in Tibet. "Namcuo" means lake, and "cuo" means "hu" in Tibetan.

The second largest saltwater lake in our country, the highest saltwater lake in the world, and a holy place in the eyes of pilgrims. Pilgrims have continued since ancient times, and the five islands in the lake are known as the incarnations of the Five Buddhas, and are regarded as sacred places for men and women. Every time in the Tibetan calendar year of the Goat, the Buddhas, Bodhisattvas, and Gods of Enlightenment will set up a large altar in Namtso, and believers will go to Namtso Lake.

[Scenery] [Fun] [Value for money] I believe many people know Nam Co! It's also a place that I am longing for! The altitude is not very high, you can see the snow-capped mountains! It is called the holy lake, naturally because of its invincible beauty and the indelible beliefs in the hearts of Tibetans! Coming here is like accepting a baptism, let the heart be free like a bird! The water of the holy lake inadvertently cleanses your soul!
A beautiful mist, the blue lake reflected the white snow mountains from afar

Sera Temple is called "Sera Mahayana Temple", one of the six main temples of the Gelug Sect of Tibetan Buddhism. Together with Drepung Monastery and Ganden Monastery, it is called the three major monasteries of Lhasa, and it is the latest one of the three major monasteries to be built. Sera Temple is a national key cultural relics protection unit. It is located at the foothills of Selawuzi Mountain, 3 kilometers north of Lhasa, surrounded by willow forests. There are many small monasteries and nuns surrounding it. There are Pubujue Monastery and Miqiong Reniku in the east and south of the temple. reviews: My son and I visited in off season late January 2020 and there weren’t many people in the square. We took loads of pictures and got some friendly local Tibetan kids involved too. Good fun. The weather that day was quite windy and very cold. So, if travelling to Lhasa Potala Palace at that time, be sure to bring warm clothes and a hat, scarf and gloves.

The Potala Palace Square is the highest altitude city square in the world, and many important activities are held in Lhasa. It is located directly opposite the Potala Palace at the foot of the Red Mountain in Lhasa, Tibet. This square is also an important part of the Potala Palace of World Heritage. It is now a modern square that combines leisure, culture, assembly and other functions. According to the plaque front inscription: Potala Palace Square is Tibet to show the world the reform, opening, development, stability of the achievements of the window, is a symbol of the great unity of the Chinese nation. Potala Palace Square is opposite the Potala Palace, the north side of the main road Beijing Middle Road, the square is north of the flag of the People's Republic of China. The square is very open, enough to make the public worship here. The square is south of the Music Fountain and the Tibetan Peace Monument, and on the other side is the Artificial Lake Park, which houses the Banyan Tower, and the Artificial Lake and the Freeing Pigeons. If the square is stunning during the day, the night view will show you a slightly tender side. The Potala Palace is unique in the lighting, and the music fountains on the square are quite emotional, and many people dance with the music. The colorful music fountains are accompanied by the beautiful melody of the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau, which has a rich and colorful sprinkling and colored lighting effect. Sometimes the magic into the lotus shape, sometimes straight into the night sky, scattered like stars of colored water, beautiful. Music fountain not only show the water charming and colorful, but also to the Chinese and foreign visitors show the snow holy city of Lhasa attractive. Lhasa Potala Palace is a glorious building, and the Potala Palace Square lawn, green trees and harmony, complement each other, like the wonderland of the world. colorful lights and melodious music is more let many tourists and citizens play among them, love. Strolling in the Potala Palace Square, standing on the square looking up at the Potala Palace, the Potala Palace in the night is quiet and peaceful, you can more experience its majestic, sacred side. This kind of beauty, in the heart of the heart is relieved. You come or not, I am waiting for you here: so majestic! So kind! So quiet! It is a blend of leisure, culture and tourism. A modern square with many functions, such as gatherings, is also an important part of the world cultural heritage of the Potala Palace. The Egyptian Museum in Cairo is over 100 years old. It contains so many Egyptian treasures that a new museum is being built closer to the Pyramids in Giza to house and better display all the treasures. It can be very crowded, so try to go in the afternoon. It is open on Thursday evenings from 5-9 pm and that is the best time to go because there are no crowds. I suggest you use the tour guide group "Walk Like An Egyptian" they are well respected, respond to emails quickly and are very knowledgeable. Going to the museum with a guide who can explain the importance of what you are seeing will greatly enhance your experience. There are so many treasures in this one building that you could spend months and never see them all. This is a certain"must do" even if you do not think you like museums you will like this one. The basic ticket does not include the Mummy Room, that is extra. But you will still see many mummy's, even if you do not pay to go to the Mummy Room. You will also see King Tut's treasure.

attractions.name: Memphis
attractions.loc_tags: Africa, Egypt, Cairo Governate, Cairo, Memphis
reviews: So enthralling. The amasement continues.

The Memphis Museum is located 32 kilometers southwest of Cairo. It was once the seat of the ancient city of Memphis, the original capital of the Memphis dynasty of ancient Egypt. It was built by Menis in 3100 BC and was destroyed in the seventh century. The museum collects various stone statues of Ramses II that were excavated and collected in the ruins of the ancient city in modern times. The exhibition is divided into an indoor part and an outdoor part. The most famous one is the 14-meter-long full-body statue on display indoors, with smooth modeling lines and delicate carving. The outdoor Sphinx of Ramses II is 4 meters high and is carved from a single piece of 80-ton rock. These statues are masterpieces from 3200 years ago and have been preserved to this day.

Memphis is an ancient city in ancient Egypt, where many statues from the Egyptian period were unearthed. Among them are many unfinished statues of pharaohs. The main purpose of the Memphis Museum is to display these statues. Divided into two parts, indoor and outdoor, these precious Egyptian stone carvings are really Egypt's national treasures, and they are worthy of everyone's appreciation.

The Memphis Museum in Egypt is a very large open-air museum, where many sculptures excavated from ancient Egypt are preserved, including unfinished pharaoh statues, sphinxes, and some idols. It is one of the important archaeological relics in Egypt. One, definitely not to be missed.

Unlike the Chinese wood and bronze civilization, the Egyptian civilization is a stone civilization. These huge stone statues are all made from a single piece of stone, and the tools used to make them are another kind of harder stone. Even after thousands of years, with the dry and vicissitudes of air in the desert, there may only be one or two "light rains" of no more than half an hour a year, creating good conditions for the preservation of the stones.

It is the holy place of Egyptian Christianity, because the Virgin Mary, who was carrying Jesus 1800 years ago, escaped the chase and was later transferred to Jerusalem to give birth to Jesus. The church is small but beautiful and has many relics of the saints, but only here can be seen, because it is not photographable.

Hanging church on the fortress

🔹From the architectural style, although it is a Christian church, the whole is full of Middle Eastern style, including exquisite cross patterns. If you think about it, many styles of the Alhambra are similar. Of course, this is also what a layman said.

The church was built in the 4th century AD. The fortress’s age was in the 6-7th century BC. To enter the church, you need to climb 29 steps; 3. Once the cathedral of the Coptic Orthodox Church; 4. [Introduction to attractions] The Hanging Church was built in the 4th century. It got its name because it was built on the Babylonian fortress in the ancient Roman era. The hall of the church is located on the south gate of the Babylonian Castle, hence the name "Hanging Church". [Overall experience] The church is located in the old Cairo district. Due to the political instability in Egypt, we will always see countless policemen maintaining the surrounding area from getting off the bus to the scenic spots. Therefore, it is very safe to travel to Egypt. I didn't feel much about this attraction before, but after I went there, I realized that it was a very meaningful attraction. The hanging church is a church for Christians. It is very small and cannot be compared with many famous churches. But since it is the first time for me to come to the church, I am deeply moved by the simplicity of this church and the strong atmosphere of faith. This church is generally ignored by tourists, so there are almost no faces of Chinese people, let alone the team. But the pious prayers of the local people in the church moved me very much. The church is a bit broken, but the atmosphere is quite good, and this attraction is free.

The hanging church in Cairo is a very special church. Because the church has a split level, the church above looks like it is hanging, hence the name. There are many wonderful and beautiful mosaic murals in the church. They are all classic biblical stories, which are worthy of everyone's appreciation. The birthplace of modern bullfighting, the Runda Bullring is one of the oldest bullrings in Spain. The ring is painted white, unlike the reddish ones on TV.

The Ronda Bullring is the oldest bullring in Spain and a place of pilgrimage for bullfighters. Spain’s current bullfighting method was born in this bullring. This circular building can accommodate 5,000 spectators. Bullfighting competitions are held here on special festivals every year. However, visitors can usually buy tickets to visit inside, listen and watch through the audio guide, especially in the bullring. Passage facilities for bulls and bulls before bullfighting. There is also a museum in the bullring, which displays various objects and pictures, which is also worth seeing.

Ronda is not only suitable for elopement, but also the birthplace of modern Spanish bullfighting! The bullfighting season is from May to October every year. Those who want to watch the bullfight must choose the right time and reserve enough travel days to see it by chance!

The Tahoe tree-lined promenade is a path located on the edge of the Ronda cliff. Along this path, you can go from the top of the cliff to the bottom of the cliff. In the hot summer, this road is very cool, and down the path to the bottom of the valley, there is a feeling of adventure, very interesting.

reviews: Longda is built on the banks of the El Tahoe Canyon, a stone bridge across the canyon called New Bridge, the city is divided by the Tagas Creek into two parts, the New City and the Old City, the old city stands on the cliff side very spectacular, maintained the ancient style.

Ronda, a small town in southern Spain, "a city built in the clouds", "a white town on the edge of a cliff", "the most suitable place for elopement in the world"... At the same time, it is also the hometown of Spanish bullfighters, a place across Elta The suspension bridge of Huo Canyon connects the two ends of the canyon where the city is located, making this a sky city built in the clouds. The weather is too strong.

First of all, the bottom of the valley is very worth a visit. Only by looking up at the new bridge from the bottom of the valley can you feel its magnificence. Secondly, all charged items can't reach the bottom of the valley, and the road to the bottom of the valley is free! We bought tickets twice and found out only after entering. One is the ticket for the Ronda Museum. It is 2.5 Euro to see the air, and there is nothing inside. The other is the House of King Moore. I walked countless stairs to the bottom. Not! There are so many pits, please go around!

The gorge of Xinqiao is the most famous scenic spot in Ronda. The 100-meter-high gorge cuts a stream. If you have enough physical strength, walk along the gorge to the canyon stand (Cl Escolleras, Plaza Maria), and you can look up at the valley across the gorge. New bridge, the scenery is spectacular and unparalleled.

The Guadalévin River passes through the El Tajo Gorge (with strange names), with natural landforms and cultural buildings, making it a unique cloud town in the world. Part of the canyon can be seen from the bridge head on the side of Longda New Bridge. You need to buy a ticket to go down to the canyon.

reviews: The town of Husca, just 40 kilometers from Ronda in the mountains, is not the home of Disney's 2011 Smurf film, but it has since become famous for its work.

Huskar was originally a white town. After Sony started filming "The Smurfs", they chose this place as the film's promotional location. With 4,000 liters of blue paint, all Huskar's more than 100 houses were painted blue. Due to the film promotion, Huskar became famous and became the first and only officially authorized "Smurf House" in the world after he transformed into the "Smurf Town".

Come to our childhood memory-Smurf Town. A family of three people in the fairy tale world in an instant, and for a moment, they all hope to return to the carefree, simple and happy childhood, because this place is really full of childishness!
In the Smurf Village of Juzcar, Spain, all the buildings in the town are blue, with Smurf elements everywhere.​​​​ ​[love it.] I really like it! ! !

In 2011, in order to promote the Smurfs movie at the time, Sony chose this town as a Smurf-themed place, but everything was on the surface, except that the walls were painted blue and put some Smurfs. Elements only.

i love hobart

Hobart is the capital of Tasmania, Australia, and a beautiful port city. It has a long history and is the second oldest city in Australia, second only to Sydney. Hobart was first discovered by the Dutch Tasman during a sailing expedition in 1642. It became a British colony in 1802. The chief executive at the time was Robert Hobart, and the city was finally named Hobart. It is the financial and administrative center of Tasmania, and Hobart is also the home port for Antarctic scientific research in Australia and France.

reviews: The Port Arthur Historic Site is a very important Australian historical area. This was once the first port where British colonists landed in Australia. Most of the sites here were prisons, and they were the places where British felons were held. Although it is broken, you can still see that the prison here is quite large and modern more than 100 years ago, and it is worth the money to visit

I am here#
我在此# Port Arthur Historic Site
Don’t look at the beautiful mountains and rivers here, the green plants are quiet, and the time has been quiet.
I think it was a tragic and distressed prisoner's cage that is illusory and can't see the sun.
At this moment, at that moment, sigh

Port Arthur is still a historically significant scenic spot. The environment here is still good. I like the feeling of taking a boat out to sea here.
Facing the sea breeze, some historical relics look very decadent in the distance
It is said that this was a place of exile, so some buildings can still see some places where prisoners lived.

Port Arthur is very well maintained and very clean. We started to participate in an introductory group (40 minutes) that gave an overview of the situation here and allowed us to tour at our own pace. There are many information and stories everywhere here that will bring you into the lives of people in the past. The short boat trip is also very fun and knowledgeable. We did not participate in another tour group and are very satisfied with this choice. Congratulations to these friendly employees, they have maintained this important historical place very well.

The Port Arthur Historic Site was the first place where the British landed in Australia more than 200 years ago. At that time, the remains of the prison church and the school were still preserved, and the ruins were damaged, but it was also seen that the bustling of Port Arthur at that time was one of the must-visit places to visit.

I’ve visited four botanical gardens in Australia’s cities and I think Hobart’s is my favourite. It’s also probably the oldest, as it was founded nearly 200 years ago. Perched on a hill overlooking the river, you can stroll through the grounds and visit the different plant displays. There’s a rose garden and even an arctic section which is inside a freezing, temperature controlled building. The gardens are a lovely place for a picnic in the summer months. It’s free to visit too, which is a bonus.
Tasmanian Botanical  Gardens are one of the finest places in Australia to be visited with family and kids. There are so much to do and enjoy the beautiful autumn leaves.

Salamanca place, with its stately old sandstone warehouse blocks now converted into galleries, restaurants and shops, is part of what makes Hobart great. Once a key part of the port for colonial Hobart Town, today this waterfront district is one of the nicest places to hang out in the city, with plenty to do and explore between window shopping, drinking and noshing.
beautiful

attractions.name: Museum of Old and New Art
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, Australia, Tasmania, Hobart, Museum of Old and New Art
attractions.open_status: Wednesday - Monday 10:00-18:00, not open on Tuesdays, open daily in January
reviews: The Museum of Ancient and Modern Art in Hobart is a professional museum that comprehensively introduces the history and culture of Tasmania, the distribution of flora and fauna, and mineral resources. The exhibits here are very rich, a comprehensive introduction to Tasmania, whether it is from industrial development or the evolution of flora and fauna, there are many exhibits and specimens in history, which are very interesting and worth visiting.

It is easy to drive from Hobart, follow the signs to park here. The museum is a good place for walking. In several high places, you can enjoy the river and the distant scenery. It is definitely a feast for the senses. Those pink beanbag cushions can let you sit and relax in the sun. , Really is a paradise.

The MONA Museum of Ancient and Modern Art was built by David Walsh at a cost of 75 million Australian dollars. The walls and top of the museum are all exposed stone walls. Inside MONA is a three-story exhibition hall that extends downwards. During the entry, it is dark. Only the wall lights are illuminated in front of the exhibits. In addition, the exhibits are avant-garde and modern, leaving a mysterious and unpredictable. a feeling of. The O-shaped exhibition is the characteristic of MONA. bit.fall is my favorite artwork, converting text into water droplets.

MONA Private Museum (Museum of Ancient and Modern Art) ​​​Mona is the coolest museum I have ever visited. I dumped NGV800 streets. Tasmanian artists' reproduction and earth worship, and the Underground Museum of Death Aesthetics. The original unmodified architectural style is dark and physically unpacked. When the confluence of religion and religion pressed on top of my head, it seemed to be dead

The Museum of Ancient and Modern Art in Hobart, Tasmania is one of the most famous museums in Hobart. In addition to displaying some of the most important artworks from ancient and modern times, what attracts me more is the herbarium there. There are many extinct animal specimens here, which are very precious and really eye-opening. The same is a passion for protecting animals and protecting the natural environment.

attractions.name: Tasmanian Museum & Art Gallery
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, Australia, Tasmania, Hobart, Tasmanian Museum & Art Gallery
reviews: A cool addition to everyone's obligatory visit to MONA (that's why you're in Hobart right?!). Unlike $25 MONA, this option is FREE hooray. Affectionately nicknamed T-MAG by locals, it was established in 1846 and is home to special and permanent exhibitions. Come here to find out everything about the extinct Tasmanian Tiger (or Thylacine) and Tasmania's history and people.

Traveling to Australia, this stop came to the capital of Tasmania-Hobart. Wandering around in the city center, came to this museum, it is located opposite the city hall, near the pier, there is a parking lot at the door, parking is very convenient, but there is a charge. The museum is free to visit. When you enter, there are some open-air art-shaped seats on the right, you can take a break, and the front left is the locker area. All guests who come to visit need to put their belongings in the locker Inside, you need to prepare a 2 Australian dollar coin, open any vacant cabinet, there is a small slot in the cabinet door, you can put coins, only coins that are exactly 2 yuan in size, and then pull out the key as soon as the cabinet door is closed. Well, when you need to advance items, plug in the key, and the door will be opened, and the coins will be automatically spit out to you. This museum has several sections, including a history and culture museum that introduces aboriginal people, a taxidermy museum, a fine collection museum, art gallery, coffee shop, rest hall, etc. I only visited the taxidermy museum due to time issues. Learn about the animals that are unique to Australia and even Tasmania. Of course, these are all specimens, such as the extinct thylacine, the Tasmanian tiger and the Tasmanian little devil. , Kangaroos, birds of various sizes, etc. The decoration of the taxidermy museum is very simple, or it is deliberately made into a primitive decoration, it feels like returning to primitive society. The lighting in the lounge is dim, but it is decorated in a British style. There are always clear instructions along the road. You can look at the signs to find your favorite pavilion.

This place is where the museum and the art gallery are together, but in this way its scale is not too big, but you must take a look at this museum. It is actually quite famous, mainly because it contains some interesting things.

A museum that is definitely worth a visit. Although it is not a large-scale museum, there are a lot of things in it. What's more, his collections are very carefully selected. I think it is a selected museum. .
It is a very characteristic art gallery, and many of the works in it are local works of art. If it is the museum part, it may be slightly insufficient, but the art gallery part is pretty good.

attractions.name: Mount Field National Park
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, Australia, Tasmania, Hobart, Mount Field National Park
attractions.address: 66 Lake Dobson Rd, National Park TAS 7140
reviews:
Traveling to Australia, this stop came to Hobart, the capital of Tasmania. Mount Feld National Park is a nature reserve in Tasmania, Australia. It is the oldest national park in Tasmania. It is located 64 kilometers northwest of Hobart. Its highest point is Mount Feld at 1,434 meters above sea level. A national park is a temperate rain forest area.
 
You can see all kinds of rare and exotic grasses in Feldberg Park. Russell Falls and Horseshoe Falls are the most famous. On the way, there are tall rain forests, etc. It is a good place for hiking, picnics, skiing and bird watching. Hiking is the most common way of sightseeing. Starting from the tourist service center, you can walk to Russell Falls for about 10 minutes and watch the beautiful scenery of the waterfall cascading down in several layers along the mountain. The trees in the park are towering, some of them are more than 400 meters above, and you can also observe the unique forest area of Tasmania on the way. There is a map of the entire national park at the entrance of the service center. You can choose the trekking time and route according to your own conditions. Starting from the lane leading to Lake Dobson, there are 13 trekking areas. There are mountain huts in the park for accommodation. .
 
Field National Park has a variety of glacial landforms showing the geological relationship between the island and Antarctica. Plants here include huge swamp eucalyptus, sparse eucalyptus, myrtle, sassafras, king pine and Australia's only deciduous forest beech. I came here in winter. When I came to the entrance of the park, I could feel that the temperature was several degrees lower than that in the city. When you step into the woods, the temperature will feel colder as you go in, and the ground is all There was mud on the ground, and dew dripped from time to time.

There is a Tasmania island in Australia, and there is a Mount Field National Park on the island! This park is a virgin forest, the environment is very good, there are many kinds of trees, there are mountains, lakes, waterfalls, etc. It is recommended!

The virgin forest of Tasmania, Australia, is a national park with a very pristine environment! With tall trees, clear lakes, and lush rainforests, it is indeed worth walking around and experiencing the magic of nature!

Correct it first: it should be Feldberg, or Feldberg, not Feldberg (Ctrip should correct it). Feldberg National Park is located about 70 kilometers northwest of Hobart, Tasmania. Starting from Hobart, you will arrive at the High Trees Promenade Parking Lot. It is about an hour's drive away. This is the park's gate 2. The landscape in the national park is diverse, ranging from eucalyptus temperate rain forests to alpine swamps. Its highest point is Mount Feld at 1,434 meters above sea level. Field Hill National Park was established in 1916 and is the oldest national park in Tasmania along with Freycinet National Park in Wineglass Bay. Russell Falls in the park The area around Russell Falls has been protected since 1885 and is Tasmania's earliest nature reserve. The last wild thylacine was captured in the area in 1933. Prior to 1946, the protected area was called a "national park", and since 1947 it was renamed as it is today. Let’s take the High Tree Walk, which is one of the 60 short-distance walks in Tasmania. The swamp almond eucalyptus in Field Hill is one of the tallest trees in Australia. While walking under the towering tree canopy, you can use an inclinometer to calculate the height of these trees! On the way to Russell Falls, I saw the Horseshoe Falls not far from the fork, so go and take a look first! After enjoying the Horseshoe Falls, turn back and go to Russell Falls. Because we were going to see the tall trees, we got off the car at the Gaoshu Group parking lot. Otherwise, we went directly to Russell Falls from the Feder Mountain National Park Visitor Center, which is much closer. Russell Falls cannot be said to be spectacular, but it is layered and exquisite, and it looks patchy with the surrounding lush vegetation. It is extraordinarily elegant and amazing. In addition to Russell Falls and Horseshoe Falls, there is also Lady Barron Falls in the park. Time is limited, and Lady Barron Falls will not go. The high tree group parking lot where we got off is in the middle, with Horseshoe Falls and Russell Falls to the northeast, and Lady Barron Falls to the southwest. If you want to watch the three waterfalls and the high tree ring road, it will take at least two and a half hours. Take another photo and stop for a while. It's hard to say, but we gave it 2 hours and 15 minutes. Seeing tall trees, Horseshoe Falls and Russell Falls, without turning back, take the Russell Falls Nature Walk, enjoy the dense rainforest along the way, observe the unique forest area of Tasmania, and meet with the guide at the visitor center. Figure 1: Field Hill National Park was listed as a Tasmanian Wilderness World Heritage Reserve in 2013; Figure 2: The 79-meter-high swamp almond eucalyptus tree cannot be photographed from the root neck to the top of the crown; Figure 5: View Russell Falls-look at the beautiful scenery that falls down into several layers along the mountain; Figure 10: Why is it called the Horseshoe Falls and is it shaped like a horseshoe? No way to know.
Mount Field National Park⛰⛰⛰ ​​​Mother's Day to feel the laws and power of nature in the virgin forest that existed before the ice age​​​

reviews: Boshang Palace is located in Naha City, one of the eight major shrines in Ryukyu, for "Okinawa General Chinju." Boshang Palace is very mini, about 1-2 hours can be spent. If you happen to be in a hurry, you will see some locals doing things.

⛩Naminoue Shrine is one of the eight largest shrines in Ryukyu. It is located in Naha City. It is built on a cliff adjacent to the sea, and Naminoue Shrine is named after it. The shrine has a typical Ryukyu architectural style. It is the shrine visited by Okinawa residents the most. After washing their hands, they prayed for fortunes here, hoping to get what they wanted. ‍♀️⭐️We chose to wear a kimono to visit this shrine in a more ancient way. (Because the weather is too hot, I have to give up my kimono and wear a yukata, don’t blame it). The gorgeous costumes and the red-tiled buildings complement each other, giving a sense of sight through time. Going down the steps, you will see the Naminoue Beach. The area is not large, but there is still a special area for people to swim. It can be seen that Japan's security deployment is very complete. Address: 1-25-11, Wakasa, Naha City Traffic guide: Monorail Prefectural Office Station, walk about 1.2 kilometers. The starting price for a taxi is also available. Naminoue Palace is free to visit, and you can only visit outside, not inside. Ask for a sign for 600 yen, and you can hang the sign on the outside rope after asking for the sign.

The shrine is built on a coral reef cliff overlooking the sea. The shrine, as its name implies, is a distant view that looks like it is above the waves when the waves rise. The red tile roof of the shrine has strong cultural colors. It is the largest shrine visited by visitors to Okinawa every year in the new month since the Ryukyu Kingdom.

A beautiful place. The shrine is located on a steep hill. If you visit with elderly people or anyone with physical problems, please remember this. The shrine is very beautiful and provides usual safe driving amulets and health amulets. Come early and avoid the crowds!

The good place is Naminoue-gu is where you can see the real believers performing services-you can also sit on their part for a small fee. This is great if you want to learn more about the culture and religion of Okinawa believers. . .
