Naba Shuli City, there are two parts of the inner city and outer city, the outer city is free, the inner city needs to buy tickets. The inner city is the former Ryukyu Kingdom's palace, to take off shoes, will provide a plastic bag, his shoes. Across the palace is a panoramic view of Naha.

The buildings, which were destroyed and burned several times, are the symbol of the Ryukyu Kingdom. One of the largest wooden structures on Okinawa, they have a distinctive Ryukyu style and combine the characteristics of traditional Chinese and Japanese architecture.

The cruise was brought over and stayed for an hour. The park is small, you can log into the tower to see the distance. You need to buy a ticket to visit. There is a souvenir shop where you can buy souvenirs and stamps. Ice cream is sold in the park and only cash is accepted. The taste is good. Take a picture and make a card. It is also one of the places visited by local primary school students.

Although the Shuli City Park is not big, but the playability is very high, that is, the stamp game can take more than three hours. The ducks in the back door Longtan are not afraid of people, do not give food to not let go, you are a siege. Shuli City is the former Ryukyu Kingdom's king city, located on a hill, can look out over the sea. The custodian gate under the city is a landmark of Okinawa. The king's palace has a unique Ryukyu architecture style, which is very beautiful, and the structure is restored to the original pattern and exhibits some relevant historical artifacts. It is a good place to understand the history and culture of the Ryukyu Kingdom Shuri City - the royal palace of the Ryukyu Kingdom, which is the imperial palace of Okinawa. Because the original buildings were destroyed by the war, now see after 1992 reconstruction. The palace is rich in color, fused with the characteristics of Japanese and Chinese architecture. Most of the park is free, but you need to buy tickets to enter the main hall. Adults 820, primary and secondary school students 310 places are not big, but it is worth going. Especially there is a collection of stamps for gifts. Children, big friends are like treasure hunt. It takes time to collect all of them, and individual seals are not easy to find. We only have 2 hours to rush to the airport to return to China, so we only completed a collection of 10 gift exchange projects, about 20. It's fun. Ancient palaces, the scenery is quiet, the inner city needs to buy tickets to enter, and some places can not take pictures. Local special performances are outside the paid scenic spot. The shows that are performed every day are not the same. It is still very worth seeing. Try to sit at the front. The scenic area is collected from the stamp activities, the stamp collection to a certain number of small gifts, especially for children. Take the monorail to the terminal station, Shuli City Station, and then follow the road signs all the way to walk, if you want to take a shortcut, you can enter from the intersection of Wansongyuan and go straight to it.

attractions.name: Okinawa Prefectural Museum & Art Museum
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Okinawa, Naha, Okinawa Prefectural Museum & Art Museum
reviews: it’s simply awesome. a really wonderful place!!!!!

I took the children to the county museum. I have to say that the design concept is comparable to our national museum. Animals and plants are drawn into various three-dimensional specimens for visitors to index, query and perceptually recognize. There are also Manza Mao’s The physical evolution model seems to be telling the past and present of Mao Manza, which is particularly interesting (get off at Monorail Xinduxin Station, near 3A Department Store)

The Okinawa Prefectural Museum is one of the most distinctive attractions in Naha. The location is a bit far from Kokusai Street, but there is a duty-free shop nearby, which is still very good. The exterior of the museum is also unique. It is the color of the famous volcanic rock on Okinawa. The appearance is simple and beautiful. Tickets for the exhibition area are 410, which is very cheap. The place inside is not too big. There are various information about Okinawa's history, humanities, animals and plants. The exhibits are mostly models, suitable for children to visit, but there is a lack of boutiques, and there are no restrictions on taking pictures along the way. In general, a permanent pavilion can take more than an hour to stroll around. Special exhibitions are different, but the price will be more expensive. Overall it is quite recommended

I wandered aimlessly in Naha and walked to the Okinawa Prefectural Museum Art Museum. It was not coincident that the art museum was closed that day, but the museum was well designed, and there was a well-dressed aunt sitting there in each exhibition area. , The whole museum is very quiet and clean. It happened to have activities on the first floor. Speeches or performances were very interesting. The person in charge also left me a business card and gave me several copies of promotional materials for me to distribute to my friends... Next to it is the largest shopping mall in Okinawa, forget the name Well, it’s close to the largest duty-free shop. Plus the weather was sunny that day, so happy~

Our direction is the prefectural art museum. There is an exhibition of Hayao Miyazaki's manuscripts. As a poor man who has been to Tokyo but failed to return to the Mitaka Art Museum regrettably, this time is obviously not to be missed, the manuscript exhibition Miyazaki and his team have seen many popular classic animations from the late 1970s to today, and saw how an animation went from manuscript to beginning. Each one embodies the efforts of the creator.

attractions.name: Naha Shopping Center
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Okinawa, Naha, Naha Shopping Center
reviews: Naha is the administrative center of Okinawa. Basically, eating, drinking, shopping are all in Naha. Naha's main attraction is Shuri City. But some of the famous attractions in Okinawa are not in Naha. If you want to go to the American village, the aquarium, and the heart-shaped island, it is best to report a day trip. The traffic is not very convenient, or the group is better.

Ocean Expo Park, Kuroshio Sea Guinness World Records's big glass sink, dolphins wonderful performance, let people linger; coffee in the aquarium, Jiyuli Island to see the sea, Japan warm winter trip warm heart.
It's a good choice to stroll around here when you have time!

Some people may not know where Naha is, but if you say Okinawa, everyone must have heard it. Yes, this is a very famous island city, especially in summer, the scenery is great! The quality of the sea water is great, and there are fine sandy beaches. Suitable for couples and parent-child travel! Well worth a visit

The main city of Okinawa, there are no attractions in the downtown area of Naha, but Shuri Castle is also worth visiting. The main shopping is in Kokusai Street.
However, the transportation in Naha is not very convenient, it is slightly more expensive, and there is only one light rail line. It's best to sign up for a day trip to go out.
The American Village and the Beautiful Aquarium are still worth visiting.

attractions.name: Onoyama Park
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Okinawa, Naha, Onoyama Park
attractions.address: Okuyama cho, Naha city, Okinawa Prefecture 52
reviews: The park is located in the city area. Okinawa Naha City, convenient transportation, non-driving tour can also take a single track directly to here. The park is large, divided into two parts, after the long stairs, the top is another day. The playground is equipped with rope nets, cage-like climbing facilities, and a number of slides, of course, a long and slippery slide.

The relative distribution of the facilities in the children’s play area: 1. Combined slide; 2. Super wide slide; 3. Mini climbing tower; 4. Large slide; 5. Single-plank bridge; 6 Climbing tower
The renovated Owushan Park is like a young version, not very long, and the slope is good...but the new and comfortable environment is very satisfying. The original roller slide has become a wooden board. This is the only one of the four slides that is not a roller. The slides are suitable for children to play, but older children will find it not exciting enough
After coming down from the light rail, you can see a dragon hovering in the bushes from a distance. Follow the sign to the direction of Owu Mountain Park. There are no people on the road. The blue sky and white clouds are surrounded by a comprehensive stadium. The slide park is the best The challenge is the topic of faucet combination. It is too challenging. You have to climb a long ladder to reach the middle level. Going up is more challenging. The single-plank bridge, climbing frame, and climbing frame are all meshed and need to crawl. Standing and walking also need to work hard. It also exercises the children’s coordination and courage. Yun Yun’s sweating and exhausting effort finally climbed to the highest point. There was a red roller slide and then she slid down. When I slid down, I heard staring at the sugar palm in the drum and laughing, it was very fun. I saw the photos here when I came home and pitifully begged me to take her there. China should really build more such small parks. , On the square is a set of mini slides, suitable for babies, and there is also an ultra-wide slide. Many children can play together. This park is the best one among the four slide parks. Families living in downtown Naha must not miss it. Here

It is very suitable for taking children and the transportation is also convenient. Take the monorail and get off at Owushan Park Station and walk for 3-5 minutes. The public slides and facilities of Owushan are free. It is a paradise for children and the best place for parents and children. And the air here is really good, if you bring bread, you can feed the pigeons very comfortably

It is different from domestic parks, mainly indoor and outdoor sports. I live at the Mercure Hotel Naha at Kebkawa Station. I walked from the monorail station to the opposite side of the bridge and I was very lucky. I wanted to watch them play that day. Baseball actually just caught up with the trials. Finally, it was not just a testimony to this moment in the comics. Although the dedicated track for running is also a rubber particle, it is embedded in the form of bricks, which can cushion the pressure on the knees. In Okinawa these days, many details are making people. Surprise and admiration

A complex park located in Naha City. There is a baseball field inside. Whenever it comes to the spring training of a baseball team, the most powerful team will use this baseball field. There is also a theater for performances. The International Ryukyu Festival is held here every year, and the excitement is never tiresome.

attractions.name: Naminoue Beach
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Okinawa, Naha, Naminoue Beach
reviews: Okinawa is a well-known holiday destination in Japan. There are many beautiful beaches on the main island of Okinawa that are comparable to the beautiful coasts of the world. If you visit Okinawa, you must go to the beach. Naminoue Beach, much like the Tasmanian Sea in New Zealand, is green and clear, so beauty has nothing to do with distance, and it does not have to fly more than 10,000 kilometers.

#Naminoue Beach, near Naminoue Palace, the only beach in Naha City, small in size, fine sand and clear water. Standing on the rocks of Naminoue Beach in Japan, the strong wind drove me crazy. There are few people and the waves are small, suitable for children.

Naminoue Beach is said to be the only public beach in downtown Naha where swimming and fishing are possible. When I arrived, I was surprised that there were such clear waters beside the continental shelf, and there were many local people. It takes about 15-20 minutes to walk from the vicinity of Kokusai Street. It is the first choice for those who are too late to go to the outlying islands. There are also Naminoue Palace attractions nearby to visit together!

It is located on the Naminoue Beach on the west side of Naha City, next to Naminoue Palace and Asahigaoka Park on the next cliff, facing the sea, there are Naminoue Rinko Viaduct and Naha West Road. The water is very clear. There are several in the morning. People go swimming or sunbathing in the morning.Because they are far from the city, there are not many tourists.They are all local residents and are very comfortable.

Naminoue Beach on the west coast of Naha is an artificial beach. There are not only beautiful seas and white sands, but also beautiful sunrises. Such natural beauty can't help but make tourists sigh: On the edge of the city, there is such a charming beauty. The beach is also equipped with a variety of recreational facilities, visitors can leisurely and intimate contact with the sea, of course, the beautiful sunrise is not to be missed. Naminoue Beach is only 15 minutes away from Naha Airport. The urban beach is known as the "last sightseeing spot" for tourists visiting Okinawa.

attractions.name: Fukushuen
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Okinawa, Naha, Fukushuen
reviews: Going overseas, the heart of the homeland, the children of Yan and Huang who make a living abroad miss their homeland, and then there is the Fuzhou Garden, a review of the inheritance of Chinese culture, in the details, you can see the hometown, the wind and rain, and the innocent heart.

The Fuzhou Garden in Naha was designed by Fuzhou architects, and it is a Chinese garden built with the urban style of Fuzhou’s three mountains, two towers, and Minjiang Gushan. This garden is free to visit. I went in the morning, avoiding the tour groups, and enjoying the quiet scenery in the garden alone, it was very pleasant!

Fuzhou Garden is located in Naha, the capital of Okinawa Prefecture, Japan. It is a Chinese-style garden park open to citizens. Strolling here, leaning on a small bridge to watch the water, and leaning on the "two towers" to see the "three mountains", you will have the illusion of time and space, thinking that you have come to Fuzhou, Fujian, China. Yes, the "Fuzhou Garden" covering an area of 8,500 square meters is really authentic and was built by the Naha City Government with an investment of 900 million yen. The park is based on the "three mountains, two towers and one river" of Fuzhou, and is built using the landscape layout and artistic composition of traditional Chinese gardens, which is full of "Chinese flavor" in itself.

The plaque at the gate is the words mentioned by Bing Xin, and the couplet is also very interesting, "Urban Blind Date Becomes Sisters", for me who was still in Fuzhou ten days ago, I must come and visit Fuzhou Garden. With a one-day ticket for the monorail, you can enjoy a group fare of 160 yen. The layout and architecture of the park are very distinctive, and there are two fat pigeons who love to rub oily fish food. A box of fish food for 100 yen can be fed to both swimming in the water and flying in the sky. The experience is also good. For the location, you can walk straight from the north exit of the prefectural hall for about 300 meters. If you go further, you can go to the cruise terminal, Naminoue Beach and the Shrine. You can go for a stroll together if you have time.

Fuzhou Park is a symbol of friendship between Naha City and Fuzhou City. It was designed and financed by Fuzhou City. The park is planted with a memorial tree symbolizing the friendship between the two cities. It has been 35 years since 2017. Representative Chinese elements can be seen everywhere in the park, such as the park’s white walls, black carved windows, pavilions in the park, hanging red lanterns, the figures of the eight immortals crossing the sea on the bridge, and the zodiac , The Panlong Column in front of the house makes people feel like they are in China.

attractions.name: First Makishi Public Market
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Okinawa, Naha, First Makishi Public Market
reviews:
Where to eat seafood in Okinawa｜Makishi Commune
Located at the iconic Kokusai Street in Naha. On the first floor of the market is a variety of shops selling seafood, meat, Okinawa limited food, etc., and on the second floor is a food street, where you can taste Okinawa seafood and Japanese cuisine.
Order seafood on the first floor of Makishi Commune, and then a waiter will send it to the restaurant on the second floor to make it. The processing fee is 500 yen per person. It doesn’t matter if you don’t speak Japanese. There are many Chinese students who work part-time there. They can help you with a good attitude.
The First Mu volunteers will be closed every Monday, and the fourth Sunday of each month is also a day off. Unfortunately, we arrive on Saturday, Sunday and Monday are not open, Tuesday is only a short morning, the market is 9:00 Open the door.

A lively and vibrant public market buys everything from souvenirs to fish, satisfying everyone from tourists to locals. Most of the items sold here are of very good quality, and I think the prices are quite reasonable. You need hours to browse this colorful market.

Recommended by a friend, it happened to be very close to the hotel where I was staying. It was about five minutes walk. Because of the New Year, most of them were closed. I could only find one casually. There was a Chinese waiter at the door. The business was naturally much better. I bought seafood. I went to the next door for processing and ordered a lobster, a large crab, five prawns, a sashimi platter, a total of 16,500 yen, a processing fee of 500 yen per person, and lobster rice with 600 yen, which is not cheap , Wins in freshness, a family of four eats full.

The No. 1 Makishi Public Market in Naha City is located at the junction of Kokusai Street and Makishi Street in the city center. It is a check-in location not to be missed in Okinawa. You can buy all kinds of living seafood on the first floor, and then process them on the second floor and eat them now. The price is similar for each stall, and the processing price on the second floor is also similar, so you can sell whatever you like.

Going along the main road of the market from Kokusai Avenue is the First Makishi Public Market [First Makishi Public Market], full of all kinds of Okinawa ingredients. The market developed from the black market after the war. It used to be a kitchen for the common people to support every family in Okinawa. During the first lunar month and the Obon festival of the lunar calendar, there are many customers who buy fish and meat.

attractions.name: Bahnhofstrasse
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Switzerland, Zurich, Zurich, Bahnhofstrasse
attractions.address: Runs north-south west of Limmat River, Zurich
reviews: Bahnhofstrasse is Zürich's main downtown street and one of the world's most expensive and exclusive shopping avenues.In 2011, a study named the Bahnhofstrasse the most expensive street for retail property in Europe, and the third most expensive worldwide. In 2016 ranked ninth.

Zurich, Switzerland, on the class is the richest in the world of the street. Class hoff street in Zurich Lima river on the west side, 1.4 kilometers long. Avenue was built in the 15 years BC, the Roman rule, the Romans in Zurich lake in the city, it began to develop into a thriving commercial center, becoming the most flourishing, one of the most "expensive" on the streets. And New York City''s fifth street (the 5 th Avenue). Switzerland''s most upscale shops can be found along the street, with its from the top of fashion designers to shoes, fur, jewelry, pottery and jewelry and so on upscale choice, of course, and the Swiss watch.
A low-key street, just a cold look like this, the buildings are more simple, not very prominent decoration, but luxury shops abound, top consumer places, snack bar prices are also extremely high.
The main street in Zurich, a main street for office and business, is not so wide and walks comfortably. There are too many luxury shops, and chocolate shops are especially expensive.

The street facing the main entrance of Zurich Railway Station is called Bahnhofstrasse. I feel that all the streets outside the Swiss city train stations are called Bahnhofstrasse. The Bahnhofstrasse in Zurich is the largest commercial street. It is crowded like Nanjing Road in Shanghai, but it is a tram running in the middle. There are four sections that carry a lot of passengers. There are also a lot of people here. There are 2 million residents in Zurich. There are many brand shops on Bahnhofstrasse and countless watch shops. Luxury goods are basically the most comprehensive. Although the price is high, China still has the most powerful purchasing power in the world. Every luxury store has Chinese salespersons who speak Chinese, so there is no problem in communication. Bahnhofstrasse is parallel to the Limmat River, with the railway station at one end and Lake Zurich at the other.

attractions.name: Grossmunster
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Switzerland, Zurich, Zurich, Grossmunster
attractions.open_status: March-October 10:00-18:00, November-February 10:00-17:00, in case of special event, the church may be temporarily closed. The time of the tower is: March-October Monday-Saturday 10:00-17:00, Sunday 12:30-17:30, November-February February-Monday-Saturday 10:00-16:30 On Sunday, 12:30-16:30; stop the tower 15 minutes before closing, may be closed early due to special activities or weather conditions. For the latest details, please check the official website.
reviews: The Grossmünster is a Romanesque-style Protestant church in Zürich, Switzerland. It is one of the four major churches in the city (the others being the Fraumünster, Predigerkirche and St. Peterskirche).Its congregation forms part of the Evangelical Reformed Church of the Canton of Zürich. The core of the present building near the banks of the Limmat was constructed on the site of a Carolingian church, which was, according to legend, originally commissioned by Charlemagne. Construction of the present structure commenced around 1100 and it was inaugurated around 1220.

Before and after the church was founded in 1100, its architectural style is known as a Roman type twin towers, as a landmark of Zurich. The river and Notre Dame cathedral church in the Swiss reformation in the 16th century, played a pivotal role, the university of Zurich seminary and reformation are established in this museum. The colored glass within the church is the modern master of art giacometti''s masterpiece.

The absolute landmark in Zurich feels like the tallest building, the twin towers are very obvious, I am puzzled by the direction of the building, not facing the square, bridge or Zurich lake, the interior is also very rich.

Zurich Cathedral (Grossmünster) is one of the three main churches in Zurich, Switzerland (the other two are the Zurich Frauenkirche and St. Peter's Church). The church is located near the banks of the Limmat River. It was built around 1100 and opened around 1220.
This church across the river from the Notre Dame Cathedral played a pivotal role in the Swiss Reformation in the 16th century. The Seminary of the University of Zurich and the Reformation Museum were both established here. The stained glass in the church is a master of modern Swiss art. A masterpiece by Giacometti.

Zurich Cathedral is one of the three main churches in Zurich, Switzerland (the other two are Frauenkirche and St. Peter’s Cathedral). The church is located near the bank of the Limmat River, across the river from the Frauenkirche, the University of Zurich Theological Seminary and The Reformation Museum is set up here. The stained glass in the church is the masterpiece of the Swiss modern art master Giacometti...

attractions.name: Rhine Falls
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Switzerland, Schaffhausen, Neuhausen am Rheinfall, Rhine Falls
reviews: Numerous waterfalls, the highest snow melt in the summer, so the waterfalls are the largest in summer. Although not as grand as the Huangguoshu waterfall, they are magnificent and magnificent! The Rhine Waterfall is a free attraction and worth a visit!
The water is quite large, and the waterfalls taken from different angles are not bad.

Schaffhausen’s Rhine Falls is about half an hour’s drive from Zurich, Switzerland. Along the way, the train will pass by the bridge next to the waterfall. Sitting by the window, I was surprised to see such a spectacular scene. I must have a stupid expression on my face. The girl sitting across from me looked at me and smiled. After getting off at Schaffhausen railway station, transfer to S33 to Schloss Laufen am Rheinfall station, or transfer to bus No. 1 and 6 to Neuhausen or Zentrum station. These two locations are located at both ends of the waterfall, and are connected by a cruise ship in the middle. If you have enough time, you can visit both ends to experience different perspectives. If time is tight, it is recommended to take the route of Schloss Laufen am Rheinfall station, because the viewing platform there is closer to the waterfall, and you can feel the powerful water coming on you. And the whole route is to go straight to the highest point of the castle, then walk a short distance to buy a ticket, and then go all the way down, one by one from the viewing platform to the pier, the route is relatively labor-saving. If you come from the other end, you have to climb up one by one. There are also two routes for cruises, the short one is just a ferry, and the long one will circle around the lake and stop under the waterfall for a closer look.

Rhein Falls / Rhine Falls near Zurich / Zurich A cousin's family residing in Switzerland, took us here from Konstanz on the German-Swiss border and started a short trip to Switzerland. This is the largest waterfall in Europe and the only waterfall in the 1,300 km course of the Rhine. At the end of winter and early spring, the snow-capped mountains melted, the Rhine River was abundant in water, and the waterfalls were beautiful and magnificent! The sky was beautiful, not only showing the background of the blue sky, but also a rainbow of seven colors suddenly appeared [Applause][Victory]

I ran to the Rhine Falls-the largest waterfall in Europe. I thought it was past 6 pm local time and should not be exposed to the sun, but it was still super super sun... I got off the train and saw the road sign for 15 minutes. There is one of my own choice The feeling that Lu is going to finish walking while kneeling. . . However, the waterfall is crystal clear and the rainbow is seen, which is not in vain. I met Dangdang, a Shanghai kid in the stained glass room, and I had to play with me all the way. Later I parted. I thought they had already left, but found that Dangdang was still sweating and waiting for me under the scorching sun.

attractions.name: Fraumunster Church
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Switzerland, Zurich, Zurich, Fraumunster Church
reviews: Church of our lady is to recognize the status of the virgin Mary mother of Jesus Christian sects, such as the Catholic, orthodox and anglicans, built by the virgin salute and named after the church; Sectarian or admit saint status, give priority to with the virgin Mary saint and named after the church.
See stained glass windows "World Creation" by Mark Chagall

The Church of Our Lady is the first landmark to see in Zurich, because its tall towers are not only prominent, the location is good, but also its top is green, in a group of gray buildings, very prominent, adjacent to the cathedral.
The green spire is very striking, even in a church to steal the cathedral, only to discover its lower spire shape and streamlined design, simple building, medium-sized, quiet interior.
The church of Notre Dame is a highly recognizable church in Zurich, close to the other churches, with a striking green spire, a single tower, and a golden clock above the tower.

attractions.name: Old Town
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Czech Republic, Prague, Old Town
reviews: booked a hotel Ibis old town hotel through Ctrip.com , hotel location is convenient , go to old town in 10 minutes , Powder tower and Charlie bridge just nearby
wonderful place, all other attractions are just in walking distance
it is truly the most magical little city you could ever visit. the people are kind and the transportation is easy to conquer. You can walk everywhere. The food is incredible. I need to go back!!!
Very nice atmosphere in the Old Town. Musicians, artists, restaurants and shops. Things are well priced and public transport is very good. Cobble streets give it a very nice feeling.

A really nice place to enjoy the city. The historic astronomical clock is in this square as well as many historic buildings. I advise you to venture elsewhere for food - the restaurants on this block will be extremely overpriced for the same meal you could get on a side alley.

attractions.name: Kunsthaus Zürich
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Switzerland, Zurich, Zurich, Kunsthaus Zürich
attractions.open_status: Closed on Mon;Open on Tue,Fri-Sun,10:00am-6:00pm;Open on Wed-Thu,10:00am-8:00pm
reviews: Art gallery is located in the old town of Zurich, Zurich open since 1787, in the 19th and 20th century western painting (impressionist and dada art) is famous for its work to bring together, rodin''s sculpture "hell''s gate" is located in the famous art gallery at the door. Zurich art gallery in the majority with Swiss painter''s works, including paintings, sculptures and engravings, art gallery, perennial exhibition Picasso, Cezanne, monet, monk, Matisse, renoir, such as the great painter and sculptor rodin''s work.
Amazing art and amazing architecture. One of the two places in the world where you can see Rodin's Gates of Hell. Worth the trip for that alone.
People who appreciate it must see it. It's not bad.

The only art museum in this trip. Although the overall feeling is not as good as Paris, all the masterpieces are still worthy of worship! The location is right in the center of the city, it is very convenient to navigate! The ticket seems to be 16 Swiss francs, not including the special exhibition. In fact, if you only come for Van Gogh Monet, you can only buy this part of the ticket! Photography is allowed in the exhibition hall.

The Zurich Museum of Art is very low-key and has a small facade. Perhaps the Swiss mountain lakes are more attractive, so that few people come here. Although it is Sunday, there are only a few people in the museum, and many of the exhibits are famous paintings. The biggest advantage is that there is no need to queue up and there are no crowds. It is almost reserved and it is very worth visiting.

attractions.name: GOLDEN ROOF MUSEUM
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Austria, Tyrol, Innsbruck, GOLDEN ROOF MUSEUM
reviews: Majestic snow mountains dominate your view wherever you go in Innsbruck. Of course, they sometimes get out of your sight as you swoop into the narrow, sheltered streets of this medieval city. However, once you see the famous Golden Roof, the quiet figure of the hills reappears and you're immediately born with an uncontrollable urge to climb the mountain and roam the day.

I heard about Innsbruck a long time ago, but I didn't have that high expectation before I went. But the last impression left is very good. Similarly, I really didn't know this golden roof before I went. Of course, I learned that it was almost one of Innsbruck's landmarks. If it’s not because it’s in the center, maybe it’s missed

The two-story canopy is 16 meters wide, and the roof alone is 3.7 meters high. The golden roof is made of 2738 gold-plated copper tiles. This is where the name of the golden roof comes from!
The edges of the cornices are decorated with carved patterns of animal motifs, and the surface of the pillars is surrounded by reliefs: among them are the statues of Emperor Maximilian I and the queen. The lower part of the front is engraved with the coat of arms of Austria and Hungary, the double-headed eagle and the king's eagle, the coat of arms of Burgund and Milan, and the coat of arms of Steiermark and Tyrol on the side.
The mural depicts two guards carrying the flag of the Empire and Tyrol on their shoulders. The authentic work of this work is in the Tyrolean Museum.

Head to the Austrian mountain town-Innsbruck. Located on the Inn River between the mountains in western Austria, the name means "Bridge over the Inn" is the capital of Tyrol. It is located in the main traffic road of the Alps, it is a famous ski resort in Europe and a paradise for ski lovers; in addition, the golden roof of the medieval old town is famous all over the world----

[View] This unique golden roof is a unique and charming view in Innsbruck! No wonder the local newcomers gather here! [Fun] Here, you can see the Albis Mountains through the alley. Don't miss the crystal, perfume, coffee and jam tarts here! [Value for money] This is the only way from Switzerland to Austria, or the Neuschwanstein Castle in Germany is located about 50 kilometers north of it.

attractions.name: St. Anna's Column (Annasaule)
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Austria, Tyrol, Innsbruck, St. Anna's Column (Annasaule)
reviews: The landmarks and historical evidence of the Maria Theresia

The St. Anna column in Innsbruck, Austria. It is a tall marble pillar. It was built to commemorate resistance to Spanish aggression. The St. Anna’s Column is one of Innsbruck’s landmarks, near the famous golden roof. It is one of the attractions that guests who come to Innsbruck must check in.

The Anna Column stands on Maria Theresia Street in Innsbruck, Austria. It can be said to be a landmark building in this small city. There is a statue of the Virgin Mary on the top of the column. (Because the sun is very strong that day, the backlight is not very clear, and the back of the Maria statue is the back of the light. It is a pity.) There are also golden roofs, famous crystal shops and so on.
A real landmark, a must-check item, the small town under the watch and blessing of the Virgin is beautiful

The memorial column standing on Maria Theresia Street can be photographed with Anna’s Column, the snow-capped mountains and the golden roof in the background. I would never know that this place is a symbol of Innsbruck before I did my homework. The town is full of history everywhere.

attractions.name: Triumphal Arch
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Austria, Tyrol, Innsbruck, Triumphal Arch
reviews: Magnificent and magnificent to welcome the gates of the army's victory

The Arc de Triomphe in Austria is in Innsbruck, although it is not as famous as the Arc de Triomphe in Paris, France. However, the Arc de Triomphe in Innsbruck, Austria has another characteristic: from north to south, through the opening of the Arc de Triomphe, you can see the majesty of the Alps, and it looks very quiet under the white snow of Kaikai. Pedestrians and tourists are at ease on the narrow road.
Innsbruck is a city in southwestern Austria and the capital of Tyrol. It borders the Inn. This beautiful small city is located in the Alpine valley and means "bridge over the Inn".

A very historical building. There are a lot of Arc de Triomphe in Europe. The entire Arc de Triomphe is an independent building that spans this street and extends to the main city core area, which is also an important historical witness. [Scenery] The scenery here is beautiful [Interesting] It is very interesting.

The Arc de Triomphe in Innsbruck is at the southern end of Maria Tracy Street. It was built to celebrate the wedding at that time. The southern end is a wedding relief, and the northern end is a funeral. Because the groom died suddenly at the wedding, you can visit it.

attractions.name: Altstadt von Innsbruck
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Austria, Tyrol, Innsbruck, Altstadt von Innsbruck
reviews: In fact, I was a bit surprised to go to Innsbruck. I wanted to go to Interlaken before. I didn’t know her in advance. After I went there, I visited the Golden Roof, Swarovski, and then the old town market. There were not too many people. The neighborhood was very modern but clean, tidy, fresh and natural, kind of leisurely. The feeling of comfort is too lingering. Is indeed an unexpected gain

The golden roof is free of charge. You can check it out. Just give it a five-star. Vienna is the current capital of Austria, Salzburg is the capital of the 18th century, and Innsbruck is the capital of the 15th and 16th century.
"The Bridge on the Inn River" is full of medieval style ☀️
With such a beautiful wall, I want to know how to do sanitation and prevent the picture from fading and falling off-if you are in Beijing, it will be thick gray in three or two days🆒

The Medieval Old Town of Innsbruck stretches along Maria Theresia Street, from the Arc de Triomphe to the Golden Roof from south to north. This old and prosperous street is the main shopping and sightseeing street of Innsbruck, with an unusual concentration of historical sites. The hospital church, Anna's Column, the Arc de Triomphe, the city hall tower, the golden roof, the Heilbronn House, etc., are all places that tourists must pass through or are happy to enter. Climb to the 57-meter-high Old Town, the symbol of the city hall tower, and have a close view of the blue sky and white clouds, the ancient streets of the mountain city, colorful buildings... the charming Yincheng has a panoramic view.

Sbruck is located in the southwestern hinterland of Austria. It faces Germany to the north, Italy to the south, and Switzerland to the west. The most unique scenery here is the medieval architecture, the scenery is breathtakingly artistic. It still maintains the appearance of a medieval city. In the narrow streets, there are many Baroque-style buildings. The air in the small town is fresh and the streets are tidy.

The Old Town of Innsbruck has created a great attraction in the world. The architecture is very magnificent. It feels great to stroll around the small old town. The journey is easy and can be completed in a few hours. Returning from hiking or skiing, it is very suitable to spend a day or half a day strolling here.

attractions.name: Court Church
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Austria, Tyrol, Innsbruck, Court Church
reviews: The Hofkirche in Innsbruck, Austria. There are three main halls in the church. Inside the church is the tomb of King Similia. There are more than two dozen bronze statues of warriors on both sides, all of which are excellent works by famous Austrian artists. The palace chapel is open to the public every day, but there is a fee to enter. And the tickets are expensive.

The palace church is pretty good. This church is a leftover building. When it was made, it belonged to a royal lock and it was not locked. The education is very special. The interior space is very large. It is dedicated to paintings and sculptures. [Scenery] The landscape here is very unique. [Interesting] It’s good to go to WeChat

The court church in Innsbruck is where Maximilian I lived. There are three main halls. The main hall is the tomb of the emperor. There are 28 lifelike bronze statues around the sarcophagus. There are other statues that are worth visiting.
These statues are the most important works of art during the Germanic Renaissance and one of the most famous art memorabilia in Tirol.
This is a very famous church, it takes about half an hour to visit here

attractions.name: Town Tower
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Austria, Tyrol, Innsbruck, Town Tower
reviews: The city tower in Innsbruck, Austria is a famous architectural attraction of the city hall and a symbol of the old town of Innsbruck. The unique and exquisite ancient buildings are very attractive. You can see snow mountains in the distance. The tower has a small dome, which is said to replace What used to be a small spire has now become a famous tourist attraction. Visitors can climb the tower to enjoy the panoramic view of Innsbruck and the surrounding mountains.
This tower can be regarded as a local landmark, and the attraction can be regarded as an attraction, but it is just a landmark.

The tower is located at the east end of Duke Street, at the end of the street. This tower is an auxiliary building of the former City Hall. It is also a clock tower. The top of the tower will have a clock inlaid on it, which is not bad.

This tower was first built in the 14th century. It was in the city hall at that time. It was rebuilt in the 16th century. The earliest spire was changed to the current dome. There are more than 100 steps in the tower.
This tower was originally a part of the local city hall, and later became a landmark of the city alone. The exterior of the tower is all brick structure, and there are more than 100 steps inside.

attractions.name: Stubaital Glacier
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Austria, Tyrol, Innsbruck, Stubaital Glacier
reviews: The scenery here is very shocking, there is a feeling of ice and snow, you will feel thousands of miles of ice, people can't help but sigh the magic of nature.

There is a special tourist bus here. The glacier is very old. It is a scene caused by geographical changes. You need to take a cable car to go here. Wear a little more shoes. It is also very cold in summer. The cable car stops operating after 4:30 in the afternoon.
[Fun] Very exciting ice and snow culture
[Cost-effective] quite high cost-effective

There are very few strategies on Stubai on the Internet. I personally experienced it today before I came to tell everyone that from Innsbruck main railway station, take the bus 590 (590 points a, b). You can go up as long as it is 590. ), after going up, tell the driver to the terminal (there will be many stops in the middle, but the glacier cableway is at the terminal, the whole journey is about 1.5 hours, 52 kilometers, about 10 euros per person), and you can see the ropeway when you get off the terminal At the entrance, it is recommended to buy the second stage of the ropeway ticket (there are 3 stages, the first stage basically only sees a little snow, the second stage is the choice of most people, here you will see many skiers , There is a lot of snow, and there are fewer people going up the third stage. Because it is windy and heavy and snowy, professional equipment is needed to go up, and basically nothing can be seen, so it is recommended that you buy the second stage), buy the second stage ropeway ticket If you don’t have to come down at the first transfer station, just continue to sit, and then you can get down at the second transfer station. After you get down, you can easily see the ski resort. Don’t worry about not finding your way. Then change your down jacket and down pants. You can get high!

Take the 590 bus from the train station to the Stubai Glacier, which is also the terminal. After getting off at the station, go to the ticket hall to buy a cable car ticket. When buying a ticket, you will be asked which line to go, because there are several hiking routes, but there is only one glacier route. You can point to the route map to tell others your route. Then you have to take the cable car up the mountain and pass three cable cars to reach the starting point of the glacier hike.

The Stubai Tram runs directly from the center of Innsbruck to the rolling hills of the Volpmes Peak in Austria’s Stubai Valley and the spectacular Alpine Animal World, Forge Museum, Goshawk Mountain, Selrus Mountain and Glaciers Tours are the focus of visits.

attractions.name: Old Quebec
attractions.loc_tags: North America, Canada, Quebec, Quebec City, Old Quebec
reviews: Quebec City, the capital of the province of Quebec, is the seventh largest city in Canada and an important city and port in eastern Canada. It is located at the confluence of the St. Lawrence River and the St. Charles River. It has a polar and sub-polar climate. Quebec City has a population of 680,000. Quebec City is the capital of New France established by Sampland in 1608. It is also a fortress and an important port.

Very French-style place. It's beautiful to take pictures in good weather, that is, the maple leaves are not very red when the National Day comes. The old town is not too big, half a day is enough to go shopping, there are many cafes and small restaurants.

The gates and walls of Quebec are currently the only complete city wall system in the Americas. The building is the famous parliament building of Quebec, a typical British architecture. Behind the Houses of Parliament is the British barracks. The last is the Chateau Fontina Hotel in Quebec, built by the Pacific Railway Company. Currently managed by Fairmont Hotel Group.
The old city still retains the style of a French city in the 18th century.

The old city of Quebec is full of castles, like a fairy tale world. Even the train station is a castle, museums and government buildings are castles. It is the right place to come here to find a sense of fairy tales.

attractions.name: Fairmont Le Chateau Frontenac
attractions.loc_tags: North America, Canada, Quebec, Quebec City, Fairmont Le Chateau Frontenac
attractions.address: 1 Rue des Carrières, Québec, QC G1R 4P5, Canada
reviews: The Fontinac Hotel is the landmark of Quebec City, and the tourist center. The landmark of a city is actually a hotel. It is really amazing. I was fortunate to check in this world-famous castle. It is really a fairy tale. Experience.
Quebec City is a very interesting city. Its landmark is actually a hotel, not a traditional attraction, but this hotel is really a punch card, like a castle, it is a fairy tale fortress for everyone.

Hotels are of course a part of travel life, but some hotels are even more of an indispensable part of a perfect itinerary. If there are less, travel is not perfect, such as the hotel in Disneyland and this castle hotel. Whatever is translated is good, anyway. No, just call the Castle Hotel. The Kasbah Hotel is a famous scene in the ancient city of Quebec. It stands tall and can be seen from not too far away. It is really a landmark building. The inside of the hotel is also very quaint, so it is an experience that is integrated with the ancient city, and it is a must to come to Quebec City.

The Fontinac Hotel inspires my young girl's heart. It turns out that every man has a castle dream in his heart. Disney Castle can't inspire it, Quebec Castle can. Quebec City must be the most beautiful city in Canada, not one of them.

The Fairmont Le Chateau Frontenac is the symbol of Quebec City and is said to be the hotel with the most shots in the world. More than three hundred years ago, the location of this hotel was the Castle of St. Louis, which suppressed the entire St. Lawrence River. It was stationed here by the Governor-General of the Colony of New France. It has become a famous world-class hotel.

attractions.name: Montmorency Falls （Parc de la Chute-Montmorency）
attractions.loc_tags: North America, Canada, Quebec, Quebec City, Montmorency Falls （Parc de la Chute-Montmorency）
reviews: Quebec's Crystal Falls (Montmorency Falls) is very powerful, because it has a drop of 83 meters, which is 1.5 times that of Niagara Falls. A large amount of water pours from the steep cliffs straight down the St. Lawrence River, making a deafening sound. The momentum is quite majestic. The lake in front of the waterfall also freezes in winter. If the ice layer is thick enough, you can ride a snowmobile, walk or climb an ice waterfall on it. There are steps along the mountain wall beside the waterfall, and there are many close waterfall viewing paths, pavilions, and bridges.

Quebec Crystal Falls/Montmorency Falls (Montmorency Falls) is located in the east of Quebec’s Old Town for more than ten minutes by car. The momentum of Montmorency Falls is very majestic, because it has a drop of 83 meters, which is 1.5 times that of Niagara Falls. A large amount of water pours down the St. Lawrence River from the steep cliffs, making a deafening sound, and the momentum is quite majestic. It is the highest waterfall in Quebec and is known as one of the three largest waterfalls in America. Its water source comes from the mouth of the Montmorency River, which flows straight down the cliffs of the mountains and meets the Saint-Laurent River. The Crystal Waterfall is very similar to the Huangguoshu Waterfall in my country. Although the width is not very spectacular, it has a unique style.

Montmorency Falls, also known as Crystal Falls, should be formed by the difference in water level when the reservoir was built.
We arrived at more than three in the afternoon and did not see where to buy tickets. The fall of the waterfall is fairly high and the width is average. You can see the back on the road, and there is a big park when you walk in, and there are fallen red apples under the apple trees. You can walk to the suspension bridge to see the waterfall, and you can go out on the other side of the suspension bridge. If you are physically fit, you can walk down the stairs to the bottom of the waterfall and listen to the torrent of water. Some brave people play zipline in the waterfall, which must be very exciting.

Montmorency Falls is located about 1 km north of Quebec City. It is formed by the Montmorency River falling vertically from an 83-meter-high mountain wall. Its height is 1.5 times that of Niagara Falls. It is magnificent and spectacular. You can choose to go down to the bottom of the valley in various ways such as cable car, small train or hiking, and get close to the waterfall in all directions

Québec’s Luncie Falls is in the snow ❄️, you can see the crystal waterfall ◤ name◢Quebec Luncie Falls◤ coordinates◢Quebec City, Quebec, Canada◤ business hours◢ see the scenic spot◤ price◢ tickets are required. ◤Best time to play◢The weather in spring and autumn is pleasant, but very short. This time is most comfortable, but there is also the romance of Quebec in winter. ◤Recommendation reasons◢One of Canada’s three major waterfalls, three beautiful waterfalls: Crystal Falls-Montmorency Falls; Thor's Water-Niagara Falls; Marilyn Monroe movie location-Bow River Falls ◤ Crystal Falls ◢Montmorency Falls, Quebec, is the highest waterfall in Quebec. It has a drop of 83 meters, which is 1.5 times that of Niagara Falls. A large amount of water pours down the St. Lawrence River from the steep cliffs. The deafening sound and majestic momentum. Its water source comes from the mouth of the Montmorency River, which flows straight down the cliffs of the mountains and meets the Saint-Laurent River. It is one of the three major waterfalls in America. ◤Tour route◢Old Quebec-Crystal Falls◤Tour experience◢Have you ever seen waterfalls in all seasons? In spring and summer, everything is lush and verdant; in autumn, the forest is full of colors and colorful; in winter, the water is frozen, and the waterfall becomes a huge icicle hanging on the cliff, looking crystal clear from a distance. ❄️In the snow all over the sky, seeing the veritable crystal waterfall, the couples travelling together were very happy and began various poses. Moon also melted into the snow completely, and I had to watch out from time to time that she would hit me with a snowball! ❄️People who love excitement often climb here. There are steps built along the mountain wall beside the waterfall, and there are many close waterfall viewing paths, pavilions, and bridges, which can make visitors more easily feel the spectacular scenery of the waterfall. Quebec ☔️ One day trip to the old town～
The main church of the Sanctuary of Our Lady is under repair. You can enter from the side door to visit. I encountered a wedding and saw a beautiful bride. Very few relatives and friends attended. We were very gossiping and guessed the reason for a long time [smile]
It is the oldest church in this parish in North America and the first church in North America to be upgraded to the Pontifical Temple (1874). It is currently listed as a World Heritage Site. The cathedral has a neoclassical facade, decorated with rich artworks: stained glass, paintings and altar lamps (a gift from Louis XIV).

North American Churches (1)|Quebec Notre-Dame Cathedral⛪️Walking into the oldest cathedral in North America When I walked into the Notre-Dame Cathedral, I saw from the eyes of the believers what they call devotion and faith. They silently prayed in their eyes I am firm and I am not a believer. I also envy them for having such a power to say: "He who has faith is happy." Perhaps if a person has faith, it is equivalent to having spiritual support. Perhaps, a person with a sense of support, with a beautiful and noble faith, is full of courage and persistence in life. Whether it is a god in the west or a bodhisattva in the east. The four governors of New France and the bishop of Quebec are buried here. This is a National Historic Site of Canada and is listed as a World Heritage Site by UNESCO. Notre Dame Cathedral in Quebec has a history of 350 years. The church has suffered several catastrophes: fires and earthquakes. The church we see now was rebuilt in 1925. This is a Baroque cathedral, and the two different-shaped spires on the left and right are the biggest features of Baroque architecture. Notre Dame Cathedral, Quebec’s first Roman Catholic archbishop, and the most influential man of that era-Francois de laval de montmorency (Francois de laval de montmorency), is buried in the side room of the church . ◤Tour route◢Quebec’s ancient city-Kasbah Hotel-Notre Dame Cathedral-Crystal Falls-Saint Anne Grand Canyon-Saint Lawrence River-Montreal round trip) ◤ Tour experience ◢ Pass through the solemn gate and buy the ticket Access to Notre-Dame Cathedral. The exterior of the church has a typical Baroque style. The twin towers are nearly 70 meters high, and the oldest clock in North America hangs on the west tower, which resembles the Notre Dame Cathedral. The sun shone on the spire of the tower for a moment, spreading all over the face, giving a sacred aura. go

When I first came to Canada, the library inside the Parliament building suffocated me and felt beautiful. But when I came to Montreal, after seeing Notre Dame Cathedral, I felt that other buildings were nothing.

Compared with Notre Dame Church in Montreal, the color here is much softer than Notre Dame Church in Montreal. The whole inside is golden, only the roof shows a touch of blue, which reminds people of some religious stories.

attractions.name: Lower Town
attractions.loc_tags: North America, Canada, Quebec, Quebec City, Lower Town
reviews: The lower part of Quebec City has a little Parisian style. Walking here seems to be walking on the miniature Champs Elysées. The locals who come and go all speak French, which still feels very exotic.

Quebec City is really a city of dreams, wandering in the streets of the old city, looking far away, there are castle-like buildings everywhere, and the low bungalows have a feeling of a European town, worthy of a little Paris

The lower city of Quebec is mainly still some old streets. These streets can only be said to have decades of history. They are relative to the modern commercial center of skyscrapers, but I think they are quite interesting.

In the lower part of Quebec City, this concept is compared to the upper part. The buildings in Xiacheng are more French style. I heard from the residents here that it has been in this style for many years. It hasn't changed for hundreds of years.

The Xiacheng District is mainly developed around the Quebec Castle. This circle is filled with some very old houses. These houses are now basically opened into various small shops, which can reflect some history.

attractions.name: Citadelle of Quebec
attractions.loc_tags: North America, Canada, Quebec, Quebec City, Citadelle of Quebec
attractions.address: 1 Cote De la Citadelle | Cap Diamant, Quebec City, Quebec G1R 3R2
reviews: The star-shaped fortress castle is an attraction that I stumbled upon when wandering around in the old city of Quebec City. When I entered the fortress and saw the name on the wall, I knew what the attraction was. I didn't really see the star-shaped fortress. I was only in this city.

Overlooking the star-shaped castle, you can turn around around, and you need to buy tickets to enter. The Queen’s Castle Park next to it is the location of the butler’s cemetery in "Lonely and Brilliant Gods and Ghosts." The star-shaped castle is the largest castle in North America, covering an area of approximately 2.3 square kilometers. It was built by the French in 1745. The British completed the castle in 1850 and regarded it as the focal point of the city's defense system. The castle is also the resident of the 22nd Regiment of the Royal Canadian Army.
It may be because this place is so important that it has been a military fortress with a large castle since ancient times. Today the fortress and castle are preserved for tourists to enjoy and visit.
This is a large-scale castle, and also a very important military fortress. This place can be regarded as the site of a large castle in North America and the most important tourist spot in Quebec.
A very beautiful castle. This is called a fortress, but I think the feeling of a fortress is much more than that. It is more like a luxurious castle inhabited by princes and nobles. It's pretty good.

attractions.name: Plains of Abraham （The Battlefields Park）
attractions.loc_tags: North America, Canada, Quebec, Quebec City, Plains of Abraham （The Battlefields Park）
attractions.address: Discovery Pavilion of the Plains of Abraham, Quebec City, Quebec G1R 5H3, Canada
reviews: Quebec City is the capital of Quebec Province. This has always made me feel incredible, because Montreal seems to have the atmosphere of a capital, and it was also qualified to compete for the capital of Canada, but after coming, I understood
The main part of this place is a very wide plain, but there are still some small hills in it, and it is good to see some small waterfalls. This place also has some famous wars in history.

This place is also known as the Battlefield Park. It is a large plain. Maybe because of its history, it was also a very big battlefield in ancient times. It's not bad here. It feels very historic and beautiful.
Don't be mistaken, this place is actually a very large park, just an open park, located on a large plain by the sea, so it is called the plain, and the scenery here is also beautiful.
This place is called the plain, but really don't think of it as a place like the big plain that we say geographically. This is actually a very open park with many buildings here.

attractions.name: Place Royale
attractions.loc_tags: North America, Canada, Quebec, Quebec City, Place Royale
reviews: Place Royale is located near the Chateau Frontenac Hotel. The old city of Quebec City is a romantic city with many castles. It is often compared with Paris. The residents here basically speak French, and they are indeed very French.

You can pretend to be a small city in Paris. There are only carriages and no cars. Looking at the castles and fantastic small cities, which is the most beautiful city in Canada? Although I have not been to all the small cities, I can be sure that it is it.

The Plaza Royale is located next to the famous Chateau Frontenac Hotel. The surrounding area of the square is surrounded by castle-style buildings. So when you walk into the ancient city of Quebec City, it is obvious that you are walking into the castle complex.

We came here last weekend (December 10th) and it was very beautiful. There is a big Christmas tree in the middle of the square. There are music, playground equipment with children, and lots of lights. I dare say you will feel like you are in Europe. The buildings here are very tall, and there are no slums in this area. There are many good art shops nearby. The most interesting is Les Trois Corbeaux, a glass blowing shop, beside the steep stairs at the corner. The magician (staff) is working inside.

Woke up in the castle, opened the curtains and looked down at the ancient city. It felt like Bruce Wayne (I'll stay when I'm not at home). Looking at the church dome and bell tower downstairs, I suddenly understood why poverty limits our imagination.

attractions.name: Basilica of Sainte-Anne-de-Beaupré
attractions.loc_tags: North America, Canada, Quebec, Quebec City, Basilica of Sainte-Anne-de-Beaupré
reviews: St. Anne’s Basilica (sainte-anne-de-beaupre’ basilica) is located on the outskirts of Quebec City. The design of the church is as exquisite as a jewel, with exquisite Gothic stained glass. The statue of Saint Anne on the top of the church is made of pure gold and is extremely precious. The church is famous for curing the disabled. Our experience of visiting the church is also amazing. It has been raining heavily on the way we went. When we reached the church and parked on the side of the road, the rain stopped completely, and when we came out after visiting the church, the sun was shining. A rainbow appeared over the church, and everyone said that we were lucky, and Saint Anne appeared.

Visit is free, and there is a paid parking lot at the door. There is an old church on the mountain, and the church currently in use is a modern building. It is said that in 1888, the churches in the parish were rumored to have such a miracle: when three worshippers passed by the statue of the Virgin Mary, suddenly the eyes of the Virgin opened. Since then, millions of pilgrims have gathered here. The statue of Saint Anne on the top of the church is made of pure gold and is extremely precious. The church is famous for curing the disabled.

A place worth visiting, especially in the autumn season. One of the three cathedrals in North America is not a false name. I don’t know the other two, but this is the most beautiful church in North America. Although it cannot be compared with European churches, it is not bad. Next to the church is a very large synagogue, with different styles and contrasts. Look at the picture, dears. Pay attention to a few details: 1. Different from many churches, it is the painted color, brown series; 2. The large rose window behind the entrance; 3. The ray image of Annie on the left; 4. The altar; 5. Two entrances The pillar was covered with crutches. Tell us directly, this is a very "spiritual" temple. 6. Bronze reliefs on the door of the church. Biblical stories began to whisper at the door to the impetuous hearts of people.

The most stunning Gothic architectural style cathedral in North America and Canada Maple Leaf Journey, especially the interior style is unique! Not far from the main entrance, there is a small Israeli church with very different styles.

St. Anne’s Cathedral is full of the standard European Spanish church style. The two tall minarets are very eye-catching. The hall is divided into two floors. The stained glass and sculptures in the upper hall are very accomplished and give a sense of sacredness. The acoustics in the church are very good, the music played is peaceful and quiet, and it is very comfortable to listen to.

attractions.name: Nara Park

reviews: park is free entrance! and it is massive! I am into jr Nara which I had read was not near to the park however when you get off the train there are signs to the bus stop outside. the bus is a loop system with fixed price. there are 1300 deer in the park- photo opportunities everywhere. well worth a visit and easy by public transport.

Nara Park is closer to Osaka than Kyoto where there is dozens of cute deer running around and waiting for people to play with them or feed them. This is such a nice experience and if you are in Osaka you should take some time to go.
This place deserves an award for taking good care of everything specially the deer! I have seen and touched the deer and even fed them, swear the deer is soooooo well mannered  ❤️❤️
A short ride from Osaka and very peaceful and relaxed atmosphere with deers!
A massive park in the middle of Nara. Tons of human-friendly deers roaming around and you can pet and feed them with deer biscuits.

attractions.name: Todaiji
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Nara, Nara, Todaiji
reviews: Very impressive historical temple. Lots of figures and architectural models to see inside. Also a good place to get some souvenirs.

Amazing temple grounds. The outer gate really shows its age and the temple gate, temple and grounds are beautiful!  Nestled in Nara park where the deer are tame and always looking for a handout this is a fun place to visit.
A grand great Buddha in Todaiji Temple situated in Nara.. the beautiful place minutes away from Osaka Japan.
My favorite temple. There is the biggest wooden Buddha inside the temple. Amazingly big and beautifully built.
Nigatsudo is a small temple and is within walking distance. Todaiji is often packed with tourists, so Nigatsudo is a welcome respite from the crowds.
