reviews: In the center of Zermatt, the museum is not very big, but it is worth a visit. The Swiss pass already includes the ticket. It will take about an hour or two to stroll. There are also videos introducing some history, which is more interesting
You can take a look at it by the way, the history of human climbing the Matterhorn is still quite emotional.

This museum shows people the history of the Matterhorn mountain climbing and the living conditions of the people here. There are a large number of photos and real objects on display, as well as modern images and light and shadow technology, which are very fresh and vivid.

This museum is located on the ground floor of Zermatt’s town square. The entire museum adopts a scene mode, telling everyone an unforgettable story about the Matterhorn through scenes, which is very good.

The museum is located below the town square. The entrance is a modern glass building. There are many climbing or archeological objects in the museum, telling the story of the Matterhorn, which is not bad.

attractions.name: Rothorn
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Switzerland, Valais, Zermatt, Matterhorn, Rothorn
reviews: Rothorn, the summit of the Matterhorn, can choose to climb the mountain, of course, the premise is sufficient physical strength and time. If you want to save time and effort, you can take the cable car. The fare is actually not expensive.

It takes about 5 minutes to walk from Zermatt Central Railway Station to the cable car station. It takes about 4 minutes to reach the Sunnegga station by the cable car. You can transfer to the 4-seater aerial tramway and it takes 7 minutes to reach Braucher. (Blauherd) station, but this line stopped in October, you can only hike up to see Lake 5, it takes 4 to 5 hours to go back and forth, but the Rothorn is the best place to view the Matterhorn.

A very good place to view the Matterhorn. Take a gear train from the ZBAG-zsb station in Zermatt, then change to a small cable car to Blauherd to Sunnegga, and then change to a large cable car to reach the Rothorn. Not only can you see the majestic Matterhorn on the top of the mountain, but you can also see more than a dozen snow-capped mountains with posters above 4000 meters, and the scenery is very spectacular. There is also a pizza shop on the top of the mountain to solve lunch.

This mountain is 2800 meters above sea level. It is said that this is the best angle to shoot the Matterhorn, but I think it is really general. The Matterhorn seen here is completely devoid of momentum and looks like a small hillside.
I really don't recommend this place. If you are short of time, you can use it. Although you can enjoy the Matterhorn up close, looking at the pier peak here is like watching a small mountain bag.

reviews: There is no scenery in April. It is not easy to climb the mountain. Hold on. I still didn't climb to the top. The scenic spot has entered the starting point of the mountain climbing. Maoer Mountain Eco-tourism Resort is located in Maoershan Town, Shangzhi City, Harbin City, Heilongjiang Province, 84 kilometers away from Harbin. The main peak of Maoer Mountain is 805 meters above sea level, which is the highest peak around Harbin. According to legend, the fairy hat fell here, forming Maoer Mountain. Strange peaks, natural secondary forests all over the mountains, the scenery is unique and beautiful throughout the year. Early spring—flowers are all over the place, colorful, colorful and fragrant; midsummer—bees flying and butterflies dancing, birds contending, flowing water, spring water gurgling; golden autumn—many mountains and red leaves, shining in the morning, five-flowered mountains, sceneries Thousands; cold winter-thousands of miles of ice peaks, thousands of miles of snow drifting, mountain dancing silver snakes, crystal clear. Today Maoershan is well-known for its five major tourism brands: mountaineering and fitness, travel and skiing, folk customs, agricultural sightseeing, and rafting. Among them, mountaineering and fitness are particularly popular among tourists. At the same time, the scenic spot deeply explores its own cultural characteristics, and the three newly built mountain roads are rationally planned and each has its own characteristics. "Quanfu Road" started in Lujiaweizi Village at the foot of Maoer Mountain, which was the road to politicians, promotion and great success; "Huifu Road" started in Kaiyuan Temple, which was the road to wisdom, study and study; "Baofu Road" It started in Fumin Village, a road to career, entrepreneurship and wealth. The way of living in the world gathers all blessings, encourages studying and enlightens Huifu, and prospering upstream is a treasure. [Scenery] [Interesting] [Cost-effective]
My hometown! Beautiful little town. [View] [Fun] [Cost-effective]

attractions.name: Shangzhi Beilin
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Heilongjiang, Harbin, Shangzhi, Shangzhi Beilin
attractions.address: N Ring St, Shangzhi Shi, Haerbin Shi, Heilongjiang Sheng, China
reviews: It's really good, I especially recommend it. The heroes of the Anti-Japanese Army, the famous historical figures, the calligraphers, and the latest addition of the literary master Mo Yan.

In terms of content, the forest of steles broke through the construction tradition of the characteristics of the forest of steles inherited by our country, and ingeniously divided the entire forest of steles into three parts: "Love in the Pearl River", "The Origin of Chinese Ink" and "Qianqiu National Quintessence". "Jiangjun Art Garden", "Zhuhe Love", "The Origin of Chinese Ink", "The Essence of Qianqiu", "The Splendor of Printing World", "Lian Yuan Yingying", and "The Light of Wisdom" are composed of seven columns. They are the chairman of the Chinese Calligraphers Association. Shen Peng was hailed as the "Han Mo Sheng Jing".
first part
"Zhuhe Love", a total of 4l stone steles, contains the inscriptions and poems and inks of Zhu De, Song Qingling, Dong Biwu and other party and state leaders for the anti-Japanese national heroes Zhao Shangzhi and Zhao Yiman martyrs; the Northeast Anti-Japanese War veteran Han Guang, Feng Zhongyun, Chen Lei’s inscription also included poems by martyrs such as Zhao Shangzhi and Zhao Yiman, the anti-Japanese national heroes.
the second part
"The Origin of Chinese Calligraphy", a total of 42 steles, is a classic work in the history of the development and evolution of Chinese calligraphy, showing the origin and development of this great art of Chinese calligraphy.
the third part
"Qianqiu National Quintessence", in accordance with the development of Chinese calligraphy art, selects masterpieces of famous masters of the past dynasties, and is made by precise reproduction and carving. Literary masterpieces such as "Before and After the Master", "Front and Back Red Cliff Fu", "Thousand Characters", "Luo Shen Fu", "Preface to the Pavilion of the King of Teng" and so on are all covered in the Stone Shangzhi Stele Forest.
【taste】
【view】
Warmly recommend, go to Forest of Steles, the famous place of Shangzhi is the Forest of Steles

Opened in 1988, it is regarded as one of Sydney's premier tourist attractions with over 55% of its visitors each year coming from overseas.

attractions.name: Blue Mountains National Park
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, Australia, New South Wales, Blue Mountains, Blue Mountains National Park
reviews: The Blue Mountains National Park is a protectednational park that is located in the Blue Mountainsregion of New South Wales, in eastern Australia. The 267,954-hectare (662,130-acre) national park is situated approximately 80 kilometres (50 mi) west of Sydney, and the park boundary is quite irregular as it is broken up by roads, urban areas and inholdings.Despite the name mountains, the area is an uplifted plateau, dissected by a number of larger rivers. The highest point in the park is Mount Werong at 1,215 metres (3,986 ft) above sea level; while the low point is on the Nepean River at 20 metres (66 ft) above sea level as it leaves the park.

reviews: Tallest observation tower in the Southern Hemisphere. Opened to the public in August 1981. They are famous with CBD buffet as it comes with 360° degree view. Frankly speaking its a must visited place.

Sydney Tower is Sydney's tallest structure and the second tallest observation tower in the Southern Hemisphere. The name Sydney Tower has become common in daily usage; however, the tower has been known as the Sydney Tower Eye,AMP Tower, Flower Tower, Glower Tower, Westfield Centrepoint Tower, Big Poke, Centrepoint Tower or just Centrepoint.

Sydney tower was established in 1981, is the highest prospect in the southern hemisphere, and the Sydney opera house, Sydney harbour bridge and the three landmark of Sydney. Visit the central point here also is pretty good, because of the high-speed elevator only spent 40 seconds journey itself is an unforgettable experience.
Compared with various observation desks in Australia and around the world, this one is only average and rather expensive.

There is no need to queue up and many tourists to buy tickets. After entering the venue, watch a 4D video about Sydney for about 5 minutes and then pass the security check. Take the elevator to the top of the Sydney Tower and enjoy the scenery of Sydney. The entire CBD, Circular Quay and Darling Harbour are unobstructed. This is the first time you come to Sydney to experience sightseeing.

The United Nations Building is the location of the United Nations Headquarters. It is located on the east side of Manhattan in New York City, USA. It is an international territory. Therefore, citizens of member states can enter and visit with passports. From the United Nations headquarters building can overlook the East River. The towering United Nations Headquarters building, like a huge book, is inlaid on a thick square base. Various sculptures praising peace and opposing war are dotted around the building.
At United Nations Headquarters in New York, you need to register across the road and make an appointment if you want to visit the General Assembly meeting room.

The hall hung the heads of successive Secretary-Generals and panels describing the history of the United Nations. Outside the building, two modern sculptures are said to be very famous, one "Broken Earth" and the other "Curly Pistols".

attractions.name: Fifth Avenue
attractions.loc_tags: North America, United States, New York State, New York, Fifth Avenue
reviews: The holiday lights on Fifth Avenue were wonderful. The Rock Center tree, big giant Toys on sidewalks, and the store windows really cheered us up.

I went to the United States on a business trip, finished my official business in Washington, D.C., and stopped by the East Bank. Fifth Avenue is an important main road in Manhattan, New York City, starting from Washington Square to 138th Street. There are many classics on Fifth Avenue, including the Empire State Building, New York Public Library, Rockefeller Center, St. Patrick's Church, Central Park, and so on. There is an "Art Gallery Avenue" near Central Park, because there are many art galleries there, such as the Metropolitan Museum of Art, Whitney Art Museum and so on. On Fifth Avenue, the world's top brand-name stores gather here, forming a high-end shopping area.

I don't know how to write this place. According to many people, this place is equivalent to Vanity Fair. All kinds of luxury brands gathered. Rich and famous people from all walks of life gathered. When I walked around, I came across a tightly guarded, black bulletproof glass car clearing the way, closing the road to watch the lively stage. Compared with the valuables in the luxury stores on Fifth Avenue, the interaction between celebrities and melon-eaters on Vanity Fair is the protagonist of the global drama on Fifth Avenue. The melon-eating crowds who come here for no reason and the celebrities who don't know each other are so harmoniously matched, I will appear on the stage after you sing, it is really lively.

When you arrive in New York, you can't experience Manhattan's fashion and appreciate the prosperity of New York unless you have a stroll on Fifth Avenue in Manhattan. The Fifth Avenue running north and south of Manhattan connects the Empire State Building, Rockefeller Center, St. Patrick’s Church, Central Park and other famous American historical landmarks. From 34th Street to 60th Street, it is the world’s most upscale shopping district. Japanese people come and go, the stream is endless~

Fifth Avenue and Broadway Avenue are probably among the most famous streets in the world. What everyone knows best is the shops of various luxury brands on this avenue. However, even if you don’t have a shopping plan, you can take a stroll on the Fifth Avenue section. The best section should be midtown and uptown. If you have good feet, you can go to downtown. Many scenic spots and historical buildings are also distributed on both sides of this avenue, such as Grand Central, Rockefeller, etc., within a short walk.

attractions.name: The British Museum

reviews: Even though they stole many artifacts from all over the world,  I accept the fact they have passion for collecting and preserving treasures.

This is a world-recognised museum of the highest quality.  Exhibits are thoughtfully displayed with historical and national expertise evident throughout.  The museum is always packed with huge queues to get in during the holiday peak times, winter and summer.  It is definitely worth a visit but make it the first thing you do in the day - fewer people.  The breathtaking exhibits from British and World culture never fail to amaze no matter how many visits.  All items on display were legally obtained and protected against damage by expert care.  The world should be grateful to this august institution.  Unlike most in the eorld, this museum remains free to enter although I always give a donation.
I suggest everybody to visit British museum in London.The great  beautiful fantastic museum I have ever seen in the world.
The British Museum is a must visit if you like history and want to see artifacts from around the world.  I spent almost 3 hours there and didn't see it all.

As One of the top museums in the world, British Museum was one of the reasons, I had chosen UK as the destination for my first oversea trip. With wonderful collections from all over the world, it was like a treasure house to me. (Surely it is the treasure house of the world). I am So grateful for the opportunities museums have provided to us, which enable us to learn and to admire...  A must visit for all. Two pictures from me as examples, there are Many photos online. By the way, we were allowed to take pictures in British Museum. Another good news is Entry is Free. A huge museum that is very famous and full of tourists. Works cover a range of cultures from across the world so there is actually a fairly limited section dedicated to British history. I recommend you plan the things you want to see before you arrive to ensure you have sufficient time

reviews: It is a nice place to have the morning stroll and there are people jogging around as well. You get to admire the greens and history of the place and buildings.

·Japan's famous National University, the main campus is located in the center of Sapporo, the capital of Hokkaido. Many places within the University are designated as important cultural heritage, among them the Second Farm of the Department of Agriculture, Clark statues, poplar tree lined road worth seeing.

In addition to being a world-famous university, Hokkaido University is also a very famous tourist attraction. It is the most famous and popular ginkgo attraction in Japan. Hokkaido University's ginkgo biloba can be said to be world famous! The campus is located in downtown Sapporo and the transportation is quite convenient. However, since the cold winter in Hokkaido comes early and the relative ginkgo season is relatively short, it is possible to grasp the time from mid to late October in just a few weeks. In addition, the campus of Peking University also holds the "Gold Leaf Festival" every year, and there will be a ginkgo lighting event, which is very dreamy!

Japan's famous National University, the main campus in the city center of Sapporo, Hokkaido. Many places within the university are designated as important cultural heritage, among them the second farm of the Department of Agriculture, Clark statue, poplar tree lined road worth to see.

Hokkaido University is still a relatively famous university in Japan. The students who come out are still quite powerful. The school building is also very good and styled. The night scene is also very beautiful.

reviews: Fish market in Hokkaido price is attractive and the sashimi so yummy

The deepest impression of the Hokkaido Jingu shrine is that there are many crows, and it is a large one, not very afraid of people, the crow here seems to be a god bird. The cherry tree in the Hokkaido Jingu shrine is not bad, but it was almost finished when I went.

It is the center of Hokkaido faith and is regarded as' so Chinju. ' In the Meiji period, it was enshrined in the Meiji period 2 year (1868 year) as the main enshrined deity of Hokkaido Jingu shrine, such as okuninushi no Kami, dainacho no Kami and shojomyo no Kami by the order of the Emperor Meiji. The scenery around the palace is almost sacred, along the quiet mountain trails and through the layers of cypress trees. About 1,400 cherry blossoms and about 250 plum blossoms are planted on the outer edge of the palace, and it is a popular flower-watching place every spring.

In Maruyama Park, the shrine that protects Hokkaido, many Japanese came to visit. The shrine is full of shade, and when spring comes, cherry blossoms and plum blossoms competed to open, attracting countless visitors. Here you can ask for your own omnibus, 1000 yen to 2000 yen, and you can also donate money to pray.

reviews: It’s a quaint little town. Life is simple and close to nature, with loads of onsens.

Jozankei Hot Spring is a century-old hot spring surrounded by valleys and forests. It is called "Sapporo's Back Garden". It is said that it was discovered in 1866 by a monk from Biqian, Miquan Jozan. The spring is a colorless and transparent salinized spring. The salt contained can prevent sweat from evaporating. After soaking, the whole body will not become cold and warm! You can enjoy the red leaves in autumn and the superb view of snow in winter, as well as lighting up the lights at night. It is a good place to spend a leisurely vacation in Sapporo, Hokkaido.
The views are amazing and I would love to return.

Jozankei is a hot spring resort area loved by locals in Sapporo. At Sapporo TV Tower, you can take the free bus from Jozankei Hot Spring Hotel. When you book a hotel, you can make a reservation and register your name. It takes about 1 hour from the city to the hot spring town. , Beautiful scenery, quiet, no foreigners are seen, all local families come to spend the weekend. The Toyohira River flows through the Jeongsan Valley. There are many hot spring hotels and guesthouses on both sides of the valley. It is also a famous red leaf viewing spot in autumn.

Don’t be too pleasant to take a bath in the hot springs in winter. If you come to Otaru, Dingshanxi Hot Spring is quite famous. If you booked the resort hotel online in advance, it is very Japanese. The beautiful snow scene outside the hotel window is almost like a fairy tale world.

Just strolling outside, not going inside, the environment is ok.

Healing Travel|Hokkaido Travel Guide
Place of travel-Hokkaido Agency's former headquarters
[Address]: Kita 3-jo Nishi 6-chome, Chuo-ku, Sapporo, Hokkaido, Japan
[Ticket]: Free
[Style]: Architecture, cultural venues
【Opening Hours】:
08:45-17:30 (January 1st-December 31st Monday-Friday)
Not open to the public: (January 1st-December 31st Saturday-Sunday)
[Recommended play time]: 1~2h
One of my favorite places in Sapporo is the Old Town Hall. Especially when I first met Hokkaido, I saw the beauty of this place.
The former main office of the Hokkaido Agency was originally the highest administrative building in Hokkaido. Built in 1888, it is a major landmark in Sapporo. This red brick and green tiled Baroque building is a symbol of the pioneering era of Hokkaido and is affectionately called the "red brick house" by the locals. The museum has the Hokkaido Literature Museum and the Hokkaido History Gallery, which are open for free viewing by the public. The museum basically maintains the style of the past. You can see many cultural relics about the development history of Hokkaido here.
I think the four appearances of the old hall, if you have time, you can take a look. The appearance during the day, the appearance of snow during the day, the appearance of snow at night, the appearance of snow at night, the most recommended is the appearance of snow at night, be sure to see!
A red brick house like a fairy tale, the sky is snowing, there are bright lights hanging on the trees in the snow, and Christmas joyous songs are all around, and it feels like walking into a fairy tale world~so beautiful~
[Traffic suggestion]:
Take the subway "Namboku Line", "Toho Line" or JR to "Sapporo Station" and walk for about 8 minutes;
Take the subway "North-South Line", "Tozai Line", "Toho Line" to "Odori Station" and walk for about 9 minutes.

The old red brick building of the Hokkaido Agency is a former government building in Sapporo. Located in the center of Sapporo, it is a baroque-style European-style building made of red bricks. Because the former hall was located, it was also called the old hall or the old hall of the Hokkaido hall, or directly called the red brick according to its appearance. It has been designated as an important national cultural property of Japan. At present, the building serves as the Hokkaido Literature Museum and the Hokkaido History Gallery. It is open to the public for free viewing. The museum basically maintains the style of the past and displays cultural relics and materials about the development history of Hokkaido. You can read historical documents about Hokkaido; There is an archive of the four northern islands (formerly Japanese territory, now occupied by Russia), including the living conditions of the people in those days, war photos and wartime supplies when Japanese soldiers protected their territories, showing related information from the time when Japan ruled the northern four islands. Cultural relics. It is very worth seeing for friends who like history.

Japan's largest Chinese city, including the Chinese cuisine store-based food restaurants, many gift shops, a total of more than 500 stores gathered here, to Yokohama must go here.

Japan's largest Chinese city, including the Chinese cuisine store-based food restaurants, many gift shop, a total of more than 500 stores gathered here. There is also the Guandi Temple, which enshrines the hero of the Three Kingdoms, Guan Yu, and pray for the safety of the voyage Mazu Temple. There is a archway in the East and West of Yokohama China Street in accordance with Fengshui, and it is possible to enjoy only the buildings in China Street. There are various sightseeing spots in China Street, and it is recommended that Yokohama China Street be arranged in the itinerary.

Yokohama Chinatown is one of the top Chinese communities in the world. For tourists from the celestial dynasty, it is of course not to look at the Chinese customs and to buy Chinese small commodities when they come to Chinatown... There are two main points here, one is to look at adapting to Japan What does the Chinese style after culture look like? The second is food. Don’t doubt, Japanese and Chinese food is different. It is said that this is the main source of creativity for the author of "Chinese Little Master", from architecture to cooking, such as fried rice and dumplings. , Mapo tofu, etc. are somewhat different in Japan, and magical products will also appear.
Yokohama Chinatown is an overseas Chinese residential area, and the whole area is composed of 180 restaurants, including famous dishes in various parts of China.

i went here for christmas dinner, which was great!!there is a big ferris wheel lightning, and yokohama bay is very hear to here. City’s atmosphere is luxury, with sea and high buildings, i am sure you are gonna love this city! i am from tokyo but i like this city more than tokyo, and recomemd tourist to come!
It was great. The water, the space... So much different from Tokyo

MinatoMirai is actually the central business district for the city of Yokohama but it is much more than that and should be the first port of call for anyone contemplating a trip to Yokohama. The area comprises a number of high rise buildings, the most famous and the tallest being Landmark Tower where you can find many shops, boutiques, restaurants, hotels and a fabulous viewing deck that provides the best panorama of the Minatomirai/Yokohama area.
Love the stores. I love going there for shopping. Landmark Tower is a great place to visit.

One does not come to Japan and not have Japanese ramen. A visit to the Ramen Museum then, makes a fitting way to educate oneself about the humble bowl of piping hot ramen. This is a place Tokyoites often take visiting out of town family and friends.
An assortment of some of the best ramens throughout all ogf Japan under one roof！
I love this place. It has become a popular date place for students. Several delicious ramen shops to choose from. Ask for help using the ticket vending machines.

Believe it or not, there are actually multiple museums dedicated to ramen in Japan. This one is set up as a replica of Tokyo circa 1958, the year instant ramen was invented. Sample from the nine ramen shops inside while you explore this unusual food-themed amusement park.

attractions.name: Yamashita Park
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Kanagawa, Yokohama, Yamashita Park
reviews: Such a nice place to walk around. especially the night view was one of the best in Japan. perfect choice if you are looking for a place for picnic.
great park with good sea view
Pleasant seaside park.  One of the main sights in Yokohama.

Mountain Down Park is a park opened in March 1930. It was made by reclaiming debris from the Great Kanto Earthquake. It is a park with many places to see, including sea view, monuments and monuments. The view over the Yokohama Bay Bridge and the boat across the harbour is quite romantic. Many of the monuments here can feel the rich interaction with foreign countries, such as the "Indian Water Tower" donated by the Japan Indian Association in 1937 and the "Water Guard" donated by the sister city of Santiago, USA. In addition, the "Rose Garden of the Future" is about 160 roses and about 1,900 flowers blooming each spring and autumn are also a good place to see.

Yamashita Park is one of the landscapes facing Yokohama Port. The park is not large and it is backed by Chinatown Subway Station. It is very convenient to visit. There are also coastal scenic spots such as the Red Brick Warehouse and Mirai 21 going north. The location of the park is made of reclaimed sea, without the twists and turns of the natural coast, and the straight trails and the smooth breakwaters are also fun. There are many landscape towers and museums around the park. If you plan well, stay here for one or two nights. Comfortable.

attractions.name: Yokohama Hakkeijima Sea Paradise
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Kanagawa, Yokohama, Yokohama Hakkeijima Sea Paradise
reviews: Yokohama Yakage Island is an artificial island located in Yokohama City, Kanagawa Prefecture. The area of Yakage Island is about 24 hectares (24 ha). Yokohama Yakage Island Sealand is an amusement park built on Yakage Island. Located at the end of Yokohama Bay, it is a new amusement park and one of Japan's best aquariums.

First of all, the surprise: there is a beach on the island, the sea is very clear, as for the aquarium, it is not as big as it is supposed to be, the legendary 4 museums, one of which is a variety of marine life, or quite rich, but the other 3 are small. The second pavilion has a couple of seals (which can be done for a few minutes) and a small outdoor animal show outside. The third pavilion has a glass passage about 10 meters long, with dolphins and fish swimming overhead, which can be done in a few minutes. The last one is the Ocean Farm, an open air promenade similar to the event docks built at sea, free to visit (which is boring) or spend a few dozen dollars fishing. Fishing fish seems to take home

Located at the end of Yokohama Bay, it is a new type of amusement park and one of the best aquariums in Japan. I heard from my friends that this is the first wave roller coaster built in Japan. It was very exciting to play, and I was right. There are specialty shops, gourmet restaurants, and a promenade and hotel hidden in the greenery and gardens.

Hakkeijima is filled out just like Odaiba. The main function is to play, including an amusement park and aquarium. The island itself is free, and there are fees for play items. In addition, there are places where you want to live, and the prices are naturally different. The more distinctive projects are sea amusement facilities, such as roller coasters on the water, because the island itself is in the sea, and the aquarium is also well connected to the natural environment, and has its own advantages compared with high-rise buildings.

There is a large central tank that is very shocking, countless sardines and sharks, super big devil fish and turtles swimming together, the performance of marine animals is also wonderful, and there is an interactive pool with marine animals, you can go into the water and touch it. So the children are not happy to play.

attractions.name: Yokohama Red Brick Warehouse
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Kanagawa, Yokohama, Yokohama Red Brick Warehouse
attractions.address: 1-1 Shinko, Naka-ku, Yokohama City, Kanagawa Prefecture
reviews: I went here for christmas market and it was great!!i could enjoy atmosphere of xmas very much, with delicious food.there are a lot of events here and i think you can enjoy them!

The red brick warehouse has two areas, the first floor is generally a few small items, souvenirs. Every time I come to Japan, a friend let me bring some souvenirs, there are many Yokohama characteristics here. Many packaging is written on the name of Yokohama.

The Yokohama Red Brick Warehouse has a history of 100 years. Most of this red brick building is left over from the shipping port during the founding period of Japan. At present, besides Yokohama, there are Hokkaido Kanemori and Western Tsuruga. As a better port city for modern development, Yokohama is planned to change the warehouse into a small commercial area, combined with the plaza green space of the port, to form a seaside park with a certain amount of fun. Of course, it is more interesting to have activities more often.

The red brick warehouse is an important historical building. It was completed between 1900 and 1921. It was the navy's armory and resting place. Since the early 1990s, the government has retained the original appearance of the red brick warehouse and converted the interior into a museum and souvenir shop. In 2012, the Red Brick Warehouse Park was established. It has now become a good place for shopping and entertainment, allowing tourists to eat, drink, play and enjoy the revitalization Historical building.
It's a very local scene, kind of interesting.

a place must try to visit. you can enjoy the main deck and top deck observatory view and the one piece animations with live shows so you can watch your favourite one piece characters live.
Tokyo Tower the 1st highest tower in Japan.The best spot also is a night view, near here in tokyo tower u can view the sakura every season of February to March. A lot of hotels near by here.

The tower is beautiful, as my imagination. At night the lights are sparkling, very majestic. Great place to live virtual. It's not that far from the station, so I can walk. There is another temple nearby. Very beautiful. Everyone to visit available please visit.
If you’re looking for fantastic 360 degree views of Tokyo then its well worth a visit to Tokyo Tower. it is never over busy and easy and convenient to find.

attractions.name: Yokohama Landmark Tower
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Kanagawa, Yokohama, Yokohama Landmark Tower
reviews: me and my family at sakuragicho landmark!

This is one of Yokohama's premier sights. The building's design is loved by residents and travelers alike. Take a ride up to the observation decks if you have time for a stunning landscape view of Yokohama. Take a few snacks or a picnic lunch and enjoy some relaxing time in the near by open spaces and parks while marveling and snapping selfies of the tower and surroundings.
One of my favorite places in Yokohama. Great views during the day and night. Staff is very friendly. Cafe is expensive but has good food and drinks.

Lovely views from the tower and nice photo opportunities of the tower.  The entire area is very walkable, especially at night.  I enjoy walking to the ship terminal and China Town.  Even at 2:00 I feel safe wandering around with a large Canon camera around my neck.  Japan is wonderful.

The Yokohama Landmark Building is at the foot of Yokohama Port and Ferris Wheel Park. The observation deck on the top floor is the best place to overlook the port area. Nearby attractions are also relatively concentrated. For example, you can visit the largest Chinatown in Asia from Chinatown Station, and then to The mountain park by the sea, all the way to the north to the red brick warehouse, and then walk to the landmark building when the sky is dark. At this time, you can enjoy the twilight and the colorful port future 21 light show.

attractions.name: Yokohama Cosmo World
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Kanagawa, Yokohama, Yokohama Cosmo World
reviews: Among the young people in Yokohama, it should be a more famous attraction, especially this very popular unit, the Ferris Wheel, but it is actually a large-scale theme amusement park. From a distance, I thought it was a Ferris wheel. Few rides. Because it is connected to the entire Future 21 Port, basically people who come to play will stop by and have a look. The popularity is still relatively high. At night, when the ferris wheel glows, there are digital timekeeping on it, which is very beautiful. For other amusement facilities, there are haunted houses and roller coasters in the park. However, the land in Japan is too small. No interest anymore.

The Space Clock Ferris Wheel is one of the largest Ferris wheels in the world, and it is an image symbol of Yokohama. It is a great experience to ride the Ferris wheel here to the top of the tallest building in the city. Other fun places (navigation on waterways, roller coasters, etc.) are also fun. There is also a playground and snack street. Space World is opposite a big mall, this mall has many places to eat and some food supermarkets

Yokohama Cosmo World is free to enter, but all the rides are paid separately after admission. There are exciting rides suitable for couples and a carousel suitable for children. It takes about 15 minutes to make a full circle of the Ferris Wheel. Many people would suggest to take a ride to see the beautiful view of Yokohama Port from different angles. There are also several haunted houses here for daring people to try.

Although the weather is not very sunny today, the scenery is still very beautiful, it is really good here. There is a satisfactory place. There is a tablet computer in the wheel well. The computer has a view of the surrounding city. Every detail of the building will be displayed when you click it. This is very useful. The prices here are also very reasonable.

We went to Yokohama Space World for a clear purpose, just to ride the Ferris wheel, because the children like it. Our family of six spent a total of 60 Australian dollars on the Ferris wheel, and it takes about 15 minutes to make a round of the Ferris wheel. It was drizzling on the day we went, so the landscape was not as spectacular as I thought, but we still enjoyed it!

attractions.name: Sankeien Garden
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Kanagawa, Yokohama, Sankeien Garden
reviews: Sanxi Garden is a beautiful, peaceful garden garden, with pagodas, promenade paths, 17th century architecture, Japanese teahouses and so on, is a rare leisure treasure. Sanxi Garden covers an area of about 180,000 square meters, trees, grass, birds, and flowers, is known as "the beautiful garden", is also one of the sightseeing plum, cherry blossoms and red leaves and other good places.

Sankeien is a Japanese-style courtyard built in modern times. It is located not far from the center of Yokohama. The original owner was the silk merchant Sankei. After the war was damaged, it was restored by the public and opened to the public as a scenic spot. There are three-storied pagodas from Kyoto's Toomingji Temple, as well as some ancient relics from other areas. The landscape is complete with mountains, waters, forests and trees. The area is not too small. Although it is not as exquisite as the famous gardens in Kyushu, it is atmospheric Have passed.

Sankeien is a private residence with Japanese garden characteristics. It can be reached by bus 134 at Yokohama Sakuragicho Station. The ticket is 220 yen and the entrance fee is 700 yen. Lakes and mountains, pavilions, towers and pavilions, beautiful scenery, worth a visit. I met a retired volunteer, Mr. Sato, who took me to explain for an hour and a half, and I met a couple of newlyweds at the door.

The cherry blossom viewing spot in Yokohama City, formerly a mansion for wealthy merchants, was later opened to the world. There are several buildings in Kyoto, Nara moved over, and the triple ancient pagoda is well preserved and rich in historical value. Tickets are not expensive, a symbolic charge of a few hundred yen, although it is a bit away from JR Ishikawa, you can still visit it. Sankei Garden: ￼ is a national treasure of Japan. It integrates various scenery in the four seasons and houses buildings from different eras, making it an important place in Japanese garden architecture. This garden was originally built by Yokohama's rich businessman Futaro (alias Sankei) all his life. A wide and beautiful Japanese garden covering an area of 180,000 square meters with flowers blooming throughout the four seasons. The historical buildings in the park were moved from Kyoto and Nara, and some have been designated as important cultural relics. Sanxi Garden is a beautiful, elegant and exquisite traditional landscape garden with a total area of 47 acres (190,000 square meters). 16 ancient buildings with a history of hundreds of years are set against ponds and hills. Sanxi Garden is derived from three streams name. There are ancient buildings from various places in the park, such as the Beezhuang Linchun Pavilion of the Kishu Tokugawa family, the Pagoda of Tenzui Temple built by Guan Bai and Taishou Minister Toyotomi Hideyoshi for the birthday of the mother, and the Wolkaden in Fushimi Castle, Tensho-in Temple in Kamakura, the Buddhist hall of the old Tokeiji Temple, the tea room Tingqiu Pavilion built for Nijo Castle by the third general of the Tokugawa shogun, Tokugawa Iemitsu, the tea room Harukaryo built for Yurakusai during the period of Oda Nobunaga, Toku Tomboji Temple The triple tower and so on. Various buildings are built according to different topography is the characteristic of Sanxi Garden. The Triple Pagoda of Yakushiji Temple is located in Nishinokyo-cho, Nara City, Japan. This tower was built in the Asuka area. Haraji was moved from Asuka to Nara in 718 after Heijokyo (the capital of the Fujiwara clan) was established. After the old temple was caught in fire, only this three-storied pagoda (also known as the east pagoda) was left. Therefore, it was most noble and was later designated as a national cultural treasure by the Japanese government. The tower is 33.8 meters high. Known as one of the most beautiful ancient stupas in Japan. When we look carefully at this temple tower, we will find its shape is very special. It is different from the temple tower structure in ancient China, the double eaves are uneven, and the tower body is placed among the trees, as if isolated. It seems that the architectural form is not uniform enough, and it has an inclusive feature. For example, each layer of the tower body has its own characteristics, and the upper and lower floors are not unified; the pillars of each layer are not bulging, they are flush with the wall, and are integrated into the entire tower itself; the bucket arch supporting the pillars is no different. The cooperation with the various ministries appears to be balanced and appropriate. Therefore, every building is full of a sense of harmony.

The interior is a bit like a domestic park, with some old Japanese buildings, and overall it is relatively quiet. When I went there were basically old people visiting, not many young people. But I guess it didn't meet the right season with me. The leaves were still very green in early November.

attractions.name: Dazaifu Tenmangū Shrine
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Fukuoka, Dazaifu, Dazaifu Tenmangū Shrine
reviews: Dazaifu Tenman-gū is a Shinto shrine in Dazaifu, Fukuoka Prefecture, Japan.It is built over the grave of Sugawara no Michizane. Open daily for visiting and closed around 0630pm.

That day encounters the 8th typhoon, the wind and rain mixed, the wind and rain added without any price, added some mysterious color. Like antiques and history, it is still very suitable to come to the National Museum to punch the card ～ Dazaifu Tianman Palace and the National Museum are connected, through the long indoor passage, can be directly reached, it feels like a crossing ～ Dazaifu can draw lots, My companions have drawn different degrees of "Ji", and it's a happy picture. Maybe there is no sign of "Ji" ～ The specialty here is a kind of umecake, in fact, our tatami and bean paste and then fried it. It is very famous and cheap. You can try it. When the weather is good, Dazaifu is very photogenic, the view and architecture are beautiful.

Dazaifu, which is now referred to as the scenic area centered on Dazaifu Tenmangu shrine, was a local government department in Kyushu during the Sengoku period (period of Warring States). It was responsible for defense and foreign affairs in Kyushu. The prince was appointed as honorary commander and Osaka was a substantive commander. Since michimasa Sugawara, udaijin (Minister of the right), gonsho Dazaifu was the Minister of the right, and he was transferred to the left. The Muto clan, Chikuzen Shugo (provincial Constable of Chikuzen province), served Dazai shosho since Kamakura. Yoshitaka Ouchi, who fought against the Shojo clan, applied for the permission of Dazai Otsuka to the imperial court to control Kitakyushu for legitimacy.

Dazaifu, which is now referred to as the scenic area centered on Dazaifu Tenmangu shrine, was a local government department in Kyushu during the Sengoku period (period of Warring States). It was responsible for defense and foreign affairs in Kyushu. The prince was appointed as honorary commander and Osaka was a substantive commander. Since michimasa Sugawara, udaijin (Minister of the right), gonsho Dazaifu was the Minister of the right, and he was transferred to the left. The Muto clan, Chikuzen Shugo (provincial Constable of Chikuzen province), served Dazai shosho since Kamakura. Yoshitaka Ouchi, who fought against the Shojo clan, applied for the permission of Dazai Otsuka to the imperial court to control Kitakyushu for legitimacy.

In the new year, we must pray for good luck. Of course, Dazaifu Tenmangu shrine in Fukuoka every year December 31 to January 1, many visitors visit, quite lively. Nishitetsu trams and nishitetsu buses are also added to special trains to Dazaifu during the new year. A toast opening ceremony at Dazaifu Station on January 1, 11:30, is expected to bring a good memory of the New Year! Don't miss it.

attractions.name: Fukuoka Tower
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Fukuoka, Fukuoka, Fukuoka Tower

Established in 757 A.D., "Putian Jinja" has a history of over 1200 years, and Osaka, Amaterasu and Suruga are the main worship gods. With the traditional Hakata Ganyu Garden Mountain Festival in 770 years, り has been listed by the United Nations as the world's intangible cultural property. The shrine is an important cultural landscape in Japan, representing a long-standing Japanese culture. As the most famous shrine in Fukuoka, it is well worth visiting. Located in the center of the city, the transportation is very convenient, there are many surrounding attractions, and it is free.

The most fun time here is the famous "Hakata Gion Yamakasa Festival" held every summer, which is an important shrine guarded by the chief guard of Hakata. There are also several POWER SPOTs in the shrine area. They are one of the well-known places to pray for immortality and longevity and harmony between husband and wife. A friend took me to Ogura City, Kitakyushu, which has a special smell.

The overall style is restored to the famous Warring States General Hosokawa’s Kokura Castle. The castle tower is also in line with Japan. Other areas are well-preserved, such as Himeji, Matsumoto, and Matsue. It can be said that they are well-built.

Kokura Castle is an ancient city behind the prosperity of Kitakyushu. The castle tower here is very famous in Japan because its shape is slightly different from other castle towers. There is no eaves between the fourth and fifth floors, which looks a little strange. It has a history of more than 700 years and is full of relics of the Tang and Song Dynasties. It is very worth visiting.

This is a very beautiful city, very close to Fukuoka Airport, about 1-2 hours by car, and about 40 minutes for shopping. The weather and environment have been very good since April. attractions.name: Goryokaku Park
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Hokkaido, Hakodate, Goryokaku Park
reviews: Beautiful and interesting place to spend your time in Hakodate.I will come back in period of snow.

It is the first western style castle in Japan was built in l855. It is designated as special historical site today. After that you can viit goryokaku Tower which is beautiful star-shaped construstion of Goryokaku, can go up to the observatory and view from the top.

The Goryongkai Park itself is free of charge. The Goryongkai itself is a huge western-style fortress, which served as the last base of the former Bakufu army during the Meiji Restoration, and was taken over by the Meiji government after the defeat and surrender of the former Bakufu army in 1868.

The seasons of Goryokaku are different. In spring, you can see the maple leaves in autumn and the white snow in winter. Climbing to the top of Goryokaku Tower and looking down, it is exactly in the shape of a five-pointed star, and it looks even more beautiful with the next white snow. After visiting Goryokaku Tower, there is a souvenir shop downstairs where you can buy souvenirs, such as Goryokaku's fridge magnets.

Came here specifically for the Japanese cherry blossoms in New Year, Hokkaido just opened at 51, the time is still quite good. But in March, I had already seen the 10,000 mu cherry blossoms in Pingba, Guizhou, and I was shocked. Looking at the pictures on the Internet, I think Goryokaku’s cherry blossoms should not be better than Pingba. But it was still amazing. Although the number of Goryokaku is average, each cherry blossom grows very lush and strong. In addition, the Japanese cherry trees are well pruned, and Goryokaku's unique shape makes them very beautiful. It is really worth coming to enjoy the cherry blossoms. And the Japanese like to grill under the cherry trees.

In the year 6, Hakodate opened as the first international trade port in Japan along with Yokohama and Nagasaki, and the Kanamori red brick warehouse was the first business warehouse in Hakodate, and the history of Hakodate was witnessed by the warehousing business.

Succumbing to the threat of force from the enormous 'black ships", the shogunate concluded the Treaty of Peace and Army between the United States of America and the Empire of Japan in 1854 and decided to open the ports of Shimoda in Izu and Hokodate.

attractions.name: Nagoya Castle
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Aichi, Nagoya, Nagoya Castle
reviews: Nagoya Castle was constructed by the Owari Domainin 1612 during the Edo period on the site of an earlier castle of the Oda clan in the Sengoku period. Nagoya Castle was the heart of one of the most important castle towns in Japan, Nagoya-juku, a post station on the Minoji road linking two of the important Edo Five Routes, the Tōkaidō and the Nakasendō. Nagoya Castle became the core of the modern Nagoya and ownership was transferred to the city by the Imperial Household Ministry in 1930.Nagoya Castle was destroyed in 1945 during the bombing of Nagoya in World War II and the reconstruction and repair of the castle has been undergoing since 1957.

attractions.address: 1 Chome-1-1 Shrine, Atsuta Ward, Nagoya, Aichi Prefecture
reviews: It is one of the oldest and most important shrines in Japan, and it has a history of 1900 years, and it enjoys high prestige in Japan. The Daiden enshrines 5 gods, including the Buson and the imperial edict, the Amaterasu omikami, the Suko no Naruto, and the Mimi ina no Mikoto. The treasures of the Jingu Palace are more than 6,000 treasures, most of the royal family, the Tokugawa family related to important cultural property, with a name of the sword. Every year on June 5th the hot-field festival is the most lively activities of the Jingu Palace, can enjoy the lighting activities and fireworks, visitors are endless.

Atsuta Jingu shrine is one of the oldest and highest shrines in Japan. Kusatake sword, one of the three major sacred treasures of Japan, is a sacred treasure in the people's Republic of Japan. The main hall of atsuta Jingu shrine is dedicated to the five gods of Takesono, Miyazaki, Amaterasu omikami, Suki Naruto, and Inazusa no Mikoto. Various forms of respect for atsuta Jingu shrine have been paid attention to in Japan. The "Nobunaga screen" in the shrine is one of the walls presented by Oda Nobunaga. ​
The shrine is large, not far from the city, and there are many tourists doing things.
It is worth a visit, not far from the city, and there are many locals going.
It's a big, solemn, quiet shrine, a little smaller than the Meiji shrine in Tokyo,

nice place. kids really will enjoy
very nice aquarium
its so very fun
Local praise, relying on sea building, aquarium biology, good environment, good service attitude, first-class, the sea view outside the museum is also good.

attractions.name: Nagoya TV Tower
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Aichi, Nagoya, Nagoya TV Tower
reviews: I always pass by this piece of architectural art everytime I go to Sakae. The Nagoya TV Tower may no longer be accepting visitors recently, but it will never stop awing people with its beauty. It looks look Paris's Eiffel Tower in one glance. It is best to see it at night when it is all lit up. Unfortunately, recently, the local government of Nagoya has stopped lighting up the tower. I don't know the reason why, but yes, they did that. The tower is located inside Hisaya Odori Park and is readily accessible via all types of public and private transportation.

Sakae's oldest landmark is the Nagoya TV Tower, which was completed in the 1950s. It was the first TV tower of its kind in Japan at an impressive 180 meters tall. There is an observation deck at the top, which is much cheaper than the one at Midland Square (but also 100 meters shorter).

The TV Tower of Nagoya, located in the center of Kuya Daichi Park, is the first intensive radio tower in Japan. It was chosen as a lover's mecca in October 2008, and a monument was set up to enjoy a 360 degree view of Nagoya night from the 90-meter-high sky rotating pavilion.

The TV Tower of Nagoya is a landmark building of Nagoya, next to Oasis OADIS 21, picture three is taken in Oasis 21, net red punching ground. The TV Tower of Nagoya is 180 high, can be 360 degrees overlooking the city panorama.
Not very tall, but higher buildings in the central area

attractions.name: Osu Kannon
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Aichi, Nagoya, Osu Kannon
attractions.address: 2 Chome-21-４７ Osu, Naka Ward, Nagoya, Aichi Prefecture
reviews: Ōsu Kannon Temple is one of my favorite places in Nagoya. Other It is such a popular temple in the city that many people visit it during holidays. They also have a lot of Doves flying around, and people can choose to feed them. During holidays and local festivals, the temple grounds usually have Food Stalls lining up. Foods in these food stalls are quite affordable. The best thing about visiting Ōsu Kannon is the fact that the Ōsu Kannon shopping district is just right next to it. So basically, you can go shopping right after you marvel at the beauty of the temple. How convenient is that?
it's all abaout new year2020. but i was first time experianced this types of celibration

Osu Kannon Temple is located near the Osu Kannon Station on the Nagoya Subway Tsurumai Line. There is a shopping street around Osu Kannon Street. Osu Kannon is one of the three largest Kannons in Japan. It is said that there are Buddhist events in October every year. Those who can catch up can check it out. You can learn about Japanese Buddhism culture here, and you can also enjoy shopping and kill two birds with one stone.

Osu Kannon Temple is a free and open place. There are a lot of Japanese visitors. It is next to the commercial street. Enter from Kannon Tongri. There are Japanese monks at the door. I don't know if it is an ascetic monk. I will shake the bell in my hand after a while. The shopping street is very lively, there are many shops with Japanese characteristics, and many locals visit. Because I just returned to Nagoya from Hokkaido, I think Osu Shopping Street is more interesting than Tanukikoji in Sapporo. There are snack bars, hundred-yen shops, fashion shops, drugstores, and clothing shops here. There are many elements and more colorful.

Osu Kannon Temple is located in Osu, Nagoya, Japan. It is one of the three largest Kannon temples in Japan. It is also known as Shinfuku Temple. It is surrounded by the famous Osu Kannon Commercial Street. It is true that Osu Kannon Temple is hidden in the city. It's not an exaggeration. If it is not for shopping, there may be few people who come here specifically to see the temple, but as a temple with a long history, Osu Kannon Temple is still worth seeing.
