reviews: From the big Xuguanyin came out is the big Xu shop street. Senior brands of the ancient stores, ancient shops, kimono shops, various countries of the restaurant, the hotel and other shops gathered here. Generally from the big Xuguanyin Temple, the map from the top down, walking to the Shangjinqian subway station. Osu shopping street is called Akihabara, Nagoya, and the annual Cosplay convention is held here. It is just that day that there is a Coser parade ~ not because of Halloween, or the event that was originally there.
A famous commercial street is close to the Daxu Guanyin Temple, where there are many small shops to eat together, can be long-term. Popular, there are about 1000 to 2,000 shops.
I think the Japanese shopping street is very special, there are skyscrapers, rain or hot weather shopping is not affected.
It's a good choice to stroll around here when you have time!
It's a good choice to stop by here on weekends!

attractions.name: Tokugawaen
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Aichi, Nagoya, Tokugawaen
attractions.address: 1001 Tokugawacho, Higashi Ward, Nagoya, Aichi Prefecture
reviews: Scenic, peaceful garden. It's small, but provides for some unexpectedly fantastic photo ops, even in the winter...but you want to see it in the spring, when the flowers are in bloom. There's a small three-tiered waterfall you can hop over to. A little downstream, there's a fun little river crossing made of stepping stones (boulders, really). There are large Koi Fish in the lake to watch, but the lake itself is probably what you'd want to look at instead.

The Japanese garden "Tokugawa Garden" in the east of Nagoya is a good place for the Nagoya City to enjoy the red leaves festival every year. During the season, not only can you see the red leaves in the daytime, but also the red leaves in the dim light after night are very attractive. There are famous ramen shops "such as water" and "fangguang" with the old shop of oranges nearby. It is recommended to go together after seeing the red leaves~

Tokugawa Garden’s exquisite Japanese-style courtyard transportation strategy: Take the JR Chuo Main Line from Nagoya Station to the Osone Exit and walk for about five minutes. There are signs along the road and you will not go wrong. Opening hours: closed on Mondays, 9:30-17 every day; 30 ticket price: single ticket is 300 yen. If you visit with the Tokugawa Museum and Ponzo Bunko, it is recommended to buy a combined ticket for 1350 yen to visit three attractions. Highlights: The Japanese garden is very exquisite, there are ponds and bridges. The attic has a stream, a small waterfall, and a maple tree. In autumn, the green leaves, red leaves, and yellow leaves are intertwined. Very beautiful. Tips: There are some couples taking kimono wedding photos in the courtyard. The whole garden is not big enough for an hour to go out. Gift Shop

The Tokugawa family occupies an important position in Japanese history. During the Shogunate period, the emperor became a puppet, and the samurai class actually ruled Japan, among which the Tokugawa shogunate ruled Japan for 300 years. Tokugawa Garden is located about 3 kilometers east of Nagoya Castle in Japan. This is the Osone mansion built by the Tokugawa Gosan family, the second-generation lord of the Owari clan, in the eighth year of Genroku (1695). There is also the Tokugawa Art Museum in the park, which contains treasures that have been collected by the Tokugawa family for generations. Unfortunately, I can’t take pictures... Today’s Tokugawa Park, ginkgo biloba is sprinkled with gold, mochi stained with frost, maple leaves are red, and autumn water is rippling. Although the footsteps of winter are approaching, the sunshine is warm and autumn is strong, and life shows its last glory before winter dormant. The beautiful historical garden [强]

Visited Nagoya Castle at noon. After reading it, there is a bus stop on the side of the road opposite the main entrance. Take the line 5 sightseeing bus directly to Tokugawa Park. It started to rain in the afternoon, and it is getting bigger and bigger [surprised], come out The boots are all wet and shiny! Frozen to death... But as soon as I walked in, I was surprised by the beautiful courtyard. Every spot in the very exquisite courtyard is so attractive. Different angles will have a different feeling. If you are not in a hurry, you must sit down and take a closer look. Savor it, it's really rewarding! This is how I was attracted by the deep charm of the Japanese garden, what should I do? Love is too deep...

attractions.name: Main Castle Tower of Nagoya Castle
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Aichi, Nagoya, Main Castle Tower of Nagoya Castle
attractions.address: 1-1 Honmaru, Naka Ward, Nagoya, Aichi Prefecture
reviews: Tenshukaku is a large castle built in the Sengoku period in Japan, and it is also the residence of the Lord of the castle. Tenshukaku is the central building of the castle, he is not only a strong military defense facilities, but also the location of the daimyo or the symbol of the status of the castle. Japan's current Tenshukaku, several Himeji Castle, Osaka Castle, the most famous Nagoya, climbed the Tenshukaku, can enjoy a beautiful view.

Nagoya Castle, the most classic attraction in Nagoya.
It has a very long history and is a cultural relic under key protection. The city wall is very strong, the moat is very wide, there are fish, swans and seagulls in it. It is not enough to play for an afternoon. recommend.

Castle tower
This is not only designed by famous artists, but also by many famous painters. The Honmaru Imperial Store is designed with an all-wood structure with gold as the main color. The layout and layout of each room are different, showing power and nobility.
Honmaru Palace stops at 16:00

The castle tower in Nagoya Castle is a must-see for almost every tourist.

Although the castle tower is currently closed for renovation, this does not affect everyone's enthusiasm at all. Shooting against the changing background of the appearance from various angles is also fun.

If you still remember the previous mobile travel frogs, then you should also remember that Nagoya Castle is one of the places where the frog son travels.

The castle tower is a large castle built during the Warring States Period in Japan. The central building of the castle is the castle tower; it is the residence of the castle lord, and it also serves as a strong military defense and reflects the political rights of the castle lord. The castle tower in Nagoya Castle is a large and small independent loft, connected by a corridor, which is a connected building; on the top of the castle tower is an auspicious golden eagle with a male tiger head and a fish tail. Nagoya Castle is one of the three major names. It is maintained internally. It is a pity that you can't climb the building and look at the beautiful scenery of the surrounding areas.

attractions.name: Oasis 21
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Aichi, Nagoya, Oasis 21
attractions.address: 1 Chome-11-1 Higashisakura, Higashi Ward, Nagoya, Aichi 461-0005
reviews: The Oasis 21, an environmentally conscious Japanese man who built the water-filled glass house, was like a baseball field-sized fish tank. It was designed and built by Hideki Casai and won the 2003 Solutia Award (for glass-based design). Oasis 21 is a local landmark, but it also shows the concept of environmental protection. The top floor is the "water spaceship", all built of glass, which is a large container for rainwater, which can be used by the following facilities. Fully demonstrate the link of natural energy recycling.

Nagoya Oasis 21, spaceship, is one of the landmarks of Nagoya, is also a great photo, can be lined up to the Nagoya TV Tower. It is one of the net red punching ground, the water reflected the TV Tower.

Next to the Nagoya TV Tower in the city center, it is very beautiful and lively, and its shape is called the spaceship of water. All the results are reinforced glass, with a pool on the top, which leads to the bus station and subway station in the middle. The store on the ground floor is very lively. It looks a lot better under the lights at night.

You can reach the Sakae subway station in Nagoya, either on the Meijo Line or the Higashiyama Line. The most beautiful under the lights at night, there is a free elevator for sightseeing to the top floor. Oasis 21 has restaurants and shopping malls on the ground floor, with Nagoya TV Tower as the background. There is the BUS transportation terminal on the basement level, which is the starting station of BUS at Central Airport, which runs every hour.

In the popular shopping mall in Rong business district, the water spaceship on the upper ground level attracts tourists from all over the world to check in. Day and night are completely different.

There is also a neon internet celebrity restaurant. The tribute tea here needs a long line. Sure enough, the neon people really love milk tea.

If you come to Rong business district, don't forget to check in.

attractions.name: Acropolis of Athens
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Greece, Attica, Kentrikos Tomeas Athinon, Athens, Acropolis of Athens
attractions.open_status: Summer April 1st - October 31st, Tuesday - Sunday 8:00-19:30, Monday 11:00-19:30 Winter November 1st - March 31st 8:30-15:00
reviews: The Acropolis in Athens was a fortress and military base during the Neolithic period, due to its position which offers a great view of the land and the sea. During the Mycenaean times, it became a religious center, dedicated to the worship of the goddess Athena.

An unprecedented conceptual design; embodied in architectural excellencePut the best of science, art and philosophy together in one creation and you have the definitive monument of human civilisation. UNESCO calls it the symbol of World Heritage. The world calls it the Athenian Acropolis!

Overall I think it was a good experince. I expected a little more to be honest. You know how expectant you are to be in the Acropolis! But it wasn’t anything wow to me. I had been in Rome previously so probably that’s why, the ruins there were more complete. But again, it was nice, the view at night was the best to see not to take pictures though but to just capture that moment with your eyes.

Muat visit destination in athens. Take many pics as you can. Its a great city but too much pollution but worth it after you see this. Come in the morning before it gets too crowded. Queue can be up to an hour or more.
this is a must in Athens, there is so much history involved in the Acropolis, and the views of the city are beautiful

attractions.name: The Parthenon
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Greece, Attica, Kentrikos Tomeas Athinon, Athens, The Parthenon
attractions.open_status: It is basically the same as the opening hours of the Acropolis, summer (April 1 - October 31): 8:00-19:30, Monday 11:00-19:30; winter (November 1 - March 31) : 8:30-15:00; Closed: January 1, March 25, May 1, Easter, December 25, December 26; Goodfriday after 12:00 Open, August 15th, Holy Spirit Day 8:00-20:00, other festival opening hours can be found in the official website.
reviews: Inside the building stood a colossal image of Athena Parthenos, constructed of gold and ivory by Pheidias and probably dedicated in 438 BC.
Great and magic place, full of energy and history. There are similar monuments nearby and it’s definetly must see if you are in Athens!!! Greece people are awsome as well, very polite and friendly!

the temple of Athena Parthenos, built on the Acropolis in 447–432 bc by Pericles to honor Athens' patron goddess and to commemorate the recent Greek victory over the Persians. It was designed by Ictinus and Callicrates with sculptures by Phidias.

It was everything you imagine! It was a really nice experience stepping into that much history. The entrance ticket was €20. You cannot go inside with any drink, except for water, so don’t buy the slushy before going in .
Love at first sight! Αγαπημενη μου Αθηνα!

attractions.name: Temple of Olympian Zeus
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Greece, Attica, Kentrikos Tomeas Athinon, Athens, Temple of Olympian Zeus
attractions.open_status: 08:00 - 20:00 (last admission 19:30). 1 January, 25 March, 1 May, Easter Sunday, 25 December, 26 December: closed.
reviews: The Temple of Olympian Zeus  also known as the Olympieion or Columns of the Olympian Zeus, is a former colossal temple at the center of the Greekcapital Athens.

The Temple of Olympian Zeus is a huge temple in the center of Athens, the capital of Greece. The construction began during the reign of the Athenian tyrants in the 6th century BC. They had envisaged the construction of the greatest temple in the ancient world, but it was not completed until about 638 years after the Roman Emperor Hadrian in the 2nd century AD. During the Roman period, this temple consisted of 104 huge pillars and was known as the largest temple in Greece and one of the largest cult statues in the ancient world.

The glory of this temple was short-lived, and was abandoned about a century after the castle was built. In the centuries after the fall of the Roman Empire, building materials were widely excavated to supply construction projects elsewhere in the city. Despite this, a large part of the temple remains today, especially the sixteen of the original giant pillars, and it is still part of a very important archaeological site in Greece.

Zeus temple is located in Athens, Greece Olympia village, was built to worship Zeus, is also one of the largest temple in ancient Greece. The temple of Zeus was built in 470 BC, was completed in 456 BC, designed by architect Libon, sculptor pheidias statue is responsible for. Until 86 BC, the Roman commander sula (Sulla) conquered Athens, destroyed the unfinished building, will be part of the stone and other building materials removed, to Rome. Until today, on the ruins of ancient Rome square in the center of Rome, also can see them. The temple of Zeus in particular is famous in the world the statue of ivory and gold.
The temple of Zeus, built for the sacrifice of Zeus, as the head of the gods, the temple of Zeus was famous for its ivory and gold statues, and it is one of the largest temples in ancient Greece.

The Temple of Olympian Zeus is a very large Greek temple at the foot of Mount Olympia. It was built to worship Zeus, the god of the universe. Although it is very dilapidated, it can be seen from the existing ruins that it was brilliant and majestic at that time. The most eye-catching building here is worth visiting.

attractions.name: Syntagma Square
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Greece, Attica, Kentrikos Tomeas Athinon, Athens, Syntagma Square
reviews: the opening of the new metro and the removal of the wooden billboard covered walls that for at least an entire year, hid the construction site that was once Athens most popular platia, Syntagma looks better then it has in many years.

Syntagma square is one of the most famous squares in Athens. It is located directly in front of the lovely old Royal Palace that houses the Greek Parliament. It is a must see when you visit Athens. A good suggestion is to visit early in the morning. I went there in August which is high season, but if you visit around 7 am there are less people around and you can have the palace guards almost to yourself for taking photos. Don't forget to check out the famous hotel Grande Bretagne which is just off to the side of Syntagma square. Additionally, a lot of hop on hop off sightseeing busses stop in front of the square.

Such an amazing square to hang out and enjoy the beautiful view. From this square, you can walk to Ermou Street, a pedestrian walking paradise, with all sort of stores. You can turn left at the end and go to Plaka area and enjoy an whole array of shops, selling Olive oils to fruits, nuts to all sort of souvenirs, with the Acropolis in the background. A must see area!
A nice public square- it is a good meeting place and point of reference for exploring the city.
No words for it.Beautiful, amazing, full of artists and historical monuments.

attractions.name: Erechtheion
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Greece, Attica, Kentrikos Tomeas Athinon, Athens, Erechtheion
reviews: The Erechtheion is often described as 'unusual' or 'complex' and this is because of its multifaceted purpose. The site is sacred ground and said to be the burial place of two important characters.

Iraq rick to ask weng temple is located in the south of Mr Rahe repair the temple of a rugged highlands, was built between 421-421 b.c., the acropolis is a typical representative of the Ionian style in construction. It is rick rees in the plan of rebuilding the acropolis finally completed a important building, design is very clever.

Another great temple on Acropolis! Similar to the other temples on this intriguing protruded mountain, the Erechtheion reflects the ancient Greeks boasting and passion for the powerful gods, glorious heroes, and honorable kings during their time. At night the foundation of the Erechtheion lights up and illuminates the entire structure on the north side of Acropolis. It's a beautiful sight to see from a rooftop restaurant or bar within the vicinity.
Once you're on the Acropolis, there's really no reason not to look at everything.

Like all the structures on the Acropolis, it seems to be in a constant cycle of restoration. Very interesting design but even more fascinating history - I would recommend visiting this one specifically with someone who knows its story (or a good guide book).

attractions.name: Acropolis Museum
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Greece, Attica, Kentrikos Tomeas Athinon, Athens, Acropolis Museum
attractions.open_status: Summer time (April-October 31st): Monday 8:00-16:00, 15:30 stop admission; Tuesday-Sunday 8:00-20:00, 19:30 stop admission; Friday 8 :00-22:00, 21:30 stop admission; winter (November 1 - March 31): Monday - Thursday: 9:00-17:00, 16:30 stop admission; Friday 9 :00-22:00, 21:30 stop admission; Saturday and Sunday: 9:00-20:00, 19:30 stop admission
attractions.address: Acropolis Museum, 15 Dionysiou Areopagitou Street, Athens 11742
reviews: Adults receive free admission with the Athens City Pass. Admission is free for children and young people under 18 from the EU and students. For children and young people from non-EU countries over the age of 5, admission costs €3 (from 1 November to 3 March) or €5 (from 1 April to 31 October).
if you visit Athens and saw the Acropolis, you must the Acropolis Museum.  The museum contains many artifacts relating to the Acropolis and the Parthenon.  the admission is 20euros.
A real jewel where an in-depth history about the Acropolis can be discovered. I strongly suggest having a guide with you so the finds can be understood. All these artifacts have a story to be told!

The Acropolis Museum is located on the southeast slope of the Acropolis Hill, on an ancient road leading to the "sacred rock" of the Classical period. The Acropolis Museum was established in 2003 and opened to the public on June 20, 2009. More than 4,250 objects were exhibited on an area of 14,000 square meters.

Definitely worth checking out while you're in Athens. Go early morning to avoid the crowds. There's a free baggage check on the ground floor along the back wall when you walk in the lobby before you enter with your admission ticket.

attractions.name: Plaka
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Greece, Attica, Kentrikos Tomeas Athinon, Athens, Plaka
reviews: Plaka has a village feel, with narrow cobblestone streets lined with tiny shops selling jewelry, clothes and local ceramics. Sidewalk cafes and family-run tavernas stay open until late, and Cine Paris shows classic movies al fresco.

Pláka (Greek: Πλάκα) is the old historical neighborhood of Athens, clustered around the northern and eastern slopes of the Acropolis, and incorporating labyrinthine streets and neoclassical architecture. Plaka is built on top of the residential areas of the ancient town of Athens. It is known as the "Neighborhood of the Gods" due to its proximity to the Acropolis and its many archaeological sites.
I really like this part of Athens as I could explore many small shops and small restaurants and cafes.
Perfect place for souvenirs, local food, and appreciate the beauty of a quiet touristic area right in the center of anciet Athens with its traditional buildings.
The old town of Athens. Definitely worth a visit!

attractions.name: Mount Lycabettus
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Greece, Attica, Kentrikos Tomeas Athinon, Athens, Mount Lycabettus
reviews: The hill is a tourist destination and can be ascended by the Lycabettus Funicular.The railway station can be found at Aristippou street. At its two peaks are the 19th century Chapel of St. George, a theatre, and a restaurant.
You can see the whole city of Athens from up there. The view is stunning and it will leave you with the best experience.

Take the time to walk up of you are able. It's not as hard as it looks and there's a clear path! It makes the reward so much sweeter. Up top there's a cafe, bar or take away place so you don't have to be allFancy if you don't want to. I went at night and the night time view of Athens was gorgeous from this vantage point!
The ride up Mount Likavitos on the cable-car railway (teleferique) is often a hit with kids. It operates every 20 minutes in summer (7€ round-trip).
A special momumental hill-the landmark of Athens, along with the Parthenon.It is great for ascending, relaxing, taking deep breaths and enjoy the city from really above.

attractions.name: Odeon of Herodes Atticus
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Greece, Attica, Kentrikos Tomeas Athinon, Athens, Odeon of Herodes Atticus
reviews: It was originally a steep-sloped theater with a three-story stone front wall and a wooden roof made of expensive cedar of Lebanon timber

Herodes Atticus is a stone Roman theater structure located on the southwest slope of the Acropolis of Athens, Greece. The building was completed in 161 AD and then renovated in 1950. It was originally a steep theater with a three-story stone front wall that can accommodate 5,000 people.

The Odeon of Herodes Atticus is a stone theatre structure located on the southwest slope of the Acropolis of Athens.It was built in 161 AD by the Athenian magnate Herodes Atticus in memory of his wife, Aspasia Annia Regilla.

Greece, adie amphitheater was built in 161 AD, the Roman emperor in the era of the philosopher Tiberius Claudius Atticus Herodes built in memory of his wife, as the world''s oldest theatre is one of the most outstanding buildings at the same time. Mainly provides the ancient Greek tragedy writers such as rope Buddha (Sophocles) and Chris yuri Peters (Euripides) show their works. Buddha Chris has important plays "edie pass king" (Oedipus Rex) and "AnDiGang ni" (Antigone), yuri Peters is with the Yosemite and (Medea, and Trojan Women "(Mauritius" Women).

Unique! Especially when you attend an event. Just make sure to have the seating arrangements, as it gets really uncomfortable if you seat for a couple of hours, as it is well known that Ancient Greeks were short and the theater was constructed according to their sizes. When I follow an opera night or an ancient theater play I get a feeling not easy to describe by words, I fly to the moon!!

attractions.name: Temple of Poseidon
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Greece, Attica, Kentrikos Tomeas Athinon, Athens, Temple of Poseidon
reviews: The Temple of Poseidon was erected in the middle of the 5th century BC at the ancient port of Sounio. It was built to honour Poseidon, God of the sea. Its architecture was of innovative design, its iconic marble pillars are an impressive reminder.

Built the temple at the beginning of the 5th century BC, when the construction project is not yet complete, then destruction by the Persian war. Now we can see monuments is before 440 BC ~ 445 years in the original Poseidon temple site built many pillars of Eric type buildings. Greek architecture in its internal structure including common porch, inside the temple, temple after three parts. The outside with the famous hephaestus is similar to the temple, and in the Ionian marble columns on the partition exquisite stone carvings, is with amazon tribe female warrior scenes and the exquisite statues, these treasures are national archaeological museum in Greece.

Especially when the dusk is approaching, the warm and soft orange-red sun is spreading over the sea, and also covering the whole temple. Such a beautiful scenery, in the hustle and bustle of the city, the middle level difficult to experience, the beauty is breathtaking.
Good (๑✧∀✧๑)☀, ancient architectural boutique

The Temple of Poseidon in Athens is a temple standing on a cliff on the coast. It has a history of 3,000 years and is very damaged, but the surrounding stone pillars are still relatively well-preserved. It is vaguely visible that it was magnificent. There is nothing around the temple, very deserted, with a strong sense of loneliness.

attractions.name: Kiyomizu-dera Temple
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Kyoto, Kyoto, Kiyomizu-dera Temple
attractions.open_status: Open at 6:00, the closing time is 17:30-18:30, depending on the season; the spring, summer and autumn are open for special visits at night, and open at night from 22:00 on December 31, The specific opening hours are subject to the official website.
attractions.address: 294 Kiyomizu 1-chome, Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto, Kyoto Prefecture 605-0862
reviews: Kiyomizu-dera  formally Otowa-san Kiyomizu-dera , is a Buddhist temple in eastern Kyoto. The temple is part of the Historic Monuments of Ancient Kyoto (Kyoto, Uji and Otsu Cities) UNESCO World Heritage site.

One of the most celebrated temples in Japan, this is a must if you are visiting Kyoto! Associated with one of the oldest schools of buddhism, this wooden temple is a beauty and historic site that must be seen.

This Buddhist temple is one of the most beautiful in ancient Kyoto. It was built without a single nail on top of a 13-meter stage - in ancient times, jumping from the stage was seen as a sign of bravery. Near the main hall vistors can catch and drink the water from Otowa waterfall, believed to have wish-granting powers.
Great place to visit alone , spiritual and great adventure
Insanely beautiful landscape and architecture...

attractions.name: Kinkaku-ji
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Kyoto, Kyoto, Kinkaku-ji
reviews: Kinkaku-ji  literally "Temple of the Golden Pavilion", officially named Rokuon-ji  literally "Deer Garden Temple", is a Zen Buddhist temple in Kyoto, Japan.It is one of the most popular buildings in Kyoto, attracting many visitors annually.It is designated as a National Special Historic Site, a National Special Landscape and is one of 17 locations making up the Historic Monuments of Ancient Kyoto which are World Heritage Sites.

I have always been in awe whenever I get to set my feet at Kyoto.I love the rustic and crisp aura it’s exudes.My love to green tea products , anything about matcha  I had this perfect picturesque meet up with this overly yummy and delightful treat

Although I came in winter the place was still covered in greenery. The Golden Pavillion is absolutely stunning. Its reflection in the lake is so beautiful it simply takes your breath away. Luckily there weren't too many people and we got a chance to really enjoy and appreciate the peacefulness of this place.
Such a niceplace. Not that big but it doesn't matter. Beautiful temple and garden. I loved it.

My winter vacation was fantastic. I went to Japan with my parents after Spring Festival.I made an attentive plan before leaving China. What a different feeling!      We decided to go to Kyoto at first. Kyoto was a small but accient city. There were many traditional buildings on the streets. The streets in Japan impressed me. All the streets were clearly. There was no rubbish anywhere.     On the first morning, we went to the Golden Pavilion.A building in there was package by gold foil. You can learn something about Japan Temples in there.       Talking about foods, we had sushi and sashimi for lunch. They were super fresh and tasty.If you come to Kyoto, a bowl of stretched noodles is a must! You can taste all kinds of Japanese stretched noodles in there.  The next day, we went to Nara by subway. Don’t worry about transportation, The subay, the bus, and the train are all convenient. We saw the biggest wooden building in the world, the Todaji Temple. Then we fed deers. There were many deers anywhere in Nara. I wonder where did they sleep. You can buy deers’food in Nara Park. Please remember put the deers’food in a plastic bag, so deers may follow you to get the food. The roast Japan Beef is a good choice for lunch. I ate a lot.  Most of the waiters and the employees could speak easy English. Japanese were helpful and kind. Service was attentive. I studied some history of Japan. This trip brought me good memory.

attractions.name: Fushimi Inari Taisha
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Kyoto, Kyoto, Fushimi Inari Taisha
attractions.address: 68 Fukakusa Yabunouchicho, Fushimi-ku, Kyoto, Kyoto Prefecture
reviews: Fushimi Inari-taisha  is the head shrine of the kami Inari, located in Fushimi-ku, Kyoto, Kyoto Prefecture, Japan. The shrine sits at the base of a mountain also named Inari which is 233 metres (764 ft) above sea level, and includes trails up the mountain to many smaller shrines which span 4 kilometres (2.5 mi) and take approximately 2 hours to walk up

伏見稲荷大社、KyotoFushimi Inari Taisha is an important Shinto shrine in southern Kyoto. It is famous for its thousands of vermilion torii gates, which straddle a network of trails behind its main buildings. The trails lead into the wooded forest of the sacred Mount Inari, which stands at 233 meters and belongs to the shrine grounds.Fushimi Inari is the most important of several thousands of shrines dedicated to Inari, the Shinto god of rice. Foxes are thought to be Inari's messengers, resulting in many fox statues across the shrine grounds. Fushimi Inari Shrine has ancient origins, predating the capital's move to Kyoto in 794.

my favorite place at japan , you can spend all day hiking along the beautiful traits , you can also hike in the night and enjoy the scenery ,. its a bit dark and scary but that what make it interesting ..... recommended !!!!

it's a golden gate in Kyoto..please come early where the attributes of shrine can be seen and luckily it's the best shrine in Kyoto .. it's far from Dotonbori ..but with the 2 days pass of Kyoto Sightseeing  , I have to say...ITS A WORTH!!
Place was a bit crowded as i expected, but it's really cool. The grounds are open 24 hours. Nice hike and really cool shrines. I loved it. Definitely must see in Kyoto.

attractions.name: Arashiyama
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Kyoto, Kyoto, Arashiyama
reviews: Arashiyama is a district on the western outskirts of Kyoto, Japan. It also refers to the mountain across the Ōi River, which forms a backdrop to the district. Arashiyama is a nationally designated Historic Site and Place of Scenic Beauty.
We thought this place was a little hyped up. It was so crowded with people taking photos that it was hard to enjoy the forest.
Went here last January 1. A breathtaking view, you will appreciate the nature. You can enjoy the area by walking or taking a bus. Would love to go back someday.

we just pass by the bamboo forest and do a hiking into the forest. the Bamboo forest is so beautiful. and after the bamboo we are up to forest. the way trekking to the forest its so peacful and fresh. Our destination is a river inside the forest. After 1 hour we reach, Take a nap besides the river, listen the sound of nature and swiming! it was an awesome trip.

We went to Arashimaya for a day trip. It was overall a fruitful experience with a visit to the famous Bamboo Grove. further down you’ll find Okochi Sanso Garden and Jojjakoji Temple, don’t miss them. The entrance fees’ not that bad considering the picturesque view they offer. Make sure to wear comfortable shoes and do not even try to google Bamboo grove, google is not updated. We got lost going to the Bamboo grove. Good thing a kind man helped us.

attractions.name: Nijo Castle
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Kyoto, Kyoto, Nijo Castle
attractions.open_status: 8:45-16:00 (the castle is closed at 17:00); July and August opening hours 8:00-18:00 (the castle is  closed at 19:00); September opening hours 8:00-16:00 ( The castle is closed at 17:00)
attractions.address: 541, Nishijo Castle, Kawasaki, Nakagawa, Nakagyo-ku, Kyoto
reviews: Nijō Castle (二条城, Nijō-jō) is a flatland castle in Kyoto, Japan. The castle consists of two concentric rings (Kuruwa) of fortifications, the Ninomaru Palace, the ruins of the Honmaru Palace, various support buildings and several gardens.The surface area of the castle is 275,000 square metres (27.5 ha; 68 acres), of which 8,000 square metres (86,000 sq ft) is occupied by buildings.
Beautiful castle! The contrast between the gold and dark wood is really striking and gardens are so vast and peaceful.
One of my favorite places. I just loved it. You can walk around the castle for free. If you want to go inside, you need to purchase the ticket, but it's worth it.

Nijo Castle is beautiful and worth the visit for those who want to take a break from visiting Kyoto’s many temples. The grounds/gardens are a scenic and tranquil haven from the busy streets outside its walls.

Home to the first Shogun of the Edo period, the Nijo Castle was used for a while as an imperial palace, before being open to public. An example of Japan feudal architecture , is surrounded by beautiful gardens.

attractions.name: Sannenzaka & Ninenzaka
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Kyoto, Kyoto, Sannenzaka & Ninenzaka
reviews: Sannenzaka, or Sannen-zaka, is a stone-paved pedestrian road and tourist attraction in Higashiyama-ku, Kyoto, Japan. The road is lined with traditional buildings and shops, and is often paired with the similar road, Ninenzaka.
Overall, I''d have to say that this historic area was intriguing to see because of the old streets and buildings. But I had to give it a 3 because of how unbelievably crowded it was.

Kiyomizu-dera is a block. The specific one is not very clear. It feels similar. That is, the degree of liveliness is different. In other words, the streets of Kyoto are really clean and very comfortable. You can also see the five-heavy Towers around, which is very good.

It is a slope of Kyoto style and is a protected area of important traditional buildings in Japan. The two-year-old Guojia building, which extends from the north of Gaotai Temple to the south, has a long history of red-shelled lattice and insect-cage window style. In the nenji, there are various Japanese snack shops, Kazunori grocery stores, and the acorn Republic around Miyazaki Sakai animation, and there are doll shops, kimono shops and Shimizu porcelain stores.

Perhaps the cherry blossom season has passed, and Sannenzaka in Kyoto is not crowded, so it is suitable for slow travel. "Saka" means "slope" in Japanese. On both sides of the road are wooden houses and ancient machiya buildings like insect cage windows, so they are two ramps with Kyoto style. There are more Japanese-style snack bars, Japanese-style grocery stores, Hayao Miyazaki animation, more doll shops, kimono shops, and Kiyomizu-yaki porcelain shops in Ninenzaka, which are good places to buy souvenirs in Kyoto. Even if it’s the first time, you don’t need to navigate at all, because each trail is very unique. Many Japanese advertisements are shot here. Going further in is Kodaiji Temple and Kiyomizu Temple. You can check in at the same time and take pictures.

attractions.name: Yasaka Shrine
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Kyoto, Kyoto, Yasaka Shrine
attractions.address: 625 Gionmachi Kitagawa, Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto, Kyoto Prefecture
reviews: Yasaka Shrine  once called Gion Shrine  is a Shinto shrine in the Gion District of Kyoto, Japan. Situated at the east end of Shijō-dōri (Fourth Avenue), the shrine includes several buildings, including gates, a main hall and a stage. The Yasaka shrine is dedicated to Susanoo as its chief kami, with his consort Kushinadahime on the east, and eight offspring deities (yahashira no mikogami) on the west. The yahashira no mikogami include Yashimajinumi no kami, Itakeru no kami, Ōyatsuhime no kami, Tsumatsuhime no kami, Ōtoshi no kami, Ukanomitama no kami, Ōyatsuhiko no kami, and Suseribime no mikoto.

The Yasaka Shrine in the evening is beautiful, you can go to the Yasaka Shrine from Kiyomizu Temple, the garden and the flower see path are nearby. The house in the middle of the shrine is too beautiful, the lights on all sides are very good, and the pictures are very good. The shrine and temples in Japan are really built too delicately. It's jasper.

Legend has 7 incredible legends ～ One is that the West Tower Gate does not have spider webs, and the rain does not leave rain traces; the second is that the Longcuo is under the main hall, directly to the Long Palace; the third is Longcuo; the fourth is Zhongsheng lantern; the fifth is Erjianyan; the sixth is beauty water; Seven is the night meteor ～ It is said that especially in the New Year, tens of thousands of people take the fire to pray for peace, the dynamic scene is very spectacular, is a unique scene on New Year's Eve in Kyoto. We came at an inappropriate time ～ No ～ It's a pity ～

The shrine located in Higashiyama District, Kyoto City is one of the most famous and oldest shrines in Kansai region. The shrine hall is called "Gion Building" and is a unique shrine building in Japan, and the dance hall has numerous lanterns, making the night very beautiful. Here is a special place for signing, writing and please guard, the picture horse is very diverse, the love-shaped picture horse is very popular.

It was the head shrine of tazoen Jinja shrine, tazoen shrine, and tazoen Senjin in temple, and it was renamed hachiman Jinja shrine by the separation of Shinto and Buddhism Ordinance in 4 (1868) during the Meiji Restoration. According to the head office, it was built in the year of emperor Saimei 2 (656), and the building was a unique garden, and it was a temple and worship hall that were divided into two, but the roof was the same. The shrine enshrines nariason, kajita hime no Mikoto, and hachijo no Mikoto, and prays for luck, safety in the family, success in the good luck, and success in the test, and commerce.

attractions.name: Gion
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Kyoto, Kyoto, Gion
reviews: Gion is Kyoto’s geisha district, with hostesses in colorful kimonos often sighted on the wooden Tatsumi Bridge, or amid upscale Japanese restaurants and boutiques on Hanamikoji Street. Gion Corner hosts traditional Kyomai dances, while Kennin-ji Temple is known for its Zen garden and Yasaka Shrine has seasonal festivals in a lantern-lit courtyard.Nightlife ranges from quiet sake bars to buzzing, pub-like izakayas and much more.
Gion is Kyoto’s geisha district, with hostesses in colorful kimonos often sighted on the wooden Tatsumi Bridge, or amid upscale Japanese restaurants and boutiques on Hanamikoji Street.

Gion is the Kyoto area, Japan, which was first built during the Sengoku period, in front of the Yasaku Temple, which was built to fill the needs of tourists and visitors to the temple. It finally grows to be one of the most exclusive and famous geisha regions across Japan.
lovely place, really showcases Japan as a tourist attraction
Gion is Kyoto’s geisha district, with hostesses in colorful kimonos often sighted on the wooden Tatsumi Bridge, or amid upscale Japanese restaurants and boutiques on Hanamikoji Street.

attractions.name: Ao Nang Beach
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Thailand, Krabi, Krabi, Ao Nang Beach
attractions.address: Ao Nang Beach, Ao Nang, Krabi 81180
reviews: You don't travel for travel's sake. It's of curiosity, witness, experience, in the silence of involvement and amazed by navigating a country to find the gem. Ride on the ups and downs of travelling. It will never be perfect but it is the twists that make it perfect. How to go Ao Nang Krabi1. You can take bus from Bangkok to Krabi Bus Terminal (approximately 12hrs land trip). From Krabi Bus Terminal you can ride Song Thaew that will pass to Ao Nang Beach. 2. Take a flight from Don Mueang International Airport or Suvarnabhumi International Airport to Krabi International Airport. From Krabi airport you can avail private airport transfer to your hotel / Ao Nang Beach. If  your budget is tight, you can avail the shared van.
Ao Nang is Krabi's vibrant tourist centre. It has the relaxed atmosphere of a small town, the beauty of a beach resort, the modern comforts of long-tail boat tour.
It's also a center for long-tail boat tours to the beaches of limestone islands such as Ko Hong, Ko Poda and Ko Gai (Chicken Island)

Beautiful beach with amazing restaraunts and so so many shops to choose from. Great food, whether you are looking for authentic Thai food, Indian or western dishes you cant go wrong. They also have an amazing selection of seafood to choose from at great prices.

There was a lot of trash from the restaurants and from beach goers. my husband and i went down to the beach and picked up trash for an hour and filled three bags. it’s a beautiful beach, but the water is a bit murky. Beautiful sunsets, though!

attractions.name: Hong Island
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Thailand, Krabi, Krabi, Hong Island
attractions.address: Koh Hong, Mueang Krabi District, Krabi
reviews: Hong Island or known as Koh Hong is a get away island on the Krabi coastline.This wonderful group of tiny islands offers breathtaking scenery, soft white-sand beaches, coral reefs and a beautiful lagoon.
Hong Island Sunset Tour, take you to visit the most beautiful beach and paradise island, Krabi Thailand.

The water is clear at hong islands so easy to snorkel straight from the beach. There are harmless large lizard type animals that roam the island , i got abit of fright the first time o saw it. great for kayaking because the water so clear you can see the fish around you while kayaking water was calm so had a easy ride. The lagoon on the middle of the island is pretty cool for taking photos

Hong is my favorite island in Krabi, together with her “sisters” Lao Ladin and Pakbia. The best way to enjoy Hong is to rent a private long tailed boat in Koh Kwang beach ( Klong Muang)go there early -from 7:30 onwards- and stay until the Marine park closes at around 16:30. you’ll have the beach all for yourself before 9:30 and after 3 pm. The beach is awesome and there is some snorkeling near the left side wall , at the end of the beach. the lagoon is amazing too.

Hong Island is one of the most beautiful island/beach in Krabi. A place where you need to stay for the whole day or at least half day doing nothing, just lazing. White sand beach, clear water, sunny place and wonderful view of rock formations. it’s more than enough to recharge your batteries. Thinking in go there? Pick up a boat at Krabi beach for 6 people max and enjoy the trip, it worth each second.

attractions.name: Emerald Pool
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Thailand, Krabi, Krabi, Emerald Pool
attractions.address: Kok Thai Sub-district.Sri Mahosot District | About 23 kms from city center, Krabi Town, Thailand
reviews: The Emerald Pool or also called Sa Morakot is is a natural turquoise blue pond with fresh water supplied from natural waterfall. They opened daily from morning till 04:30pm.
Thung Teao Forest National Park is a virgin rainforest home to spectacular flora and fauna unseen elsewhere in Thailand.
hidden gem in the wilderness of Krabi, crystal clear pool, good place to escape the heat on a hot day. recommended.
There was a nice walk through the jungle to a natural hot pool. There were multiple pools but we didn't have enough time to see them all on our tour. Lots of markets outside the jungle.
emerald pool is another must  do attraction for visitors of the region. the waters are crystal clear and comfortable to swim in. the pool is also surrounded by a lush rainfroest you can walk around.

attractions.name: View Point
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Thailand, Krabi, Krabi, Phi Phi Islands, View Point
attractions.address: Ao Nang, Mueang Krabi District, Krabi 81000
reviews: The best Krabi Viewpoint is Khao Ngon Nak Viewpoint. It is a perfect playground for hikers and tropical adventure seekers. Usually lot of tourist will come over for deadly sunset photo moment.
The climb to this viewpoint is not to be taken lightly. It is strenuous and extreme. They have 5 best viewpoint in Thailand. Do explore it!
There are 3 view points. Addmision is 30THB.You can arrive there by following signs say view point from city center.picture is view point 1&2.
that feeling while looking at the natural shape of the island, it makes you realize how wonderful the earth and how lucky we are living on this beautiful place.

We were undecided on whether we wanted to pay the 30baht entrance fee and walk up all those stairs with little ones but we did it in the end. The views are very nice and although the landscaped entrance with fruit shaped seats is a bit odd, the kids loved it. Viewpoint 2 is where you get the panoramic view over PhiPhi island.

attractions.name: Ko Mai Phai Island
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Thailand, Krabi, Krabi, Phi Phi Islands, Ko Mai Phai Island
reviews: Ko Mai Phai is a small island in Thailand, located between the Krabi coast and the Phi Phi Islands.
Ko Mai Phai is located in the north of Ko Phi Phi Don. It is not far from Ko Yung. The north and east of Ko Mai Phai have beautiful beaches.

Little Phi Phi Island and Big Phi Phi Island are separated by about 2 kilometers, surrounded by cliffs. The terrain is dangerous and there are several huge limestone caves. The island has not undergone any development, nor does it provide accommodation. The wild monkeys are full of mountains, but the water quality is particularly clear, especially suitable for diving. There are scenic spots such as Maya Bay and Viking Caves. Maya Bay can be used for diving. There are many petrels inhabiting the Viking Caves, so it is also called "bird's nest cave". It is precisely because of the clear waters and snow-white beaches that this place was chosen as the location for the Hollywood movie "Beach".

There are a lot of tourists who come here for island-hopping tours. This island has a relatively primitive feeling. There are many dead branches that fall in the sea, and the primitive jungle on the island, I think they are all Very attractive.

This island has very beautiful beaches. The beaches here are very white under the sun. I think it is very special, and there are not many tourists in this place, so I can stay here for an entire afternoon.

attractions.name: Hagia Sophia Museum
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Turkey, Istanbul Region, Istanbul, Hagia Sophia Museum
attractions.open_status: From April 15th to October 30th, 9:00-19:00, October 30th - April 15th, 9:00-17:00, stop selling tickets 1 hour before closing. The first day of Ramadan is not open every year, and lesser bairam is only open for half a day.
attractions.address: Sultan Ahmet Mahallesi, Ayasofya Meydanı, 34122 Fatih/İstanbul
reviews: Hagia Sophia (/ˈhɑːɡiə soʊˈfiːə/; from Koinē Greek: Ἁγία Σοφία, romanized: Hagía Sophía; Latin: Sancta Sophia, lit. 'Holy Wisdom'), officially the Hagia Sophia Holy Grand Mosque (Turkish: Ayasofya-i Kebir Cami-i Şerifi) and formerly the Church of Hagia Sophia,[4]is a Late Antique place of worship in Istanbul, designed by the Greek geometers Isidore of Miletusand Anthemius of Tralles.Built in 537 as the patriarchal cathedral of the imperial capital of Constantinople, it was the largest Christian church of the eastern Roman Empire (the Byzantine Empire) and the Eastern Orthodox Church, except during the Latin Empire from 1204 to 1261, when it became the city's Roman Catholic cathedral. In 1453, after the Fall of Constantinople to the Ottoman Empire, it was converted into a mosque. In 1935 the secular Turkish Republic established it as a museum. In 2020, it re-opened as a mosque.
it’s an amazing architecture with a beautiful interior it’s a place of worship for the Muslims it is known that it was a church in the past and converted
it is reallly beautiful I love being there ! ❤️ I spent 2 weeks in turkey and it is my best holiday ever ✅ I’m impress with the architecture of hagia sophia very stunning

That's a place with an interesting history. It was first a church and then it turned into a mosque but, as you can see, the images on the walls have been renovated. Revealing the images is a hard and precise work

If one visits Turkey its one of its must see places.Its an amazing structure, once oround it or in it it still gives you the feeling that time is at a standstill, it gives you a feeling of living the moment when it was created.

attractions.name: Sultan Ahmed Mosque
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Turkey, Istanbul Region, Istanbul, Sultan Ahmed Mosque
attractions.open_status: Generally, it is open during 8:30-16:45. No entry during the Muslim religious service. There is a sign at the front of the door to remind visitors of the opening time of the day (about 3 periods per day). Friday is usually open to visitors from 13:00.
attractions.address: Sultanahmet Mah At Meydani Cad No: 7, İstanbul 34122
reviews: Sultan Ahmed Mosque (Turkish: Sultan Ahmet Camii), also known as the Blue Mosque, is an Ottoman-era friday mosque located in Istanbul, Turkey.A functioning mosque, it also attracts large numbers of tourist visitors. It was constructed between 1609 and 1616 during the rule of Ahmed I. Its Külliye contains Ahmed's tomb, a madrasah and a hospice. Hand-painted blue tiles adorn the mosque’s interior walls, and at night the mosque is bathed in blue as lights frame the mosque’s five main domes, six minarets and eight secondary domes.It sits next to the Hagia Sophia, the principal mosque of Istanbul until the Blue Mosque's construction and another popular tourist site.

Its a beautiful mosque of Ottoman era.It has a distinction of having five minarets.At the time of its construction there were four minarets of Masjad e Haram,the most sacred mosque.To give it a differentiation from that five minarets were constructed.It is located in Sultan Ahmet square which is accessible through tram,taxi or on foot.Women are advised to cover their bodies while visiting this mosque.During the time of prayers non muslims are forbidden to visit.They can visit after the prayers though.It is also called The blue mosque for its blue colour
Historical mosque with fantastic architechtural elements.

Spacious masjid. During CMCO, obligatory to wear a mask, bring your own sajadah, and dont forget to bring your handphone to scan qr code. However you can Salah outside of Masjid if you not bring those items.

attractions.name: Basilica Cistern
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Turkey, Istanbul Region, Istanbul, Basilica Cistern
attractions.address: Alemdar Mah. Yerebatan Cad. 34410 Sultanahmet, Fatih, Istanbul, Turkey
reviews: The Basilica Cistern is the largest of several hundred ancient cisterns that lie beneath the city of Istanbul, Turkey. The cistern, located 150 metres (490 ft) southwest of the Hagia Sophia on the historical peninsula of Sarayburnu, was built in the 6th century during the reign of Byzantine Emperor Justinian
This place is located just cross the road from Hagia Sophia and the entrance ticket is only 20 Turkish lira. There are many famous columns inside such as Medusa's head column and crying column.
One the major attraction near blue mosque is this Basilica Cistern. Entry fee is a cheap at TR20 and it's worth visiting as we learn how the structure stands.

I've been to Istambul not long ago, and visiting The Cistern Basilica was on the top of my list. It is amazing how after more than 15 centuries ago, this place, first used as a temple, and later as a water reservoir, has survived the time. Definitely a must see.

there is a lot of history in the Basilca Cistern.  the cistern contained over 300+ columns.  the hightlight are the 2 head of Medusa at the base of 2 columns.  the admission is 20 Turkish Lira.  very busy but the line moves quickly.

attractions.name: Grand Bazaar
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Turkey, Istanbul Region, Istanbul, Grand Bazaar
attractions.address: Beyazıt Mh., Kalpakçılar Cd. No:22, 34126 Fatih/İstanbul
reviews: The Grand Bazaar is one of the largest and oldest covered markets in the world, with 61 covered streets. In 2014, it was listed No.1 among the world's most-visited tourist attractions with 91,250,000 annual visitors.The Grand Bazaar at Istanbul is often regarded as one of the first shopping malls of the world.

It was a very interesting experience. If you have ever been to a public market then you get the idea. The main difference is the size of the Grand Bazaar. This place is enormous with people barking for their shops on every corner. It can be a bit overwhelming at times though.

Large places, large markets worn around in small alleys, are not only a place for tourists to shop, but also a market for locals. There are also many small daily necessities and spices. Buy scarves directly at half the price.

attractions.name: Topkapi Palace
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Turkey, Istanbul Region, Istanbul, Topkapi Palace
attractions.open_status: October 30th - April 15th, 9:00-16:45 (stopping ticket sales at 16:00), April 15th - October 30th 9:00-18:45 (stop selling tickets at 18:00); It is not open every Tuesday of the year. The opening hours of public holidays and religious holidays will be adjusted.
reviews: This palace is in story MAGNIFICIENT CENTURY.It was so beautiful palace.I start to proud with this place when i watch this movie.
Topkapi Palace is an incredibly historic site, home to Ottoman Sultans and it really feels like Sultans still live there.
Plan to spend a few hours here if you want to see everything.  A variety of rooms and areas to explore the different portions of the palace.
Amazing palace.Eveyone should come and see this beauty
This is one of the best things I've visited in Istanbul, depending on the season, there are long queues waiting to enter, allocate a lot of time to explore this magnificent and huge palace.

attractions.name: Istiklal Avenue
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Turkey, Istanbul Region, Istanbul, Istiklal Avenue
reviews: İstiklal Avenue  known as the Grand Avenue of Pera (Ottoman Turkis is one of the most famous avenues in Istanbul, Turkey, visited by nearly 3 million people in a single day over the course of weekends. Full of houses boutiques, music stores, bookstores, art galleries, cinemas, theatres, libraries, cafés, pubs, nightclubs with live music, historical patisseries, chocolateries and restaurants.
It is a very nice area in Istambul. You can ride the tram. Visit some interesting places. Eat at fine restaurant or a street stand. All excellent experiences

Streets with a lot of people and few cars, basically pedestrian streets, there is a double-decker tram, but the frequency is extremely low, on both sides are handicraft shops, snack shops, clothing stores, etc., to the southern end to Galata Tower.

The "Champs Elysées" in Istanbul, newcomers must come here. The 3 km-long pedestrian street starts from Taksim Square in the north to Galata Tower in the south, and is dotted with churches, consulates, restaurants, and a variety of colors. Various shops are very prosperous, and the retro tram shuttles in the middle of the street is also a scenic line not to be missed.

I signed up for a day trip, and the last stop is here. It takes half an hour to walk the whole street quickly, like Nanjing Road in Shanghai, but the architecture is more European and beautiful. It’s better to stop and take pictures all the way. In fact, it feels better during the day. , I took two shots of the red tinkling car, and there are actually locals with trailers. There are many performers along the road, and the guitar player is the most popular.

attractions.name: Dolmabahce Palace
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Turkey, Istanbul Region, Istanbul, Dolmabahce Palace
reviews: Dolmabahçe Palace located in the Beşiktaşdistrict of Istanbul, Turkey, on the European coast of the Bosporus strait, served as the main administrative center of the Ottoman Empire from 1856 to 1887
Take the tram to Kabataş, which is the last station, cross the road to the right and then walk a bit until you see the gorgeous white palace stands in front of you
Beautiful and the grandest of all palace during the ottoman empire of Istanbul.

A jewel of Istanbul! A must see place! A long queue to the ticket office, but it’s really worth it! I recommend to byu tickets to the main part and to Harem too. Beautiful architecture, nice park. There is a picture museum on the territory of the palace - don’t miss it! A part with Aivazovskii paitings is incredible.
It got over my expections, this place is really nice and I highly recommend it.

attractions.name: Galata Tower

reviews: The Galata Tower  is a medieval stone tower in the Galata/Karaköy quarter of Istanbul, Turkey, just to the north of the Golden Horn's junction with the Bosphorus. It is a high, cone-capped cylinder that dominates the skyline and offers a panoramic vista of Istanbul's historic peninsula and its environs.

old but good one laa historical cool laa as cool as the weather when I was there laa next to the tower I found galata towel shop you know I thought this was the galata tower/towel shop laaa hehe joke sikit laa yaa please
dont miss out the neighborhood, alot of cute cafe are nearby, and the beaty of those historical architecture and alleys are all around the corners...
Awesome!!! Great view and amazing restaurants around this place, highly recommend it to all the tourists :)
beautiful and definitely worth seeing, but there's actually a cafe nearby that's just as tall and has just as good a view, but you can also see the tower. try to find it

attractions.name: Miyajima
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Hiroshima, Hiroshima, Miyajima
attractions.address: Hiroshima ken,  Hatsukaichi city,  Miyajima cho
reviews: Itsukushima, also known as Miyajima, is a small island in Hiroshima Bay, western Japan. It is known for its forests and ancient temples. Just offshore, the giant, orange Great Torii Gate is partially submerged at high tide. It marks the entrance to the Itsukushima Shrine, which was first built in the 12th century. Nearby, the Museum of History and Folklore has cultural artifacts in a 19th-century merchant's home.

It's worth going there. Every season has a good atmosphere though I highly recommend visiting there in Spring. From Misen Mountain, you can see such a spectacular view!!Local food is also good! There are plenty of choices to grab.
Quiet little town away from traffic but not tourist lol. had a beautiful time there. Food is ok and mostly oysters everywhere.

it is definitely worth a visit. it is our second time here. the shrine is closed for renovations but it is still very mice to stroll around the small lanes and sample some food like grilled oysters. enjoy the free roaming deer.

Miyajima = Itsukushima. When you get out of JR Miyajima Exit, you will see the sign to the pier, just follow. There are two shipping companies at the pier. It is recommended to take JR boats with or without JR PASS because it is close to the Otorii. Miyajima is very large and there are many places to play. There is a guide map in the cruise hall. It is best to take one copy in Japanese and Chinese. The places marked in the Japanese version are more detailed. If you play all over the island, it will be a busy day. Because there were no red leaves during May 1st, so I didn't go all the way up the mountain before, and swayed around Itsukushima Shrine and nearby. It’s a five-minute walk from the pier to Itsukushima Shrine. It’s less likely to walk by the water. It is recommended that you finish reading the Itsukushima Shrine before heading to the shopping street inside. It is best to determine the high tide and low tide time before you come. The two times are completely different at Itsukushima Shrine. If you stay for another day or at night, it is highly recommended to watch the sunset at Otorii.

attractions.name: Itsukushima Shrine
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Hiroshima, Hiroshima, Itsukushima Shrine
attractions.open_status: New Year's Day January 1st - January 5th will be based on actual conditions; January 6th - February 28th 6:30-17:30; March 1st - October 14th 6:30-18: 00; October 15th - November 30th 6:30-17:30; December 1st - December 31st 6:30-17:00.
reviews: Itsukushima Shrine (厳島神社 (嚴島神社), Itsukushima-jinja) is a Shinto shrine on the island of Itsukushima (popularly known as Miyajima), best known for its "floating" torii gate.It is in the city of Hatsukaichi in Hiroshima Prefecture in Japan. The shrine complex is listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site, and the Japanese government has designated several buildings and possessions as National Treasures.

wonderful shrine .... you can enjoy your time here , walking along the coast , gentle patting the deer , the food here also really good ..... near the shrine you can enjoy the food and souvenir street , also you can spend your time on hiking the mountain ..... during the evening when the water getting low you can walk along the big toori , around 4-5 , you can ask the store or ryokan owner about the exact time ......  very nice and beautiful island
I love going to Miyajima, the deers are adorable and the food is just so tasty my mouth is getting watery just thinking about it.

Itsukushima Shrine is one of Japan's three scenic spots. The big torii standing in the sea is a lot of introductions. The cover of Japanese articles is more famous abroad than in China. It is the most famous representative of Miyajima. In fact, Itsukushima Shrine is also built on the seaside with many plank roads. When the tide is low, there is sand under the plank road. When the tide is high, the sea will be poured in. The entire shrine will become floating on the sea. It is particularly spectacular on Miyajima. In addition to the Miyajima Shrine, the cute deer is also a major attraction. The conscience is guaranteed to be really cute. It’s not the brutal look of Nara Park, and it’s very suitable for taking selfies with them.

Going to the Sakurajima Shrine in Miyajima, it is super fun and not even enough! Going back by boat, eating a lot of delicious food, watching the big bird house ⛩️, there are people in the shrine who are married feel superb, there are many deer on the road to rob the tourists to eat hhh

attractions.name: Atomic Bomb Dome
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Hiroshima, Hiroshima, Atomic Bomb Dome
reviews: The A-Bomb Dome is a symbol of peace which most people have at least seen at one time in a picture. The building, which was designed by a Czech architect in 1915,

The original bomb dome was the most famous landmark in Hiroshima, and the predecessor was the industrial encouragement hall in Hiroshima Prefecture, but during the Second World War, the bomb was dropped on the U. s.military's 8 6 day 1945, and the bomb center fell nearby and the surrounding buildings were almost flat. The building was a ruined building, but it was barely preserved, and the dome became an anti war symbol of this sad incident and was registered as a world heritage site in 1996.

Witnessing the historical trajectory of the WWII blast damage. Could be a very powerful feeling. The witnessing felt very unreal but very real. Really worth the place to visit. A visit to Hiroshima must be made to this historic landmark, and when you see the building that survived the atomic bombs up close, you can't help but feel the cruelty of the war by looking at the descriptions on the information boards.
It is a reinforced concrete structure designed by Czech architect Jane cherzer.
One of the two cities where the atomic bombs exploded, you can see.

attractions.name: Hiroshima Peace Memorial Park
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Hiroshima, Hiroshima, Hiroshima Peace Memorial Park
reviews: Hiroshima Peace Memorial Park is a memorial park in the center of Hiroshima, Japan. It is dedicated to the legacy of Hiroshima as the first city in the world to suffer a nuclear attack, and to the memories of the bomb's direct and indirect victims (of whom there may have been as many as 140,000). The Hiroshima Peace Memorial Park is visited by more than one million people each year.The park is there in memory of the victims of the nuclear attack on August 6, 1945, in which the United States dropped an atomic bomb on the Japanese city of Hiroshima.The Hiroshima Peace Memorial Park was planned and designed by the Japanese Architect Kenzō Tange at Tange Lab.
the word peace and serenity best describe the park and its layout. whilst the museum shows the horrors of the bombing and its aftermath. still very memorable.

The Peace Park is a wonderful place to walk, and escape the downtown area of Hiroshima. With winding trails and footpaths, bring your walking shoes because there is a lot of ground to cover. Mainly are many memorials to those who lost their lives in the dropping of the Atomic Bombs

A morbid feeling definitely creeps into your soul when you visit the Hiroshima Peace Memorial, but in a way where it humbles the person you are by seeing exactly how much destruction and loss was endured during the time of the atomic bomb. I can't even put into words how I felt the entire time I went through the museum and even walking the grounds of where all the destruction occurred. The reigning message that was spread throughout this place was definitely of peace. Peace after such tragedy and horror. I recommend visiting this place to really get a sense of how it would feel, even just a tiny bit, if our lives were to ever be affected by such a catastrophic event. So powerful. I remember it like it was yesterday.

Must when you're at Hiroshima. If you want to learn more about the history of Hiroshima, it's a must-go-place for you. Walk it through, use a lot of time, spend the whole day in there. You will see so much that you won't even notice that the time passed.

attractions.name: Itsukushima Floating Torii Gate
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Hiroshima, Hiroshima, Itsukushima Floating Torii Gate
reviews: One of Japan's most revered sites, this ancient Shinto shrine seems to float on water at high tide.

The special ferry to see the big bird house, also because I was too late to Miyajima, visit the time of the shrine of the island, so I also hurriedly take pictures. The mall is also closed very early, about 6 pm, the whole street is almost closed, there is no mean to make tourists money at all) The deer on Miyajima is much more gentle than the deer in Nara, but it is still forbidden to feed! I hope to have a chance to visit the look of the big bird house next time.

Few people who come to Miyajima do not come to this torii gate. The great torii gate of Itsukushima is the soul of this island, but people who have plans to travel before August 200 should give up. Unfortunately, the large torii gate of Itsukushima Shrine is under repair, and it has been under maintenance until the opening of the Tokyo Olympic Games.
    The torii is standing in the sea and on the sea. You can still go down to the beach at low tide. The torii is very spectacular. If it is the original vermilion torii, it will be very shocking.
    Of course, the people who designed this place at the beginning are also powerful. The most magical part of Itsukushima is actually the high tide and low tide. When the high tide is fully utilized, the whole shrine floats on the water. It is a shrine in the sea. When the tide is low, people can go down to the beach and watch it up close. so amazing. Of course, the times of rising and falling tides are different every day, you need to pay attention to the official website for details.
     It’s a shame that I didn’t have a chance to get the vermilion version as a place to take pictures.

It's so beautiful that I regret that I only arranged for one day and stayed here. The suggestion is to check the time of the highest and lowest point of the tide on the official website now, so that you can see two different faces of Otorii. The large torii gate is close to one kilometer from the pier, and the scenery is very good when walking along the beach. It's almost a good time to go to the highest or lowest tide point. After viewing it, go to other places on the island to have a meal. It is almost the next time when the tide is highest or lowest.

You can go nearby. From the Miyajima Otorii Gate to the pier, there is a section of Itsukushima Monzencho Tourist Street. It is a place where you must spend time to visit Otorii. There are plenty of snacks and souvenirs in small department stores on the street.

attractions.name: Hiroshima Castle
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Hiroshima, Hiroshima, Hiroshima Castle
attractions.address: 21-1 Motomachi, Naka Ward, Hiroshima, Hiroshima Prefecture
reviews: Hiroshima Castle (広島城, Hiroshima-jō), sometimes called Carp Castle (鯉城, Rijō), is a castle in Hiroshima, Japan that was the home of the daimyō(feudal lord) of the Hiroshima han (fief). The castle was originally constructed in the 1590s, but was destroyed by the atomic bombing on August 6, 1945. The castle was rebuilt in 1958, a replica of the original that now serves as a museum of Hiroshima's history before World War II.
good to visit and experience the old Samurai Culture
Where the atomic bombs were once detonated, it is now a beautiful town.

The real Hiroshima Castle was destroyed by atomic bombing, and the current building was later rebuilt. Hiroshima Castle is also called "Carp Castle", and it is said that it looks like a black carp. There is an exhibition inside Hiroshima Castle, but I think it’s beautiful to take pictures outside, and I completely forgot the exhibits inside. The Shukkeen Garden opposite Hiroshima Castle is very beautiful, and the view of Hiroshima Castle from the garden is very beautiful. Several scenic spots in Hiroshima are not far away, and sightseeing buses will arrive along the way, which is fun. The introductions of many scenic spots on the bus are great. I really got off to visit when I saw the introductions and felt interested. It is very convenient for the transportation of scenic spots.

This is a huge island (surrounded by a moat) to visit. There are many things to see... the trees that survived the explosion, the original stones from the castle, and of course, the beautiful large castle itself. Now it is a museum. Even if you don't like staying in the museum, the beauty here is still worth the entrance fee.

attractions.name: Mount Misen
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Hiroshima, Hiroshima, Mount Misen
reviews: Mount Misen is the sacred mountain on Itsukushima in Hatsukaichi, Hiroshima, Japan, and is the highest mountain on the island at 535 m; it is situated within the World Heritage area of Itsukushima Shrine. The sea around the island and all of the island are within Setonaikai National Park.

Miyama is behind Itsukushima Shrine and is a world natural heritage. Walking from the shrine to Mishan, you will pass a delicious commercial street and a forest road with artistic conception. There are a lot of people lining up to take the cable car, but the signs on both sides of the line are fun and not boring. After arriving at the top of the mountain, the viewing platform is very beautiful, allowing visitors to immediately see the beauty of Mishan. After walking through a mountain path that feels ordinary, I am really serious about climbing the mountain. I will pass a few shrines first. Zhu Yuyin is also quite distinctive. At the end, the scenery on the top of the mountain is vast and the mountains and green waters are quiet. It takes a day to visit Mishan and Itsukushima Shrine. The beauty of the two places is completely different, and I feel a kind of peace of mind.

Mount Mishan is 535m above sea level and is the main peak of Miyajima. Because it has been admired as a sacred mountain since ancient times, the natural environment is well protected, and the original ecological environment is preserved. Many rare animals and plants grow in the virgin forest on the mountain, which is listed in the world as Mishan virgin forest and Itsukushima Shrine. Heritage list.

Miyama, Japan’s three scenic spots, took a car to the Shishi Rock Observation Deck and walked for 30 minutes to the top of the mountain. It happened that there were too many people on that day. It was already 4 o’clock in the afternoon, and the queue was about 1 hour. The queue was exhausting. After 5 minutes, I came down. I'm afraid that the car will take a long time to line up. Although the scenery is good, there are mountains and waters, it takes a lot of time to line up, and the price is not high.

This mountain is not very high, but standing on the top of the mountain, you can overlook the entire mountain, and the scenery on the sea has a small view of the mountains. Looking at the clouds in the sky, and the big ships on the sea, There is a kind of quiet time.

attractions.name: Senjokaku Pavilion
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Hiroshima, Hiroshima, Senjokaku Pavilion
reviews: Wooden Momoyama-period shrine commissioned by samurai Toyotomi Hideyoshi, overlooking the sea.

This is really an amazing attraction, one of the must-visit places on Miyajima. According to history, it is said that it was built during the Hideyoshi era, but it has not been completed since it was suspended midway. The loft is located on the top of a small hill. After climbing a section of the mountain road, you can see this simple color Senjokaku, which is completely different from the Itsukushima Taisha below. Qiandi is a unit of area, but there is no concept of how big it is. After seeing it, it is really a super large platform with a very wide view. There is an extended platform on the side facing the sea. You can sit on it and look out. It is also officially because it is not completed. On the contrary, it seems very imposing, which can be regarded as a characteristic of the Azuchi era. The wooden pavilion is covered with various plaques, and they are basically all Chinese calligraphy, which is consistent with the Chinese aesthetic habits. In addition, there are many pictures with rich colors. But there are no things that belong to that era, and all that can be seen are added by later generations. It's always recommended. Together with the five-storied pagoda, it is a place worth visiting.

It has a large area and is full of logs. It is a good place to relax and enjoy the cool air. Tickets are 100 yen. Next to it is the five-storied pagoda. Thousands of Houses. It is the largest building on the island and is used as a memorial hall for Toyonari Hideyoshi's soldiers who died. It is composed of 857 tatami mats, hence the name Qianho Pavilion. But Hideyoshi died before he finished making it, and now he still keeps the way he hadn't finished making it. Except for the upper part of the statue seat, no patio has been built, and there is no siding, and it has been preserved in the above-mentioned unfinished state. In the Edo period, it was loved as a place for communication and enjoying the coolness. Therefore, the name of the Kabuki performers at the time, Kabuki (17-character short poem), etc. are recorded on the large pillar. In the Meiji era, it was officially renamed Toyokuni Shrine to honor him and Kato Kiyomasa.

The architectural style here is somewhat similar to that of a pure wooden structure in Nara, Senjokaku is very ventilated and cool on all sides. Sitting under the corridor of Senjokaku, walking between the corridors of Itsukushima Shrine, imagine that we are being purified. Sit more

Inside the Toyokuni Shrine, together with the five-storied pagoda, you need a ticket of 100 yuan. You must take off your shoes to get in. The inside is big, the wooden floor is slippery, and the simple architectural style is a place to pay tribute to the dead.

attractions.name: Momijidani Park
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Hiroshima, Hiroshima, Momijidani Park
reviews: Momijidani Park (紅葉谷公園, Momijidani-Kōen) is one of the most famous maple leaves valley parks in Japan. The park is located at the foot of Mt. Misen, along Momijidani River, behind Itsukushima Shrine in Miyajima, Hatsukaichi, Hiroshima. There are more than 200 maples, including 110 acer palmatum thunberg, 60 palmatum var. matsumurae, 10 acer rufinerve, acer buergerianum, acer sieboldianum miquel and acer amoenum carriere var. amoenum.

Hongye Valley Park
Located in the sacred place of Hiroshima Prefecture-Miyajima's original forest valley. The red leaves of Momiji Valley Park have been planted since the Edo period. It is an elegant garden with many old red-leaf maple trees. As its name suggests, the park has about 700 red leaves and it is full of forests. In mid-November, the entire park is dyed into a bright red scene, magnificent and moving, and sometimes you can see the deer walking under the red leaves! At the end of November every year, the Autumn Leaf Festival is held at the Daishoin Temple in Miyajima, which is definitely a major event for local maple viewing!
Transportation: Transportation: 15-minute walk from JR Miyajimaguchi Station to Miyajimaguchi Pier
Start time: open all day
#日本旅游# #广岛旅游#

Momiji Valley Park is located at the foot of Mt. Miyama on Miyajima, very close to the cable car station. The park expands along the Red Leaf Valley River and planted with about 700 red leaf trees. Every mid-to-late November, this is the sacred place for viewing autumn leaves in Miyajima.

Since September, the weather is no longer hot, autumn is here, and the most beautiful scenery of the year is here. Going to the Momiji Valley in Hiroshima, Japan to enjoy the most beautiful autumn leaves is a must-see in autumn, so you must prepare quickly.

Hongye Valley Park, autumn is full of red leaves, especially beautiful when the sun shines at noon. There is also a beautiful maple forest behind the main hall of Mishan, but unfortunately it is impossible to enter. The ginkgo in front of the Qiande Pavilion is also in golden yellow, and you can directly hit this big ginkgo from many places on the island.
The maple leaves in Dashengyuan have fallen a little, but the surrounding ginkgo and maple leaves are still leaning. Unfortunately, there was no sunlight when I went there in the afternoon and the photos were dark.

attractions.name: Colosseum
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Italy, Lazio, Rome, Colosseum
reviews: It's one if the iconic buildings in Rome. It takes yiu back to thousands years if Roman history and heritage. Colosseum tour along with Roman Forum and Platine Hill is good starting point to immerse yourself in the city's heritage. It can get crowded so uts best to take a private tour which are available in plenty. It involves lot of walking so wear comfortable shoes.

One of my favorite places to visit in Rome is the Colosseum. Book tickets in advance so your wait time is not as long, because it is always crowded. The tour of the underground areas is limited in numbers, but is worth the extra expense. A good tour guide really explains the meaning of what you are seeing and adds to the experience. My children enjoyed this attraction as much as the adults. Sometimes there are discounts for students if you have a student ID.
