The Roman Colosseum is a fantastic piece of architecture and historialGet an audio video guide when you enter. It explains the story behind the architecture - the social classes during Roman empire, the battle of Gladiators, their hidden surprise rooms below the battlegrounds,spend at least 2 hours roaming around and exploring this wonderful monument. The Roman ruins and other popular landmarks are also close by when you are done with this gem. there will be a ticket to visit it. it is better to buy online to avoid very long queue. and c trip ticket are cheaper than on site ticket

one of the New7Wonders of the World.[9] It is one of Rome's most popular tourist attractions and also has links to the Roman Catholic Church, as each Good Friday the Pope leads a torchlit "Way of the Cross" procession that starts in the area around the Colosseum.
For some one who has never seen Rome, It is hard to believe how beautiful life can be ⛪️❤️

attractions.name: Trevi Fountain
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Italy, Lazio, Rome, Trevi Fountain
reviews: very beautiful, pictures don’t do it justice unless you have a very good camera. It’s located in the heart of the city so very nice to walk around from here
beautiful place especially to go at nights. the lights are awesome and that place is really amazing. i would come back there all my life.

Absolutely gorgeous! I would say definitely go during the day to get the full picture, but if you can only go once, go at night. There are less people, it won't be as hot (granted it was mid august when I went haha) and it is beautiful at night.
Beautiful and very romantic ! is always packed with people, best to go there either really early in morning 5:30am - 8:00am. you will have the fountain all to yourself
Do not miss this attraction If you are in Rome! The location is ideal to have some good food, go shopping or just relax and enjoy the view.

attractions.name: Piazza di Spagna
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Italy, Lazio, Rome, Piazza di Spagna
reviews: There are ancient buildings in the square, including the governor’s residence, gardens, and Spanish arches. The ancient Romanesque cloisters, arches, capitals, and Arabic and Spanish architectural styles are considered as the most beautiful square in Spain. There are two Plaza de España, one is the Trinity Church in Rome, Italy, and the other is the site of the old Spanish governor
It's not bad. It's good to see. It's really good.
The famous Spanish square is famous for the encounter of Roman holiday princesses and journalists on its steps.
Piazza Espana is one of the most lively neighborhoods in Rome, with a huge crowd of nearby cafes and luxury shops. The most famous square is the ruined boat sprayer designed by Benini.
Place de Espanya is close to a lot of shopping!

attractions.name: The Pantheon
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Italy, Lazio, Rome, The Pantheon
attractions.open_status: Sun 9:00 AM - 6:00 PM, Mon - Fri 8:30 AM - 6:00 PM, Sat 8:30 AM - 7:30 PM
reviews: المكان هايل ويوضح حضاره التاريخ وتعتبر من الكنائس الغير تقليديه والطراز المعماري لوجود فتحه دائريه كبيره في القبه يوضح مدي الفن المعماري وحول البنثيون مطاعم وكفيهات يمكن الجلوس عليها والتمتع بمنظره من الخارج وانا ارشحه للزياره لكل من يذهب الي روما
In the city centre, very imposing attraction, certainly worth a visit. Entrance is free and inside there is a lot to see
the best and amazing building ive ever seen.
very beautiful and it has a magnificent atmosphere

I always forget how beautiful the Pantheon is!! It is gorgeous on the inside and has so much history! I also forget that it’s a church... it doesn’t seem like it would be until you get inside. A beautiful piece a architecture... like a giant work of art! Definitely a must see as you’re wandering through Rome.

attractions.name: Piazza Venezia
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Italy, Lazio, Rome, Piazza Venezia
reviews: Free entry is a minute museum, with or without limited time, so it's all a walk, just remember to see some military flags

Located in a round square in the center of Rome. The front of the square is a neoclassical building made of white marble, nicknamed "Wedding Cake🍰"😂, which is really a bit like ~ It is said that the arc-shaped facade formed by 16 columns is its most exciting part, and there are two sets of fountains under the steps⛲ Also very beautiful.
If you want to take a panoramic view, you may be close to the road, pay attention to safety.

To the south of Piazza Venezia is Rome’s iconic building, the Altar of the Fatherland, nicknamed "Big Cake". It was built to commemorate the unification of Italy. It was built in 1911 and is equivalent to Tiananmen Square in Beijing. To the west of the square is the Venetian Palace built in the fifteenth century. It was originally the Pope’s palace, then the Embassy of the Republic of Venice in the Papal State, and Mussolini’s office in the last century. On the east side of the square, there is a Venetian Insurance Building symmetrical to the Venetian Palace. It was built in 1911. On the north side of the square, there is Via del Corso, which leads to Piazza del Popolo. It is the most important street in Rome. At the intersection of Via del Corso, there is a palace built in the 17th century because it is the last residence of Napoleon’s mother, now called Bona In Bar Palace, Napoleon's mother Letizia likes to sit on the second floor terrace and watch the bustling passers-by on the square.

Venice is a world-famous water city with a resident population of 60,000, but it attracts nearly 10 million tourists from around the world every year. The entire city of Venice is built on blue waves, with 118 islands and 177 canals criss-crossed by boats. The gondola roams in it, and it feels like being in a fairyland.

Mentioning this place, I have to say that in history, Mussolini delivered the infamous "balcony speech" to the fanatics on the second floor balcony of Piazza Venezia. This building is known as the book book because of its shape. machine.

attractions.name: Roman Forum
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Italy, Lazio, Rome, Roman Forum
attractions.open_status: 8:30 to 1 hour before sunset; closed on January 1 and December 25
attractions.address: Via della Salara Vecchia, 5/6, 00186 Rome RM
reviews: represent the grandeur and power of Rome nearly 2,000 years ago. These ruins are what remains of Rome’s ancient center city – the Roman Forum. Often overlooked by the Colosseum, the Forum contains some of Rome’s most important history
You must see this. Go there early morning, you can take one ticket for coliseum and forum. This is for whole day
非常值得一訪非常值得一訪非常值得一訪

We combined the Colosseum and the Roman Forum with our tour with What a Life Tours. It was the perfect combo. It can get quite hectic there, so having a guide is wonderful. We needed our tour up on Palatine Hill which looks over Rome. The sun was starting to set so it was so beautiful! Just know if you go alone in the afternoon it will be beyond packed with people!
Hay más que ver aquí que en Coliseo. Es impresionante y vale la pena visitar.  There is more to see here than in the Coliseum. It is impressive and worth a visit.

attractions.name: Arch of Constantine
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Italy, Lazio, Rome, Arch of Constantine
attractions.address: Via di San Gregorio, 00186 Roma RM, Italy
reviews: You would never think that being in a place such as the colusseum you had the opportunity to also admire the grandeur of the arc of Constantine .. simple beautiful

The Arch of Constantine I, erected in c. 315 CE, stands in Rome and commemorates Roman Emperor Constantine’s victory over the Roman tyrant Maxentius on 28th October 312 CE at the battle of Milvian Bridge in Rome.

Located a short walk west of the Colosseum, this well-preserved monumental arch was erected (sometime soon after 315) to commemorate the victory of Constantine, the first Christian emperor, over his rival Maxentius at the Battle of the Milvian Bridge in 312. In general design, the Arch of Constantine imitates the century-earlier Arch of Septimius Severus (nearby in the Forum) - the quality of its sculptural decoration, however, betrays the slow degradation that Classical Roman sculpture had experienced in the 3rd century AD. Free to view.
A huge arch just outside the Colosseum, from where you can get great views of it too.
This was undergoing restoration when we were there, but definitely worth seeing. It's right next to the Colosseum and shouldn't be overlooked.

attractions.name: Castel Sant'Angelo
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Italy, Lazio, Rome, Castel Sant'Angelo
reviews: Very beautiful to walk around here, the location on the river is very pretty. The structure is imposing and there are always some expositions inside to visit, it can get very crowded
It’s a must see place!
it's an incredible experience to visit the Castle Sant'Angelo

One of Rome's iconic monument.  It's not on most tourists sites to visit but it's really a site to see.  It's a historic place so try to visit the museum inside if time permits.  There is a scheduled guided tour of the passageways inside.

This was my favourite tourist attraction in Rome. Very close to the Vatican with superb views of St. Peter's Basilica.The entrance fee is €7 for EU citizens between 18-25 and €14 for everyone else.There is a free audioguide provided in the form of an app with Bluetooth way points that activate when you walk into the correct room. It works exceptionally well.There is a coffee shop with amazing views of St. Peter's Basilica and a rooftop terrace with a view over the entire city. I really recommend coming in the evening to see the city and monuments lit up.

attractions.name: The Mouth of Truth
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Italy, Lazio, Rome, The Mouth of Truth
attractions.address: Piazza della Bocca della Verità, 18, 00186 Rome RM
reviews: The Piazza della bocca della Verità contains the Temples of Ercole and Temple of Portunus. The legend of Bocca della Verità (Mouth of Truth) says that if you place your hand in the mouth and have lies on your conscience, the mouth will bite your hand. You arrive to Bocca della verità in 10 minutes by walk.
Every sunday night you can assist at the celebration with chants and procession of the oriental rite and also admire the beautiful mosaics.

Do not miss a visit to the Basilica of Our Lady in Trastevere. This Basilica is one of the oldest Churches of Rome. The basic floor plan and wall structure of the church dates back to the 340s. After the visit, do not look at your map and just get lost in the nice small cobblestone streets of Trastevere. You will find plenty of bars & restaurants where to relax and have a good time.

The basilica is located in Trastevere.  It was founded in 3rd century and is one of the oldest churches in Rome.  The interiors are impressive and features 13th century mosaics, impressive altar pieces and a beautiful golden mosaic on its apse.
You may miss this for it''s too small

attractions.name: Mabul Island
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Malaysia, Sabah, Bahagian Tawau, Semporna, Mabul Island
reviews: Mabul is a small island off the south-eastern coast of Sabah in Malaysia. The island has been a fishing village since the 1970s. In the 1990s, it first became popular to divers due to its proximity to Sipadan island.
from kl direct flight to tawau . then from tawau can take a bus to semporna, from semporna take a boat or to the island
Best place to stay for your diving trip to Sipadan Island. Plenty of hotel choices from homestays, inns, beachfront hotels, water bungalows and chalets.

Mabul Island (Mabul Island) is about 45 minutes away from the town of Senbona, not a pure tourist island about 2,000 people, and some Bahu people, the island has a base of the Mabu Island, about 15 minutes away from the famous dive resort Shibadan. It's the nearest island to Shibadan.

This Senbona's Mabu Island is really great. His beach and his tax is really great and well worth going. Their big boats are very safe, one can sit fifty or sixty people on the boat. Wow, people everywhere can see it. It's not the star grade in the house. It's the local kids. They don't have that race. They sell all kinds of seafood every day there. They can buy it and eat it.

attractions.name: Tun Sakaran Marine Park
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Malaysia, Sabah, Bahagian Tawau, Semporna, Tun Sakaran Marine Park
reviews: Tun Sakaran Marine Park is a 35,000 ha archipelago located at the entrance of Darvel Bay, off Semporna and is a unique blend of nature and beauty of the island.
A must visit destinations in Malaysia. The beautiful island of Tun Sakaran Marine  is speechless.

The Tun Sakaran Marine Park is perhaps one of the most underrated diving destinations in Sabah. It doesn't get as much attention as Sipadan, but it is equally stunning underwater. The marine park consists of eight islands and while you are there, you should definitely go hiking in Boheydulang. The 600-metre trail takes about 40 minutes. It is a bit of a challenge when it gets steep, but trust me the view from the top is absolutely worth a million dollars.

A paradise for diving lovers, a utopia for ocean addicts
    There is such a place in Malaysia, she is far away from the crowd, with beautiful sky, ocean, beach blue sky, clear sea like the sky. This is Semporna, originally just a small fishing village, later developed into a well-known tourist city and a paradise for diving enthusiasts. This is a place that many people yearn for in their dreams, and it is also a fairyland that has been on fire on various online video apps. Semporna literally means perfect in Malay. When you reach Semporna, you will find that this small island is worthy of the name. It is perfect, because there are the most beautiful sky and clouds, making people confused whether it is in the world or in the sky. There are mainly four charming islands in the surrounding area, namely Mabu Island, Kappa Rai Island, Mabul Island and Bang Bang Island. These small islands are all surrounded by sea water, just like a dream island in the real world. There are the most beautiful fairy tales, the most innocent children. There is no noisy car whistle, no hustle and bustle of people, and inner peace, where you can hear the sound of the sea.
    The seawater resources here are very well protected, the visibility of the seawater is very high, there are many corals and they are well protected. This is not only an ideal place for beginner divers and intermediate divers to enjoy the fun of deep-sea diving, but also a good place to satisfy underwater photographers. If you have friends who like to shoot VOLG, you must choose here. There is a vertical diving shrine with a depth of 100 meters on the west coast of Madang Island. Beautiful corals of various shapes are one of the characteristics of Madajon Island. It is also a paradise for many manatee animals and fishes.
    There is a must-visit island in Dunsakaran Marine Park called Pearl Island, surrounded by a large area of corals and slopes on the outside of the island. It is a very good place to see the panoramic view and photography of Dunsakalang. All of his photographs are from here. But you have to climb up from the bottom of the mountain by yourself. The mountain road is rugged and there is no real road. It takes about forty minutes to climb up with both hands and feet. However, you will find it all worthwhile to reach the summit with a 360-degree unobstructed view of the entire sea. .
Excellent, the water quality is very good, and the tour guide is also very good

attractions.name: The Robert Wan Pearl Museum
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, French Polynesia, Windward Islands, Tahiti, The Robert Wan Pearl Museum
reviews: Very nice pieces of art and beautiful place

4 reasons to come to Robert WAN Pearl Museum:
1. The only black pearl museum in the world. After enjoying the natural beauty of the outer islands, before returning to the main island to board an international flight, learn about Tahiti black pearls and expand their knowledge. This is also a discussion resource after returning to China;
2. Black pearls are a specialty of Tahiti. But to be honest, pearls are a bit like jade. Those who don’t know how to do it may look the same. If you don’t put them together, you may not see much difference. So if you want to buy jewelry, it’s better to know about it. Spent money for nothing~
3. The museum was funded and built by the famous Chinese Wen Huiren, also named Robert WAN. It has chain stores in Hong Kong, Shanghai and Dubai. The brand is guaranteed and the after-sales service is guaranteed. It is hard to come here. If you want to buy it, you will naturally buy the best.
4. There are Chinese explanations, Chinese shopping guides, and Chinese tax refund guides. You can call to make an appointment to pick up the car. If you shop, you can also send it back to the hotel for free.

The Robert Wan Pearl Museum mainly displays Tahiti's specialties, precious black pearls. Various crafts made of black pearls are very exquisite here. At the same time, the collection process of pearls and the identification standards of pearl size are also exhibited. The price is about 30[%] cheaper than a domestic treasure.

The Robert Wan Pearl Museum is very worth coming. It is really beautiful. It was founded by French Chinese. Here you can see the development process of pearl cultivation. It displays many beautiful pearls. It is definitely worth coming. .

Let me talk about transportation first. It is very convenient to get to the Robert Wynn Pearl Museum. They provide free pick-up. Call to make an appointment. They can pick up from the hotel. If you spend there, you will be sent back to the hotel for free. If you are already in Papeete It is more convenient to walk to the city center. It provides services in Chinese. If you want to know, you will give a detailed explanation. Needless to say, the quality of pearls is good, mainly because you believe in this brand. It's an eye-opener to see the world's largest round black pearl. The dazzling array of jewels there will make you want to take home.

attractions.name: Museum of Tahiti and Her Islands
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, French Polynesia, Windward Islands, Tahiti, Museum of Tahiti and Her Islands
attractions.address: PK15, Pointe des pêcheurs ' Nu'uroa, PUNAAUIA, 98718 Tamanu
reviews: The scenery is pleasant and the water is clear, which is very nice!
The museum in this archipelago is worth visiting, and it has benefited a lot!
I had the opportunity to come to a museum in Tahiti and see such a magical display of trees, which really opened my eyes.

The most beautiful museum in the South Pacific, showing the environment and history of the Lagoon. It also introduced the history, religion, culture, nature and folklore of Polynesia before the explorers and missionaries arrived. Highlights of the exhibits include rare collections of paintings and calligraphy, sculptures, ancient canoes and historical artifacts

Those who want to learn about the history and traditional crafts of Tahiti can visit the museum. It is recommended to avoid Monday because it is closed to the public. There are many stone statues, many pictures and some handicrafts, and some replicas of cultural relics left over from the past. Almost an hour or two is enough to visit here.

attractions.name: Friday Beach
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Philippines, Western Visayas, Malay, Boracay, Friday Beach
reviews: lovely place
Friday beach is the best place to see the island

I went there on my honeymoon. Friday Beach, s1, s2, and s3 are better. I really enjoy the days when I go to bed and walk on the beach every day and dmall eat gourmet smoothies. The FRIDAY logo is not conspicuous. Looking for a long time
Friday beach section is the most visited area

The beaches of Boracay are vast, with fine sand, and have the finest beaches in the world. Of course, it is really sunny when visiting during the day. It is recommended to watch the most beautiful sunset in the evening.

To say that Boracay has the finest, softest, whitest, and most beautiful beaches, it is Friday Beach. It is located at the end of the S1 area of White Beach and is named after the "Friday Hotel" located there. The locals call it "Powder Sand". When the fine white sand is hidden in the transparent and clear water, it forms a milky powder. Swimming and playing on the shore are like walking on the cow's milk lake, and come to the beach to pile sand. , Dui Castle can use your artistic imagination or you can lie down under the coconut grove beach, enjoy the sea and sky, blue sea and blue sky, or stroll on the beautiful and tranquil white sand beach and watch the sunset, which is beautiful.

How to get there: Friday Beach is not far to the west of Willy’s Key, and it is connected to the white sand beach. If you have good physical strength, you are advised to walk west from the white sand beach, passing Friday Beach, and then to the west is Dingweed Beach , And further west is the West Bay Hotel.

Recommended item: sailboat. You can go out to sea at any time, but it is most recommended at sunset. The afterglow of the setting sun dyes the entire sea red, and rides on a swaying sailboat to let the sea breeze slowly blow. You can wash away the fatigue of the whole day with just one trip.

attractions.name: Puka Shell Beach
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Philippines, Western Visayas, Malay, Boracay, Puka Shell Beach
reviews: love the place is really easy to go, we just had to take a mototaxi that is not more expensive than 100 pesos, the water is fantastic and the sunset make you feel in another world.

very beatiful place clear water with some corals breakdown in the side of the beach beatiful view and can also buy some souvenir like bag made by true dried frogs and bracelet wind chime made of corals its a beatiful place to go check it out
PUKA SHELL BEACH.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED. this place is heaven. the sand the water....everything..
amazing people matches awesome beach with its clear water and fine white sand! It was a perfect stay❤️❤️❤️
It is a pristine white sand part of boracay where i enjoy much my stay. I feel relax and feels the vitamin sea. Beautiful place to visit again.

attractions.name: Boracay's D'Mall
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Philippines, Western Visayas, Malay, Boracay, Boracay's D'Mall
attractions.address: D'Mall, D'Mall de Boracay, Boracay Island, Malay, 5608, Aklan
reviews: D'Mall is quite quaint. It is full of restruants, cafes, fruit stands, a pharmacy, and souvenir shops. It also has some high quality shops like The Body Shop. It's a nice place to go if you need anything!
There are a lot of things in the commercial street. You can eat, drink and have fun.
The shopping center is big, and everything is quite complete.

D'Mall is the beach on one side and the main road of Boracay on the other. It is close to the port of the main road and is the largest supermarket in Boracay. It is recommended that you buy large bottles of drinking water here. Then here is also the best place to buy souvenirs such as dried mango and shell products before leaving Boracay. There are a whole world of tastes from Greek, Japanese, Korean, barbecue, etc. nearby, making life very convenient.

Dmall is a commercial shopping center in Boracay, Philippines, and the most visited area, located in the S2 beach area. Dmall is a commercial center integrating dining, entertainment and shopping. Dmall runs through the beaches of Boracay Island and the main road of Boracay. The entrance of the beach area is located at S2 Beach, and the entrance will also be marked; the entrance of the main road of Boracay has 2 There are two intersections, one front entrance and one side entrance. The main entrance on the main road of Dmall is not very big, and it is not very obvious. There is a supermarket next to the main entrance. Just look for the supermarket. The shops at the entrance mainly sell some souvenirs or water supplies. There is a Dmall avenue in Dmall. This avenue is only 50 meters long. There are small shops on both sides. There are also a lot of chairs for tourists to rest on the avenue. The representative plants of tropical regions are planted in the middle. Palm tree. The number of DMALL tourists at night is much smaller. Walking on the streets of DML, you can vaguely feel the faint sea breeze. With this peaceful environment, the mind and body will feel very relaxed. If you want to buy some souvenirs from Boracay, Philippines, it is recommended to visit DMALL at night. Many shops can bargain.

attractions.name: Mount Luho
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Philippines, Western Visayas, Malay, Boracay, Mount Luho
attractions.address: Near Bolabog Beach, Malay, Aklan Province, Philippines
reviews: beatiful view from the top u can see beach and islands very amazing wind u can feel and u can see a heartshape display where is also good to take pictures with,and there was a eyeglasses wearing scorpion display in the area so funny and cute at the same time must recommend place to have a visit

Mount Lou is located in the northern part of Boracay Island and is the commanding height of Boracay Island. Here you can almost see the panoramic view of Boracay Island, very beautiful. We went on an off-road vehicle, and the scenery on the top of the mountain was pretty good.

The height of Mount Luho is only 100 meters, but it is the highest altitude in the area. There is a viewing platform on the top of the mountain, overlooking the dumbbell-shaped Boracay. The driver said the round-trip price and asked him to wait at the bottom of the mountain for your return journey, and come to overlook the panoramic view of Boracay. Special reminder: pay attention to dressing, the wind on the top of the mountain is not normal. .

Tickets are 120p, if the hotel is on the beach, you can take a tuk-tuk to go back and forth within 300p, go karts on the mountain, and 3D painting exhibition. Climbing to the top of the mountain is very nice

We drove up the mountain in a kart, the mountain road is very narrow, so we must drive carefully; there is a viewing platform on the top of the mountain, you can overlook the whole view of Boracay, the view is wide, the heart is refreshing, the blue sea is unparalleled, absolutely A great place to take beautiful photos, don't miss it when you go to Long Beach.

attractions.name: Diniwid Beach
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Philippines, Western Visayas, Malay, Boracay, Diniwid Beach
reviews: The beach is so beautiful, the sky is blue, and there are many people on the beach. It's very suitable for holidays. Many people bring children to play here.
Love how this beach is separate from White beach. It's a lot quieter.  It's just a little bit messier, messier as in there's more seaweed and shells on the shore; no litter.

This beach is a bit quieter and more peaceful than nearby White Beach. Love that in Boracay you can hangout at any stretch of the beach and the resorts don't confine you to their section of the beachfront. Boracay is beautiful!
A relatively short beach but quiet and filled with affordable resorts, you get to enjoy cliff views too! Great location for just tanning over lounges during the day.

Widder Beach is located in the northwest of Boracay. To go to Nami Hotel and West Bay Hotel, you need to pass through this restaurant and walk along the path along the coastline. Looking back at the beach of S1 in this restaurant. On the high-quality beach, there is emerald-like gentle water, clear and agile. The water depth here is very shallow, you can go into the water far away without submerging your chest. This cave is a shortcut to the Nami Hotel, passing through here is Dingweed Beach. Not far away is the Nami Hotel, which is built on a cliff. The beaches and seas here are very good, and the crab boats are docked, as if they are suspended in the water... This beach and sea in the northwest of Boracay, and Bohol Island The same is the most beautiful beach I have ever seen.

attractions.name: Bat Caves
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Philippines, Western Visayas, Malay, Boracay, Bat Caves
attractions.address: East of Yapak, Malay, Aklan Province 5608, Philippines
reviews: I wouldn't go out of my way for bats but the area of the caves is near the best and most secluded beach on the island , (Iligigan) for this reason you need to go . but tricycles may not make it the entire way so be prepared with comfy shoes

This is a very interesting tourist attraction and it is definitely worth taking a risk in your life. . . . It is full of adrenaline impulse, I really like the rich flora and fauna in this cave. It's great to see the bat sleeping upside down. It really enriches my knowledge here. During your arduous journey to the island, you will clearly see hundreds of bats hanging up and down on the trees beside the cave. This is a cool scene. The water here is very good. We are snorkeling nearby. There is no doubt that it is worth seeing here.

The bat cave is not far from Puka Beach. There are various cave bats, flying foxes, fruit bats, etc. in the cave. If you aspire to be a naturalist or cave explorer, you can hire a local guide to take you through jungle trails to find these caves. At sunset, groups of bats fly out of the cave to hunt for food. The scene can be said to be quite spectacular. But if you want to go to the bat cave to find out, you need to endure the strong smell in the cave. To get to the bat cave, you need to cross the jungle path and climb down the steep wall. Usually tourists will hire a local guide who knows the structure of the cave very well and it will be easier to follow along. Go down to the bottom of the cave and continue to go deep, and you will find dense bats hanging on the cave wall above your head. Because the light in the cave is dark, you need to use a flashlight to see the bats clearly

The bat cave is also a natural cave with a very dangerous environment. The deep location here is also very important. The number of bats is very large, and the temperature inside is quite similar. There are also many tourists visiting here.

There are more than 2.5 million bats living in this scenic spot. Every night at 6:30 in the evening, they fly out in groups to find food. The scene is very dark and crushed. The main food of these bats is fruit. The reason why the durian output of Dabao is so good. More than half is due to the spread of pollination by these bats, so locals say that without bats, there would be no durian.

attractions.name: Arima Onsen
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Hyogo, Kobe, Arima Onsen
attractions.address: Arimacho, Kita-ku, Kobe City, Hyogo Prefecture
reviews: Love this place. This is my second trip here and I try to make it an annual trip. The whole area is simply so relaxing and beautiful. Try their gold onsen, it's good for your skin. You can see many local Japanese old aunties travel all the way here every week for skinbeauty treatment through soaking themselves in the onsen. It's known that during the olden days, only the emperor or the royal family members can enjoy the gold onsen.

I spent one night in this area. there are plenty of onsen hotel and resort to stay. I love the environment and private onsen service in some of the hotels in here so if you like Japanese onsen I recommend you the hotel is in this area.

In the public bath of Arima Onsen, there are "golden soup (gold spring)" and "golden soup (gold spring)". If you use the one-day package of Arako, you can choose one of them. The price of the public bath itself is not expensive, the price of the gold soup is 650 baht, the silver soup is 550 baht, and the two museums common coupon is 850 baht, the three museums (plus the Taihe Tangdian Hall) common coupon is 1000 baht, there are occasional discounts on some special days, you can go to the website to pay attention to the relevant information, If you don't want to spend money just to experience the hot springs, there is free soup next to the soup can be used!

Arima Onsen is located in the mountainous area of the heart of Kobe, it is one of the famous hot springs in Japan since ancient times. As a multi-geothermal activity island country, Japanese hot springs are natural water quality, which can be a famous spring has certain characteristics, for example, Arima here is rich in mineral substances in the water. Around the gold spring, silver spring hotel concentration area.

Stay here for one night, and there is a dedicated bus from Sannomiya Station to Arima Onsen Station. In addition, a 2-minute walk from Arima Onsen Station is an express bus to Osaka. You can't take pictures in the hot spring bath, the experience is very good. The golden soup is rich in iron and the silver soup is clear. The Guquan Pavilion where I live has its own two baths. During the stay, there are unlimited bathing and there are few people, almost private. The Japanese-style room includes kaiseki dinner and breakfast, RMB 2,100 per night for two. Very cost-effective, Ctrip can be ordered.

attractions.name: Port of Kobe
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Hyogo, Kobe, Port of Kobe
reviews: Kobe port was one of the most important industrial and commercial ports in Japan, and it was a foreign country in the Meiji period. The Port Tower, the Ocean Museum and the Mosaic Ferris Wheel are the landmarks of the Port.

Kobe port was one of the most important industrial and commercial ports in Japan, and it was a foreign country in the Meiji period. The Port Tower, the Ocean Museum and the Mosaic Ferris Wheel are the landmarks of the Port.
The night is beautiful, five years before it is estimated to go out again, the epidemic has changed the world.
Well worth a visit, a place famous for Kobe and would go again.

After taking the PORT LINER line full of surprises in the evening, there are still surprises in the Kobe Port at night! After taking the subway to HARBORLAND Station, it takes about 20 minutes to walk to Kobe Port. Looking back afterwards, walking from Mina To Motomachi will be closer. On the way there is a super-large OUTLET that forgot its name. Interested friends can go shopping. When you enter the Kobe Port area, the first thing you see is PORT TOWER. The tower under the curtain of night, under the radiance of the lights, presents the noble tones of red and gold. If you are a photography enthusiast, this is definitely a good place to fight monsters and level up. The mosaic square on the opposite side of PORT TOWER is also brightly lit, and it seems to be competing with the red-gold port tower in brilliant colors. Generally speaking, I feel that it is the best time to visit Kobe Port after nightfall, especially Port Tower. The noble and mysterious characteristics shown by the light at night should not be observed in the morning.

attractions.name: Kobe Kitano ijinkangai
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Hyogo, Kobe, Kobe Kitano ijinkangai
attractions.address: Yamamotodori, Chuo Ward, Kobe, Hyōgo Prefecture
reviews: I love Kitano area. It's so nice and artzy to wak around. The East meets West old building made me spent almost the whole day exploring this area. I've found some wonderful café and restaurant for my meal too. It's an unforgettable sweet memory for me.

Here is suitable for hanging around, very exotic flavor, different mood different feelings ～ path to see a group of over half a century old grandmother in the collective painting building, this is not a different scenery line.

Kitano Ijinkan Street in Kobe is actually an old European-style house. It is now open to attractions similar to museums or old residences. Let’s go to the Fengjian Chicken House first, just in time for the renovation. The smell of paint is not much. Stay. Later, I went to the Menghuang Pavilion, which is slightly larger than the Fengjian Chicken Pavilion and looks more beautiful. In order to protect the cultural relics, you need to change your shoes to visit. The inside is very clean. There is also a place to strike a chapter, as a souvenir.

Kitano Ijinkan, a European-style building concentration area in Kobe area. It takes about 20 minutes to walk from Sannomiya subway station, all the way up the slope. Except for Kobe Tower and Kobe Port, all the attractions in downtown Kobe are concentrated in Kitano Ijinkan. There are Japan’s first Starbucks, Moehuang Museum, Kazemiji, and Kitano Tenmangu Shrine, where you pray for school. There are few tourists along the way, you can walk slowly and take pictures of scenery and photos. Or simply find a coffee shop for afternoon tea. There are many time-honored desserts here. Don’t miss frantz’s strawberry truffles and pudding, as well as Rokko Ranch’s ice cream and doughnuts. Kobe limited royce pudding and Kobe local yellow pudding, each one is delicious. You can start from Starbucks all the way to the Menghuang Museum. Then to Fengjianji and Kitano Tenmangu Shrine. It takes about 2 hours to walk down the whole journey. The Kitano Tenmangu Shrine is free to visit. The Menghuangzhikan and Kazejianji can be visited inside, and the ticket prices are not high.

Kobe Kitano Ijinkan Street ~ From Sannomiya, Japan, through Kitanozaka, walk north, and you can reach Ijinkan Street in 10-15 minutes. If you start from Shin-Kobe Station, Kitano Yuki Trail is the best route.　"Kitano Ijinkan". Because Kobe was a place where foreigners lived during the opening of the Meiji era, a large number of 19th-century Western-style buildings have been left behind. They are collectively called "Ijinkan". The most famous among them are "Kaimijikan" and "Moehuangzhikan": the rich European-style "Kaimijikan" is named after the "Kaimiji" standing on a triangular roof. It stands in Japanese tradition. In the tones, the graceful carvings and architectural curves are more prominent.

attractions.name: Mount Rokko
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Hyogo, Kobe, Mount Rokko
attractions.address: Motoyamachomori, Higashinada Ward, Kobe City, Hyogo Prefecture
reviews: Mt. Rokko stands 931 meters above sea level, and is one of the most popular places for outdoor activities in all of Kansai. It's one of the few mountains in the world that has over 100 hiking courses, so of course, many people travel from all over to hike there. Paths are all clearly marked with signs (in Japanese only, but some have photos to help you out) and you can choose from a variety of shorter or very long hikes great for all different fitness levels.

The highest peak is Mt. Maya, and the Rokko mountains surround Kobe city. The mountain has built various viewing platforms and sightseeing resorts, including the Liujia Mountain Ranch, which has close contact with small animals, the vibrant cloth garden and the Music Box Museum are all great for family trips. Among them, the viewing of the whole city from the comet terrace on Mt. Maya is considered the best viewing point of Kobe night. In addition, the cable car from Mt. Rokko to Arima is one of the main transportation modes to the Arima area. If you choose to visit Mt. rokko and then go to the horse route, it is necessary to purchase a ticket for the rokko mountain.

Mount Rokko is a mountain block located in the Totan District and Kita District of Kobe City, Hyogo Prefecture. The elevation is 931.25 meters. The mountain is designated as the Seto Inland Sea National Park, one of Japan’s 300 famous mountains and one of the 50 mountains in Hyogo

Finally arrived in Arima, first go to the hotel to put down the luggage, and then continue up from our hotel, about 20 minutes to walk to the cable car station, because we bought the Malacca Free Pass, so we can take the cable car for free, of course , Who is okay to run up and down. . . In fact, there is a Mount Mayer next to it which is also very good, but unfortunately we don't have so much time. With the pass, we got on the cable car. There was time for every trip. There was a cable car staff who carefully checked the cable car’s safety, locked the door, bowed, and explained the time required for the whole cable car (20 minutes) ), the time of the last cable car was about 9:30 pm, and then steadily drove out of the cable car station. Our time was just right to see the sunset of Mount Rokko. It was so beautiful! There are some buses on the mountain. We didn't study it much. They should travel between Arimakou, Rokko and Maya Mountain. There are a lot of vegetation on the top of Rokko Mountain, most of which we have not seen before. Apart from the familiar hydrangea on the roadside, there is also this little purple-blue flower. It is very beautiful, like a little elf, hidden in A piece of green ocean, and later I saw the diagram of the cable car station, only to realize that this flower is called Pine Cordyceps, a humble little guy~! The top of Rokko Mountain is the best place to view the night view of Kobe Port. The night view seen here is called the "Night View of 10 Million Dollars". Here is a warm reminder: the top of Rokko Mountain is a bit cold, friends who mind to come to see the night view can bring a long-sleeved jacket.
The mountain is not high, it is a very famous Kansai area. There are also accommodations above, you can see the scenery.

attractions.name: Chinatown (Nankinmachi)
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Hyogo, Kobe, Chinatown (Nankinmachi)
attractions.address: 1 Chome-3-18 Sakaemachidori, Chuo Ward, Kobe, Hyōgo Prefecture
reviews: Lots of food.. The famous award winning Japanese milk pudding is just right at the entrance of China Town Kobe.. smooth, creamy and there's a layer of brown sugar syrup at the bottom. I personally prefer it without the brown sugar syrup. Frankly speaking, the Isuzu bakery award winning mini cream bun with burned orange slice caramelize topping is cheaper and taste much better than this pudding in China Town.

Chinatown can be used as a separate attraction in many countries, and its name is different in different countries. Chinatown in Singapore is called Chinatown, and Chinatown in Kobe is directly called Chinatown.

Chinatown in Motomachi, the center of Kobe, can be regarded as one of the most lively attractions in Kobe. It is close to the center of Sannomiya and is also a key channel linking Kobe Port. The dazzling merchants are selling Kobe beef as the main snack. But the milk tea is still the best. The milk has a strong taste

Kobe's Chinatown is a compact place with several blocks. Those blocks were madly busy. There are shops selling all kinds of cheap goods, restaurants and street food, enough to satisfy all tastes-as long as your taste is Chinese. Noisy, colorful, and crowded.

The Chinatown in Kobe is a good place for those with tight budgets and wanting to eat cheaper in Kobe. Most of the street food in Kobe is found near Sannomiya Station, but it is very clean, like other parts of Japan.

attractions.name: Akashi Kaikyō Bridge
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Hyogo, Kobe, Akashi Kaikyō Bridge
reviews: Longest Suspension Bridge SpanLength: 6,532 ft.Before this steel behemoth bridged the Akashi Strait that separates Kobe from Iwaya, severe storms in the area would routinely sink ferries. Not that the world’s longest suspension bridge has it any easier: every day, 23,000 cars pass over a structure that must withstand earthquakes (a 7.2 magnitude earthquake hit in 1995), consistently strong tidal currents (9 knots), and wind gusts up to 179 mph. Completed in 1998, the record-setting central span 213 feet above the sea makes up over half its total 12,831-foot length; by comparison, the Golden Gate’s central span is only 4,200 feet. For an up-close-and-personal (and gut-dropping) view, bridge tours take visitors to the top of one of the towers.
Akashi Strait Bridge is a bridge of 3, 911m across the Akashi Strait between Honshu and Shikoku, Japan, and Kobe and Awaji Island, Japan.
Akashi Strait Bridge is a cross-sea bridge connecting Honshu Island and Shikoku in Kobe, Hyogo Prefecture. The bridge is powerful and well-shaped. Our group drove by, very spectacular, (●●)
Very good, very loaded and wide, probably the longest sea bridge in Japan, you can see it
Akashi Kaikyo Bridge is a cross-sea bridge connecting Honshu Island and Shikoku, in Kobe City, Hyogo Prefecture. The bridge is majestic and well-shaped. Our party passed by by car, very spectacular

attractions.name: Kobe Port Tower
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Hyogo, Kobe, Kobe Port Tower
reviews: Breezing chili nice weather. Beautiful clear blue sky, some elderly people on wheelchair planting colorful flowers, it's a wonderful experience for me.
すごかった

Kobe Port Tower is a tall observation deck sitting along the city's coastline. At night it lights up different colors and is an iconic part of the Kobe skyline. Visitors can go inside and go up the tower for a small fee. At the top you'll find various observation decks, and a glass panel that you can stand on and look straight down to the street! There is also a rotating restaurant at the top which is a great place to grab drinks and watch the sunset.
It’s about 10 usd to ride to the top. I don’t believe it’s worth the price.
Kobe Tower is the first tower in the world built in tubes. Its unique architecture is not only in Japan, but also unique in the world, and has won many awards for architecture.

attractions.name: Sannomiya Center Gai Shopping Street
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Hyogo, Kobe, Sannomiya Center Gai Shopping Street
reviews: Best Kobe beef pate and steak is being serve at the restaurant here with reasonable pricing. Need not need to travel all the way to Kobe town. On top of that, one can walk around after food. Very interesting international crowd. Plenty of food and snacks choices for your exploration. There are even cowboy night clubs for the lonely women who are curious about Japanese young cowboys entertainment outlets, but no hanky panky, only drinking and chit chatting

Sannomiya Motomachi is similar to Beijing Wangfujing Shanghai Nanjing Road. How can it be regarded as the commercial hub of the entire Kobe area? There are all kinds of small alleys hidden in various streets where you can buy small commodities and the positioning is also different. Very popular with everyone, especially young people, many local brands are not expensive, and there are often promotions

Motomachi is one of the busiest commercial streets in Kobe, only 10 minutes away from the bustling Sannomiya area. Since the opening of Kobe in the Meiji era, Motomachi has been a particularly European-style business district. You can see a lot of Western-style buildings here and deeply feel the charm of exotic customs. Motomachi’s shops are mainly based on trendy brands and style restaurants. Fashionable petty bourgeois cafes, exotic shops and high-end luxury brand shops can be found everywhere. When shopping in Motomachi, I believe you will have a very fulfilling and beautiful life. Motomachi represents the forefront trend of Kobe, so don’t miss it. In addition, the Chinese street "Nanjing Town", which is famous for Chinese cuisine, is also near Motomachi. If you want to taste the taste of your hometown, you might as well go to Nanjing Town for a walk.

A shopping street similar to Shinkyogoku, with a ceiling on it, you can walk around slowly, and there is a Chinatown nearby where you can eat. There are many drugstores in it, but it is recommended to shop around, the price difference is not small, there is a small supermarket, The same snacks inside are one third cheaper than convenience stores, but cash only

The area from Sannomiya to Motomachi is the center of Kobe. Strolling in Sannomiya Center Street and Motomachi Shopping Street, you can fully enjoy the fun of food and shopping. To the south from Sannomiya, on the west side of Flower Street is the old settlement. It was the place where foreign merchants lived when the Port of Kobe was first opened to the outside world. There are many nostalgic old-fashioned western buildings, imported goods stores, cafes, etc. It is a good place for shopping and walking.

attractions.name: Former Thomas's House
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Hyogo, Kobe, Former Thomas's House
reviews: The reason for its name is that the tower has a metal Fengjian, which moves along the wind. The building was built in 1909, the earliest of which was a German businessman's residence. The Fengjian is more luxurious and more European aristocratic than the small, fresh MOE Huang Pavilion.

When you arrive in Kobe, you will definitely arrange the itinerary to Kitano Ijinkan, so Kazamijikan is one of the main sights to visit. Ijin is actually the name given to foreigners by the Japanese at the time, that is, people who look different. meaning. Therefore, the architectural style is Western-style architecture. Because Kobe is a port opened to the outside world, there are more foreigners, and many Western-style cultures and buildings are left behind. There is a big iron rooster on the roof of the house for observation. The wind direction and wind speed are used, so it is named Fengjian Chicken Restaurant. I especially like the glass window balcony inside, which is very beautiful and tasteful. It’s more cost-effective to buy a joint ticket for Fengjianjikan and Moehuangzhikan. It’s a loss if you don’t even go in... Buy a ticket for a day trip on a bus to enjoy the sights of Kobe. Yes, basically every scenic spot has a station to arrive, and there is a special bus route map for your reference.
Kobe Fumi Cock House used to be the U.S. Embassy in Japan
The name is very special, Kobe is still a nice place, European culture, very stylish
The name is very funny, ok, you can go and see, it is good.

attractions.name: The Langkawi Sky Bridge
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Malaysia, Kedah, Langkawi, The Langkawi Sky Bridge
attractions.open_status: The opening time is basically 9:30-19:00. Please check the official website for the specific time.
reviews: Langkawi Sky Bridge is a 125-metre curved pedestrian cable-stayed bridge in Malaysia, completed in 2005.The bridge deck is 660 metres above sea level at the peak of Gunung Mat Cincang on Pulau Langkawi, the main island of the Langkawi archipelago in Kedah. Price start around RM 40 for a package 3 in 1 if not mistaken.
SkyBridgeThe Longest Free Span and Curved Bridge In The World World's Most Spectacular Pedestrian BridgesMust experience activity, it's long 410ft and completed on 2005.

visited this place in August 2019. Very beautiful landscape around. You can enjoy the ride on the cable car and walk on the sky bridge. Family with small kids can use skyglide to reach the bridge easily. Others can do little hiking for fun if they want. Must see place in Langkawi.

This was my first experience on a sky bridge and did not disappoint. Breath taking view form. the sky bridge. Took some very nice pictures. We enjoyed the sky bridge very much. They even have places to eat and rest. This is a full day’s activity.
National park on the northern side of Langkawi, Prepare for a lot of walking but worth every minute wandering inside the reserve.

attractions.name: Cenang Beach
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Malaysia, Kedah, Langkawi, Cenang Beach
reviews: Cenang Beach is a 2KM long unremarkable stretch of beach surrounded by restaurants and shopping. Popular spot for tourists.

Pantai Cenang is the busiest beach town on Langkawi Island, where you can find a diverse mix of cafes and restaurants, as well as souvenir shops, and duty-free outlets along its picturesque beach strip.
One of the most beautiful beaches in langkawi, full with all kinds of entertainment and activities like jet sking, banana boat, parasailing and other beach activities. A must visit place!
Cenang is Langkawi’s most popular area with a gorgeous beach. Cenang Beach is the best place for sunbathing and exciting water sports such as jet skiing and parasailing. ♥ tis place very much!!!

attractions.name: Eagle Square
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Malaysia, Kedah, Langkawi, Eagle Square
reviews: Dataran Lang, or Eagle Square in English, is a square on Langkawi near the port where ferries sail in and out. It is the first sight visitors to this Malaysian island will see when they arrive by boat.
Popular photo spot featuring a huge eagle statue perched over a scenic waterfront plaza.
Really beautiful place.  The statue is huge and really great to take photos of.  Nice shopping Centre close by with many places to eat and drink.
I like the scent of the in front of the Eagle Square and the scenery is ideal. the blue sky makes it even more dramatic.

you will regret if you didn't go this place... this is the main symbol for Langkawi. the place were clean and lot of people like to visit here just to capture they precious memory..just exactly like i did...

attractions.name: Payar Island
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Malaysia, Kedah, Langkawi, Payar Island
reviews: Payar Island is an island in Kedah, Malaysia. Payar Island status as a marine park offers protection for its diverse marine life. Payar Island is also a snorkelling and diving site famous for its corals.
Payar Island is an island in Kedah, Malaysia. Payar Island status as a marine park offers protection for its diverse marine life.

【Scenery】Paya Island, as a Langkawi diving park, the scenery nearby is still good, not as good as Semporna. [Fun] Paia Island is suitable for traveling with children. It is relatively simple to travel here. The locals are very nice. Diving feels OK, mainly because of the water quality. [Cost-effective] relatively high!

Paya Island is a beautiful island overseas in Langkawi. It is about an hour’s boat ride away from Langkawi. The sea around the island is very clear, with shallows and deep seas, and there are very good corals under the sea. Therefore, it is a sacred place for diving, and it is very worth visiting.

A small island dedicated to tourists for snorkeling. The island is surrounded by green vegetation, deep blue water and log bridges. The scenery is beautiful. Small fishes of various colors in the sea can gather as soon as they see the breadcrumbs. , And there are even small sharks. Some of the small fish have sharp teeth, so I was bitten. The water is very clear and especially suitable for snorkeling.

attractions.name: Black Sand Beach
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Malaysia, Kedah, Langkawi, Black Sand Beach
reviews: Black Sand Beach Langkawi, located four kilometres southwest of Tanjung Rhu Beach, offers memorable photo opportunities and a peaceful retreat from the island’s often crowded areas. A 20-minute drive from the Langkawi Cable Car, it’s a popular hangout spot among locals, especially during weekends and public holidays.Despite its name, the beach is actually a mix of black and white sand, which some locals believe to be the result of a centuries-old curse laid by a mermaid because a fisherman had stolen her ring. Others claim that it’s soil from the rice paddy fields that were burned by farmers back in 1821.
It's known as the Black Desert Island in the Lankawi Island, Kedah in history or the people's story.

It is about six kilometers away from Tanjung Rhu Beach, so you can visit it on the way, so there is no need to go there! It is called the black sand beach, naturally because the sand is black, but the black sand here is completely different from the black sand that can be seen on the beaches of Taiwan. The sand quality is relatively fine, only the surface of the sand is black. There is still golden sand underneath. The hinterland of the entire beach is not large (maybe at high tide), next to it is the fishing boat berth, not far from Tanjung Rhu Beach, but the beauty index is very different. To be honest, you can leave more time for Tanjung Rhu Beach!

Some beautiful scenery will be unforgettable if you only see it once in your life, and some places will feel a bit regretful if you don’t go there in person. Even so, the black beach of Vic is in my heart. This place will not be a walk-and-go tour. It takes a long time to plan, and the natural beauty will not disappoint you. Although as a young person, the current way of traveling generally chooses to travel freely, so as not to be uncomfortable with the group tour, or to receive time constraints, but I feel that it is better to travel with a group if you come here for the first time. Otherwise, it will take a long time to find the way, or it will be better to find acquaintances or friends in the local area to play with. Otherwise, even if you do enough strategy, you will be confused, especially if you have been living in Asia and don’t know the local situation. It is better to be cautious. It is generally more suitable for a group tour to take about 15 days. I personally feel that when I come to this place, I can learn about the situation through a tour guide and see some natural landscapes. The black sand beach is rarely seen in China, so the first time I saw it is beautiful, although it is black sand, it looks very clean and does not feel dirty, so it is very comfortable to play, watching the sea view here, I feel It is even more spectacular, and it makes people feel comfortable in an instant that makes people forget all their troubles. We have a good itinerary for the group tour this time, but I feel that the meal is still not delicious, and may not be suitable for the taste of local dishes, so I often go hungry at night or go back to the store to buy some snacks, so it is recommended to match the food Those who have taste requirements can suggest to bring some food to fill their stomachs when necessary, but this attraction is really worth visiting.

For the 2018 Malaysia New Year's Eve, the last stop is the black sand beach near Tanjung Lu Beach in Langkawi. It is sparsely populated and there are few commercial facilities, so it is not a popular check-in spot. On the contrary, many local children are playing happily. The black sand beach originated from the movement of the earth's crust hundreds of millions of years ago, which allowed countless creatures that had no time to escape into fossils under the ground, and gradually washed away and weathered into a black sand beach over time, forming today's unique landform!

attractions.name: Dayang Bunting Island
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Malaysia, Kedah, Langkawi, Dayang Bunting Island
reviews: Second-largest island in Langkawi archipelago, Dayang Bunting Island (Pulau Dayang Bunting) and its surrounding 99 small island within the lake.

The legend of Tasik Dayang Bunting goes like this: The favourite bathing pool of a celestial princess named Mambang Sari was said to be Tasik Dayang Bunting (Lake of the Pregnant Maiden). A prince, Mat Teja, fell madly in love with her and tricked her into marrying him.Sadly, their child died from a mysterious illness at the age of seven days. Distraught, the grieving Mambang Sari left the child’s body in the lake and returned to her heavenly abode. Today, some believe that barren women who bathe in this lake will be endowed with a child.

The Tasik Dayang Bunting is one of the stops on the island hopping tour. It is a lake surrounded by hills, where we could participate in water activities like paddleboating and kayaking. We visited the lake in mid January 2020. There’s entrance fee of 10rm per person which includes a life jacket and the water activities. You can place your belongings at a corner with the staff at your own risk. The equipments were in good condition. My family had an enjoyable time kayaking and paddle boating but we had only one hour of the tour allocated at the lake unfortunately. Also, we recommend you guys to bring your own drinks and snacks as it can be a little pricey at the island. Beware of monkeys though! For people who want to get away from the city life, we definitely recommend you guys to give this place a visit!

RM3 for entry of the vacinity and RM10 promo price for rental of life jacket, kayak n Swan Paddle Ride! If not life jacket will be just RM2 when u are inside the lake area. great views n great atmosphere very realxing.

attractions.name: Oriental Village
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Malaysia, Kedah, Langkawi, Oriental Village
reviews: Oriental Village is best known as the home of the Langkawi Cable Car and Sky Bridge. It is a themed open-air complex with a huge lake in the centre and an art gallery, animal exhibits, clothes, souvenir and handicraft stores spread out around it plus a few local and international restaurants.
Oriental Village is best known as the home of the Langkawi Cable Car and Sky Bridge. It is a themed open-air complex with a huge lake in Lamgkawi.
Beautiful experience!!!!

In this "fake" village there are plenty of attractions, food and souvenir stalls to keep you busy for more than a day. Among them stands out the Cable Car. Some are tourist traps, but despite the sometime excessive crowd, is not a bad place to spend some time.
The Oriental Village is a relatively new tourist destination that offers shopping and multiple food options.  More important, the Oriental Village is at the foot of the Langkawi Cable Car station.

attractions.name: Underwater World Langkawi
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Malaysia, Kedah, Langkawi, Underwater World Langkawi
reviews: when holiday i go to langkawi with familiar
great aquarium in the city of chenang beach...how can u find a aquaria in an island?if u have nothing to do or dont have a plan yet...you should try to here.
See one of the largest aquariums in Malaysia with a visit to the Langkawi Underwater World! · Check out the 4,000 different aquatic species.
Worth the 45RM entrance fee. It was 1 hour tour but we ended up for 2 hours. Lots of thigs to see especially liked the seal and penguins
this is my third time visit, but it seems a bit old and not maintained well compare last time visit. suitable for family with children. definitely enjoy n gain under sea creatures knowledges.

attractions.name: Managaha Island
attractions.loc_tags: North America, United States, Northern Mariana Islands, Saipan, Managaha Island
reviews: Feel the all year summer heat in Managaha!..explore the small island and get a cool snorkeling experience with great underwater view!
fantastic island,romantic,unbelievable, i wonna be there again.
Great place to stay and I would go again!
The most beautiful island, snorkeling can see a lot of fish
A good place for diving, not far from the main island of Saipan, usually for a day trip, there is nothing on the island, just the endless sea, very clear, and I saw a beautiful sunset here.

attractions.name: The Grotto
attractions.loc_tags: North America, United States, Northern Mariana Islands, Saipan, The Grotto
reviews: i think the view under the sea will be more beautiful than we saw.

Don’t miss the beautiful blue hole. You must not miss it when you come to Saipan. Some people feel that it is not safe and the water is too cold. In fact, everything is worth it the moment you see the blue hole. It’s so fun.
The islands are worth a visit, the sea is very blue, very clean, several classic attractions high photo-optimal rate, all went.

Located in Saipan Island, the Blue Cave is a natural cave connected to the Pacific Ocean. It is a deep hole formed by the limestone seabed formed by coral reefs that has been eroded and collapsed by the sea water for a long time. The water fills the deep hole through the waterway, and the length of the light path makes the blue and purple light scatter more thoroughly and appear bluer, and it becomes the so-called blue hole.

The blue of the Blue Cave has a powerful attraction that makes people eager to jump out of it all, which is mostly a passion for every dive fan. It's like riding on a supercar and craving to step on the accelerator, Diving and sports cars can inspire such impulses. Also, I stayed at the place where we rented the car at night. The Starsha Hotel is where we rent the car. It is very convenient. We use qq to rent the car. We also eat in the car @尼@海@鲜@餐@厅, Tony Seafood, which is also near our car rental, very convenient, super like, The seafood is also very delicious.

attractions.name: Bird Island
attractions.loc_tags: North America, United States, Northern Mariana Islands, Saipan, Bird Island
reviews: I don’t know why it’s called Bird Island. I can’t go up and I didn’t see the birds, but the scenery is really beautiful. The sea is too blue and clear. However, there is a lot of wind and waves here.

Bird Island, located in the northern part of the Saipan region of the Mariana Islands in the United States, is made of limestone and is named for the many birds that inhabit. Although the island is small, it provides ample living space for birds. There are hundreds of bird species on the island. At high tide, Bird Island is like an isolated island on the sea. When the tide is low, it is connected to the island, and the whole island shines brightly under the sun.

Maybe it’s too hot in the afternoon and I didn’t see a bird, but I saw the vast Pacific Ocean under the sun. The actual scenery is much more beautiful than the photo. Because of the breeze and fine waves, different shades of blue jump with the waves, as if spinning under the light. The sapphire is constantly shining with charming brilliance. The beauty of nature is really wonderful! For details, please refer to my travel notes, website: http://you.ctrip.com/travels/saipan569/3363072.html

Bird Island is located in the northern part of Saipan, just beside the blue cave. Torishima is named for its many birds. It takes about ten minutes to drive there. The distance to the island is about 100 meters.
Bird Island is said to have lived because of the many birds on the island, but now because of the number of people, so not too many birds, but can see in the morning, can see the sunrise, also good.

attractions.name: Banzai Cliff
attractions.loc_tags: North America, United States, Northern Mariana Islands, Saipan, Banzai Cliff
reviews: The View od Banzai Cliff is just stunning!! You can just see a perfect combination pf the cliff and the ocean. It is sugguested to go there in thr evening so that you can see the sunset together! Take a good camera for endless photos!

I remember 50,000 people on the island, 10,000 soldiers and 10,000 poor people. There are many jumps, but there are also jumps forced by soldiers. The picture of children jumping in the sea, even if I am Chinese. I don't bear to look straight at it.

A very steep cliff where the Japanese army forced the locals to jump off the cliff during World War II. It is now a war site. The seaside itself is beautiful, it would be a good place without these tragic things

During World War II, Japan had more than 30,000 defenders in Saipan. In order to occupy Saipan, the United States sent 70,000 troops to attack Saipan. The war was extremely fierce. In the end, the Japanese army judged that they could not defeat the American army. In order to avoid being captured, they gathered all the islands. Thousands of Japanese people jumped off the suicide cliff and died.

Long live cliff is a cliff located in the northernmost part of Saipan. In 1944, the US army attacked the Japanese base on the Mariana Islands. The Japanese army retreated to the northern end of the island and did not want to surrender. They forced the old, young, and women to the edge of the Long live cliff together. After shouting long live, they collectively jumped into the cliff.

reviews: Walk north along the seaside road to the end. There is a large park with many phoenix trees. Although it is not in the flowering period, there are still a few blooming sporadically. It is beautiful and very quiet. There is a memorial hall in the park to understand the history of World War II. Now it has become a good place for locals to walk, jog, bike and walk their dogs. I also stayed at the place where we rented a car at night. Xingsha Hotel, Xingsha Hotel is where we rented a car. Convenient, we use qq to rent a car, and we eat at To@尼@海@鲜@饭@室, Tony Seafood, is also near our car rental, very convenient, I love it, and the seafood is also very good eat

It is a park very suitable for leisure and a good walk. It is very quiet. It will play some historical documentaries. It is very good, and it is less than a few hundred meters from the Xingsha Hotel where we live, so it’s not bad to go for a walk. To go to Saipan, we must make some preparations.
