Wolfgang lake is a famous Austrian central beautiful lake resort, walk in the town, as immersed in the flower in the river, every household half wooden structure buildings windowsill are flowers, delicate and charming be about to drip.

[Scenery] Austria’s lake area is so beautiful. Green water and green mountains, no water entertainment, quiet and quiet. Perfect for a holiday
[Fun] There are several famous towns in the surrounding area, suitable for staying for a few days; the climbing train can reach Mount Shaf; there are bicycle paths and trails along the lake, both for cycling and hiking. I also encountered diving, which seems to be a basic training
[Value for money] Lake Wolfgang is a traditional resort for locals with complete facilities

Lake St. Wolfgang is located in the lake area of Salzkammergut, Austria. There are many lakes in the lake area. The most famous one is undoubtedly Hallstatt. Lake St. Wolfgang is also one of the best. The green lake, the Schaff Mountain next to the lake, the small town of St. Wolfgang and the famous White Horse Hotel are all beautiful spots of the St. Wolfgang Lake. You can swim and boat in the lake, and there are far fewer tourists than Hallstatt. It feels very pleasant to spend a holiday by the lake.

St. Wolfgang Lake is very beautiful, the lake is azure blue, the sky is also very transparent, white clouds are floating, especially in the process of boarding the Schaff Mountain by the small train, the small train travels through the undulating mountains and forests. The creaking of machinery and the sound of siren, the vegetation there is very rich and beautiful, there are many small houses along the way, just like in a fairy tale, overlooking the beautiful lakes and mountains, there is a sense of time and space inversion.

Before I came to another lake, I was wondering whether it was unnecessary to come to the Austrian Lake District from Switzerland. After I came, I felt that each of these lakes near the Alps is really beautiful, similar and unique.

attractions.name: Mozartplatz
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Austria, Salzburg, Salzburg, Mozartplatz
reviews: Mozartplatz or Mozart Monument is located in the center of the Salzburg historical district and is flanked by Residenz. Our last visit was back then 2018 which is 3 years ago and now still the same.

Bishop of Mozart plaza is located in the square and the square of the statue of Mozart from salzburg donation completed on September 5, 1842, Mozart''s two sons, attended the ceremony. In 1997, the old town of salzburg been listed as world cultural heritage list, the statue in front of the lettering on the ground to record this historic moment

A bronze Mozart statue monument is the center of the square, and the old mansion on Vargo Square next to it is the birthplace of the famous local poet George Traco. King Ludwig I of Bavaria was an important advocate for the establishment of this square. He personally donated a huge sum of money and also donated a marble base. Today this pedestal is housed in the Carolina Augustin Museum.
Mozart Square is very small. The bronze Mozart statue is the center of the square, surrounded by cafes and candy shops. The square is very clean and quiet. You can also visit the nearby Wagga Square

The famous musician Mozart is a native of Salzburg. The people of his hometown built Mozart Square to commemorate him. There is a statue of Mozart on the square, not far from his former residence in Grain Alley. The photo was taken when I went to Austria last year.

attractions.name: St. Peter's Cemetery (Petersfriedhof)
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Austria, Salzburg, Salzburg, St. Peter's Cemetery (Petersfriedhof)
reviews: St Peter's Cemetery is not often that a cemetery will feature on a list of top attractions, but this is actually one of the most visited locations in Salzburg. Open daily from 0630am seven days a week.

St Peter''s cemetery is the oldest cemetery salzburg, buried a lot of famous local characters. Including na Neil · Mozart (Mozart''s sister), Michael Haydn Haydn''s younger brother (musician), Herbert von karajan teacher, big cathedral architects, st Ding Nuo sola, benefit and so on. "The city of music" and Trinidad and Tobago rapp a behind the tombstone of the escaping is hiding here

Built according to the slope of st Peter monastery is a triple aisle Roman basilica, built here in 696 to strengthen Christian church. Until today, is still a monastery of monks practice. This ancient monastery is the only Romanesque church salzburg, in the center of the building of the ceiling, there are many portraits depicting religious, is very interesting.

St. Peter’s Monastery is located in the southwest of Salzburg’s Bishop’s Palace, close to the mountain wall. It seems not far away, but it is not easy to find. When I went there, I caught up with the church to be repaired. The church was inaccessible. I visited the monastery and the cemetery behind.

A monastery located at the foot of the mountain is quite famous. You can see many characteristic buildings in this monastery. The autumn scenery here is very beautiful. The nearby woods have changed to yellow and red leaves. Many landscapes are You can see it here.

attractions.name: Chengde Mountain Resort
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Hebei, Chengde, Chengde Mountain Resort
attractions.address: Lizhengmen St, Shuangqiao Qu, Chengde Shi, Hebei Sheng, China, 067000
reviews: The Mountain Resort was the summer retreat for some of the Qing Emporers and it's scale and beauty definitely speaks of power of the Qing at its height. There is the Palace area which is now a museum with an extre fee to enter, however it is probably worth it. The there is the lakes area which are one of the best parts. Artificial islands house pavilions and palaces which are great for walking around and then having a rest in the shade. To the right of the lakes is the plains area showing the manchurian heritage of the Qing dynasty. This area if just grassland, but at the end there are some Mongolian yurts and a tall pagoda. Then there is the mountain area which takes up most of the space of the resort. This area is sometimes closed (late winter and spring), but the tour bus that races around the mountains is definitely worth it. There are many areas in which you can get off, with the highlight probably being the view of the 'mini potala palace' from the wall. Definitely worthy of its designation as a world heritage site, and worth going, despite the rather steep price (at least for Chinese standards).
loved, loved, loved the resort! we went close to national holiday and while there were many people it was still really enjoyable. The lake makes the whole place look magnificent

awesome place. totally worth a visit. the scenic environment plus the wonderful climate make this scenic spot extremely exciting and adventurous. if you are desiring a trip which will not only be exciting but also be giving you peace and tranquility you must visit this resort not only is this resort comfy and inviting but the people here are usually very welcoming and have a great attitude which will make your visit even more worth it!
super fantastic resort with cool breeze and beautifull scenary aswell i love this place too much

attractions.name: Putuo Zongcheng Temple
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Hebei, Chengde, Putuo Zongcheng Temple
reviews: The temple of Putuo Zongcheng was built after the Potala Palace in Lhasa, Tibet. The translation of the Tibetan word "Potala" is Putuo Zongcheng. The temple was built on the mountain, and the north side faces the south, with the Beige in the mountain gate, the north side with the five towers, more than ten meters high, with three arches, and five Lama Towers, red, yellow, black, white and green. The north gate is Liuli archway. The north archway topography is gradually higher, all kinds of white platform, tower building because of the topography scattered, the height and the low, the change of many ends. Finally for the majestic tall main building big red platform.

The temple of Putuo Zongcheng, also called the "Little Potala Palace", was a Buddhist temple built by the Emperor Qianlong of Qing Dynasty to celebrate his 60th birthday and the 80th birthday of the Empress Dowager Chongqing. Located in the north of the summer resort in Chengde City, Hebei Province, south of Lion Valley, Chengde Wai eight temples the largest building complex, built in the 36th year of Qianlong Qing Dynasty.

The layout of the temple of Zongcheng in Putuo consists of three parts: the front part includes the mountain gate, the monumental pavilion and the five tower gate; the middle part includes the Liuli archway, the white platform, the monk's house and so on; The rear is the main building Dahongtai and other buildings around the area, and the size of 60 is surrounded by a large wall of ridges and mountains, and the temple is surrounded by a large wall.

The temple of Putuo Zongcheng was built after the Potala Palace in Lhasa, Tibet. The translation of the Tibetan word "Potala" is Putuo Zongcheng. The temple was built on the mountain, and the north side faces the south, with the Beige in the mountain gate, the north side with the five towers, more than ten meters high, with three arches, and five Lama Towers, red, yellow, black, white and green. The north gate is Liuli archway. The north archway topography is gradually higher, all kinds of white platform, tower building because of the topography scattered, the height and the low, the change of many ends. Finally for the majestic tall main building big red platform.

I went to Putuo Zongcheng Temple on December 17th. It is worth the visit. Although the weather is colder, there are few tourists and the red and white buildings are spectacular. It is recommended to set aside half a day to visit. Compared with the Summer Resort, it feels more interesting here.

attractions.name: Jinshanling Great Wall
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Hebei, Chengde, Luanping, Jinshanling Great Wall
reviews: We started at the middle enterance and hiked until the east gate. Very exhausting but worth the view. If you are not up for hiking up you can take a cable car. Very touristed and crowded, but not as much on the trail. Side shops are everywhere, so you don't have to carry tons of water up with you. Also builds a lot of muscle in your legs. ️
I''m wondering how could the ancient times could have such amazing tech to hold it.
The Great Wall of Jinshanling is fantastic! How wonderful it is. We thought it is amazing!
It''s an amazing place! We were so surprise about the Great Wall!

attractions.name: Puning Temple
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Hebei, Chengde, Puning Temple
attractions.address: Puning Rd, Shuangqiao Qu, Chengde Shi, Hebei Sheng, China
reviews: the most gorgeous temple we have visited so far! we arrived just before closing and had the entire place just for ourselves for almost an hour! simply amazing

Departing from Tianjin at 7:00 in the morning, it took 4 hours to arrive at Chengde and went directly to Puning Temple without checking in. The first stop of the Dragon Boat Festival trip to Chengde. I didn't know anything about Chengde and I was surprised to see the architecture of Tibetan Buddhism. Because the people of Beijing are prohibited from leaving Beijing due to the epidemic, there are very few tourists in Chengde this Dragon Boat Festival. Puning Temple parking lot is very empty, parking fee is 10 yuan per time, unlimited time. Then go to the main entrance and show the Hebei Health Code, temperature measurement, ID card registration, and then enter the door after five passes and six generals 😂. The weather in Chengde during the Dragon Boat Festival was good. It was cloudy and not hot when we went, but the photo effects were not good. The temples in Chengde are built on the mountain, so the whole tour process is like climbing a mountain, but you can see while climbing, so it's not as boring and hard as climbing. Puning Temple should be the most open temple in Chengde. Each temple has many different Buddha statues, and there is also a very big Buddha, which is very remarkable. As long as there is a staircase, climb up to the top. There is a rest area. It looks like a small house surrounded by Buddhist scripture flags. There are stone tables and stools inside. There is also a Puyou Temple next to the temple. It is very small and only remains. The staff at the door will explain to you what it was like before it was burned down. It is very enthusiastic. Along the exit, not far is the parking lot. The route is well planned. Puning Temple is very worth visiting.

Puning Temple is located in Chengde City, Hebei Province, and was built in the Qianlong period of the Qing Dynasty. The first half of the temple is Han style, with the characteristics of traditional Han Buddhist temples; the second half is Tibetan style, imitated the Tibetan Sangzhang Temple, two different styles of architecture merged into one.

Puning Temple is located in Chengde City, Hebei Province, and is the largest Buddhist activity site in northern China. The monks are gathered and the incense is very prosperous. UNESCO has determined the world cultural heritage. The first 4A-level scenic spot has been announced by the country. The main statue of Buddha in Puning Temple is a thousand-handed thousand-eye Guanyin Bodhisattva. Tonggao 27.21 meters is the largest gold lacquer wood carving thousand-hand thousand-eye Guanyin Bodhisattva in the world. It has been listed in the Guinness World Records. After overall maintenance, it has more charm of religious art. Its cultural relics and artistic values are among the highest in the world. Puning Temple was built in the Qianlong period of the Qing Dynasty, a temple combining Han and Tibetan. The first half is Han-style, with the characteristics of traditional Han Buddhist temples; the second half is Tibetan-style, imitated Tibetan Sangzha Temple. Two different styles of architecture merge into one, the combination of the perfect.
The Puning Temple has a long history and many tourists come to visit it!!

attractions.name: Dual Pagoda Mountain
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Hebei, Chengde, Dual Pagoda Mountain
reviews: It’s much more fun than Qingfeng Mountain Forest Park. There are mountains and waters, and mountain climbing is not that good. The main reason is the chance to see wild monkeys. You can feel the magical work of nature by standing under the Shuangta Mountain. It is very good and worth a visit. .

Shuangta Mountain is located in the world-famous Chengde Summer Resort in Hebei Province, ten kilometers southwest of the total area of 3000 hectares, scenic beauty, Chengde City is the largest natural scenic tourist area.

A very good tour! The scenic area has a beautiful environment, pleasant scenery and fresh air. It is a place with both humanities and history as well as natural scenery. The monkeys on the back mountain are naughty and cute, suitable for adults and children to play together. The scenery is good, the overall is awesome, interesting and fun, and cost-effective,

The scenic area is very small. It's best to walk around the line counterclockwise and stop and go for more than two hours. The most interesting thing is that I saw the monkeys. The scenic area is very clean. The bigger the mountain is, the higher it is. Interesting and fun, the scenery is good, it is recommended, the experience is very good,

I think Shuangtashan ranks relatively low on ***, but in fact, I think this attraction is quite good. Because it is very scarce, I don’t think you can miss it if you like natural and cultural landscapes. The tickets are not expensive and the price/performance ratio is high. Because I brought a baby, I can only choose the cable car. The cable car is a bit worthless and low cost performance. I suggest that adults without children and the elderly can climb on their own. In fact, they are not very high, and they will go up in half an hour.

attractions.name: Fengshuiwan Hot Spring
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Hebei, Chengde, Fengshuiwan Hot Spring
attractions.address: Maojingba Hot Spring Cultural Tourism Industrial Park, Longhua County, Chengde City
reviews: Basically a public bath.

If you arrive at around 12 noon, you can buy a ticket 168 on Ctrip. After you arrive, you can change to a paper ticket and buy a ticket 198 on the spot. It is the same. The water can be changed at any time according to demand. It's too cold outside, but the water is hot. There are all kinds of hot springs, milk, chocolate, and all kinds of strange pools in the room. Each pool trades for 15 minutes. The lunch buffet is also good. After dinner, there is a lounge to rest. There were two surfing at 2.30 and 4.30 in the afternoon, so cool! After playing for an afternoon, I was not tired and casual. I slept in a place indoors around 4pm, which was very comfortable. Suitable for a family to play together! The only downside is that it was a bit cloudy and it rained in the afternoon. We left after seeing thunder and will come again next time!

The hot spring water is very hot and it is comfortable to soak. Children play surfing. It’s a pleasure to watch my son. There is also a pool dedicated to children’s amusement facilities. Parents are also very comfortable. There are too many people on May Day. I waited for a long time, it’s too noisy indoors, a little headache, not bad outdoors, maybe the place is big, I don’t feel crowded when I’m soaking, it’s all diverted, I can go there next weekend, you can have fun
It is said that it exceeds the water quality standards of medical mineral water and can even be consumed directly.

Very good, the children are very happy, but the food is not good, the facilities are aging, the mountain hot springs are not developed, not very clean, and there are caterpillars. At least the hot springs are real, and the children are happy.

attractions.name: Mount Wuling
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Hebei, Chengde, Xinglong, Mount Wuling
reviews: Wuling Mountain National Nature Reserve is located in Xinglong County, Hebei Province, surrounded by four cities, Beijing, Tianjin, Tang and Cheng, with a total area of 14247 hectares. Wuling Mountain is the main peak of Yanshan Mountain, with an altitude of 2118 meters. It is a warm temperate humid continental monsoon climate, annual average temperature 7.6℃, summer maximum temperature 28℃, abundant rainfall, cool climate and rich species. There are 1,870 species of higher plants and 173 species of terrestrial vertebrates.

Self-driving tour of Wuling Mountain Forest Park during National Day holiday. It takes 3.5 hours from Beijing to reach the south gate of Wuling Mountain from Xinglong, Hebei. After purchasing the ticket, you will enter by car and walk along the roads of the scenic spot. Immortal Tower, Yiran Pavilion, Wuling Jinshan, Qingliang Boundary Monument,... The main peak of Wuling Mountain is 2118 meters, with strong wind and low temperature. Fortunately, I brought my own cotton clothes. There are also cotton coats for rent on the top platform. The car drives up the mountain top platform, but also has to walk up some steps to the top of the mountain. There are hotels and restaurants in the scenic area. Tickets for the scenic area are 108 yuan, half price for 60-65 years old, and free for people over 65. There is no fare for self-driving cars. It took more than 4 hours to walk in and stop from the south gate to the north gate. Maybe it can save time on weekdays. It takes 1,500 meters to walk to Longmen Waterfall, so I gave up because I didn't have enough time and physical strength. 80 yuan by cable car. The roads in the scenic area are cement pavement and the pavement is narrow, so you need to drive carefully. The west gate of the scenic spot cannot be entered by car, only on foot. In short, traveling by car in Wuling Mountain is a good experience.

Generally speaking, it’s okay, and it can only be okay. There are few scenic spots in the mountains. We lived in the middle of the mountain. The temperature difference between morning and evening is still very big. The thick clothes are all put on the food but can eat the next morning. The sunrise from the top of the mountain is very beautiful. When I went down the mountain, I went to a scenic spot at the foot of the mountain. Especially suitable for summer to go very cool.

The scenery is good, driving around the mountain ＋ climbing the mountain, very comfortable, the scenery is very beautiful ~ the small waterfall in Mt. Wuling is small but still worth going~ the air of nature is good, the mood is comfortable ~ autumn into the mountain advice or bring a thin down jacket, haha~
The Mt Wuling is huge and stayed one night to watch the sunrise

attractions.name: Saihanba National Forest Park
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Hebei, Chengde, Saihanba National Forest Park
attractions.address: Yuke Line, Weichang Manzumengguzuzizhixian, Chengde Shi, Hebei Sheng, China
reviews: The people of Saihanba Manchu and Mongolian nationalities live together, and their culture is intermingled with each other, especially the cultural characteristics of the Manchu Mongolian are outstanding. Visitors can enjoy a variety of food and snacks, participate in horse racing, wrestling, bag meetings and other activities of the Manchu Mongolian nation, and carry out national tourism, which is one of the features of Saihanba National Forest Park different from other forest grasslands.
Historically, Saihanba is a natural park with abundant water and grass, dense forest and abundant animal. It was called the "Thousand-Li Pine Forest" in Liao and Jin Dynasties.

Saihanba is located in the Weichang Manchu and Mongolian Autonomous County of Chengde City, Hebei Province, on the southeastern edge of the Inner Mongolia Plateau. It is located at the junction of the Inner Mongolia Plateau and the northern mountains of Hebei. Mesa. "Saihan" in the name is Mongolian, meaning "beautiful"; "ba" is Chinese, meaning "kaolin", and the full name can be translated as "beautiful kaolin". It is 51.46 kilometers long from east to west, 17.84 kilometers wide from north to south, with an average altitude of 1500-2067 meters and an area of 20029 hectares. The Qing Dynasty once set up a "Mulan Paddock" here. In history, Saihanba was a place full of water and grass, dense forests, and thriving animals. It was called "Thousand Miles of Pine Forest" during the Liao and Jin Dynasties. It was once a hunting place for emperors. Known as "the source of water, the hometown of clouds, the world of flowers, the ocean of forests".

Hebei Saihanba National Forest Park is located in the north of Weichang County, Chengde City, part of the Qin Dynasty Royal Hunting Garden Hemulan Paddock, with a total area of 200.29 square kilometers and an average altitude of 1500 meters.

In China, there is the largest artificial forest in the world, that is Saihanba. During the Kangxi period of the Qing Dynasty, it was once a royal family. Various plants were born on this fertile land. Birds lived happily here. Wild animals are countless.

attractions.name: Simon Cabaret Show

attractions.address: 8 Sirirat Rd, Tambon Patong, Amphoe Kathu, Chang Wat Phuket

Wonderful entertainment with great music, awesome cast and magnificent costumes. loved the photo taking session after the show

Even though this show is a bit expensive, it is worth every bit. It is professional and extremely entertaining. The venue is impressive too. Have an open mind when going to the show. No cameras or recordings allowed. Ticket includes a drink before or after the show.

Simon Cabaret is a very amazing show.  with a very graceful dance show.  they are a man who is transformed into a very beautiful woman.  if you go to Phuket, you have to watch this show.  thank you Trip.com
the show was really good, im so happy i has a chance to go and see all the beautiful lady boy

The famously raucous nightlife scene features beer bars, go-go bars, nightclubs, massage parlors and cabarets that overflow into the street along neon-lit

We went there twice. I can say only one word-AMAZING!!
The park is home to nine islands with long coral sand beaches and crystal clear waters.
What a beautiful and fantastic tourism scenery destination! it''s worth of visiting time and time again.
Three day dives around the Similan Islands. With a chance late afternoon to visit island no.4 for a couple of hours.

One of my fav destinations in the world, place full of warm breeze and nice people , the food is great and the drinks are delicious , shopping also good

Kata Beach is an exquisite paradise beach. with amazing bucket list activities like parasailing, jet skiing and they even teach you how to surf. It was a once in a life time experience and I am already booking my trip back there.
Kata Beach is a 1.5-km strip of golden sand and is considered one of the most popular beaches in Phuket.
nice beach. beautiful sunsets. spend there all the time during the staying in Phuket. Will come here again in the futurw

Karon Beach in Phuket is one of the longest beaches on the island.It is spanning 5 km of fine white sand overlooking the Andaman Sea. See to believe and feel to experience it.
At this time very suitable for all beach in Phuket, less crowded, recommended
there is a famous beach of phuket thailand

street foods are everywhere. you can find cheap and nice food at the night market. Weekdays not much people but during weekends are much more crowded.
Bustling local market lined with stalls featuring souvenirs, clothing, traditional food & more.

went there for the first time and i felt in love with it such a beautiful and wonderful place to visits must visit the bar streer at night and go to big budda and patong beach and if you can rent a motorbike and enjoy free visit and go whenever you want to, but be sure you got the drive license or go pay 1000 baht for a free day drive

Fantasea is spectacular entertainment for the whole family or couples dating or newlyweds on honeymoon. Prepare enough time to take 100s of photos in and around the Elephant Theater! plenty of restaurants available and the buffet is great value for money!

This was the amazing show we ever had. The buffet serves all kinds of international cuisine. A happy tummy before the show started. You can also enjoy the elephant ride, souvenirs, full of surprises of beautiful people performing before and after the show... surely would love to come back with my friends and explore more..

Phuket Fantasea is very amazing, there is I large cultural theme park with carnival-like games, lots of shopping opportunities, and one of  buffets , great entertainment value for all ages. thank you Trip.com you always the best.
its an amazing place to visit while in phuket . the event is packed with amazing entertainment and traditional knowledge about thai culture

reviews: it's pretty Derpish. Nice derpios, we ate some & watched the sunset. derpios are my favourite deep based nutritional supplement. that boat, it's Coolio.
Promthep Cape is one of the most photographed locations in Phuket. Every evening, tour buses, scooters and private cars sweep through the area bringing locals and tourist from all over the places.
There is small jogging track here and beware of the steep and slippery track to go to the cape... 5 PM is better as the sun is about to set and there's enough light to take a beautiful shot.
nice view point at promthep cape is popular
A place recommended for sunset in Phuket.

attractions.name: Shinsaibashi
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Osaka, Osaka, Shinsaibashi
attractions.address: 2 Chome-2-２２ Shinsaibashisuji, Chuo Ward, Osaka, Osaka Prefecture
reviews: เป็นย่านขายของที่มีของเยอะ ของกินก็น่ากินมากๆ มุมถ่ายรูปก็เยอะ ชอบมากๆ ไว้จะมาอีกบ่อยๆ

Shinsaibashi is a district in the Chūō-ku ward of Osaka, Japan and the city's main shopping area.At its center is Shinsaibashi-suji, a covered shopping street, that is north of Dōtonbori and Sōemonchō, and parallel and east of Mido-suji street.
Food lover paradise! The Daimutsu department store foodhall at basement 2 is incredible! I cannot find a reason why not to love Osaka.

This part of Osaka is like Camden town in London. Narrow streets, designer and vintage shops, street food, pubs and crowd always everywhere. The most visible difference with Camden market is the lack of trash and trashcans. We lived nearby, so with a convenient walk we could reach out to these streets anytime. This is a must-see area in Osaka for designer handbag lovers.

From Shinsaibashi Station about 550m walking just straight ahead and you will see this area. Many shopping mall with tax free. Souvenirs. And don't forget to try the TAKOYAKI which is famous in Osaka.

reviews: ปราสาทที่ถ่ายมุมไหนก็สวย ใครชอบแฮรี่พอตเตอร์ มาที่นี่รับรองถูกใจแน่นอนเลย สวยจริงๆ

The Wizarding World of Harry Potter is a themed area based on the Harry Potter series built at Universal Parks & Resorts' Universal Studios Japan theme park in Osaka, Japan. They provide costume for you to feel like you part of it.

MY POTTERHEAD HEART WAS FULL WHEN I FINALLY VISITED THIS DREAMLAND! ♥️ I've been dreaming of going to USJ to finally experience my Harry Potter dream, and last March 2019, it finally happened! I finally was there. I have a lot to say! First, the Castle was magnificent. Well, not just the castle but, everything was an exact copy of all the places in the movies. Second, I got my wand from Ollivander's exactly as how Harry got his! Third, I bought ny Ravenclaw Scarf! I drank Butterbeer, and by the way, it's for ¥1000. Plus ¥500 if you want to buy the plastic cup. I ate at the Three Broomsticks. I stayed half of the day at Hogsmeade. The castle ride was an absolute fun! I did it twice! Lastly, it is a must to see the Castle Illumination at night. You should never miss it!

We are so glad very wizarding have fun so adventerous ... we really like the rides its so close to the movies of Harry Potter and the caramel beer its so sweet and creamy and the people children wow so fantastic magical kingdom that you can ever imagine in USJ. We are all so happy have fun and excited to visit again.

If it’s not on your list of things to do while your in Osaka... add it. Now. Utterly fantastic! The ride was phenomenal and the Olivander’s wand shop experience was brilliant. The Butterbeer was gross though. More like ButtBeer.

The aquarium located in the harbor area is very convenient to get to and buy tickets, below is a mall, after entering the aquarium, a little bit from the land, the overall is the descent passage, then a huge tank, divided into different areas, various fish, animals in the water, very spectacular, Very nice
One of the most important attractions in Osaka, this aquarium is one of the largest in Asia, the size of the place is very large and meticulous, and bought small plush toys as a souvenir

A must-do itinerary with children to Osaka! When buying tickets at the door, I think it’s very intimate that there are 2 types of fares for children, 4 years old and above ¥400, elementary and middle school students ¥900, the price is not the same, my son is just 5 years old, only asks age regardless of height, or Feel very cheap. The transportation is convenient, and the circulation in the museum is well planned. It is the largest indoor aquarium in the world. The best part is that you don’t need to go to the Hokkaido Museum to see the King Penguins. I am very happy to see the group of penguins. It turns out that they sleep standing up. They are so cute! There is also a sink at the exit (I think the Japanese are very attentive). After the children wash their hands, they can touch the stingray experience. The son is very happy; the mall next to it happened to have a discount, and the mother was very happy to buy it. I would like to go again next time because there is still a boat to tour Osaka that hasn't been taken yet.

it was very good experience here in Osaka dotonburi is the area of night life and sight seeing at the same time you should come at least once ^^

Abenoharukas or Abenobashi Terminal Building is a multi-purpose commercial facility in Abenosuji Itchome, Abeno-ku, Osaka, Japan.It consists of the New Annex, Eastern Annex, and a 300 m tall skyscraper Abeno Harukas.The reconstruction began in January 2010, and opened on March 7, 2014.
so romantic  nice experience..

attractions.name: Osaka Castle Park
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Osaka, Osaka, Osaka Castle Park
reviews: Such a historic place. Was there in the summer. Great for groups. Performance by high school students. Shops nearby served street food. Half a day would be sufficient to see around.

Osaka Castle Park (大阪城公園, Osaka-Jō-Kōen) is a public urban park and historical site situated at Osaka-Jō in Chūō-ku, Osaka, Japan.It lies on the south of the Ōkawa (Kyū-Yodo River) and occupies a large area in the center of the city of Osaka. This park is the second largest park in the city.
😍😍 Best experience

The construction of Osaka Castle (大阪城, Ōsakajō) started in 1583 on the former site of the Ishiyama Honganji Temple, which had been destroyed by Oda Nobunaga thirteen years earlier. Toyotomi Hideyoshi intended the castle to become the center of a new, unified Japan under Toyotomi rule. It was the largest castle at the time.However, a few years after Hideyoshi's death, Tokugawa troops attacked and destroyed the castle and terminated the Toyotomi lineage in 1615. Osaka Castle was rebuilt by Tokugawa Hidetada in the 1620s, but its main castle tower was struck by lightening in 1665 and burnt down.It was not until 1931 that the present ferro-concrete reconstruction of the castle tower was built. During the war it miraculously survived the city wide air raids. Major repair works gave the castle new glamor in 1997. The castle tower is now entirely modern on the inside and even features an elevator for easier accessibility. It houses an informative museum about the castle's history and Toyotomi Hideyoshi.
The place was so beautiful, worth to visit. A place that you must visit when you travel to Osaka.

reviews: Tsūtenkaku, is a tower and well-known landmark of Osaka, Japan and advertises Hitachi. It is located in the Shinsekai district of Naniwa-ku, Osaka.Its total height is 103 m; the main observation deck is at a height of 91 m.
Nothing special to see, nothing clear at night, entry 900 yen per person.

We could get there easily with metro line from downtown area. It’s close to the Zoo. Nice place to stroll around, climb the tower and according to weather conditions shoot some pics from the city. Also you can find delicious street food and snacks in every corner.

An eye-catching tower which can be seen almost anywhere around Shinsekai District for it used to be the second tallest tower in Asia. Standing proudly since 1912, it has become one of Osaka’s icons, which miniature and souvenir could be easily found anywhere at touristy area around the city. Mostly visitor comes to this tower whether for taking picture of each attractive shopping street in Shinsekai with the tower as a background or for saying some pray while rubbing the sole of Billiken’s feet at the tower observation deck. Whatever it is, I’ve always been the first type.
Awesome view of Osaka skyline

Umeda Sky Building is the nineteenth-tallest building in Osaka Prefecture, Japan, and one of the city's most recognizable landmarks.It consists of two 40-story towers that connect at their two uppermost stories, with bridges and an escalator crossing the wide atrium-like space in the center.

It is located in Umeda ward, which is a high-rise building, and it has an upper floor of 40 floors and an underground 2 floors, and the height is about 173m, and it has an aerial garden observatory on the 39 floor, and the night view is a sight that the traveler is attracted to. The architecture is quite special, need to take the escalator between two buildings up, there is suspended in the half-empty thrill. But from the labyrinth-like Umeda looking for the sky building, often seem to be in front of the find, it is recommended to go before the route to do a good job.

Umeda Blue Sky Building is a very design-minded skyscraper in Osaka. Although it is a common twin-storey building in high-rises, the skyscraper at the top of the connecting place leaves a hole in the sky. It is said that this kind of high-rise design is the first in Japan, for skyscrapers necessary for the viewing function of many colors, plus the advantage of the location, basically tourists will be on the way.
With the big toads to go around the card, can climb up the Umeda skyscraper top floor, and the open-air lookout, can see very far, here is the center of Umeda area, the building is very chic.

attractions.name: Marienplatz
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Germany, Bavaria, Munich, Marienplatz
reviews: Waiting for the weather to warm up again. In the meantime I''ll be wearing bright lipstick to inject some sunshine into my days.

Maria (Marienplatz square) is in the centre of the city square in Munich. Square in the middle is the statue of the virgin Mary, the north side of the square is the gothic architecture of the city hall (Rathaus), 1867-1908. Among city hall is 85 meters high tower, a famous doll on chimes, at 11 am and 5 PM chimes dolls with music presented the wedding ceremony scene in 1568, William v and eliminate the black death scene. Northwest of square not far away there are two famous Frauenkirche (Frauenkirche) on the top of the Onions, building is the symbol of Munich.

Maria Square, the central square of Munich, is the statue of the Virgin Mary in the middle of the square, and the north of the square is the Gothic building of the town hall. There are several churches around, but it seems only the cathedral can enter. Don't miss the puppet show at the city hall on time.

This is the center of Munich...with S-bahn and U-bahn. Not only because of the busyness, there are many shops to go outside, there are other attractions nearby...it is all arranged in a day trip, it is quite worth going to day or night.

Marienplatz is located in the center of the old city of Munich. The square was built in 1158 and is the largest and most important square in Munich. Because Munich’s new and old town halls are all around the square, Marienplatz is also known as Munich’s "city living room". It is the transportation hub of Munich and a place for various political and cultural activities, as well as citizens’ recreation and gatherings. The Bayern Munich football team also celebrated their victory here.

reviews: I took as many pictures in my three hours here than I took during the rest of my 3 week trip to Europe. Gorgeous displays of both production and concept cars.
The BMW Museum has a fantastic factory tour where you can see how a BMW is made from beginning to end.
Great place to be to learn about the history of BMW, such a heaven also for bimmerheads! Great collection of cars!
Munich has way more to offer than Octoberfest. The BMW museum is cool for all ages and the museum tours even an inside look into their factory right next door. Bring your student ID for a discount
Must go on the tour but you need to be there early cos it's always fully booked.

reviews: Very worthwhile place to visit, the most authentic beer, the most atmosphere of the beer house, the most traditional praise, the noisy voice is boiling, the crowds are constantly flowing, the satisfaction of eating and drinking, experience the life of Bavaria, is both a restaurant and a attraction, five-star recommendation ～
It's not bad to make a date with a little barbecue.
Not bad, clean and tidy, I am very happy to drink.

Of course, you have to taste German beer when you go to Munich, Germany. We went to the famous local beer house. The facade is not very big, but there are many people inside. We went in as a team of ten or so people, and there was no suitable seat, and the hospitable store let us take seats for regular customers. The lights in the beer hall are dim and there is a band performing. The band members are a bunch of happy fat uncles. The yard was also full of beer drinkers. When I come to Munich, I think I must come here to experience it. I am embarrassed to order half a liter of beer. I must order one liter and one sheaf. The price is acceptable.
The Royal Beer House is quite lively and many tourists come!

The Allianz Arena in Munich (Allianz Arena) for its exquisite structure the magnificent appearance, become the glory of that in Munich, Germany. Allianz stadium opening ceremony was chosen for the 2006 World Cup in Germany. This the stadium can hold 66000 people in 2005 officially kicked off on May 30 and 31, by 1860 and Germany''s most successful team in Munich club bayern Munich a joint venture. 14 years in August 1860 in Munich announced unable to pay loans, bayern Munich took the 1860 hands of loans, from then on, the allianz arena for bayern.

One of the most beautiful football stadiums in the world and definitly the best architecture of all , its so unique that you can distinguish it from the Plane window while you are thousands meters above Munich , It looks like a doughnut with a sugar topping :D
UEFA Champions League Final in the beautiful city Munich!Link: http://www.uefa.com/uefachampionsleague/season%3D2012/final/index.html
incredible huge construction, beautiful specially at night when the colors are changing. Easy acess from town, home of Bayern Munich one of the best soccer teams in Europe.

NingFen fort is imperial princes of the Summer Palace, located in the northwest of Munich, built in 1664 to 1664, the main building is a baroque style, the entire palace sitting west toward the east, by each square into a group of buildings, building positive for up to 600 meters. Prince Ferdinand is Mary gives the gift of wife, thanks for she gave birth to a son that kingdom of a succession. It took 200 years before and after the expansion project of the time. Although the palace have not been able to reach the palace as the size of the French king Louis xiv, but certainly the German such palace. One of the largest. However, the south of the most famous gallery. The gallery was born more than 100 years has always been strongly attracted countless art lovers and visitors. Among the evergreen, there was a small and exquisite of hunting palace - Marlene palace, slim and interior decoration elegant.
The Nymphenburg Palace is a Baroque palace in Munich. The palace is the main summer residence of the former rulers of Bavaria of the House of Wittelsbach.
Schloss Nymphenburg is a beautiful palace and so is it's huge garden. It was the residence of the Wittelsbacher, the rulers of Bavaria. It's very pompous and extravagant.
Beautiful palace with lots of architectural detail and beauty. A nice walk from the train station. Do not miss the Gallery of Beauties. Beware of the geese on the property.

attractions.name: BMW World
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Germany, Bavaria, Munich, BMW World
attractions.open_status: Sun 9:00 AM - 12:00 AM, Mon - Sat 7:30 AM - 12:00 AM
reviews: The factory tour is excellent although photography is not allowed. A must see in Munich.

Unique double cone and floating clouds roof is BMW the remarkable feature of the world. The structure of the open and transparent glass walls make a lot of light, the whole building is like into the arms of the surrounding nature. BMW, the world well reflects the function and design and design ideas. 16500 square meters of cloud cover on the double cone roof, only by the 11 pillars hold up the vivid representation of a floating sensation, and roof equipment of solar power equipment, expressed the idea of sustainable development. Double cone is not just visual and architectural window, at the same time it also platform theme exhibitions and cultural activities. It has been compared to a breaking point, show from here is not only the whole building, and the content of the connotation of the brand image of the BMW brand and the idea of radiation to the whole building from here.

If there's one place you want to drive a BMW, this is the place.  The building is an attraction in itself and you can walk in for free to explore. Of course, if you want to see more you'll have to over to the BMW Museum.

Located near the Olympic Park, BMW Welt is a multi-functional building integrating car purchase, visiting, entertainment, and catering. The exterior of the building is double-conical and the design is full of modernity. The museum displays BMW and MINI brands ranging from classic to concept cars. Whether you are a fan or not, you will be shocked when you come here!

Located in Munich, Bavaria, southern Germany, BMW Welt is a comprehensive multi-functional building integrating a new car delivery center, a technology and design studio, a gallery, a youth classroom, and a lounge bar. The unique double-cone and cloud-like roof are the salient features of BMW World, which contrasts with the surrounding BMW headquarters "four-cylinder" building, BMW Museum and Olympic Park. BMW World is a unique place that reflects the characteristics of the BMW brand. BMW World provides visitors and customers with a comprehensive experience of the BMW brand. The core of BMW World is actually car delivery. The delivery area is about 3,000 square meters. After spending a few hours here, the customer will get the car key personally, and then drive the brand new BMW car away from here. BMW World showcased various BMW products. Visitors can simulate driving and watch performances of BMW cars and motorcycles. It is very convenient to come here by subway and bus.

reviews: it is very recommended to visit this very huge park.  i went there on spring time but i think it will be perfect to go in summer time.  but even in spring you can see people surfing there.  such a unique Activity to surf there.
Throwback to the sunny Sunday in Munich, the famous Chinese Tower and the river surfing   ​​​

Looks like just another garden but no, this is where you can suntan by the mini-waterfall along Isar bank from MaximilianStraße, or just sit amongst the green carpet and soak in the warmth as spring seeps in, a lovely way to spend your weekend.
I love the spacious English Garden in Munich. Don't miss the cool surfers catching some waves or the lively beer garden located at the Chinese pavilion.

The Englischer Garten (English Garden) is Munich’s (and Germany’s) largest city park, covering over 910 acres of lush landscaped parks, streams and lakes. Miles and miles of trails, walks and bridle paths.  Perfect for picnics, birdwatching, people watching and just breathing fresh air.

reviews: (Residenz palace Museum Museum), located in the southwest of the palace area, after the second world war in the ruined palaces on the basis of reconstruction was set up for the Museum, the Museum also saved a large amount of victor, the 19th century''s dynasty in the 16th century, large collection of fine art, including painting, sculpture, furniture and other works of art, is divided into 120 exhibition on display.
As a former royal residence, it is a show of aristocratic style and the interior is very luxurious and very nice
The history of the Royal Palace area of Munich is so much to see!
It also seems more ordinary, the previous palace is more general.

There are many buildings such as the King's Building, the Maximilian Palace, the Banquet Hall Building, the Bavarian Opera House, and the General Memorial Hall in the Royal Palace District of Munich. Due to the different eras and functions, these buildings may be brilliant, magnificent, or simple. It may be complicated, with different styles, but the noble atmosphere is the common feature of the architectural complex of the Munich Imperial Palace.
