reviews: Frauenkirche (Frauenkirche, full Dom zu unserer lieben Frau) is located in Munich, Germany, the virgin square, downtown is Catholic Munich - si difen archdiocese cathedral, is also an important landmark in Munich and a popular tourist attraction.
Go to the clean and elegant art and culture city of Munich, look for the history of the Middle Ages. In your lifetime, you must go to the series. ​
The Church of Our Lady is so historic and worth seeing!!!
The Cathedral of Notre Dame is very historic and well worth seeing!!
It's a nice shape, not like a normal church.

attractions.name: New Town Hall
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Germany, Bavaria, Munich, New Town Hall
reviews: Munich''s new town hall is a seat in the north of maria square, built in the late 19th century yingbiao dark brown, gothic architecture above as the frost. It has byrne niche between the front of the window and bid Kings, saints, and the statue of the hero myth. The whole building layout is grand, beautifully decorated, from 1867 to no demand for 40 years to build.
Gothic architecture, nice architecture.

The New Town Hall of Munich is a Gothic building constructed from 1867 to 1908, with a magnificent layout and ornate decoration. The central bell tower is 85 meters high. The New Town Hall is located on Maria Square in the heart of Munich. There are also popular attractions such as the Old City Hall, the Church of Our Lady, and the Old Peter's Basilica nearby. The Golden Statue of Our Lady stands in the square.

This is a black Gothic building that has been smoked by fire. It is tall and tall. The pointed bell tower must be looked up to see the spire. It is said to be 85 meters high. The bell tower is equipped with the largest puppet clock in Germany. It is 12 noon every day. When you click on time, the puppet inside will come out and turn. There are statues of kings, saints, and mythological heroes in the niches between the windows on the front of the building. The layout of the entire building is magnificent and the exterior is gorgeously decorated. It is a landmark building worth seeing in Munich. What is interesting is that the new city hall is old and smoky, and the old city hall, which was not far from the east, which was first seen in 1310, is new because of its beautiful architecture. Marion Square is small, so if you want to take a panoramic view of the new city hall building, you have to set the wide-angle lens to the side.

The Neues Rathaus is a building located in Hannover, Germany. It was opened on July 20, 1913. It took 12 years to build and cost 10 million marks. It is the city hall of Hanover. The building was damaged during World War II and restored after the war.

attractions.name: Grand Canyon of Verdon and Lake of St. Croix
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, France, Provence-Alpes-Cote d'Azur, Bouches-du-Rhone, Aix-en-Provence, Grand Canyon of Verdon and Lake of St. Croix
reviews: Verdun grand canyon lake and holy cross, the 25 kilometers long and 700 m deep canyon in provence - blue coast regions, here attracted a lot of outdoor enthusiasts. Holy cross lake is a man-made landscape. In the 1970 s, verdun grand canyon was found there is a huge water storage potential, France where the narrow canyon built a dam, named "holy cross dam".

Lac de Sainte-Croix (Lac de Sainte-Croix) can be arranged on the same day as Valensole. Lake Sainte-Croix is located in the central part of the Provence region of southern France and is connected to the Grand Canyon of Verdun. It is a good place for summer vacations. You can take an unpowered pedal boat to explore on your own in the lake, and it is better to travel here by self-driving on Lake Santa Croce. Driving from Valensole to Lake Sainte-Croix, you will encounter mountain roads, a lot of continuous curves, but fortunately there are not many cars. The water of Lake Sainte-Croix is really beautiful and unreal, just like a beautiful painting.

When you come to South France, you must not miss the emerald jewel-like Lake Sainte Croix and the steep sides of it, which is known as one of the most beautiful canyons in Europe-the Grand Canyon of Verdun. Water activities are very popular in Lake Sainte-Croix! Including pedal boats, canoes, and many young people who climb onto the rocks and dive, one is higher than the other, which is really amazing.
Lake Sainte-Croix is not a natural lake, but an oversized artificial reservoir. It is the second largest dam in France. The lake water here is used for hydroelectric power generation. It is also a popular attraction for various water activities in summer.

If you think that there is only a sea of flowers in Provence, you are wrong! Driving from a purple lavender road for dozens of kilometers, turning past the green barrier of trees, a piece of pure Tiffany blue came into view without warning, and the first sight of Lake Sainte-Croix was its beauty. conquer! The Sainte-Croix Lake is connected to the Grand Canyon of Verdun. The azure water forms a beautiful landscape. The quiet lake and fine sand beaches are like a paradise. There are huge cliffs, gurgling creeks, clear lakes, and even rolling mountains. It is a good place to embrace nature. This is the most famous summer camping site in Southern France. It is a great place to embrace nature with its cliffs, gurgling brooks, clear lakes and mountains. It is a good place to embrace nature. You can climb or play. Kayaking. But for us, with such beautiful scenery, we must fly an airplane to take an aerial photo of the blue beauty in the canyon.

If it is a special trip abroad, it is not recommended because it is a lake and canyon that is not as majestic as expected. There is a small town not far from there. Every household buys ceramics. The locals like to call it a ceramic town, but the scenery is really true. Picnic on the lake or kayaking on the lake is also a good choice

attractions.name: Cathédrale La Major
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, France, Provence-Alpes-Cote d'Azur, Bouches-du-Rhone, Marseille, Cathédrale La Major
attractions.address: Place de la Major, 13002 Marseille, France
reviews: Marseille cathedral (Cathedrale Sainte Marie - Majeure DE Marseille) is a Roman Catholic cathedral, historical sites, France in 1896 as temple. Church built in 1852 to 1852, the Byzantine - Roman type style. The bulk of the old cathedral (Vieille Major) has been removed, the rest of the stand on the side, compared with the new cathedral, in the shade.

Zhuo''s cathedral was built in the twelfth century, belong to a Roman building, the cathedral of the stately, luxuriant elegance, are gems in the 19th century Byzantine Roman architecture, see today are the result of reconstruction, but inside still have a collection of 1122 Italian artist Luca Della Robbia (made an altar, and a 15th century to the altar of Lazarus. In addition, the church and the tomb of a venerable bishop.
The Cathedral of Marseille has a long history and many things are well preserved! !

The exterior design of the church is very distinctive, with white marble and Florentine greenstone alternated with each other. The whole church is shaped like a zebra. The church is located near the Old Port of Marseille, close to the Museum of Mediterranean Civilization and the ancient castle next to the Old Port, facing the sea with a wide view. The church has four large domes, the interior space is large, and the decoration is not luxurious. There is a bronze statue of the bishop in the square outside the church. It is said that he was dedicated to his life when the plague pandemic in the eighteenth century.
The biggest church here is more majestic and worth seeing.

attractions.name: Musée des Civilisations de l'Europe et de la Méditerranée
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, France, Provence-Alpes-Cote d'Azur, Bouches-du-Rhone, Marseille, Musée des Civilisations de l'Europe et de la Méditerranée
reviews: Designed by French architect Rudy Ricciotti, the museum is like a diamond platform hanging on the seaside. The interior is very wide, including auditorium, large meeting room, shop, cafe, restaurant and other facilities.
You can learn more about the civilization of the Mediterranean, it is quite knowledgeable.

The newest landmark in Cyprus, the European Museum of Mediterranean Civilizations is really an important landscape. This museum is also a very interesting design style. The Museum of Mediterranean Civilizations also looks very novel and has a lot of collections.

The museum was designed by French architect Rudy Ricciotti. It looks like a diamond platform hanging over the sea. The interior is very wide, including an auditorium, large conference rooms, shops, cafes, restaurants and other supporting facilities.

The Museum of European and Mediterranean Civilizations is a very modern museum. There are a lot of introductions about the history and modernity of the Mediterranean. There are also many items in the museum. You can learn about the history of France here.

attractions.name: Basilique Notre-Dame-de-la-Garde
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, France, Provence, Basilique Notre-Dame-de-la-Garde
attractions.address: Rue Fort du Sanctuaire,  Marseille, France 13006
reviews: Located on the hill near the port of Marseille, the church can be seen towering into the clouds from the city of Marseille, which is the commanding height of the whole city of Marseille. The volume of the church is not very large, and it is definitely inferior to the famous European cathedrals in the world. However, the church occupies an excellent geographical location. The rooftop surrounding the church overlooks the romantic scenery of Marseille and the Mediterranean, which is refreshing. You can go up the mountain by bus or walk up the mountain, and the church is open for free. You must not miss it when you get to Marseille.

From all angles of Marseille, you can clearly see the golden Virgin and Child at the top of the temple. This statue of the Virgin and Child, which can be seen from afar, is also the protector of sailors, fishermen and all Maasai people. Reason for recommendation: There is a viewing platform under the Sanctuary of Our Lady of the Guardian. This is the best place to overlook the entire Marseille and the Port of Marseille. If you visit the sea, you can also see the prototype of the prison in "The Count of Monte Cristo": Chateau d’If . The viewing platform is especially suitable for watching the sunset. In summer, the sunset is relatively late, so you can come early and admire the inside of the temple first, otherwise the door will close at six and you will not be able to enter.

The Basilica of Our Lady of Garde is a symbol of Marseille. It is built on a hill 150 meters high. From here you can overlook the whole city of Marseille and the Mediterranean landscape. From the old port of Marseille, you can see the Cathedral of Our Lady of Garde standing on the high ground, and from the church you can see the panorama of Marseille and the Isle of Yves. The exterior and interior of the church are very magnificent and beautiful. Above the main building of the cathedral, there is a golden gilded Madonna with a height of 9.7 meters. It is said that this glittering Madonna can be seen from almost any angle in Marseille. The cathedral is an attraction that cannot be overlooked in Marseille.

We walked from the hotel to the Cathedral of Our Lady of the Garde, the sign was very clear so that the walkers could see very clearly. This is a big climb, especially in height! But it's worth it! If you don't want to walk, there is a small tourist train departing from the old port. Once you reach the top of the mountain, you can have a 360-degree view of the wonderful city landscape! Bring your camera, because this is a great place to take pictures! The cathedral is also a beautiful tour. With so much history in this place, it is definitely worth a visit.

The neatest part of this place is a narrow road southeast of the hotel. There are a few small houses on it, so the scenery there is particularly amazing. This place is superb, both inside and out. If you have time, you can look inside the church. Each painting describes death and disaster, detection and slavery. Several paintings are beautiful and thought-provoking. Don't miss it. This is the best place in the south of France, don't miss it, it can make you feel the style of Marseille again.

attractions.name: Centre de la Vieille Charite
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, France, Provence-Alpes-Cote d'Azur, Bouches-du-Rhone, Marseille, Centre de la Vieille Charite
attractions.address: 2 rue de la Charite, 13002 Marseille, France
reviews: Hospice divided into two parts, the hospital and the dome church, by the French king Louis 14 imperial architect Pierre Puget design. The master charges, he is the most famous buildings on the outskirts of Paris Versailles. The hospice church some Italian Renaissance style, but is relatively simple. Now hospice into the Mediterranean archaeological museum (Musee dArcheologie), Africa and Egypt artifacts on display.
Older buildings, you can remember the history.
The almshouse is a Baroque style building, but simple and elegant.

In 1671, the French royal family ordered the construction of a shelter for the poor, the Hospice de la Vieille Charité (Hospice de la Vieille Charité). The main purpose was to build a shelter for the poor and sick immigrants on the streets of Marseille. This is a very strange selfish attitude, not out of compassion, because the nobles asked these poor people not to leave the asylum at will, they don't like to see these poor people running around in Marseille. The center of the ancient relief house has an artistic courtyard, the Museum of Archeology (Musée d''Archéologie) and the Museum of African, Oceanic & American Indian Art (Museum of African, Oceanic & American Indian Art), which is very eye-catching. In 1671, the nobles of Marseille established a refuge for the "poor and beggars". This was the ancient almshouse in the old city of Marseille. The main body of the hospice is divided into two parts: the Pierre hospital and the dome church. It was designed by Pierre, the author of the Palace of Versailles, the queen architect of the French King Louis XIV. It has the style of the Italian Renaissance but is simpler simple. After several renovations, the current almshouse has become a comprehensive cultural center including the Mediterranean Archaeological Museum, the Egyptian Antiquities Museum, the African Art Museum, and the French Academy of Social Sciences. It is said that the completion of the ancient almshouse was not because of the great mercy of the nobles of Marseille, but because of their peculiar mentality similar to "cleanliness". They were fed up with the poor people who had been squandering the streets of Marseille for a long time. So they simply built this refuge and forced them to live in it, and they were not allowed to leave at will. Unexpectedly, hundreds of years later, this building would come in handy.

The building of the almshouse itself is very simple, and there are hardly too many tedious designs, but there are many exhibition halls inside the almshouse, which mainly display exhibits from Africa and ancient Rome, which are not rich enough, but very special. If you do not enter the exhibition hall, you do not need to buy tickets.

attractions.name: Gare de Marseille St.Charles
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, France, Provence-Alpes-Cote d'Azur, Bouches-du-Rhone, Marseille, Gare de Marseille St.Charles
reviews: The Marseille Railway Station is located in the Saint Charles area. It is not tall in appearance. Because it is built on a high slope, it takes two sections of pedestrian elevators from the station to the subway platform, one of which is very long. The facilities in the station have been modernized, and your life and services are complete. Trains enter and leave the station in a terminal style, with each platform lined up, and there is no need to go up and down the tunnel when changing.

Many soldiers patrol the railway station. I don't know if it is a special arrangement during the European Cup or it is usually done. There is a place to store luggage in the train station, which is very cheap. The large locker costs 9.5 Euro a day and can hold 3 large luggage. We deposited it. I saw many fans also come here to store their luggage. Then you can play lightly. Remember to check if the train departure time is too late, and the luggage area will open at around 8:30 in the morning, so don't delay the trip.

Marseille Railway Station is also a very important place leading to many places of travel. This small station is constantly large. The car show has transportation to other cities in France. This railway station is also a historic gate with many buildings. They are all short.

Marseille train station has high-speed rail to Paris, which is relatively convenient. It’s two subway stops away from the old port in the city center. It takes more than 20 minutes to walk. The law and order here may not be very good, so pay attention to safety.
The old buildings here are very well preserved

attractions.name: Hoi An Old Town
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Vietnam, Quang Nam, Hoi An, Hoi An Old Town
reviews: the ancient town always attracted me with it unique charming, Hoian has a lot historical significance and local foods
Charming ancient town. Walking and biking through the town is better at night. There a small river with tour boats nightly to experience the town as well.
Very beautiful town. The lanterns at night are very colorful and food is so good here. Will be back for sure!
Great ambient & environment in Hoi An ancient town, suurounding by many stalls, sip coffee to enjoy the relax moment.

The whole place is so aesthetic, eye pleasing and the vibe is just so unexplainable. Every corner is photo worthy and the cafe and shops are also very aesthetic. I couldn’t stop myself from stopping at every corner to take a photo as everything is worth admiring . And at night time it gets better the streets are filled with lanterns and the riverside is filled with lanterns and boats and bars with live music . the market is also opened around the night time and the street foods are the best thing I’ve had in Hoi An. overall it’s a great place and worth a visit !

attractions.name: Japanese Covered Bridge
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Vietnam, Quang Nam, Hoi An, Japanese Covered Bridge
attractions.address: Nguyen Thi Minh Khai, Cam Pho, Hoi An
reviews: located right in the central of town, you definitely have to visit when you have came Hoian

Hoi An is just an achingly beautiful place, made even more beautiful by signature artistic flourishes such as the Japanese Covered Bridge.More than just a bridge, it was originally constructed in the 1590's and to connect two very different parts of town - the Chinese community and the Vietnamese community. Today this stunning wooden bridge is the gateway to the narrow streets of the old town. It's a lovely symbol of Hoi An's inclusive history and makes a great Instagram shot too!

The western extremity of Tran Phu is marked by a small arched bridge of red-painted wood, popularly known as the Japanese Covered Bridge, which has been adopted as Hoi An’s emblem.It was known to exist in the mid-sixteenth century, and has subsequently been reconstructed several times to the same simple design. According to local folklore, the bridge was erected after Japan suffered a series of violent earthquakes which geomancers attributed to a restless monster lying with its head in India, tail in Japan and heart in Hoi An. The only remedy was to build a bridge whose stone piles would drive a metaphorical sword through the beast’s heart and fortuitously provide a handy passage across the muddy creek.
The most iconic site in Old Town it's not the most beautiful in my opinion. Have a look, take a picture and move on to something more characteristic.
The bridge is Japanese but the temple is Chinese , it's  amazing how the wooden structure hold such a big flow of tourist everyday!

attractions.name: Site Archeologique de My Son
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Vietnam, Quang Nam, Site Archeologique de My Son
reviews: Come to the moon to must come to Meishan always to see, here can not only feel beautiful not to say my words can also feel different scenery of Vietnam, the opportunity to go to the lover's hand walk in the car under the wash of the culture, good.

The mini version of Angkor Wat in Vietnam, but the magnificence and protection of the building are still far behind Angkor Wat. The place is very remote. We went by chartered car. There are few tourists. It may be because it is relatively hot at noon. Although there are no tourists, there is no desire to take pictures. It is too hot. The entire scenic spot can be seen everywhere in the large pits that were exploded by bombs dropped by the US military during the Vietnam War. Decades have passed. The pits are covered with grass, but the traces of the war cannot be erased. The Vietnamese tour guide said that these small temples built by the ancients were made of special materials and would not grow grass. Grass would grow in places where they were restored by later generations.
Remember to come back and forth to see it together, not only people here say I do not have the imprint of the Vietnam era and so it is the most desirable place for people.
It is a complex of buildings of the same race and style as Angkor Wat in Cambodia, so it is also called Little Angkor.

The Mỹ Sơn Sanctuary of Meishan was built in the fourth century AD. It is a complex with more than 70 temple towers and sculptures typical of each historical period of the Cham Kingdom. The architectural styles here are divided into 6 categories: ancient style, Hualai, Tongyang, Meishan, PoNagar and peace style. Most of the architectural works and sculptures are influenced by Hinduism. It was also a place for ancient sacrifices and the tombs of the kings and princes of the Chămpa Cham Dynasty. If you like ancient culture, don’t miss it. ️

attractions.name: Myeong Dong
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, South Korea, Seoul, Myeong Dong
reviews: Bustling Myeong-dong is a shopping area packed with international fashion brands, luxury department stores and homegrown cosmetics shops. Casual eateries offer Korean dumplings and ginseng chicken soup, while street vendors sell Japanese and Thai snacks. Shows mixing folk music and drama are staged at Myeongdong Nanta Theatre. Nearby 19th-century Myeong-dong Cathedral features a Gothic-style bell tower.
i love this place so much. have a lot of things to buy
fo rthose who really love shoppings. this place is perfect for you. you'll love the street foods also. try different kind of korean food. love this place i really like to spend night here.
amazing i visit this area before 4 years i love it sooooo much
it was fun and I enjoyed everything 😊

attractions.name: N Seoul Tower
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, South Korea, Seoul, N Seoul Tower
attractions.open_status: 10:00-23:00 (Monday-Thursday, Sunday), 10:00-24:00 (Friday, Saturday). Opening hours may change due to factors such as weather condition. Ticket collection time: 10:00-22:30 (Monday-Thursday, Sunday), 10:00-23:30 (Friday, Saturday).
reviews: The N Seoul Tower (Korean: N서울타워), officially the YTN Seoul Tower and commonly known as the Namsan Tower or Seoul Tower, is a communicationand observation tower located on Namsan Mountainin central Seoul, South Korea. The 236-meter (774 ft)-tall tower marks the second highest point in Seoul.
Usually gets pretty crowded. Best to go during sunset. But you would have to time it very well. If you're lucky, you would get a beautiful view of Seoul. Remember to bring you own locks too!
ชอบไปที่นี่มาก สวยมากก แนะนำให้ไปกันนะ

The N Seoul Tower is located south of the city hall area. it is difficuly to grt to As it is on a hill in a large park . you can take a sky tram to the tower area. There is a fee for the sky tram . There is a fee to go up the tower. There is a restaurant at the top. They recently cleaned the windows so the views are clear at the time of this writing . i suggest you go about 45 minutes before sunset to get the best photos. It will get crowded at sunset time so another reasonto arrive a bit early

This is an awesome place to get a really good view of Seoul!  You can get inside and outside view.  There are restaurants in here for eating and several places to buy souvenirs.  Cable car ride to the top was a little scary.

attractions.name: Gyeongbokgung Palace
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, South Korea, Seoul, Gyeongbokgung Palace
attractions.open_status: Open from 1/1-2/28,Mon,Wed-Sun,9:00am-5:00pm;Open from 3/1-5/31,Mon,Wed-Sun,9:00am-6:00pm;Open from 6/1-8/31,Mon,Wed-Sun,9:00am-6:30pm;Open from 9/1-10/31,Mon,Wed-Sun,9:00am-6:00pm;Open from 11/1-12/31,Mon,Wed-Sun,9:00am-5:00pm;Closed on Tue
reviews: Gyeongbokgung (Korean: 경복궁; Hanja: 景福宮), also known as Gyeongbokgung Palace or Gyeongbok Palace, was the main royal palace of the Joseon dynasty. Built in 1395, it is located in northern Seoul, South Korea. The largest of the Five Grand Palacesbuilt by the Joseon dynasty, Gyeongbokgung served as the home of Kings of the Joseon dynasty, the Kings' households, as well as the government of Joseon.
เป็นพระราชวังที่มีความสวยงามมาก ชอบมาก

The most beautiful palace in seoul, a great tips is to rent an hanbok (traditional clothing), if you do so, the entry to the palace is free. Moreover, you can enjoy visiting this place in the closing people where wearing then. No need to feel strange about it a lot of people are doing so, the fees of renting it is between 10 000 ₩ to 35 000₩ depending the model and the place you choose.
a perfect place for photo ops! the Hanbok rentals are outside the palace but you can get in the palace for free if you wear traditional clothing in!

This was the busiest but also one of the most beautiful palaces. I loved every minute spent here! I was lucky enough to arrive just before the free English guided tour around the palace which was excellent and highly informative. They give free tours in English, Chinese and Korean so be sure to look up what times these are.

attractions.name: COEX Aquarium
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, South Korea, Seoul, COEX Aquarium
attractions.address: 513 Yeongdong-daero, Samseong 1(il)-dong, Gangnam-gu, 서울특별시 South Korea
reviews: เป็นห้างที่มีอะไรน่าสนใจเยอะมาก มีห้องสมุดด้วย มีพิพิธภัณฑ์สัตว์น้ำด้วย

The COEX Aquarium in Gangnam district, Seoul, is one of South Korea's largest Aquariums with over 40,000 creatures from over 650 species on display.The COEX Aquarium features 90 exhibition tanks grouped in fourteen "discovery zones",including six themed areas.The aquarium is housed within the COEX mall, which is, itself, part of the larger COEX Convention & Exhibition Center. The aquarium opened in 2000.
a place worth to visit in Seoul. there’s many kind of fish and very interesting things to see
very good way to spend an afternoon. entertaining and informative! a must for anyone with a spare afternoon in Seoul
wonderful with many fish, shark. I was very impressed

attractions.name: Bukchon Hanok Village
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, South Korea, Seoul, Bukchon Hanok Village
reviews: Bukchon Hanok Village is a Korean traditional villagein Seoul with a long history located on the top of a hill between Gyeongbok Palace, Changdeok Palace and Jongmyo Royal Shrine. The traditional village is composed of many alleys, hanok and is preserved to show a 600-year-old urban environment.
ชอบที่นี่มากกก แลบสวยมากอ่ะ แต่ว่าแนะนำให้มาฤดูหนาวนะ

The Buichon Hanok Village is between two of the palaces in Seoul and is on the North side of the city . A main road going North to South seperates this village area into two sections. The larger section is on the west side of the road . the buildings in this area are very well maintained and are occupied by current residence people . There are signs every where telling you to keep you voices down. There are also monitors or helpers on the street to answer your questions or to help you with photos . The area is on a hill so it does give you good views of the Seoul Skyline.
A beautiful old style village where you can see traditional Korean houses and part take in some traditional Korean arts and crafts. This is a must see if you are ever in Seoul

get an opportunity to wear a hanok and explore this lovely villiage. You can rent a hanok for 30 minutes to 2 hours. Follow the map around the village to see all the beautiful homes, stores and places to eat, you can also visit a tea shop. Great experience

attractions.name: Cheong Wa Dae
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, South Korea, Seoul, Cheong Wa Dae
reviews: Cheongwadae (Korean: 청와대; Hanja: 靑瓦臺; literally "pavilion of blue tiles"),also known as the Blue House, is the executive office and official residenceof the Republic of Korea's head of state, the President of the Republic of Korea, located in Jongno-gu of the capital Seoul. Cheongwadae is in fact a complex of multiple buildings, built largely in the traditional Korean architectural style with some modern architectural elements and facilities. The Blue House is the most protected official residence in Asia.
เป็นที่ที่สำคัญ แต่เข้าไปไม่ได่น่ะ

Korea Political Center Free visit to the Republic of Korea Presidential Palace TOP10 Qingwatai is the Republic of Korea Presidential Palace, located in the northwestern Seoul City, facing the Jingfu Palace, backed by North Prison Mountain and Mount Inwang, is the Korean political center. The twisting path extends from the Jingfu Palace to the tile roof, and on the left side is the stone wall of Jingfu Palace, and on the right side is the art museum. The Qingwatai is composed of the main building, guesthouse, green garden, infinite flower garden, seven palaces and so on located in the center, all the buildings are built according to the traditional Korean building model. The main building on the right side is the Spring and Autumn Hall, the roof is made of traditional ceramic tiles, used for the press conference; On the left side of the main building is a guest house, which is used to receive foreign guests.

The Blue House is the official residence of the President of South Korea. It is located at No. 1, Sejong-ro, Jongno-gu, Seoul. It was originally the palace of the Goryeo Dynasty. After the Joseon Dynasty established the capital of Seoul (Seoul) in 1426, it was used as the back garden of Gyeongbokgung Palace.
Very good and worth a visit. Incheon Airport Korean brother welcomes you! Trip.com, micro-identifier.

attractions.name: Ewha Womans University
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, South Korea, Seoul, Ewha Womans University
attractions.address: 52 Ewhayeodae-gil, Sinchon-dong, Seodaemun-gu, Seoul, South Korea
reviews: เป็นมหาวิทยาลัยที่สวยมาก เชื่อว่า ใครๆที่มาเกาหลีก็ต้องมาที่นี่

Ewha Womans University (Korean: 이화여자대학교; Hanja: 梨花女子大學校) is a private women's university in Seoul founded in 1886 by Mary F. Scranton under Emperor Gojong. It is the first founded university in South Korea. Currently, Ewha is the world's largest female educational institute as well as one of the most prestigious universities in South Korea.
For me, life should be like this！keep on studying.Discovering more about the world will bring much more fun to your life.

The University of the pear flower women's college was founded in 1886, is one of the oldest universities in Seoul, Korea. The original name of the pear flower school, changed to pear flower women's university in 1948, is the world's largest female education institution. · elegance of European-style buildings and spectacular classrooms with underwater architecture appealing to countless visitors.
Very good and worth a visit. Korean Chinese brother welcomes you! Trip.com, micro-identifier.

attractions.name: Cheonggyecheon
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, South Korea, Seoul, Cheonggyecheon
reviews: Cheonggyecheon is a 10.9-kilometre-long (6.8 mi), modern public recreation space in downtown Seoul, South Korea. The massive urban renewal project is on the site of a stream that flowed before the rapid post-war economic developmentcaused it to be covered by transportation infrastructure. The $900 million project initially attracted much public criticism but, since opening in 2005, has become popular among residents and tourists.
เป็นคลองที่สวยมากกก เดินเล่นกลางคืนสบายๆ

My favorite place in Seoul. You can get to many landmarks just walking along Cheonggyechon, which is about 5km long. I usually start at the Plaza (with spiral fountain) and stop by Dongdaemun Market with its various shopping malls. You can take awesome pictures along the way.

It was breezy and cool to walk along the stream in May and we decided to sit at the pavement to relax, drink our tea and ate our snacks, and also to get a bit of sunlight because we felt a bit chill.  Love this place.
Went over the Winer Holiday and the park was beautifully lit with many photo opportunities and stands to eat.

attractions.name: Namsan Park
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, South Korea, Seoul, Namsan Park
reviews: เป็นสวนที่สวยมากก มาเดินเล่นตอนเย็นๆคือดีมากก

Nam Mountain is a 262-meter-high peak in the Jung-gu district of south central Seoul, South Korea. Although known as Mongmyeoksan, or 목멱산 / 木覓山 in the past, it is now commonly referred to as Mt. Namsan. It offers some hiking, picnic areas and views of downtown Seoul's skyline.
well known place in Seoul where you must visit there if you go to Seoul City. You can seeing seoul city from 7000 feet in the high place
nice view, specially on autumn season. i went here 3x. and want to go back again this year
For me South Korea is the best place to go. I love living here🥰😇

attractions.name: Insadong
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, South Korea, Seoul, Insadong
reviews: The focal point of lively Insadong is its pedestrianized main street, which is crammed with teahouses and Korean eateries, plus shops selling traditional goods like pottery, tea and handmade hanji paper. The offbeat Ssamziegil complex has cozy cafes and mural-lined stairwells leading to a roof terrace, while the Hakgojae gallery shows modern art. Leafy Tapgol Park has a massive stone pagoda.
ย่านอินซาดง ที่ไม่ว่าใครมาเกาหลี ก็ต้องมาที่นี่
Nice places to hang around besides myeongdong, hongdae. There are many local people in these area. It located near the traditional Korean village, can go after that.

It is an icon building in Insadong.  There were many small shops selling different things, from personalised travel luggage tags, costume jewellery, personalised woodcraft for welcoming guests to your house, clothings, eateries, etc.  I would say every business is showcasing its uniqueness.  And bring more money with you because many of these items are so tempting to own it.  Outside this icon building are the streets of houses selling all types of souvenirs, restaurants, and so on.  And one of the lane can bring you to the Joygesa Temple too.
If I visit Seoul again~ sure I will come this place and spend a day~

attractions.name: Genghis Khan Square
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Mongolia, Ulaanbaatar, Genghis Khan Square
reviews: A fantastic place to stroll around, hang around and see locals on their daily lives in Ulaan. Windy place and you can enjoy the huge area including a garden upfront the square. The Choijin Lama Temple is actually a cluster of four temples originally occupied by the Choijin Lama Luvsankhaidav, the brother of the ruler Bogh Khan who was a mighty leader at that time. There is a ticket price to enter the temple, once in, you are free to walk into any of the four temples which contain historical artifacts of Buddhist art including sculptures of Zanabazar, brightly coloured coral masks for the traditional Tsam Dance and silk tangkas. Well worth a visit if you wish to delve deeper into the Buddhist lineage in Mongolia.
Lamaism is rare in Mongolia, and museums are rare.

The Lama Temple Museum is also a very large venue. You can see many good things here. The Lama Temple is also a very special religious form in Mongolia. The structure of the temple is very strong and it is also a good place to visit. Place.

Qiaojin Lama Temple Museum This small temple is located in the center of the city. It is one of the few Buddhist buildings that survived the Buddhist purge in the 1930s. The temple contains some treasures of Buddhist art, including paintings by the famous religious reformer and artist Zanabazar in the 17th century, as well as shaman dance masks, exotic bronzes, silk tapestries and other artworks.

attractions.name: Yarlung Zangbo Grand Canyon
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Tibet, Nyingchi, Yarlung Zangbo Grand Canyon
reviews: The total length 504.6 km, the deepest 6009 m, the average depth of 2268 m, is the world's largest canyon. Some of the main falls are in 30-50 m. The canyon has 9 vertical natural zones, ranging from high mountain ice and snow to low valley rainforest, and brings together a variety of biological resources, including 2/3 of known higher plant species in the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau, 1/2 of known mammals, 4/5 of known insects, and 3/5 of known macrofungi in China.

The deepest canyon on the earth, the true peach blossom source is here, the closer to the Grand Canyon, the more and more peach blossoms, but not as good as the concentration of Bomi peach blossom gully, the peach blossoms in the valley, the willow green on the beach, the green river water, the winding snow mountain, you never know how many painting winds Tibet will change for you - oh , my god !
Driving through the Grand Canyon of Brahmaputra, must punch in, the scenery is pleasant, beautiful scenery, beautiful scenery, interesting, pure natural natural scenery, amazing, great.

The scenery is really beautiful, it can be called a paradise on earth and a paradise. There is no one in my opinion. If you have the opportunity, you should also take your family to visit again and share this pure and quiet beauty! The air is transparent and the water is clear and green, which is not seen in the mainland at all. The blue sky and white clouds are not mentioned. There is also the world's largest canyon, which is very spectacular and majestic. You can also see Nanga Bawa Peak. It is the most beautiful snow mountain in China. ! There are also plants that I have never seen before, like a science lesson. I took a hot air balloon, which is said to be the highest in the world. It feels good to fly on the roof of the world. The service attitude of the bus driver in the scenic area is very good, let me don’t worry, don’t run, take my time, so caring, I must like it👍

The Grand Canyon starts from Daduka village, Paizhen, Milin County, at 3000 meters above sea level, passes through the great turn of the Brahmaputra River in Pailong Township, and goes south to Baxika village, Meto County, at 115 meters above sea level. The main part of the Grand Canyon is in Meto County, the largest and deepest canyon on the earth.

attractions.name: Bayi Town
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Tibet, Nyingchi, Bayi Town
attractions.address: Bayi Zhen, Bayi, Nyingchi, Tibet, China
reviews: Bayi Town is the seat of the Nyingchi government. It is a city surrounded by snow-capped mountains, surrounded by the Niyang River, and dancing with white clouds. It is extremely convenient for food, lodging and transportation. I like walking on the Niyang River in the morning. The clouds are ever-changing!
Very nice! Good? Good!!!!!

Bayi Town is the center of Nyingchi. It has now been renamed Bayi District. It is the lowest altitude area on the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau. It has a temperate humid monsoon climate with abundant rainfall and sufficient sunshine, mild and dry winters, and humid summers without high temperatures. The vegetation types here are very rich, from subtropical to frigid zone plants grow, it is called "Tibet Jiangnan".

The seat of the Bayi Town government was originally called "La Riga". Before the PLA arrived here in the 1950s, it was a chaotic beach. After the PLA arrived here, construction began, so it was called Bayi Town.

Bayi Town is the capital of Nyingchi, Tibet. It is located on the Niyang River, more than 30 kilometers away from the confluence of the Yarlung Zangbo and Niyang River, and more than 400 kilometers away from Lhasa. In the early years, this town was a base camp for aid-Tibet construction in Yunnan, Sichuan and other inland areas. A large number of convoys from Sichuan-Tibet Highway and Yunnan-Tibet Highway passed through here. Therefore, there are many inland people here. Restaurants and restaurants are opened in the town. There are many people in Sichuan who open hotels and shops.

Buda Castle

reviews: The Budav ri palata (Budav ri palata) is a palace built on the right bank of the Danube by the Aruba Dynasty in the 13 century, and the Budapest in Turkey occupied the Budapest, and it was partially rebuilt in the 18 century, and it was restored and expanded in the middle of the 19 century, and it became a new Baroque building. After the devastation of World War II, a special reconstruction committee was set up to rebuild the Potala Palace. The center of the palace is now part of the Historical Museum, the National Gallery and the Museum of the Workers Movement. The museum displays historical materials about Budapest and Hungary, and chronologically. The gallery displays mainly the works of Hungarian representative painters and sculptors.

Buda Palace was built in 1247
Is the ancient court of Hungary
The southern end of the Buda Castle in the capital Budapest
A group of neo-baroque ancient buildings

The area of the palace accounts for 1/3 of the castle area
The building is magnificent,

European palaces have their own characteristics, and this palace is also very beautiful.

The Buda Palace is located on the Buda side of Budapest, Hungary, with Fisherman’s Bastion and Matthias Church on the north and Buda Castle Hill on the south. The Buda Palace is nowhere near as famous as the Fisherman’s Bastion, Matthias Church, and the Capitol on the other side of the river, but its spectacular appearance and highly recognizable green dome shape are undoubtedly Buda One The most obvious landmark on the side. The Buda Palace is currently open to the public as an art gallery. From the palace you can choose to go up and down by cable car or elevator.

I wrote this review to remind all visitors that when you arrive at the Buda Palace, in addition to looking at the Pest and the Capitol on the opposite bank, don’t miss the scenery behind the Buda Palace. Behind the Buda Palace, you can see Buda, this small mountain city, with a feeling of overlapping mountains. Especially, if you come here in spring, the back of the Grand Palace is full of cherry blossoms, and it is the double cherry blossoms! Very bright and beautiful! Not inferior to the cherry blossoms seen in Japan!

From the top of the dome, you can have stunning views of the city! Always remember to dress respectfully and be quiet when visiting the church.
A beautiful basilica, donate upon entering. Don't miss relics and beautiful windows.

attractions.name: Castle Hill
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Hungary, Pest, Budapest, Castle Hill
reviews: 2018.06.05 Even if the sun is shining in my eyes, I must come to Castle Hill to see the panoramic view of Budapest. Ride the cable car to the castle, with a wide view, and the round-trip fare is very fair. The cable car has been in operation since the Middle Ages, when it was driven by steam. The cable car, which had been changed to electric drive, took us to the top of the mountain in less than 2 minutes. Standing at the highest point of Buda, looking around, the Danube is right in front of you, and Pest on the other side of the chain bridge is quiet and charming. As I remember, the side with the castle is Buda. In just three days, I have been deeply attracted by this beautiful and magnificent city. If you plan to travel to Europe, remember to include Hungary in the list of cities. It will not disappoint.

Budapest Castle Hill is the earliest old city in Budapest. It is like a huge museum showing the history of Hungary's development from ancient times to the present. Standing on the Castle Hill overlooking the city, Budapest is full of weather, picturesque scenery, visual impact, the wide Danube River passes through the city, the Baroque buildings on both sides of the city and the majestic castle complement each other, and a majestic imperial atmosphere is oncoming.
More scenic spots worth seeing, the scenery is still very good.

Castle Hill is located on the Buda side of Budapest, Hungary. The famous Fisherman's Bastion, Majiaszhai Church and Buda Palace are all located on the Castle Hill. If you are going to the Buda Palace on Castle Hill, you can consider using a cable car or elevator. If you are going to Fisherman’s Bastion, you can take a direct bus.

Budapest Castle Hill
Budapest Castle Hill is the earliest old city in Budapest. It is like a huge museum, showing the history of Budapest’s urban development and the past of the Hungarian nation.
The topography of Castle Hill is dangerous. It sits on a hill 167 meters above sea level on the bank of the Danube. Choosing such a place to build the castle was obviously out of the need for war defense.
The most famous attractions in Castle Hill are:
The Holy Trinity Square is the central square of Castle Hill. The Trinity Memorial Column, also known as the "Plague Column", was erected by the residents of the old city in the 18th century to commemorate the elimination of the Black Death.
Matthias Church (Santa Maria Church, Church of the Assumption), it has 700 years of history.
Fisherman’s Bastion, the white Fisherman’s Bastion is next to the Matthias Church. This is a neo-Gothic building built on the foundation of the original medieval city wall at the beginning of the last century. The 7 minaret-like bunkers represent the 7 tribes of the early Magya people in Hungary. Standing on the city of Fisherman’s Bastion, the Danube River flows quietly from underfoot. The parliament building on the opposite bank, various buildings along the river, the lush Margit Island and the distant mountains have a panoramic view. The mood suddenly became clear. No wonder it is recognized that the Fisherman’s Bastion adds a lot to the castle’s landscape.
The bronze statue between the Matthias Church and the Fisherman’s Castle is the coronation in 1000 AD, the founder of the Hungarian state, and the first Hungarian King Saint Istavan I.
The southern end of Castle Hill is completely occupied by the grand ancient palace. As long as you see the bullet-scarred and crumbling old palace gate that has not been repaired so far, you can imagine the historical ordeal that this famous European palace has experienced.
Castle Hill is free and open all day. The tour time takes about 2-3 hours. It is also a great place to watch the view of Budapest and the Danube, and the night view is also very beautiful.

In the Dutch ports near Rotterdam and Amsterdam, windmills are mills, sawmills and paper mills. Windmills play a huge role in this arduous project as the Dutch people build land and sea. First, they put the top of the windmill on the roller wheel, which is called the Dutch windmill.

Flying directly from Hong Kong to Amsterdam in mid November 2019, then take the city rail from the Central Railway Station to the windmill village (the flight is dense), the temperature is about 5 degrees, wear large down, the weather is normal, but can play so far, see the windmill in the textbook, I feel moved, and I will never forget it.

The beautiful Netherlands, as a lowland country, the most important project is the drainage project in the low-lying land. As an important part of the drainage system, the windmill has the features of functionality and beauty at the same time. It has become a beautiful scenery in tourist attractions. Schans Windmill Village is only a half-day trip away from Amsterdam.

Lisse flower bed near Keukenhof, just 10 minutes drive outside Keukenhof garden, you can walk along the aisle to enjoy those fully bloom tulips!
[scene] Spring is so good! ! ! !

The coolness of the cold winter is just like the flowers just stick out their heads to declare eternal love ~ Visiting Keukenhof, the country of flowers, does not bother you. The park is located between Amsterdam and The Hague and can be accessed by the A4 highway (Nieuw-Vennep exit) and the A44 highway ( Exit Lisse 3) Arrive at the flower viewing shuttle bus: You can purchase a package including return bus tickets and Keukenhof tickets. reviews: Green eyes, flowers like brocade, no cars, boats are a stepping tool, quiet beautiful.

I like oil painting, and I dreamed that the world through the frame would one day become my home. After growing up, I still like oil painting, but I feel that the world in oil painting is not real. But this time... When I set foot on this small village far from home, the first thing I saw was a large area of distinct but soft green. I was amazed at the supernatural workmanship of nature, the world in the original oil painting actually exists. ￼￼￼How to start from Amsterdam, Netherlands: You can buy a round-trip pass for 39 euros at the Amsterdam train station, including train transfer and bus, and there are super cute maps of other cities. On the way to the train, you can enjoy the natural scenery outside the window, but remember, there is a transfer in the middle, you need to change a train to Steenwijk in Zwolle The place name of the station is displayed on the train, which can be easily checked. When you get to Steenwijk, you can find the No. 70 bus stop (you can take the pass with the pass) when you get out of the train station. Then you will get off at Dominee TO Hylkemaweg, Giethoorn in Giethoorn. The whole journey takes more than 2 hours. . Among them, bus No. 70 returns from Giethoorn to Steenwijk at the latest at 19:09 from Monday to Friday, and at 18:06 on weekends. So friends can refer to the schedule to have fun. It is added that the earliest bus No. 70 from Steenwijk to Giethoorn is at 06:57 from Monday to Friday, 08:27 on Saturday, and 09:26 on Sunday. Xiaotian’s travel suggestions: 1. For the trip to Giethoorn, Xiaotian recommends that everyone go for a day trip without accommodation and return on the same day. Giethoorn is not big. If the schedule is tight, there is no need to spend extra time and money. But if you want to spend a holiday here, it’s not a good idea to experience a local B&B. For self-service travelers who are not restricted by their itinerary, it is recommended to spend 2-3 days on vacation here. Rent a cabin and a small wooden boat in the camping area, or rent a bicycle to stroll around the boulevards, and enjoy the joy of life in the closest way to nature. 2. The camera equipment must be fully charged. The beautiful scenery here is indeed picturesque. You can call yourself a picture scroll when you take a picture. You can choose some bright clothes to match the beautiful scenery. 3. Don’t worry if you don’t know how to swim. Giethoorn’s climate is pleasant, and the boats are steady and slow. Please enjoy the spring lake here. Of course, if you suffer from seasickness, it is always safe to prepare medicine. The scenery like an oil painting, the simple and enthusiastic residents, away from the hustle and bustle of Taoyuan, welcome you to enjoy a beautiful holiday here! (Best travel time from April to October)

[Scenery] The beauty of Giethoorn is not only the beauty of nature, but also the beauty of humanistic care during the trip! After we got off the train, the driver who took the bus to the village made me appreciate the enthusiasm of pointing; when I entered the village entrance Van de Jonge restaurant and hotel, I once again felt at home, without looking at the passport, but directly into the afternoon. During the tea time, I arranged a dinner menu for us; I woke up early and went shopping in the village, and the boys and girls on bicycles heard good morning sounds in Dutch and English. I also heard Chinese "Good morning"! [Fun] One day in Taoyuan, the world has been thousands of years. Learn about the architectural features here, the special thatch, and the nearly lost craftsmanship! [Value for money] You won’t miss it!
It is far away from the hustle and bustle, pure and peaceful, completely free from outside intrusion.

Giethoorn, a classic windmill water village around Amsterdam. It takes 40 minutes to get there directly by bus, and you can use the Amsterdam wide area ticket, which is suitable for a day round trip from the airport. Windmill lake view, blue sky and white clouds, plus black and white cows, very strong Dutch flavor. Recommended.

attractions.name: Anne Frank House
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Netherlands, Noord-Holland, Amsterdam, Anne Frank House
attractions.open_status: Sun - Fri 9:00 AM - 7:00 PM, Sat 9:00 AM - 10:00 PM
reviews: Really cool!! There was quite a lot of people waiting to go inside but the line is totally worth it,
Amazing history and feel! Prebook unless you want to wait in the longest line. Give yourself plenty of time for this one.
So much history. Definitely worth the trip. Be sure to get your tix way ahead of time online...i didn't and had to wait outside for over 2 hours!!!

Glad I finally got to visit here, and it’s hard to find the words to describe this place. Instead of trying to capture the experience in a review, I’ll leave a tip. Online tickets are posted 2 months in advance. They sell out quickly, but more tickets are released in batches up to the day of the tour, so just keep checking the website during Dutch working hours. We managed to get ours the day of the visit.

I have always wanted to visit this and I was waiting for a long time.I loved the city as well, and I think Amsterdam is one of the most wonderful cities in Europe with lot of history behind its name.Visiting Anna's house was, for me, like a dream come true. I don't know how many time I have read the book or watched the movies.I loved looking at their stuff and I could not get the fact that they once lived there, where I am standing. It was extra extraordinary for me.It was repaired a lot, and I know it's not the same but it's still very OK and I loved every second of it.It's not expensive at all, but be careful with booking, as you will need to do it online and ahead.

attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Netherlands, Noord-Holland, Amsterdam, Centraal Station
reviews: Simply a very beautiful train station. It has an authentic Dutch building style, with amazing view looking at the canal where you can embark for the canal tour. The station itself is very big, but do not worry, you won’t get lost, as the signs are very clear and the people there will always be ready to help you :)
The train station gives me the impression of being in a European movie, with a high ceiling and a sharp train but the interior seats are obviously different from what they were before.

The square in front of Amsterdam Central Station is very wide, with a river winding through the middle. What made me curious was that a two-story parking garage at the door was filled with all kinds of bicycles.
The old station in the heart of the Netherlands, which is a historic, well-designed, convenient stop for travel to parts of Europe.

Amsterdam Central Station is a beautiful building built in 1889. Outside the station is the lively Central Railway Station Square. Viewing the railway station building from the square, there are towers on either side of it. One is a clock tower and the other is a weather vane. For the Dutch who deal with sailboats and windmills, it is very important to have wind direction information.

Showy mountains and waters, fragrant rape flowers, beautiful environment, worth to visit, cost-effective...
The view of the cascading waterfalls is nice and the view is nice
Very good, very satisfied, but a little bit not so good to make a little bit of rape flower sea, you will find better overall, great value for money,

attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Yunnan, Qujing, Luoping, Lubuge "Little Three Gorges"
reviews: Ok, went to see the Canyon.

Been there many times, the only thing that attracts my friends and me is the "Little Three Gorges Copper Pot Fish" which is super super!
The sour bamboo shoots are great, sour, immortal, and fragrant, and they can’t make their way!
There are also fried fish cubes, God, the aftertaste is also going to drool now! The outside is crispy, the mouth is full of fragrance! Unique!

He can also stay in his home, the style is simple, fresh and clean, and I have experienced the feeling of sleeping on the shore, great! The air is so fresh that you can't bear to sleep in!
The scenery is very beautiful and it is worth playing. The scenery is good, it is recommended, the experience is very good, interesting and fun,

The scenery is pleasant, the whole journey is done by boat, and there are many unique stockades on the way. Yunnan is on the left side of the river, and Guizhou is on the right side of the river. I never thought Guizhou was so close to us. I like it very much! The scenery is good, it is recommended, the experience is very good, interesting and fun,

We went in March and saw the Luoping rape blossoms and the Little Three Gorges Canyon. The scenery is beautiful, the mountain peaks are steep, the water surface is like a mirror, the blue sky and white clouds, the cauliflower is golden, it is a good trip! The wind is strong on the river, so you must prepare wind-proof clothes.

attractions.name: Jiulong Waterfalls
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Yunnan, Qujing, Luoping, Jiulong Waterfalls
reviews: one of the best waterfalls in yunnan province , worth visiting
Good view, nice waterfall. Nothing like Giuzhaiguo but good for local travels.

Jiang Ji/Travel Notes: Luoping Jiulong Waterfall Jiulong Waterfall is located in Luoping County, Qujing. I went again because there was no water when I went last time, so I didn't think it was. I just spent a day in the farmland. This time, after inquiring about the situation, I finally got my wish. I have seen a lot of waterfalls. To put it bluntly, it is not a big spectacle. The main reason is the drop and scale. Of course, it is very important whether it is the rainy season. If you encounter the feat of a foreign waterfall that went against the sky a few days ago, it will be hard to come by. The advantage of Jiulong Waterfall is that it is crowded. We enter from the west gate of the scenic spot, which is regarded as the back door. There are very few tourists entering from the west gate. The advantage of the back door is not that it does not require money, but that it is located at a high position, so the biggest advantage of visiting the waterfalls in reverse is that there is no need to climb. The greenery with bamboo as the main vegetation along the way is refreshing, and some terraced fields add a humanistic atmosphere, which becomes a landscape of mountains, rocks and water, green plants and blue sky. When you walk down the stairs, you will encounter several stalls selling water and corn and sweet potatoes. Water is the price of the scenic spot, and corn is the standard of the vegetable market. If you want to come to the countryside, the things grown in the land are worthless. There are also a few wild tour guides, the local women who are more articulate, will come forward to pull business, but will not entangle. The waterfalls here are beautiful. Where there is a large amount of water, a diffused mist will form. The small amount of water is like a crystal-clear jade bead curtain. The green between the mountains and the water is more dense. With the fresh air, it really is a place worth visiting. There is a tea pavilion shop on the mountainside. The wooden structure is quite simple, but the seller is not friendly. A cup of tea with paper cups that can’t tell what it is costs 15 yuan. We chose to sit near the waterfall. Next, the right to drink tea and smoke when buying tickets again. The water quality I visited this time is said to be quite good. When there is plenty of rain, the mud and sand will be washed down, and the water will become turbid, but there is still a gap with the clearer waterfall I have seen, but it is much more unique because of its richness. , It's not a concealment. When you reach the bottom section, you can enjoy the scenery of the multi-cascade waterfall. The waterfall surface is also wide. It is difficult to take a panoramic view with a mobile phone, and it can be said to be a little spectacular. Then go out to the main entrance of the scenic spot, which is the east gate. There is a group of welcoming waterfalls at the entrance, which looks like a large-scale bonsai, very elegant. Of course, it is nothing new to enter from the west gate to here. There is a large parking lot and a souvenir shop at the front entrance. We found a black car to ride back to the west gate. The fare of ten yuan per person is very fair. After all, the uphill road for several kilometers is not so easy. Then we stayed at Longyu B&B near Ximen and ate chicken soup and freshly picked vegetables. It was very delicious. We also drank some small roasts made by the owner. The room was clean and affordable, and we had a relaxing day.

The Jiulong Waterfalls in Luoping, Yunnan is one of the six most beautiful waterfalls in my country recommended by the magazine "Chinese National Geographic", 22 kilometers away from Luoping County. Due to the special geological structure and the millennia of erosion by the water flow, ten-level waterfalls with different shapes and heights have been formed here. The largest one is 112 meters wide and 56 meters high. It is magnificent and spectacular. The first waterfall in Kowloon. The Jiulong Waterfalls group has its own unique viewing characteristics due to its numerous waterfalls and dense scenic spots. The scenery is continuous throughout the year. It is known as the "Nine Dragons Ten Waterfalls, a unique in the South".

The Jiulong Waterfalls group is particularly powerful, because the many waterfalls are gathered together, so there is a roar of ten thousand horses, which makes many tourists who come to it amazed. This life is proud of seeing such waterfalls.

attractions.name: Phoenix Valley
