reviews: Come to Phoenix Valley this scenic spot, feel "high, big, dangerous, strange", contain the local area is quiet environment, beautiful picture "screen map", let the tourist in such a single landscape space lingering, feel the beauty of the geography of the mountains and rivers.
The scenery is good, that is, the tickets are not included, all items have to be re-purchased, it feels that the price is not high.
The view is good,

Ticket office tickets and boat tickets, tickets are sold separately, and it is very confusing. Because there is a car at the end of the trip, you don't have to take the return car. Ask the staff if the boat must be taken, the answer is yes. Ask why the tickets are sold separately, not including tickets together, the answer is because a ticket for an attraction ticket and a transportation ticket can not be together. . . But you need to buy it first, you can't buy tickets inside. It turns out that this person is nonsense. The boat road and the land road near the end point are both available, the journey is not long, and you are completely free to choose. Going out, asking for information is very normal, and asking for serious staff, so using the tourist information is not equal, blatant cheating, can not tolerate. Good attractions, bad service reviews.
To be improved,

attractions.name: Tham Jang
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Laos, Vientiane, Vang Vieng, Tham Jang
attractions.address: Meuang Xong Village, Vang Vieng 1003, Laos
reviews: The Tanjiang Karst Cave is the most famous cave in the Vang Vieng area. In the early 19th century, it was used as a bunker against Yunnan Muslims and a resting place for Yunnan robbers. With nearly 200 stairs going up, it leads to the main cave entrance. The cave itself is not the most attractive place. In the main cave, which leads to the opening of the limestone wall, you can enjoy the gorgeous and charming scenery of the river valley and the panoramic view of Vang Vieng town in the distance, especially when the sun is setting. , The scenery is really charming. This cave is completely dry, there is no river inside, and the stalactites are illuminated with colorful lights, which is very mysterious. Except for the simple lighting street lamps, there are almost no traces of artificial carvings in the caves. These limestone walls of various shapes are the visual enjoyment that nature bestows on mankind. Although the temperature outside is extremely high, the inside of the cave is very cool and refreshing. The scene here is still very suitable for taking pictures. The karst landforms created these caves, which can satisfy everyone's desire for exploration. Although there are lights inside, prepare a large flashlight, which has a novel feeling. See the world freely

Tickets are not expensive and only 10,000 kip. There are no other tourists. It is located in the mountains and forests. It is very original and the original flavor that we all like very much. The cave is in the forest on the mountainside. The entrance of the cave is very small and locked with an iron gate. The ticket seller in the scenic spot accompanied us all the way to climb the mountain and opened the door, and turned on the simple lights in the cave. After a section of winding and deep entrance road, the front suddenly opened up and a cave appeared. In the hall, weird stalactites were presented in front of us. With the faint light, they climbed up through the hall. There was still a hall inside. The scenery was still good. Everyone took a closer look and left after taking pictures.

Located on the west bank of the Nansong River, the Tanjiang Karst cave is the most prestigious cave in Vang Vieng. The pool in the cave is extremely clear and you can swim and play. Standing at the entrance of the cave, you can enjoy the panoramic view of Wanrong and the fields, which makes people feel refreshed.

Wanrong is a standard karst landform, so there are many karst caves, most of which have not been developed and utilized. The two or three more famous karst caves such as Tanjiang have simple basic supporting facilities, so the original ecology is also very well maintained. Play cave exploration game.
Good walkWalked on the famous red orange bridge. Dipped in the cold water spring. Excellent for passing time. Not far from the town. A typical hangout for starters in vangvieng.

attractions.name: Uncle Tom's Trails - Private Day Tours
VLT Tour
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Laos, Vientiane, Vang Vieng, VLT Tour
attractions.address: Nam Song, Nam Song Kangmuong St, Vang Vieng 30060, Laos
reviews: I have long heard that Vang Vieng is known as the most relaxing place in Laos. The scenery here is beautiful, with limestone hills, verdant rivers, and dense vegetation, much like the scenery of Guilin. You can drift in the water, you can swim and dive, you can play hot air balloons in the sky, and explore caves in the underground. I don’t want to play anymore. There are many bars, cafes and restaurants by the river, and you can order a pot of tea or coffee, blowing the river breeze. Looking at the scenery, you can sit all day.

When I went to Wan Vieng to play, I specially tried the local hot air balloon project. Because it is a project opened by a Chinese, the order is a bit cheaper. But it costs more than $80 per person. I went to the meeting point early the next morning. The staff were all Chinese, very enthusiastic and helped to take pictures. The hot-air balloon pilots are also Chinese and very enthusiastic. The whole trip was very pleasant.

The hot air balloon in Vang Vieng is probably the cheapest in the world. The price is now about US$90 per person and it takes about 45 minutes. There are two hot air balloons a day, one at around 6 in the morning and one at four or five in the afternoon.
I didn't buy any tickets for the afternoon that day, and I chose the one for the next morning.
The hot air balloon company is run by Chinese, and the main staff are also Chinese.
The price includes hotel pick-up and drop-off.
It is still very spectacular to see the panoramic view of Vang Vieng in the air in the early morning, very beautiful. The shock is beyond words.

It is probably the cheapest hot air balloon ride in the world. After we arrived in Vang Vieng, we looked for a hot air balloon agent on the street. Finally found a shop of 87.75 dollars. Pick us up early the next morning. The team are all Chinese, so they are very enthusiastic when they see it, and they help take pictures. The captain of the hot air balloon is also a Chinese national, and he also introduced the content. Great.

This is probably the cheapest and best value hot air balloon I have ever taken. I went there many years ago. At that time, it seemed that there was only 60 dollars, and the transfer was included. Pickup trucks will pick you up at the hotel and return to the hotel after the end. Think about $60 for a good meal in Shanghai is not enough, you can play a hot air balloon comfortably in Vang Vieng. Wanrong is really a paradise for outdoor sports! The hot air balloon company seemed to be opened by a Chinese in Wanrong. It's a coincidence. It seems that all the hot air balloons I have traveled all over the world were driven by Chinese. The difference is that the price of this store is only a fraction of that of Australia and the United States, which is more than a digit less. The hot air balloon is unpowered and depends on the wind. The time I sat in it seemed to be very windy, flying high, and far away. As a result, it took a lot of effort to land and finally returned to the ground. Picture 4 shows a group of ground crews descending in a hot air balloon. A car followed the hot air balloon on the ground throughout the journey. The hot air balloon pilot will use the walkie-talkie to communicate with the ground where to land. Hot air balloons are not suitable for people who are afraid of heights. The time I sat, there was a person in the basket who was not flying high at first, but after flying high, his feet became weak and he finally squatted in the basket.

attractions.name: River Tubing
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Laos, Vientiane, Vang Vieng, River Tubing
reviews: Impressive Cave/impressive statuesReally impressive. The cave alone would have been worth a visit, but the Buddha statues make it a place you really should visit. It was quite busy but that really didn''t reduce the impact. There are lots of reviews which mention the aggressive monkey population; while there are lots of monkeys outside of the cave they all seemed perfectly fine!!

When I first arrived in Vang Vieng, I couldn’t wait to play tire drifting. The water was deep and the waves were anxious. I was a person who knew how to spin in the water and couldn’t control how much I sent. After that, I played with foreign friends on the mud grass. In a volleyball match, although I fell into the mud, it was super hilarious. The most unfortunate thing was that there was no grass disco.

Since it is the dry season now! The water in the river is gentle! The water quality is also better! It's very pleasant to have a rafting here in a sunny day! Unexpectedly, the drifting here is drifting tires, and tourists from Europe and the United States are in droves! It's very cost-effective! The renminbi is valuable here!

Well, I was in Vang Vieng for the past two days. I played a kart in the rain, a rush in the mud, other floating balloons, etc., all stopped, look at the river, even the locals’ boats have stopped. There are tourist boats.

The tire drift rental point is opposite the RoungNakhone Palace, and a few people are gathered to have a double car to the upstream departure point. If you are alone, I'm sorry, or wait for some money to be sent by car. Pay special attention to safety if the water is not good.

attractions.name: Tham Phu Kham Cave and Blue Lagoon
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Laos, Vientiane, Vang Vieng, Tham Phu Kham Cave and Blue Lagoon
attractions.address: 7km West of Vang Vieng, Vang Vieng 1003, Laos
reviews:
Visiting the scene in person, I think it is a very fun place.
I don't know what program in South Korea drives the tourism here. Most of the people who play here are Koreans.
The most exciting thing is to climb the old tree and dive down.
However, Koreans are very strange, and everyone who can swim must wear a life jacket.

The friend pinched his nose and jumped down and the goggles sank into the water.
In addition to Asians, there are many Europeans and Americans who also have fun

Naturally uncarved, it was a great fun to dive and swim. I got it late in the afternoon and the tickets were confiscated if I went in after five o'clock. Haha, many foreigners met two European beauties riding motorcycles and said they came from Thailand. It is worth seeing, the recommendation index is four stars

I checked the guide before I came, recommended by a lot of people, there are mountains and rivers, and the water is particularly clear. When I went there were many foreigners, most Koreans, I heard that there seems to be a show in Korea that has been here. You can swim and dive here. After an afternoon here, I feel really good, but I don't dare to jump.
After playing the zipline, it was more than addictive, it was very beautiful and natural, and there was a valley with gurgling water flowing in it.
It's a pretty and natural small pond with Asian faces. There are still many people. If there are few people, it should be fun.

attractions.name: Farm Tomita
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Hokkaido, Furano, Farm Tomita
attractions.open_status: The garden is open all year round. Flower house: late April - September 8:30-18:00, October - mid-April 9:00-16:00; Dried flower shed: late April - October 8:30-17:00; distillation Club and perfume house: late April - September 8:30-17:00. Please refer to the official website for the opening hours of other venues.
attractions.address: No.15 Nakafurano Kisen Kita, Nakafurano, Sorachi District, Hokkaido
reviews: a very good place for city people who has rare touches to natural things, also very good for families with kids, very organized, no entrance fees, beautiful flowers, many lavender related products and experiences, the city is quiet and not so crowded during late August
There is lavender ice cream, melon ice cream, dried lavender, basically there is lavender everywhere. You do not have to pay an entrance fee, since people expect you to buy a lot inside.

Breathtaking view of colorful carpets of flowers in summer.  Several gift shops available in and around the farm mostly catering to the lavender flower as well as the cantaloupe fruit (rock melon).  The subtly flavored lavender ice-cream is a must try!
Wonderful area to visit when the flowers are in bloom.

Farm Tomita located in the beautiful fields of Furano-shi is perhaps most famous for its lavender fields and products.  In the summer time, the farm is filled with beautiful and fragrant flowers and herbs.  Even in the winter time, summer flowers can be found in the green houses.  one cannot leave Farm Tomita without trying their milky lavender soft serve: smooth, fragrant, and delicious!

attractions.name: Furano
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Hokkaido, Furano, Furano
reviews: When it comes to Furano, the "Tomita Farm" is one of the keys to the park! Especially when you come to Furano in July, you must go! You can smell the fragrance of lavender as soon as you step into the park, so that you can feel calm. The lavender sea of lavender is elegant, and there are various flowers against it, beautiful. Come here and remember to order "milk ice cream Hami melon" to eat! Hokkaido two famous things combined dessert, refreshing not greasy you must eat!
Furano Ski Resort is located in Furano City, Hokkaido, just 80 minutes from Asahikawa Airport. It has abundant powder and snow resources and can be the venue for the ski World Cup.

The Furano National Park is still very beautiful terraces, and the flowers in bloom are so beautiful and beautiful, it is worth seeing and seeing the various beautiful scenery. The locals also like to go,

Hinode Park in Kamifurano is the birthplace of Furano lavender, and it is also the earliest and most extensive lavender field in Japan. At the beginning of summer every year, the entire slope of the hills is covered with a whole piece of purple, and the spectacular pictures do not know how many people's hearts are moved. Every May, all kinds of flowers start to bloom, and the entire Furano hills are like a vast sea of purple flowers, which makes people dizzy, and has become a shooting location for many Japanese advertisements. Farm Tomita, the most colorful and colorful, is most often seen in Hokkaido landscape postcards. The farm is divided into five colorful flower areas. The colorful flower field at the rear is a representative landscape, like a cosmic super luxurious tapestry stretching out to the side of the flower field. Pine forest. See the world freely

I spent 3 days and 2 nights in Furano on this flower viewing trip. The beautiful scenery, the spotless streets, and the courteous locals felt really great. I live in the hotel in front of Furano Station. It is extremely convenient to travel. The jr line, lavender bus, and taxi waiting point are all nearby. Farm Tomita, Machiei Lavender Garden, Hinode Park, New Furano Prince Hotel are all worth visiting. Although Furano is relatively remote, there are Fukuzushi, Sensari Japanese cuisine, and barbecue restaurants near the station, which can satisfy a few days of dinner.

attractions.name: Ningle Terrace
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Hokkaido, Furano, Ningle Terrace
attractions.address: Near Furano City Hotel, New Furano Prince Hotel
reviews: The forest spirit balcony in Hokkaido is still a very good balcony, where you can see good snow. The main area is very beautiful and textured.

On the day I arrived at the Fairy Terrace, there was a lot of snow, the kind that could fill my hat in an instant. This is a relatively independent attraction. It is said that it was a scene created for filming in the past. It really looks like a fairy tale world. It feels like there should be little people living in the cabin. In fact, there are shops in the cabin. When the sky gets dark, it is the most beautiful time here.
I regretted the chartered car with a tour group. This is the last stop of the itinerary. Because the journey is relatively long, the tour time arranged by the travel agency is very tight. Half an hour includes the time to go to the bathroom, but the bathroom is still a bit far away and there is a queue, so Basically, it came out after taking some photos after turning around. If you have time, I recommend you come by car and take photos and drink coffee here.
Just don't miss the time of the shuttle bus. The traffic here is not very convenient. Missing the shuttle bus is more troublesome.

The Fairy Terrace is actually the Forest Handicraft Village. Along the trail in the forest, you can slowly visit each handicraft shop. Each has its own unique works, exquisite and lovely. After sunset, the small wooden houses in the forest will be lit, and the fairy terrace under the night has a special flavor.

The Ningle Terrace is near the Furano Prince Hotel. It is more beautiful under the lights at night, and it is better if it is accompanied by snow. If you live nearby and stroll around, it is not necessary to arrange it as a main attraction.

In the forest next to the New Furano Prince Hotel, there are a total of 15 cabins. The name of the Ningle balcony comes from the work of Satoshi Kuramoto. It is said that there are wise elf in the forest of Hokkaido. Each of the 15 cabins has a different theme. There are Paper House, Blacksmith House, Wind House, Leather Workshop, Wood Forest House, and the most popular Mori’s Cafe.

attractions.name: Furano Lavander Fields
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Hokkaido, Furano, Furano Lavander Fields
reviews: I really love the flower view, here is a best places to travel in the summer! recommend it to all the people who love nature

Kitahoshiyama Choei Lavender Garden is next to Nakafurano Station. The order from south to north is approximately Furano-Nakafurano-Upper Furano-Biei. Nakafurano is closer to the mountains and the terrain is more undulating. The lavender garden is on the slopes of Mount Hokushin. In addition to taking pictures for general sightseeing, you will usually consider taking a cable car up the mountain to overlook the farm, which is also a difference here.

Take JR to Nakafurano Station. There is a bicycle rental shop near the station. There is a cycling route near Nakafurano. You can get a route map in the station. Don't forget to stamp it. Each station has a different stamp. After cycling all the way to see the beautiful scenery, I stopped. The cycling here is very cool. Although it is summer, it is not hot at all in Hokkaido.

After playing at Farm Tomita, if you want to return to Furano, you can only go to Nakafurano Station to take a JR or a bus. During this time, you will pass by North Star Mountain. Futian Farm is a flat piece of land, while Beixing Mountain is mainly a hillside. There is a cable car next to it, the most primitive kind of cable car. But the slope is not big, just walk around. The key is that the flowers on the slope of the season we went to have been harvested, and only a piece of cosmos and sage were planted at the foot of the mountain. In fact, if it is not on the way, there is no need to make a special trip to Beixing Mountain after watching Tomita Farm. The flowers are almost the same.

Cheese and cheese are the same. Cheese, also known as cheese, is a fermented milk product, which is rich in nutrients such as protein, calcium, fat, phosphorus and vitamins. People usually mistake them for different things because of the different names. In China, it is often called cheese, while in Western countries, it is often called cheese. Other than that, they have no other differences.
Interesting place. Oh, and bring back some souvenirs.

From JR Furano, I went directly to the cheese workshop by taxi. Taxi drove quickly and arrived in more than 10 minutes. There are not many people on the road in Furano, and the speed is fast. Of course, the price of taxi is also very high. When it arrived, it was still raining, and as a result, there was a big sun in a while. I really like the design of this house. The appearance is not so dazzling, but the small rooms and small passages inside are very sensational. Tebi is a triangular roof design on the two floors, and the sunlight is too beautiful. There is a pizza restaurant on the first floor, which is full of aromas before reaching the door. Buy it on the self-service machine at the door, and then give it to the waiter when you enter. The viewing platform includes both indoor and outdoor areas as well as a gift shop. The views of the city and the waterfalls are spectacular. Be prepared for the wind and the top of the tower is very windy. I would recommend a 30 minute tour if it is just a tour of the viewing platform and 1 hour and 30 minutes if there is also a meal to be had to be eaten by the tour of the viewing platform.

The Ferris wheel is near the booked hotel. Regarding the Courtyard by Marriott Niagara Falls, I remember that at that time (late July 2018), it was a double room booked through Ctrip. You can see the city view from the room, but not the view of the waterfall. The location of the hotel is good, you can see the Sky Wheel within a five or six minutes walk, which is a lively place. Walking all the way, walking and enjoying, I feel like Las Vegas-like western excitement, take the opportunity to appreciate the western culture a little; then walk, follow the crowd, you can reach the scenic spots to watch the Great Falls. From the Canadian side of this viewing point, you can see the "American Falls" on the opposite side, and the "Horseshoe Falls" can also be seen from a distance. The waterfall fireworks show at night is very beautiful. I did not book a hotel breakfast. There are many restaurants around the hotel, and you can find one for breakfast outside. It is suitable for traveling alone or in groups, and also suitable for bringing children or the elderly. However, extra beds are not allowed in standard rooms. Theoretically speaking, it is usually impossible to see the waterfall directly from the rooms of this hotel, because there are other hotels in front of the hotel that are closer to the waterfall, so they are blocked and cannot directly watch the waterfall. However, under normal circumstances, most travelers will not book hotels and rooms with direct views of the Great Falls because of cost-effectiveness.

Standing on the observation deck, the perspective is wide and unobstructed. The whole town is at your feet. It’s not bad to go around and watch the scenery while eating and chatting at leisure.

Came here to watch the waterfall ascend and overlook. This skylon is in the center of the town, and you can see it from there. The fare is not expensive. reviews:
To view Niagara Falls on the American side, the best option is to take the "Maid of the Mist" cruise.
Take a cruise from the pier in Waterfall Park, and the staff will hand out a blue raincoat according to the size of the passengers.
The cruise ship slowly bid farewell to the Rainbow Bridge and sailed along the Niagara River through the "American Falls" and the "Bridal Wedding Falls". When it came to the "Horseshoe Bay Falls", the waves were thunderous and the water mist was vast. The hat of the line of sight, the fog is pouring down~ It's cool!

"Maid of the Mist" is a cruise project on the American side of Niagara Falls to see the waterfalls up close. You can see three waterfalls up close. Because of the majestic waterfalls, visitors must wear raincoats, otherwise they will be soaked.

It is estimated that the famous tourist project of Niagara Falls is to take the Maid of the Mist to get close to the waterfall. You can take a boat from the American side, a two-story cruise, and a second-story platform for taking pictures and feeling the waterfall. Visitors will wear simple raincoats. But even so, when you are close to the Horseshoe Falls and feel the waterfall up close, you will still get wet by the water mist and splashes of the waterfall, and electronic products such as cameras should be specially protected. Getting wet by the waterfall is also a characteristic ceremony of cruise, just like getting wet during the Songkran Festival. It’s a joy to get close to the waterfall.

The Maid of the Mist is a sightseeing cruise to visit Niagara Falls. Everyone is given a raincoat when boarding the ship. When the ship is near the waterfall, the water splashes and it is easy to get wet. Sometimes the raincoat can't block it.
Must experience items, shoes must wear slippers or sandals, must enter the water! Quite exciting and very good project, but the cruise time is shorter! The child hopes to sit twice more!

attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Zhejiang, Shaoxing, East Lake

reviews: Probably my favourite park/lake in Shaoxing. While much less famous then its's Hangzhou counterpart and not even being the most famous scenic place in Shaoxing, I find it the most charming and pictoresque one. If you climb the hill by the lake you can enjoy the view as well as pluck some fresh tea leaves. The lake(looking more like a canal) is really pretty and has some really nice and impressive cliffs by its side. There is also a stage where Yue opera is sometimes performed.

A scenic spot on the east side of Shaoxing. It is introduced that many big people have been there. I used to go to the card half day before I left Shaoxing. In fact, the scenic spot is not big. I didn't take a boat for less than an hour. I finished all the walks. I thought at the beginning that there was no place to open. Only later did I know it was so big that I could only walk up the hill again at the entrance again, and I got a full half-day trip to the tea garden and the view.

The legend says Qin Shihuang is stationed in the drinking horse, this semi-artificial landscape of the large bonsai cliffs, stone, caves are deeply attracted to me. Also, sometimes really exclamation: the stone bridge in the south of the Yangtze River, often without the railings on both sides, so simple, natural. In the East Lake scenic area took awning boat, through the stone cave, willow dark flowers.

Qingming Xiaolong Holiday came to Shaoxing for two days. This afternoon's train returned to Shanghai. I still want to find an attraction that Shaoxing had not been to before the return trip and send a few hours. I went to the East Lake Scenic Area and proved that the choice is very correct. The East Lake is not big. You can see it all in up to two hours. We even climbed the mountain, watched the tea garden, and took a panoramic view, but there is no boat, in fact it is not big, it is not with old people and children or poor physical strength. We have already experienced an awning boat and don't have to sit. The scenery is good,

The small East Lake is very beautiful, and the weather is very good while there are not many tourists on weekdays. It is very happy to visit the East Lake. It is very pleasant to take an awning boat and shuttle among the stone walls to enjoy the beautiful scenery. There is a poem carved in the mountain wall, very special. Trip.com ticket purchase is also very convenient and fast, 2 people a boat, unforgettable memories.

reviews: Shen Garden is famous for “Phoenix Hairpin”, the scenery is very beautiful, but I still felt upset because of the miserable love between Lu You and Tang Wan.

Originally, it is the private garden of the Shen family, the garden is not big, not as beautiful as the Suzhou garden, but because of the love story of Luyou, but the garden is famous for the world, in addition to the ancient site, there is a Luyou memorial hall, which tells the life of Luyou, Luyou is a patriotic poet, It's admirable, but in love, he feels like he's always the one who's failed.

In 1125, Lu You was born in Shanyin, Yuezhou, which is now Shaoxing, Zhejiang. It is said that Lu You's mother is a little sissy of Qin Guan, she used the name of Qin Guan (Guan) made Lu You's character (Wu Guan) and Qin Guan's character (Zi You) made Lu You's name. "Shantoufeng*Red Squat Hand" is my childhood will recite the words, young did not understand the taste of words, later know Tang Xu's "Shantoufeng* world sentiments" and their stories. Lonely mourning, is the self-simile of the Fangweng. Remnants of wall, two "Shantoufeng" side by side wall, a mountain stone carved with the "Feoyuer * Guoqiu Ci": ask what is the world love, direct education life and death. Every time think of these words, it is sad. If there was no Luyou, Shenyuan, a garden of the Song Dynasty, was abandoned and no one asked for it. Unlike the gardens of the Ming and Qing Dynasties, Shenyuan, after more than 800 years, was more primitive, elegant and solemn. Several repairs, the scale of the final emergence. I remember there was a wild fir tree by the pond in Dongyuan. I went to visit, the fruit was not ripe. The drizzle was a lot, along with the music of Love Rivers and Mountains More Beauty, and with Jun, while enjoying the rain while sipping tea. That was the best osmanthus day tea I had ever had.

Very cost-effective, the performance of Shenyuan Night is worth seeing, the historical information in Lu Xun's hometown is more informative. Overall is more cost-effective than buying tickets for a single attraction. There are many historical stories in Lanting scenic spot, it is best to have a tour guide to explain. It takes two days to play.

The Shenyuan Garden is mainly composed of three parts: the historic site area, the Dongyuan Garden and the Nanyuan Garden (Luyou Memorial Hall and Lianli Garden). It covers an area of 57 acres and forms the "Elegy of Broken Clouds", "Love in Poetry", and "Spring Wave Shocked "", "Remnant Wall Remains", "Lone Crane Lamenting", "Bihe Reflecting the Sun", "Palace Wall Resents Willow", "Treading Snow and Asking Plum", "Poetry and Books Fragrant" and "Magpie Bridge Tearing Love".

attractions.name: Dafo Temple Scenic Spot
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Zhejiang, Shaoxing, Xinchang, Dafo Temple Scenic Spot

reviews: Dafo Temple - Big buddha Temple is one of the BEST place that one has to visit in china for sure.  The smiling face of the buddha , the ambience of peace and eternity surrounded byThe main spots are 1. Reclining buddha 2. Buddha heart square 3.  Gate to dafosi 4. Xiguang temple 5. Hall of three god's 6. Hall of god of wealth 7. Wanfo stupa8. Seven cascade water fall 9. Prajna valley 10. Cherry valley Reclining buddha - located top of the hill and the view from the bottom is a bliss - the water that swipes each slabs and gets to the pool which is green color with many of big koi fishes. Climbing the steps to reach the top have a clear view of the nature at its best. Mind-blowing architecture which was built decades back. Old drums , stone cravings , praying arenas are quite interesting. The place is so calm and peaceful. The buddha with that smiling face is amazing sculpture - damn positivity 🙏... Thousand buddha cave - was interesting and good we can find many creativity at its best inside and can see the old well( mouth not so big) near the exit area. City gold temple with 3000 years old tree and fossil trees, longetivity stone that are really a natural gem , with kind people to explain each and everything . The pools with centre spray attractions are really good to see. Jiagnan gaint buddha - very most of the prayers done, people come here and worship for wellness , health and wealth. Many Monks are seen - which makes ones to admire their discipline. Thousand hand bodhisattva , golden buddha in the pool surrounded with golden lotus , mountain cravings depicting the scenario's are really impressive. Statue on top of the dragon fish and another statue on top of an animal made with pool entrance inside like a cave is way beyond words to describe .Overall the best experience in my life , will never forget and will never hesitate to go again.. will always recommend for one to have their inner peace & love #dafotemple #buddha #xinchang

Xinchang Dafo Temple is located in the valley between Mt. Ming and Mt. Ishijo in the southwest of Xinchang County, Zhejiang Province, built in the Yonghe era (345-350 years) in the Eastern Jin Dynasty. It has a history of over 1600 years and is one of the important national temples. There are stone statues of Dai Maitreya Buddha, and there are scenic spots such as hidden caves, sawing rocks, pavilions, stone kiboku, stone chess plateau, free pond and some cliff stone carvings outside the temple.

Xinchang Great Buddha Temple is indeed a treasure hidden in the city, the scale of the city has a lot of cultural and Buddhist knowledge, unfortunately we arrived late to see all the complete, the next opportunity to go again.

The Grand Buddha Temple is definitely one of the best attractions in the combination of humanities, history and nature. The Grand Buddha Temple in spring is full of spring color and fragrance of birds. It is peaceful and peaceful to wander in the historical sites.

Good value for money, good scenery, fun and fun, overall super awesome, revisited after ten years, I feel like I have played a new attraction, big change, still very fun, the place is large, there are many attractions, half a day happy.

reviews: We arrived in Shaoxing at noon and after having lunch we went to the Orchid Pavilion first. Wang Xizhi, a famous calligrapher in the Jin Dynasty, lived here in the past. At Orchid Pavilion, we saw many of Wang Xizhi’s works, his handwriting was very good!

Iast year;I went to shaoxing with my classmates.When we arrived,the weather was sunnu and warm.After a little time,we arrived at Lanting which located in ShaoXing.We visited the Lan ting Muserm.It had many knowlege of Wang Xi Zhi.If you are interested in Wang's hand writing the best choice is visiting this museum.There were many characters hand writings of this.We went to Lu Xun's home town next.There were many stories of him.I knew more about his life and I was interested in his books.The books were great.But when we left there,there was a heary rain.So we had to go back to Lu Xun Museum.By the way,we visisted the museum.I learned more knowlege about.Lu Xun after visiting.Then the rain stopped,so we went back to our hotel.It was a nice day!

Lanting is famous for Wang Tongzhi, and for "Lanting Sequence" and become a calligraphy holy place. Back to Shaoxing tomb sweeping often go to visit, these years after the renovation of the orchid Pavilion, and newly built "Lanting calligraphy Museum", through modern technology, show the beauty of calligraphy.

"Nine years of Yonghe, the age of the ugliness, the beginning of the spring, will be in the Guiji Shanyin orchid, repairing things. Qunxian to the end, less long Xianji. There are mountains, wood bamboo, and clear streams, the right and left, led to the flow of water, sitting next. Although there is no silk bamboo orchid, a bow, but also enough to talk about the Yueqing. According to legend, the orchid is the place where the Yue Wang goujian planted orchids in the Spring and Autumn Period, because of this gathering and Wang Xizhi's "Orchid Pavilion Collection" became the network red carding place of successive dynasties to the present day. The original "Orchid Pavilion Collection" Xu in Zhaoling, Xu in Qianling. Every year, on the third of March, the Chinese Lanting calligraphy festival is held here, the grand occasion is extraordinary.

Frankfurt Cathedral, Frankfurt Cathedral, also known as Kaiserdom, Kaiserdom; the emperor was crowned here, also known as the Coronation Church. The main building of the cathedral is a Gothic building with a tower height of 95 meters. Tips: Frankfurt Cathedral is located east of Frankfurt's Roman Forum. Address, Domplatz Frankfurt, Hesse Germany. You can take the U-Bahn to Hauptwache station. Tips: You can browse the nearby area on foot. Frankfurt Cathedral and the Roman Forum are not far from the Main River Cruise Terminal. Walk all the way, watch the scenery, take a few photos as you like, or sit down and have a drink. If there is not much free space in the tourist season, fortunately, there are still. attractions.open_status: Sun 10:00 AM - 5:30 PM, Mon - Sat 10:00 AM - 6:00 PM
reviews: If you are in Frankfurt, consider a visit to this place. Goethe, one of Germany's national poets, was born and spent his youth here. It is the house of his family. There are furniture and several objects related to his family on exhibition. If you have more time, combine this with a visit to Leipzig (where Goethe attended university) and Goethe national museum in Weimar (the city where Goethe spent most of his productive live as a poet).

Goethehaus is home to Johann Wolfgang von Goethe, a German writer from the 18th century, where he lived. The house showcases his home with many of the furnishing including flooring and equipment. If you would like to experience how a home feels like in the 18th century, it's worth a visit. The house is currently having renovation on some parts of the building.

The Goethehaus, located in the Alstadt district of Frankfurt, Germany was the family residence of the Goethe Family, most notably Johann Wolfgang Von Goethe. Goethe was, perhaps the most famous writer, artist and poet in German history. The house was destroyed during the AllIed bombing in 1944 but was restored after the war between 1947 and 1951. What you see pictured are actual pictures of his and/or items from his house.
The Goethehaus is the house were Johann Wolfgang von Goethe lived. You can see the rooms he lived up with and hear stories about his family.

Frankfurt is the home of the most important German writer, Johann Wolfgang von Goethe (1749-1832). Although Goethe's birthplace was destroyed in World War II, the house has been rebuilt and you can still get a great idea of the house in which Goethe wrote some of his most famous works.

Frankfurt’s Old Town Hall, das Rathaus, is a landmark of Frankfurt and a symbol of old Frankfurt. It is located on the west side of the Roman Forum in Frankfurt, also known as the Romans, der Römer. The Old City Hall is composed of three gothic buildings with gable walls, and its roof is in a stepped herringbone shape, which is quite distinctive. One of the three buildings is called Rema. On the second floor of Rema there is the Emperor’s Hall, Kaisersaal, where the coronation ceremony of the Holy Roman Emperor was held. Frankfurt is famous for its modern industrial, financial, and air transportation centers, and the Roman Forum, where the old city hall is located, is a symbol of old Frankfurt. Strolling in the Roman Forum, walking through the quaint old buildings, and smelling the scent of coffee, you gradually become immersed in the relaxed elegance. Unknowingly, I have walked to the River Main. It is not as gorgeous as London’s River Thames, nor as romantic as Paris’s Seine River, but there is a lot of mixed tranquility, like a long whistle, penetrating the desolation in the open field , Bringing the fun of cooling off in childhood and summer. It is said that these buildings of Rema are the products of the 15th century; in fact, most of the buildings were rebuilt after World War II. Human beings always cry out to cherish, and despise and mutilate them. Always push yourself to the corner, desperate and bruised. Rema, Rema, what a nice term. Rema, tell me, is it difficult to keep the bottom line? Can you not lie to yourself?

The gate of the old city hall opened in a very inconspicuous courtyard on the fork road, and there was only a self-service ticket vending machine. Ascended a circular staircase and came to the interior of the city hall. The walls on both sides are covered with portraits of successive kings.

[Fun] Actually, if you are not particularly familiar with history, you really don't understand it, but the color of the house is really good, especially if you have a blue sky in the background. Because there is a small church next to it⛪️, you can hear the bell ringing when it is punctual.

The Frankfurt Old Opera is at the end of the luxury pedestrian street and is also an important attraction in Frankfurt. It used to be an opera house in history, and now it is a concert hall. The old opera house was completed in 1880. It was destroyed during World War II and was once known as the most beautiful ruin in Germany. After the war, the exterior was faithfully restored, and the interior was changed to a concert hall. The fountain at the entrance is easy to take pictures.
The Frankfurt Old Opera is a general opera house, but it is worth a visit compared to domestic opera houses.

Melbourne has two airports, and international flights all take off and land at airports closer to the city. There is a train station in the city, and trains to the suburbs of Melbourne or to Sydney pass through here. The urban transportation is convenient. Public transportation has trams, urban trains, buses but no subway. Buses to the suburbs depart at a large interval, almost every half an hour, which is not as convenient as Beijing. Taxis are generally only found at fixed taxi stands, and generally cannot be stopped on the street. It is very convenient to buy a local bus card (myki card), which can be bought at the airport. I live on Swanston Street in the city center, not far from Federation Square, Flinders Railway Station, Chinatown, and St. Paul’s Church, all within walking distance. When I went to catch up with the Australian Open, I was lying on Federation Square basking in the sun, drinking beer and watching the live broadcast on the big screen, with a large group of people lying around. There are several stations around the hotel where I live, and it is very convenient to go out by bus. It's very convenient to travel for free in Melbourne's CBD area. There are not as many public toilets as in Beijing. The city center is crowded and crowded. At night, people who are homeless and drunk start to show up on the streets, yelling, blowing and beating. If no one is around, you will feel that Beijing is still safe. The surrounding towns are very quiet, you can take the light rail to the town to experience the daily life of the locals. There are many Italian restaurants on Lygon Street. I feel that a Ferrari-car-themed restaurant called Café Corretto is worth recommending. It is cost-effective and crowded, especially on weekends. Diagonally opposite brunetti is a famous local dessert shop, you can try it. I tried several ice creams there. They were generally sweet and tasted average. You can eat something else next time. Brightonbeach is actually a large beach, divided into three parts. The most well-known section has a lot of people. I think the middle brightonbeach is better, but the traffic is not very convenient. There is no light rail train and you can only take a bus. You should go to the Great Ocean Road. I will give a detailed description in the review of the Great Ocean Road. In short, Melbourne is still very good, the environment is good, the locals live a comfortable life, the city is livable, and it is better than Sydney where I later went. The reason why I haven't visited all the places in Melbourne is probably because I think I will go there in the future.

Australia is the only country in the world that covers the entire continent. It has many unique animals, plants and natural landscapes. It is also a multicultural immigrant country, so you can meet different friends and experience different folk customs. After visiting various cities in Australia, the most important feeling is that the pastoral style and modern atmosphere are perfectly combined, and the comfortable atmosphere of the environment makes people fully feel the convenience and relaxation of city life. See the world freely

Must go to Crux&Co in South Melbourne for a brunch, super delicious! ! ! Many people line up, but the food is worth it. You can go outside to take pictures while waiting. I ate N’s fruit salad during my trip to Australia for more than ten days. The best fruit salad was eaten here.

attractions.name: Twelve Apostles
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, Australia, Victoria, Corangamite Shire, Princetown, Twelve Apostles
attractions.address: Great Ocean Rd & Booringa Rd, Princetown VIC 3269, Australia
reviews: Twelve Apostles is a collection of limestone stacks off the shore of Port Campbell National Park, by the Great Ocean Road in Victoria, Australia. It's a good place to walk by the side while snapping some photos.

Twelve Apostles is a collection of limestone stacks off the shore of Port Campbell National Park, by the Great Ocean Road in Victoria, Australia.Their proximity to one another has made the site a popular tourist attraction.
Very beautiful, is a must-be going place when travelling in Austrilia.

The natural landscape of the 12 Apostle Rocks in Port Campbell is spectacular. The Port Campbell National Park is made up of five scenic spots, the most famous of which is the "12 Apostle Rocks" in the National Park. Due to the impact of the sea water, there are only 7 of the twelve apostle rocks due to the collapse and erosion, and it can be seen from the observation platform in the garden. The steep limestone cliffs tower above the roaring sea, and the waves and tides that have shook and eroded the soft rocks for thousands of years have finally created these priceless natural treasures. The twelve Apostle Rocks are the essence of Australia's natural landscape. Standing on the rock cliffs, the monsoon winds from the Antarctic Circle, the waves are hitting the beach under the cliffs, and the waves are hitting the shore. The huge rock blocks along the coast, cut by sea and rain, and eroded by strong winds, have, after thousands or tens of thousands of years, become stony columns of different shapes, shimmering in the sea and blue sky. Although the journey from Melbourne to Campbell Port is far away, the boats are damaged, but it is still worth it, after all, the casual film is postcards, easy to win the August friends circle holiday photography contest first name.

The scenery of the ocean road lasts for hundreds of kilometers, watching the cliffs and waves, stirring in the sun! At last, the twelve disciples arrived, all the boats and cars are worth the effort, the magic of nature, the small human beings

attractions.name: Chinatown Melbourne
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, Australia, Victoria, Melbourne, Chinatown Melbourne
reviews: Previously they opened for 24hour daily however business operation hours may change due to covid-19 pandemic. Step through the grand red gates of Melbourne's Chinatown and enter a whole new world of Asian cuisine, karaoke, cocktail bars

Chinatown is an ethnic enclave in the Central Business District (CBD) of Melbourne, Victoria, Australia. Centred at the eastern end of Little Bourke Street, it extends between the corners of Swanston and Spring Streets, and consists of numerous laneways, alleys and arcades.Established in the 1850s during the Victorian gold rush, it is notable for being the longest continuous Chinese settlement in the Western World and the oldest Chinatown in the Southern Hemisphere.

Oh my god I LOVE China Town. Not for its shopping, because that really is a bit meh in my opinion, there are far better places to go. But I love it for the food. There is such an exotic array of restaurants to go to that pretty much serve every Chinese dish imaginable! If you love (or even like) Chinese food, you need to go to China Town.

It was around Christmas week in Melbourne so after 9pm only places that still remain opened were in Chinatown. We found a lot of interesting places to eat and drink around the 3 block area. Chinatown was quite clean compared to other cities Chinatowns and food selections were good.

The original Chinese population came to Victoria in the mid-1800s chasing the promise of riches during Australia’s gold rush era. Today, a large population of Chinese remain in Melbourne and the city has arguably one of the best Chinatowns in the country. During the year, there are many traditional festivals and activities in this part of town, making it a vibrant place to explore. And with the restaurants in the area serving up delicious food, this is a location not to be missed.

attractions.name: Eureka Skydeck 88
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, Australia, Victoria, Melbourne, Eureka Skydeck 88
reviews: This place is stunning. You won't want to miss it. This Skycraper even comes with penthouse as well. Can you imagine that.

Eureka Tower is a 297.3 m (975 ft) skyscraper located in the Southbank precinct of Melbourne, Victoria, Australia.Construction began in August 2002 and the exterior was completed on 1 June 2006. The plaza was finished in June 2006 and the building was officially opened on 11 October 2006.The project was designed by Melbourne architectural firm Fender Katsalidis Architects and was built by Grocon (Grollo Australia). The developer of the tower was Eureka Tower Pty Ltd, a joint venture consisting of Daniel Grollo (Grocon), investor Tab Fried and one of the Tower's architects Nonda Katsalidis.It was the world's tallest residential tower when measured to its highest floor until surpassed by Ocean Heights and the HHHR Tower in Dubai.
Amazing view of all the Melbourne. If in the sky not clouds you can see all the attractions of this amazing city on 360 degrees view.
The best view of Melbourne City is at Eureka Skydeck 88. But that’s just about it, you go up for the view. Best to go during sunset time.

The views were stunning and it is definitely the best spot to each the subset but the ride in the suspended glass cube was disappointing.  We wetenot permitted to take our own pictures and those taken were rushed and of poor quality.

attractions.name: Federation Square
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, Australia, Victoria, Melbourne, Federation Square
attractions.address: Swanston St & Flinders St, Melbourne VIC 3000
reviews: Due to this pandemic , this mall was the first time ever empty. Federation square was a World-class art galleries and exhibitions, a diverse range of food and drink options, and events that capture the heart of Melbourne since year 2002.

Federation Square is a venue for arts, culture and public events on the edge of the Melbourne central business district.It covers an area of 3.2 ha (7.9 acres) at the intersection of Flinders and Swanston Streets built above busy railway lines and across the road from Flinders Street station.It incorporates major cultural institutions such as the Ian Potter Centre, Australian Centre for the Moving Image (ACMI) and the Koorie Heritage Trust as well as cafes and bars in a series of buildings centred around a large paved square, and a glass walled atrium.
great space
I was there back when I was young beautiful arkiqkektour I reli enjoy laa melbourne city hen hao I was there back when I was young beautiful arkiqkektour I reli enjoy laa melbourne city hen hao

Great place to meet friends in the city. Very much a landmark of Melbourne. Right across the road from the main station of Flinders Street Station and is culturally important as well. Lots of events are run all year round here at Federation Square. The Yarra River is also a stone throw away. For any tourists, this is a must visit all year round. Or just sit by the steps and relax and enjoy the Melbourne city skyline all around you in 360 degree view.

attractions.name: Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, Australia, Victoria, Melbourne, Royal Botanic Gardens Melbourne
reviews: If you want to discover the rare and beautiful plants, breathtaking landscapes and iconic buildings on offer at their Botanic Garden which open daily from 0730am to 0730pm.

Royal Botanic Gardens Victoria are botanic gardens across two sites - Melbourne and Cranbourne. Melbourne Gardens was founded in 1846 when land was reserved on the south side of the Yarra River for a new botanic garden.It extends across 38 hectares that slope to the river with trees, garden beds, lakes and lawns.
If you're looking for peace and serenity, you'll find it here. The gardens are beautiful and well kept. The staff were friendly and helpful in the information centre
A haven of green tranquility in a bustling city. Perfect for individuals and families. Particularly scenic along the Yarra River, with views of the city skyscrapers in the distance.
such a beautiful place yo spend the day. the new cactus gardens are amazing. lots of great trees and flowers. great indoor displays. lots of great botanincal information.

attractions.name: Melbourne Aquarium
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, Australia, Victoria, Melbourne, Melbourne Aquarium
reviews: This Sea Life Aquarium opened since year 2000 and has more than 500 species. You can come over to explore this wet world as they are worthy and even provide dine in inside those aquarium.

Sea Life Melbourne Aquarium is a Southern Ocean and Antarctic aquarium in central Melbourne, Australia.It is located on the banks of the Yarra River beside and under the Flinders Street Viaduct and the King Street Bridge. The attraction is a Sea Life Centre owned by Merlin Entertainments.

ouwww yeaa many fish mann shark and pengweng are the best yo’ I will take my wives and kids next tyme ouwww yeaa many fish mann shark and pengweng are the best yo’ I will take my wives and kids next tyme

I absolutely loved the aquarium it's so fun for the little ones especially their are so many tgibgs that you can do such as touching starfish looking at the sharks getting some awesome photos taken so I do recommend the aquarium

attractions.name: St Paul's Cathedral
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, Australia, Victoria, Melbourne, St Paul's Cathedral
attractions.open_status: Sun 8:00 AM - 7:00 PM, Mon - Fri 8:00 AM - 6:00 PM, Sat 9:00 AM - 4:00 PM
attractions.address: Cnr Flinders & Swanston Streets, Melbourne, Victoria 3000, Australia
reviews: They opened daily and never missed their coffee served free after sunday morning event  This place back then built on 1892 and it is the cathedral church of the Diocese of Melbourne.

St Paul's Cathedral is built on the site where the first public Christian service in Melbourne was conducted in 1835.The block was then a government reserve far from the centre of town to the west, and used as a corn market. By 1848 the site was then adjacent to the first Princes Bridge across the Yarra, and the prominent site was granted to the Anglican Church.The bluestone Church of St Paul the Apostle was consecrated in 1852.Nearly 30 years later with the huge growth of the city and Swanston Street becoming a major thoroughfare, the diocese decided to build a grand cathedral on the site to supersede the 1839 St James Old Cathedral located in the western end of the CBD.
we are simply mesmerized by the beautiful architecture. its is next to federation sq. easy to locate. travel by tram or train.

Went to have a look at the Cathedral, very picturesque. I was impressed with everything I looked at. While I was there, there was a Piano Recital as the Lunchtime Concert. It was given by Hannah Shin. What an accomplished Musician and Pianist. I personally enjoyed every minute of this Concert. We don't have Concerts like this or as much as good as this Level of performance. Congratulations Hannah and thank you.
Amazingly beautiful cathedral, highly recommended for a visit especially on Sunday where you have an opportunity to witness a service. Evening hour visits for a sunset shot.

attractions.name: Melbourne Zoo
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, Australia, Victoria, Melbourne, Melbourne Zoo
reviews: Melbourne Zoo is a zoo in Melbourne, Australia. It is located within Royal Park in Parkville, approximately 4 kilometres north of the centre of Melbourne. It is the primary zoo serving Melbourne.
This Melbourne Zoo is open daily seven days a week from 9am to 5pm every day, including all Easter. Don't remember much the ticket price but not too pricey.

This wonderful and well-laid-out zoo offers a chance to see unique Australian wildlife that you rarely get the opportunity to spot in normal life. There’s a duckbilled platypus, wombats, Tasmanian devils and koalas, as well as the more easily spotted kangaroos and emus. It was great to get up close to animals like the platypus and wombats.
Terrific zoo! Don't miss out on the butterfly house or the lemur exhibit, those were my favorites. Getting to the zoo from Melbourne's CBD is quite easy- Tram 55 takes you right there.

I went their the other day with school and some of the tourists there were very rude, this little boy needed help with a game and I asked if he needed help and he said yes then I helped him and then his mother comes up to me and yells at me for 'snatching a toy off a child' and 'snatching it so I could play the game' I just think this is inconsiderate

attractions.name: Puffing Billy Railway
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, Australia, Victoria, Melbourne, Puffing Billy Railway
attractions.open_status: The departure time per station is different every day, Please refer to the website http://puffingbilly.com.au/en/visit-puffing-billy/timetable/
reviews: They opened daily from 09am to 05pm except saturday sunday until 12pm. Puffing Billy is Australia's premier preserved steam railway and operates every day (except Christmas Day).

The Puffing Billy Railway is a 2 ft 6 in (762 mm) narrow gauge heritage railway in the Dandenong Ranges in Melbourne, Australia.The primary starting point, operations and administration centre, main refreshment room (also selling souvenirs) and ticket purchasing are located at Belgrave station.Journeys may also be commenced at out-stations of which some have limited facilities for the purchase of tickets, refreshments and souvenirs.Tickets may also be purchased from the conductor before boarding the train.

very nice experience to take the steam train. my boy loves it so much. of course you cannot choose where to seat and which wagon to seat. the seat are allocated by the personnel on site. the only thing is you shall try to seat at the fat end wagon to avoid smoke .....
Always had a good time on the 5 occasions I have travelled on the Puffing Billy. A great excuse to bring out the inner child.
I love this place. I really enjoy the cool breeze when riding

attractions.name: Chengdu Research Base of Giant Panda Breeding
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Sichuan, Chengdu, Chengdu Research Base of Giant Panda Breeding
attractions.address: No. 1375, North Panda Avenue, Chenghua District, Chengdu
reviews: simply amazing! make sure u arrive early to see lots of  panda action and with less crowd. the facilities areexcellent- clean toilets/ restaurants. highly enjoyed myself

It’s not to far from the city center, easy to get there by subway. Air is fresh, pleasant view, amazing cute pandas 🐼 Park is very big, need a lot of time to see all of it and take pictures. I don’t mind going there again.
Absolutely worth a visit, recommend going with a guide to make the most of your time at the park.
Had a great time, dispite the heat. The enclourse were nice a spaced out and while walking to each one, I had some nice photo opportunities with the surrounding wildlife and flora/fawner.
If you wanna see the pandas in their active mood, go earlier like 8am onwards.

attractions.name: Dujiangyan Irrigation System
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Sichuan, Chengdu, Dujiangyan, Dujiangyan Irrigation System
reviews: The weather is cloudy. The irrigation scenery is amazing. We went there during holiday so it’s a bit crowded. I’m curious what’s the significance of the stone packed in a bamboo.
You can go to dujiangyan Irrigation system after hiking the Qingcheng mountain.

This is to highlight that the nearest train station is no longer the Du Jiang Yan station, they have newly open a new station which is just right at door step - Li Dui Gong Yuan station (离堆公园站).Du Jiang Yan has 3 significant sections - upper, mid and bottom, we took a small bus from bottom to upper stream, and walk back to the bottom stream. Unlike the usual concrete path, we chose to walk from the mountain side, which allows us to see the entire stream of river - this is really amazing, but your leg will be sore by then, a lot of tracking indeed, but it really worth it!I personally like the color of the water, mixed of blue and green, despite the misty weather, I still managed to catch a nice photo of the entire Du Jiang Yan.Don’t forget to have a walk at the old street when you leave the place, we pop by a small eating place and they do serve a very nice dishes (农家小炒).

Dujiangyan located 50min train ride from central chengdu.  Do alight one stop before dujiangyan station . is about 10min walk to the actual site .. from there u will pass by a passenger street .. just follow the crowd / sign boad . entrance fee is 80rmb . do hire a guild as the history and fact of this place is kind of interesting . there is a suspense bridge . take the tram 10rmb . unless u are ok to walk about 2-3km  . when returning take the path is a more senicen view it is also call the old trade road . this path will link all the way back to a temple along the passanger street
beautiful irrigation system!

attractions.name: Qingcheng Mountain
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Sichuan, Chengdu, Dujiangyan, Qingcheng Mountain, Qingcheng Mountain
attractions.address: Qingcheng Mountain Scenic Spot, southwest of Dujiangyan City, Chengdu
reviews: this mountain is not that bad for young or old people to go hiking.

What an absolutely incredible experience for our family of 4 Americans, including 2ten daughters. The mountain was lush with foliage and so green. The buildings were incredible and the views at the top were not too be missed. It was worth the trekk through the heart, humidity, and traffic to see this beautiful place.

It feels very relaxed to hike in Qingcheng mountain. The air is extremely fresh and there are a lot of trees surrounding the whole place. As you walk up the mountains to visit temples, there are stops along the way for visitors to take a rest and buy food and drinks at the stalls. The path to go up and down the mountain is not so easy to walk because the steps are built of stones and they are not of even height. I suggest visitors to cater a full day to visit Qingcheng mountain and go as early as possible when the tour bus and cable car start operation.

Mount Qingcheng is a good place to hike, but the steps are a bit difficult to walk. The elderly may find it hard. At the bottom of the mountain, you can take the ropeway up to the mountainside, and then hike up to the top of the mountain. People who cannot hike can also be carried up and down the mountain for an additional fee. The air in the mountains is fresh and there are green trees everywhere. Hiking all the way up the mountain, there are a few rest stops to see the temples and eat something.
A thing of beauty is joy forever. Must visit place

attractions.name: Du Fu's Thatched Cottage
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Sichuan, Chengdu, Du Fu's Thatched Cottage
attractions.address: No. 37, Qinghua Road, Qingyang District, Chengdu
reviews: Very famous landmark dedicated to the place very very famous person has lived in Chengdu. There are several small museums with interesting exhibition. The park is wonderful area with its paths through bamboo and bushes. Old trees are pretty old, looks like they really counted two or more hundred years
It's a nice place to go wondering and relax.

There are a lot of greens inside Du Fu's Thatched Cottage. It was a very nice place to walk around to enjoy the fresh air and greenery. The place is not considered very big. You can finished visiting the entire place in about 3 hours.
Du Fu's cottage is full of trees and the air is very fresh. Walking inside, reading the poems written by Du Fu, I feel like a poet.
i had a good time at the street of Chengdu... this small lake is a nice place to visit.
