reviews: I really enjoyed seeing all of the sea animals, however the park looks slightly run down. It is also very expensive, just one adult ticket is 240 RMB.

Buy a ticket and see clearly, Ocean Park and Ice and Snow Park. First of all, if you are going to Ice and Snow Park, please wear thicker, clear and cool. After two minutes, I came out. My head almost hurt. The Ocean Park can go, the Jellyfish Museum is beautiful,

With the child, before the regular price ticket has always felt expensive plus the child is small, this year three years old just met the activity ticket, decisively take the doll to play, go late, go to a little more in the afternoon, play to come out at 5:30, the child did not play enough, it is recommended to go out in the morning, the child is asleep in the afternoon, no spirit play. However, this ticket price is really recommended. The ice and snow park is too cold, haha, it comes out in a few minutes. If you are not cold, it is recommended to wear thick clothes.

Definitely worth the price! There is also a conditional discount for Trip.com and more discounts! Although it is called Ocean Park, it is amusement city~ in addition to marine life, there are amusement parks, pet parks, a stop for entertainment. ~ jellyfish, sharks, turtles, mermaid shows, dolphin shows, sea lion shows, there are no 6 hours to go shopping~ there are snacks, fast food, drinks~ especially suitable for parent-child tours, The theme aquarium inside can take pictures and enrich the knowledge of children! Lovers see dolphins 🐬 is love~ Carousel takes pictures, girlfriend is more beautiful haha~
Take the kids to see the animals properly! The food inside is a bit expensive

attractions.name: Wuhou Shrine
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Sichuan, Chengdu, Wuhou Shrine
attractions.address: No. 231 Wuhouyu Street, Wuhou District, Chengdu
reviews: really pretty architecture and just next to jinli street where u can get a bite to eat after. recommend to get a guide to tell you about the history of the place and the different statues. see liu bei and his ministers and commanders.
very good. fast service and very convenient. the product was accurate and the service is world class
Suitable for tourist that know the story from romance of three kingdoms. Jinli is next to attraction, go in afternoon and spend evening in jin li.

Wuhou Temple is Jinli Ancient Street. If you want to have friends who are ready to go to Chengdu, the two places can play together. Wuhou Temple has a long history, and the sculptures inside are shaped by Kangxi years. Unfortunately, we went late and did not ask the tour guide to explain. The big red wall inside is very beautiful and the photo taking is very interesting.

Wuhou Temple is the most famous attraction in Chengdu. You can see everything about Zhuge Liang here. So it is a pity that you will not come to Wuhou Temple in Chengdu. Wuhou Temple is a temple dedicated to Liu Bei, Zhuge Liang and other heroes of the Han Dynasty. It began when Liu Bei Huiling was built in the first year of the Emperor Zhaolie in the Sui and Han Dynasty, and built the temple in the same time. About 500 years ago and after the Northern and Southern Dynasties, Wuhou Temple moved from the "short city" of Chengdu to build the temple in Huiling and Han Dynasty, which continued into the Ming Dynasty. In the Ming Dynasty, in 1390, the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king of the king At the end of Ming Dynasty, the Wuhou domain was destroyed by war fire, and in 1671 years (Kangxi 10), the Wuhou domain was restored and rebuilt on the site, and the present pattern was formed. In 1961, it was designated as the first national important cultural relics protection unit by the State Council, and the museum was established in 1984, and the whole sangi Temple was moved to the Wuhou residence in 1997, and the Nanbu Park and the Wuhou residence were merged in 2003. In 2008, Wuhou Temple was named the National First Class Museum, and the Jinli II opening in January 2009.

attractions.name: Jinsha Site Museum
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Sichuan, Chengdu, Jinsha Site Museum
attractions.open_status: Open from 01/01-4/30,Tue-Sun,9:00am-6:00pm;Closed from 3/1-6/30,Mon;Open from 9:00am-6:00pm during Chinese public holidays;Open from 5/1-10/31,Sat-Sun,9:00am-8:00pm
attractions.address: Chengdu Jinsha Site Museum, No. 2 Jinsha Site Road, Qingyang District, Chengdu
reviews: A very cool museum for anyone who finds archeology fascinating! So manny wonderful pieces and a lot to learn
Impressive site with few visitors, 30 mins from downtown to the scenic. It is worth of paying a visit.

Jinsha culture is a continuation of the Samsungdui culture, the sites include ecological parks, archaeological sites and cultural relics exhibition halls, Jinsha ancient pupa civilization has been fully displayed. The museum's live explanation is usually only 1 hour. If you see Bikego on Trip.com, you can talk about two and a half hours, so you place an order. Only we two traveled that day, the instructor Xie Dong is a local, she took us slowly forward, full of pride and enthusiasm to filial piety, every site, every artifacts are so rare, detailed to impeccable! Before went to Samsungdui, was shocked by the ancient Shu civilization, there are many questions: is a sacrificial pit used once or several times? Samsungdui and Jinsha site what is the connection? Why some cultural relics are so delicate to the modern civilization can not reach the point? What does the different hairstyles mean for the bronze man? Wait...Xie Dong gave very patient explanations and was extremely professional. For those who enjoy deep travel, it is a good choice to go with Bikego. Overall great, fun, fun, cost-effective,

In these days, I happened to encounter the excavation of the 3-8 Sacrifice pit of Samsung Dui, and was forced to have a heat. If I came by myself, I might also focus on the relatively famous cultural relics of bronze Xiaoliren, Sun Godbird, Golden Mask, and Ten Jade Kiln. The discovery of Jinsha site, the archaeological process, the cultural background and the unknown exploration can not get more combing and understanding. Thank you very much for the nearly 3 hours of teacher Yang's explanation, really recommend this product, can better understand the whole Jinsha site represents the ancient Shu culture.

Can say without exaggeration, visit Jinsha Museum is the biggest harvest of this Chengdu trip! I like the culture and blog, love the culture and blog, is and I love history directly linked, the more I like, gradually more love the country and love the nation. The Sunbird, I have seen it on TV and in various media, I stand in front of the original and I can't believe my eyes! Exquisite, mysterious, mysterious, beautiful... as a symbol of the protection of China's material cultural heritage, it has absolute authority, and the world will be amazed and convinced! The time is very short, but it fills the shortcomings of historical knowledge, not a worthwhile trip. I will definitely come again!

attractions.name: Chengdu Zoo
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Sichuan, Chengdu, Chengdu Zoo
attractions.address: No. 234, Zhaojue Temple South Road, Chenghua District, Chengdu (驷马桥)
reviews: please make people more covilized , as they are making kids do WC anywhere. place is little old and dirty.

Don't go on holidays, go on weekdays to get less people, otherwise there are too many people, you can see others. Unfortunately, I didn't see the elephant this time, in maintaining its home, the best interaction is in, the sea lion, the panda has a good fat.

Very good service, great experience, cost-effective, worth the experience, suitable for family trips overall is awesome, Chengdu full of pandas, the environment is very good, there are many hot girls, very good for couples to travel

Good, it is recommended, mainly because I haven't gone to the zoo for a long time. I went to Chengdu for a few days and chose the zoo at the last stop. The animals in it are quite cute, but there are a little few species.

I have been to many attractions in China, which is the most real. The ticket price is always around 20 per year, which is really a conscience! This time, because the spring has warmed up some, the animals are very active.

attractions.name: Emperor Qinshihuang's Mausoleum Site Museum
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Shaanxi, Xi'an, Emperor Qinshihuang's Mausoleum Site Museum
attractions.address: 1.5 km east of Qin Shihuang Mausoleum in Lintong District, Xi'an City
reviews: I have been in many places worldwide but this one is and will be forever in my Top5...

Of course it’s hard for something as storied as the Terracotta Warriors to completely live up to hype and expectations, but they come awfully close to doing so. Pro-tip: walk the galleries in reverse order so you save the largest hall with the most recognizable figures for last. This makes it much better experience.
the mausoleum was so many I think they are like real because it was so straight
this is the one of best place near in Xian, the old capital city.

this place is a wonderful place to visit. its good to visit the place if u know abt it beforehand. though there are english speaking chinese guides. wiki will give some light abt the place. we went from fast train so from xian north station took a didi like a uber for 110 rmb . the ticket price is 120 and if you have a student card its half the price. the place is large enough to spend around 3 hours . there are three pits 3,2,1.. i started from third pit coz its the smallest one.. and the 2 and then 1 .. the 1 pit is the largest one but the excavation work is still goin on .. there are hundreds of statues.. the hard work is just magnificient.. the pictures which we take are not enough for to capture the feelings which we have when we look at those by naked eyes.. the place is a must to go place though a bit far from city.

attractions.name: Fortifications of Xi'an
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Shaanxi, Xi'an, Fortifications of Xi'an
attractions.address: The city center of Xi'an, Shaanxi Province, is rectangular, with four gates: Dongchanglemen (Xi'an City Wall, Huancheng East Road, Xincheng District, Xi'an), Xi'an Dingmen (West Street and Xijuyuan Lane) Nearby Xi'an City Wall (Huancheng West Road), South Yongning Gate (No. 2 South Street, Beilin District, Xi'an), Bei'an Yuanmen (Intersection of North Street and Huancheng North Road, Xincheng District, Xi'an)
reviews: we go at night. but spent time around the surroundings. to visit wall you need to pay 54 rmb. I have taken these images from outside.
Beautiful place to take a wake or ride a bike. I would have done the whole round of 13,74km if I hadn’t had my kids with me. Great place to see the old town and enjoy a walk.

I walked all the way around the Xi'An city walls. It's certainly a long walk, but away from the most touristy sections it's quite a peaceful walk. If you haven't got 4-5 hours a bike is a good choice to make a circumnavigation. Rent a cycle (mountain bike or tandem) at various points and drop it off at any other station. There are a few crowded spots where bikes aren't allowed but you can drop one off on side and pick up another the same on the other side.
The walls of Xi’an were beautiful even on a cloudy day. It’s fun to bike around, though give yourself a few hours to go around and pack a snack and water. a beautiful part of history.

South Gate Fort is beautiful and even better at night! It's magical walking along the wall and imagining what it might have been like to be alive during the early Dynasties. You can even rent bikes on the top of the wall!

attractions.name: Shaanxi History Museum
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Shaanxi, Xi'an, Shaanxi History Museum
attractions.open_status: Open on Tue-Sun,9:00am-5:30pm;Closed on Mon;Open from 9:00am-5:30pm during Chinese public holidays
attractions.address: No. 91 Xiaozhai East Road, Yanta District, Xi'an (Northwest Side of Big Wild Goose Pagoda)
reviews: My friends and I got in for free since we are foreigners. Made the most of that trip by spending 3 hours walking around inside.
very informative museum with lots to see. they have an interesting exhibit showing how the terracotta warriors looked when painted.
love the place

It is free to enter! Nice scenery. On the first floor you can mostly find potteries, but the more interesting stuff are on the higher floors. There was also an Egyptian exhibition for 50rmb but it was very small and nothing of importance could be seen there - so thats a disappointment. The small terracotta soldiers are in nice conditions and there are several weapons you can check out from the ancient days to the classical age. Behind the building is the Tomb of one of the Hans and his wife. But I guess its still under construction because there was nothing to be seen.
very educational

attractions.name: Tang Dynasty Furong Garden
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Shaanxi, Xi'an, Tang Dynasty Furong Garden
attractions.address: No. 99, Furong West Road, Qujiang New District, Xi'an
reviews: This is very romantic place! Couples, please, do not miss this spot! Bright, beautiful and romantic!  The park is big and includes several sections. Small performances are organized in every part and shown during the day several times. The big show is evening gala, must be watched! The story of Xi'an, former Chang An, told via dancing and music with very professional actors. This place has a special meaning for me...  I met here my wife))))
Beautiful big garden. Good for family
The ticket is a bit pricey - 120 RMB, but the scenery is very beautiful. Especially at night.
excellent tourist spot

ticket was a bit pricey (90y) and food/drinks inside was expensive. nice way to relax and get away from the crowds but prob not worthwhile if you are short on time or prefer more authentic experience. includes a small museum and "zoo" with cranes, peacocks, houses etc.

attractions.name: Huaqing Pool
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Shaanxi, Xi'an, Huaqing Pool
attractions.address: No. 38, Huaqing Road, Lishan, Lintong District, Xi'an City
reviews: Big park, including a hill for climbing. Every evening there is a performance with bright special effects, please, book tickets online in advance.  Theme is love story happened here in Hua Qing pool. The area is interesting for slow walking, There is also peace of modern history, the hidden hq of Chinese rebels and brave fighting (the bullets are not removed from the walls ). The second theatrical performance is dedicated to that case.
nice place with rich history of the beginning of Taoism and the love affair of the famous Tang emperor and his concubine Yang.
Stunning landscape, With a beautiful nature
excellent travel place

This palace is not huge but meaningful of history.  Not only famous in Spa structure for the king family, but also the LiShan (hill of the palace) with over 1,000m height & stairs going up to the top with the point of fire which used as message signal in ancient time.   Interesting there …

attractions.name: "The Song of Everlasting Sorrow"
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Shaanxi, Xi'an, "The Song of Everlasting Sorrow"
attractions.address: No. 38 Huaqing Road, Lintong District, Xi'an City
reviews: The song of everlasting Sarrow is a musical theater show . It is a series of vinettes about stories about life during the Tang Dynasty which is about 809 AD to 913 AD. This was a great show that gave you some history and culture of the Tang Dyanasy period. The music was wonderful . The lighting was professional and excellent. The actors and actresses put on a beautifully performed show. There is fee to see this show . i was able to buy same day tickets . There is no reserved seating so if you get there a little early you can get a great seat. You are allowed photography.

u r guided by stuff to ur places, so it's almost impossible to get lost. even its crowed, its all calmn and well organized. the show is amazing. lots of technical surprises, fire, fireworks and even an own moon is projected on the hills xDfor round about 30€ totally worth it. pay attention on the location, cause its almost an hour out of the city centre of Xi'an

This was a beautiful​ show with stunning dancing, costumes, set design and effects. The only thing I didn't​ like was the occassional use of the screen with tacky backgrounds. I found it was not needed and took attention away from the exquiste actors and setting. But definitely​ worth seeing.
During the evening time enjoyable walking around this area fantastic lightings around, great
This place is awesome. it attracts peoples to see the great and historical culture of china

attractions.name: Qinling Wildlife Park
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Shaanxi, Xi'an, Qinling Wildlife Park
attractions.address: Qi Town, Chang'an District, Xi'an City
reviews: Many activities for children. The prices is reasonable, train bus and the show's included. Take a bus to feed the tiger is a MUST. The show takes time but it worthwhile.

西安秦岭野生动物园 in Chinese. This is the big park. There are many interesting species. But I would like to say, the space of area was sacrificed for building small shops and restaurants. It could be better to provide animals larger areas then create shops. The show performance was interesting and funny, except lions. That was the big pity. The lions were on drugs that made them calm down , one Lion was overdosed and got lost roams on the podium. Animals should not be treated like this. The travel on buses through the wild area among big cats was short and different from advertisement. But however it is a good option for whole day.

Going on a rainy day, the artistic conception is really absolute, really beautiful 🥳🥳🥳, recommended, but don't go in the heavy rain, it's drizzling, and there are many animals, the little monkey is really cute, and you can take a sightseeing bus with the ticket for free, duck! ! !

During the epidemic period, make an appointment online for free entry into the park. The scenery is good. It is at the foot of the mountain. It is the first time to bring your baby into the zoo. During the epidemic period, the animals live in a normal sanitary environment. As soon as I enter the park, I recommend taking a bus to see the wildlife activity area. I think it is worth a visit. I hope the shuttle driver will drive the car slower and pass without a careful look. You can go shopping slowly for 5 or 6 hours. It is recommended to go in the morning. There is also a place to buy food at the gate, so if you don’t worry about eating out, you can bring some food and water in advance. Animals are common on TV, and most of them are. It is still necessary to take the children.

Fun, fun, good scenery, good value for money, overall great, many species of animals, the weather is not good when we go, plus many animals are resting at noon, overall the experience is good, the children are also very happy, it is recommended to take a long stay in the cart, have the opportunity to go again. Great theater night is good 😄

attractions.name: Giant Wild Goose Pagoda
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Shaanxi, Xi'an, Giant Wild Goose Pagoda
attractions.address: Yanta Road, Yanta District, Xi'an City
reviews: Outstanding park, always full of people, snacks, kites flying around. Such an interesting place to visit, especially in the spring.

I like this place! I like from time to time to come here. Walking around makes you feel happy like a child. The place looks like is charged by positive energy! Everyone is smiling, Hui Zu ethnic minority always organizes dance performance here, just regular citizens participate, those who wanna have fun. Bug green area is transformed into park outside, but another one is located inside of scenic spot. The dancing music fountain is located just in front of area with pagoda.  Pagoda itself symbolises the beginning of journey, "The story of Journey to the west" has began here. And taking into account our location, we are at the start point of the silk road, so,  before to move forward to Gansu or Qinghai or Ningxia in your travel along the numerous paths of the silk road web, please,  come here to feel you are part of this big tale!The pagoda was renovated several times, but it still representing this unique place ancient architects vision. To my mind, this is the mix of muslin and ancient tang dynasty styles.
Such an impressive sight to see. Also, I enjoyed the small statue where you can throw coins into for good luck.

This place is a WoW. it has the greatest vibes ever. the venue around it looks even more attractive. the entrance is kinda expensive though. 40 to enter pagoda and 25 to climb it is a total rip off but you know what? You are gonna love every minute of it. don’t forget the fountain show the north side of the landmark. it is number one in Asia. we missed it but we definitely will be back for it. you should definitely try the rooftop of the mall across from the South Gate. maybe a couple of drinks at Blue Frogs ;) make sure you will check out all the streets around that area.

A very calming, peaceful place of worship, and the pagoda itself is huge and fascinating! The park is massive, and there are three parts to it. The outer park is free, and full of restaurants and gift stores. The inner part is ¥40 and has beautiful temples and forests to wander around. The pagoda itself is an extra ¥25, and you can climb to the top, seven stories up! Absolutely lush views from the top!Be respectful at the temples - don’t take photos of the Buddha statues, and be mindful that people come and light incense and give offerings to the Buddha at these temples. Giant Wild Goose Pagoda is well worth a visit - peaceful, beautiful place, and easy to get to via the metro system too!

attractions.name: Bell Tower of Xi'an
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Shaanxi, Xi'an, Bell Tower of Xi'an
attractions.address: Intersection of the East, West, and North Sizhi Streets in Beilin District, Xi'an
reviews: there are couple of places to visit surrounding bell tower. I suggest to visit this place at night. the entry fee is around 30 rmb.
I had the opportunity to see it in the night...the lights make it so outstanding...

the place is just beautiful.. reached there at 530 pm so couldnt climb up.. but we can still enjoy around.. there is a muslim food street just besides it.. just beautiful place to go and have food after.. just enjoyed the lightings and foods were delicious.. the place is a lively place.. loved it to be there.. u can take a metro train back to wherever u want to go coz the station is just near by

钟楼，Many Chinese cities exposing their Drum Towers to visitors. Xi'an drum tower also became the landmark. There is nothing different compare to other cities except the size. This one is really bigger than other I have seen in many cities in northwest China. Located in exactly the middle of cross-road in the exact city center and oriented towards north, south, west and east, this fortification like frozen in time depicted the rules for planing if the city in ancient China. yeah, that filling, it really looks like a piece of past pasted in modern city with all these noisy roads and high buildings surrounding the Tower .Located in five minutes by walking from Hui Min jie walking street.

Adorable place, Even it was crowded with too many peaople but I did enjoy the crowd because of its historical items, I really like it, you can buy tickets underpass of Zhonglou subway station by automatic  machines (ctrip app). I enjoy the old teapots, and the old soldiers statues. It was very nice place, I personnally high recommend it.

attractions.address: No. 1 Qujiang 2nd Road, Yanta District, Xi'an (near East Gate of Datang Furong Garden)
reviews: it’s great place, I went there during summer and it was fun
very beautiful place

A good experience, with two children, my fourth-grade sister more than 1.4 meters, need to buy adult tickets, watched the dolphin show, and also took a photo with the dolphin, know many sea creatures, but this smoking area brand is a bit... I hope the merchant will correct it as soon as possible.

A good experience, with two children, my fourth-grade sister more than 1.4 meters, need to buy adult tickets, watched the dolphin show, and also took a photo with the dolphin, know many sea creatures, but this smoking area brand is a bit... I hope the merchant will correct it as soon as possible.

A good experience, with two children, my fourth-grade sister more than 1.4 meters, need to buy adult tickets, watched the dolphin show, and also took a photo with the dolphin, know many sea creatures, but this smoking area brand is a bit... I hope the merchant will correct it as soon as possible.

attractions.name: Harbin Polar Museum
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Heilongjiang, Harbin, Harbin Polar Museum
attractions.address: No. 3, Sun Avenue, Songbei District, Harbin
reviews: this was worth the trip. the saddest part though is the wolves sanctuary. the parents were separated from their babies by glass 😞😞. and the polar bear was lonely 😔. the shows gave me mixed emotions. the animals were great though.

"Awesome"  is the word to describe Harbin Polar Pavilion. We were impressed and felt that this is one of the ideal travel destination for families and kids. This will be the best place that will get you out of the cold in winter. We enjoyed the Beluga and Sealion shows.
it is awsome place to visit. the shows are so much nice and heart touching.

I enjoyed seeing the shows - Beluga whales in particular and the Sea lions and a Walrus show, they were quite entertaining. The museum or aquarium was undergoing some expansion work during my visit, I could see why as there wasn’t much else to see that was exceptional. I’ve been to more spectacular aquariums.
Nice place, went in winter, fun for family

attractions.name: Northeast Tiger Forest Park
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Heilongjiang, Harbin, Northeast Tiger Forest Park
reviews: I was a little hesitant at first to visit this place, but I’m really happy that I did! it was really nice. the tigers are beautiful. they come up to the van and you can feed them, but the meat to feed them is an extra ¥120 or so. I didn’t experience that part. it was well worth the visit!

They gave me a choice of tickets, I opted for the most expensive and regretted it, although you had the chance to feed the big cats, there were too many people on the bus to gain access or see the animals clearly. Go for the cheaper tickets. You get to walk around the park at the end, so you still get to see the animals more clearly. They seem to be fairly well looked after.
great place Thousands of tigers including white tiger and plenty of Siberian tigers must go place

We bought tickets with the show having no idea what it was. When we got out the park was closing not long after. So the bus to see the tigers was really fast. We saw some but nothing extraordinary. And the show is really not worth.

Vivi uma fabulosa experiência e recomendo. Aqui senti os ventos frios da Sibéria e vi animais em verdadeira extinção. Os tigres, o Jaguar negro. O percurso é feito dentro de autocarros amarelos vedados e vêem-se muitas crianças. O bilhete custa 110 yuan. Não hà nada de especial para lembrança. Seria excelente ter descrições em inglês das atracções turísticas de Harbin. Fabuloso. É ver para crer pelo que não publico fotografias.

attractions.name: Songhua River Sightseeing Cableway
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Heilongjiang, Harbin, Songhua River Sightseeing Cableway
reviews: 80rmb return, 50rmb one way, I just took it back into the city, fairly convenient, too polluted to see anything spectacular on the day I went. The river was frozen over, you can take a walk on it
this place is fun I need coins I am writing the review. but this place is fun . to take good pictures from the top . it’s good feeling and safe

Muito simpáticos todos os funcionários desta maravilhosa atracção turística. Ao lado do Bairro Russo, a natureza contempla-nos. Visitem e deliciem-se. Por 50 yuan um bilhete de ida, este passeio vale ouro. Os carros que deslizam pelo rio gelado são um espetáculo único. Formidável!

The locals advised us not to go to Sun Island in this season, but we insisted on taking the cable car. The result was a perfect experience, a worthwhile trip. What southerners want to see is the snow scene, especially the sunset and snow scene seen from the cable car on the return trip at 3:40 pm, which can be said to be the most beautiful in Harbin. The scenery is nice, interesting and fun, cost-effective, and overall excellent,
My home is in the northeast...Songhua River up...🎵

attractions.name: Dragon Tower
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Heilongjiang, Harbin, Dragon Tower
attractions.address: No.178, Changjiang Road, Nangang District, Harbin
reviews: It was a good experience, wait times to go up the tower are relatively short, we went during a national holiday so that's probably as long as it gets. You get a panoramic view of the city from the top of the tower. There's a mini restaurant up there and also a souvenir stand where you can buy some memoirs to remember your trip to Harbin or just the tower. It's as simple as it gets really, tall tower, view from above. There's a couple more things to see and do in the tower but i won't spoil the fun, go and see for yourself
Dragon's successors up the dragon tower, deep in the sky to enjoy the city of Harbin, really good!
Nice scenery, Xiaowen service is good. Overall great,
The beautiful guide explained it very well, climbing the Longta overlooking Harbin, the scenery is really beautiful.
It was the highest steel in Asia, and it was the most powerful.

attractions.name: Harbin Wanda BMW Snow Park
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Heilongjiang, Harbin, Harbin Wanda BMW Snow Park
attractions.address: Intersection of Shimao Avenue and Hongyuan Street, Songbei District, HarbinIntersection of Shimao Avenue and Hongyuan Street, Songbei District, Harbin
reviews: looking forward to it on december 2019

Skiing is a unique sport in the north, and has become a popular sport in recent years. Harbin Snow World, formerly Wanda Ice Park, was once Asia's largest indoor skiing resort. The transportation to the Snow World is very convenient, well equipped, the big turn down the middle and advanced snow lanes is a challenge for skiers, due to the winter Olympics, there are many professional athletes training here now, due to their too large movements, Snow trails make it more difficult for amateurs. For skiers, it is still a good choice, carefully calculated, the price/performance ratio is not inferior to the outdoor ski resort, it is recommended to experience!

The largest indoor ski resort 🎿 is divided into two floors. The first floor is the primary road, the second floor is the intermediate road, and the high-level road. First of all, the environmental hygiene and staff quality are very good. For example, the staff passing by will tell you how to wear clothes and how Wearing shoes can help you solve all problems. The length and slope of the ski resort are very suitable, but the advanced trail is more exciting. According to the staff, the slope of the advanced trail is 25.4 vertical and 80 meters, reminding everyone who can’t ski. I have to weigh it up ~ the last recommendation is recommended👍

The employees say that it is the only largest indoor ski resort. It is really big and spectacular when I come in. It immediately attracted me. The ticket price is also cheap. In addition to gloves, everything else is included in the ticket. It is economical and affordable. The coach is patient

19.9 Two hours is overvalued. There are more people just inside, and there are fewer skids, because most people are really going to experience 😃. The timeout is half an hour and 40 yuan / person, 60 an hour; 120 is upgraded for an unlimited day. Because I know that 2 hours is not enough to slip, this price is included in the snowwear helmet, so even if it is timeout is appropriate, I will enjoy it. This primary snowway is divided into three slides, really primary, the slope is slow and short, more suitable for novice beginners. Addiction, snow is a bit hard. But this is OK, you can't want anything 😊

attractions.name: St. Sophia Cathedral
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Heilongjiang, Harbin, St. Sophia Cathedral
attractions.address: No. 88, Toulong Street, Daoli District, Harbin
reviews: Beautiful St.Sophia Cathedral is a must see sight in Harbin. Architecture is breathtaking and with the snow it brings a different view and feeling.
Really beautiful, just a bit pricey to get in. But overall it was a good experience,.
Lovely photos can be taken here in every season. Lights up beautifully at night. Lots of shopping and restaurants nearby.
it’s a very nice cathedral. I went in the evening time, so I didn’t get the full experience. it was pretty from the outside though!

St. Sophia Cathedral is a must see place when you are in Harbin. Its architecture is stunning specially at night. Just a word of caution, it gets really cold during winter so make sure you have the right clothing.

attractions.name: Harbin Ice and Snow World
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Heilongjiang, Harbin, Harbin Ice and Snow World
attractions.address: Ice and Snow World Park, Sun Island West District, Songbei District, Harbin
reviews: What a lovely sight to see in Harbin. It’s insanely beautiful but cold. It’s truly amazing to walk around and see all these sculptures. Definitely a must see sight.

Went on 31 December 2020. Absolutely amazing.  It's breathtakingly beautiful. Reviews can't capture how stunning it is, so go see for yourself. Some tips for first timers:- Make sure to go before sunset so see everything in daylight and all lit up. It truly is worth it seeing it in daylight too. It was dark out at around 4.30pm. - Getting there early might save you from standing for a 2hour wait in a queue for one of the big slides. - It's cold. Exposed hair froze, eyelashes froze, nostril hair froze. If you dress properly, and prepare for it, the cold isn't too bad. Take heating patches with and stick 'em in your pockets. Your hands will frikken BURN from cold if you keep taking gloves off to handle your phone. These things saved us! They also help keep your phone from dying in your pocket. - Didi doesn't come through to the entrance for pick ups. It's about a 30min queue outside for a taxi at night. Be prepared with a drop off location for the the driver if you can't speak Mandarin because...-  It's colder outside the park than in it (wind). If your phones battery hasn't failed you by this point, this is where it will just drop. Mine went from 39℅ to dead in like 4 min trying to get the hotels address.

absolutely beautiful and highly recommend!! no photos will ever do the justice of how breathtaking it really is. Frozen meets Alice in Wonderland. I was in awe the entire time! it’s best to go before sunset and watch it turn into a lit up winter wonderland at night. We ate at the dumpling restaurant and the food was great

I went on the day opening 23 December 2020, go before sunset to see it in the day and night, it's so worth it! Got a discount for being so early! Lot's to do, food inside, one quick walk around takes around 40 minutes, but taking your time and enjoying everything you could spend the best part of half a day. It's so worth it. You can buy tickets on the door.

AMAZING!! I’ve been wanting to visit this festival for the past 3 years and I finally made it. it’s totally worth it. everything is so pretty. the weather was really cold, but there were places you could go in to warm yourself up. I recommend visiting!!

attractions.name: Poseidon Beach Water World
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Heilongjiang, Harbin, Poseidon Beach Water World
reviews: Generally, the swimming ring is especially expensive. Bring it with you before you go.

Good value for money, the baby is super happy, the mouth of the mermaid island is purple, the playing time is too long, go to the bubble hot spring, the beach surfing is old, there are adult projects are all fun, fun, good scenery, overall super awesome,
Had a great time, the kids loved it, it was good
It's really nice, it's warm and I want to come back.

Super good, I went there for the second time, I want to go next time! Not enough! If there is a chance, I will definitely go back, Lian recommends driving! Because I must have brought a lot of things when I went. So driving is more convenient! If you like to play, it is recommended to play during the day. The evening show is not enough to play! Overall awesome, interesting and fun, cost-effective, OK

attractions.name: The Little Mermaid
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Denmark, Hovedstaden, Copenhagen, The Little Mermaid
reviews: lovely walk on a sunny day. the statue recalls the popular fairytale making you feel a child again. not too many people so it’s enjoyable. there was a seagull on the head of the mermaid, nice shot for a photo.

We rented a bicycle in Copenhagen to see important parts of the city. Our first stop was the very famous little mermaid statue. The weather was nice and the breeze was just right so it was the perfect time to see it. However, there were lots of people during that time so it was so difficult to get a good photo. The area was extremely beautiful and was perfect for just walking or resting. I might have had very high expectations that's why I didn't find it too spectacular, but it is still worth seeing.
Free to see, not much else, it is more interesting to see from a boat and with guides who will tell you interesting stories about its history.
We used to see it in the book.it is located  in  park of Langelinie of copenhagen. it is so beautiful.
The Little Mermaid is symbol of Copenhagen therefore this place is overcrowded but definitely you must visit her. Around this statue are some small shops with souvenirs and also coffee shops.

attractions.name: New Harbor
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Denmark, Hovedstaden, Copenhagen, New Harbor
reviews: Nyhavn was an amazing sight! We just stopped there to feel the breeze and see the wonderful architecture lined up along the beautiful waterway. Nearby are public places where people can sunbathe and play beach volleyball.  This place is a must see in Copenhagen!

The location is in the city center, not far from the palace, not big in Newport, just a street, a bit like Amsterdam, there are many restaurants by the river, sitting outside in the summer should be great.
Newport is old houses, but Denmark is generally a good many years of houses, the exterior walls are very eye-catching, the bay is full of bars and ice cream shops, many scenic spots are here
It's really a beautiful place, a little Dutch.
Copenhagen is not big, the new harbor is a good place to sit and blow. There is a hot ice cream business nearby.

attractions.name: Amalienborg Palace
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Denmark, Hovedstaden, Copenhagen, Amalienborg Palace
reviews:
Amalienborg Palace is the residence of the Danish royal family. It consists of four identical classical palace facades, surrounded by rococo interiors in an octagonal courtyard; in the center of the square is a huge equestrian statue of King Frederick V, founder of Amalienborg.

Amalienborg was originally built for four noble families. However, when the Christiansborg Palace was burned down on February 26, 1794, the royal family purchased these palaces and moved into this palace. Over the years, various monarchs and their families lived in four different palaces.

The Royal Palace of Amreimburg, on the shore of the Orson Strait in the eastern part of Copenhagen, is the main palace of the Danish royal family. The Queen of Denmark spends most of the year here. The Royal Guards guarding the palace are all around 1.9 meters. They wore bearskin hats, black uniforms, gold buttons, blue trousers, white ribbons, and big boots on their ankles, and white straps crossed in front of them, swords and shackles (ancient fashion bullets, ammunition) hanging behind them, living like the "iron soldier" in Andersen's fairy tale. They stood at a fixed point, with their guns, at times standing in front of the spire, the eight-rowed, red sign; at other times, with their shoulder-fired guns and their hands crossed, and with their feet in front, the two guards walked face to face or side by side from one end of the gate to the other. Then they turned 180 degrees back.
Denmark, famous Nordic country, nice place, palace is beautiful, recommended to see, very well preserved
It is close to the place where concerts are often heard and passing by, as if it is now an army station, only to look outside
A pretty castle, not too high, with a history.

attractions.name: Rosenborg Castle
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Denmark, Hovedstaden, Copenhagen, Rosenborg Castle
reviews: Must visit when in Copenhagen.Copenhagen Pass Includes entry to Rosenborg Castle. You can view Crown Jewels in this Castle.
This palace is worth a visit, even just to see from the outside and soak up the nature in the garden! It is really a fantasy castle and only a few minutes away from the city hall on foot.
good place for relax and rest with big park in front of the beutiful  place

attractions.name: Copenhagen City Hall Square
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Denmark, Hovedstaden, Copenhagen, Copenhagen City Hall Square
reviews: That's it, it's ok, just walk around.

In 1913, the Danish sculptor Edvard Eriksen cast a bronze statue of a mermaid based on Andersen's fairy tale "The Daughter of the Sea". The bronze statue is located in the Long Causeway Park (Langelinie) in Copenhagen and has become a symbol of Denmark. In addition, in Copenhagen’s Town Hall Square, there is a full-body bronze statue of Andersen. Every tourist passing by must shook hands with the "Father of Fairy Tales", holding Andersen's books and taking pictures with them. In Odense, Andersen's hometown, there is the Andersen House Museum, where countless people who are fascinated by Andersen's fairy tales come to pay their respects and visit.
The environment is still good, you can go and see it

Denmark’s City Hall Square, which can accommodate 100,000 square meters, is the oldest commercial square in Copenhagen. The city hall’s building is a red brick spire. The clock on it has been around for three hundred years. The error is two banknotes [强]. The main entrance is one On the side is a bronze statue of Andersen, and the leather shoe on his left foot has been touched by tourists.

It is a lively square. This building is very interesting and looks very old, although I haven't verified it. I like to walk around here and take a look at other things in the city. The lights will be turned off at 10:30 in the evening, so you can see many things. A wonderful time.

attractions.name: Gefion Fountain
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Denmark, Hovedstaden, Copenhagen, Gefion Fountain
reviews: Gefion fountain, which was not too far from the Little Mermaid by bike, was very picturesque.  Bus loads of tourists stop there to buy some snacks from street vendors and snap some Instagram-worthy photos with the magnificent fountain. We personally loved it because the water from the fountain sparkled with the dazzling sun.
Very cute and close to the little mermaid statue

The Gefion Fountain is a large fountain on the harbour front in Copenhagen, Denmark. It features a large-scale group of animal figures being driven by the legendary Norse goddess, Gefjun. The Fountain was donated by the Carlsberg Foundation as a gift to the city on the occasion of the Carlsberg brewery’s 50 year anniversary

The Gefion Fountain (Danish: Gefionspringvandet) is a large fountain on the harbour front in Copenhagen, Denmark. It features a large-scale group of animal figures being driven by the legendary Norse goddess, Gefjun. It is located in Nordre Toldbod area next to Kastellet and immediately south of Langelinie. It is the largest monument in Copenhagen and used as a wishing well.

Pretty fountain in the citadel (Kastellet) area, not far from the Little Mermaid. Worth a quick photo. Based on legend the Swedish king Gylfi promised Gefjun the territory she could plow in a night. She turned her four sons into oxen, and the territory they plowed out of the earth was then thrown into the Danish sea between Scania and the island of Fyn. The hole became a lake called Lögrinn and Leginum (locative). Snorri identifies the lake Löginn, as the lake of Old Sigtuna west of Stockholm, i.e., Lake Mälaren, an identification that he returns to later in the Saga of Olaf the Holy.

attractions.name: Stanley Park
attractions.loc_tags: North America, Canada, British Columbia, Greater Vancouver, Vancouver, Stanley Park
attractions.address: Stanley Park Causeway, Vancouver, British Columbia V6G 1Z4
reviews: The land was originally used by Indigenous peoples for thousands of years before British Columbia was colonized by the British during the 1858 Fraser Canyon Gold Rush and was one of the first areas to be explored in the city. For many years after colonization, the future park with its abundant resources would also be home to non-Indigenous settlers.The land was later turned into Vancouver's first park when the city incorporated in 1886. It was named after Lord Stanley, 16th Earl of Derby, a British politician who had recently been appointed Governor General. It was originally known as Coal Peninsula and was set aside for military fortifications to guard the entrance to Vancouver harbour. In 1886 Vancouver city council successfully sought a lease of the park which was granted for $1 per year. In September 1888 Lord Stanley opened the park in his name.

it’s my home there Stanley market. there are have a nice view and many of shops you can enjoy a shopping there have everything you can buy what you want. also in the evening you can enjoy for dinner &bars

There are many events that go on in the area, and if you're up for some live music, wander into the lobby of the Fairmont Pacific Rim. Also, be sure to grab some gelato from Bella Gelateria (you'll know it by the ginormous line out front) and make your Canada Place experience that much more incredible!

attractions.name: Capilano Suspension Bridge Park
attractions.loc_tags: North America, Canada, British Columbia, Greater Vancouver, Vancouver, Capilano Suspension Bridge Park
reviews: An incredible place that has amazing views and makes you feel immersed in the forest.
It was the dopest place I’ve ever seen.

1. A spot full of tourists. During the trip in Canada, the population density of this attraction is the highest, and everyone has to wait in line to get on the suspension bridge. 2. If you get on the suspension bridge, you will temporarily stop moving forward. That's because some tourists want to stop to take pictures themselves, or very kindly, pause for other people to take pictures. My personal suggestion is that there are more tourists when you go, and you may take pictures on the return journey. With fewer people, the difficulty of taking pictures will be reduced. 3. There is also a small suspension bridge inside. Unlike the landscape underneath the suspension bridge at Ruyuan, there are trees underneath it, which is less crowded and more wild. 4. Temperate rainforest, with lush woods and high oxygen content, walking in it, layers of green, high and low mountains, there is a feeling of a small forest adventure.
First feeling, the ancient trees are amazing! The air is fresh, the negative ions are very high, the environment is clean and well worth a visit

reviews: Sometimes, the place to study is much more important than the content to study. I am really enegized by the sunshine.

Stanford University, located in the southern San Francisco Bay Area, Palo Alto, is a world-famous private university, founded in 1885, by local rich Stanford, covering an area of about 33 square kilometers. The university, which is responsible for important scientific research, currently ranks among the world's top universities. It has a great campus scenery, with a large lawn playground showing the heart of the 100-year-old school, a spacious interior road lined with palm trees, such as a tropical botanical garden, the main building and many supporting buildings are not too high, some like medieval monasteries, Arched colonnades and spacious and bright marble floors highlight the important elements of the building. Visitors can visit for free.

This is the second time I have been to Stanford University. The world-class companies I have served in the past were born here, so the first time I went to the headquarters, Stanford left a deep impression on me. So taking advantage of this trip to Silicon Valley, I took a special day off and went to the clock tower to look down.

reviews: Union Square, though small, is home to the world's most famous luxury brands.

Spring Festival to the United States West, drive from LA all the way north, take the 5th high speed to San Francisco, Union Square is definitely the first stop, look at the City Hall, San Francisco Symphony Orchestra site, here is a good place to buy things, a variety of big brands are very rich, lucky to draw the bloomingdale 20% card, Popular! One of the purposes of spring trips to San Francisco is of course to eat. The unique history and culture of San Francisco has created a unique atmosphere for eating. From high-end Michelin-starred restaurants to night market roadside stalls, from fine French cuisine to the cravings of barbecue. Whatever you like, this is the place to meet. Follow my food map today and step out and see where your favorite dishes are in San Francisco! The six-block, small Japanese town, is a collection of the most classic Japanese food outlets and a one-stop, tasty service experience that will make you enjoy your meal and your time. As one of the oldest Japanese cities in the United States, it is a veritable food paradise, ramen, udon, sushi, you can think of all can eat here. The Mission is one of the most integrated and diverse neighborhoods in town, and along Valencia, Mission and 24th Street you pass by many Mexican fast food restaurants and restaurants to try authentic South American style. Recommended are Gracias Madre, a vegetarian-oriented Mexican restaurant; Taqueria Cancún, pushing super burrito; and Tacolicious, a popular Mexican-flavored restaurant. Of course, apart from the three mentioned above, each has its own characteristics, which is worth trying! Vegetarians It's not easy to go out and eat anywhere with vegetarians, but in San Francisco, a city that loves meat and vegetables, you can find a lot of vegetarian options no matter where you are in the neighborhood. The smell of home in Richmond and Sunset is a sure way to go to Chinatown when you think of it, but Chinatown is not the only place to go. If you go to Richmond and Sunset, you'll find many delicious authentic Chinese restaurants. The status of the brunch at Union Square is not to be underestimated in San Francisco. Every weekend, people give up sleeping late for the unlimited mimosa, coffee and brunch. If you want to experience the local brunch charm, Union Square in the city center is the perfect place to be. Friendship tip: It's best to be at the restaurant by 9 o'clock, after all, the more people you see in the queue at dinner, the more happy you will be. Who said there can be no romance in the trip? If you're worried about a romantic candlelit dinner, bring your dear TA, to Mount Noble or the Views Restaurant on the coast, and take the city's starlight and panoramic view. In the evening, the two can also walk along the river pier, to keep the sunset romantic time. The most hidden street food Marina and SOMA have become the most popular food in San Francisco in recent years, making it difficult to find the best food in the dining car. Fortunately, you can go to Fort Mason, where the Off the Grid dining car assembly will definitely let you find your favorite. There is also hidden under the high-speed SoMa street dining car food park, one by one to eat, let you eat.

Union Square is a must-see attraction in San Francisco. Strictly speaking, there is nothing to visit, just a square, just passing by, there is no need to spend time visiting. This is also the transportation center of San Francisco, and most lines can be transferred here. The surrounding business is very developed, and shopping here is also a good choice. For example, the Tiffany store next to it is a whole building, and Macy's is also nearby. There are also many high-end hotels next to it. Because of the convenient transportation, the traffic is also very large.

attractions.address: 351 S Studio Dr, Lake Buena Vista, FL 32830
reviews: You need to include in your vacation plan, a time to see the Fantasmic at Disney's Hollywood Studios.  It's amazing.  Be attention to time and date of the presentation, you can program your visit accessing the Disney Park WebSite.

Technical difficulties aside (and there were many this past time), the Fantasmic as Disneyland is far better on an artistic level. I'm not quite sure why Mickey's imagination would feature pre-colonial era miners and a corrupt religious figure from France, but I digress. We're talking about the imagination of a troubled mouse here.Lines are long so FastPass+ this one.

My favorite show in Disneyworld. The combination of story, music, character spotting and fireworks makes it an all-around exciting experience. The amphitheater is designed so you can get a good view from any seat. It is cancelled by rain or strong winds, so keep that in mind.

Don't miss this!!We were completely amazed by the Fantasmic show at Hollywood Studios. Water fountains, fireworks, lasers, projection images, boats...you name it, it was there. Don't miss this one!There are lunch/dinner packages that will get you reserved seats for the show. Otherwise you'll want to get to the amphitheater at least 60 minutes prior to the show starting. They've added some pre-show entertainment to keep the crowd from losing their minds with boredom until the show starts.Once its over, take your time getting out. You'll feel like cattle being herded through a narrow passageway. :)
One of my favorite shows in Disney I would see it again.

great place to see sea animals and learn about them. Great shows for the family. Aquatica is their new park also.
A wonderful day with a difference. Prepare to be amazed."
Great option for a day away from Disney.  Less people and a bit slower pace with sit down shows and attractions.  The food plan gives you lots of food at a pretty good value and taste.

reviews: Been to Magic Kingdom in Tokyo & HK, and I was quite blown away by the Orlando one with new rides and expansion! Too bad that in the morning, there were constructions going on at the castle it wasn’t as picture perfect. Trip.com offers the best prices for these tickets!
One piece of the Disney complex and, I think, the most well known one of all of them. This is the original park. Parking is not free except for specific ticket
Have fun, all kinds of toys, it's pretty.

Orlando Disney, Orlando’s most worthwhile attractions ranked in the top ten, here is definitely worth spending a whole day of fun, the most fresh and profound to me is that it restored the scene of the planet Pandora in the movie Avatar, let Immersive

attractions.name: Epcot
attractions.loc_tags: North America, United States, Florida, Orange County, Orlando, Epcot
reviews: Epcot never seizes to amaze! Good food and a great environment with great people is all you need!
Awesome place to be and share with your loved ones!!
We enjoyed our trip to Epcot. Fast track and Soarin were our favorites. Even though the lines were long for some rides it went really fast.

EPCOT is Disney’s vision for future high-tech cities, divided into Future world and World Showcase. The future world is dominated by high-tech amusement facilities and experiences; Window of the World is a reduced version of the cultures of 11 countries, including Mexico, Norway, China, Germany, Italy, the United States, Japan, Morocco, France, the United Kingdom and Canada. Each country has local specialty souvenirs for sale and many gourmet restaurants, wonderful street performances and theme amusement facilities, it seems to travel the world. This park is the most popular and largest park besides Magic Kingdom.
Runaway to inferred play order reference: Future World-Window of the World
◆Future World: Soarin—Living with the Land—Mission: SPACE (out for the Advanced Training Lab area)—Test Track—Electric Umbrella lunch—Epcot Character Spot—The Seas with Nemo Friends area—Spaceship Earth (out for Project Tomorrow: Inventing the Wonders of the Future)—Journey Into Imagination With Figment (ImageWorks)
◆ Window of the World (counterclockwise tour starting at 3pm): Canada—United Kingdom (photo with people)—France—Morocco—Japan—The American Adventure—Italy—Germany—China—Mexico—Fireworks—Norway
FP received: Soarin, Mission: SPACE, Spaceship Earth

Compared with the other theme parks, we can tell from the name that Epcot is a special one. Finally, I found some restaurants worth using Credit. It is best to get to EO before 6 o'clock in time to compare several final choices. The price is the most reasonable.

reviews: Even though it’s actual park has been closed due to COVID, Universal has done a GREAT job at still providing us with entertainment with the wonders of City Walk. Great place for date night, friends, and family experiences!
The atmosphere is fun and light here. you never know who you might run into. GREAT AREA !

This is an amazing place to spend with family.  Its HUGE!  with lots of rides, attractions, shows and places to eat.  There is a behind the scenes tour where you can see the movie sets and places where television shows are filmed.  I highly recommend this park if you are in the area.

It’s a good time if you’re into VR coasters and movie tech. People who get motion sick easily might have trouble. Their were also a lot of chatacter encounters and random little street shows. The set shows are great, especially Waterworld.
My second time but still it was an amazing experience. Its like my comfort zone and one of my GO TO  place.  if you are looking for peace of mind and happiness, you know where to go.

To th east of the beach is a very large shopping complex . The complex also has places for you to get a bite to eat . the people are very friendly in this area and not as many street beggars as Venice Beach .
The sunset view here was really awesome!I’ve been here twice during my journey.I also recommend you to look over the Venice beach along the way of Santa monica beach.

a wonderful beach and pier that is easy to get too. the beach is wide and has plenty of spa e to relax. the beach is very clean . the pier isvery famous and can be seen in many mivies and TV shows . a shopping district is within walking distance

There is also a mini museum with free entrance at night. Definitely a must visit for first-timers in LA.
if you want a great view, booked a hiking tour you will not regret it!! you will see the stunning view of LA downtown and city

It is a cool place to go and spend a weekend with your family and/or friends, but sometimes it could be full and thats kinda annoying at least for me

reviews: Just a pleasure to stroll around the complex grounds, around the gardens and magnificent vistas. Entrance is free, parking is not. The museum has permanent and rotating exhibits. Time it so you don't miss the spectacular sunset!- November 2017

The Getty Center is a wonderful museum and is very close by for those museum enthusiasts!

attractions.name: Akihabara
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Tokyo, Akihabara
reviews: Akihabara is a buzzing shopping hub famed for its electronics retailers, ranging from tiny stalls to vast department stores like Yodobashi Multimedia Akiba. Akihabara is a Gaijin-Pot under Otaku.Venues specializing in manga, anime, and video games include Tokyo Anime Center, for exhibits and souvenirs, and Radio Kaikan with 10 floors of toys, trading cards, and collectibles. Staff dressed as maids or butlers serve tea and desserts at nearby maid cafes.
เป็นสถานที่ที่คนมาข้อปปิ้งกันหลากหลายมาก มีของขายเยอะมาก มีแต่ของน่าสนใจทั้งนั้นเลย

Akihabara, one of my favorite places in Tokyo, is a paradise for all anime fans like me. Once you come out from Akihabara station, all anime, comic, games posters are everywhere. Arcade, UFO (doll catching machine), comic character models, you can find all your favourite characters here. We spent quite a lot of money on doll catching game, but somehow when you spent a certain amount and still unable to catch your doll, their friendly staff will give you a helping hand to ‘adjust’ the doll in an easy catch position, so... spend more and you will definitely get a doll home!

vintage game maid cafe ufo catcher figuring shop to archade .. all can be found in this area .. even you are not a fan of toy game figrue .. but there is no harm for walking down this interesting street , skip the shine for a day . visit her try your luck on those big soft toy catching machinese . in short the ufo catcher .

I picked Akihabara to stay based on comments I had read online and I wasn't disappointed. Akihabara is very easy to get to as it's in the middle of Tokyo and quite close to Tokyo station if you decide to take the train. at night there are beautiful things to see and do. lots of manga/anime shops, arcades, maid coffees, video games shop..

attractions.name: Ueno Park
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Tokyo, Ueno Park
reviews: Ueno Park (上野公園, Ueno Kōen) is a spacious public park in the Ueno district of Taitō, Tokyo, Japan. The park was established in 1873 on lands formerly belonging to the temple of Kan'ei-ji. Amongst the country's first public parks, it was founded following the western example as part of the borrowing and assimilation of international practices that characterizes the early Meiji period. The home of a number of major museums, Ueno Park is also celebrated in spring for its cherry blossoms and hanami.In recent times the park and its attractions have drawn over ten million visitors a year, making it Japan's most popular city park.
great place to see the Sakura in the Sakura season
Beautiful park with so many attractions to explore! The gardens here are beautiful any time of the year and it's just so peaceful and serene as you're walking through the temples
good place with continues walk you can access the Zoo, Museum, Scientific museum i guessthe structures are amazing.my favorite is Gate of Hell
its nice in sping have sukura, its beautiful and have a zoo nearby which is cheap and extensive many diffenence kinds of animals in the zoo. you can spend a whole day there.

wonderful Place

She was also very busy at the time, but she was still very patient and told the baby carefully. All in all, this trip is very happy. thank you very much!

attractions.name: Nanshan Cultural Tourism Zone
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Hainan, Sanya, Nanshan Cultural Tourism Zone
attractions.address: Nanshan District, Yacheng Town, Yazhou District, Sanya City
reviews: The landmark of Nanshan Cultural Tourism Zone is the 88 m tall Nanhai Guanyin (Goddess of Mercy of the Southern Sea) statue. It stands impressive offshore linked to the land by a causeway and looking into 3 different directions with her 3 faces and bodies. It is visible and stands out when you look down  from the skies when your flight is making it'd approach onto the Sanya Phoenix  airport. Otherwise the Nanshan temple is the other attraction you must visit in this tourism zone.
Nanshan zone and temple is just amazing! The Buddha is really impressive, beautiful and huge! It’s surrounded by the sea and mountains. the views are stunning! Definitely worth it the visit!

A good place if you wants to find peaceful mind and visit Buddhism Temples. Entrance fee is a bit overprice but I think its similar other sightseeing places in Sanya. Shuttle bus “ding ding che” is worth to buy ticket then you can hop on-off and visit different spots. There were quite a lot of people around Big Guanyin Statue but less people with better scene of temple, moutain and ocean in Nanshan Temple. I also saw hotel, vegetarian restaurants and some people studying Buddhism if you consider for stay there for a night.
great place to visit and spend some time
Great spiritual centre and peaceful culture zone. Felt extremely blissful at this amazing place. Must visit spiritual centre.

fantastic green park and amazing views !

It is a beautiful place to explore, but be warned, it is a lot of hiking and walking although there were shuttles. There is a lovely restaurant there (it is a part of the resort) with good western food. The main attractions are the Orchid Valley, Rope Bridge, Glass Bridge, Ostriches, and Souvenir Shops.
Very good 👏 👏 👏

attractions.name: Luhuitou Scenic Area
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Hainan, Sanya, Luhuitou Scenic Area
attractions.address: Luhuitou Park, Luling Road, Dadonghai Tourist Area, Sanya City
reviews: Luhuitou 🦌: The best place to overlook the beauty of Sanya. One of the must-see attractions in Sanya 👍. Sanya is also called "Lucheng", which is named by Luhuitou, and it can be imagined that the importance of this attraction ⭐️. [🈵️ Mountain is love, 🈵️ Eye is love, 🈵️ Heart is touched] - ❣️ Do not miss this view of Sanya. ❗️ - ❣️ Here ticket price 🎫 Cheap, beautiful scenery, can also see the scenery of Sanya, absolutely value. It is recommended to arrive in the afternoon (because the sun is too strong at noon ☀️ when the weather is good), then watch the sunset 🌄, stay until 🌃 at night, be sure to see the night view and then go down the mountain 🏜️ Oh, the scenery during the day and night is different. -❣️ When buying tickets 🎫, you can buy the sightseeing car 🚌 together. Friends with energy suggest walking 🚶‍♀️ up the mountain. All the way to the mountain 📈 can see the scenery below the mountain, one side is the mountain ⛰️ one side is the view 🏞. Although it is uphill, it is very smooth, there is a need to push a baby carriage or an old wheelchair 🦽, absolutely no problem 👌. (✨ The battery car is only driving a road, and the mountain road behind it needs to go by itself) - ❣️ Deer Return Statue: The "Deer Return" statue on the mountain 🗿 is 12m high, it is a deer 🦌, a girl 👩 and a youth 👨. This is a beautiful legend, and the name of "Deer Return" is also derived from it. -❣️ Peak Viewing Platform ⛰️: This is the most worthwhile place to stop. 🌆 Watch the sunset in the evening and the lights are shining at night. ✨ Sanya's most beautiful night view ✨. -❣️ There are macaques on the mountain 🐒: Macaques occasionally come out. I saw them last year when it was dark, and suddenly two 🐒 and a little afraid of 😱. If you see monkey 🐒, it is recommended not to play and not to throw food, walk quietly forward 😂. -🎫 Tickets: 42 yuan in peak season (10.1-4.30 day). 35 yuan (5.1-9.30 day) in off-season. 1.2m below and over 70 years old free 🆓. 🚌 Sightseeing car: 15 yuan / person times (including round trip). The last shift at 22 o'clock. ⏰ Closed time: 21:30 stop entry, 22 o'clock start clearing.

I have been to Sanya many times. The deer has not punched back. This time I stayed at the hotel next to me and came to see the sunset in the fall. The scenic tickets are divided into two types with cable car and hike up, as long as the legs are not so inconvenient, it is recommended to go up is really not very far. Start climbing up the mountain at 4 o'clock, just saw the sunset at 5:30, really beautiful, much better than Sanya Bay, after all, in a high angle of overlook, definitely worth going to the place. I used to feel that there was no fun to travel on a sunny day, this small attraction has a little surprise, there is a panoramic view of Sanya along the way, especially the other parts of Phoenix Island are difficult to see, although the statue is not interesting, but the sunset is really worth it.

After going to the first market to eat the perfect smell of Linjie seafood, take a ten-minute car to Sanya's landmark Luhuitou. The Luhuitou mountain top is simply beautiful to enjoy the sunset and night view of Sanya, especially after a short walk up the mountain. It is located in the seaside hills around the sea on three sides of Sanya City, the main peak is 275.1 meters above sea level. Here the corners of the mountains and the waves reflect, standing on the mountain overlooking the vast sea, overlooking the rolling mountains, the panoramic view of Sanya City is extremely magnificent. The highest sculpture of the entire island of Hainan, built according to the beautiful love legend, has become the city sculpture of Sanya, which is also named Lucheng. Adult tickets alone 32 yuan, including 48 yuan of battery car. It is relatively safe to buy at least 20 minutes in advance. Purchase on the spot online can not enter the park immediately. There is a special network ticket exchange window. The process is very smooth. No. 54 bus can reach the parking lot of the scenic spot. The last bus departure time is 9:30 in the evening. No. 26 bus can reach the scenic gate, the last bus is early. If the physical strength is better or even average, it is recommended to walk up the mountain, not high, although some of the individual curves are a bit of a big slope, but the whole climb process is not difficult, even if not often exercise people can easily reach. Moreover, there are many observation pavilions half way, it is well worth stopping to enjoy the scenery of Sanya from different angles. The most recommended tour time is the evening mountain, so you can enjoy the sunset, did not eat, bring your own food and eat at the top, waiting for the city lights to light up, and you can enjoy the night of Sanya at the top. But there is nothing to play at the top, from sunset to light, few people can bear this loneliness, hahahaha. There are several shops on the top of the mountain that sell food. The price is the price of the scenic spot, but it is also ok, roasted sausage is very good. The Deer Head Park has a nice view and I think it is worth going to.

This year's Spring Festival in Sanya, the first day is to Luhuitou Scenic Area, there are good legends, love stories, standing at the highest peak, saw Dadong Bay, Sanya Bay, Phoenix Island far away can also see Haitang Bay, if your God, remember to go to Luhuitou!

Very cost-effective attractions, parking is very convenient, parking fee is only 5 yuan. Trip.com's ticket + battery car is only 52 yuan for adults, the scenic spot scan code to buy tickets is 57 yuan, the elderly over 60 years old and under 18 years old are only 40 yuan, fast ticket issuance, no need to change tickets, use ID card and QR code can enter the park. Unless you are very physically strong, the battery car must be done, and the climb on the hill is very tired. After getting off the battery car and entering the scenic spot, the mimosa in the flower bed at the foot of the mountain is very cute. Touching the leaves with your hand and closing it is quite fun. It is recommended to follow the road to the observation deck, when you go down the mountain, you can walk down the steps, and go directly to the door after coming down, very convenient. The scenery at the top is beautiful, there are two props for pictures, the scenery is good, the overall is awesome, fun, fun, cost-effective, there are attractions where old people and children will not be tired, have fun.
