Although there is no fireworks, but not so much commercial atmosphere.

attractions.name: Lion Monument
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Switzerland, Lucerne, Lucerne, Lion Monument
reviews: The Lion Monument, or the Lion of Lucerne, is a rock relief in Lucerne, Switzerland, designed by Bertel Thorvaldsen and hewn in 1820–21 by Lukas Ahorn.It commemorates the Swiss Guards who were massacred in 1792 during the French Revolution, when revolutionaries stormed the Tuileries Palace in Paris.

Lion monument is designed by the Danish sculptor, bateer David tovar, sen, and in the natural rock carving out of a great lion like dying, to commemorate on August 10, 1792, to protect the family of the French king Louis xvi of safe and sacrifice 786 loyal Swiss mercenaries. Image dying lion lion monument is engraved on a shallow holes, a dying lion with an expression of sorrow and pain, feebly prostrate on the floor, a long sharp arrow struck deeply into his back, his front PAWS and hold the broken spear and shield, the shield respectively symbolize the Swiss cross badge on vetiver iris markers and the French royal family.

The majestic but poignant lion is a slightly strange and unique evaluation, but it does not seem abrupt in Lucerne. If you say that Switzerland is not expensive, it is basically impossible to say that there is nothing but beautiful. Lucerne is the beauty in the beauty. It is located in the middle and sits on a large beautiful lake. Mark Twain is not hesitant to say good things about it. Lake Lucerne may not be as beautiful as the mountains and ice lakes, but the old city and the surrounding beautiful small towns can always be surrounded by her beauty, and the combination is even more beautiful.
The environment is not bad, the location is very good to find a good choice.
The sculptures inside are so beautifully depicted that it is really heart-rending to see such a strong animal as the lion.

attractions.name: Chapel Bridge and Water Tower
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Switzerland, Lucerne, Lucerne, Chapel Bridge and Water Tower
reviews: Chapel Bridge or known as 'The Kapellbrücke' is a covered wooden footbridge spanning the river Reuss diagonally in the city of Lucerne in central Switzerland.

The Chapel Bridge was built in 1333 and was originally built for the defense of Lucerne. The bridge body is brown, and the top of the bridge is painted red. Inside the covered bridge are about 120 paintings about the history of Lucerne painted in the 17th century. Unfortunately, most of the Cabel Bridge was destroyed in a fire in 1993 due to a ship collision accident. It was quickly rebuilt and restored to its original appearance. There is a 140-foot-high octagonal water tower (Wasserturm) in the middle of the bridge, built of bricks. This water tower was originally used as a prison, torture, observation deck and vault. Now every early summer, geraniums are planted outside the wooden bridge.
Number one of the bridges of Luzern, worth visitng while there

Built in 1332, connecting the lucerne cantrell short on both sides, is Europe''s oldest wooden covered Bridges, it''s been rebuilt after a fire in 1993, has been to lucerne''s most representative photos landscape, octagon towers. Like jose siegel walls, the lounge Bridges and towers are also part of lucerne fortifications. Lucerne iconic landmarks and octagon cantrell short water tower is the symbol of the lucerne, and Switzerland, often appear on the postcard. During the day, on the bridge has a delicate and charming romantic flowers; Walk in the dusk, will see the middle of the romantic feelings; Night, the lounge Bridges and towers in the backdrop of the lights is very romantic. So it is often referred to as the "flower bridge towers".

If you say that Switzerland is not expensive, it is basically impossible to say that there is nothing but beautiful. Lucerne is the beauty in the beauty. It is located in the middle and sits on a large beautiful lake. Mark Twain is not hesitant to say good things about it. Lake Lucerne may not be as beautiful as the mountains and ice lakes, but the old city and the surrounding beautiful small towns can always be surrounded by her beauty, and the combination is even more beautiful. The seemingly inconspicuous but ancient Capel Bridge needs to be carefully tasted, the beauty is different

attractions.name: Lucerne
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Switzerland, Lucerne, Lucerne, Lucerne
reviews: Lucerne, a compact city in Switzerland known for its preserved medieval architecture, sits amid snowcapped mountains on Lake Lucerne. Its colorful Altstadt (Old Town) is bordered on the north by 870m Museggmauer (Musegg Wall), a 14-century rampart.The covered Kapellbrücke (Chapel Bridge), built in 1333, links the Aldstadt to the Reuss River's right bank.

Lucerne (lucerne) bright and beautiful, as early as the 19th century, the poet Goethe, queen Victoria and composer Richard Wagner had deeply taste the beauty of it. Since then, lucerne is rushed to the resort famed the world. Today, it is still beautiful. Urban tourist attractions is concentrated in the old town hall, the surrounding area such as old town hall was built in the 17th century, the symbol of lucerne cabell bridge and in the 17th century Jesus church and other attractions. You can remain in the medieval flavor of the old, round art galleries and museums, if I had more time, might as well go to visit the museum of the lake and or sunbathing in lake, in repose to lucerne beauty deeply imprinted in my heart.

If you say that Switzerland is not expensive, it is basically impossible to say that there is nothing but beautiful. Lucerne is the beauty in the beauty. It is located in the middle and sits on a large beautiful lake. Mark Twain is not hesitant to say good things about it. Lake Lucerne may not be as beautiful as the mountains and ice lakes, but the old city and the surrounding beautiful small towns can always be surrounded by her beauty, and the combination is even more beautiful.

As for which city Switzerland likes the most, I choose Lucerne, also called Lucerne. It is a city that perfectly combines modernity and classicism. The transportation is very convenient, the buildings are exquisite, and the high point overlooks the city. The lion statue is very beautiful.

Lucerne means the city of light in German. Legend has it that a lamp-carrying angel guided the earliest settlers of Lucerne to choose the location of the church. Lucerne was originally just a small fishing village, but because it is located on the side of a beautiful lake and surrounded by legendary mountains, it complements the medieval water tower and the Capel Bridge that have stood in the lake for hundreds of years, exuding Switzerland Unique charm. When the romantic writer Hugo traveled to Lake Lucerne, he wrote a beautiful verse, "Elegant and quiet, the clear water gently pats the river bank, and the soft water flows under my feet...". Alexandre Dumas once praised Lucerne as "the pearl in the most beautiful clam shell in the world". When I walked and wandered the streets of Lucerne, I could really appreciate what it means to travel in a painting. 1️⃣Capel Bridge Capel means "little church" in German. Because there is St. Peter's Church not far from the bridge, it is named "Chapel Bridge". The railings on both sides of the bridge are decorated with red flowers all the year round, which looks like a flower corridor, also called the flower bridge. There is also a saying in this beautiful town: "If you have not stepped on the wooden covered bridge Capel Bridge, you have not really been to Lucerne." It connects Lucerne's new city and old city with an all-wood structure. city. Walking on the bridge, watching the clear water gently pat the river bank, the soft water flowing under the feet, and looking up, the texture of the covered bridge, the castle, the swans, and the full screen of oil painting also emerged spontaneously. 2️⃣The dying lion monument tells a sad history of Switzerland. It is the most famous sculpture in Lucerne and a symbol of Swiss loyalty and perseverance. This is to commemorate the French Revolution in 1792, when the mob attacked the Tuileries Palace in France, to protect the French King Louis XVI and Queen Mary, the monument built by 786 Swiss officers and guards who died, is intended to pray for world peace. Mark Twain hailed the "Dying Lion" as "the most tragic and touching statue in the world." 3️⃣The forefront of the Rigi Alps, known as the Queen of the Mountains, is the most famous observation tower in central Switzerland, and it is also the sister mountain of Mount Emei in China. Since ancient times, it has been a well-known place to watch sunrise and sunset. From the observation deck on the top of the mountain, you can overlook the panoramic view of the Alps and the plains of Germany and France, as well as the blue Lake Lucerne. So the playing time will take about half a day, you can refer to my itinerary guide. 10:12 Depart from Lucerne Pier 1 at 11:09 Arrive at Viznau (Fitz brain) 11:15 Depart from Viznau and take a cog train 11:45 Arrive at the top of Rigi at 13:03 Depart from the top of Rigi and descend 4️⃣Lake Lucerne The lake is my favorite place in the whole of Lucerne. Sitting on the bench by the lake, the clouds are soothing, the lower eyebrows are the clear water, the swans on the lake are chasing and frolicking, the water birds are flying in groups, and the old trees with all leaves are beautifully Stretching out the branches, the setting sun gleams on the lake surface, as if to illuminate the late autumn with some warmth. In Lucerne, even if you don’t go anywhere, just sitting by the lake, watching people come and going, teasing swans and waterbirds, listening to the lake and taking pictures of the shore is a kind of enjoyment.

attractions.name: Mt. Titlis
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Switzerland, Obwalden, Obwalden, Engelberg, Mt. Titlis
attractions.open_status: The opening time of the cable car is roughly 8:30-17:00. The time of each road is different. The opening time may be  adjusted due to the weather.It is recommended to check the official website for specific moments and check the outage date in advance.
reviews: Mt. Titlis is a mountain of the Uri Alps, located on the border between the cantons of Obwalden and Bern.At 3,238 metres above sea level, it is the highest summit of the range north of the Susten Pass, between the Bernese Oberland and Central Switzerland.

Titlis should be included in Switzerland itinerary for the first timer. a short train ride (45 minutes) from Lucern to Engelberg, Titlis offers magnificent views especially during winter. If you have more time, spend a night at one the resorts/hotels in Engelberg.

Tie li is located in the famous Swiss skiing, and mountain hot springs resort - eng fort, located in the south lucerne, about 33 kilometers apart. Tie li mountain 3238 meters above sea level, is the highest peak in central Switzerland, and the area only can be the top in 1 hour of the glacier. Rich tour only at the top of the snowy mountains, can we truly appreciate the beauty of the Alps.

The Titlis Snow Mountain in Engelberg is very beautiful. Although it arrives in summer, it is still far from the ski season, and there is still a lot of snow. The amount of snow in summer at an altitude of early 3000 is already very good. The world's first large revolving cable car is very interesting, the scenery on the way is also charming enough, and the small town at the foot of the mountain is also beautiful. It's worth coming back in the snow season

Titlis Snow Mountain Tour Guide
📍Geographical location: A famous scenic spot in the Alps, located in the small town of Engelberg in the south of Lucerne, Switzerland. The snow-capped mountains are about 3020 meters above sea level.
🚄Means of transportation: Take the train from Lucerne to Engelberg and you can walk to the scenic area. Please check sbb.cn for specific train times.
🚘The advantage of self-driving in Switzerland is that the scenery along the road is better, and the driving habits are the same. The disadvantage is that some routes need to pick up the car back and forth, and many scenic spots cannot enjoy discounts without the swiss pass.
🅿️Parking: Most outdoor parking lots are capped at CHF 5.
🎫Ticket: 92 francs, fold in half with swiss pass. There is a queue for ordering on site. We passed in the spring. The queue is very long. Basically, they bring their own ski equipment to the mountain.
📝Travel tips
🔸The small town of Engelberg can reserve most of the day to go up and down the mountain.
🔸The snow is thicker in spring, but sometimes the visibility is not high, and the chance of encountering cloudy days is higher. The situation on the snowy mountains is hard to say, it depends on luck. Remember to wear sunglasses. Snow blindness is easy on the mountain. In addition, sun protection needs to be in place.
🔸The food at the foot of the mountain is definitely cheaper than on the mountain. After climbing to the top, it is also a good choice to go down and have a picnic at the foot of Titlis.

attractions.name: Court Church of St. Leodegar
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Switzerland, Lucerne, Lucerne, Court Church of St. Leodegar
reviews: Howe''s full name lai oda, church cathedral, is located in the north of lake lucerne, is the most important church in lucerne. The church was built in 735, was originally Roman architecture, converted into gothic in the 14th century, the 17th century because of fire damage and reconstruction for the Renaissance. Cantrell covered the east of stretched tall stone steps to the front of a church road, like the holy shrine to the church. Internal solemn church, week bench late Renaissance carvings, vivid and exquisite, worth watching. Today''s Howe''s cathedral is located at the center of local beliefs and church music performance. There is concert within the church, the church''s religious musical compositions foil extraordinarily solemn and grand. Here you can see a big pipe organ, made in 1640, a total of 4950 root organ, is still used in lucerne summer festival.

The high tower on the facade of this church is very pointed, and it feels like it clamps the center building tightly. The interior space is reminiscent of Notre Dame Cathedral. The decoration styles do have similarities. This is a good space for meditation, as well as the atrium.

I went to Lucerne to visit the Hof Cathedral last year. I happened to be in the church for worship, so I can’t bother you. These revisited Lucerne, the first spot in the morning was to go straight to the Hauf Church, to take a good time and make up for the regret last time. The Hof Cathedral is an important church in Lucerne. It has the largest pipe organ in the world. The interior layout of the church is very solemn and the two-tower architecture is very conspicuous and beautiful. The building more than a thousand years ago has been preserved and published after vicissitudes of life. Not easy.

The Hof Church, in the most prominent position of the skyline of Lucerne’s old town, is the first one to see from the east from the Reuss River and the Kappel Bridge, or from the cruise terminal of Lake Lucerne and the arch of the railway station to the north. It must be the twin spires of the Hof church.
From the Lion Square on the northern shore of Lake Lucerne, 300 meters east, you reach the Hof Church. Built in 735 AD and rebuilt in 1645, the exterior of the church is Renaissance style, elegant and magnificent, and the interior is solemn and magnificent.
The church’s 4950 brass pipe organ made in 1640 is well-known and is still playing sacred religious music and the rhythm of summer music~

The Hof Church, located on the north side of Lake Lucerne, is the most important church in Lucerne. The Romanesque building started in 735 AD was converted into Gothic style in the 14th century and Renaissance style in the 17th century. The interior of the church is solemn, and there are vivid and delicate carvings on the church. The church organ, manufactured in 1640, has a total of 4950 organ pipes, which are still used at the Lucerne Summer Music Festival.

attractions.name: Swiss Museum of Transport
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Switzerland, Lucerne, Lucerne, Lake Lucerne, Swiss Museum of Transport
reviews: Swiss transport museum is one of the most representative traffic museum in Europe, is one of the biggest museum of lucerne, through exhibitions, theme park, demonstration simulation, interactive radio and films and other forms of transportation and communication development. The museum is located in the lake lucerne, a beautiful environment, both indoor and outdoor display, just like a big park. Museum of land, sea, air and accessible introduction to mechanical knowledge and history, exhibits include steam locomotives, mountaineering, classic cars, train wagons, plane, ship, etc. Visitors can also experience on sitting in the driver''s position, or to the engine room watching the movement of the machine. In addition, there are also can see the universe, or the sea scene planetarium, chocolate adventure exhibition and IMAX high-definition movie theaters and other facilities, need to buy tickets to visit alone.
Although the traffic museum is not big, but it is quite interesting, it includes train hall, ship hall, airplane hall and automobile hall.

It took a whole day, and as a parent, I haven't had enough fun, let alone children. The train pavilion, automobile pavilion, airplane pavilion, and ship pavilion are all very exciting. There are also small construction sites outdoors, with large equipment such as excavators and bulldozers. The children wear reflective vests, hard hats, and wield small shovels. Don't be serious. I really envy the children of Switzerland, five-star recommendation.

The Swiss Transport Museum, located next to Lake Lucerne in the tourist city of Lucerne in Switzerland, is the largest transport museum in Europe with the richest exhibits. There are more than 7,000 cultural relics and 150,000 important historical documents. There are canoes dating back more than 3,000 years. Medieval carriages, steam locomotives and mountain trains from the 19th century, vintage cars and airplanes from the 20th century, and spaceships of the future, as many as 3000 exhibits. The exhibition systematically introduced the development of road, rail and water transportation, and the content of space transportation. The exhibition focuses on interaction and fun, with simulated fighter jets, train driving, car crash tests, boating competitions, car showcases and other interesting activities. In the automobile exhibition hall, various cars are displayed on the exhibition shelf, and the electronic version of the car will continue to appear on the TV screen. If the audience likes the old-fashioned car displayed on a certain computer, they can tap the keyboard in front of them. The classic car that has been clicked the most can be displayed in front of the audience from the exhibition stand. There is also a special activity area for children in the museum, where you can learn about driving traffic rules and the construction of roads and railways through games. After seeing the museum, taking a walk by the lake is a great enjoyment.

I thought that the swiss pass ticket was free, but only a 50% discount, 16 Swiss francs after discount, this museum is definitely worth playing, there are several branches, trains, cars, planes, ships, each museum except for some physical cars In addition, there are many interactive gadgets. As a nearly 40-year-old adult, I enjoyed it all. I went in at 3pm and played until the door was closed. Among them, the airport hall also has an airplane test drive cabin and a helicopter test drive to experience. It is recommended to bring children to play

attractions.name: Horseshoe Bend
attractions.loc_tags: North America, United States, Arizona, Coconino County, Page, Horseshoe Bend
reviews: Mother Nature is magical, just near Peggy, after visiting the Grand Canyon, go to the Antelope Canyon will pass here. After parking, you have to walk a distance to reach. Standing on the edge of the rock to see the canyon is still quite shocking, you must pay attention to safety.
Beautiful place. One of those tourists "must see" places. Short walk down. It's nice to sit and enjoy for a moment if you can manage to get away from people.
Loved here, pure natural wonderful pictures, natural ghosts and axes magical work of color and shapes here perfectly.
Horseshoe Bay is really magnificent, and the magic of nature makes people linger.

[Horseshoe Bend] is a U-shaped channel of the Colorado River in Arizona. Because the giant rocks surrounding the river bend are shaped like horseshoes, it is called "Horseshoe Bend", although I don't see it like a horseshoe😂
Standing on the wall of a canyon that is said to be 300 meters high, overlooking a 270-degree arc-shaped bay of clear water, it is really shocking (a child who is afraid of heights refuses to come close to see 😂).

attractions.name: Majestic Monument Valley Touring Co.
attractions.loc_tags: North America, United States, Arizona, Coconino County, Page, Majestic Monument Valley Touring Co.
reviews: The Monument Valley, known as Monument Valley Navajo Tribal Park, is located on the Navajo Indian Reservation, Arizona-Utah border, one of the ten enchanting deserts of the United States, with its magnificent scenery, which is used many times as a location for the Hollywood Westerns and as a television set. The background of the advertisement is more famous for the Forrest Gump biography. The formation of the special geomorphology is the deposition of the ancient Rocky Mountains here, and then turned into sandstone, because of the pressure of strata, resulting in the surface fault uplift, and the erosion of the wind and rain, became the ancient city of the present ruins of the landscape.

The monument valley Navajo tribal park is located in the Indian reserve of Navajo, Arizona and Utah, and is not under the jurisdiction of the national park, but is managed by the Navajo park entertainment department established in 1957. The origin of the place is the deposition of the ancient Rocky Mountains and the formation of sandstones, and later, because of the increased pressure under the stratum, the surface faults uplift and gradually formed the canyon, and the erosion of wind and rain, became what we saw. Of course, the erosion and change are continuing, but only slowly. Nine of America's Monument Valley believe many people have seen the back series, many of which are shot here in the third episode; Many years ago, the population of the flying wolf film, prefer to choose this place as "secret base." It is because many western films and TV series are all thousands of miles to get here, the people's idea of the west seems to be shaped into the wilderness of the horse, with numerous wilderness mountains. But also because of this, make the local scenery more famous.
We liked the view here so much ,the gift from Mother Nature,it is absolutely stunning

45 USD/person to travel around the valley in a jeep.
It lasted nearly 2 hours. The whole mountain road is called a bump... The simple windshield equipment of the jeep can't stop the roaring cold wind. The people in the car are shaking with cold and they can’t wait to put on all the clothes 🥶, and the wind blowing Sand fascinates our eyes from time to time (background music: you are wind and I am sand~), but the magnificent scenery along the way makes us feel that all the hardships are worth it~

It takes about an hour to drive from Page Town to Memorial Valley. The Monument Valley is not a valley, but a landscape on a vast red soil plain. It is said that Memorial Valley is an enduring symbol of the western United States. The red flat-topped mountain stands In the desert, the colors are bright, mainly including peculiar sandstone landforms, Indian Neiva and tribal areas, and the four-state border monument. Travel here to explore the history of the American West and learn about the history of American Indians. The visitor center provides tourist souvenirs, fast food and toilets.

attractions.name: Lake Powell
attractions.loc_tags: North America, United States, Arizona, Coconino County, Page, Lake Powell
reviews: We drove to lake Powell and walked to the beach where we sat and watched the sunset. What a beautiful tranquil place to visit
A must visit to Lake Powell for a visit to the Grand Canyon, preferably a boat ride

【Lake Powell】It is said to be the second largest artificial lake in the United States. Check in advance the sunrise time of the next day at 07:36 and adjust the alarm clock.
Early the next morning, get up early, walk to the shore of Lake Powell, and wait for the beautiful sunrise. But I didn't expect that the clouds were too thick and the sun was completely covered by the father-in-law. Okay, it's a pity, but Lake Powell is quiet and peaceful in the early morning, and the scenery is still beautiful.

【Arizona❥Lake Powell】
All lakes love Lake Powell
[Performance price] Not bad, the consumption of supporting equipment is not high,
[Fun] Not bad.

Nestled in the rugged loess and rocks between Utah and Arizona, Lake Powell is vast and blue, quiet and charming! Traveling around by boat, you will be even more amazed at the splendor between the world and the earth, and the magical workmanship!

attractions.name: Antelope Canyon
attractions.loc_tags: North America, United States, Arizona, Coconino County, Antelope Canyon
reviews: Antelope Canyon was like a Labyrinth, once you enter it, just follow the certain path, enjoy that wonderful nature legacy, and reach the end of the cave unconciously.whereas your life, you create your own labyrinth, pursuing your dream, having some fun, full of laughter and tears, happiness and sadness respectively until the uncertain end of time. #myNovGetaway #thanksgiving

It’s a magical place that requires light to take good-looking photos. It is necessary to book a place for the visit online in advance. If there are many people waiting on the spot, it may not be guaranteed. After gathering, I got on a special jeep and blew a head of dust before it arrived. The canyon is not long, and everyone has enough time to take photos slowly.

I read a lot of introductions and guides before going to the Antelope Valley. Some people say that the Lower Antelope Valley is more beautiful than the Upper Antelope Valley; some people say that you don’t need to see the Lower Antelope Valley if you go to the Upper Antelope Valley (also say that you don’t need to go to the Upper Antelope Valley if you go to Lower Antelope Valley) ; Some people say that the road down Antelope Canyon is steep. I have everything to say, making me undecided whether to go up the valley or down the valley, so I set aside half a day when planning the trip to Peggy. Practice has proved that this arrangement is really wise (boast yourself 😂). Our arrangement is like this. Before going to the United States, book Shanggu tickets on Ctrip.com. After going to Shanggu, drive to the Xiagu ticket office. Fortunately, the ticket office sells tickets for the day and the next day on site. Bought tickets for the next morning. To be honest, although Shanggu and Xiagu are the same landform, the landscapes are very beautiful but different. The Shanggu is flat. It takes time (good weather + noon) and a guide to help you spread sand to create the effect. ; Although the road is a little difficult to walk in the lower valley (compared to the upper valley), anyone who can walk can pass smoothly. The landscape of Xiagu is everywhere and the spiral stone walls are even more breathtaking. If you rarely have the opportunity to travel to Peggy again, it is recommended to go to the Antelope Canyon or the upper and lower valleys to visit, in order to pay for the trip. In your spare time touring the Upper and Lower Valleys, you can arrange to visit Horseshoe Bay, Lake Powell (must take a boat tour) and Grand Dam. The first picture was taken when I was out of the valley. When the tour was completed, there was only one passable space, but it was not difficult.
We took the lower canyon tour. Had a fantastic tour guide as well. I would highly recommend you take a tour of this magical , mystical land!!!
What a strange light, the light at noon is particularly good

attractions.name: Glen Canyon Dam
attractions.loc_tags: North America, United States, Arizona, Coconino County, Page, Glen Canyon Dam
reviews: Come here mainly to and from Horseshoe Bend, Antelope Valley. There is a tourist service center on the dam where you can book tickets to visit the dam. If you don’t want to spend money, you can also walk around the dam and take pictures. But I personally think that the surrounding views of the Grand Canyon, the several viewpoints at Lake Powell, are also very good if you have time to play

After visiting Horseshoe Bay, we will visit the Antelope Canyon in the afternoon. Passing by the Grand Canyon Dam, the car stopped for us to enjoy and take pictures. In fact, when the sun was scorching, many people were reluctant to get out of the car. It was too hot. But the beauty needs such a good day. The Colorado River flows quietly and is so blue that it makes people's minds heartwarming. This is a very important dam in the United States. Our interest in the dam itself is no match for our interest in the beautiful river under the blue sky and white clouds.

Although the Grand Canyon Dam is not as large and famous as the Hoover Dam, it is also a particularly spectacular attraction. The scenery around the dam is particularly good. Although the self-driving car stopped here for a while, the beautiful scenery still impressed us

Arizona. The Grand Dam is at Lake Powell. A dam blocked the Colorado River and formed Lake Powell. The drop of the dam is more than that of Hoover, which is very spectacular. There is a parking lot and a tourist center above the dam. The tourist center has free toilets and a souvenir shop.

Glen Canyon Dam is located in Page City, Northern Arizona. It controls the flow of the Colorado River and can generate electricity. The mission of the dam is to store water resources for this particularly arid area of the United States. Under the blue sky and white clouds, this dam is even more spectacular.

attractions.name: Glen Canyon National Recreation Area（Wahweap）
attractions.loc_tags: North America, United States, Arizona, Coconino County, Page, Glen Canyon National Recreation Area（Wahweap）
reviews: Next to the Gran Canyon Group is a famous dam in Arizona, the Gran Dam, which can be seen on the way to Lake Powell. The gorge is very magnificent and the dam is very impressive and it is worth a visit.

The best way to visit the Grand Canyon is to take the Canyon Explorer in Pecs. There are two routes, one is the Guinea Gorge and the Lingyang Canyon, which takes about 3 hours, and the other is the rainbow in the most beautiful Grand Canyon. The bridge is also the only rainbow stone bridge in the world. The boat will stay 45 centimeters to disembark and take pictures of this boat on foot. The journey takes about 5 hours. The best time to shoot the reflection of the rainbow bridge is in the morning, so take the boat at 7 o'clock in the morning.

The Glen Canyon Dam, shaped like a fan, is inserted straight into the red canyon more than two hundred meters deep, firmly blocking the rushing Colorado River, and creating a large blue lake stretching hundreds of miles behind it. . I heard that a lot of electricity is generated from here every year. We went through strict security checks, followed the staff to board the dam, and felt its majesty up close.

This includes a large number of resorts and nature reserves such as Lake Powell, Antelope Valley, Horseshoe Bay. It belongs to the special landform of the red sandstone area in the Grand Canyon. In summer, you can also take a boat trip and stay by the lake. The visitor center here can also be stamped as a souvenir!

To see the original natural scenery-Glen Canyon National Recreation Area (Wahweap) unknown national park If you say Page is the most recommended attraction, I will definitely choose Glen Canyon National Recreation Area without hesitation. The national park, which is very niche in name and strategy, was indeed one of the most surprising locations of our trip. Although the facilities are relatively simple or even rudimentary, it feels very simple and authentic. Here we are the first time to touch an otter up close. The best way to visit the national park with two lines for a full day is to take a boat. There are two lines to choose from. One is the Guinea Gorge and the Lingyang Gorge, which takes about two hours. One is the Rainbow Bridge line we chose, which takes about five hours. Just listen to the name, and of course choose the dreamy Rainbow Bridge. However, we recommend taking the boat at 7 o'clock in the morning for this line. In this case, it is the morning to reach the Rainbow Stone Bridge, and the reflection of the famous Rainbow Bridge can be photographed in calm waves. The blue pearl and red rocks are no exaggeration to say that Powell Lake is really blue like a gem, and the blue sky is as beautiful and unreal as in a documentary. The red soil and the white sandy beach are themselves a painting with rich colors. The ladies wear gypsy-style skirts and take pictures~

attractions.name: Antelope Canyon Tours
attractions.loc_tags: North America, United States, Arizona, Coconino County, Page, Antelope Canyon Tours
attractions.address: 22 S Lake Powell Blvd, Page, AZ 86040
reviews: The cave is unique in its incredible soft curve, plus the rock itself contains many minerals, in the top of the natural light lighting, showing rich orange yellow, red, purple and other colors, very beautiful, legend is antelope frequent and perch place.

The Antelope Canyon is a famous slot-shaped canyon in the world, and it is a place where it's very popular. It must be visited by a local Indian guide, and the magical scenery is breathtaking 👍🏻. It’s really like what the tour guide said: When you enter the Antelope Canyon, no matter whether you take pictures with a SLR or the most common mobile phone, the results are super good!

There is a little risk in the process of going down the stairs to the inside of the Caixue, so be careful. It’s not allowed to take pictures when going up and down the stairs. Be sure to grab the frozen metal handrails on both sides that look like popsicles (I regret not coming out with gloves). I regret wearing this wide-brimmed hat. The small corners of the inside are missing. I am often bumped and bumped 😰

We visited Lower Antelope Canyon. A team of dozens of people separated into small teams of 10 and followed Navajo Indian guides into the colorful cave. These guides had no fixed salary and depended on tips. Therefore, it’s best for everyone to tip the guide before starting the tour. They will introduce you to the scenic spots more vigorously, tell you how the camera should be graded to get a good effect, and which location will be more beautiful. Of course you can also ask him Take pictures for you.
It is very shady after entering the valley bottom. The Antelope Canyon is a slit canyon, formed by soft sandstone after millions of years of various erosive forces, including flash floods and wind erosion. The vertical erosive force of the flash flood formed the terrain of the Antelope Canyon and its smooth water-like edges. The magical landscape makes everyone cries of wonder from time to time.

The beauty of American Antelope Canyon cannot be expressed with photos...
Come to this land of Indians
As if I am already in it
Only when you are on the scene can you feel her beauty
The Antelope Canyon, one of the seven geological photography wonders in the world, is really a blockbuster for casual shooting

If "Lamb Cave" is a late affair, then I prefer it to be the goddess of my heart forever. No man-made light, all is a feast of the light and shadow of nature. The red sandstones are refracted by natural beams of light to produce beautiful colors, such as dream silk, layers of dancing, and such as beautiful dreams, such as intoxicated. The erosion of the torrents and winds over a million years has created the most unique cave in the history of the world's geology, hidden underground, unintentionally discovered by a little girl who sheds sheep. It's not beautiful you want to see. If it encounters a torrential rain, this narrow heaven can become a rapids, never escape the possibility of hell. If it encounters a cloudy day, no sun light into, it completely loses the colorful charm. Last but not least, if you don't listen to the command and make Indian guides unhappy, let you out, out directly

attractions.name: Great Barrier Reef
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, Australia, Queensland, Great Barrier Reef, Great Barrier Reef
reviews: Great Barrier Reef, the place where you must punch in your life is early in the morning, report to the dock, take the speedboat to the platform, spend the whole day playing on the platform in the Great Barrier Reef, take a helicopter 🚁 go shopping in the sky, dive to the bottom of the sea, play with fish 🐟, see the coral reef, eat seafood, Write a postcard to send to yourself in the future, with the Great Barrier Reef postmarks on it, and you'll be happy to think of this interesting journey every time you see it.

Located in Cairns City, the Aquarium covers all the distinctive land life and marine animals of Australia. Visit the Aquarium to explore the Sea World before heading deep into the Great Barrier Reef. The Great Barrier Reef is the largest and largest coral reef ecosystem in the world, consisting of 2900 separate coral reefs, 600 islands and 300 coral reefs. The main transport means to the Great Barrier Reef are boats and helicopters.
The Great Barrier Reef in Cairns, Australia, world famous
The world's largest coral reef system, stretching over 3,000 kilometers.

We are near the Great Barrier Reef for the first time, so we think we should travel there and do snorkeling. We chose Skedaddle and I can recommend this company to it. The day we went was very gloomy and dull, which did not show the best coral reef. The coral reef itself may have surpassed the best state. We have been snorkeling in many places around the world and the results are much better. The Ningaloo coral reef in Western Australia is far better than GBR. However, if you are like us, you think you should go when I am leaving in Cairns. We saw all kinds of fish, but the coral itself was very disappointing.

attractions.name: Sunlover Reef Cruises
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, Australia, Queensland, Cairns, Sunlover Reef Cruises
attractions.address: 1 Spence Street | Reef Fleet Terminal Tenancy 3, Queensland 4870, Australia
reviews: The Sun Lover's Outer Barrier Reef Cruise is the best cruise ship to visit the Great Barrier Reef. You can take this cruise out to see the beauty of the Great Barrier Reef. Not only can you see beautiful corals, you can also see cheering dolphins, you can also go snorkeling, and you can also enjoy a very good lunch. It is the most convenient way to visit the Great Barrier Reef. The most economical way.

The Sun Lover’s Outer Barrier Reef Cruise is a large cruise ship with a relatively low price and is an economical choice for viewing the Great Barrier Reef at sea. The entire trip is about 4 hours, about 4 islands in the Great Barrier Reef, and diving activities, it is still worth to experience.

I didn't get the helicopter, so I had to go to the boat back, plus the helicopter to overlook the Great Barrier Reef for 10 minutes. The sea green is like emeralds, and it is breathtaking. After playing snorkeling, the transparency of the sea water is not bad, suitable for beginners. Turbulence at sea is inevitable, and anti-sickness medicine can be used.

If you say that people who have been to the sea will feel very boring, after all, there are few fishes that can be seen, mainly corals, and there are no special highlights. The key is easy to get seasick.

A great experience! The Great Barrier Reef is very beautiful, you can swim and snorkel in the sea! Lunch is also good! You can participate in various marine activities on board, it is very safe, and you can experience many different projects!

reviews: great experience . the skyrail will take you 30 mins for one way trip.Never dispointment .

The Skyrail Rainforest Cableway is a pricey attraction but worth its money for e.g. a day tour with your family. The view from the skyrail is phenomenal and the city of Kuranda charming with its many cafe's and shops.
Amazing ride on top of the rain forrest canopy, a nice day trip from Cairns.

One of the coolest things you can do while in Cairns is ride the Skyrail Rainforest Cableway.  Set aside some money for the excursion and ride it through a lush rainforest.  Sure you might not see any animals but you'll see an assortment of flora that boggles the mind.  Some of the trees are only native to Australia so it was really cool to check them out along with the views of one of the last preserved rainforests on earth.  Enjoy the ride!

Nice transportation to explore.  You can on and off the cableway to stop and look at the waterfalls.  Don't pay extra for the upgraded cableway.  The regular cableway is good enough to get an aerial view.

reviews: great island for snorking and water activity

Ahhhhh Cairns, this is truly well worth visiting, and Green Island is just terrific, I was there twice, Cairns is great, I found it to be a safe city, great local people, just take the usual precaurions that you would take whilst touring anywhere

The Great Barrier Reef is one of the most beautiful sights that the world is going to disappear and has the pleasure to experience it on site. Especially the Green Island which is a must for everyone. Not only did the snorkeling experience the water and sand, but also took a helicopter from the sky to see the beauty, just didn't go deep diving, catch up next time

I know that tourist attractions are trying to find a balance between opening so that people who can be tourists (i.e. Queenslanders) come to visit and make a living, if no one else (i.e. overseas tourists) can, don’t waste money, but people what if None are opened, will not visit! This is a very good line! Fortunately, the dive shop and beach are beautiful. Gorgeous weather, beaches and islands.
A must-visit place in a lifetime to experience different scenery

attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, Australia, Queensland, Cairns, Esplanade
reviews: Great spot, huge pool thtbtge public can use for free.  Great views and restaurants and bars all around... nice walk way and even an outdoor gym!

Australia is surrounded by the sea, so many cities face the sea. Cairns is one of them. The promenade facing the sea is very spacious and the scenery is very beautiful. The tropical plants are even more refreshing. There is also a public swimming pool on Binhai Boulevard, where you can enjoy the water and sea views, which is so beautiful!

The most famous Cairns snorkeling depth and the starting point for helicopter activities, the dock is relatively large, docked by the Magic Great Barrier Reef, Silver Shuttle, Sunshine Lover, and many other cruise ships, and there are many western restaurants with good atmosphere famous for seafood. There is also a bar, which is very lively until the evening. At the same time, you can hear the calls of seagulls and various seabirds. The sunshine in the morning is full of vitality and yearning.

The densely populated coastal road is a major feature of the local area. There are many restaurants and bars. The most important thing is that the most attractive thing here is the beautiful seascape, especially the fish in Figure 2 can be regarded as important landmarks here. A very nice resort!

The Cairns seaside is full of wet landforms, so you can't go to the sea, you can go to the coastal road, you artificial swimming pool, and there are many fitness places. If you live in the city and choose to go out to sea in Cairns, you can try to walk to the pier, which is very comfortable

attractions.name: Moore Outer Reef
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, Australia, Queensland, Cairns, Moore Outer Reef
attractions.address: Reef Fleet Terminal , 1 Spence St , Cairns, Qld
reviews: loved the reef amazing colourful creation by nature..

It takes about 40 minutes to take Reef Magic to Moore Reef by boat. I vomited about 10 times when the wind and waves were not strong, and my husband did not vomit even once. Therefore, seasick children take seasickness medicine 30 minutes before boarding! Then on the water platform, get up and change the jellyfish suit and snorkeling equipment, which are provided free of charge. Floating on the sea for a while to relieve seasickness and wait for the helicopter tour. In addition, friends who plan to dive deep want to take a helicopter. Remember to coordinate the time and dive first. The helicopter is 6 people at a time, flying in the air overlooking the Pacific Ocean is super beautiful, very suitable for couples, the vast sea, coral reefs dotted among them, although I did not see the real love barrier reef, but I saw a similar one. . After seeing the panorama, eating some buffet lunch, and snorkeling to get close to the fish and corals, it feels amazing! My husband went deep diving, his ears hurt when I went down, but there were more fish than snorkeling.

The Great Barrier Reef is divided into an inner barrier reef and an outer barrier reef. The difference is that the inner barrier reef is closer to Cairns, but the coral and seawater scenery is far less than that of the outer barrier reef. The outer barrier reef is farther from Cairns and the Moore Reef is the outer barrier reef water that is closest to Cairns. Very crystal clear blue, clear and highly visible, the colorful coral reef is located on a bed of fine white sand on the seabed. Whether you are sitting on a helicopter and overlooking the entire Great Barrier Reef or diving into the seabed to watch various tropical fish shuttle between the corals, it is a wonderful sight.

I took the Dayang Lover to go snorkeling on Moore Reef. I heard people say that it might be seasick, but there was nothing wrong with it. Boat to the snorkeling area, there are activities such as semi-submarine, glass boat, etc. It is good to see the underwater world. Usually lunch first, buffet style, fairly generous. Then start snorkeling. It lasted four hours, but we had a great time. worth it.

First of all, the Great Barrier Reef is divided into inner Barrier Reef and outer Barrier Reef. The inner Barrier Reef is generally going to the Emerald Island, which is cheap but the scenery is really general. So the Great Barrier Reef must go to outer Barrier Reef, which is the Moor Reef which is the nearest outer Barrier Reef to Cairns. It is very My view is the right way to open the Great Barrier Reef.

attractions.name: Palm Cove
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, Australia, Queensland, Cairns, Palm Cove
reviews: great place for viewing and relaxation

Palm Cove is a beautiful bay and an important beach in Cairns. The sand here is as white as snow, although it is not very soft when stepped on, it is also very comfortable. There are many colorful houses on the beach, which feel a bit Southeast Asian style, very island style. You can spend a leisurely afternoon drinking coffee, eating seafood and enjoying the sea view here.

Palm Cove in Cairns is a bay full of tropical island flavors. Rows of palm trees on the coast sway with the wind. Wooden beach houses are hidden in it, giving people a sense of relaxation and freedom. Come and play.

The location of this bay is a little bit off, and the beach feels average, small and the sand is relatively thick, but the best thing here is that there are fewer people and more seabirds, depending on personal choice.

This is a long and narrow bay. The beach is not particularly wide, but it is more suitable for walking or sitting. But the environment here is very quiet. There are not too many people. We live in this area.

attractions.name: Paronella Park
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, Australia, Queensland, Cairns, Paronella Park
attractions.address: 1671 Japoonvale Rd, Mena Creek, Queensland 4871, Australia
reviews: vey beautiful place to enjoy day :-) thank you guys
Great location, nice environment, especially like

Paronila Park is a very good virgin forest park in Cairns, where there are many ancient buildings and tall trees, especially the banyan tree and other buildings perfectly blended together, it looks very simple and elegant, full of mystery The air here is also very fresh. It is definitely a place worth visiting in Cairns.

The beautiful Paronella Park is a place about dreams and persistence! The original owner Jose built the castle of his dreams little by little in 8 years. Although the perfect castle in 1935 has been destroyed by storms, floods and fires, you can still find his ingenuity in the details of the castle. Using discarded railroad tracks to make beams, electricity from hydroelectric power generation, and picnic tables that are staggered to ensure that every location can perfectly watch waterfalls, jazz tables, movie screens, cafes, tennis courts, lover's roads, and even peripherals The bamboos of the barrier are all landscapes of their own. The current owner is the former president of General Electric Asia. After buying the park, he took care of it and did not rebuild it. Instead, he kept the original owner's thoughts intact. One is to create, the other is to guard! It has nothing to do with interests, only the true heart. I hope that the wishing pool can record our wish, and we will complete it one day...( ˃᷄˶˶̫˶˂᷅)

Everyone has dreams, but most people forget them. What is your aspiration? attractions.name: Mount John

reviews: Hiking up Mount John. Mount John is located on the shore of Lake Tekapo. You can enjoy the beautiful Lake Tekapo and the lakeside town from the top of the mountain. The most notable thing is that there is an observatory on the top of the mountain, which is an important base for space research in New Zealand. Because it is far away from big cities and the sky is clear, it has the most beautiful starry sky at night. It is also one of the four best stargazing spots in the world. It is recognized as the best place to observe the Milky Way and the center of the universe. There is also a coffee shop on the top of the mountain, which is known as the best coffee shop in the world. Climb to Mount John for a cup of star coffee and wait for stargazing
Everywhere is the scenery, the sky is blue, and the good mood is quietly coming closer to us.

Mount John is located on the shore of Lake Tekapo. It is a mountain with an altitude of more than 1,000 meters. It is very majestic and majestic. It is also a great place for hiking, and the most recommended is the stargazing trip here. Since there is no air pollution and light pollution, it is really beautiful to see the bright Milky Way at night.
It's really good, and I will go if I get the chance. Overall it is awesome, interesting and fun, and cost-effective.

attractions.name: Church of the Good Shepherd
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, New Zealand, Canterbury, Mount Cook National Park, Church of the Good Shepherd
attractions.address: 23 Pioneer Dr, Lake Tekapo 7999, New Zealand
reviews: Church of Tje Good Shepherd story was Rodman, one of the two builders, was the first person to get married at the church. On 14 December 1935, he married Peggy Trott.The Australian oak shingles did not last in the harsh climate of the Mackenzie Basin and in 1957, the roof was covered with slate shingles instead.On 5 September 1985, the building was registered by the New Zealand Historic Places Trust (now Heritage New Zealand) as a Category I structure, with register number 311.The Church of the Good Shepherd is one of the most photographed items in New Zealand; photography within the building is no longer permitted as it interfered with worship.
Nice view, good weather

This beautiful stone church is located on the shore of Lake Tekapo in New Zealand, with a vast landscape in the background, giving the illusion of people walking in the middle of the painting! The blue sky, the crystal clear lake, the white stones scattered on the shore and the swarms of albatross by the lake are just a postcard! The children also like it very much, throwing stones on the shore, interacting with water birds, and we were pleasantly surprised to find a cute bunny in the grass~ Highly recommend the friends who drive in South Island, New Zealand to check in, take pictures, sunset The church below and Lake Tekapo are really beautiful! The Church of the Good Shepherd is named after a sculpture of a shepherd dog. It is a tribute to the pioneers who created farmland and the Mackenzie area in the past. It is very memorable that they will always remember their great achievements. The church was built in 1935 by the famous architect Benjamin Woolfield Mumford, and its Gothic wood and stone structures are unique in New Zealand. Many new couples choose to hold their wedding here. From the window of the church altar, you can see the most spectacular scenery of the Southern Alps. Transportation: Lake Tekapo is a 3-hour drive from Christchurch

The Church of the Good Shepherd, located on the shore of the lake on the south side of Lake Tekapo, is accompanied and complemented by Lake Tekapo. The lake provides the church with the lake and mountains, making it more elegant and quiet; the church is like a piece of precious jade, dotted with the lake, making it more shining. The church was built in 1935, and then named "The Church of the Good Shepherd" in response to the neighboring shepherd dog sculptures. It was also the place where many shepherd spirits were sued. Today, there are still many believers in the historic church. Because of its exquisite and quaint appearance and the best location to enjoy the beauty of Lake Tekapo, there are more tourists. The surrounding parking lot is hundreds of times larger than the church area. . When going to the church, the volunteer old man at the door repeatedly warned: Don't make a loud noise, don't take pictures indoors, only use the telephoto to leave your favorite photos.

The church itself is unremarkable. It is a simple stone building. Domestic female celebrities came here to take wedding dresses and suddenly became Internet celebrities. Chinese tourists came to check in during the day and watch the stars at night. The mountain view and lake view reflected next to it are actually very beautiful. The town is so comfortable that I regretted staying in a hurry and left. There is indeed a particularly magnificent starry sky here. It is very cold at night when the National Day comes. You need to be wrapped tightly before you can go out.

attractions.name: Lake Tekapo
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, New Zealand, Canterbury, Mount Cook National Park, Lake Tekapo
reviews: Lake Tekapo is a small town located at the southern end of the lake of the same name in the inland South Island of New Zealand.It had 558 residents according to the 2018 census, being one of five settlements in the sparsely populated Mackenzie Basin

Lake Tekapo (Lake Tekapo): The second largest lake in the northern part of the McKinch basin, which flows from north to south, is recharged by the Godley River, which is 700 meters above sea level and has a watershed area of 83 square kilometers. Located between Christchurch and Queenstown, the famous tourist city of South Island, New Zealand, lies in the heart of the Cook Mountain Basin and MacKenzie. Beautiful, charming lake of Tikapo surrounds trees and snowy white covered by golden sun, endless snowy mountains. Lake Tecabo and the smaller nearby lakes Alexandrina, McGregor and Conway are great places to catch brown and rainbow rays in the right season. In the winter, the town of Tecabo hosts a large number of skiers

There are many lakes in New Zealand, most of which are surrounded by mountains, the shoreline is tortuous, the lake is clear, and the scenery is pleasant. It is an excellent tourist attraction. Lake Tekapo, located in the middle of Mount Cook National Park, has become a must-visit tourist attraction in the South Island of New Zealand with its three characteristics. First, the iconic landscape is famous all over the world. The Church of the Good Shepherd and the Shepherd Dog sculpture on the south bank of Lake Tekapo are not only the iconic landscape of Lake Tekapo, but also the business card of New Zealand tourism. The dark gray and elegant churches, the dark and strong sculptures and the splendid scenery complement each other, which is unforgettable. The second is the beauty of the lakes and mountains. The sparkling milk-blue lake, the year-round snow peaks on the top of the mountain, the colorful Lubing flowers on the lake shore, and the dark gray rocky beach by the lake, are like a beautiful painting, making people like a fairyland and linger. The third is that the dreamy starry sky is desirable. The Tekapo area is the "Dark Night Starry Sky Reserve" named by UNESCO and is the best place to watch the stars in the southern hemisphere. The splendid Milky Way and dots of stars attract many star fans to come and enjoy the mystery of the starry sky.
Beautiful, really beautiful! The lake is blue like a gem, the Lu Binghua on the lake is not true
A must see between Christchurch and Queenstown for first timers to visit New Zealand.

reviews: Lake Tekapo is formed by the eruption of a volcano, so it is also rich in geothermal resources. There are many hot springs, and the middle age is misty. You can enjoy the hot springs here. Warmth and curative effect, very comfortable, it is definitely worth experiencing.
Tekapo Hot Springs is a truly refreshing experience. The beautiful snow-capped lake Tekapo, a famous starry sky town, soak in a hot spring here, this is really a life for the gods!

The scenery is beautiful, and there are many people in the winter. There is drinking water. There are charge lockers. You need to bring your own bathing suit, bath towel, slippers. There are three pools, and children can only soak in the two with low temperature. But this water temperature is more suitable than Japanese hot springs, and it will not be very hot.

Tekapo Hot Spring is a real volcanic hot spring. The hot spring is the outdoor one. There are not too many things. The hot spring here is also very popular with children. The temperature is moderate and it is very comfortable.

We enjoy the hot springs. The child wants to try other things (skating, etc.). The price is a bit expensive for tourists, but it is worth it. After driving for 4-5 hours from QT, on the way to Christchurch, this provides a place to relax. We didn't prepare, but they let us rent a set (swimming suit/towel) for $5. The lockers are working well. The only missing facility: soap and shampoo in the shower room.

attractions.name: Mount Cook National Park
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, New Zealand, Canterbury, Mackenzie District, Mount Cook National Park
reviews: Mount Cook or Aoraki is the highest mountain in New Zealand.Its height, as of 2014, is listed as 3,724 metres. It lies in the Southern Alps / Kā Tiritiri o te Moana, the mountain range which runs the length of the South Island.A popular tourist destination, it is also a favourite challenge for mountain climbers.
[Scenery] Very beautiful [Interesting] Fun [Value for money] Very good

Cook Mountain National Park is the most important natural landscape in New Zealand. It is a large area and it is recommended to spend a week visiting it, with endless snow mountains, magical cradles and a variety of alpine lakes. Like a place where the gods live, it's really super beautiful.
A good place to see glaciers and snow-capped mountains is just like a hotel residence. Suitable for couples to play together.

Cook Mountain National Park is about 60 minutes from Shepherd Church, drive west, turn right at T-junction at the source of Pukaki Lake, then trundle through the silver beech forests along the azure Pukaki Lake, a World Heritage Site in southwest New Zealand. It is a combination of Westland National Park, Asperi Mountain National Park and Fjord National Park. The Cook Mountain National Park Camp is at the end of the road. The scenery is like a big movie. There are five best short trails, Governor Jungle Trail, Bowen Jungle Trail, Glencoe Trail, Antelope Horn Trail, and Hook Valley Trail, all set off from Cook Hills, with stunning views. The most popular walk in the park is the Hook Valley Trail, which is longer than the other four trails, about 3-4 hours round trip, more challenging, and the quaint boulders, meadows and the backdrop of three suspension bridges for photo ops are also fun. The trail starts at the Baimashan campground with a wide view. The original place was the Heights Hotel. In 1913, it was destroyed by a mountain torrent. Now there are still some ruins. In 1957, the rebuilt hotel was relocated 2 kilometers away from the plains. It looks around and is covered with shrubs and jungles. Through the "Arhatsong Arch", the beginning of the nine-kilometer walk of Hook Valley, the road is smooth, rugged and complex alpine meadow with woody roads, summer season, the mountains full of daisies, fluffy grass and lily like alpine hair, beautiful. The trail includes a monument to the first victims of a mountaineering accident, near the Hook Valley Trail's villa. Inscriptions show three climbers killed in an avalanche in 1914, only one body was found, but 12 years later the glacier melted. The second body was found at the bottom of Hochstetter Lcefall, 2,000 meters below where the team was buried at the time, and the glacier moved at a rapid rate. The temperature was getting lower and lower as the mountain climbed, and the gravel landslides were visible on the mountainside, and the traces of the meadow vegetation were visible, and finally the lake was near, and halfway up the mountain, there was a viewing platform, and the wooden seats were simple, and the next step was Lake Hook, and the ice-blue fault was on the cross-section of the glacier. There was a blue-sky light. There was a huge stone attraction on the trail, with a photo showing her as the first woman to make the climb to the top of Cook Mountain. After the climb, Freda left her crisp, short skirt and cane-held in front of the rock.

Queenstown, New Zealand, is a beautiful town surrounded by the South Alps, and a beautiful city with mountains and rivers. Queenstown is full of sightseeing spots, summer blue sun, autumn bright red and golden leaves dyed colorful features, the winter climate is clear and clear, and there are large snow-covered mountains, and spring is a day of flowers. Four seasons are clear, each has different appearance, I like the most is colorful autumn, beautiful like a fairy tale world, go to want to go to the second time.

Queenstown. Call for the dreamy Queenstown! Have been to several times, but always convinced that she is intoxicating beauty, blue sky, clouds and shadows, when and where, the movement. Reading you from mountain to lake, thousands of times, still will not be tired. I don't know what magic blues are hidden in the snowy mountains and lakes, which attract your heart, and go on and on, and miss it again and again.

After visiting the South Island of New Zealand's North Island, Queenstown is my favorite place. There are so many delicious, fun and beautiful scenery, as well as various play experiences. No matter which bite you are, you can find a way to attract you here. Bungee jumping, jet boat, lake cruise, sky gondola and restaurants, I also spend the most money in Queenstown hahaha. attractions.name: Lake Wakatipu
