reviews: Funny and informative.  Cash only when I went, so be prepared! This little museum is a quick walk from the “downtown” area of Reykjavik.
it was a very fun experience. its a small museum but definitely something u wouldn’t see everyday.

Small but dedicated. If you have a juvenile sense of humor this is the perfect place to visit. I really got a kick out of their mythological penises. I'm still laughing about the elf penis. I wish they had better postcards (aka more inappropriate). Don't miss this one.

Oh this is so quirky! To be strictly serious it should be a science museum b ut the idea that you are surrounded by - ahem - penises it's a little hilarious but shows just how open even modern Iceland is.I found the most interesting thing was they had models of the entire Iceland football team's 'junk'! :)
Lots of members.

attractions.name: Sun Voyager
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Iceland, Greater Reykjavik, Reykjavik, Sun Voyager
reviews: A nice statute by the bay of Reykjavik. More impressive on the photos, but still iconic and must see. The walk by the harbor and the bay behind Harpa is super, and there are boards with historical info about Iceland. Bundle it all on a nice weather day.

This is a sculpture on the waterfront of Reykjavik, the capital of Iceland. It is said to represent a pirate ship and commemorate the pioneering spirit of Icelandic ancestors. The design of the ship sculpture is indeed unique and abstract, but it is not difficult to understand.

This thing is a local landmark. It is said to be built in the shape of a Viking ship, using fish bones. When I passed by in the morning, I took two photos in the car, but they were a bit shaky. When I came back in the afternoon, I didn’t take a car. I walked back and wanted to take two more shots. But I took photos from east to west, but the walking time was much longer than the estimated time. As a result, the road behind was almost 800 meters in sports. The speed rushed back to the dock, and almost missed the cruise. The annoying thing is that so many photos were taken along the way, but it was still not a decent sun voyager. Because I walked on the opposite side of the road, not a coastal trail. After I walked, there was no sidewalk, only the highway-like roadway.

The Sun Voyager is a fishbone-shaped sculpture of a Viking ship, shaped like a big worm. The online travel notes write that this sculpture is like a big worm. It also symbolizes the viking spirit of the Vikings. This is also an important landmark here. The sculpture is very exquisite and I like it too much. The Icelandic design concept is really not a boast.

The Sun Voyager is a very famous statue in Iceland. It is also a landmark not far from the hotel where we are staying. It is very close to the surrounding scenery, and it is also very close to the concert hall. You can visit it together

attractions.name: National Museum of Iceland
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Iceland, Greater Reykjavik, Reykjavik, National Museum of Iceland
attractions.open_status: Closed from 1/1-4/30,Mon;Open from 1/1-4/30,Tue-Sun,10:00am-5:00pm;Open from 5/1-9/15,10:00am-5:00pm;Closed from 9/16-12/31,Mon;Open from 9/16-12/31,Tue-Sun,10:00am-5:00pm
reviews: A great museum that tells the story of Iceland, and it's not just about the history and heritage but how society has evolved into the current modern lives of Icelandic people today.

To understand a country, the National Museum must be the best place. The National History Museum of Iceland explores the history of this country for more than 1,000 years. A country that has only had two wars in history, but established the world’s earliest parliament in 930 AD... Located in the Arctic Circle, the volcanic ash geology has no trees, only Can grow moss, lack of resources, and bad weather. But it has the world's sixth-largest GDP per capita. After the country declared bankruptcy 10 years ago, the country has revived its economy, and now there is a state of economic recovery. The country that has seen the most change in Europe in three years. A group of lovely islanders live on this magical island country. If there is a living alien planet, Iceland should be the closest place to an alien planet.

I came to the National Museum of Iceland 20 minutes before closing, and enjoyed an undisturbed time visiting the exhibition. The National Museum is really full of sense of history, everything from the Vikings is concentrated here, and the glass windows of the museum are also very nice [Applause]

The National Museum of Iceland is probably the smallest national museum I have ever seen. The fact that they established the earliest parliament in the world is really impressive. After all, democracy was born in the icy wilderness.

The main purpose of the museum is to preserve Iceland's cultural heritage from early to modern times. There are many precious exhibits that reveal history, so that visitors can wander in the long river of Icelandic history. It is worth your visit!

attractions.name: Perlan
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Iceland, Greater Reykjavik, Reykjavik, Perlan
reviews: The Pearl Tower is actually a building that supplies water for the entire capital area! Have to admire the designer, design such a building so beautiful, like a pearl!

I don’t know why, this city is full of Chinese, and only Chinese. I met all kinds of Chinese on the road, from China, from the United States, from Hong Kong, from Taiwan, from Europe, and from Australia. , Iceland’s sky is really beautiful, after all, the sunshine time is 4 hours, so you can watch the sunset while watching the sunrise

One of the landmarks of Reykjavik, tourists usually check in. Bought tickets for sightseeing on the upstairs platform, you can view the entire city of Reykjavik in 360 degrees without blind spots. The restaurant on the top floor is nice, and dining here in good weather is definitely a treat.

The Pearl Tower is located at a high point in Reykjavík, the capital of Iceland. You can see the entire city of Reykjavík in front of the door. It is one of Iceland's landmarks and was converted from an original water storage tank. There is a paid pavilion inside, and some pictures of Icelandic scenery are displayed underground.

The building is divided into 5 floors. The hall on the first floor often holds exhibitions and exhibits some handicrafts. The 4-5 floors are viewing platforms and rotating. From the viewing platform, you can see the beautiful scenery of Reykjavik from all angles. The restaurant here is known as one of the ten best restaurants in the world.

attractions.name: Harpa
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Iceland, Greater Reykjavik, Reykjavik, Harpa
reviews: Located by the sea in Reykjavik, it has a shiny appearance. The glass bricks of different shapes and colors reflect the blue sky, white clouds and the sea, projecting bright lighting effects at night. This design allows the interior of the concert hall to enjoy excellent lighting. The sunlight enters the room through the glass, forming a wonderful view of light and shadow, which is particularly dreamy and surreal.

Harpa Concert Hall and Conference Center is located at the land-sea junction of Iceland’s capital Reykjavík. It is Iceland’s newest and largest integrated concert hall and conference center. Measure the shape of the night aurora and volcanic rock. The glass exterior of the building is like a huge kaleidoscope. Thousands of irregular geometric glass bricks reflect the colors of the sky and the seasons that dwarf the rainbow. This state-of-the-art modern building is a venue for Reykjavik to enjoy music and hold important meetings. Here, you can listen to the performances of the Icelandic Symphony Orchestra, watch Icelandic dramas and various musical genres. The largest concert hall here can accommodate 1,800 people. In addition, there are two rehearsal halls, lounges, restaurants, coffee shops, music record shops and souvenir shops.

There are pictures of Harpa Concert Hall in Huawei's mobile push, so I know this attraction in Reykjavik. Entering the concert hall, there are many points worth visiting and taking pictures. The toilets in this concert hall are charged. A handsome guy sits in the town, 250 crowns a time, and he can swipe his card to solve the problem.

As the third stop of the scenic spots along the coastline, this place is still very stunning. The exterior and interior of the building are very worth seeing! The entire building has won the most prestigious contemporary architecture award in Europe! The unique feature is that the large, three-dimensional honeycomb-like colored glass is magnificent under the refraction of sunlight! Shine! The simple line structure inside the main body of the glass is also amazing. Those who study architectural design definitely should come here! If you don’t have time to listen to a concert, go downstairs and browse the souvenir shop~ or have a cup of coffee in the cafe here, which is also a good choice!

Super exquisite building, sparkling in the sun, like a huge irregular diamond. Reykjavik landmark buildings, local concert hall, inside can be visited, there are bookstore shops and so on. It’s not far from the pier. If you can arrange an indoor tour that day, you can watch the whales first, then walk here to visit, and then go to the cathedral

reviews: Walk around and enjoy the old part of Reykjavik, delight yourself with birds around the pound or buy some bread and feed them.. very interesting and old building around the area. many brought from Norway over 100 years ago..
I love visiting this little lake. It makes for a nice walk. I really enjoy all the birds that visit - especially the Arctic Terns. I can't get enough of watching them hunt for fish.
"The pond" is little lake in Reykjavik that's surrounded by museums, parliament buildings, churches, and city hall. There are usually geese and other arctic birds swimming here.
Large lake in the centre of Reykjavik. Pleasant walk around it and the chance to do some birdwatching

Tjörnin (The Pond) is a small lake in central Reykjavik. Although it is not among the biggest lakes in the country, it is one of the best known. I passed along it's shore on the way to the National Museum of Iceland and to take a look at City Hall as it sits right on the water. There were also few ducks that piqued my interest.

attractions.name: Mogao Grottoes
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Gansu, Jiuquan, Dunhuang, Mogao Grottoes
attractions.address: 25 km southeast of Dunhuang City, Jiuquan City, on the cliffs on the west bank of the Songshan Mountains
reviews: We bought the transportation package at the tour office next to Dunhuang Train Station for 100 Yuan each, bought our own tickets and meals and they sent us to our hotel after the day trip. They brought us to the Crescent Lake and the Desert (which are in the same place) and Mogao Grottos. Grottos ticket 238 Yuan including the presentation in 2 different rooms, a tour guide, 8 cave visits and internal bus. The guide gave us the earphone as she speaks very softly. She led us to view the caves and explained in Mandarin. We didn't buy the tickets having English speaking guide. The site is large, looks nice, well organized for tourists, has newly built buildings to protect the remaining caves inside so it looks not authentic enough to me. The statues and artworks look so nice. The trip ended in about 2 hours.

Amazing place to visit close to Dunhuang! The two mandatory movies before heading to the grottos was annoying. however, once you are at the grottos, that annoyance is quickly forgotten. What sets this grotto apart from the other famous ones in China is the free English guides (french and german as well i think). i went in the off season and had an English guide to myself. it was very educational, and made the Mogao grottos more significant amd memorable than other grottos.

Hello everyone. The mogao Grottoes near dunhaung city is an very unique place and even due I don't much understand in archeology, I definitely impressed from the Tour and all the stories behind the Grottoes. In addition, I would say that even that there was an impressive movies, guide and shuttle to the site, I think the price it's little bit expensive.

It was an amazing experience, starting  with 2 short films, one of those showed its best caves with a 360 degree screen. At the caves one learns how the mixture of cultures that came with the silk road and how they onfluenced each other.

attractions.name: Mingsha Mountain Crescent Spring
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Gansu, Jiuquan, Dunhuang, Mingsha Mountain Crescent Spring
attractions.address: 6 km south of Dunhuang City, Jiuquan City
reviews: It is an amazing view from the very top. Very fun to run down the dunes, but also very exhausting to climb up. I would recommend camel  riding. It is a lot of fun and there are a lot of camels there. It is best to wear flip flops or sandels but if you prefer closed shoes you should buy shoe covers so no sand gets in your shoes. If you want amazing pictures you should go at sunset or sunrise.

This place was beautiful. Very touristy in the morning and afternoon, so the best time to go is midday or for sunrise (but even sunrise had more people than we expected). In any case, the desert is big enough to find a quiet spot to enjoy. We did not choose to ride the camels as it was too busy, but that is also an option.

Hello everyone, I visited this place with my girlfriend faw days ago and we was amazed by the beauty of the place.  We spent a lot of time just walking on the sand and see the view. For pepole who wants there is a lot of attractions over there like helicopter tour, sand sliding, camels riding and more.

The spring itself is very uninteresting, but the sand dunes surrounding it are breathtaking. you can take camel rides into the dunes and walk to the top if them. 4-wheeler and helicopter rides are available too, but they seemed pricey. tickets into the dunes are valid for 2 or 3 days.

To get to the top they are providing thing for u to climb, actually way too easy to go up there. Also, you should be prepared to meet many many many many tourist. It is very touristic place. We were waiting for sunset and we had a nice time there. So many activities for family traveller. I have to be honestly that I don’t really like how they have the camel ride .... 😭 Feel sorry for the camel 🐪

attractions.address: West side of the digital center of Mogao Grottoes, Dunhuang City, Jiuquan City
reviews: Very very good experience, the service of the morning tour is very good, the master staff is particularly patient. The key is that the show is very good, the immersion performance is different from other theater versions, the beauty of the dance is simply amazing, more than a thousand years of Dunhuang stories, can not help but make people cry. We are your vows on the silk road but we will eventually be buried in the sand. Highly recommend

Very special experience, the first half of the walk and see, immersion, all sides may become the stage, I heard that this performance form is still the only in the country at present, I think it is really a must-see in Dunhuang! The plot is OK, I still feel quite moving with the tears. Some of the lines are awkward, some are not bad, the last songs are good! There are many actors, it is not easy.

An extremely shocking experience, following the actors and scenes of the transformation of the immersion of the scene as if through Dunhuang thousands of years, music, costumes, the modeling is impeccable! With the theme of "In a moment, in a moment; a dream, dream for a thousand years; a blink, just a blink; the dream has been awake, but after a thousand years", tears wailed through Dunhuang. Overall superb, fun and fun,

I had already learned about some of the history of the Mogao Grottoes before I went there, and thought it was just a declarative show, but I was really surprised by one unexpected after another! The immersion performances brought the audience to the empathy is real, and the viewing really understand why someone moved to tears. Mogao Grottoes are born from suffering, is the world's attention after the rest of life, so the tone of the performance will be heavy, but it is really worth 🎆 Everyone remembers that the performance is not allowed to bring water and eat~

Very special performance form, very strong sense of immersion, the first hour is standing, to walk in the middle, to go to different spaces. Content, you can feel the performance want to pass on the deep connotation, pay tribute to every person in the history of the Silk Road, the awe of Dunhuang culture and so on. In terms of service, the Chinese bus transfer is very good, but I forgot to give the gift.

attractions.name: Yangguan Ancient Site
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Gansu, Jiuquan, Dunhuang, Yangguan Ancient Site
attractions.address: Yangguan Scenic Spot, Yangguan Town, Dunhuang City, Jiuquan City
reviews: Many people said it''s so so but we spent a good 3 hours there. We did horse riding which took us to a different route that others won''t be able to visit. There is a blue lake at the other side of the sand dune. It feels like at Han Dynasty to ride in the middle of desert. You could easily spend an hour in the museum if you are interested in the history. All in all, it''s a must visit too.
The museum is included in the ticket of Yang Pass. Worth a visit.
It was so much to see the Hexi Corridor, a historical witness

Reading a thousand volumes of books is not as good as traveling a thousand miles, to the poem in the Yangguan, feeling the ancient traffic inconvenience. Outside Yangguan is the customs, very desolate, although said that the ancient desert is not so serious, but the standard of living is still relatively poor, very hard. The ancient Yangguan is now basically weathered, leaving only a trace.

Yangguan is the place of the ancient land transportation outside China, is the pass that Silk Road South Road must pass. It is located in the southwest of Dunhuang City, Gansu Province near the antique beach. The Western Han Dynasty, because of the south of Yumenguan, so named. And Yumenguan was the gateway to the western region of the time. Dunhuang Yangguan Scenic Area is currently a national 4A level tourist attraction.

attractions.name: Yumen Pass
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Gansu, Jiuquan, Dunhuang, Yumen Pass
reviews: On the way to Yadan so you have to pay. It''s much cheaper compared to others so not bad to stop over for a few minutes.

Yumenguan site is located in the south bank of the Shule River at the west end of the Hexi Corridor, and is composed of Gobi, desert, river and lake beach. The north is located in the north mountain, the south is in response to the Qilian Mountain, the southeast is about 90km from Dunhuang City, and the west is about 150km from the eastern edge of Lop Nur. This area has the mark position of the East-West traffic boundary in the geographical area, since ancient times, it has been an important passageway of East and West traffic.

[Yumen Pass] [Yumen Pass], also known as Xiaofangpancheng, was first named after Emperor Wu of the Han Dynasty opened the road to the Western Regions and set up the four counties of Hexi. It was named after Hetian jade was imported from the Western Regions. In the Han Dynasty, it was the gateway to all parts of the Western Regions, and its original site was in Xiaofangpan City, northwest of Dunhuang, Gansu. From 116 BC to 105 BC, the Great Wall from Jiuquan to Yumen was built, and Yumen Pass was established. The Yellow River is far above the white clouds, and there is a lone city Wanrenshan; why the Qiang flute has to blame the willows, the spring breeze does not pass Yumen Pass. Most people know about Yumen Pass from Wang Zhihuan's "Liangzhou Ci", and today there are only the ruins! In 1907, Stein, an adventurer, archaeologist, and smuggler, excavated many Han slips from the ruins not far to the north of Guancheng. From the contents of the slips, it can be determined that Xiaofangpancheng is the location of Yumen Pass. According to historical records According to records, the location of Yumen Pass is quite nearby, but Xiaofangpan City, which is only 600 square meters, is an important customs in the Han Dynasty. It is too small. So until now, the exact location of Yumen Pass is still uncertain. The well-preserved Xiaofangpancheng site is tentatively designated as Yumenguan site. Adult ticket for Yumen Pass: 40 RMB, 50 for sightseeing car, bundled, no self-driving into the scenic spot and on foot. However, the scenic area includes the Great Wall of Han Dynasty and Dafangpan (also known as Hecang City). Self-drive or join a day tour group, otherwise there is no public transportation to come here

"Spring wind does not measure the Yumen Pass", some people say that the trip to the west of Dunhuang is to see the soil pile, Yangguan is a pile of soil, Yumen Pass is a few piles of soil, in fact it is. The erosion of northwest sand caused ruins or very serious damage. The punching point is far from the entrance of the scenic spot. After entering the scenic spot, I took the scenic tour bus and really did the card- punching tour. However, the Yumenguan attraction is still more rich than Yangguan.

Yumenguan, also known as Xiaofangpan City, flourished with the flourishing Silk Road, was once the only place for Western merchants and Central Plains to travel. Wada Meiyu from ancient times imported from the Central Plains, so it was named. The erosion of the years, the jade gate has lost the appearance of that year, now the jade gate is a mound of earth ruins.

Take the scenic bus to visit Yadan Devil City. Dunhuang Yadan National Geopark, commonly known as Dunhuang Yadan Devil City. It is an important part of the tourist scenic spot of the western line of Dunhuang. It is 180 kilometers away from the city of Dunhuang. It is located northwest of Yumenguan. The scenic spot is divided into two regions, about 25 kilometers long and about 13 kilometers wide. The park area is 346.34 square kilometers, mainly the geological relics formed by wind erosion. In December 2001, the Ministry of Land and Resources approved the establishment of "Gansu Dunhuang Yadan National Geopark", in August 2003, the official opening of the park to unveil monuments, and to visitors. In 2006 11, it was designated as a AAAA class tourist attraction by the National Tourism Bureau, and it was approved as a science popularization base of land and resources, a science popularization education base of Gansu Province, and a geological heritage nature reserve of Gansu Province. Dunhuang Yadan National Geopark is the film and television advertising film site, has been filmed "heroes", "Tianmai Legend", "sea god", and other film and television advertising works. The Yadan National Geopark in Dunhuang attracts many brave explorers to uncover the mysterious veil of "devil city" and explore the mysteries of nature with its unique desert scenery, geological wonders of various forms and ancient folklore.

As a museum in the Dunhuang area, the museum mainly introduces the achievements of the area, but because of Dunhuang's position on the Silk Road, the exhibits here are very distinctive. The museum itself is not large in scale. You can visit it along the way. It is divided into several exhibition halls along the way. The exhibitions are displayed according to different eras. Among them, the hair style of the Han Dynasty is the most essential part, and there are many exhibits in each era. What is shocking is that almost all the exhibits here are originals without imitations. There are a lot of them, and most of them are not limited to shooting, which is still very impressive. The biggest feature here is the one-to-one reproduction of the Mogao Caves, which is the one introduced in the Mogao Dome movie. The shape and exquisiteness are still very beautiful. There are even restoration models of tombs at that time, and the experience is very real. There is also the only photo of Wang Taoist himself. There is a QR code on the wall of every exhibition hall here. After scanning through WeChat, there will be an audio guide for the hall. Fairy Mountain is located on the north bank of Wujiang River in Wulong District, Chongqing. The land belongs to Wuling Mountains. It is 180 kilometers away from the main urban area of Chongqing. Furong Cave is called "a magnificent underground art palace and rich cave museum" by the China Cave Association, which has a rich landscape, including the undersea dragon palace, the giant curtain waterfall, coral cistern pool, the art gallery peak, magnificent and magnificent.

Furong Cave is a large limestone cave, with a large stone waterfall and stone curtain, a bright jade stone bench, such as stars of stone flowers, among which the red coral and calcite crystals are very precious, is known as "one of the three world caves".

In January 2021, the explanation in Furong Cave is to be invited separately. When you go, you will explain that the collective will not go up the mountain. The first train from Chongqing North-Wulong in the morning is walking to the Wulong-Jiangkou bus station outside Wulong Station. It leaves at 11:40. It takes less than 1 hour to reach the terminal of Jiangkou Police Station. You can only take a taxi to the scenic spot (there will be a shuttle bus in the peak season). The bus master helped me contact the local Pedicab driver (with ***, one person in off-season should be very needed). I contacted this one in the upper and lower scenic spots. There was no price increase. It was a real person. Thank you two masters. The last bus of Wulong-Fairy Town from 18:00 in the scenic spot did not catch up, and another tourist car to the Fairy Mountain Visitor Center, the counter price is 60, and the highest price is 80. The hotel next to the Su Visitor Center, the big bed room in winter (can ski, I don't know if it is a low season) 100 nights, the price is higher than this, can be cut. Even if the Furong River is foggy, the sight is very close to the scenery is also beautiful, recommend this attraction.

Furong Cave is a large limestone cave formed in the Quaternary Pleistocene (about 1.2 million years ago) and developed in the ancient Cambrian dolomite limestone. The stable temperature in the deep part of the cave is 16.1 degrees. Furong Cave’s main cave is 2,700 meters long, the tourist road is 1,860 meters, the bottom width is more than 12-15 meters, and the widest is 69.5 meters; the height of the cave is generally 8-25 meters, and the highest is 48.3 meters; the total area of the cave bottom is 37,000 square meters, including the glorious hall area. Above 1,000 square meters, with an area of 11,000 square meters, the most spectacular. The maximum static and passenger capacity of the entire Furong Cave is 185,000 people. It is also known as one of the "Three Caves in the World".

Tianfu Official Post was built in the Tang Dynasty and was an important post for official information transmission in Fuzhou and Qianzhou in ancient times. It was destroyed by war and rebuilt in 2005. It is the location for the filming of the movie "Full of Golden Armour".

Tianfu Official Post is located in the Tiansheng Sanqiao Scenic Area, Wulong, Chongqing. Take the vertical elevator down to the bottom of the Tiankeng and cross the first stone arch bridge. A place full of special scenery, because it is a local one-day tour, the stay time is not long, so I didn't buy a ticket to go in for an in-depth tour, just climb around and take pictures at will.

From a distance, I saw the lake in the middle of the lake and thought it was a mountain composed of various stones. I was surprised by the fluffy cactus. But don't tie it up with your hands, it's not polite. There are some stones.

Departure time: Day1-10:30 departure, Day3-18:00 return to the departure location: travel agency entrance fee: 800Bob/person (if the third day is to Chile, you need to add 100Bob/person) Containing: 1. Two days of accommodation, the first day of double room, one person to pay 10bs for bathing, need to prepare your own toiletries, The next day, everyone will live in the six-person room together, can not take a bath 2. All the meals in the group trip. If there is a vegetarian diet or if there is anything that is not eaten, please inform the travel agency in advance. 3. (except for the National Park tickets, which are voluntary) 5. The whole trip is very, very rare. One toilet, try to go up, if you really can't stand it, then nature finds a place to solve 7. attractions.name: Museo Arquecologia y Antropologico de los Andes Meridionales
The Grand Prismatic Spring
attractions.loc_tags: North America, United States, Yellowstone National Park, The Grand Prismatic Spring
attractions.address: Grand Loop Rd， Yellowstone National Park， WY
reviews: 真的是一个很有魅力的地方，神秘，美丽，不虚此行
Epic view of the Grand Prismatic Spring ! One of the most interactive National Parks in the States!
It is a must-see attraction in Yellowstone Park and the largest hot spring in the United States, with colorful rainbows.

Grand Prismatic Spring is one of the most famous hot springs in Yellowstone Park. The Grand Prism is a masterpiece of Huangshi, like a business card of Huangshan's Welcome Pine. People may not have been to Huangshan, but you must have seen the image of Yingke Pine; similarly, people may not have been to Huangshi, but the panorama of the Grand Prism must have appeared on the top tourist list in the United States.
 
The colorful big prism, about 100 meters in diameter, is the largest hot spring in the United States and the third largest in the world. It is nearly 50 meters deep and the water temperature is as high as 85°C. 2000 liters of spring water gush out every minute. In the sky with clear rain, it seems more heated. The angle that pedestrians can see is a side plane, not the panoramic aerial view seen in major brochures.

But even if you only take a glimpse of it, you can already feel its imposing momentum. There is a feeling that you don't know the true face of Mount Lu, and you are only in it. There is another kind of scenery that is generally not easy to see at the level of a great god.

During the full-day tour, just a few minutes of staying here, it rained. At this time, the weather, wind and rain, made people feel like being in the embrace of nature, with the clouds in the sky, wind and rain, surging in my heart. I have always believed that all the encounters during the journey are fate. Enjoy the all-round experience of the wind, rain and heat in the world, here, it is a classic!

The following paragraph is heard on the Internet: "The beauty of the Grand Prismatic Hot Spring is that the color of the lake changes with the seasons. In spring, the lake changes from green to brilliant orange-red. This is due to the algae living in the mineral-rich water. The ratio of chlorophyll to carotenoids in their bodies changes with the seasons, and the water body shows different colors.” Therefore, in the summer we arrive, the chlorophyll content here is relatively high. Low, showing orange, red, or yellow. But I heard that in winter, due to lack of light, these microorganisms will produce more chlorophyll to inhibit the color of carotenoids, so the water body appears dark green.
Compared with the big prism, there are three small hot springs around. Although there is no big prism atmosphere, they are still delicate and beautiful.

In the sun, the large patches of wrinkled ground around the big prisms give off a magical reflection. It's incredible! The colors seen from different angles are different. Everyone who comes here sees different colors at different times, different angles. In this moment, time and light may not be the best, but it is the only one. The closer you get to the Great Prism Spring, the more you can't see the full picture of it, but at close range, you can feel the heat of the steam winding in the Great Prism Spring, you can hear its gentle pulsation, it is a wonderful feeling that you can't see in the picture and you can't see it.

attractions.name: Canyon Area
attractions.loc_tags: North America, United States, Yellowstone National Park, Canyon Area
attractions.address: Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone， Yellowstone National Park， WY
reviews: Yellowstone Canyon is located in Yellowstone National Park, the United States, in Yellowstone National Park 90 sightseeing spots ranked 1. Yellowstone Lake in the United States of America out of the river, after a gentle hilly zone, into a length of about 38 kilometers of steep canyon, known as Yellowstone Canyon. This is one of the most magnificent and gorgeous scenery in Yellowstone Park. Here, the swift rivers splatter and form two magnificent waterfalls, roaring into the valley floor. The first waterfall is 33 meters high, this is the upper waterfall, the second is 92 meters high, called the lower waterfall. The Yellowstone Canyon is formed by the Yellowstone River erosion and geothermal erosion of volcanic rock. About 14000 to 18000 years ago, the Grand Canyon connects three times of glacier erosion, gradually forming this typical V-shaped canyon. The Yellowstone Canyon, which was only around 10,000 years ago, is quite young. One of the best spots to view Lower Falls is Uncle Tom's Trail, a branch of South Rim Trail. The end of Trail is a platform located at the waist of the canyon. From here, the waterfall is like a white cliff, with water running halfway up the valley and rainbows crossing the cliffs. It's spectacular.

Upper waterfall Yellowstone Falls. The panorama word is so poor that it can only be described as spectacular. The water from the waterfall melts from the snow on the volcano and then flows into the Mississippi River.

There are 290 waterfalls above 4.6 meters in height in the park, of which the tallest is the 94-meter Yellowstone Falls. The biggest highlight of today's itinerary is to come to the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone and overlook the Yellowstone Falls. If you are traveling by car, it is recommended to follow the hiking route to the foot of the waterfall and watch the waterfall close up. If you have the opportunity, you must be immersive in order to experience the natural wonders that the limited human language cannot describe and can only be breathtaking.

The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is one of the famous landscapes of Yellowstone Park. You can watch the spectacular and deep canyon scenery and the waterfalls that flow down at the same time. The river water flowing out of Yellowstone Lake forms the 97-kilometer-long Yellowstone River, which is "the only river in the United States without dams." The river water runs through the volcanic rocks, and the long-term strong erosion has formed the majestic Yellowstone Canyon that is 32 kilometers long, 450-1200 meters wide, and 360 meters deep. This is the most magnificent and beautiful scenery in Yellowstone Park. The long-term river scouring has formed a rock wall with magnificent colors, showing yellow, orange, brown, brown, etc. The Indians called it "Yellow Stone",-hence the name of the Yellow Stone. From the Yellowstone River to the Yellowstone Canyon, it fell twice in a row within a distance of less than 1 km, forming two waterfalls. The lower waterfall is 92 meters high and is the most ornamental canyon waterfall in Yellowstone Park. It is nearly twice as high as the world-famous Niagara Falls, and the upper waterfall is 33 meters high. There are viewing spots on the opposite bank of the Yellowstone River, which are: Lookout Point, Grand View and Inspiration Point. The best viewing point for the Yellowstone Grand Canyon is Inspiration Point. It should be noted that this road is a one-way street, and it is convenient to Canyon Village before leaving this section. In Upper Falls, the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone feels like an oil painting. But you can only watch the waterfall from a distance. Then we walked Uncle Tom’s Trail. From the Artist Point Observation Deck, return along the original road of South Rim Drive on the South Rim Drive. There is a fork before returning to the main road. You can go to the Uncle Tom's Trail and see Lower falls up close! Although the total length is only about 2 miles, the steel structure stairs in the second half are very steep, with a total of 328 steps. It takes about 20 minutes to go down and 40 minutes to walk up. I thought I could go down to the bottom of the waterfall, but in fact it was down to half waist. But it's very close to the waterfall, it's quite spectacular! As long as the weather is good, you will see a rainbow across the canyon.

The Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone is located in Yellowstone National Park in the United States, ranking first among the 90 tourist attractions in Yellowstone National Park. The river water flowing out of Yellowstone Lake in Yellowstone National Park in the United States flows through a section of gentle hills and then enters a steep canyon about 38 kilometers long, known as the Grand Canyon of the Yellowstone. This is one of the most magnificent and beautiful scenery in Yellowstone Park. Here, the turbulent river waves splashed, forming two magnificent waterfalls, roaring into the valley floor. The first waterfall is 33 meters high, this is the upper waterfall, and the second is 92 meters high, called the lower waterfall. There is also the Indian Racecourse, the sun is really too dazzling...Even if you wear sunglasses, your eyes cannot see the camera.

The Artist point is the most classic location for viewing the Lower Yellowstone Falls. From here, the waterfall is like a high white cliff. The water vapor rises from the bottom of the valley to the sky. When the weather is good, you will see a rainbow across the cliff. ,very impressive. At the same time, you can also watch the most magnificent section of the Yellowstone Grand Canyon. Looking at the Grand Canyon is like admiring a landscape painting. The waterfalls of the Yellowstone River in the canyon are majestic and rapid. The green water rushes, the sky is high and the earth is far away, this kind of scene is very atmospheric and open!

attractions.name: Old Faithful Geyser
attractions.loc_tags: North America, United States, Yellowstone National Park, Old Faithful Geyser
attractions.address: Old Faithful Yellowstone National Park, WY 82190
reviews: Old Faithful Fountain is the most famous landscape in Yellowstone. The most famous geyser in Yellowstone is Old Faithful Fountain. It doesn't erupt regularly like other fountains. It erupts every few minutes and never disappoints travelers. It is always faithful and loved by the world. The old faithful fountains are sprayed every 56 minutes, each time for about 4 minutes, the highest and most beautiful time is the first 20 seconds, each time the hot water is about 10,000 gallons, the height of 40-50 meters, water temperature of 93 degrees Celsius. After winter and summer, the old faithful fountains are so in accordance with certain rules and endless spray, so that "old faithful" such a reputation. People come to Yellowstone Park, must see the old faithful fountains. But see it does not spray, a spray is like a thousand horses, more in the sunshine, water vapor flashes out of seven colors, grand, who can not give a sound of praise.
The Old Faithful Spring is really loyal and the daily jets are mostly timed and the audience is gathered to wait

Yellowstone National Park is one of the most destructive "super volcanoes" on the planet lying in the heart of the United States. The geological activity is intense, and the underground magma contains a large amount of silica, which can solidify a huge amount of explosive gas in the magma. Once the gas and magma solidify together, it will cause a large-scale eruption. Scientists estimate that in the future, a super volcanic eruption may still occur in Yellowstone Park.

The Old Faithful Geyser is the most prestigious landscape in Yellowstone Park in the United States. It was the first geyser named during the Washburn-Langford-Dorn Expedition in 1870. Because it erupts regularly, the regularity of each eruption can basically be calculated. The current eruption regularity is about 90 minutes. You can search for the eruption time before entering the park and watch it in advance according to its time. Basically, it will erupt several times throughout the day, so you will never miss it. Do you know what Old Faithful Fountain was used for in the past? Everyone would never think that the old faithful fountain used to be a "washing machine". Because of its regular eruption, some people found that cotton and linen clothes were washed by the old faithful fountain after they were placed on the fountain. The clothes were not damaged and they were washed very clean. But clothes made of wool fabrics will be torn into pieces. But now the wonder of washing with the old faithful fountain is invisible. Since we missed the 4:30 in the afternoon, we rushed to watch the Old Faithful Fountain at 6 o’clock in the evening. We encountered a small traffic jam on the way to the road because we were on the lawn on the road. There was a brown bear on the road. Everyone parked on the side of the road to watch, causing the car to move slowly. Fortunately, the driver swiftly circumvented the car and we just caught up with the time to watch. When it was exactly 18 o'clock, the crowd was already standing by the lawn. The official eruption began at 18:05. First, thick smoke and small water jets were emitted, sometimes large and small, sometimes high and sometimes short. The highest point of today's eruption reached 32 meters, although it is not the highest point in history (the highest height can reach 40-50 meters), we also felt the magnificent scene when it erupted like a galloping horse. The water temperature here is also very high, about 70-150℃, and some of it has been vaporized into smoke. The entire eruption lasted only about 4 minutes.

The old faithful geyser of OLD FAITHFUL GERSER can be described as true loyalty. It is not like other fountains in Yellowstone Park. It has always erupted every 90 minutes or so every time for more than 100 years since it was discovered. minute. It is said that about 10,000 gallons of hot water can be sprayed each time, the height is 50 meters, and the water temperature is more than 90 degrees Celsius. The daily eruption time of the Old Faithful Fountain is announced in Old Faithful hotels, visitor centers, etc. You can confirm it before you go. This is the only attraction with benches on the viewing platform! Everyone sat in a circle and seemed to be enjoying a performance, and sincerely thanked nature for its wonderful performance. If you have time, be sure to visit the Old Faithful Inn next to it for a cup of coffee. This is the preferred accommodation recommended by LP. It was built in the 19th century and has a history of more than 140 years. It is said to be the most difficult one in the park. The eruption of the geyser can be seen from the balcony of the lobby. The hotel was built with local pine logs, no matter the beams, columns, walls, and ceilings of the building, all logs were used. The shape of the building is magnificent, the interior space is tall and open, and the hollow lobby is six or seven stories high, which is very artistic and is a rare large-scale log structure building.

attractions.name: Yellowstone Lake
attractions.loc_tags: North America, United States, Yellowstone National Park, Yellowstone Lake
attractions.address: Grand Loop Road, Between Fishing Bridge and Grant Village, Yellowstone National Park, WY 82190
reviews: Like a mirror of water, reflecting the surrounding snowy peaks and deep forests, it is difficult to distinguish between reality and reality. Compared to lakes in other places, the most special place should be the surrounding high mountains. Because of the high altitude, the snow on the mountains has not melted until the end of May, and the tops of the mountains still look white. The stones in Yellowstone Park have high sulfur content, which makes the water in Yellowstone Lake and Yellowstone River look very clear, but they cannot drink or swim.

The southeast of Yellowstone Park is the Huangshi Lake area, the main scenery is lakes and mountains and abundant wildlife. With an area of about 354k square meters, Huangshi Lake is a typical crater lake and "the largest mountain lake in the United States." Huangshi Lake is full of evergreen trees in the cold zone such as fir trees and true fir trees. It is a habitat for many birds and wild animals, and it is also the best place for those who like to fish and boat. The shape of the lake is like a hand, and WestThumb is the place to the west like a thumb. Looking at Huangshi Lake from West Thumb, you will find that the lake surface is colorful and the color is constantly changing. This is a sign that the hot fountain at the bottom of the lake is erupting. It is hard to imagine that under this tranquil lake is the largest ancient crater in the world.

Huangshi Lake is located in Yellowstone Park. The area of the lake is not small. The lake is clear but very sunny. There are many small hot springs and pits in the lake. Some national or local kayakers are training and will follow us when they pass by. greet. Compared with other more famous attractions in Yellowstone Park, the characteristics here are not so prominent.

Yellowstone Lake is located in the southeast of Yellowstone National Park. The clear lake reflects the snow-white peaks and deep woods of the lake, which is very beautiful. The most distinctive feature is that in the shallow water area near the lakeshore, there are fountain mouths with bubbles from time to time; beside the beautiful shoreline, clusters of fallen branches and green trees contrast with each other.

Yellowstone Lake is the birthplace of the Mississippi River. Its only exit is the Yellowstone River. The soil and stones in Yellowstone Park have high sulfur content, which makes the water in Yellowstone Lake and Yellowstone River look very clear, but they cannot drink or swim.

attractions.name: Mammoth Hot Spring
attractions.loc_tags: North America, United States, Yellowstone National Park, Mammoth Hot Spring
reviews: Mammoth Hot Springs: The Yellowstone Park in the United States, where limestone steps are the main landscape, also known as the hot step zone. It is the largest carbonate deposition hot spring in the world, and one of the most important purposes of the park's initial establishment is to protect its unique geothermal landscape. Mammoths hot springs are the most active and longest-lived geothermal areas. The hot springs are very dense, resulting in a huge karst plateau, where old and new hot springs alternately undulating in years. Looking out over the horizon, the crystal clear, the hot springs left form a very beautiful, colorful steps along the hillside. The area is the only tourist lodging in Yellowstone National Park that can be reached by car in winter.

What used to be colorful and radiant, now only the bleak and dry terraces are left... Seen from a distance, there are piles of golden jade, crystal clear, as a foodie, it feels quite like layers of butter cake, so it is also commonly known as "Cake Spa". The fall of Cake Hot Springs marks the existence of an active volcano in Yellowstone Park. As the earth's crust changes, places that were originally active may suddenly become quiet; places that were originally unknown may also be a blockbuster.

MAMMOTH HOT SPRINGS is located in the northwest of Yellowstone Park and is the largest proven carbonate deposition hot spring in the world. The continuously gushing hot springs make the landscape here continue to change. The headquarters of the Yellowstone Park Administration is also here, with the Albright Visitor Service Center open all year round. Looking at Mammoth Hot Springs from a distance, it is like a mountain covered in snow. When I approached, I realized that it was the perfect combination of Pamukkale and Huanglong. Originally, multiple hot springs flowed down from the hillside section by section, breeding a large number of bacteria, and became a colorful ladder. However, after a crustal movement in 2002, most of the hot springs ceased activity, resulting in a large number of hot springs. The death of microorganisms made Mammoth Hot Springs lose its color. You can no longer see the previous colors. If you really want to compare with Huanglong or Pamukkale, there is still a gap! The dead bacteria also turned into off-white powder, remaining on the dried up steps. Palette Spring is the most beautiful in the entire scenic spot, because it is alive, with water flowing, and it is especially white. We also saw herds of deer nearby! Elk and Moose are stupidly unclear, so let's call them "deer" for the time being! Ha ha. . . It is said that the grass planted around here is what the deer like most, so many deer are attracted here. The children are so happy to meet wild deer so close! Yellowstone Park is really a paradise where "nature rules everything"! Along the way, we met many wild animals, without cages or barbed wire. Animals here don't avoid people when they see them, and people don't hurt them, they just watch them quietly. Humans and animals coexist peacefully, depend on each other, and deeply feel all the beauty that nature has given!

Yellowstone National Park. The Mammoth Fountain is at the northernmost part of Yellowstone's 8-character route, and generally few Chinese tour groups come. It is the largest proven carbonate deposition fountain in the world, and the landscape is dominated by lime steps.

Mammoth Hot Springs is a unique scenic spot in Yellowstone National Park. The scenic spot on the platform is full of white steps, and the steaming heat mist and the white marble stone steps complement each other, like a fairyland. There are many yellow steps in the scenic spot under the platform, and the Cangsang feels shocking.

attractions.name: Norris Geyser Basin
attractions.loc_tags: North America, United States, Yellowstone National Park, Norris Geyser Basin
attractions.address: Yellowstone Park, the lower left half of the upper circle
reviews: It was 10 o'clock in the morning when I arrived in Norris. Before entering the geothermal area, there was a small museum. The museum displayed objects and exhibition boards that popularized the knowledge of hot springs. Most of the hot springs in Yellowstone are alkaline, but most of the water in Norris is acidic, including acid geysers rarely seen elsewhere. The Norris Geyser Basin (Norris Geyser Basin) is to the west of the figure-of-eight waist of Yellowstone. It is also the thinnest place on the surface of Yellowstone. If it is a volcanic eruption, this will be the first place to erupt. The Norris Geyser Basin is a geothermal area with the highest temperature, the longest history, and the most geothermal energy in the Yellowstone region. It is the hottest and most unstable series of geysers in Yellowstone Park. The world's largest geyser "Steamboat Geyser" is also located in this area. The Norris Basin consists of the Porcelain Basin in the north and the Back Basin in the south.

Norris Geyser Basin, this is the hottest and most unstable series of geysers in Yellowstone Park. The world's largest geyser, Steamboat Geyser, is also located in this area. When entering the scenic spot from the Norris Spring parking lot, you have to pass through a small museum, which mainly introduces the situation of the scenic spot, the geological origin of various landforms in the Yellowstone area, and the US national park system. The geysers in this area are also quite rich in color, with soft blue-white like milk, and clear blue-green. Many orange or green rivers formed by fungi are also very beautiful. Due to its instability, new fountains are produced every year, and old fountains die.

Norris Geyser Basin is the hottest and most unstable series of geysers in Yellowstone Park. The world’s largest geyser, Steamboat Geyser, is also located in this area. It erupted only once for a long time. The last eruption was in 2008, and it created an eruption height. The record is 380 feet. The colors of the geysers in this area are also quite rich, ranging from clear blue-green to the soft blue-white like milk. Due to its instability, new fountains are produced every year, and some old fountains die. There are also some orange or green rivers formed by fungi, which are very beautiful.

The weather in Yellowstone National Park is unpredictable. Because of the influence of geothermal heat, the weather forecast here will not be too accurate. It is said that it was still snowing the week before we came (at the end of May), and snow was also seen in some mountains. status. Just the day before us, it was still raining in Yellowstone Park. Fortunately, it was sunny when we visited. On the day we were about to leave the United States, I heard from the tour guide that it was snowing again in Yellowstone Park (mid-June), so the weather here is really unpredictable. The weather really depends on luck. It is estimated that the scenery with the leaves turning yellow in the fall of September should be the most beautiful. I hope I can drive to Yellowstone Park again next time in the autumn.

Yellowstone National Park. Norris is the hottest and most unstable series of geysers in Yellowstone Park, and the world's largest geyser steamboat geyser is also located here. The geysers in this area are quite rich in color, ranging from clear blue-green to the bottom, and soft blue-white like milk. Here, looking everywhere, there is a doomsday feeling.

attractions.name: West Thumb Geyser Basin
attractions.loc_tags: North America, United States, Yellowstone National Park, West Thumb Geyser Basin
reviews: The first attraction after entering from the south gate is the West Thumb Geyser Basin. There are various hot and colorful hot springs in West Thumb. I also saw the Elk family! In the bottomless spring, there was a sign on the side of the road saying that someone threw a coin in, causing the bacteria to die, and the color of the water changed. The park management office could only send someone to salvage it! Protecting the environment is a long way to go!

A large lake bay of Yellowstone Lake, shaped like the Great Thumb. The West Thumb Basin formed 150,000 years ago by the collapse of the earth's crust. It is located just south-east of the Yellowstone Eight-Character Highway. The trail of the West Thumb Basin, which takes less than 1 hour to walk slowly, can see all kinds of hot springs, gap springs, steam holes and other geothermal landscapes along the way. Especially beautiful are several points: 1. Abyss pool, like a "Emerald", up to 16 meters deepest. Historically, the abyss pool erupted once in 1987, on a large scale, and has been dormant ever since. 2.Thumb Paint Pots, translate to "paint bucket" or "palette dish." 3.Black Pool Black pool. Where is black? Many dark bacteria that are resistant to high temperatures have been growing inside. They are black. As the water gets warmer and warmer, the pool becomes azure blue. 4. The most interesting thing is the lake near the shore, with a series of small holes, most of which are interstitial springs. One of them is called the fishing cone (Fishing Cone). The 1870 expeditioner described Hedges's fishing scene here: "He stood on a stone that separated Yellowstone Lake and the hot springs, and when a cod was shaken out of the water, it decoupled and fell into the hot springs. After a while, it was out of the water at a magical speed, trying to escape, stopping at the water, dead, and ripe. The hot spring boiled fish, more like a Chinese-style tourism model, had been banned. The hot water is rich in hydrogen sulfide, and the hot microbes dye the land on the shores to be dazzling. The blue western thumb lake in the distance, plus the blue sky and white clouds, the magic of nature and the magnificent shocked us again. Look up at the west thumb lake, pure as a sapphire. The yacht was the Americans with pickup trucks to drag in, they live what a fairy day. Don't be fooled by this calm. Yellowstone is centered on the West Thumb, 15 miles to the east and 50 miles to the south and north, forming a huge crater. A smoky landscape combined with the hot water fountain and the lake, with a smell of sulphur like rotten eggs, steam is not really "fairy" at all.

Yellowstone Park is divided into five areas: the Mammoth Hot Springs area in the northwest is dominated by limestone steps, so it is also called the hot step area; the northeast is the Roosevelt area, which still retains the old western landscape; the middle is the canyon area, where you can enjoy the Yellowstone Grand Canyon and waterfalls; The southeast is the Huangshi Lake area, which is mainly composed of lakes and mountains; the west and southwest are geyser areas, full of geysers, hot springs, steam, hot water pools, mud and fumaroles.
        Regular browsing of Yellowstone National Park is mainly concentrated on both sides of the road called the "Grand Loop Rd", which is shaped like an Arabic numeral "8" to connect the entire national park.

◤West Thumb Geyser Basin (West Thumb Geyser Basin)◢ is located on the bank of Yellowstone Lake. The scenic trail runs along the bank of Yellowstone Lake. You can enjoy the colorful geothermal landscape, the clear lake and the distant snow-capped mountains at the same time. This kind of scenery makes this pocket-sized and exquisite scenic spot unique.

West Thumb Geyser Basin (West Thumb Geyser Basin) is located to the west of Yellowstone Lake, the southernmost part of the 8-character Yellowstone National Park. There are many hot springs, lakeside hot springs, and lake hot springs. The lake hot springs are here. Features, the sprinklers gurg out from the bottom of the lake. The sprinklers have a variety of colors, some are transparent green, some are gem blue, and some are dark black, which is very rich. We will go around for 30 minutes, if not If you are in a hurry, you can spend an hour walking slowly.

attractions.name: Tower Fall
attractions.loc_tags: North America, United States, Yellowstone National Park, Tower Fall
reviews: From the Grand Canyon Visitor Center, about 30 kilometers away, we arrived at Tower Fall. This waterfall is an obvious waterfall in Yellowstone Park, the source is Tower Greek. The height of the waterfall is 1,933 meters and the total length of the waterfall is 40 meters. There is a beautiful river under the waterfall. But the road to the river is very difficult! In fact, there is no road, it's just a soil slope, basically just rolling and climbing! There is a smell of sulfur in the river, but there are still people fishing not far away! Haha...

Look for a good angle to watch this waterfall, because the water flow of the waterfall itself is not very large, if the angle is not found, it looks meaningless. The scenery of the waterfall itself is quite beautiful.

The hot springs in Yellowstone National Park have a variety of colors. The colors of hot springs are mainly determined by the temperature of the water and the types of microorganisms in the water. If you want to learn more, it is recommended to visit the exhibition area in the visitor center before visiting.

The Yellowstone River is a long river in Yellowstone Park. We drove around in a figure eight by ourselves. We often saw many tourists by the river taking out benches and holding coffee, enjoying the beautiful scenery quietly. Some people were holding fish. Fishing in the river under the most beautiful equipment, the river is really beautiful
Gaota Waterfall is located on the north side of Yellowstone Park and is the most famous of the many waterfalls in the park.

attractions.name: Charles Bridge
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Czech Republic, Prague, Charles Bridge
reviews: You will get stunning views of this bridge all around the river. Get to the bridge early during peak season as it gets soooo busy and then it is not pleasant to walk on. A river cruise is also a beautiful way to see it.

Situated in the Old Town it is beautiful walk along the bridge with artists willing to do your portrait and musicians playing music. Small trinkets can be also purchased. There are many good restaurants located very, very close by. Nice view of the city.
Charles Bridge is a landmark in Prague.  Highly recommend to walk through the bridge and enjoy the great view.
it is kind of surreal bridge with lot of monuments and big towers in their front and back. with ppl playing music and selling souvenirs all the way
packed with tourists. but viewpoint from tower is very nice.

attractions.name: Old Town Square
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Czech Republic, Prague, Old Town Square
reviews: There is no Prague Square, only Prague Old Town Square, there is no Trevi Fountain, there are ancient churches, bluestone streets, streetside cafes and astronomical clock towers. This is a must-visit Prague landmark area, with carriages quietly waiting for visitors around the world in front of European-style buildings.
Goodbye! Prague, Czech capital, one of the thousand towers, "There's a place I want you to know" by Xu Jinglei, who directed the film about love in Prague, the European romantic art capital

The square is also a very important place in the whole city, the square is also quite big, many places are quite interesting, the old city building is very historical, the square area is not large, many foreign tourists.

The core area of Prague’s Old Town is the Old Town Square, also known as Prague Square. The square is surrounded by landmarks such as the Tyne Church and the Astronomical Clock. It is full of people during the day and is more flavorful after the lights are turned on at night. But if you want to shoot a square with few people, you have to get up early. Many wedding photos are taken early. The astronomical clock is the most popular angle, but in fact, the intricate roads of the old city are also one step at a time.

The old town square is not very big, we just happened to catch up with a lot of national dance performances, just on the square side of the restaurant eating and watching, after watching the surrounding shops strolling. There is a famous soap store, a variety of soaps and skin care products. The Chinese people are really going to it. The waiters in the store are basically in Chinese. Their soaps are very special. Can be hung up

attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Czech Republic, Prague, Prague Castle
attractions.open_status: April-October Castle Courtyard 6:00-22:00, Historic Buildings 9:00-17:00; November-March  Castle Courtyard 6:00-22:00, Historic Buildings 9:00- 16:00. reviews: One of the most beautiful places in Europe. Not just castle, everything around it is fascinating

It is a grand place but not what a traditional castle would look like. There are many different buildings, churches, a monestary and viewing points of the city. We'll worth the visit. A walking tour is highly recommended.

It’s a marvellous experience to see Prague from the top of the city - the Prague. You’re bound to see both the daytime & stunning night views of this very pretty city. You can choose to have a romantic dinner at any of the hillside restaurants serving hogh-end dishes.
The Prague Castle is beautiful and historic, yet packed. It is a must see in Prague but it will be so busy no matter what. I advise you to eat outside of the castle area since it is overpriced!
One of my favorite spots in Prague.  There a breathtaking view of the city and the inside the complex will have you spending hours exploring the intricate details of the 9th century.

reviews: I think this clock is simply amazing! The story behind it and how it’s still working is just superb! During summer it can get quite crowded, but just make sure you find a noce spot to take a picture. In the evening is very beautiful as well!
Unique and nice. in the big town square, it is beautiful
Very nice to visit. The clock still rings at the top of the hour, every hour, and draws a huge crowd.
Beautiful gilded clock in the center of Prague, good meeting point and good for knowing the time.
A must-see when coming to Prague! It is an intricate and historical piece of Prague.  It puts on a show, which I did not feel was worth the wait or the crowd.

attractions.name: Golden Lane
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Czech Republic, Prague, Golden Lane
reviews: Golden lane is one of the famous scenic spot in Prague castle, located in the northeast corner of the castle area, between the st and Prague toy museum, you will come to this place full of fairy tale. Golden lane narrow winding path with stone pavement, colorful small houses on both sides stand. Historical background, although known as the "gold", this alley is not made of gold, the legend of the holy Roman empire rudolph ii, the emperor was called the alchemist settled here, golden lane and hence the name.

Located in Prague Castle, a very narrow alley, 22 Golden Lane is the home of the famous Czech writer Kafka, but he is said to have lived here only for a month or so and returned to the Charles Bridge. The buildings and rooms in the alley are very small, like the world of small people.

Prague is also a representative city building complex, the natural scenery and landscape is very beautiful, the Golden Lane is also a pretty fun thing, the entire building area is very grand, the visit here is also very good.
Golden Lane is a famous attraction in Prague Castle. It is a small alley, small house.
Golden Lane is a street paved with bricks. The street is very narrow. It was originally the place where the royal servants lived.

reviews: I did not go into the house - apparently it is a resturant. but the outside structure is quite funky and different from all the other houses around it - which is why it stands out so well. Its a nice structure to see.
dancing house!!!
Really awesome building to see. About a 15 minute walk from main square.

Dance house name Netherlands national insurance building, is the symbol of the new Prague modern architecture, it is by the famous architect blah, rice lu niki and frank gehry designed, since its completion in 1996, the modelling of its novelty is already became a vor tower tile riverside scenery. Design scheme of the building in question in the first place, critics argue that the irregular shape and baroque buildings around, thanks to the several ten years living in the area of the then President havel support, plan to run smoothly. Today, the dance floor after Prague''s medieval buildings has become the most attract photography fans. In addition, you can to building 7 layer CELESTE Restaurant dining, Michelin three-star Restaurant can enjoy cate, get a good view of the Prague castle and Betty Lin hills of beautiful scenery.
While in Prague you must visit the Dancing House. Its peculiar architecture is mind-blowing.

attractions.name: Church of Our Lady Before Tyn
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Czech Republic, Prague, Church of Our Lady Before Tyn
reviews: Grace church in Prague square, is one of the most prominent buildings in Prague old town. Film of the gothic spires of the twin towers is its most eye-catching logo, the whole church deep and mysterious, so also known as "the devil" church. Historical background of grace church history can be traced back to the 12th century, the original this is a Romanesque church, in the 14th century, presided over the Charles bridge and st vitus cathedral of Peter palmer le (Peter Parle ř) portable grace church building, finally in 1380, will it change to gothic church we see today.
beautiful church
The most striking building in the old town square, formerly known as a place for foreign merchants, is now a well-known cathedral in Gothic style.
This church looks particularly grand and spectacular, and is a great value for money

The Tyn Church is the most eye-catching building on Prague’s Old Town Square, and it can also be said to be a landmark of Prague. The predecessor of Tyn Church was built in 1135, and the current building was built in 1365. It is famous for its Gothic-style two-tower architecture. The top is decorated with pure gold rods. The total height is about 80 meters. Because the shape of the church resembles a fairy tale The Devil’s Castle in China is vividly called the "Devil's Church".

if you have time you can take boat form koh Tao to koh Nanyuan , and live Nan Yua.

Very beautiful private island, it is very convenient to go to the island, but you need to follow the rules there, such as what shoes to wear, you can’t bring plastic bottles, and you can’t take away the sand and stones there. The water is clear and the snorkeling conditions are good. Those who are not interested can also sunbathe on the side. The island’s facilities are well-equipped and there are many romantic restaurants. The food is not delicious. It is very suitable for spending two more days there.

attractions.name: Ang Thong National Marine Park
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Thailand, Surat Thani, Koh Samui, Ang Thong National Marine Park
attractions.address: 45/1-2 Moo 1, Thongsala Koh Phangan Surat Thani
reviews: National Marine Park is known as Mu Koh Angthong. It is a pristine archipelago of 42 islands in the Gulf of Thailand.
Ang Thong National Marine Park is located 40KM away from Koh Samui city.It is also a a pristine archipelago of 42 islands in the Gulf of Thailand.
An excellent day trip from any of the three main islands. Troops of Dusky Leaf Monkeys inhabit many parts of the park and much less pesky than the larger, more aggressive Macaques.
Definitely worth the climb to see this view, not for the faint hearted though... make sure you have water and a good pair of walking shoes☺

Ang Thong National Marine Park is one of Thailand’s best natural wonders. The islands of the park are covered in tropical forest, and set like gems within a turquoise sea. It’s pure pleasure to be on these pristine and protected islands. There are green snake-infested lagoons, dazzling white sand beaches, and overhanging cliffs to explore by kayak.

Chaweng Walking Street is like a Flee Market or called Bazaar among Asean· Their opening hours only Monday–Thursday and Saturdays.It's from about 4.30pm to 12am. Remeber! they Closed on Fridays and Sundays.

This place is the most prosperous place on Koh Samui. The streets are densely packed with simple shops, and then there will be several big markets. Whether it is fresh food or dining, it feels like there are many choices. It.

This is the largest street in the local area. At night, it is the largest night market. It can be said to be a focus of the entire night life. The night market is good in terms of scale and sanitary conditions.

All impressions of this street should be equivalent to a big night market, and every tourist who comes to Koh Samui must have been to this night market. It is very lively, and everything is sold for fun.

reviews: Wat Phra Yai, first opened was on 1972. It is known in English as the Big Buddha Temple, is a Buddhist temple on Ko Phan (also spelled Koh Fan or Koh Faan). Climb up the stairs, get some photos.
12 Meter tall golden Buddha image. The 12 meters tall image that was built in 1972 is located inside the temple grounds of the Wat Phra Yai. We enjoy our tour and stay as well.
To the highest,can see beautiful view

A temple with local characteristics. In this temple, there is actually a small square surrounded by many Buddha statues. The largest Buddha statue is located at the highest point of the temple. It feels a bit like a cartoon.

This temple should be the most important temple in the area, but it seems that there are not too many people. It is all tourists. Maybe it will play a big role in some religious festivals, but it is still relatively large.

reviews: Storied natural rock formations known for bearing a resemblance to male & female genitalia.
A large reef on the rare seaside, bare, don't have a feeling, and their shape is very special, so you can also come to punch the card, the feeling is still very good, it is quite fun.

This place is a large piece of reef, but it has been given a very beautiful imagination and name. It is also a place for tourists to check in. In fact, it still depends on imagination, but the scenery is quite good.

The island tour set at the hotel included it. I was really disappointed after watching it for only 20 minutes. The scenery is so beautiful, the sky is blue and the water is clear, and the leisurely walks of crabs between the stones and the water are beautiful. You must go again when you have time.

Shinta and Shinya are an important attraction on Koh Samui, so a huge boulder on the seashore has different characteristics of men and women. He is also called by the locals as grandpa and grandpa. In Thailand, he is worshipped like a god by men and women and prayed for blessings. Almost every couple of newcomers come here to pray for old age together.

attractions.name: Wat Plai Laem
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Thailand, Surat Thani, Koh Samui, Wat Plai Laem
attractions.address: Near Ban Plai Laem School, Road 4171, Plai Laem, Thailand
reviews: Wat Plai Laem is a wat on the resort island of Ko Samui, Thailand. Like the nearby Wat Phra Yai or "Big Buddha Temple", it is a modern Buddhist temple.

largest temple complex on Koh Samui. In the center is the temple Plai Laem. On both sides, on artificial islands, statues of Buddhist deities. On one side, the eighteen-armed statue of the goddess Guanyin.

Beautiful building with a huge statue of Buddha with many arms. It is an active Thai temple, so remember to cover your arms and knees if you want to get inside. What Plai Laem is really beautiful and colourful place. It's situated pretty close to the famous Big Buddha temple.

Wat Plai Laem is a Buddhist temple complex in the northern part of Ko Samui Island. The Wat (temple) features an imposing and unique white 18-arm statue of Guanyin, the Goddess of Mercy and Compassion. I have yet to see this image in any other Wat during my travels throughout Thailand. The Wat also features a large white laughing Buddha and a colorful and elaborate prayer and ceremonial hall. The Wat is distinctive in that it's built upon both Thai and Chinese Buddhist traditions.  Wat Plai Laem is a relaxing and reflective way to spend your afternoon and experience some local culture.
Beautiful temple very close to the villa.

attractions.name: Tanah Lot
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Indonesia, Bali, Bali, Tanah Lot
attractions.address: Jl. Tanah Lot, Beraban, Kediri, Kabupaten Tabanan, Bali
reviews: Tanah Lot is a rock formation off the Indonesian island of Bali. It is home to the ancient Hindu pilgrimage temple Pura Tanah Lot (literally "Tanah Lot temple"), a popular tourist and cultural icon for photography.
it was a great adventure to travel to this beautiful place
this is one of my favorite places in Bali. the sunset here is very beautiful. I would recommend anyone to see this place while visiting.
Breathtaking views , Tanah Lot is a must see while visiting Bali! you can spend hours here just sitting in the grass gardens while overlooking the beautiful ocean!
watching sunset here is amazing, romantic and beautiful view of floating Temple with the sun setting behind it, make sure to get there early so you can take photos of day light and sunset.

attractions.name: Jimbaran Beach
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Indonesia, Bali, Bali, Jimbaran Beach
reviews: Very nice and clean beach with beautiful sunsets and lots of seafood restaurants. You can get very cheap coconut and enjoy the view of the ocean with surfers practicing their skills.

Jimbaran is a fishing village and tourist resort in Bali, Indonesia. Located south of Ngurah Rai International Airport, the beach has seafood restaurants and luxury hotels, including the five-star Le Meridien Bali Jimbaran , Kayumanis Private Estate & Spa, Intercontinental Hotel Bali, AYANA Resort and Spa Bali, Four Seasons and Jimbaran Puri Bali and the casual dining restaurant Cuca. Lately, Jimbaran is developing more affordable accommodations.
lovely beach, favorite beach in bali
excellent sunset views. perfect to be there from 5 pm until 8 pm. cheap seafood and the restaurants are just in the beach.  An excellent meal for two can cost around 100rmb with seafood.
awesome place for sunset. Food is a little pricy compared to other parts of Bali but the gorgeous sunset makes it worth paying the little extra.

attractions.name: Ubud
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Indonesia, Bali, Bali, Ubud
reviews: The town of Ubud, in the uplands of Bali, Indonesia, is known as a center for traditional crafts and dance. The surrounding Ubud District’s rainforest and terraced rice paddies, dotted with Hindu temples and shrines, are among Bali’s most famous landscapes. Ancient holy sites include the intricately carved Goa Gajah (“Elephant Cave”) and Gunung Kawi, with its rock-cut shrines.
verry beautiful place, quite enough to relax

Fun in the jungles! Ubud is the place to be if your looking at becoming one with nature. This is the most lush landscape in Bali with great things to do. While there ( travelled with two children) we experienced ATV riding throughout the rain forest , rivers and waterfalls , to the sight of free roaming monkeys at the Monkey Sanctuary , gracefully washed elephants at the Masons lodge ... experienced the beauty of rice terraces and topped it off with an evening camping out! Ubud is a must do for that total Bali experience with endless possibilities.

The Ubud area is away fromthe beaches so it is a bit more quieter. this is the area to go to see some lush vegetation . There are some really beautiful rice terraces in this region . some are a bit touristy but others you can find are quiet . the weather is variable in this region so constantly check your weather reports . plan to spend a full day in this area before heading back

One of the big surprise of this year for me  , such nice and idyllic place, amazing landscapes , rice fields , temples , monkey forest,palace , reataurants, amazing service in hotels really out of this world , no like other place  ! ideal for retreat and honeymooners , surrounded for historical places . Much recommended !

reviews: Uluwatu Temple is a Balinese Hindu sea temple located in Uluwatu. The temple is regarded as one of the sad kahyangan and is dedicated to Sang Hyang Widhi Wasa in his manifestation as Rudra.
Uluwato has the best sunsets you can ever imagine, the atmosphere , vibe and the feels are unmatched.go out there and enjoy ✌
Nice place to see sunset. Be careful with monkeys as they are naughty enough to take away glasses and hats from tourists . Anyway it is really worth to visit.

very nice temple area on the west shore . a popular touist atraction that is overy crowded. it is especiall crowded before and at sunset . there is a culture showvat sunset . you will need to get a ticket and get to a seat about one hour before the start time or you wont get in. i found the cliffs on the north side are less crowded and provide for good photo opportunities . there are monkeys in the area
First time in Uluwatu, though i have been bali for 5times. Love the white sands beach at Sunday’s club. Food is fabulous.

reviews: The Ubud Palace, officially Puri Saren Agung, is a historical building complex situated in Ubud, Gianyar Regency of Bali, Indonesia.
beautiful architecture and loads off history. despite having lots off tourists it is well worth a visit.

attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Indonesia, Bali, Bali, Tirta Empul Temple
