reviews: Tirta Empul temple is a Hindu Balinese water temple located near the town of Tampaksiring, Bali, Indonesia.The temple compound consists of a petirtaan or bathing structure, famous for its holy spring water, where Balinese Hindus go to for ritual purification.

Tirta Temple is definitely good for people who wants to pray for something, each holy water site is designated for different prayers. The water is cool, clear and the scent inside the temple is really good. The water is so clean that you can drink it directly from the spring for purification. I highly suggest this holy water ritual.

Holy stream temple built in accordance with the underground spring, hence the name, is said to be baptized in the holy stream can get shelter, dispel disease. Here you can see almost all the characteristics of Bali temple, especially ivory carvings. Holy stream was holy stream baptism baptism to experience time process, you might as well as the locals do, to dive in the flow of spring water baptism, and starting from the outlet on the left, in turn to the right.

The name of the Holy Spring Temple comes from the holy spring water that has been incessant for years, and the springs are flowing in turn, and they are said to have different meanings in each spring.

Shengquan Temple is a must-visit attraction for tourists. It feels good. You need to enclose the sarong to get started. There are a lot of people inside, but of course it is much less than in China. The Holy Spring is amazing and beautiful! Then the silt stirred up by the tumbling spring water is not turbid at all, it is so clear as to think of the underwater world! There are a lot of people who take a bath, but I didn’t take a bath...

attractions.name: Cancun Underwater Museum
attractions.loc_tags: North America, Mexico, Quintana Roo, Cancun, Cancun Underwater Museum
attractions.address: Cerrada Las Golondrinas, Alfredo V. Bonfil # 24, 77560 Cancún, Q.R., Mexico
reviews: I would say this underwater museum is one of the most amazing places in the world. I loved it and the reviews made me spend an incredible day here in my life.

Receiving tourists to the Cancun Underwater Museum, first set off by boat. In 2009, the Cancun Underwater Art Museum (MUSA-Museo Subacuático de Arte), a large underwater contemporary art museum was officially opened. The Art Museum is only a 10-minute boat ride from Cancun. In this 15-meter deep and two-kilometer underwater art museum, you can easily find a variety of corals and tropical fish. The Museum of Art was created in 2009 by British sculptors Jason Taylor, Karen Salinas, Roberto Diaz and other Mexican sculptors. They placed as many as 500 sculptures on the west side of Quintana Roo National Park, making this underwater art museum considered the largest underwater art museum in the world. For more fun in Mexico, please consult me

The underwater museum in Cancun is about 10 meters below the sea surface. There are many mysterious statues and remains of cars on the sea floor. These were all sunk into the seabed at that time, and now the surface is covered with thick seaweed, which has become a very famous underwater relic. Every year, many diving enthusiasts come to explore it. It is a very popular attraction in Cancun.

The Cancun Underwater Museum is definitely a mysterious place in the world. There are many strange stone statues that have been sunk into the bottom of the sea, and some modern industries, such as cars and ships, have been covered with coral after decades of soaking under the sea. And seaweed has become a paradise for fish. Diving and exploring here is really sensational, and it is worth trying it out.

The underwater museum in Cancun has a lot of sculptures and shipwrecks. The entire underwater thing is caused by the changes in the movement of the earth's crust. The museum has a very large area. You need to dive to see more. A lot of water plants and small animals are here. Gather.
[Fun] Very good experience
[Scenery] The underwater scenery is beautiful

There is also a very beautiful coast, and there are thrilling water worlds from time to time. It will definitely make you forget all the troubles. Staying here for three or four days is really super comfortable and super happy.

The Shelha Water Park is the most fun place in Cancun, with the water park adjacent to the sea, half of the onshore waters and the other half the beach. It is also a famous water amusement city in the world. The project is very numerous and very thrilling. It is definitely worth noting that it will not be too much for two or three days.

The Shelha Waterpark is a seaside water world with beautiful beaches and colourful water entertainment. Every night, there are wonderful fireworks and acrobatic performances, which are very exciting. In addition, there are many Mexican foods to taste in the park, which is very delicious.

attractions.name: Playa Delfines
attractions.loc_tags: North America, Mexico, Quintana Roo, Cancun, Playa Delfines
attractions.address: Boulevard Kukulkan | Zona Hotelera, Cancun 77500, Mexico
reviews: Cancun’s hotel zone has more private beaches. Most people who travel here choose to stay in five-star hotels here. Because we don't live in a hotel, we can only look for public beaches. Dolphin Beach is far away, about 20 minutes. There are only a few street parking spaces at the door. But the beach is great, unobstructed, and there are many free thatch umbrellas. There are not many people, so I just found one and sat down. Dolphin Beach has two entrances and parking lots. Choose the one farther away without the Cancun logo. It is easier to find a parking space. Here is what I am looking forward to, the level of the sea is still so rich! It's not in vain that I pursue it for thousands of miles. There are really not many people on the public beach, maybe even less than the private beach of the hotel, you need to judge for yourself whether you need to stay in an expensive five-star hotel.

Welcome tourists to Dolphin Beach. The iconic landmark here is the big logo of the "CANCUN" logo, which is also a good place for tourists to check in. This is the public beach in the hotel zone. After all, many all-inclusive hotels are their own private beaches! Pay attention to sun protection in the azure blue Caribbean Sea, and parasols are provided. Cancun Shopping Center La Isla Shopping Village is the largest shopping center and commercial street with local brands, a variety of souvenirs, and international brand stores. It is located opposite Westin Lagunamar in the central area of the hotel zone.

For more fun in Mexico, please consult me!

Dolphin Beach is one of the very beautiful beaches in Cancun. The sandy quality of the beach here is very white and the water is very clear, showing a very layered blue. Every day at dusk, there will be many dolphins under the trestle bridge on the beach. Everyone can feed them small fishes. It is very interesting and the Dolphin Beach is named after it.

Dolphin Beach is a favorite beach for children in Cancun, because you can see lively and lovely dolphins. The water here is very clear and the beach is as white as snow. Dolphins often swim to the beach. Asking tourists for medicine is really cute.

It''s amazing place

Themed trails on the Allmendhubel peak include the Flower Panorama and North Face paths.

The jungfrau region on the west side, with the east green del ward, is in the old valley cliff village chronology is tender. Here can not only look the beauty of the peak, Edgar peak jungfrau, monks, is the starting point of snow mont blanc.
The views are endless, to the flower town, to Mirren, to Kimmelwald, to another beautiful village, it's really beautiful, the air is amazing, no city noise, it's very relaxing!

The most beautiful town in Interlaken and even in Switzerland, its beauty lies in the half-hill position of Schilthorn, facing the Jungfrau Snow Mountain, with green forests and grasslands at the foot. The buildings are very delicate and beautiful in color.
The fairy tale town, the wooden house, the flowers, the grass, the snowy mountains, it's so beautiful, I want to go again.

reviews: Lake Thun is an Alpine lake in Switzerland’s Bernese Oberland region. Its shore is dotted with towns, including Thun, and Romanesque churches.In Thun’s old town, 12th-century Thun Castle houses a museum exhibiting prehistoric and medieval artifacts.To the south, Schadau Park has the Thun Panorama, a 19th-century 360-degree painting of the town. Farther south is Spiez Castle, with furnished 15th-century courtrooms.

Internet is root in west lake thun, the east lake is brien Bates. Systems and is long and narrow shape, slightly become warped, north together like a disconnect between crescent moon. Exquisite PoGang village or high landscapes, or in accordance with the water''s edge, which was decorated with several seductive nature.
The lake is beautiful and beautiful. The lake is bright and bright.

With the Swiss pass, from Thun to Interlaken, the ship shivered at the cold front, but everyone was out, because the scenery was so beautiful, the snowy mountains in the distance, and the small towns on both sides.

The Eye of God really deserves its reputation. Many people choose to take a boat from Thun to Interlaken, especially when using the Swiss Pass. This is the best way to feel the lake. It is a very quiet lake with beautiful scenery.

attractions.name: Schilthorn
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Switzerland, Berne, Interlaken District, Lauterbrunnen, Schilthorn
reviews: The Schilthorn is a summit in Europe, in the Bernese Alps of Switzerland. It overlooks the valley of Lauterbrunnen in the Bernese Oberland, and is the highest mountain in the range lying north of the Sefinenfurgge Pass.The Schilthorn lies above the village of Mürren, from where a cable car leads to its summit.

Snow peak in Switzerland interlochen Ken city in place of the Alps, elevation 2970 meters, the surrounding a famous mountains jungfrau, Edgar peak, etc, is looking at the peak of good lookout points. Here because of the 007 series one of the film "the queen star in a thrilling fight scenes in this film is famous.
The beautiful view

Cost-effective, you can see the Jungfrau Mountain opposite, and you can get a discount on the cable car with a transportation pass. I want to buy a one-way trip and then walk down. Then the conductor patiently persuaded me. The mountain top restaurant is good and has WIFI. The coexistence of snow-capped mountains and green forests is very beautiful.

I wanted to go to the Jungfrau, but the weather was bad, and I couldn't see clearly when I arrived at Schilthorn. I took the train and then turned to the cable car. I was a little disappointed. Of course, the scenery should be beautiful when it is fine.

attractions.name: Ice Palace
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Switzerland, Berne, Jungfrau, Ice Palace
reviews: Never seen this before

The ice palace of Jungfrau is pierced 30 meters below the longest glacier in Europe, Aletsch, and it is full of various realistic animal ice sculptures, quietly telling the history of the glacier. The Ice Palace is located 20 meters below the Jungfrau Observation Deck. The cave-like rooms and halls of this glacier tunnel in Tongxiang contain crystal clear ice sculptures with different shapes and are very interesting. Because the ground is also ice, it is a bit slower to walk in the ice palace, and some positions are still a bit slippery. At the end of the ice palace is the outdoor viewing platform of the Jungfrau Mountain. After adjusting to the temperature in the ice palace, you will not feel cold outside.

Last year, when I went to Jungfraujoch, the sun was shining under the mountain, but when I got to the mountain, the dense fog locked the mountain, the visibility was below 20 meters, and the surrounding was white. Where is the Jungfrau? This year, I went up the mountain with a lot of hope, but it was still similar to last year. Unfortunately, I fell face up on the viewing platform, but fortunately no bones were injured. It seems that we have no relationship with the Jungfrau. If we want to come, maybe There will not be a third time, because this year I have been short of breath (alpine sickness) when I went up the mountain. Jungfrau and Jungfrau, missed and unwilling to complain.

If you take the train to the top station of the Jungfrau, there is an indoor sightseeing hall. From here, there is a gate open and you can go up the mountain to the top of the Samfong Bridge.
But because of going to winter. The wind on the mountain is too big, so most of the time I found the ice palace with a long corridor down the observation deck.
The point is that many things are truly icy. But I don’t feel cold inside

The Jungfrau Ice Palace is an ice cave excavated in the solid ice. There are many ice sculptures inside, which are all made of ice. There are some ice sculptures and a symbol of the top of Europe. It gives people the magic of the ice age. Feel! I had a severe altitude sickness, but I didn’t expect that when I walked here, I suddenly felt so comfortable and the air was fresher!

On the way up and down the Jungfrau, passing through several small mountain towns, it is like a fairyland on earth. Behind it is the snow-capped mountains, a silvery white, and the yellow-brown sloping roofs nearby, one by one, like a mountain growing out. The small mushrooms in the world resemble the elves in the silver world. The small wooden houses are open under the shadow of the trees in the mountains, and the winding roads winding through the mountainside, passing through the village, link every family together.

It's really super beautiful, the clear lake water is green and green, and some yachts docked by the lake can be said to be one of the most beautiful lakes in Switzerland. The small town of Brienz is also a charming place that will really make you linger, here is for taking pictures Holy land, a place that must not be missed when visiting Switzerland.

You will hate all the tourists there, but you MUST go there. This is Venice's grandeur. Try going there very early in the morning and just absorb the atmosphere. You will go back centuries. A marvel (but a prostitute to mass tourism)!
Must see this beautiful city,Soooo lovely and artistic.
You cannot go to Venice and not go to Pizzale  Michelangelo. It is breathtaking. Be aware of large crowds and pickpockets.
So majestic place. We really enjoyed. Love u Venice

reviews: Take a gondola ride to the grand canal and around Venice! The gondola will give you the most breathtaking views of the city.

this is the highway in venice , so try to use the waterway as much as you can to move from area to area. from the airport to the old venice and to the lical stations between. its part of the venice experience . dont just take ouctures- be on it .
The main channel of Venice along which the most important historic building lay.
The Grande Canal is the main canal through the center of the city of Venice.

In fact, I don't like the lichens of Venice in all the Italian cities and sightseeing spots because he is a river city to and from the boat ride, the feeling of rocking on the water is not safe and crowded, and the water is not so clear and clean. But it is also in this context that you understand the way the Venetians live and the deep things that the famous novels and plays tell the Venetian merchants.

attractions.name: Bridge of Sighs
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Italy, Veneto, Venice, Bridge of Sighs
reviews: The Venice icon is beautiful. View it from the distance or from inside as part of a visit to the Doge’s Palace.
One memory of Venice I will never forget, highly enjoyed the tour that allowed me to walk through the bridge to experience what really makes it the bridge of sighs!
I was fortunate enough to go intocthenbridge of sighs. The bridge is much more beautiful from the outside.

Celebrated by the great French novelist Alexandre Dumas, this bridge witnessed the love story of two young people as their meeting place and the story, though romantic, ended tragically.  It is no surprise since the Greek era that love stories are often tragical. Later on in the Renaissance time, Shakespeare and Racine (and Coeneille) brought back these stories to the scene and plays like Le Cid or Romeo and Juliet are until today masterpieces. So, why not have an idyll and play the role (or live ) a love story. It will be a landmark in your life.

Most people see the Bridge of Sighs from the exterior, as connecting the Doge's Palace to its adjacent prison. A more insightful experience is to take a tour inside Palazzo Ducale that takes you through the Secret Passageways and through the bridge  where you can stop and admire Venice from the other side, as seen through the cracks of the bridge. I took a VIP Access Secret Passages: Doge's Palace and St Mark's Tour with Walks of Italy that I highly recommend which allowed me to spend extra time on the bridge, as well as see the cavernous cells where the Venetian wrongdoers were held - one of which incarcerated the infamous Casanova that managed to escape.

reviews: A must-visit but book in advance to skip the line and leave your backpack elsewhere.
Such a calm place, and busy at the same time. Beautiful destination
Basilica di San Marco is quite lovely and the paintings (even on the exterior at night) almost seem as though they're lit from within.
It's the giant church that lords it over Venice. Pretty much a must see on any trip.

Beautiful! Amazing! I went to Venice two months ago! I visited St. Mark's Basilica and I was so excited to see this masterpiece! A great mix of art! I suggest to prebook the entrance on internet with venetoinside.com! It was really quick without any queue! www.venetoinside.com

attractions.name: Doge's Palace
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Italy, Veneto, Venice, Doge's Palace
attractions.open_status: 8:30-17:30 (November 1st to March 31st), 8:30-19:00 (April 1st to October 31st) (not allowed within one hour before closing) December 25th And not open on January 1st
reviews: Beautiful palace with great views of the surrounding area. Book in advance or visit late in the day to avoid long lines.

The regular tour of the Doge’s Palace (the Palazzo Ducale) in Venice is extraordinary enough. The building is a quite remarkable example of Gothic civic architecture. Every stone, passageway and artwork evokes the power that the Serene Republic wielded over a millennium of unparalleled imperial power. But you might want to dig even deeper – to explore the hidden corners of the palace on the Itinerari Segreti del Palazzo Ducale (the secret tour of the Doge’s Palace).Get there early to book a ticket on the special touryou get to see areas and things most people dont know about! You also get to to the normal tour / walk around.On the tour you will get to see where Casanova was in-prisoned and where he made his escape from, the hidden ways behind the scenes ( and sometimes on top of them ! ), torture rooms,  Your tour is likely to end at the Ponte dei Sospiri or Bridge of Sighs … the final walk of prisoners across the water to the ‘new prison’.

Grand and imperial palace is a palace builti  Venetian Gothic style, and one of the main landmarks of the city of Venice, northern Italy. The palace was the residence of the Doge of Venice, the supreme authority of the Republic of Venice,opening as a museum in 1923.
While not as marvelous as some of the other palaces in Florence or Rome, definitely worth a visit in Venice. The adjoining prison and walking across the Bridge of Sighs is interesting to kids.
After having missed out on visiting the palace during my first couple of visits, finally made it inside. Sadly found it a great disappointment as there wasn't much to see inside.

attractions.name: Ponte Rialto
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Italy, Veneto, Venice, Ponte Rialto
reviews: Great trip by gondola to admire the bridge! The view by boat has really different feeling, i suggest to have a try, just once in life! ;)
Nothing can prevent you from enjoying this elegant creature in the most romantic city. A cup of of espresso, croissant and freshly squezzed orange juice will definitely add to the pleasure!

You have not truly visited Venice without seeing Rialto bridge. It is one of only a few bridges over the Gand Canal and by far the largest and most famous one. After 10 am the bridge starts to be crowded by tourists, so go early. We had a hotel close to the bridge, thus no problem. The water bus next to the bridge is also named 'Rialto' - so its easy to find, best take line 1.
Beautiful bridge with great views of the Grand Canal. Also your path to freedom in the charming San Polo and San Croce neighborhoods.
Gondola rides are definitely not something to miss! It’s a unique and fun experience unlike anywhere else.

attractions.open_status: September 19-September 30: 8:30-19:45; October 1st-October 9th: 9:30-19:00 (last entry time 18:15); October 10-10 31st; 9:30-17:30; November 1st - March 31st: 9:30-17:30 (last entry time 16:45); January 8th - January 19th: Close maintenance work; April 1st - April 30th: 9:00-17:30 (last entry time 16:45); May 1st - September 4th: 8:30-21:00 (final entry Time 20:45); September 5th - September 18th: 8:30-20:15.
reviews: close to my hometown, the city I went to university...with its wonderful Campanile in San Marco square. lovely place!

The Campanile is, perhaps, Venice's most iconic structure. It is also the tallest building in Venice and visible from almost everywhere. Visitors can take an elevator to the top (for 8 euros) and get a panoramic view over the city. The price of the lift has gone up over the years, but the view is well worth the cost. Lines move quickly, but it's worth it to get there early, as there is almost always a crowd.
When everyone is fighting to go up the bell tower in St Marks Square, come here and be the only one in line for a magnificent view.
The view from the top on sunny days is absolutely worth the queue!

It is surely the most famous monument in Venezia and one of the most famous of Italy. Together with the Basilica of San Marco and Piazza San Marco it is the very heart of Venice. It was built around IX Century and then damaged in different periods. At the beginning of 1900 it falled down and was then rebuilt.

Beaches have a lot of rocks but the water is clear and Nice teracces Nice boulevard aswell

reviews: Peel goss town built on the highest point of the santorini, the panoramic view overlooking the grandeur of santorini. Remain here until the early 19th century is the capital of santorini, legacy town many exquisite Byzantine architecture and many magnificent slab. Moreover peel goss and santorini important shopping places, arts and crafts, native products of the market here is very worth a stroll.

Quiet and peaceful, there are no tourists in Ruzhi, and there is no need to look for small blue roofs. It can be seen everywhere and consumption is relatively suitable. Places without Chinese are always more flavorful

The small town of Pyrgos is the most geographically located town on Santorini. Because of its special geographical location, it overlooks the entire island of Santorini at the top of the town, which often attracts tourists to see the island. Compared to other small towns, such as Oia, Fira and other well-known attractions, it can be considered a quieter destination!

In addition to the famous three towns of Santorini, there are actually several other towns with very beautiful scenery, and Pyrgos Town is also one of them. The scenery here is also very beautiful, with a magnificent coastline, and there are few tourists, and the price-performance ratio is very high. You may come and experience it.

The hotel is a converted hotel with a bathroom view of the former underground cellar, the interior is a bit like the simple destitute wind of the Kim Kardashian family, there is a small courtyard outside, suitable for friends to have a barbecue, a private pool and a small balcony. Pyrgos Old Winery Villa Detail address Pirgos Kallistis, the surrounding area of Pyrgos is in the town, very quiet, you can walk out into the fairytale colored alleys, the town is a few minutes to walk through, not many tourists, there is a blue roof church on the hillside, In the evening, you can see the sunset from the sea view. The highlight of the wine cellar is remodeled, the hotel is large, the family can stay in the private pool with an extra bed is very bright, there is a massage function yard which is quite comfortable, there is a big tree, under the tree, there is a romantic spit: no breakfast is provided, there is no bottle of water at the time of check-in. The hot water is short and you have to finish the shower as fast as you can every day. Small tips: the pick-up and drop-off and other cars are best to say hello in advance, otherwise there is no chance to negotiate. There is a very beautiful terrace restaurant in the town. It is a pity that there is no place to go that day. Remember to book in advance if you like it.

attractions.name: Night Safari
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Singapore, Singapore, Night Safari
reviews: The place is slightly scary at night because you wouldn’t know what you’ll see. Nice place for adventures!

The concept of a nocturnal park in Singapore was suggested in the 1980s by the former executive chairman of the Singapore Zoo, Dr Ong Swee Law. Constructed at a cost of S$63 million, the Night Safari was officially opened on 26 May 1994 and occupies 35 hectares (86 acres) of secondary rainforest adjacent to the Singapore Zoo and Upper Seletar Reservoir.The Night Safari currently houses over 900 animals representing over 100 species, of which 41% are threatened species.The Night Safari is managed by Wildlife Reserves Singapore, and about 1.3 million visitors visit the safari per year. The Night Safari received its 11 millionth visitor on 29 May 2007.
one of the interesting place in Singapore. can escape the hot day and enjoy the night sitting in the tram to move around
A place where excitement never ends. A must visit for for wild life lovers and night watcher. that's than we will always be surprised by new information
We had never done a night safari before so we thought we would bite the bullet. Well, I can say that most of the reviews are unfortunately true.

attractions.name: Singapore Flyer
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Singapore, Singapore, Singapore Flyer
reviews: Standing at 165m – the height of a 42-storey building – the Singapore Flyer is Asia's largest giant observation wheel. A must visit to Singapore!

Singapore Flyer is one of the best ride to see and admire Singapore's Skyline. It has an audio (in English) which explains the different areas as you rotate, its background, and a little trivia. Each capsules is air-conditioned and ensures safety of each passengers. When we visited, they have this Barbie-themed capsule...talking about nostagia. They also have a passenger lounge (especial tickets) and like most of the attractions here in Singapore, at the end of your ride, there's a souvenir shop and you can look at your photos which taken before boarding and decided wether to take them or not. It costs sgd25.
Amazing Ariel view of whole Singapore . It takes approximately 45 mins to complete one round. If you are with a big group of 18-20 person , you can book one trip. Great experience.
I was lucky coming in the morning. I made to be the only one in my capsule. Had a lot of private space and enjoyed perfectly 30 minutes ride. Could see the real Singapore with unbelievable view.
nice view from top . we can see all view around there marina bay - marina gadenbay and have special parckage for wedding .

One of the best attractions over at Sentosa, i prepaid for my ticket which cost £13 on get your guide ans allowed me to get on twice, went straight in and queued for the cable car. It took just over 20 minutes for the wait to get onto the lift, but it was worth the wait as the views were amazing! The line at the other side had taken a lot longer but I really enjoyed it. Suitable for all ages, the luge is most enjoyed at night (after 7pm ish) as they start the rainbow LED lights which makes the experience a lot more fun and the queue wasnt as bad.
Thrilling and awesome place. You don’t even need to know how to drive to use the gokart. And the skyline ride is magnificent. Truly, once is never enough.
So much fun in one package. The trill of going up in the sky is equally matched with the immense joy of speeding down the tracks. You could do it all day.
Awesome experience. Got to skip the queue and also spend lessed on the ticket. My friend and I had a very smooth experience!

attractions.name: River Safari
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Singapore, Singapore, River Safari
reviews: Jurong Bird Park, River Safari, Night Safari and Singapore Zoo are now open to all guests.Our four parks are operating with limited capacity, and Night Safari opens from Thursdays to Sundays, as well as eve of and on public holidays. Operating hours are from 6.30pm to 12am.Please note that from 11-21 Mar 2021, Night Safari will be open every day from 7.15pm to 12am.Entry to our parks is time-based, so make sure to purchase your tickets online and select your entry time before you visit. Visits are limited to eight guests per group. Above detail are for 2021.
amazing day at the river safari. especially love watching the panda eat
very nice experience overall! enjoyed the walk and fast purchase during the COVID-19 times.

Enjoyed our day at the River Safari. Pleasantly surprised to note that the whole park has sheltered walkways. So rain or shine, this is a perfect place for a family outing. The information posted along the way is very helpful and educational
Good experience! River safari is good with cruise and boat ride.

attractions.name: Sands SkyPark
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Singapore, Singapore, Sands SkyPark
reviews: The Sands SkyPark — including the Observation Deck — is open from 11am to 9pm. The Observation Deck may be closed for private events or commercial. Price for admission is RM 45.89
One of sleek rooftop bars and restaurants in the Sands SkyPark. With building descriptions, you can know more about is when you enter itself. Need to pay for it.
The view is amazing. Even if you are afraid of heights like I am, you will feel comfortable at the deck. There is a long line before getting to the deck. So be ready for waiting.
Have A Big Sky Garden And best night viewing
An amazing place to chill that makes you feel, you're on top of the world.

attractions.name: Singapore Cable Car
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Singapore, Singapore, Singapore Cable Car
attractions.address: 1 Harbourfront Ave, tower 2 Keppel Bay Tower , Singapore
reviews: Fantastic panoramic views but not many f&b outlets open due to covid. But when they do, and it's safe, it's a nice place to stop by and take some pictures. For now , get an ice cream at the gift shop and enjoy the view. Pretty stunning if you plan your route through the Henderson waves nearby
loved the stunning views . worth a try .
Boleh la, worth to try. Not much different from LGK and Genting Highland.
nice view... good for couples to get together
it was fun, love the view from the cable car

attractions.name: The Palace Museum
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Beijing, The Palace Museum
attractions.address: No. 4, Jingshanqian Street, Dongcheng District, Beijing
reviews: great visit, very cheap to visit and great days adventure 👌

It's obviously gorgeous and historic and is definitely a must-see if you ever travel through Beijing. But do know that it is absolutely massive, sprawling, and easy to get lost in. There are a lot of hidden corners, and many of the courtyards resemble each other. As my group continued through, we found ourselves asking, "Have we already been here?" on more than one occasion. If possible, I'd recommend not going in the summer as there is little shade and it gets HOT. If you do go in the summer, make sure to bring plenty of sunscreen and if you get one, a mini handheld fan. There were places inside to buy water, but I'd recommend bringing your own, too.

A must see when visiting Beijing. I've heard people say it is too big and there's too much walking, I did not have that feeling. I thought it was very pleasant and worth it, especially if you understand the historical significance of the City.

Forbidden City was like no other . it was a sight to see . Huge place to shop and lots of food to try near by. you get to see how massive the palace and all the different areas around it looks. great place to visit.
The whole development is tremendous and unforgettable.  The structures of the development are well maintained and visitor  can trace the footprint of chinese history from Ming to Ching Dynasties.

attractions.name: Badaling Great Wall
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Beijing, Badaling Great Wall
attractions.address: Turn right at Exit 58 of Beijing-Tibet Expressway, Yanqing County, Beijing
reviews: Going to the Badaling Greatwall is one of my favorite weekend get aways. It’s easy to get there via the subway and train. It’s refreshing to walk there.....best to go there on weekdays though. Will definitely go there again and not only once.....but countless times while I am here in Beijing.
it was awesome to be able to climb the wonders of the world

I visited the Great Wall December 30 2020. it was -12 degrees and windy. Due to the weather it was incredibly quiet which was magnificent but it was not pleasant feeling so cold. The wall is not a walk it is a climb. There are some very steep sections and the stairs can be a little daunting if you’re afraid of heights. standing at the top of the 8th tower is something special, looking into the distance at how far it stretches and the fact that people made this huge structure is mind blowing. I feel very accomplished for climbing the wall in the conditions I faced but I’m not sure I would recommend going during the same weather conditions but definitely make an effort to visit. Be sure to book online and it is much easier to get a didi to the wall as I tried getting the train to find I had no idea which train to take.

It is a beautiful destination, but I recommend going when it isn't tourist season. The best time to go is in the winter, around the beginning of December, while children are still in school and it is not too cold during the daytime. Otherwise you'll only see people and not the Great Wall. 人上人海 😅
absolutely breathtaking. I would suggest going in the summer.

attractions.name: Beijing Wildlife Park
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Beijing, Beijing Wildlife Park
attractions.address: Wanmu Forest, Yucheng Town, Daxing District, Beijing
reviews: Best place to enjoy with family if u have enough rush-less time because its too big finish by a day..

A great place to spend a day with the whole family. They have a safari ride on a truck, when the visitors can see and feed tigers and bears. Although on the weekend there are very many people and it's hard to get there by car because of the traffic. Kids can enjoy the baby animal kindergarten there.

it is a good place but not an actual safari wild park experience. animals are captive by pits or fences and they donot allow the visitors to move outside to take pictures anywhere in the park. this needs to be improved. besides this the scenery is nice and they have a separate place for captive animals and birds
great family friendly park! Exceeded my expectations. Best wildlife park in Beijing. The Safari is a must, but get there early to avoid a long line.
After playing around, I feel like driving by car is pretty normal, and the domestic animals are so cute.

attractions.name: Old Summer Palace
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Beijing, Old Summer Palace
attractions.address: No. 28, Qinghua West Road, Haidian District, Beijing
reviews: nice place. i dis not know that china has many many maybe most nice places in the country.
hi. i know this place near to big university. it has fantastic history
great view, great experiences. THANKYOU trip .com.

The Old Summer Palace is known in Chinese as Yuanming Yuan. It is originally called the Imperial Gardens. I really liked this place. The territory of Yuanming Yuan is big and beautiful - a lor of trees, lakes, halls and ruins of Old Palace. It is a perfect place to take a walk, to read a book and to enjoy the nature and history.
unbelievable place. visit and enjoy

attractions.name: Prince Gong's Mansion
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Beijing, Prince Gong's Mansion
attractions.open_status: Open on Tue-Sun,8:30am-5:00pm;Closed on Mon;Open from 8:30am-5:00pm during Chinese public holidays
attractions.address: No.14, Liuyin Street, Xicheng District, Beijing
reviews: Goonfoot,inbeijingisreally,deservetovisit.It''sTheoldhouseofherson.Itcarriesmany,chinesetraditionalcultures,youcan,knowhow.Bigmonster,Lived,inOldtimeofchina.
Visited this place while school examinations were ongoing, thus didn''t make it.

Prince Kung's Mansion (Prince Kung's Mansion) is a national important cultural relics protection unit, a national first-class museum and a national AAAAA tourist attraction in Xicheng District, Beijing. It is the largest building group in Qing Dynasty. The residence of Yongzheng, Prince of Qing Dynasty, was sealed by the Qing Dynasty in 1851. The name of the palace of Prince Kyo was also derived. Gongwangfu is a huge building with an area of 60,000 square meters, divided into two parts: mansion and garden, with more than 30 buildings of various types, which has experienced the historical process from the peak to the fall of the Qing Dynasty, and has carried a wealth of historical and cultural information. Therefore, there is a "a courtesy of the king, half of the history of the Qing Dynasty".

When my friend came to Beijing, of course I would take a tour of Prince Gong’s Mansion. It is now the most complete preserved palace building, which is very complete. Compared with other palaces, either they were torn apart and turned into large courtyards, or occupied by various units, or they were in ruins. There are more than 30 building communities here, with exquisite layout and extraordinary style. Originally the mansion of Heshen, it has gone through the historical process of the Qing Dynasty from its heyday to its decline, so it is said that "a Palace of Prince Gong, half of the history of the Qing Dynasty".

There were too many people during the Qingming holiday. I wanted to ask a guide but I didn't ask him. I could only follow the crowd and explain it! The guide is more expensive than the Forbidden City, 30/person! The guide in 5 people is 200! More than 5 people are 40/person! More people can't walk up, the experience is not good, only half of it, it comes out! The "first blessing in the world" doesn't allow photos! 1987 is so bad! Not recommended!

attractions.name: Gubei Water Town
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Beijing, Gubei Water Town
attractions.address: Gubei Water Town, Simatai Village, Gubeikou Town, Miyun County, Beijing
reviews: very nice to visit in Spring and Autumn.
crazily amazing refurbished ancient town! lots of activities, instaworthy photographs ! amazing food and unbelievable ambience !

Gubei Water Town is a fantastic day visit.. Only 2 hours from Beijing.  Judy was our tour guide and she was fantastic. From treating us to a fantastic lunch, to pointing out all the key landmarks at Gubei.  We had an awesome time.. Very good place to take great pictures/see the great wall/feel like you are in a Swiss mountain town.. Will definitely return in the Summer.

If you want to escape the Beijing life for a mean time, go to Gubei. It’s a worth to visit, got a lot of interesting sights to see, if you want photography, you will surely love this place. Very traditional, got small alleys to take picture at, and don’t miss the show at night. You will be amazed how they collaborated the music and 3d effect all together. If you have more time, try out to feel being a princess by renting a costume, and take a picture around.

Gubei Water Town is my favorite place around Beijing. It's a very pittoresque and magical place. It's very well preserved and it is easy accesible. It is 1.5/2 hrs from Dongzhimen station and there is a direct bus that leaves in the morning (09:00). It is great to wander around the cosy village and explore all its corners and interesting attractions. The hotsprings are very beautiful and reaxing and there are so many great views in the Town. You can also visit a part of the Great Wall by night and overlook the Town. In summer there are also interesting small exhibitions and workshops. There are great food places and lots of little shops and authentic snacks. You can easily enjoy your time here for a few days and dive into the traditional culture : there are opera shows, arts and crafts shops and music.There is a pagoda, an old church, and traditional houses turned into musea. You also learn about the history or just enjoy your time with leisurely activities such as bowling, hotsprings and dining. It is a perfect getaway. We didn't organize our hostel on beforehand, we just went there and choose from the options, with hotsprings included.

attractions.name: Happy Valley Beijing
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Beijing, Happy Valley Beijing
attractions.open_status: Open from 3/16-4/2,9:30am-7:00pm;Open from 8:30am-10:00pm during Ching Ming Festival;Open from 4/6-6/20,9:00am-10:00pm
attractions.address: Xiaowuji North Road, East Fourth Ring, Jinyu West Road, Chaoyang District, Beijing (Southeast of Sifang Bridge)
reviews: Happy Valley is one of those places that makes a summer day the best it can be! Reminds you of childhood and all the fun we sometimes miss out on as adults. Some of the rides might have a long line or you might be too tall to ride some of them but the memories and fun are worth it! Delicious slushees and  an exciting day spent with friends! If you have a free sunny summer day consider Happy Valley your best destination☀️
proud to be part of trip.com really appreciate your service.
A fun theme park with something for everyone!

There are many places you can find for fun and enjoy your life with your family and buddies. But Happy Valley is one of the funniest and amazing place that you could spend your all day without looking go back at home . You can find everythings there, like if you want something comedy or scarry, or adventures or even though very childhood thingy, such as water balloon and throwing or hitting to eachothers make us wet, wow haha. it was amazing i played with my cute friend Amber. Moreover, dance music and so on. finally i would say that it's a perfect place to have fun moments and release your all burdens and stress to joy your life. I am sure you guys also enjoy Happy Valley.
I had an awesome experience at Happy Valley with some friends. I haven’t been on rides like that since I was a teenager. it brought back the joy of childhood.

attractions.name: Mutianyu Great Wall
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Beijing, Huairou District, Mutianyu Great Wall
attractions.address: Mutianyu Village, Bohai Town, Huairou District, Beijing
reviews: Had a great trip to the great wall today with our exceptional trip guide Ms Lily. She made sure our trip was informative and we'll refreshed. She went far over and above to accommodate our requirements throughout the trip. she not only drove us to the destination but also helped us secure the tickets. She had the VIP access and could drive us to the ticket office for the wall which was not available for all. Lily accompanied us to the wall and also took family pictures recommending trendy poses at various locations. She also got us water and some bananas to regain the energy after the hike. Then she took to us to some of most famous restaurants around the area to try some delicious local cuisine. She also helped us buy tickets to temple of heaven and dropped us for our next destination. She also offered to wait and pick us up if needed to drop us back to the hotel. Even after dropping us she suggested to contact her in case we needed help. She was very thoughtful, genuinely helpful and extremely kid friendly person who made our trip a memorable one. I am extremely happy to recommend her to anyone wishing to visit the great wall in future.
nice,in fast mode you can take the tower 14 go left and then finish the other side and take the slider on the 6th can take you 4 or 5 hours (including photos! ) total cost 480yuan walk! walk ! walk!
It was last of autumn that’s why the scenery is not satisfactory 😆😆😆😆
Beautiful part of the wall, moderately easy to climb, and not so cold on the day I went, the climbing warms you up! Some restaurants and shops around too. Very happy I went!

It was a beautiful experience to visit Mutianyu Great Wall. We had an opportunity to play with the snow while walking up the mountain to watch tower 10, we made our way to watch tower 6 while taking beautiful photos of the experience and took the toboggan down, it was amazing.

attractions.name: Beijing Zoo
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Beijing, Beijing Zoo
attractions.address: No. 137, Xizhimenwai Street, Xicheng District, Beijing
reviews: it was a wonderful experience. mostly being able to see different types of snakes and lizards and Ofcourse the pandas. not much is left to see otherwise in comparison to many zoos I’ve seen around the world.

I visited the zoo on Christmas Day. It has so many animals to see and is so big that I did not manage to see everything. I loved seeing the pandas, tigers, wolves, polar bear, eagle, lion and the little otters were incredibly cute. I thoroughly enjoyed my visit.

You can not miss this if you are traveling with kids. The tickets are under 15rmb and the inside Panda experience inclusive tickets are more than worth it. White tiger, lion, elephant and many other species.
Beijing Zoo. Great tourist attraction. When visiting the zoo, you can also visit the aquarium and see giant pandas.
Beijing Zoo is nice but can be very crowded on a weekend or holiday. Some animal exhibits are very small, but the panda area is very nice and probably the best thing at this zoo.

attractions.name: Mount Victoria
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, New Zealand, Wellington, Wellington, Mount Victoria
attractions.address: Alexandra Lookout Rd, Wellington 6001, New Zealand
reviews: It is a really nice place to have the entire view of the city. you can go by taking the bus 20 very near to the city and take again 20 to drop off in the city

The Arch of Wellington, one of London's icons, is set up in Hyde Park to commemorate the victory of the Battle of Waterloo, the Duke of Wellington, where the Buckingham Palace's horse guards pass every day and are a great place to see.

Mount Victoria on the coast of Wellington is a large area with many entrances to the mountain. Mount Victoria is known as the lungs of the city. The mountains are covered with green plants and there are many ancient plants. A bird’s eye view of the coast from the mountain is very beautiful. There is a viewing platform on the top of the mountain. We went up the mountain on foot. There are bus stops and large parking lots on the top of the mountain. The locals walk their dogs, run, and ride bicycles. There are not many tourists. The air is fresh and it feels very good. There are no managers along the way and it is very clean. Pay attention to maintaining the environment on the mountain.

Victoria Hill in Wellington is the highest place in the whole of Huilington, it is located on the edge of the sea, the scenery is very beautiful, you can take the cableway up to the top of the mountain, on the viewing platform to see the beautiful sea view, the scenery is really very good, do not miss.

Mt. Victoria is located in the west of Wellington, the highest point of the whole of Wellington. The vegetation of Mt. Victoria is very rich and the air is very good. The viewing platform at the top overlooks the bustling city of Wellington and also the blue sea. The view is very charming and one of the important sights of Wellington.

attractions.name: Museum of New Zealand (Te Papa Tongarewa)
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, New Zealand, Wellington, Wellington, Museum of New Zealand (Te Papa Tongarewa)
reviews: The Te Papa National Museum of New Zealand is an important museum dedicated to displaying Australian indigenous culture and paleontological history. There are many fossils of ancient animals in the collection, which is very amazing. In addition, the Maori cultural exhibitions here are also rich and colorful, showing the cultural characteristics of New Zealand in all aspects, making people linger.
Free project, very cost-effective. Wellington must visit attractions.

Wellington's National Museum is a place to feel the rich history of New Zealand and the Maori customs, known by locals as The Papa, which is Maori. The museum shows the history, culture, and beauty of early New Zealand's Maori people. Maori totems, clothing, accessories, housing, warehouses, canoes, tools to use, etc. New Zealand National Museum is a comprehensive museum. There are introductions to New Zealand's geography, diversity of plants and organisms, more than 100 years of political and economic development, folk art and contemporary cultural art. Feel the 4th, 5th and 6th floors can be seen, informative and interesting. There are free and paid time-specific lectures in the museum. There are small films. There are some interactive items. The rooftop overlooks Wellington City and is good for photos. There are coffee seats in the pavilion, lots of chairs to rest and lots of locals to take children to visit.

Visiting the Tippapa National Museum in New Zealand was blown away by a collection of war-themed sculptures about a life-like 5, The 6 times as lifelike as the sweat on the head, blood on the body, pores are so realistic it was stunning but even more so when watching the last group of sculptures there was a table drawer next to a round red paper in which many people (more young people) were watching The pool of red paper that was filled with the voices of many people I took a picture of a 18-year-old or nine-year-old who was throwing the paper and then standing in front of the statue of the hero looking at him. I was shocked by the respectful look I don't know if there is a heroic martyr protection law in New Zealand or if they are carrying out revolutionary tradition education but this pool of red paper, the look of the teenager's eyes may give me an answer!

The Tipapa National Museum is a large natural museum with a large collection of fossils of ancient animals and plants unearthed in New Zealand, including a huge and very precious nautilus. The museum building itself is very atmospheric, with advanced exhibition facilities, teaching and entertainment is very attractive.

attractions.name: New Zealand Parliament
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, New Zealand, Wellington, Wellington, New Zealand Parliament
reviews: Recommended by the Capitol: It is best to make an appointment on weekends in this place. Usually there are not many people. You can go in without making an appointment. Go through the security check before entering the door. Except you can go in, nothing else can be brought in. There is a place to send packages for free. After sending the package, go to the service desk to register and get a number. A tour guide will take you to the Parliament Building. There are only English-speaking guides, but there are brochures in Chinese. Transportation: In the city center, walking, you can also take the bus, there are stations nearby, see Figure 3. Tickets: Free, it is best to book a visit time online. Time-consuming: about 2 hours

The New Zealand Parliament building is a very strange building, it is a bit like our Chinese roundabout, a small circle of columns, a bit like the local Maori traditional building, very different, and one of Wellington's iconic buildings, Well worth a look.

The New Zealand Capitol building in Wellington is a wonderful building. It is shaped like a tower of our Chinese architecture, with a 30-posted building underneath. The interior is a spacious conference hall, an iconic building of Wellington, and worth a visit.
The streets of Wellington in the New Year are very lively. Happy New Year to share with everyone

Free tour, the door needs security check, there is an hour to visit the inside explanation, need to send a bag. Very good, you can understand the government work and New Zealand history, there is a special room of Maori staff, which has Maori jewelry, very special. In addition, we visited the House of Lords and House of Commons and suggested that visitors visit it. There is a beautiful building next to it, creamy yellow, can do wedding photo background, superb.

attractions.name: Wellington Botanic Gardens
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, New Zealand, Wellington, Wellington, Wellington Botanic Gardens
attractions.address: 101 Glenmore St, Kelburn, Wellington 6012, New Zealand
reviews: The cleanest most beatiful park and Gardens I have seen. Do take the cable car up or down for a great experience.
Great place to stroll and relax, suitable for all ages.

Wellington Botanic Garden is the largest botanical garden in New Zealand. It has a very large area and planted many rare plants from all over the world. Although it is located in the cold zone, you can see many tropical plants in the greenhouse, and the spring and summer flowers here are very beautiful.

New Zealand's Wellington Botanic Garden (WELLINGTONBOTANIC GARDEN) is located in the city center, covering an area of 25 hectares, free of tickets, and many entrances and exits. The best route is to take a cable car from LambtonQuay in the city center to the top of the mountain and enter the park on foot. Wellington Botanic Garden is very original ecology. Visiting the Botanical Garden is like walking into a natural scenic spot, with dense and tall plants such as virgin forests, low bushes, creeping plants and ubiquitous moss. The trails are guided by tile paintings. Stroll along the winding trails along the mountain road, breathe fresh air surrounded by green plants, hear the sound of birds and mountain streams, sometimes stop to look at the distant view of the city or the vast sea, and rest in the observation deck when tired. There is a botanical garden map at the entrance, which introduces several trails and marks the distance and which exit. Along the trail attractions, visitors only need to walk along the underground tile paintings, which is very convenient. The greenhouse is standard equipment for the Botanical Garden, and the indoor part of the Wellington Botanic Garden is relatively simple. Five years ago, it was the early autumn season. I saw plants growing in the air (LIVE ON AIR) for the first time there, some hanging on shelves and some climbing on other plants, very strange. The information center is called TREEHOUSE. There is a wood sculpture called BEELADY at the door. It is a work of a female artist. The material comes from a eucalyptus tree that broke in the storm in the Blue Mountains of Sydney. There is also a children’s room next to it.

Wellington has two botanical gardens. This is an older one. It has a large area with exotic flowers and weeds from all over the world, and three large greenhouses. The flowers bloom in all seasons and the scenery is very beautiful. It is a place you must not miss when you come to Wellington.

attractions.name: Wellington Zoo
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, New Zealand, Wellington, Wellington, Wellington Zoo
attractions.address: 200 Daniell Street | Newtown, Wellington 6021, New Zealand
reviews: Wellington Zoo is built at the foot of the mountain. The environment of the entire zoo is still very good and natural, so the animals here seem to be lively, and some animals can still be in close contact with it.
This is a large zoo. There are many types and numbers of animals in it. This zoo attracts many tourists every day, and its facilities and environment are good. I think they are all pretty good.
I feel that the animals I see here are dumb and cute. There are many types of animals in this place, but the number may not be that many. There are one or two for each animal.

This is the largest zoo in New Zealand. The environment and animal types inside are very large. You can see many endangered animals here. I think it’s not bad. Located at the foot of the mountain, the environment is also good.
This zoo is suitable for bringing children here. The environment inside is quite good, and the animals here look good, clean, and the atmosphere created is very good. Can come.

attractions.name: Weta Workshop
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, New Zealand, Wellington, Wellington, Weta Workshop
attractions.address: Corner Camperdown Rd & Weka St, Miramar, Wellington
reviews: Wellington’s Weta Studio is a must-visit place for all Lord of the Rings fans. Here, all the character scenes and props in the Lord of the Rings movie can be easily found, as if you are in the movie. These props do everything It's very lifelike, especially the characters, which look like alive and amazing. I have to admire how powerful these craftsmen are.

Wellington feels peaceful, laid back and friendly. There are very few people, and most of the CBD commercial streets are closed at 7pm. This inconspicuous building (Weta workshop) is the Weta workshop. The shapes of Lord of the Rings and King Kong, including the scenes in Hollywood blockbusters, were born here. There are only more than 20 core designers in the studio, designing and modeling. , Props, scene production are all done here). Weta Digital (more than 1,000 people) completed computer post-production. Wellington may not have any special highlights, but Weta Studios will still shock visitors.

In order to visit the Weta Studio, we flew from Auckland to Wellington specifically to worship this New Zealand movie kingdom. In fact, only a small part of the site was open. It is equivalent to making a mini museum and exhibition center for tourists.
The museum is not allowed to take pictures, you can only take pictures of the souvenir shop, and there are some small open areas at the door. The main thing is to tell you these movie special effects, how are these props made?

The Weta Studio in Wellington is a mecca for fans of the Lord of the Rings. Many of the props in the Lord of the Rings movies are from this studio. There are many wax figures of the characters in the Lord of the Rings movies, exactly the same as the images in the movies. There are also many props that are meticulously crafted in the same proportions, which will definitely make everyone enjoy the addiction of The Lord of the Rings, definitely come to visit.

This place was the former production base of the movie The Lord of the Rings, showing some of the models and props used in the production of this movie at the time. Students who like this movie think it is not bad here, I think it is average.

attractions.name: Old St Paul's
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, New Zealand, Wellington, Wellington, Old St Paul's
attractions.address: 34 Mulgrave Street PO Box 12291 Thorndon Wellington 6011
reviews: The Old St. Paul's Church is one of New Zealand's most important historical heritage. This is a sacred building that was first laid in 1866, imitating the early Gothic architecture of the United Kingdom, and it was all built using New Zealand wood. This is an old church, and the figures on the stained glass are all parishioners and stories from the Bible. I was particularly curious about several flags hung in the church, including the Royal Navy flag, the US Marine Corps flag and the American flag stationed in Wellington during World War II. The staff explained that this is a flag with a story. Church, people will never forget them, God bless and bless them. This church is now mainly rented for weddings, concerts, memorials, or funerals. There is also a St. Paul's Cathedral in Wellington nearby. It is a relatively modern church we have seen and is known as the most vital church in the 21st century. There are more than 1,000 seats in total, and behind the altar is an abstract glass painting. Some windows stained glass paintings are also geometric patterns, which look modern and fashionable. The overall construction was completed in 1998. Now this church is a venue for national religious events, seminars, concerts and major events in New Zealand.

The old St. Paul’s Church is a magnificent Gothic cathedral. Most of the locals who come here are most famous for the stained glass of this church. The church is well preserved. I didn’t expect the dark windows outside to look out from the inside. But you can see the colorful sunshine!

I thought that the church called St. Paul should be a magnificent cathedral, but this church is a beautiful and small church. It is beautifully located in a wood. It has a white spire and is also very beautiful inside.

This church is not a cathedral, it looks like a wooden hut in the woods from the outside, but it cannot be denied that it is very beautiful, the details of the construction are very beautiful, and the interior is also very beautiful.
This is a small church with an all-wood structure. It looks like a small farmyard, but I think it is very beautiful. The dark roof and white walls are all decorated with wood.

attractions.name: Zealandia （Karori Wildlife Sanctuary）
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, New Zealand, Wellington, Wellington, Zealandia （Karori Wildlife Sanctuary）
reviews: Zealandia Animal and Plant Reserve is a large zoo and botanical garden. The plants here are very luxuriant. Many of them are rare plant species. Many animals live here. The environment is very elegant and it is definitely worth visiting. .

A very big and beautiful place. I feel that this place belongs to the nature of a semi-wild zoo. I can see some more ordinary animals, and there are a lot of birds in it. I saw different birds all the way.

You can really describe this place as beautiful mountains and clear waters. The area of the entire reserve is very large. It can be considered as a large pasture or farm. There are some common animals living here very leisurely.

We are a tourist group. We have half a day to explore this reserve with our guide. Actually, it is not particularly mysterious, but there are some flora and fauna. If there is no guide to explain, you may miss it.
This reserve is really a good place to explore nature, and it feels that many places are full of mystery, and there are many kinds of trees and all kinds of small animals.

attractions.name: Puerto-Princesa Subterranean River National Park
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Philippines, Mimaropa, Palawan, Puerto-Princesa Subterranean River National Park
attractions.address: Puerto Princesa Subterranean River National Park, Puerto Princesa, MIMAROPA
reviews: Subterranean River National Park is a must try experience eapecially those who wants to have a stong bond connection with their family and loved ones.
One of the seven wonders of the world. Simply breathtaking.

The Puerto Princesa Subterranean River National Park is located about 50 km north of the city of Puerto Princesa, Palawan, Philippines. It features a limestone karst mountain landscape with an 8.2 km. navigable underground river. A distinguishing feature of the river is that it winds through a cave before flowing directly into the South China Sea. It includes major formations of stalactites and stalagmites, and several large chambers. The lower portion of the river is subject to tidal influences. The underground river is reputed to be the world’s longest. At the mouth of the cave, a clear lagoon is framed by ancient trees growing right to the water’s edge. Monkeys, large monitor lizards, and squirrels find their niche on the beach near the cave.... http://world.new7wonders.com/the-new7wonders-of-nature/puerto-princessa-underground-river-philippines/

The one thing that can not be missed when visiting Palawan. This is considered the 8th wonder of the world and I can see why. There are lots of tourists but there is a limit to how many can visit the caves at ant given time. Unlike some of the sites in Vietnam and Thailand, the area is still relatively undeveloped. The water is pristine with the experience of sailing into the cave exciting and full of beauty.
A real paradise! Voted One of the 8th wonders of the world.

attractions.name: Kayangan Lake
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Philippines, Mimaropa, Palawan, Coron, Kayangan Lake
reviews: It's heaven on earth... Inside the lake is like a journey to another dimension. To my fellow Filipinos, go no farther, visit Kayangan lake while in Coron.
There’s a short walk up a steep hill but totally worth it  because views!!
Such a wonderful hidden place in Coron.

Many people have always thought that it is a freshwater lake, because it is very rare to find a lake in the island, and we have tried that the water here is not much different from fresh water, the salty taste is not obvious, and the lake water is very clear. When the sun goes down, you can't see it. People in the water can see clearly. You will also see people coming to this hill to dive deep.

200 package meals at sea, the scenery is unforgettable, the same level as Madai, but not at all, this is the sea water has a strong sense of layering, and the lake and the sea are connected. After the epidemic is over, we still have a chance to go. No filter, authentic.

attractions.name: Banana Island
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Philippines, Mimaropa, Palawan, Banana Island
reviews: Banana Island is on a day trip. The beach on this island is quite beautiful and the sand quality is very good. The sand on the beach is quite white under the sun. Some thatched huts built with bamboo are provided for guests to cool off or take a day trip. The group members of the itinerary dine and sit. The outer part of the beach is covered with white sand at the bottom of the water, and you can see big fish, and live corals can swim farther!

Yesterday afternoon (May 21, 2019) a group of people took a sailing boat and crossed the Nile River to the famous banana island in Egypt. It seems that the place is not very big, but there are some small animals: such as crocodiles, monkeys, etc. We drank drinks on Wushang, and tasted bananas and so on.
Unexpectedly, there really is a banana island. Is there a lot of bananas inside? The scenery is very beautiful
This time I can taste local wine on the island. The island is not very big and there are not many tourists, but the tranquility is very enjoyable.
I used to think that this place should be all bananas. I only found out after I came here. It’s not what I imagined. It feels okay

attractions.name: Mount Tapyas
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Philippines, Mimaropa, Palawan, Coron, Mount Tapyas
reviews: If you want to go the the best viewpoint in Coron, Mt. Tapyas is a place to be. It’s highly recommended to visit in the afternoon to witness an incredible sunset in the island. Unlike most tourist spots, Mt. Tapyas has no entrance fee. It’s reachable by a 10 minute tricycle ride from Coron town. From the entrance, it will take you 721 steps to reach the peak which is roughly 30 minutes depending on your speed. Along the way, there are locals selling bottled water and refreshments to get you hydrated during the hike. Once you reach the summit, there’s a “CORON” signage that resembles the Hollywood sign in California. Mt. Tapyas is really a must-see once you visit Coron.
View of sunset and sunrise is mesmerising...

The Mountain of Crosses mentioned in many itineraries is here. There is a small hill, which is suitable for walking over in the evening, and then climb the mountain to see the beautiful sunset. The name of the Mountain of Crosses comes from the huge cross on the mountain, which shows that this is also a place of Catholicism. How profound the religious influence of the Spaniards was. You can get here on foot in the town, no need to take a car, whoever takes the car will get here!

It’s very close to the town. I’ve been here for four days and I’ve always wanted to take a look at the morning, take a bird’s eye view of the town and watch the sunset. But every afternoon it starts to rain heavily in the evening, the big kind. It can be regarded as leaving a little regret for my trip. The last photo was found online. If it is infringing, please notify me to delete it, thank you!
The Mountain of Crosses is right next to me, but it has been raining all the time.

attractions.name: Imperial City
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Vietnam, Tinh Thua Thien-Hue, Hue, Imperial City
reviews: I ve been here twice. One was in the rain season, another one was in winter. It was great, i loved the place and the history of this cities. Visited many tombs and hue citadel.
a great ancient place to visit while travelling to Hue city. i’ve been here quite a few time and still gonna go back if i had a chance to.

The Hue Imperial Palace may not even have one-tenth of the Forbidden City. It is completely out of touch with lavishness. What you can visit is only a part of the buildings, with some English explanations. Regarding the territorial dispute in the South China Sea, a Chinese explanation was added, ha ha ha. Tickets for foreigners are a lot more expensive than natives. There is no way. Who can make us not speak Vietnamese? Even if we can speak Vietnamese, the Chinese are very different from the locals. First of all, the skin color is too pale. , Secondly, I was dressed too foreign, not to mention wearing a backpack and colorful hats. Hue is not too big, and it’s not far from the hotel by taxi. Two hours are enough to see it. I feel that Vietnam’s history and cultural heritage is rounded to nowhere, and I don’t know where the cultural relics are. Are there any specialized research institutes and researchers.
It's a nice place to visit. It's a nice place to take your family or girlfriend out.
The Imperial City of Hue is the ancient capital of the three dynasties in Vietnam. It is small in size, but you can still visit it.

attractions.name: Thien Mu Pagoda
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Vietnam, Tinh Thua Thien-Hue, Hue, Thien Mu Pagoda
reviews: The blue Austin sedan with the license plate number DBA-599, which is now stored at Lingma Temple in Hue, was the vehicle that carried Shi Guangde to Ho Chi Minh’s self-immolation. After stepping out of the car, Master Shi Guangde went to the middle of the road and sat down. The assistant poured five gallons of gasoline on Shi Guangde, who was chanting Buddha's name righteously, and then set it alight. The believers regard it as the sacred heart and call it Guangde Bodhisattva. This period of history can be slightly revealed here.

Tianmu Temple is located on a small terrace on the north bank of the Xiangjiang River outside Hue. Unlike China, the tower of Tianmu Temple is in front of the mountain gate. Ascending the steep stone steps from the road along the river, you can see the tower, and then the temple buildings and courtyards. The famous Shi Guangde incident in South Vietnam. The blue car that Shi Guangde took from Hue to Saigon is now displayed in Tianmu Temple. Tianmu Temple is one of the few free attractions in Hue.

Hue Tianmu Temple: Tianmu Temple is nothing special, one tower and one temple, and its location is remote. But this cannot deter tourists from all over the world, because the Austin car in the famous photo in Figure 5 is housed in the temple. The monk Shi Guangde took this car from Hue to Saigon (now Ho Chi Minh City), the capital of South Vietnam. The frightening thing is that Shi Guangde's heart survived the fire and became a "heart relic" (Figure 6).

Hue Tienmu Temple has a history of more than 400 years and is the oldest temple in Hue. The Buddhist temple is located next to the Xiangjiang River. Its seven-story octagonal, 21-meter-high Fuyuan Pagoda is a symbolic building from Tianmu Temple to Hue. The name of the temple derives from the hill "Tianmu Mountain", but in the 19th century, in the era of Emperor Tu De, it was changed to "Lingmao Temple" for fear that the name would anger the sky. The temple has been expanded several times since it was built, but it was severely damaged by a typhoon in 1904, and was rebuilt several times later. The temple as a whole is a Chinese-style Buddhist temple. When you enter, you will find familiar buildings such as the bell tower, drum tower, Tianwang Hall, and Daxiong Hall. Tianmu Temple even has the monuments of gods and virtues commonly found in Chinese royal tombs, but the temple still has Vietnamese characteristics. The strangest thing is that there is an abandoned old car in the temple. It turned out to be the car used by the abbot of the temple, Shi Guangde, when he went to Saigon (now Ho Chi Minh City) to set himself on fire in 1953 to protest the government's suppression of Buddhism. The incident was successful that year. Arouse international attention.

From the Hue Imperial City along the Xiangjiang River to the north for about 6 kilometers, you will reach Lingma Temple or Tianma Temple. The temple was built on the site of an ancient Cham pagoda group for nearly 400 years. Although it has experienced several damages But it has been restored and it is the oldest temple in Hue~

attractions.name: Tomb of Khai Dinh
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Vietnam, Tinh Thua Thien-Hue, Hue, Tomb of Khai Dinh
attractions.address: | Thuy Bang Commune, Huong Thuy, 530000, Vietnam
reviews: Qiding imperial mausoleum is the smallest of the Hue imperial mausoleum, but it is undoubtedly the most characteristic one: Qiding imperial mausoleum is more modern, so the architectural style is also Chinese and Western, quite a bit of the style of Yuanmingyuan architecture, while other imperial mausoleum is basically Chinese style. More tourists come here than the Jingde Huangling, especially the tour group like to bring here. Huangling according to the layout of the mountain, steep steps up, a platform on both sides of the stone people, is the net red punching point, continue to the main building. The mausoleums inside the main building are magnificent and the inlaid art is a lot of people forget. The small hall next to the mausoleum hall has some art, clocks, swords, etc sent by the French, reflecting the king and the history of the country at that time. It is cheaper to buy a combined ticket with the Hue Palace than to visit it alone.

Unique, rich and noble performance, the combination of Chinese and Western!!
This imperial tomb is very different from China or the imperial tombs of his ancestors a hundred years ago. There are also couples in Vietnam’s wedding photos taken here. It’s really unexpected.

The last stop in Hue, hurried to arrive at 4:30. In December, the weather in Vietnam was also dark early, so I could only visit in a hurry. The Khai Dinh Mausoleum is small in scale and is the tomb of Khai Dinh, the father of Emperor Bao Da, the last emperor of Vietnam. The style combines Chinese and Western styles with mosaic wall decorations, which is extremely exquisite. The figurines of the gods are dressed in the official uniforms of the Ruan Dynasty. This place often appears on postcards.

The Khai Dinh Mausoleum is a characteristic attraction in Vietnam, on the hillside. Tickets are not expensive, and it is the only imperial tomb in Vietnam that has not been repaired. Very Vietnamese, if you have time, you can come and see

This imperial tomb is about 20 kilometers away from the imperial city of Hue. On the half slope of a hill, the area is small, and the style has changed a lot from the previous imperial tombs. It has been largely influenced by French culture, although the main style is still the mark of Chinese culture.

attractions.name: Perfume River
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Vietnam, Tinh Thua Thien-Hue, Hue, Perfume River
reviews: Beautiful brigde and river. You can smiply walking with your girlfriend to enjoy the fresh air of Hue

Riverside beauties-"Ya Dai" is similar to our country's cheongsam, mostly in single colors such as white, blue and red. It is simple and elegant, but it can be swayed with the wind and more charming, so it is also lined with trousers. , Fully outlines the slim and graceful figure of women. They are the courtesy ladies of the upcoming "Hue Tourism Festival".

Wandering along Hue Xiangjiang, there are not many people here because of rainy days. The layout on both sides is good. Xiangjiang can be regarded as an important river in Hue. Hue Imperial City is more famous here.

Near Binjiang Road in Hue New Town, Hue, walk across the clear and wide Xianghe River to the old town. Although it is convenient to follow the tour, it is not free and expensive. I like to visit the city in depth. So I kept walking along Xianghe Road, and unexpectedly ran into a group of girls wearing traditional national costumes "Ya Dai" on the river bank beside the bridge.

It’s strange that many rivers in Vietnam have the same names as China. The important rivers in Hue City are pretty clean, but I don’t feel much care for them now. In the evening, there are cruise ships on the Xiangjiang River and a night market on the shore.

attractions.name: Lang Co  Beach
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Vietnam, Tinh Thua Thien-Hue, Hue, Lang Co  Beach
attractions.address: Lang Co Town， Phu Loc District， Hue
reviews: Lingu Beach is very beautiful, with blue waters and delicate sandy beaches. It is a good place to stroll along the beach. There are many people on the beach, it is very comfortable to blow the sea breeze, and it is also a good place to take pictures, but pay attention to sun protection

A beautiful beach located in central Vietnam, between Hue and Danang. It is about an hour from Da Nang or Hue by car. This beach has clear waters and fine sands and beautiful beaches. It is one of the most beautiful beaches in Vietnam. Those who have time to travel in central Vietnam will definitely be there.

The scenery is beautiful, the sea is crystal clear, and there are many small crabs on the beach. There are not many people. Most of them are local children playing on the beach. The entire beach is very long and can be played for a long time, but the sun is also very sunny.

This is a bay. There is a road bridge at the mouth of the bay. The road from Danang to Hue crosses the bridge and passes through Linggu town. If you want to go to Lingu Bay, don't cross the bridge, turn left and take the trail. Here is a quiet and stable tourist route. There are many oyster farms in Linggu Bay, where you can see the work of local fishermen.

Linggu Beach under Haiyunling is a white sandy beach. The waves roll up white waves and rush in layers. Under the blue sky and white clouds, it is very magnificent. There is a church and a small road by the beach, and the rest are fishermen. The fishing boats parked on the beach are different in style from those in South Vietnam, with pointed ends and colored paintings, which are very tangible and beautiful.

attractions.name: Tomb of Minh Mang
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Vietnam, Tinh Thua Thien-Hue, Hue, Tomb of Minh Mang
attractions.address: | Huong Tho, Hurong Tra, Hue 530000, Vietnam
reviews: One out of the 3 kings tombs in central Vietnam. This ancient tomb is for king Ming Mang. He built the ancient city Huế during his reign.

There are several imperial tombs in Hue. What we visited was the tomb of the last emperor Nguyen Yongrui, the Tomb of Kai Dinh. Construction started in 1920 and completed in 1931.
