It has been meticulously crafted, and it is quite sophisticated. The last emperor studied in France and was deeply impressed by Chinese culture. Therefore, he designed a building that combines Chinese and Western styles, with European-style chandeliers, round floor-to-ceiling windows, floral curtains, blue and white from China, and glass from Japan. Fragmented, spell out a beautiful pattern on the wall. The emperor was thoughtful. No matter how many years have passed since his death, the color of this pattern is still as bright as ever, and his achievements will be remembered by future generations.

Ming Ming Mausoleum is the tomb of the second emperor of the Nguyen Dynasty. It is also the most magnificent tomb in the Hue Imperial Tombs. Tickets are 100,000 dong. . It's still worth taking a look. Although it is not at all comparable to the mausoleum of the emperor of the Great Heavenly Dynasty. The tomb is surrounded by a lake to form an island in the lake. It is said that the bird's-eye view here is the Ming of a Chinese character. Although I did not verify the authenticity.

As the ancient capital of Vietnam, Hue’s ancient buildings have been included in the “World Cultural and Natural Heritage”. Among them, the imperial mausoleum is even more important, because these buildings are relatively intact, unlike the imperial city that was seriously damaged. Can deeply understand the Vietnamese architectural style that combines the characteristics of ancient Chinese architecture. The tombs of the emperors of the New Nguyen Dynasty-including the tombs of 6 emperors, namely, Jialong Mausoleum, Ming Ming Mausoleum, Shaozhi Mausoleum, Tu De Mausoleum, Tongqing Mausoleum and Qiding Mausoleum. Among them, Ming Ming, Tu De and Qi Ding Tomb are must-sees, each with its own characteristics. You can admire the Chinese-style gardens, exquisite interior decoration, and historic temples. Tickets are also very cheap. It is recommended to charter a half-day tour in the local area.

Be sure to charter a car to Hue! Taking the bus in a hurry can't savor the tranquility of Hue. In the new coffee travel agency chartered car, a four-person and seven-seater CMB is about 500 yuan a day. The driver is simple. You will pass the beautiful Haiyun Pass and Linggu Bay. This imperial tomb is actually a big park as a secluded one!

attractions.name: Louvre Museum
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, France, Ile-De-France, Paris, Louvre Museum
reviews: The Louvre or Louvre Museum is the largest art gallery in the world and a historical monument in Paris, France. It is the central landmark of the city, located on the right bank of the Seine in the first district of the city. From prehistory to the 21st century, there are approximately 38,000 objects on display on an area of 72,735 square meters. In 2019, the Louvre received 9.6 million visitors, making it the most visited museum in the world.

that the place where u can see monalisa .. in fact 90% of tourist that go to louvre just to a glance of the famous art piece. Anyway the louvre it self is a historic monument and  world largest art musume . those on buget could just visit the site without entering the musume . one could always purchase ticket online to skip the que .. non peak is about 30min peak can be up to 2 hour qaiting time . prepaid ticket can by purchase via trip.com

Louvre is a very big museums, in total it feels like there are 10 museums in one place! Make sure you plan your route well, as it is so big, to see everything maybe you will need about 3 days! So, I would suggest just research which arts that you would really want to see, so you will save alot of time. Outside the museum is really beautiful too. Don’t forget to visit this attraction if you go to Paris.

I call it the Love~ love love loved it! it’s massive!  The artwork, the sculpture, the paintings,  make sure you give yourself at least one full day minimum, 2 or three would be better.  It did not disappoint!
a great place that will last forever in your memory. countless ancient paintings and sculptures. so many diffetent sections from other parts of the world. followed by an outdoor big relaxing garden.

attractions.name: Eiffel Tower
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, France, Ile-De-France, Paris, Eiffel Tower
attractions.address: Champ de Mars, 5 Avenue Anatole France, 75007 Paris
reviews: The icon of Paris! Make sure you see the tower when you come to Paris. It is really magnificent, the height, the details. Also, make sure you see it at night time as well, when the lights up. IT IS EXTREMELY BEAUTIFUL. If you wait until midnight, there will be lights twinkling right at 00.00. The best view point is high up across the river. There will be some musicisans playing at nights too there, making it more romantic.
absolutely beautiful. even.at night.  great view of Paris.  wait in line wasn't that long. around 30 min. a large group goes up together each time

Eiffel Tower!!! Everyone who goes to Paris, France absolutely go to see it!!! Who wouldn’t??!!!! Lol It looked beautiful and exactly same in Pictures i have seen on web so far!!! Omg so adoable, pretty, highly desighnated... never get tired of seeing it...  I am very very glad to finally see it in person and take bunch of photos with! hahaha Just amazing i can tell you xxx
coming to Paris to see the eiffel tower is a dream come true.  i had chills and almost bursted into tears upon seeing it. it was surreal. it is beautiful. incomparable.
One of the best location to watch Eiffel Tower at evening is Champ de Mars. Highly recommend you to have a mini picnic in there with your family or friends and watch the stunning Eiffel Tower!

attractions.name: Palace of Versailles
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, France, Ile-De-France, Dampierres-en-Yvelines, Versailles, Palace of Versailles
reviews: Magnificent Palace. People say it would be hard to impress people with another palace after you visit Palaca of Versailles, which I think its true. It is huge and beautiful. Inside, you can see the decoration of the palace where the King used to live and his family. Outside, there is a HUGE and BEAUTIFUL garden which also has many fountains and a big lake. On some of the days, there will be a musical fountains show, though it costs extra money, but it is definetely worth to see. You will feel like youre actually inside a movie like Troy or Game of Thrones!
So luxury place

The Chateau de Versailles, which was the principal royal residence of France since 1682, was at the beginning of the French Revolution in 1789. It is about 20 kilometers southwest of central Paris. The Versailles Gardens, which cover about 800 hectares, are located on the west side of the Palace, and are mostly arranged in the classic French style of formal gardens.

The Palace of Versailles is a splendid palace! It is the main residence of King Louis XIV to XVI of France. With the efforts of generations of architects, sculptors, decorators and landscapers, the palace and its gardens have influenced many other large gardens in Europe, becoming the ultimate model of taste and style, and the interior is extremely luxurious! Especially the Mirror Hall, it was absolutely brilliant in the time!

The first stop in Paris is here, the various tour buses at the door, it seems that this is the place to go to Paris, the golden gates at the door are very expensive, there is a style to enter the palace, and after entering the inside, the various exhibition halls opened my eyes, very worth visiting.

attractions.name: Arc de Triomphe de l’Etoile
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, France, Ile-De-France, Paris, Arc de Triomphe de l’Etoile
reviews: nice place to go in paris. very pretty sights among the heritage buildings

You have to go here if you come to Paris! This is where some of the streets meet in Paris. Make sure you go up where you can see the Eiffel Tower from there, and also many streets where the Arc will be right in the middle. Be ready to take the steps up, as there is no elevator. In between the sections, there will be a galleries where it shows the history of the Arc, and some stories too.

Arc de Triomphe one of the most famous monuments in paris . is located at the end of the famous street champs elysees. for metro pls get of at charles de gaulle etoile . once you exit you will be able to see the arc to get over the arc use the underpass . below the arc there is thetomb of the unknow soldier and there is the first eternal flame . do note that the monument only can accept a certain no of vistor and it cost euro 12 , didnt went up as i dont think is worth it . but there is a discount for teacher , and young ppl 18-25just need some id to prove it open to foreign too
such a magnificent structure the detail is uncanny. a must see landmark while in Paris. many ways to get there.
I was amazed and in awe of the beautifulul detail crafted into the Arc de Triomphe! I stood under the Arc in awe of its beauty! Even the trees leading up to the were beautifully crafted!

attractions.name: Disneyland Paris
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, France, Ile-De-France, Paris, Disneyland Paris
reviews: Fantastic stay. Worth every penny. Unforgettable family holiday
Séjour vraiment magnifique, lieu magique pour les enfants, possibilités de trouver une navette qui vous conduit jusqu'au Parc Disneyland. A visiter
that was a wonderful experience! super easy to book the ticket and get in! thank you for such easy process! Dont forget to print out the barcode! i liked this trip a lot!
It was truly amazing, a smooth experience with Trip. Com was again. My friend and I were very happy. She had a blast on her birthday. Until next time Disneyland ❣️
everyone love this place. children are the most exciting on disney characters. our memories remains at disney paris.

attractions.name: Basilica of the Sacred Heart of Paris
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, France, Ile-De-France, Paris, Basilica of the Sacred Heart of Paris
attractions.open_status: The main hall of the church opening time is 6:00-22:30; the dome opening time is  May-September 8:30-20:00, October-April 9:00-17:00. Opening hours may be adjusted due to weather conditions.
reviews: This is my favourite place in Paris. It’s quite a climb, yet there are some great restaurants at the top. It is a tourist trap at weekends so probably best to avoid then. In the week it’s busy but easy to find somewhere to eat without booking. The views of Paris are spectacular and the cathedral itself is very impressive. Great place to soak in the atmosphere.

A very beatiful chruch that was located up on the hill. To get there, you can take Metro and then you can walk up, which is alot of steps, or you can also take the funicular ride up for only 2 euro. Once you are up, you can also go inside the church, which was so beautiful. I went inside when there was a mass, so alot of people joined it. If you want, you can also hike to the dome, where you will get an amazing view of Paris as well as the Eiffel tower

Sacré-Cœur is a small Roman Catholic cathedral in Paris, France. The cathedral is the most popular landmark in Paris. It is located on the peak of Montmartre Butte, the highest point in Paris. The Basilica of the Sacred Heart is first of all a religious building and is also regarded as a political and cultural monument. The construction of the cathedral began in 1875 and was completed in 1914.
One of the best views from Paris, go early to avoid to much tourists in the area
Always popular and always amazing. The trick is to get the timing so you don't miss the last entrance for the top of the dome, but still get to see one of the best sunsets in Paris.

attractions.name: Black Rock Beach and Nikao Social Centre
Te Ara- Cook Islands Museum of Cultural Enterprise
Margaret River
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, Australia, Western Australia, Shire of Augusta-Margaret River, Margaret River, Margaret River
reviews: ok👍👍👍
very nice place 👍

The coastal area of Margret river is a famous surfing destination in Australia. Because it is only more than 300 kilometers away from Perth, the capital of Western Australia, it has attracted many local and nearby surfers. Several international surfing events are held here every year. There are surfing spots of various difficulties and levels, such as Surfer's point, Conto, Redgate, etc. In addition to surfers, there are many families who come to Margret river. They form a group to experience the fun of camping in the wild and experience the excitement of cave exploration. Coupled with the opportunity to get close to kangaroos near Eagle's bay and Meelup beach, this is also a good place for parent-child fun.

Had a great experience of how the wine are harvest. It is an awesome experience with actual wine being grown here. In under fifty years, Margaret River has built an international reputation as a home of fine wine in Australia.  It is a region that is more than capable of producing wines to match the world's best, offering powerful, yet elegant, Cabernet Sauvignon, Chardonnay and Semillon/Sauvignon Blanc blends.

attractions.name: Mammoth Cave
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, Australia, Western Australia, Shire of Augusta-Margaret River, Margaret River, Mammoth Cave
attractions.address: Caves Road, Forest Grove, WA, 6285, Australia
reviews: Visited here a few times. Definitely worth going!

Stopped by when I was playing in the Margaret River area. There are several caves here, we chose the larger mammoth cave. The inside of the cave is very cool, and there are staff members who will explain it. When we went there were few people, it was basically a private room. There is a stone in the hole with a special color and shape, like a red shawl.

There are actually several caves in this area. It will be cheaper if you buy a package, but we have limited time and can only visit one. The time to go to Mammoth Cave is relatively early, so there are basically no other people. The special thing in the cave is a red stone, like a shawl, which is very interesting.

attractions.name: Busselton Jetty
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, Australia, Western Australia, City of Busselton, Busselton, Busselton Jetty
reviews:
Clock in the prototype of the Spirited Away Sea Train
Busselton Trestle, the longest maritime trestle in the southern hemisphere, would probably not be well known to the Chinese people without the romantic travel of his wife. It lies so quietly in the deep part of the Indian Ocean, watching every morning and sunset of this blue planet....The function of the old Japan has long been faded, and the trestle bridge has become a net red place. The small train slowly heading towards the depths of the ocean is known as the inspiration prototype of Spirited Away. It is no longer the truck that transported materials back then. It has become a cartoon-shaped, bright-colored, and concave-shaped prop for tourists from all over the world.
Sitting in the semi-open carriage of the small train, walking slowly along the pure white trestle bridge, the railings on both sides are infinitely laid out and seem to be retreating... At this moment, the warm sea breeze of the Indian Ocean on his face, my thoughts are light I can dance and spin, and imagine that whatever it is, it’s okay.. All the drunken things that flash into my mind unconsciously, all the people who inadvertently jump in their minds, all about the sun, the sea, the sky, The cognition of wings, dreams and voyages.. Putting those wild pixels into the scene before us, and then flavoring a dose of anticipation and excitement for the unknown distance, perhaps there is also a hint of anxious pleasure.. …In this way, you can complete a lonely and magical cleansing with the exhausted self in this world, filtering out the dirt and dross, compassion and self-pity, and shielding the eyes of the second person. No matter disdain or praise, you only need to take care of yourself .. is this wonderful place to give back to me the most nutritious time..

Busselton Trestle Bridge is located in the western part of Australia. The scenery is very beautiful. Standing on the trestle bridge and enjoying the magnificent sea, I feel very good! There is also the underwater world to enjoy, and the marine life in the southern hemisphere is also very cute! Have the opportunity to appreciate it again!

This is a classic attraction in Western Australia, Australia. The long trestle bridge extends into the sea. If you don't want to walk with a small train, the water on both sides is crystal clear. There is a restaurant in Qiaotou, the seafood feast there is really good
【view】
【taste】
[Price ratio]

The interpretation of Busselton Trestle is a trestle that goes deep into the sea. The trestle extends to the sea. Above the trestle, there is a small sea train. The little red train was driving on the trestle bridge, and the sea breeze passed by. Sometimes the waves hit, and it feels really magical, and it feels very different.

Summer in Australia is a sunny day. The retro and cute train, with the blue sky and white clouds and the endless sea, and the cute grandpa, this picture makes people feel good and comfortable. It is recommended that if you want to take photos with the train, you must first confirm the departure and return time of the train.

attractions.name: Cape Leeuwin
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, Australia, Western Australia, Shire of Augusta-Margaret River, Leeuwin, Cape Leeuwin
reviews: Cape Ruin is a very magnificent promontory near Perth, where a white lighthouse stands on the cliff. He is like a guide directing the ships coming and going. The cape is condescending, it is an excellent place to watch the sea view, it is very open and comfortable.

Cape Rue is a famous cape in the world. It is located on the southwest coast of Australia. It is where the Southern Ocean and the Indian Ocean meet. The scenery here is really magnificent. The seas of the two suns meet here, forming different colors and levels. The feeling is very clear. There is also the tallest lighthouse in Australia, standing on the westernmost side of Australia, it is so beautiful and sacred.

Cape Leuwin (CAPE LEEUWIN)-Australia's most southwestern cape, the intersection of the South Pacific and the Indian Ocean, is a cape where you can see the magnificent intersection of two oceans except the Cape of Good Hope. The white lighthouse stands under the blue sky and is very eye-catching; the small house where the lighthouse staff worked and rested in the past is still preserved, and now it has become a small history museum with introduction. At the confluence of the two oceans, the sea is bluish, showing a different blue under the sun.

Cape Rue is the place that Perth must visit, because the geographical significance here is so important, because the left side here is the Atlantic Ocean, and the right side is the Indian Ocean. This cape is sandwiched between the two oceans. Really It is magnificent.

In the morning, I had another exquisite English breakfast. The weather today is very good. It seems that the wait yesterday is quite worthwhile. We continue to set off to see Cape Leeuwin. I suggest that friends traveling to Western Australia, set aside a little more time and try to get a good weather to see the sea. Cape Leeuwin, the lighthouse at the intersection of the Pacific and Indian Oceans, is also the tallest lighthouse on land in Australia and is very majestic.

attractions.name: Sabeto Hot Springs and Mud Pool
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, Fiji, Western Division, Nadi, Sabeto Hot Springs and Mud Pool
reviews: Untie the clothes, soak yourself in the mud, and wait 30 minutes to dry. There are three hot springs to soak afterwards. The first one is mud. If you are clumsy, getting in and out is a bit difficult. The second is hard ground, and again, if you are clumsy, you will encounter problems again. A great place to rest, no wind. You can get a massage later, which is very cheap.

The reputation of Sabeto Mud Hot Springs comes from the fact that the spring water of an active volcano is sulfided and mixed with mud. The open-air hot spring mud pool is good for health. You can spread the mud all over your body like cake cream in the pool, and then go to the hot spring pool to wash it off. You can also help your companions to smear or fight an unforgettable mud water battle. It will be more fun to come to Sabeto Mud Hot Springs together.
这里的温泉能解除你一天的疲劳，斐济泥浆温泉很棒
It’s a good deal to go to the mud bath. It costs more than 70 RMB per person. It’s still a Mercedes-Benz pick-up. There are mud baths, hot springs, and various swimming pools.
The unique mud bath, the price here is so cheap that you can't imagine, it may be cheaper than Vietnam. Not only is it distinctive, but the skin really looks smooth and white.

attractions.name: Fiji Airways Premier Lounge
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, Fiji, Western Division, Nadi, Fiji Airways Premier Lounge
attractions.address: Airside, Ground Floor, Nadi International Airport Departures Terminal, Nadi, Viti Levu, Fiji

attractions.name: Port Denarau Marina
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, Fiji, Western Division, Nadi, Port Denarau Marina
attractions.address: Port Denarau, Denarau Island, Viti Levu 679
reviews: The place and facilities are amazing with all the services you need
Awsome

This is really a beautiful place with lovely marinas and restaurants / shops as well as Hard Rock Cafes and bars. It is also a gathering place for holidaymakers visiting Denalo. My husband and I live on the Coral Coast and we felt that the resort could have been better. This pier has countless boats going to the surrounding islands. It was nice to be here for a visit.

The best place to start a cruise and snorkel trip here! It was also a great place to have lunch or dinner. The shopping was also very nice and there was everything you could possibly need, such as souvenirs, groceries and clothing. There is also a cultural show at night, the band in the open air restaurant, which is full of energy and excitement!

At the pier here, you can take a cruise to go fishing in the sea. It is a good experience, and the cost is not particularly high. The blue sky and white clouds are really good. The cruise ship here is also equipped with complete facilities and abundant supplies.

attractions.name: Captain Cook Cruises Fiji
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, Fiji, Western Division, Nadi, Captain Cook Cruises Fiji
reviews: Captain Cook's heart-shaped island day trip is interesting and fun. It takes 50 minutes to reach the heart-shaped island by sailing. During the sailing process, the crew is warm and thoughtful, singing and dancing to interact with tourists, not boring at all, the crew will also make cava Entertain tourists. The heart-shaped island is very beautiful, the water is clear, and there are small sharks swimming leisurely on the shore. They are very docile and play with tourists. After getting on the island, take a glass boat to see the underwater creatures and beautiful scenery, and then take tourists to snorkel and dive. Lunch is delicious and rich, and drinks are free.
In MV 2000, you can listen to live bands sing passionately, dance with friends from all over the world when it rises, and spend an unforgettable sleepless night at sea.

This sunset cruise is really recommended. First, after boarding the ship, I don’t think there are too many people. There are only about 20 people in total. You can sit on the outdoor deck and sail out of the port. The captain will take everyone to find the most beautiful sunset. Among the wines, there is a non-alcoholic Virgin pina colada which is my favorite. Dinner is half a lobster per person after watching the sunset. The rest is in the form of a buffet. Fish and various seafood. The overall taste is good. Finally, there is dessert What impressed me the most was that when I returned to the voyage after the meal, all the crew members taught everyone to dance, cheerful music and passionate dance steps. At that moment I really fell in love with Fiji.

During the 7-hour cruise of the Pacific Islands, enjoy our cuisine prepared with local and imported food. Buffet lunch, morning tea and afternoon tea, other drinks are provided by the bar on board at your own expense.
This is quite good, I have the opportunity to come to Fiji, I still like to participate in tourism projects here

attractions.name: Sri Siva Subramaniya Swami Temple
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, Fiji, Western Division, Nadi, Sri Siva Subramaniya Swami Temple
reviews: The southern Hemispheres largest Hindu Temple in reality its small, takes less than 15 minutes to be done. 5 dollars entry, also gas a dress code.

We heard a lot about the temple and decided to visit it one afternoon. We did everything wrong. . . Put the shoes in the wrong place and went in without paying 5 Fiji yuan per person. Taking pictures in the temple, even if we weren't 'clean', we went inside (my wife and daughter could later go in because they were vegetarians and there was a shower earlier in the day). We didn't understand the language of ghosts (numberless ghosts). I don't think this is for me, but it might be more interesting for other tourists.

We took a small tour. It is a gorgeously decorated Indian temple and well worth the trip. You can easily spend 30 minutes walking and enjoying it here, but there is no signage or introduction. You need to wear clothes that cover your shoulders and knees to get in, and don't take pictures in the temple.

It is said that this is the largest Hindu temple in the South Pacific. I don't think there is much to say. There are not a few small countries in the South Pacific. The buildings here are very beautiful and colorful.
Although this temple dedicated to Shiva is small, the building is small and exquisite, and it seems that it is still being decorated. This place is like a small park, but there are not many people.

attractions.name: Garden of the Sleeping Giant
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, Fiji, Veti Levu, Garden of the Sleeping Giant
attractions.address: Wailoko Rd, Nadi, Viti Levu, Fiji
reviews: Walking around the gardens was pleasant, beautiful, well maintained and a nice jungle walk. I also took some great pictures of beautiful flowers and lovely cats. Beautiful gardens to see don't miss the viewing platform! However it takes 18 Fiji yuan and is simply a plunder for tourists. I would go again but not satisfied with the price.

My husband and I came to this garden this afternoon as one of the stops on the tour. We spent 45 minutes watching orchids and walking around the gardens. We could have easily spent over an hour but we speeded up the tour due to limited tour time. We were impressed with the variety of orchids, almost all of them were in bloom. The walk through the orchids was flat and laid back for all ages and in good health. The garden trail has many steps and it can be difficult to walk up. The weather was a bit overcast and particularly comfortable. We did not feel bugs when we visited here. Several glasses of ice juice were provided as we walked out which was a refreshing way to end our trip. Considering the only few dollars for the tickets, I felt great for anyone who wants to see orchids.

Visiting the sleeping garden of the giant is very interesting, not far from Nadi city, you can join Rosie’s tour group, including other activities. The orchard that grows there is spectacular, with many varieties. The hike is not difficult, the road is easy to walk, and there are restaurants where you can sit down and have a drink and rest. The tour guide is very friendly and will be happy to answer your questions. Actor Burr Ives was the host here many years ago.

This is indeed a garden, because of the climate here, every place here is full of flowers, like a very beautiful botanical garden. It really doesn't have to be deliberately modified, it is just a nature.

This place shouldn’t be called the Sleeping Giant. It’s far more beautiful and beautiful than the word “giant” gives. It is a very gentle and quiet large garden full of various flowers, which is very beautiful.

attractions.name: Treasure Island
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, Fiji, Mamanuca Islands, Treasure Island
reviews: Treasure Island is the favorite holiday destination for holidaymakers in Fiji. It is a huge marine reserve, so there are not many tourists who entertain every day. However, the facilities on the island are very complete. The seabed here is very low and the water is clear. It's almost transparent. You don’t need heavy professional diving equipment, just bring your diving goggles and snorkel to enjoy the wonderful world under the sea. The island is small and exquisite, and the room decoration is simple and bright.

There is no gold or silver here. There is only a very beautiful natural beauty. It is recommended that everyone can live in the wooden house on the water. The feeling is still great, especially at night, you can see the sky full of stars at the door of your room .

This island is the kind with fewer people, and the resorts built here are also very beautiful in my opinion. They are large in scale and slightly more expensive, but they can enjoy good service and food, which is not bad.
The beach here is very good, large in size, and very clean. If it is early in the morning, there are actually no people. However, since there is a resort here, there are more people since noon.

This is where we live, so we are familiar with this small island. This place is a little farther away, but at the same time it will be quieter and the environment will be better. The main reason to come here is to stay away from the large number of tourists.

attractions.name: Presidential Palace of Nanjing
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Jiangsu, Nanjing, Presidential Palace of Nanjing
attractions.open_status: Open on Tue-Sun,8:30am-5:00pm;Closed on Mon;Open from 8:30am-5:00pm during Chinese public holidays
attractions.address: No. 292, Changjiang Road, Xuanwu District, Nanjing
reviews: ok bro know the old history of country but no need to be top1 place as per trip site
Beautiful! Take metro line 2/3 to Daxinggong and walk a couple of minutes to the ticket office, It’s very easy to navigate and should be top of your list of places to visit in the city!
Great history lesson. its a good place to start the day if you are staying near the 1912 district. i thiught the fee was high, but it costs money to maintain this as well as they do.
Interesting, green and worth a visit even on a crowdy day. I was there during Mid Autumn festival and it was not super crowded
this is the shot point worth to visit , location is good which is so near the metro

attractions.name: Sun Yatsen Mausoleum
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Jiangsu, Nanjing, Sun Yatsen Mausoleum
attractions.address: No. 7 Shixiang Road, Xuanwu District, Nanjing
reviews: Very scenic view.
Dr. Sun Yat-sen's Mausoleum is situated at the foot of the second peak of Purple Mountain in Nanjing, China.It is closed at 05pm daily for visit.
Sun Yat-sen Mausoleum, designed in the shape of an alarm bell, is the mausoleum for Dr. Sun Yat-sen, the “Father of Modern China".

Impressive Mausoleum to the Father of the Chinese Republic on the outskirts of Nanjing. about 20 minutes taxi ride from downtown. wear some comfortable shoes, you will need them for the long walk up to the top
we bought tickets with student discount which cost 50 yuan and we have access to all places around, spend 2 hours for the Mausoleum

attractions.name: Hongshan Forest Zoo
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Jiangsu, Nanjing, Hongshan Forest Zoo
attractions.address: No.168 Heyan Road, Xuanwu District, Nanjing
reviews: Nanjing Hongshan Forest Zoo is a 171 acres zoological park which was established in 1998. The park is operate from 07:30 am - 06:00 pm.

Hongshan Forest Zoo is a zoological park in Nanjing, the capital city of Jiangsu province, China.Located on 168 Heyan Road in the northern section of Nanjing city, it is a 171 acres (69 ha) park and forest with 280 kinds of animals.
There are not many animals to see, we couldn’t see the tigers and so on. But it’s a great place nonetheless, you can have a good time!

there are a lot of wild animals to see although some were not available to be seen on the day we went. The elephants don’t look well fed. there’s a shuttle bus you can take to the top of where most animals are but no returning shuttles so there’s lots of walking. I’d advise going in the morning because it can get very packed.

Hongshan Zoo deserves the world-class zoo design concept and the title of the most respectable zoo in China. It shows the original ecosystem of animals as much as possible, and has a better balance between the nature of the animals and the nature of the animals. The place is recommended as a landmark in Nanjing. Ps: At present, the cat pavilion, the bear pavilion and the African animal area are being remodeled, losing some of the ornamental properties, and looking forward to the next time the Red Mountain is full and then step on again.

attractions.name: Ming Xiaoling Mausoleum
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Jiangsu, Nanjing, Ming Xiaoling Mausoleum
attractions.address: No. 7 Shixiang Road, Xuanwu District, Nanjing
reviews: Great place for a walk. It may take all day to see all the places of interest on the mountain so it is wise to go in the morning and wear comfortably.
The Ming Xiaoling is the mausoleum of the Hongwu Emperor, the founder of the Ming dynasty. It lies at the southern foot of Purple Mountain.It is also opened as early of 0630am to 0500pm daily.
Love this place
Ming Xiaoling Mausoleum is the largest imperial tomb in Nanjing City and is also one of the largest imperial ones in China.
Beautiful area very nice

attractions.name: Confucius Temple
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Jiangsu, Nanjing, Confucius Temple
attractions.address: Qinhuai River Scenic Area, Qinhuai District, Nanjing
reviews: Fuzi Miao is perhaps at its best around night time when multi-sized and multi-colored lanterns were lit up. You can also enjoy roaming around the area and check out some shops or experience some Nanjing delicacies.
very nice  place to visit and wonderful experience 👏👏

Nanjing Fuzimiao or known as  'Confucian Temple' is a Confucius Temple and former site of imperial examination hall located in southern Nanjing City on banks of the Qinhuai River.It is now a popular tourist attraction with pedestrian shopping streets.

What a lovely experience. So many shops ,lovely traditional dishes and the Temple was an amazing experience. Its big so you have to go early morning to enjoy the day and just live the memories of this beautiful place.
Confucius Temple in Nanjing was originally constructed in the year of 1034 in the Song Dynasty.

attractions.name: Niushou Mountain Cultural Tourism Zone
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Jiangsu, Nanjing, Niushou Mountain Cultural Tourism Zone
attractions.address: No. 18 Ningdan Avenue, Jiangning District, Nanjing
reviews: Wow.. it’s amazing.. beautiful place to visit and can enjoy the place morning to evening.
Absolutely beautiful
Place definitely worth a trip. It takes about 3 hours just to see the main part but in a nice weather it would be nice to spend all day enjoying the walk on the mountain.
Beautiful area very nice must visit
Niushou Mountain comes with a magnificent feat by mankind, everything from the hall on top to the underground rooms engulfed in golden figurines and just the grandiose display is extraordinary.

attractions.name: Nanjing Underwater World
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Jiangsu, Nanjing, Nanjing Underwater World
attractions.address: No. 8, Sifang City, Xuanwu District, Nanjing
reviews: Nanjing Underwater World is an aquarium near the Sun Yat-sen Mausoleum in Nanjing.Underwater World is on the south side of Purple Mountain within walking distance of the Ming Xiaoling Mausoleum.
The dolphin performance of Nanjing Underwater World is the leading marine animal performance in east China.
Visited  Nanjing Underwater World with my family... It was a great and fun day, seeing different animals and it was really fun show watching the dolphins and the sea lion dancing 😂🤣🤩😍
Fantastic place to visit during the holidays. The dolphin performance was entertaining. Always wanted to see a polar bear and I did. I will definitely visit Nanjing again just to go there once more.

I had such an great time there felt bad for some of the animals would have liked to be able to take a photo of the dolphins properly because I have never seem one them so close before and it was a life long dream. Had such an amazing experience. The shows are great and so much fun.

attractions.name: Zhongshan Mountain Mational Park
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Jiangsu, Nanjing, Zhongshan Mountain Mational Park
attractions.address: No. 7 Shixiang Road, Xuanwu District, Nanjing
reviews: Beautiful area specially in spring

Zhongshan Mountain National Park, located in Nanjing’s Xuanwu district, was among the first batch of 5A scenic areas in China.The national park includes several prestigious tourist attractions, such as Sun Yat-sen Mausoleum, Meiling Palace, Music Stage, Ming Tomb and Linggu scenic area.
The city has a long history. Nanjing is listed as one of the Four Great Ancient Capitals of China (along with Beijing, and Zhonshan).
nature livers delight & full of traditional chinese monuments. Easy, green, peaceful place to be, when you want yourself to embrace nature.

definitely would recommend this place. Buy the 100rmb ticket at the gate. But again plan before the time or atleast have two days free... I thoroughly enjoyed the Meiling Tomb- one big beautiful garden with various statues.. Its really big so should take you about 1-2hours even longer depending on how often you stop and take in the views. Walking to the San YatSun mausoleum from here is about 1-1.5km so no need to take a shuttle.  But again the park is great and there are  a lot of trees that are nice and cool with many pathways so even if you just want to go walk around you can. Some sights do not require a ticket even. But this is a MUST visit when in Nanjing.

attractions.name: Grand Baoen Temple Heritage and Scenic Area
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Jiangsu, Nanjing, Grand Baoen Temple Heritage and Scenic Area
attractions.address: No. 1 Yuhua Road, Qinhuai District, Nanjing
reviews: it’s very nice 👍 can enjoy wow what a porcelain tower. Beautiful maintenance 👍
Grand Baoen Temple or known as Da Bao'en Temple , and Porcelain Tower of Nanjing built on a huge site covering 40 football fields, took 100,000 artisans 17 years to build.
During the reign of Emperor Yongle of the Ming Dynasty a most grand and extraordinary building was created in Nanjing. How amazing right. I can't believe it either.

The origin of the poem "Four Eighty Temples" in the Southern Dynasty is the Grand Patrimony Temple. Located outside the Chinese Gate of Qinhuai District, Nanjing, the Grand Bao'en Temple is the oldest Buddhist temple in Chinese history. Its predecessor is the Jianchu Temple and the Ashoka Pagoda built during the Chiwu era in the Soochow era. It is the second temple in China after the Baima Temple in Luoyang. It is the first Buddhist temple built in southern China. It is called kinryo Sandai Ji Temple along with reigu Ji Temple and tenkai Ji Temple in China, and 100 Ji Temple is under the jurisdiction.

Located outside the Chinese gate of Qinhuai District, Nanjing, the Dabao En Temple Site Park is the highest in China's specifications, the largest in scale and the most intact temple site. The protective displays in the Site Park show the millennium di palace and precious gallery in the Dabao En Temple site, as well as the stone letters excavated from the di palace. Tiehan, shichiho asao tower, gold cherry blossoms and silver cherry blossoms are world-class national treasures.

attractions.name: Xuanwu Lake
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Jiangsu, Nanjing, Xuanwu Lake
attractions.open_status: The lake road open all day, Wuzhou summer 5:00-22:00; winter 5:00-21:00
attractions.address: No. 1 Xuanwu Lane, Xuanwu District, Nanjing
reviews: Very nice
Beautiful area , nice to spend a whole day

Xuanwu Lake is located in Xuanwu District in the central-northeast part of Nanjing, Jiangsu.It is near the Nanjing Railway Station and Ji Ming Temple. Five islands within the lake are interconnected by arched bridges.

Beautiful area for an afternoon walk. many trees, gardens and open grassy fields. kids can run and play freely. also many quiet spots to sit and relax, smell the fresh scented air, and take in the scenery
472 hectares Xuanwu Lake Park was the largest Imperial lake garden in China's history.It is also the largest downtown park in the south City of Nanjing

attractions.name: Sagrada Familia
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Spain, Catalonia, Barcelona Province, Barcelona, Sagrada Familia
reviews: Sagrada Familia was massive, aglessive and big! It seems to have long histories in there:) i was very imressed and glad to finally see in person! sad that it was undergoing atm... but you should go there when you visit to Barcelona one day xx

Sagrada Familia is absolutely amazing. When you walked out of the subway for the first time and turned your head to look at it, it definitely took my breath away. The details and its size are incredible. I bought the ticket in advance and was able to walk around before my trip. I highly recommend taking this tour because there is a lot of information and history about this church. People say that the best time to visit the Sagrada Familia is during sunset... they are right.

This was one of the most amazing constructions in Barcelona. It lives up to everything you imagine. Eventhough it was under reconstrution, you could still see the greatness of it all. It was by far my favorite. It is humongous and just looking at every detail leaves you in awe. The ticket was a bit expensive so I couldn’t go in but I bet it was more surprising from the inside.
incredible landmark! you cannot miss it when traveling to Barcelona!
this place is just incredible, in the middle of the city of barcelona very easy to arrive by subway.

attractions.name: Casa Mila
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Spain, Catalonia, Barcelona Province, Barcelona, Casa Mila
reviews: Very elegant building. Like I've never seen before. I didn't go inside but I would recommend a visit.
Really cool architecture. One of Gaudi’s masterpieces. You have to at least pass by and look at it!
Ge-wel-dig. Neem de tijd, zeer indrukwekkend. Voor architecten een absolute aanrader

It is more popularly known as La Pedrera and is one of the best works of Gaudi.  Amazing architectural masterpiece.  The rooftop will simply blow you away.  And the view from the top is great.  This is not to be missed.

I regret that we didn't take a tour inside. We chose to go Parc Güell instead, but a repeat visit I will definitely go inside too see more of Gaudi's work. It's cool to to check out the exterior of the building too for a free sneak peek.

attractions.name: Casa Batlló
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Spain, Catalonia, Barcelona Province, Barcelona, Casa Batlló
reviews: increible! una obra maestra de arquitectura, muy impactante para epoca en lanque fue construida t diseñada por el gran Dali.
Amazing from the outside! Beautifully unique building with organic surfaces that capture the eye.
Very beautiful architecture by gaudi. Would highly recommend a visit. If you don't want to pay to get in the outside is just as magnificent.
Con’t discover Casa Batlló inside-immerse into Gaudí freest imagination with 3D video is absolutely a big surprise about house of bones, oceans n more....
Another great Gaudí piece. People gather outside and just marvel at the façade. It looks like it’s taken out of a storybook.

attractions.name: Park Guell
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Spain, Catalonia, Barcelona Province, Barcelona, Park Guell
reviews: It was such an incredible and fascinating sites to see and experience ..The art .the senery and essence of being part of these arts work is surreal .

Nice to see. We bought tickets online in advance. It is definitely recommended. You don't have to wait for a few hours, you definitely know you have a ticket. The moment we arrived, we were able to walk directly. However, if there is no paid part, you can see a lot. In the paid part, it is very busy, so you always have to pay attention that you can only get the best things with other tourists in the photos

I was dissapointed after walking all the way up there and finding out that you had to buy a ticket to get into a park! I get it that you have to pay to get into Gaudi’s house and stuff but a park?! plus, there were no tickets left. I recommend you buying your tickets in advanved if you want to get in. however views from the city were great! You can walk around the park but not get into the actual park, where all the cool sculptures are without a ticket.
Amazing place to spend the day. Whether you're admiring the architecture, gardens, or the environment, you are bound to have a great time here.

Gorgeous and large sprawling park built onto steep hills a bit away from the old city center. The entire park has lots of accents by Gaudi, but if you want to get into the museum and the highly ornate part of the park, it's only to paying customers, and even with multiple gates, there's always a line. Probably better go earlier in the day. Even without going inside the museum, the park is lovely and has pretty good hiking opportunities. Bring a snack, not a whole lot to eat in the immediate area.

attractions.name: Camp Nou
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Spain, Catalonia, Barcelona Province, Barcelona, Camp Nou
attractions.open_status: Sun 10:00 AM - 2:30 PM, Mon - Sat 10:00 AM - 6:30 PM
reviews: Without doubt this the greatest football stadium in the world. Having just been on the tour I was absolutely taken away by sheer enormity of the stadium. From the outside it looks no bigger than a 40,000 seater stadium but when you get inside you are taken away by the almost 100,000 seater stadium that awaits you. I cannot wait to come back and watch a La Liga match. The tour itself is superb giving you access to the museum to the press areas and then to all 3 levels of the stadium.

Took my son here when we visited. I didn't think I would have enjoyed it, but to be fair I had a great time. So much to see and get around. Staff were helpful and lots of photo ops. Worth a visit, even for people not that into football.

The nou camp is Barcelona at home, the stadium is quite new. After a game in Spain is really hits the spot. Buy tickets is not nervous, can go to the site, but in advance can ensure better position, in the centre of the city to buy a lot of places, suggest to buy more than 80 European area, high cost performance. Before you buy price comparison website, to prevent pit. Traffic, to subway line L3 in Les Corts station, or in Collbanc L5 line subway station to get off, but after the break is very crowded. The official souvenir shop in camp nou, need to check-in after entering to find. The door and around there are a lot of souvenir shop, but the price is not cheap even more expensive than the official store. After approach can take mineral water comes into play, but need to get rid of bottle caps.
Close range to experience one of greatest football club.
Another must see for football fans. Very good and informative tour. Possibly the only football ground in the world containing a Salvador Dali designed chapel.

attractions.name: Picasso Museum
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Spain, Catalonia, Barcelona Province, Barcelona, Picasso Museum
attractions.open_status: Tuesday-Sunday 11:00-21:00, closed on Monday(Including public holiday Mondays). The opening time of the ticket office finishes 30 minutes before the closing time of the Museum. Closed on 1st January, 1st May, 24th June and 25th December. Reduced opening hours: 5th January(From 9am to 5pm)  24th and 31st December (From 9am to 2pm).
reviews: This is my favorite museum in all of Barcelona. Before you go make sure to check the hours as I tried one day when it was closed. The paintings are beautiful and breathtaking leaving you wondering how Picasso created each piece so uniquely.
So interesting and well put together. I spent several hours in here admiring and learning about Picasso and his work. If art appeals to you I would highly recommend!
Wonderful collection of Picasso's earlier work.  Definitely worth the admission, it's free once a week but you can also buy an articket and it grants you admission to this and 5 other museums.
Pass by Picasso museum, here to collect Picasso works as a teenager, worth a look. But a lot of people waiting in line, we waited in line for a long time, and will be qualified to enter time.
If you are a student and show your ID, entrance is free! Take the opportunity to look at all of his work. Even the 7-10€ charge is worth it.

attractions.name: Barceloneta Beach
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Spain, Catalonia, Barcelona Province, Barcelona, Barceloneta Beach
reviews: Gorgeous. Along the beach there are many restaurants and stores. You can hang around for hours.

Near the beach is very beautiful, some snacks are really tasty, Barcelona because it is harbour, rich food flavors, is where we eat the most delicious in Europe. The beach &singing band, beautiful scenery and music was happy mood.
I like the beach even though we came here in a windy winter. Many boys and girls are exercising in the outside. With the sea and the sunshine the city feels very active.
For city beach is Barceloneta more then good. Is clean the water is clean and you have a many beach volleyball courts where you can entrain yourself with couple of friends.
Just 20 minutes bus away. Take bus D20 from Parallel and enjoy the beach

attractions.name: Barcelona Cathedral
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Spain, Catalonia, Barcelona Province, Barcelona, Barcelona Cathedral
attractions.address: Pla de la Seu, s/n, 08002 Barcelona
reviews: Another amazing architectural feat of Barcelona. The place is magnificent and the art inside is out of this world.
Free after 5pm. And there are events throughout the year right in front of the cathedral, including a reoccurring antiques market, a Christmas market, and market-type events of all sorts.
First time I got a clear pic of the cathedral without any scaffolding around it. I love the gothic architecture and this is one of my favorites.
Breathtakingly beautiful- amazingly intricate archways and fun local musicians creating a great atmosphere

Church look simple, using only vertical wall decoration, st ivo door is a good example of the gothic style Catalonia region. In addition to visit inside the cathedral, courtyard outside the white yulan, palm trees, fountain, white swan, and the warm sunshine, let a person feel except solemn solemn church, added a sweet and elegant. Fountain next to a group of white geese, careful count, there are 13 original, so curious to explore why would keep the geese. Later found that the 13 original white swan is in honor of saint, nature also became a special scenery line in the Barcelona the cathedral.

attractions.name: Columbus Monument

attractions.open_status: (March 1st - September 30th) 8:30-20:30, (October 1st - February 28th of the following year) 8:30-19:30 (January 1, January 6th, December 25, 26) rest. Stop entering 30 minutes before closing
attractions.address: Plaça Portal de la pau, s/n, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
reviews: in my opinion, the statue is more like a totem, one hand holds book, one hand, pointing to the direction of the American continent Columbus in the face of the sea, "to the west, to the west" shout and behind saturated with faith, has been deeply integrated into the once sea overlord of every people in the blood.
The statue is high more than 7 meter, it's placed at the site where Christoffel Columbus arrived in 1493 after his discovery of America the year before.
Памятник самому известному испанцу. Величественный монумент, на самом верху которого расположена смотровая площадка.
Though it was many years ago it is a land mark so old you can't stop staring at it once you see it. The artistry is excellent.
It's an impressive monument surrounded by traffic. It makes for some nice photos juxtaposing the past with the present.

attractions.name: Berlin Cathedral
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Germany, Berlin, Berlin, Berlin Cathedral
reviews: I have never seen such as beautiful Cathedral church before , Berlin Cathedral Church is the one attracted me to visited for half of day
It''s one of the most famous scenery destinations of Berlin and you will never regret of visiting the gorgeous place.

The Duomo, Dom, is not far from Museum Island, and the magnificent Gothic cathedral, with its dome especially majestic, is visible from a distance. Like Berlin, it did not survive the destruction of the war during World War II, and the restoration has lasted for many years, and is now a little less delicate and delicate than it was before. The large lawn in front of the church is a great place for locals to relax and the grass is full of people in summer
As a historic cathedral, the exterior is very grand and the interior is very well decorated

Reflections on the war can be said to be silently reminding you at every sight and street...the parliament building today is far from the war fire...many tourists, it is said to be a month or two to make an appointment

attractions.name: Parliament Building
