attractions.open_status: Roof terrace and dome: 8:00-24:00 The latest entry is 22:00, the day is closed on December 24th and the time is 16:00 on December 31st.
reviews: Great views across the city with interesting tour guide included free of charge!
Здорово, красиво, масштабно! Вблизи от Бранденбургских ворот! Несомненно стоит увидеть это место своими глазами!

The Dome on top the Berlin wall has an breathtaking view. You can see the whole city. When you go, you can take an audio guide and listen to the explanations of what you are currently seeing from your point view. Make sure you do a reservation early.
The Parliament of the Democratic German republic with the beautiful work of Norman Foster turning it in a really magic place

The building is beautiful and the dome is an incredible piece of architecture plus there is a great history of the government, the rise of Hitler and the path leading up to the current state of government. You can book late appointments which are less busy and the views at night are unique and stunning.

attractions.name: Brandenburg Gate
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Germany, Berlin, Berlin, Brandenburg Gate
reviews: Nice stroll after a great meal near Mall of Berlin! There's plenty of great structure and places of interest along the way. Take time by walking down from the mall. (:

Whatever it used to be, the Brandenburg Gate is now a symbol of peace and openness. It is a great place for a meet up as well - so wide open that you are bound to see your rendezvous partner (just in case, there is also Starbucks for free wifi).  As you come out of the metro (S-bahn Branderburg Tor) you can find park benches and places to park your bike. Learn about the history beforehand, it will make standing there a much richer experience!
place to be - one of the most important buildings pf berlin. also by night beautiful to watch
wonderful place, lots of things near by and activities. i would love to stay more
their are very secure and trustful and also give you the best price and hotel in town. give it up nice one

attractions.name: Berlin Wall Memorial
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Germany, Berlin, Berlin, Berlin Wall Memorial
reviews: Berlin is a unique and vibrant city, unparalleled with preserved reminders from history. Every inch of East Berlin feels dedicated to the story of the people, from monuments commemorating feats of courage and tragedy, to museums dedicated to the city's art movements. A truly revolutionary spirit runs through this city. It was a privilege to visit. I love cold war history and my visit to the wall still sticks in my mind.

If you really want a picture of what it was like living with the Berlin Wall, this is the place to go. It's free, it's real and has both indoor and outdoor sections. The stories are written and in some cases have audio components. It's definitely a place I've gone more than once as there are so many different ways you can experience it: from just walking through, to reading every plaque to picturing yourself in someone's shoes. Really impacting and worth your time.

Take a walk along Bernauerstraße following pieces of the original wall and sculptures marking out it’s place and feel history seep over you as you pass the ‘no mans land’ area. Historic photographs blown up onto the sides of buildings, information plaques and memorials will inform you of the people who lost their homes to the wall construction and those who perished trying to cross the wall. Less busy and touristy than other wall sights.

The Fall of Berlin Wall was celebrated by people around the world. It's been ever since a reminder to keep open the communications, care about the community and share a common goal. The reminders is also to never forget, to avoid another wall erected in Germany. The Gedenkstätte Berliner Mauer (Berlin Wall Memorial)  consists of the Memorial to the Victims of the Wall, a Documentation Centre and the Chapel of Reconciliation. The best part is the surviving section of the wall and watchtower, where you can get a real experience of how the border worked and how difficult it was to actually cross it.

An impressive documentation centre stands at a famous location of the Berlin Wall - it was here that the Wall was built incorporating apartment buildings on Bernauer Straße (you may have seen the dramatic video of the woman leaping from a window to escape). Across the street from the documentation centre is a remaining stretch of the Wall which, if you climb to the top of the centre, you can see over to the reconstructed no-man's land. The area between the centre and Brunnenstraße to the east is also being developed with an open air exhibition and history of the wall and the history of Bernauer Straße. A must visit for everyone. And it's free!

attractions.name: Memorial to the Murdered Jews of Europe
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Germany, Berlin, Berlin, Memorial to the Murdered Jews of Europe
reviews: The memorial is a thoughtful offering to all people, which needs to be experienced. tread slowly through the cement blocks and pay attention to what feelings arise. From the way the ground goes up and down in waves to depict unsteadiness, to the stripping off individual identities that the blocks represent, they all tell different facets of the story. take your time here. We owe it to our present and future selves.
Somber memorial to the Jews killed in Europe. Unfortunately, there are still people who take it respectful tourist posing photos here.
It is a very impressive place. Besides, I feel it is great from an architecture perspective.
Impressive monument dedicated to the Jewish  people murdered during the War
Breathtaking memorial for the holocaust . You walk around between the stones and as you get deeper you get lost and become tiny as the Jews felt when everything was closing on them

attractions.name: Museum Island
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Germany, Berlin, Berlin, Museum Island
attractions.open_status: The museums are closed on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, Fridays and Sundays from 10:00 to 18:00, Thursdays from 10:00 to 20:00, and on Mondays.
reviews: Strongly recommend to purchase the two days pass. If u like ancient history, this is the place u must visit.
Could spend the whole day on this island! Packed full of incredible museums with rare artefacts and artwork.
beautiful structure^^
Good please to visit, have a walk and have a lunch in the grass :)

Berlin dates back to the late 12th century. She is made up of the current settlement of Berlin and Museum Island on the northern bank of the Spree. Both settlements existed in the 13th century and were first proposed by Coelln on October 28, 1237. In 1307, the two parts were merged and Berlin was born. It was the day Berlin was born.

attractions.name: East Side Gallery
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Germany, Berlin, Berlin, East Side Gallery
reviews: Your trip to Berlin will not be complete without visiting East Side Gallery! Its a great place to go and admire the art piece by diff artist. Try out going there in the daytime and night. U will be able to take picture easily with lesser ppl at night or early in the morning!
it was so fun and unique^^
this is core of berlin for art people
It''s one of the most famous scenery destinations of Berlin and it is worth of visiting time and time again.
Well worth the visit, very fun place.

attractions.name: Under the Linden Trees
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Germany, Berlin, Berlin, Under the Linden Trees
reviews: A lovely street to walk down after visiting the Brandenburg gate. Stretches for a while, and is very interesting to explore.

What the Champ d'elysees is to Paris, Unter den Linden is to Berlin.  Though it is a little bit more stark on this street.  You know... Communist rule and all.  But since the reunification, there is life on this street once more.  Starting from Brandenburg Gate it reaches far to the Reichstag.  A good portion of the main sites of Berlin can be found along this street.
this is the avenue that will take you to the bradenburgo gate, this is history.
Good for a stroll.
Nice avenue to walk. Great historical buildings from East Germany along the way from the Brandenburg Gate to the Island Of the Museums & theRiver Spree.

attractions.name: Berlin TV Tower (Fernsehturm)
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Germany, Berlin, Berlin, Berlin TV Tower (Fernsehturm)
reviews: It is rare to see such a high TV tower in Europe, even the tall buildings south, really unique.
The tallest building in Germany, 300 meters high, has a viewing platform with panoramic views of the city of Berlin, and a revolving restaurant on the platform, which can rotate 360 degrees.

The Berlin TV Tower is one of Berlin’s landmark buildings. In the center of Berlin, you can see the Berlin TV Tower from almost every angle. This tall TV tower can be combined with the surrounding buildings to form a beautiful picture. The TV tower can also be climbed to the top. The entrance is near Alexanderplatz. It is best to book in advance.

The TV tower located at Alexanderplatz is the coordinates of Berlin; it is also my coordinates in Berlin. I visited Berlin three times and stayed in a hotel near the TV tower twice. I drove in Berlin for the first time. After picking up the car, I didn't use the foreign language navigation on the car. I drove around the city directly, looking for traces of the TV tower, and finally drove back to the hotel. I also set off from under the TV tower several times and walked across the boulevard under the Linden Tree to the Brandenburg Gate. Therefore, what I know about Berlin is probably between the Brandenburg Gate and the TV Tower. Besides, it is impossible to comment without reaching the top. So one sunny afternoon, a person came to the tower specially. I seem to like climbing high and the feeling of overlooking a city. From this perspective, the height of all cities is worth climbing, regardless of whether the tower itself is beautiful. The same is true for the Berlin Tower. You can look at the city from a height, look at its overall colors, look for the sights you have visited, sign the distance between them, understand the layout of the city, and sometimes you can also see it from the sky. When the sun shines through the dark clouds and casts on the city, you can see through the edge of the city and feel the feeling of the sky. Lots of fun, and more. Look at the picture.

The Berlin TV Tower can be regarded as the most conspicuous landmark of the city. Just like the status of the Oriental Pearl in Shanghai, it exists in Berlin. Although it is close to a pile of historical buildings on the Museum Island, its slightly elongated figure does not affect the architectural skyline of the historical and cultural area. On the contrary, near the TV tower constitutes the hub of the entire Berlin bus system. Many trams and trains can be found. The cinema mall next to the TV tower also makes this one of Germany's most important commercial centers.

attractions.name: Potsdamer Platz
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Germany, Berlin, Berlin, Potsdamer Platz
reviews: a very fashion place, looks like NY time square, especially the sony center.
The most famous square in Germany is equivalent to our Tiananmen Square.

This hotel has convenient transportation. It can be reached directly from Berlin Central Station by M85. Next to a subway station, this is a ground station. You can see trains entering and leaving the station from the room. The scenery is very beautiful. There is another subway station, which is an underground station. You can choose the most convenient station according to where you need to go. The hotel facilities are not new, but the space is relatively large and the price is good.

Potsdamer Platz is the center of Berlin, at the junction of East and West Berlin. It is a new and prosperous commercial center. The three most prominent high-rise buildings, one of which is the building of Deutsche Bahn DB, is a modern commercial building. The road is very wide, connected by a subway station, and there are several large shopping malls nearby.

Potsdamer Platz heads west from Checkpoint Charlie, passing by the Federal Ministry of Finance with the People's Uprising and the antique Bundestag. The first three modern high-rise buildings that appear in front of you are the iconic buildings of Potsdamer Platz. Looking at the prosperous realm, can you imagine that it was once covered with mines during World War II? With the development of history, a barren land has become Berlin's current transportation hub and commercial center. The shiny LOGO on the roof highlights their commercial status. The night in Berlin is extremely beautiful, especially the squares at Christmas. From the end of November to December, Christmas markets with different themes attract many people who come here... During Christmas, the center of Potsdamer Platz becomes a snowy white The world, the theme here is-"Winterwelt auf dem Potsdamer Platz". Snowtubes, the largest mobile ski trail in Europe, welcomes countless adults and children. A single person is 1.5 euros, a family of 4 people is 5 euros, and a small group of 10 people only needs 10 euros. You can experience the excitement of sliding down from a height together, excited and safe! There is also a merry-go-round here, which evokes innocence in every minute. If you’re tired and cold, you can also buy food and drink in the small wooden houses in the Christmas market and continue the Christmas Eve party. It is also worth mentioning that the Christmas market at Potsdamer Platz lasts a long time, from November 23, 2015 to January 3, 2016! Attraction Tips: Address: Potsdamer Platz How to arrive: Light rail/Metro: S1/S2/S25/U2, Potsdamer Station Tickets: Free ski trails: 1.5 euros for a single person, 5 euros for a family of 4, and only 10 for a small group of 10 Europe

attractions.name: Mezquita-Catedral
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Spain, Andalusia, Cordoba Province, Cordoba, Mezquita-Catedral
reviews: The process from the monastery to the mosque to the Catholic church is really attracted me, let me see in the transformation process of the wisdom of the religion to get along with. There seem to be very few over to them, nothing down, nothing up this tit-for-tat attitudes, and just according to their own religious use function to adjust the original architectural features and improve. Although have damage, but, after all, still retained many of the essence of the original building, so to leave this with the appearance of Islam and a Catholic heart grand buildings.
Córdoba is here to see the world-famous mosque, which is not only the best cultural relic left by the Shah in Andalusia, but also houses a church with its fine architecture.
The sculptures in the mosque are extremely delicate, and you can slowly savor its grandeur and history.

The most beautiful part of the Grand Mosque in Cordoba is the red and white, two-story overlapping horseshoe marble columns, the north-south axis line, supporting the roof of the entire mosque, which is unique to Arab architectural decoration.

It is said to be a mosque, but in fact it has long been converted into a cathedral. However, it is still obvious that it is different from other European churches, that is, the style has a strong Islamic flavor. This is a must-visit attraction in Cordoba, it takes two or three hours.

attractions.name: Roman Bridge
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Spain, Andalusia, Cordoba Province, Cordoba, Roman Bridge
reviews: Still in the use of the Roman bridge first built in the 1st century, in the 13th century to the 19th century and have different degree of building, bridge with stone buildings, there are 16 span. Sunset Roman bridge is one of the most beautiful scenery in cordoba, standing at the southern tip of the bridge, the other side of the mosque and the bridge synergies of of primitive simplicity.

The ancient Roman Bridge under the sunset is one of the most beautiful views of Cordoba, more than 2,000 years old, and witness the change of the ancient city of Cordoba. The sculpture on the bridge is the guardian of the Holy Raphael Angel of Cordoba.

Historically, Andalusia was an important part of the Spanish province of the Roman Empire. It left a lot of ancient Roman ruins. The most important thing to come to Cordoba was to see the landmark city building.

Although Cordoba is a small city, it is very historical. From the Great Mosque, which is now the cathedral, is the city gate. There is an old bridge by the river leading to the outside of the old city. It's even more unique in the evening. Relatively speaking, there are fewer tourists, but the photos are not as good as those taken during the day.

This is a great place to enjoy the scenery and at the same time see the importance of the Guadalquivir River to city life. The bridge is not only a passage, but also controls the water area, pushing a mill to grind grains and directing water up to the water features and fountains of Alcazar. It's a magical return, the road flowing back to the city is so spectacular.

attractions.name: Calleja de las Flores
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Spain, Andalusia, Cordoba Province, Cordoba, Calleja de las Flores
attractions.address: Calleja de las Flores, 1, 14003 Córdoba, Spain
reviews: Calleja DE las flores near the mosque in the ghetto, is a very typical cordoba quiet alley. Unlike other parts of Andalusia and cordoba is a city flower city, small town everybody knows flowers, love flowers, and flowers. It can see in the calleja DE las flores, in the narrow, winding alleys flowers hanging on the wall, windowsill with flowers, even the roads are filled with flowers. Suggest travelers don''t miss love flowers beautifully calleja DE las flores, cordoba courtyard section may in every year, some parts of the garden will be host is decorated with flowers, free and open to visit.

The alleys across the slope of the mosque are famous Baihua alleys, originally thought it was a wide road, but did not think it was really just an alley, full of flowers with pots. In fact, Cordoba has the reputation of the city of Baihua.

This is natural. Cordoba is the home of the courtyard festival. I am embarrassed to say hello to the courtyard festival in any hotel without a courtyard. Cordoba is a grand festival in May every year, in order to spend the summer in Andalusia comfortably In this festival, almost every household has a courtyard. Every courtyard is desperately decorated by the owner. The competition to see whose courtyard is the most beautiful. Photos of each courtyard will be posted on Calleja, known as the "alley of flowers". Another characteristic of Cordoba on the white walls of de las Flores is that the streets are full of orange trees, and the air is filled with the fragrance of oranges. After a cup of afternoon tea in the courtyard, it faces La Juderia, the ghetto-the legendary white The alley is headed. The white alley is located in the northwest of the mosque. It is called a labyrinth. With the mosque as the center, you never get lost. Public parking lots. We parked in the underground garage of a square in Ronda, the open-air public parking lot in Nerja, and a shopping mall in Seville. Underground parking garages are charged by the hour. You need to take the parking card from the gate when you get in. When you leave the car, remember to bring the card, and then go to the automatic payment machine to pay the fee. Some payment machines can swipe the card, and some can only use cash. Insert the parking card into the machine. Shows the amount you need to pay. After paying, the machine will write the payment information into the parking card, and then you must leave the garage within 10-15 minutes (different from each parking lot), and finally use the parking card to exit the garage from the gate.

Baihua Lane, as the name suggests, is a small alley full of flowers. It is located in the old ghetto. The streets in this area are narrow and complicated. Most of the alleys are lined with residential houses, and the outer walls of the houses are generally white. Residents decorate their own small world with flowers. Flowers of the season can be seen everywhere on the outer walls, balcony fences and tiles. It is said that every May, Cordoba will put on its most gorgeous costume and usher in the colorful "Courtyard Festival". Visiting tourists dig into an alley at random, and they can see Geraniums scattered on the front door and on the wall, and the flowers are as sweet and charming as a girl. During the courtyard festival, people can enter the private courtyard to visit, chat with the owner and admire the flowers, and feel the beauty of spring. The alley is really small, and you will pass by if you are not careful. When taking pictures, you can take pictures of the bell tower behind through the alleys.

Baihua Alley is actually a very narrow, narrow and short path, which is really disappointing, but the small gift shops around are good for shopping. In fact, you can find a place to sit here and feel the ease of life in the small city is very happy. There are two well-known handmade leather shops in the alley, a shoe shop and a bag shop. Many people who like it will come here, but the shop is not very eye-catching.

attractions.name: Alcazar de los Reyes Cristianos
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Spain, Andalusia, Cordoba Province, Cordoba, Alcazar de los Reyes Cristianos
attractions.address: Pl. Campo Santo de los Martires, San Basilio, 14004 Cordoba, Spain
reviews: In cordoba is a medieval castle, here is used to rewrite history of one of the double main residence of the king of Spain. Later became napoleon''s troops barracks in 1810, in 1821, the castle became a prison again. The experienced countless hardships of the castle was in the 1950 s as a tourist attraction for people to visit. The castle by Alfonso signal was built in 1328, is a jose tiga palace, with exquisite garden. Here in the 15th century, the Catholic monarchs built his own palace and launched the war conquest of granada. In 1483, abdi imprisoned here, and in nearly 300 years, al casal palace are treated as religious base of decision.
The tower is very tall and there is not much to see inside, but the terrace is the best place to overlook the gardens and the city view. The regular pools, trimmed trees, and Islamic courtyards.

Although the Cathedral of Cordoba is one of the most amazing places I have visited, the Royal Palace of Cordoba is overrated. There are too few buildings here, the access is very limited, and the general information is too little (I can't find any English materials; there are no leaflets, audio guides or similar things here).

This should be a must-visit place for a trip to Cordoba. It’s great to take a walk in the beautiful garden. I have been here three times and I can always find new things that appeal to me. The palace and tower are great, especially the rooms inside. In 1492, Columbus planned a voyage to America in that room. But it is the garden that makes me linger. On a sunny morning in Cordoba, there is nothing better than strolling in the garden for an hour or two!

This is a must-visit attraction for tour groups, so it's understandable to have a long queue. The gardens here are ok, but not very special compared to other gardens we have visited in Spain. The small ponds with fish in the garden are very interesting and give a glimpse of the luxurious life of Spanish aristocrats. It's nice to stroll around in the garden, we didn't go to the museum because there were too many people.

attractions.name: Sinagoga
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Spain, Andalusia, Cordoba Province, Cordoba, Sinagoga
attractions.address: Calle de los Judíos, 20, 14004 Córdoba, Córdoba, Spain, Cordoba, Spain
reviews: Built in 1314 of cordoba synagogue was the only synagogue, Andalusia is also one of Spain''s best kept the synagogue. 1492 jews were expelled after the synagogue was transformed into a hospital, and was transformed into the school, it was not until the end of the 19th century was reformed to for people to visit the synagogue.

Built in the 14th century, the synagogue is the only synagogue in Andalusia and one of the best-preserved synagogues in Spain. There is only a small room, the carvings are fairly exquisite, and the original Hebrew inscriptions are still preserved on the surrounding walls.

A church tells the history of its city-Cordova Cathedral. At first glance, she looked like a mosque. Yes, Cordova was once the capital of Islam. Her predecessor was a mosque; when it was overthrown, she was converted into a Catholic church. So this church combines Islamic and Catholic art classics!
Many Jews do not go to church, but accompany a few fixed companions to pray in a fixed room
Here is the fusion of multi-element culture, a very nice place

attractions.name: Palacio de Viana
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Spain, Andalusia, Cordoba Province, Cordoba, Palacio de Viana
reviews: Very nice, a bit far from the Grand Mosque (estimated to walk more than 20 minutes), there are twelve courtyards with different styles, you can enjoy the most beautiful courtyard art in Cordoba, it is recommended to definitely visit when you have time. It’s worth seeing, there are too many plants

Palacio de Viana (Viana Palace), also known as the Garden Museum, is a magnificent spot that is easy to visit and photograph. The original building began 500 years ago as a noble manor. It has undergone a generational expansion. There are 12 gardens, both large and small. It was bought by a public enterprise in 1980 and opened for viewing.
It is about 10 minutes on foot from Tendillas Square in the city center, and about 17 minutes on foot from the Great Mosque. The courtyard visit ticket is 5 euros, and there are a few hours a week to open for free.

This place is really beautiful, just like a beautiful suburban garden. It is not a royal palace. It has many independent small courtyards. Each courtyard has a different style, but they are full of flowers.

This place is famous for its 12 beautiful and beautiful courtyards. There are orange trees, cypress trees and various flowers in these courtyards to form an atmosphere of fragrance in the four seasons. It is very exquisite and is a must-see for tourists.
This place is more like a royal garden. His most attractive place is his various types of small gardens. There are 12 courtyards in total, each with different themed flowers and decoration styles.

attractions.name: Museo Municipal Taurino

reviews: A free museum, some general. If you really interested in a bullfight, next to recommend to the ring, have Chinese phonetic explanation, can better understand the bullfight culture and history in Spain, because the two are inseparable. If 5-6 month to go, can go to see a bullfight, ticket price from a few euros to have hundreds of euros.

The Bullfighting Museum is a very distinctive museum, which represents the traditional culture of Spain, traditional characteristics, increased knowledge, strong interest, and high cost performance. It is worth recommending to everyone, not bad!

Spanish bullfighting is believed to be unknown. You can't miss the bullfighting museum in Cordoba. It displays famous bullfighter costumes and other items, as well as bull head specimens, and you can learn about the history of bullfighting. .
When I came to Spain to check in, I didn’t see the bullfighting. The buildings are pretty good!

A small bullfighting museum is built in the circular passage below the bullring. Through the display of pictures and props on the wall, it tells every visitor the history and development of bullfighting. There are also many famous bullfighting museums on display here. Portraits of bullfighters and used items, but the most attractive thing is of course the specimens of bullfighting bull heads hanging high on the wall, because they are the real heroes in the bullring!

attractions.name: Posada del Potro
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Spain, Andalusia, Cordoba Province, Cordoba, Posada del Potro
reviews: Strolling through the streets of Cordoba and looking for the splendid courtyards is one of the experiences you cannot miss when visiting this city. Each courtyard is unique but has a strong sense of tranquility and communion with nature. Unfortunately, during our visit, some of them were closed, so it is better to visit those that are open rather than to see some special courtyards. After walking for a few miles, they found that they were not open.
This looks so familiar. I didn’t expect that there are inns in foreign countries.
I didn’t expect that there are inns in foreign countries. I thought that only in China there are inns. The name of this inn is very good, Xiaoma Inn.
Not bad environment is good, you can try

The pony statue at the top of the fountain in the center of Pony Square is the city emblem of Cordoba. The square used to be a lively bazaar where hawkers gathered. Now there are many gift shops around the square selling various local specialties. The pony inn on the corner of the square, where Cervantes once lived. Another building on the square is the Art Gallery of Cordoba.

attractions.name: Medina Azahara
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Spain, Andalusia, Cordoba Province, Cordoba, Medina Azahara
attractions.address: Ctra de Palma del Rio, Km 5 (5 km from Palma Highway)
reviews: The Asahala Palace has a long history and well-preserved buildings, very distinctive!
This is a very famous attraction with unique characteristics, it is worth seeing!

We didn't know its existence before, but once we were directed to it [it usually opens when the weather is cool], it is a fascinating place for people who love history and archeology. The museum itself is very attractive, with vibrant exhibits to illustrate how the place was built and decorated and used. Then a bus will take you to take a brief tour of this place. There is a wide valley with beautiful scenery everywhere. If you have been to Knossos in Crete, you will love this form of travel. If you haven't been, just take a stroll and admire this ancient place, which was buried under tons of soil not long ago.

A relatively large relic building complex, the entire palace is built on the hillside, with distinct levels. Each floor is separated by stone walls, dividing the palace into three parts. In addition, the palace also preserves various styles of stone pillars and paintings.

Medina-Ashahara Palace, located in the downtown area of Cordoba, this palace was built by the Arab caliph Abdul Rahman. Nowadays, it has lost its original glory, only some of the past Broken wall, you can still see the past glory

The Mummy Museum, with 24 exhibition halls, has a large collection of rare treasures, showing the development of ancient Mexican civilization. It is a world-class human treasure house. Each collection is only annotated in Spanish. If you do your best homework in advance, you will be amazed In this gathering place of the gods.

This is the most mysterious and terrifying museum in Guanajuato-the Mummy Museum. There are hundreds of mummies from ancient times to the present, all of which are quite well preserved. Because it feels terrifying, I didn't dare to take photos. I have the opportunity to feel it for myself.

There is a museum of mummies in Guanajuato, where hundreds of mummies are collected here, which looks rather horrible, because the children did not dare to go in and visit. Just took a few pictures at the door and passed by. Next time you come alone, you have the opportunity to go in and take a look.

In the downtown area of Guanajuato, there is a famous museum of mummies, where many famous Mexican mummies are displayed. I saw it accidentally that day, but because I was afraid, I didn't dare to go in. I only took a few photos outside as a souvenir.

attractions.name: Basilica of Our Lady of Guanajuato
attractions.loc_tags: North America, Mexico, Guanajuato, Guanajuato, Basilica of Our Lady of Guanajuato
reviews: The Basilica of Our Lady of Guanajuato is located in the center of Guanajuato. It is one of the most eye-catching buildings in Guanajuato. It is colorful, with yellow walls. The corners are outlined in red, with a red roof. The exquisite bell tower is faint Pink, unique style.

This yellow-red cathedral has a history of more than 300 years and is a landmark of the city of Guanajuato. There is a symbol of Guanajuato’s world heritage on the square not far from it. The church is open for free. Its interior decoration gives people a fresh and natural feeling.

The Basilica of Our Lady of Guanajuato is the most conspicuous building in the entire old city. It is located in the center of the old city. It has a yellow facade and a red roof that can recognize him at a glance. It is also the most important church in the entire Everbright Huatuo. It has a history of more than 400 years. It is a tourist attraction that must be visited when visiting Guanajuato.

The Basilica of Our Lady is the most famous and conspicuous building in Guanajuato. Its yellow exterior wall and red top make it unique in the old town of Guanajuato. It is a famous religious site here and there are many believers every day. Coming here to pray has a lofty status in the hearts of Guanajuato people.

The Cathedral of Notre Dame is very beautiful. It is located in a location on the outskirts of a city, but it is worth a visit. Its main body is an old building, and it is now painted yellowish brown with a very special color.

reviews: amazing views from the top. you can either walk or take a cable cart. also, bring cash as they don't accept other payment methods. there is so much beautiful scenery all around with various activities and pathways to see and explore.

The scenery is pleasant and the food is delicious. Although it is a modern scenic spot, everything is well equipped and well equipped. It is a worthwhile trip to combine the local most advantageous lake water, air, food and ingeniousness.

Very cost-effective, 200 including tickets, boat tickets, etc. My son especially likes the yellow rabbit, and he is very unhappy when talking to the rabbit. The legs are a bit shaken at the highest point, but the whole scenery is in full view. There is a sense of monarchy. Haha 😊

Tianmu Lake is located eight kilometers south of Liyang City, Changzhou. Because it is a remnant of Tianmu Mountain, it is named Tianmu Lake [1]. Tianmu Lake is a narrow, deep-water lake (reservoir) with a deep water depth of about 4～5m in the south and about 10～14m in the north. Around Tianmu Lake, there are many historical and cultural sites: Wuyuan Mountain named after Wuzi, a Chu native of the Spring and Autumn Period, the reading table of the Eastern Han Dynasty, the Taibai Tower, the Baoen Temple, the former site of the Longxing Temple, the first stone arch dam in the Tang Dynasty, etc. Tianmu Lake region is rich in products, "Shahe Guilu" green tea, "Oolong tea", "Pearl chestnut", "Guiyuan chestnut", "casserole head" and so on.

reviews: I have been to Yushui Hot Spring before. I saw Hantian Hot Spring. Although I didn't live here, I drove over for 10 minutes. It's very easy to find parking. The hot spring is divided into three layers and five areas. This time, there are not many people. It's very comfortable. It's just like the impurity in the water. After the bubble is done in the harbor. I ate in the restaurant, it was delicious, and then I did a foot massage at the lounge. No. 28, the technician was very good.

In addition, I also want to thank the staff of the children's pool, Zhang Liu Ji, who took the initiative to bring the children a swimming ring, also sent a small gift, and poured several cups of ginger tea for us. When you leave, the staff will say that you will come back next time. The third floor of the Hong Kong restaurant is delicious. In addition, the ginger tea in the hot spring is very strong and delicious. Because it is not too late to visit, you will definitely come back next time.

A super satisfied hot spring trip! Lived in a triple room with two girlfriends, the room was very large. Inside, slippers, towels, shower, shampoo, shower gel, skin care products, hair dryer, etc. are all available. It is recommended that everyone go up after entering the hot spring area, because the hot spring and the scenery above are more exciting, so you can soak in the front when you are full of energy. Lest you get tired in the second half and can't climb the mountain and miss the scenery.

The overall environment is still quite good, the second time I came, but this time the pool was closed a lot, not more than the first time, and the place where the scenery was taken when I first bubbled is now turned into the place of the Baochi. I am not satisfied with the two times. Every time I pass the hotel that spinach restaurant is where there is a night cat, this time I bit my boyfriend, I hope to strengthen this management, in case of a rabies outbreak, is it necessary to be responsible for the resort?

Yixing Shanjuan Cave is located in Luoyan Mountain, 25km southwest of Yixing City, Jiangsu Province, which is a national AAAA class scenic spot with a total area of 5000 square meters. The beauty of the four caves of the water is mainly embodied in the lower cave and the water cave.

Shanjuan Cave is one of the three caves in Yixing and the first underground karst cave developed in China. There are both odd stone stalactites and underground rivers and underground waterfalls. It is very spectacular. The underground river can be rowed by boat. The cave is colorful and worth seeing.

attractions.name: Yixing Zhuhai
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Jiangsu, Wuxi, Yixing, Yixing Zhuhai

reviews: Really beautiful bamboo forest. Remember to wear your walking / hiking shoes :)

I visited on 23 December and enjoyed the experience.I was disappointed because the cable car was not operational on the day.I was extremely disgusted by the lack of customer service of the bus service inside the attraction, since at 4:30 I was far away from the exit and the busses that had passed me were full, but none of the drivers took the initiative to call a colleague to come to my assistance. As a foreigner and first time visitor, I could easily have been lost in the forest overnight and these individuals didn't care. I got to the exit gate with the help of an elderly maintenance worker.

It is well worth a visit. Yixing Zhuhai Scenic Area is located in Huxiang Town, 31 kilometers southwest of Yixing City, Jiangsu Province, and is one of the top ten scenic spots of the AAAAA class tourist area, national scenic spot, provincial forest park, Wuxi Tourism 18 scenic spots and Yixing. Bamboo sea scenic area extends to Su, Zhe, and Guizhou Provinces, more than 800 miles, known as "East China's first bamboo sea", is a representative scenic spot of bamboo scenery, bamboo style and bamboo culture. Although Yixing Bamboo Sea is not as famous as Nanshan Bamboo Sea and Anji Bamboo Sea, but for me who lived in Hubei, the bamboo sea is full of mountains and mountains of the Cuizhu is enough to shock, the Japanese side always have time to appreciate the beauty of other bamboo sea. The above picture is a hand-painted map of the scenic spot. Through my own walking experience, the scenic area is large. It can be divided into two large parts on the level of difficulty: one is a scenic spot centered on Jinghu, the other is a climbing mountain centered on Wanmu bamboo forest and the first peak of Southern Jiangsu. Mountain area, suitable for all ages of tourism lovers. Whether you want to try easy sightseeing tour, bamboo culture experience tour, mountaineering leisure tour, or deep walking tour, the scenery of Yixing Bamboo Sea will not let you down. By the way, I arrived at the scenic spot at 9 am on the weekend of last September and left at 4 pm. The advantage of arriving early is that the tourists have not started to get more, the scenic spot is very quiet, and I am walking the deep tour route, suitable for physical strength and hope to experience the beautiful scenery of the bamboo sea. Travel. Personally think it is the first bamboo sea in East China, Yixing Bamboo Sea.

Meilan bamboo four gentleman love bamboo, to Yixing bamboo sea has great hope, also not to be disappointed! Super-class help! First of all, the weather is strong, all the way to cloudy, such weather not only will not be gloomy, but is particularly suitable for mountaineering outdoor activities! Yixing bamboo sea is divided into two parts, one is the lake and human landscape at the foot of the mountain, the other part is the mountain! Once inside the gate, the first cloth is in the eyes is a wet, clean and comfortable environment. Follow the winding path to the foot of the mountain, it will not feel lonely at all, there will be a view in three or five steps! We chose to walk to the foot of the mountain and take the cable car up the mountain! From the park entrance to the foot of the mountain, you can do a battery car! You can take the cable car up and down the mountain! We choose the cable car 🚡 up the mountain, so you can view the bamboo sea from a high point ～ very enjoyable! The top of the mountain is foggy, and you feel a little drunk oxygen in the cloud sea! Stay on the top of the hill, which is called the first peak of southern Jiangsu, and walk down the artificial stone steps in the bamboo sea, you must have a walking stick! Otherwise, the knee joints are very damaged, and the steps are too high! Walk down the mountain for about 2 hours! You must praise the restrooms in the scenic area, which are like a museum! The paper inside is all available, the bathroom is super five-star clean and smellless! I like the bamboo sea too much! There are everywhere on the road, the scene is full of spring and vitality! 100 points of scenic spot! This scenic spot that doesn't go to the village and doesn't go to the store in the morning and evening 🉐️ net red, will go again!

There are no tourist groups attractions, very quiet, the bamboo everywhere is spectacular. It takes about 2 minutes to walk up the mountain more than 600 meters. It's foggy to the top of the mountain, and you can't see anything. It's drizzling, so take the cable car down the mountain, 30 yuan / person, 25 minutes. When the cable car arrives at the mountain, it is ok to walk out of the scenic spot. It is not necessary to pay 10 yuan to take the battery car. It is only 1000 meters.

reviews: japan in a park. clean, quiet, peaceful. very well maintained park, great for a relaxing day.

Kuribayashi Park, from the early to mid Edo period, was the most famous trekking daimyo garden in Japan. It is located in the southern suburb of Takamatsu City, Kagawa Prefecture, Shikoku, with a total area of about 75 hectares. It was named Samsung daimyo garden by [Michelin ・ Green Guide ・ Japan].

Maybe the gardens in Jiangsu and Zhejiang have seen more. I feel that it is more general from the area to the scenery. You can slowly spend half to an hour and finish shopping. The special point is that there are a lot of pine trees. You can buy tickets by using self-service machines. The ticket gate has enthusiastic aunts to guide.

Clean and exquisite just the four words I learned when I walked into the park, the whole park was walking inside, and it felt like every place had a view, every place was very thoughtful with the designer's design concept

Michelin three stars? Kimono Experience at Takamatsu Kuribayashi Park, Japan Kuribayashi Park is located in Takamatsu, a city in the Shikoku region of Japan, near the Seto Inland Sea. It was originally built by local tycoons in the 16th century. It was later designated as a national special scenic spot and open to public tours. Step by step, between the mountains and rocks, the scenery is elegant and beautiful. It was rated as a three-star attraction in the Michelin Green Guide Japan. The scenery of the park changes with the four seasons. In October, we went to a lush greenery. If you can see the red leaves in late November. Although it is called Kuribayashi, there are the best pine trees in Japan. There are 1,400 pine trees in the courtyard, which are basically built by garden craftsmen, all of which are more than 300 years old! Kimonos can be rented at the garden pavilion in the park for 3,800 yen. The aunt in the store will help to put it on, and there are also handbags and headdresses to choose from. Walking in the courtyard in a kimono is very elegant and cute. We entered too late in the afternoon. The Chuyue Pavilion, which was rated as two Michelin stars, missed the time to visit the park. It's worth going in, so pay attention to the time: 9:00-16:30, the admission fee includes 700 yen for matcha adults. Admission fee to Kuribayashi Park: 410 yen⌚️Business hours change according to the season, please refer to the official website for details. November and December. Business hours: 9:00-17:00 Take the Kotoden Bus from JR Takamatsu Station, and walk for 1 minute before arriving at Kuribayashi Park

attractions.name: takamatsujyo
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Kagawa, Takamatsu, takamatsujyo
reviews: another nice natural experience in Takamatsu. to understand the real essence of this culture it is essential to visit this castle. what fascinated me the most is the contrast between old building and Japanese style garden and the new city with tall buildings in the background.

Honmaru in Takamatsu Castle is now only a pile of stones, and the building on it has long ceased to exist. The beautiful attic in the photo is actually the Tsukimi Yag at the corner of the city wall. It faces the direction of Takamatsu Port. If foreign enemies invade from the sea, this will be the first place to get a signal. The strategic location is very important, but it is now a landmark of Takamatsu Castle.

The entire Tamamo Castle is a park centered on Takamatsu Castle. In fact, the castle tower in Takamatsu Castle was demolished as early as 1884, and now only some foundation stones can be seen. From the perspective of the structure of the castle, the Honmaru of Takamatsu Castle is at the center, surrounded by a moat, connected to the outside by only a wooden sheath bridge; strategically, if the sheath bridge falls, Honmaru will be completely isolated. The turrets you can see today are Tsukimi Yagura and Water Gate, which are designated important cultural properties of Japan.

Takamatsu Castle was originally erected on the north shore of Takamatsu in the four countries of Japan. It was tall and large, and was built on the pan of the Seto Inland Sea. However, it was hit by war and the wooden structures such as the castle and the castle have already existed, and the foundation of the castle is still standing here. , But it has been renamed Tamazo Park, and it has become a place for viewing autumn leaves and cherry blossoms in spring.

Since ancient times, Shikoku Island has few people and poor resources, and it has not changed much. In terms of historical sites, most of the castles can be seen, but the Japanese-style castles are similar, and the jade of Himeji Castle is in front. You can only see some small features of the seaside castle. Takamatsu Castle is in Tamamo Park, and there are many tall pine trees... It is a low-lying land. When Toyotomi Hideyoshi was the younger brother of Oda Nobunaga, the last battle was here, and the water was flooded.

attractions.name: Shikoku Mura
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Kagawa, Takamatsu, Shikoku Mura
reviews: The concept of Siguo Village is similar to that of popular folk culture in China. It fully displays the rural life of a few years ago (rural love stories??). Compared with the noisy ancient towns, temples, palaces, etc., this quiet village is more capable. Relaxing travellers. At first glance, the first thing I thought of was Ninja Village... It should be because the assembly stage, huts, courtyards, suspension bridges, and kilns of Shikoku Village all created a stagnant old-time scenery.

Not in the plan, but temporarily decided to go to Shikoku Village. I really think I made a very wise choice. The weather was clear that day, and Shikoku Village was particularly beautiful and peaceful. The transportation is very convenient. I live in Wacho and take the Kotohira train directly to Kotodenya Island. Walk in the indicated direction for about 5 minutes. Adult tickets are 1,000 yen. The so-called Shikoku Village is the 33 private houses that were moved here from all over the Shikoku. After being restored to their original appearance, they are distributed throughout the village, allowing you to experience the past life and the wisdom of the ancestors. If you are hungry after walking around, there is a straw house udon noodle restaurant here, and the small bowl is about 500 yen. The noodles are very strong. But don't eat too much, because there is also a very British cafe called Yiren's Restaurant. I ordered a cup of English black tea, a piece of cheesecake, and three ice cream balls. It was only 1,100 yen (72Rmb). The environment inside is very good, you can bask in the sun and have afternoon tea leisurely.

Shikoku Village is a traditional folk house museum of Shikoku. It displays 33 old folk houses gathered from various prefectures and cities in the Shikoku region and Hyogo Prefecture. It is the best place to learn about the folk culture of the Shikoku region. Convenient transportation is the biggest reason why we chose this place. It is located at the foot of the Yadao scenic spot. The layout of the entire scenic spot is unique. The designer's careful planning can be seen everywhere in the village. All steps are natural stone steps, and the guardrails of bamboo paths are made of fine hemp rope. To fix. Walking into that quiet and beautiful forest, any troubles will dissipate! Going out of Shikoku Village, you can take a bus directly to the top of Yashima Mountain, which overlooks Takamatsu and various islands. Since we did not eat at noon and were too hungry, we did not go up to the mountain, but went to the Internet celebrity shop to eat chicken , I ordered all the famous meals, um...In fact, the taste of the Internet celebrity shop is really not very good!
It's worth going because there are few beautiful people. After 2 hours, you can go to 8⃣️Li Temple. The distance is three kilometers.
In this village you can see many ancient buildings and some historical sites.

It shows that it was built by Japanese monks in the Tang Dynasty when they returned from the country. It is also considered to have a long history. The mountain peaks backed by the sea are extremely scenic. A good place, overlooking the city, looking out over the Seto Islands, up the mountain, you can choose a trail or the Yakuri cable car, it is recommended that the trail is not far away~

[Scenery] It’s the first time I go to a temple in Japan and I feel very different. Different people will feel different, it's very quiet, people are still Luoyi, but because it is on the mountain, the place is very big, and the five swords peaks are also very beautiful.

This temple is also a very high-end landscape. The environment of the whole temple is also quite good. You can see a lot of rich resources. The temple here is also very simple, which is a form of traditional design style.

This temple is not very famous, and I have never heard of it before. I only found out when I saw the sign on the way to Yashima. There is another famous temple called Yashima Temple on the top of Yashima Mountain, and Yashima Temple is in another of Yashima Temple. one side.

Ba Li Temple is not very famous. Basically, tourists don’t go there to play. I just passed by accidentally. I saw a sign to know to go there. There is a temple called Ba Li Si, which is on the mountain of Yashima. Go to the innermost.

reviews: The construction of the Cologne Cathedral (KölnerDom) began in 1248, but was suspended around 1560. It was not until the 1840s that the project restarted, and the Great Twin Towers completed its original medieval plan in 1880. The cathedral is 157 meters high and is currently the tallest twin-tower church in the world.
spectacular view at night to See the Köln Dom.
One of the best pieces of artitecture in Germany if not europe.

attractions.name: Hohenzollern Bridge
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Germany, North Rhine-Westphalia, Cologne, Hohenzollern Bridge
reviews: The Hohenzollern Bridge is a bridge that crosses the Rhine in Köln, Germany. It crosses the Rhine at 688.5 kilometers. Initially, the bridge was both a railway bridge and a road bridge. However, after the destruction of the Second World War in 1945 and subsequent reconstruction, only railways and pedestrians can pass.
The most beautiful and famous bridge on the Rhine in Cologne, it is even more beautiful at night with the lights and loved it
The Colognes believed that a lock on the Hohensoren Bridge, which was a unique landscape, could be put on the Rhine River by throwing the keys.

Cologne (Köln) is a 2,000-year-old city. The city of Cologne straddles the Rhine River in western Germany. The Hohenzollern Bridge is a bridge across the Rhine in the center of Cologne. Initially, the bridge was both a railway bridge and a road bridge. However, after destruction in 1945 and subsequent reconstruction, only railways and pedestrians can pass.

The Hohenzollern Bridge is a bridge that crosses the Rhine in Köln, Germany. Initially, the bridge was both a railway bridge and a road bridge. However, after destruction in 1945 and subsequent reconstruction, only railways and pedestrians can pass.

reviews: The Cologne Chocolate Museum is quite novel! Worth a look!
Going to know that overseas is really doing things in a practical way, see how people's chocolates do

The Chocolate Museum in Cologne is located on the Rhine River. It was built in 1993 and is one of the ten most visited museums in Germany. Here you can learn about the history of chocolate in Europe and the process of making chocolate.

The Cologne Chocolate Museum is located on the banks of the Rhine. The ticket to the sea is 12 euros. After entering, I started with a variety of popular science chocolate knowledge and chocolate history, which is especially suitable for bringing children, having fun and learning. The following is a demonstration of the entire process and procedures of chocolate making. And it's a real re-production. After it's done, visitors can taste and buy it for free. Finally, there is a shopping area where you can buy some chocolates and souvenirs. Tax-free, you can apply for a tax refund immediately after purchase.

In the up position, here is chocolate from the door, from discovery to development and the role of chocolate are all displayed. You can also taste the chocolate just made for free. German brand-name chocolates are also available here

attractions.name: Great St. Martin Church
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Germany, North Rhine-Westphalia, Cologne, Great St. Martin Church
attractions.open_status: Open on Sun,1:15pm-6:00pm;Open on Mon-Thu,9:00am-12:30am,1:15pm-5:00pm;Open on Fri,9:30am-12:00am,1:15pm-5:00pm
reviews: Great St Martin's Church with a lot of history and well worth seeing!!

The Great St. Martin's Church is a Roman Catholic church in Cologne, Germany. Its foundation is the remains of the Roman church, which was built on the island of the Rhine at the time. The church later became a Benedictine monastery. The current buildings, including the towering sea-crossing tower, are landmarks in Cologne’s Old Town, built between 1150-1250.

The Great Saint Martin Church is a Roman Catholic church in Cologne, Germany. Its foundation is the remains of the Roman church, which was built on the island of the Rhine at the time. The church later became a Benedictine monastery. The current buildings, including the towering sea-crossing tower, are landmarks in Cologne’s Old Town, built between 1150-1250. The building at its eastern end forms a three-hole or three-leaf plan, consisting of three near-sighted points around the intersection, similar to Santa Maria Capitol. The church was severely damaged in World War II; restoration work was completed in 1985.

Very quiet church, you can feel the architecture of that era. It is a pity that many buildings except the church were rebuilt after being destroyed in World War II. The overall building is still very new and bright in color.

Gross St Martin, located on the Rhine River in Cologne, Germany, is one of the important landmarks on the Rhine River. It was built in the first century AD. After successive reconstructions, it became the spectacular prototype of the fifteenth century. Its biggest feature is the sharp thorny spire in the center of the church. Surrounding the spire, there are four spectacular towers towering above the seafood market in the old town. The floor is paved in the shape of a clover. It was once the most spectacular of all ancient Roman churches in Cologne. Before the completion of the Cologne Cathedral, the St. Martin's Church has always been the representative of Cologne. Until today, the St. Martin's Church and the Cologne Cathedral stand side by side. Looking north and south, it is still a splendid beauty on the Rhine.

attractions.name: Cologne City Hall
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Germany, North Rhine-Westphalia, Cologne, Cologne City Hall
attractions.open_status: Open on Mon,Wed-Thu,8:00am-4:00pm;Open on Tue,8:00am-6:00pm;Open on Fri,8:00am-12:00am
reviews: Cologne’s historic city hall was built in 1569 and is one of the most typical Renaissance buildings. It is listed in almost all art history dictionaries. The tower of the Cologne City Hall was built between 1407 and 1414. As a symbol of its city rule, its five-story building, with a total height of 61 meters, became the first secular "high-rise building" in Cologne.

Cologne City Hall is a historic building in Cologne, western Germany. It is located near HoheStraße in the Innenstadt district, between the Rathausplatz and Alter Markt squares. It houses part of the city government departments, including the city council and the office of the mayor.

The Cologne City Hall is not far from the cathedral. When I got there, a couple was registering their marriage. Even the pet dog wore a bow tie. It was a sense of ceremony. The city hall was destroyed by the bombing during World War II and was not completely restored. Part of it was rebuilt and part of it was built into a modern-style building. It is said that the old part that has been preserved is still very beautiful. Unfortunately, I didn't do enough homework, so I didn't look at it.

I originally planned to go to the Perfume Museum in Cologne. When I navigated to the neighborhood, it turned out that the City Hall of Cologne is near the Perfume Museum, so I stopped by. The city hall of Cologne was destroyed during World War II and later rebuilt. The buildings here are a combination of many different styles and are very distinctive. It is free to visit here, and you can observe the ancient architectural history here.

Cologne City Hall is an antique house, which is also very precious to look at. The entire city hall is a well-preserved pair of buildings. Come here to learn about the history here. The entire structure of the city hall is also in the old town style. Unified.
[Value for money] The appearance can be visited for free
[View] The view is great

If you don't want to buy perfume, you can consider buying fragrance.

The Cologne Perfume Museum is located near the Cologne City Hall, from the Cologne Cathedral along the shopping street, to a certain intersection, turn to another alley. Follow the GPS to find it easily. There are two floors. The first floor sells perfume and the second floor is a museum. The first bottle of cologne is more famous here, and the taste is relatively fresh. There are many different sizes to buy, and it is good to be packaged for gifts. There are also constellation perfumes, but the taste is average.

The Cologne Perfume Museum has a very strong smell. Many of the perfumes here are brewed from local plants. The original craftsmanship of the perfume is also from here. Whenever you smell the perfume, you feel very comfortable. The Perfume Museum also collects quite a lot. Many items. [Fun] The fun is quite interesting [The price/performance ratio] The purchase is also very cheap

attractions.name: Museum Ludwig
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Germany, North Rhine-Westphalia, Cologne, Museum Ludwig
reviews:
The Ludwig Museum in Cologne, Germany has a collection of modern art.
The works of art include pop art, abstract and surrealist works, and owns one of the largest Picasso collections in Europe. The Ludwig Museum was established in 1976.

The Surrealist Art Museum in Cologne, Germany, has a lot of fine arts, all of which are very precious master-level works of art. The works of the art gallery are very precious, and you can buy a lot of things here.
[Scenery] The scenery is very good
[Fun] The original Picasso
Very artistic, Picasso’s paintings have not found the ticket at the door and bought a pass to see 5-6 museums for a total price of 18 yuan. The validity period is 3 days. Not bad

When the Ludwig Museum (Museum Ludwig) in Cologne was founded in 1976, Peter and Irene Ludwig donated 350 modern artworks to the city of Cologne. Since then, the museum, named after its creator, has continuously expanded its collections to include the most important art collections of the 20th and 21st centuries, including works by Picasso. In the Ludwig Museum, one trend is chasing the next! The museum has been focusing on modern art since the beginning of the 20th century. Through new collections, especially from young artists, the collection is regularly expanded, and special exhibitions are held regularly. The exhibition content mainly includes:-German expressionism-Russian avant-garde-Surrealist paintings-Picasso collection-Pop art-Contemporary art (since 1970 Since the ages)-hand-painted and graphics-photography and video In addition to works of art, I also like the line design in the museum, which is concise and intriguing. Detailed address: Heinrich-Böll-Platz, 50667 Köln Business hours: Tuesday to Sunday, "Public Holidays" from 10 am to 6 pm; the first Thursday of each month from 10 am to 10 pm; closed tickets on Mondays Valid throughout the day, 11 euros per adult

A great art gallery, I think the exhibition inside can be divided into three parts, one is a large number of Picasso's works, the other is modern art works, including pop art and ultramodernism, and the third part is a photography gallery .

attractions.name: Romano-Germanic Museum
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Germany, North Rhine-Westphalia, Cologne, Romano-Germanic Museum
reviews: The Romano-Germanic Museum is located in the center of Köln. Cologne is a 2000-year-old city that straddles the Rhine River in western Germany. It has long been settled by ancient Rome and is now the cultural center of the region. The Roman Museum contains Roman antiquities.

The Roman Germanic Museum displays a large number of cultural artworks. This museum is quite interesting. You can experience the history of Germanic style here. The collection is also quite rich. You can learn about some very unique items and precious collections. Oh. [View] The view here is pretty good [Value for money] Very good value for money

A very interesting museum. The first time I came across so many exquisite cultural relics and handicrafts in ancient Rome so close, I still find it incredible. It also displays some archaeological discoveries from Cologne since prehistoric times.

After visiting this museum, I realized that there were such exquisite and dazzling handicrafts and cultural relics in ancient Rome. I have always thought that it was either iron or gold. I didn't expect it to be so beautiful.

The original purpose of this museum was to protect the mosaics of Dionysus, a very precious and famous relic of ancient Rome. Now it has become a museum showing the civilization and art of ancient Rome.

attractions.name: Domschatzkammer
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Germany, North Rhine-Westphalia, Cologne, Domschatzkammer
reviews: Cologne Cathedral is a must-visit place for tourists in Cologne. The interior of the church itself is a treasure hall. Because the construction of the church took more than 600 years, spanning more than six centuries, during this period, the style and exquisiteness of religious works have been very good. The big change is that when you walk in the church, you can see many works of different styles, such as frescoes, reliefs, icon screens, etc., and slowly appreciate it, you can feel a very heavy sense of history.

The Cologne Cathedral is worth a visit. The traffic is very convenient. It is next to the Cologne Central Station and the Rhine River in front. The church is free to visit. The unique architectural design, built with heart for a hundred years, even visitors without religious beliefs can't help but respect and be amazed!

The Treasure Hall of Cologne Cathedral looks quite interesting. The treasure display area is full of precious artworks. The Cologne Cathedral is a free place to visit. The Treasure Hall displays a lot of precious royal art in German history.
[Fun] Treasures are all beautiful
[Scenery] The scenery is beautiful

A very shocking place, the treasure hall is expressly prohibited to take pictures. I can only describe in words, he is really worth visiting. If there is a chance, I am willing to go again, because what you see with your eyes is always more detailed than what you photograph! [Scenery] [Fun]
The Treasures of the Clone Cathedral exhibited many utensils for worship, as well as many precious medieval sculptures.

reviews: It is a high church, very creative and very Brazilian

The Stairway Church has a long history and is worth seeing! !

The Ladder Cathedral is located on the Chilean Avenue in Rio de Janeiro, Brazil. The style of this Catholic church is completely different from the traditional European architectural styles with ancient history, which is known for its elegance and magnificence. The whole church looks like a reinforced concrete from the outside. The pyramid has a staircase-like channel design on all sides, reaching the top, just like a staircase leading to heaven.
The interior style of the church is full of modernity and fashion. The dome is marked with a huge cross in the form of a glass skylight, and white glaze is used on all sides to pass through the dome from the ground. The center of the building space is a huge one tied to a golden cross. The statue of Jesus above, the whole building is open and simple.
When we arrived, it happened to be here at the inauguration ceremony of the giant clergy. At the end of the ceremony, the choir girls sang hymns. The whole scene was shocking.

The place that the local one-day tour group will basically go to is located in the center of the CBD. In fact, the most beautiful angle on the exterior of the building is the reflection of the opposite glass curtain wall building. The dome inside the church is an ordinary triangle but huge color The glass looks very rare and the bright cross on the top is also extremely shocking

attractions.name: Rocinha Favela
attractions.loc_tags: South America, Brazil, Rio de Janeiro, Rio de Janeiro, Rocinha Favela
attractions.address: Rio de Janeiro, State of Rio de Janeiro, Brazil
reviews: A night at one of Rio de Janeiro’s infamous favelas, will unquestionably be a new experience you're unlikely to forget in a hurry. Whist the prospect of dancing the night away in one of the city's most dangerous neighbourhoods sounds daunting, the reality is completely the opposite. Brazilians are renowned for knowing how to have a good time, and the nightlife in the favelas epitomises this, as the locals forget about their daily routines and let their hair down for a night of Favela madness! Just make sure you book it through a tour guide, rather than braving it by yourself.

Yo tourists...stay the hell out of this district.  The city of Rio is the only city in the world that has it's own army and many a time they are battling the drug lords in this Favela.  Every house here is illegal and the people here are not residents of Rio but deemed squatters.  This is not a tourist spot but the largest slum in the city and Brazil.
It was a block from the rich man's district, over the expensive high-rises, over the wooden pegged sheds and the low, crowded, broken-brick houses.

Brazil is a country with a wide gap between rich and poor, so slums exist in several major cities. The Rosignia slum is the most famous slum in Rio. The houses here are mostly old-fashioned buildings, and the sanitation is relatively poor. It is in sharp contrast with the bustling city not far away. This is the place where ordinary people in Brazil live and live. Many world-class stars walk out of these slums. It is really not easy. When you come here, you must pay attention to your own safety, especially your belongings. As the saying goes, if you do not encounter robbery and theft in Brazil, it is a miracle. Therefore, you must pay attention.

They are basically densely packed houses, but the colorful ones also form a very beautiful scenery. The inside of the line is indeed quite scary. It is recommended not to bring too much money in the past, because thieves are also more powerful.

reviews: We loved this botanical garden! This was our first trip to South America, so this garden was perfect to see loads of tropical trees, plants, flowers and nature life from the area. There are many picturesque spots with pagodas, statues, waterfalls, and ponds. We saw so many women have photoshoots here -- mostly maternity shots! There are tropical birds too and even a distant view of Christ the Redeemer.
It is a most beautiful garden and from there, there is a trail to go all the way up to the concrete Christ!

This botanical garden is one of the best I've ever seen. A huge expansive area of interesting tropical plans as well as several small animal sightings. The garden has many themed areas including a small Japanese tea garden. There is also a distant view of Christ the redeemer.

Unmissable! Walk through the forest green and has encounters with monkeys, toucans and other birds in our beautiful wildlife. If you get hungry, stop at the cafeteria that exists within the park and enjoy a snack in exellent atmosphere around centennial trees. The park entrance 200 meters from this property! Do not miss!
If you love the nature, you'll love the Botanical Garden.

Work of art from a man, Selaron, recently deceased, who collected tiles from all over the world for these steps.

This brightly colored staircase connects Lapa to St. Teresa. It is the handiwork of a Chilean genius by the name of Jorge Selaron. The 215 steps are covered by yellow, green, and blue tiles which are the colors of the Brazilan flag.

According to the tour guide, only their company has this privilege. Asked about the price, the domestic league is about 150 to 350 Brazilian reals, depending on the seat, the price should be very good!

Fortunately, during the Rio Olympics, I felt the closing ceremony at the Maracanã Stadium. The hot samba of tens of thousands of people, and the pouring rain could not extinguish the passion in the blood of the Brazilian people! It is very convenient to take the subway or take a taxi to the stadium. However, due to road closures during the Olympics, taxis could not enter this area after a long time. Obviously, the subway is more convenient. It takes only five minutes to walk to the stadium. The whole stadium still feels very grand, and it feels good.

Maracanã Stadium is a huge stadium with a very historic history. The structure of the entire stadium is very unique. It is also necessary to visit here. The environment and style of the stadium are very exquisite.
[Interest] Highly interesting
[Price/Price Ratio] Very unique price/performance ratio
[Scenery] The scenery is also beautiful

The Maracanã Stadium is one of the largest stadiums in the world, originally capable of accommodating 205,000 people. The 1950 World Cup was the biggest motivation for the Brazilians to build the Maracanã Stadium. Construction started on August 2, 1948. About 10,000 workers participated in the construction. It was opened before the World Cup on June 16, 1950. It was not until 1965 that the entire stadium was opened. Completed the construction. Unlike the platforms of other stadiums in the world, the platform of Maracanã Stadium is located in a deep trench around the lawn, and its height is much lower than that of the turf.

attractions.name: Tengchong Thermal Sea Scenic Area
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Yunnan, Baoshan, Tengchong, Tengchong Thermal Sea Scenic Area
reviews: ctripwld00064ctripwld00064

At the gate of the scenic spot around 9:12 in the morning on November 26, 2017, the tour will end at about 11:30, and more than 2 hours is enough. There are now more than ten attractions in the scenic area, such as large and small pots, hamazui, beautiful women's pond, lion head, pearl spring, drum spring, conceived well, fairy bathhouse and bathhouse river waterfall. The most impressive is the top hot sea hot pot, its diameter is more than 3 meters, water depth 1.5 meters, water temperature can reach 97 ℃, day and night boiling, four seasons hot steam. It is said that once there was a cow to the big boiling pot to eat salty spring water, accidentally fell into the pot, waiting for the shepherd boy from the village shouting for people, has boiled into a pot of beef. The first stop of Tengchong's trip is to the Atami Scenic Area. It takes half an hour from the city of Tengchong to the scenic spot. Parking in the scenic area is also very cheap. It is not too fast. The physical strength of the small partners can totally visit on foot. The geothermal resources of Tengchong are really rich. The whole hot sea scenic area is also the most rich place of Tengchong geothermal, and the whole scenic area's hot steam is filled like a wonderland. Follow the scenic scenic walking path to the hot sea big hot pot pot, experience the special steam food, feel the magic of nature. Fun, fun, good views, overall great, good value for money,

Today I send you a hot spring another good hot spring, bath valley photos, today this group is more than beautiful pools, especially natural sulfur pool water, just like milk, white, with red rose petals, that is called a beauty, that is called a cool. Yunnan is rich in geothermal resources, Tengchong is one of the three geothermal areas, Foquan is all over, especially the most representative of Thermal Sea. It is the second largest hot field in China, composed of the Thermal Sea stone, the big roll pot, the Bath Valley, the womb well, Pearl Spring, beautiful pool and so on.
