The core scenic area is the big hot pot, really.

attractions.name: Heshun Ancient Town
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Yunnan, Baoshan, Tengchong, Heshun Ancient Town
reviews: like a mysterious large zigzag village! not commercial like most of those ancient towns elsewhere, has local life and businesses! atmospheric, wavy streets next to a lake and wetlands! I suggest staying in heshun when visiting tengchong

A serene town which is not as commercial as the Lijiang Ancient Town.  You can still find many local residents staying in the town and there are many clan activities too. Very interesting town to visit.
I don't think the ticket actually worth the price, but all right

Heshun Ancient Town is like an ancient small village. There are volcanic-like hills around the village, there are large plateau rice fields, and there are many ponds with lotus flowers, which is very idyllic. The ancient town is very clean and tidy. Some of them are old buildings with adobe walls. Many of them were newly built in recent years and are quite beautiful. However, the overall architectural style is still relatively ancient, with more traditional features, and some are very fashionable inside but traditional outside. Walking on the streets of the ancient town, the roads are relatively narrow, and they are all small alleys. They are similar to the ancient city of Lijiang. There are many shops that do jade and jade business. Many people still live in the ancient town. Commercial attractions without permanent residents feel completely different. Except near the gate, the entire ancient town, especially the more remote places, is still very quiet. It is also good to live in the inn inside and enjoy the days in the quiet village.

On November 25, 2017, I arrived at about 1:43 pm, left around 6:25 pm, stayed for about 5 hours, basically the whole ancient town is finished, of course, many small attractions are also spent on a horse-travel, if you want to stay for a night. Heshun is an ancient town built in the Ming Dynasty. Most of the Han people in the area are descended from Sichuan, Jiangnan and Central Plains who came to Yunnan in the early Ming Dynasty to engage in military and civilian affairs. The scenery of the ancient town is still very good, and the weather that day is also good, blue sky and white clouds, the mood is very comfortable.

attractions.name: Beihai Wetlands
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, China, Yunnan, Baoshan, Tengchong, Beihai Wetlands
reviews: I was quite skeptical about this place , but after visiting, I just loved the beauty tucked in hills. I suggest walking the length of the wetlands and walk over the pathway on it! boating could be skipped!

Yunnan Province is the only national wetland reserve, is a plateau volcanic silt lake ecosystem, is a good place to escape from the city bustle, seek tranquility. The scenic area is surrounded by mountains, floating on the water, a variety of flowers and seas, not clear is the grassland or lake, like a colorful giant flower blanket, beautiful magic. In autumn and winter, although the grass withered yellow, but a large flock of migratory birds migration, can see hundreds of thousands of birds flocking spectacular scene. The mid-April to May of every year is the time when orchids bloom in the North Sea, and the most beautiful season in the North Sea.

It is better than expected, not only is the scenery beautiful, the ecological environment is good, but also a lot of water projects, come here for a day to enjoy. Water projects canoe, grass flying, etc., must go to play. Will come again next time.

The afternoon to the Beihai Wetland, the sun is strong, so the scenery is very good, the boat tour wetland, is a kind of enjoyment, enjoy the breath of nature. Saw a program here has been done, there are stars hanging here in large photos.

Jiang Ji/Travel Notes in Tengchong The first time I heard about Tengchong was more than ten years ago. At that time, a friend of the bank recommended this place to me after a vacation. The remoteness of the place and the me at that time I don't have much interest in traveling, so I didn't even think about it. In the past two years, I like to walk around before recombining the ideal place to go. Tengchong is the place I am looking forward to. This time I will visit Yunnan for the second time even if the journey is far away. Tengchong has a variety of landscapes, including a well-known Beihai wetland, a geopark that is well planned and protected. Wetland has always been not my favorite type of scenery, because in my impression the wetland should be a swamp, bubbling, dark and dirty, and then it will be swallowed accidentally, and it will get goose bumps when I think of it. But the wetlands in Tengchong or Yunnan are different. They are more like lakes, not dirty, and have plenty of water. The main thing is that there will be beautiful thick meadows on the top. This is something I don't understand very well, it's fun and beautiful. Obviously it is dense green grass. The long and densely packed pieces form a large piece on the water surface, but it is actually movable, like a floating iceberg. People can stand on it and use a bamboo pole to row like a boat. Locally called slippery. grass. There are swans on the lake with more water and less grass. The elegant and noble cruising, the sapphire-like water surface is stirred into ripples, which is very charming. There is also a platform that extends into the lake, and you can take a nap under a parasol. It is really beautiful to taste a pot of Dianhong, and it has a moving price. Tengchong also has rich geothermal resources. There is a geothermal park called Atami, which is full of smoke as soon as you enter it, which is like a sauna. The water temperature of the hot spring is very high, the average water temperature is 80 to 90 degrees, the water quality is smooth and full, a bit like oil texture. Along the way to the rocky walls of the mountains and the lush plants, the smell of sulphur floats over from time to time. Many people soak their feet on the side of the big boiling pot, which can be regarded as experiencing folk customs, although the price is not very friendly. Of course, I have to join in the fun. I can’t go to Atami and just talk about Xu Xiake. I still have to be grounded so as not to be made fun of. In this era, Xu Xiake's travel notes are uncommon, and the hot spring eggs can still have friends. There is also an ancient town in Tengchong, Heshun, which is as its name, Shihe Minshun. Heshun Ancient Town is not obtrusive, there is no strong commercial wind, more harmony and tranquility, it is a living ancient city. There is delicious food there, and there is a restaurant called Mom’s Taste that has won my heart, and it tastes like home. There are also shops selling Pu'er flower cakes, coffee shops, hand-made silver ornaments, and odds and ends of daily necessities. The overall taste of life is very strong, and there is a sense that she will be there if you come or not. The ancient town also has beautiful scenery, gentle and flexible, and ancient houses. The walls are mottled leaving traces of the years. There are neatly manicured green plants and wild flowers and weeds that grow randomly. I love it without deliberately not being artificial. I also drank a kind of juice squeezed from fresh dendrobium in the ancient city, which was refreshing and refreshing. Of course there are also people, the leisurely and calm people, even if the epidemic affects business, everyone still keeps a smile, not far-fetched or flattering. Our place in Tengchong is also very comfortable

reviews: overrated! too much walk and hike to see this. only worth if you plan this alongside rehai hot springs . then it’s a good deal

The big roll pot is the iconic attraction of the Atami, opened a "big roll pot restaurant" at the entrance of the scenic spot, which is the scenic restaurant. The restaurant has a large space, with large round tables mainly for many people. The restaurant's "big save" taste is great, although the price is more expensive than the small store outside, but it is better in the taste. In the most spectacular "big boiling pot" in the Atami, such as eight-foot shape, the pool is about 10 square meters wide, the depth of about 1.5 meters, the highest water temperature can exceed 97 degrees. Approaching the "big boiling pot" can feel the foot ironing, the pool water suddenly turn, leap out of the water, forming a large splash. Because the water is high enough, local people in the side of the corn, eggs, peanuts into a pot to cook, raw eggs can be cooked in five minutes, other food is also immediately available, flavor.

As the only five-a-level scenic spot in Tengchong, Atami is really a worthwhile trip! The geological landscape is very strange, the scenery is pleasant, and the trail is easy to sign in place, which is a must-see attraction in Tengchong. It's rare to wait for a quiet photo without anyone else getting in the way because of the epidemic. The view is good, fun and fun, and overall it's amazing.

reviews: 🌸To Tengchong travel, how can you not go to the hot spring? Very good hot spring experience, many outdoor pools, being in the nature, it is very enjoyable. There are too few varieties of refreshments and should be improved. It is very good in general and recommended.

attractions.name: Noboribetsu Bear Park
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Hokkaido, Noboribetsu, Noboribetsu Bear Park
reviews: The tobetsu bear ranch, which is located not far from Wenquan Street, is the home of the slogan “Please pay attention to bears coming in and out” in Hokkaido. It is divided into the first ranch, the second ranch and the bear ranch, and the museum has more than 500 items on display. You can buy the feeds of bears in the garden, feed the cute bears, and watch the brown bears play.

There are not many scenic spots in Noboribetsu. In fact, you come to Noboribetsu more to enjoy hot spring hotels. Since you are here, you still have to come to see Jigokudani and Bear Ranch. After returning from Jigokudani to the hotel, I booked a shuttle bus to the Bear Ranch. In fact, the distance is very close, and the hot spring street is here. It was good to walk all the way back from the hot spring street when I was in the process. When you arrive at the bear farm, buy a ticket first and support WeChat payment. Remember that you can use red envelopes, so it is the most cost-effective to buy one by one person. Then take the cable car to see the raging! I actually saw a special hanging fish on the cable car. It is estimated that it was sent to the bears to eat~ The bear farm is actually not very playable. The only fun is to feed the bears to eat bear biscuits. The bears will fight for food, but also for tourists to feed themselves, some beckon and some are cute. One of their favorite bears will grab their feet and shake them like a tumbler. I don’t know where I learned the posture. Really It's so cute! After watching the bear, I continued to walk forward. I felt like I was in a small village. The small houses are so cute. I guess I can sell small commodities when it gets hotter. Go to the Bear Restaurant for lunch, the taste is not bad, then go to the Bear Museum to visit, continue outdoor activities, watching the sea in the snow scene is really beautiful! There is actually an observatory. We coined a coin and looked into the distance with binoculars, and actually saw the cruise ship on the opposite side. There is also a photo spot here, where you can take pictures of the lake behind. The two Chinese couples have been here for a long time and we can only take a long view...All in all, it’s worth the price. It’s very original in winter. Naturally!
Baby Bear, Bear 🐻 Don't farm many brown bears live here or a lot of cows are here. A large range of ranch connects the town, especially many locals and domestic tourists want to play here.
There are several attractions in the bear ranch, such as museums, observatory, first bear ranch, second bear ranch, etc.... and exclusive bear show time. Also... Duck races~ can bet...

For a holiday in Noboribetsu, in addition to having a big meal and soaking in the hot springs at the hot spring hotel, there is also the lovely bear ranch, an attraction!
Come out of Hell Hot Springs, go back to the hotel for a short rest, and set off for the Bear Ranch! A worthwhile trip! You can play in the snow in winter~
We stayed in Daiichi Takimoto. When we went there, the hotel’s shuttle bus took us there. On the return trip, we walked back along the hot spring street. Although it is a bear farm, there are many other small animals.
You can take the cable car, feed the big bears, play in the snow, visit the museum...you won't be bored all afternoon to play~ It is very suitable for parents and children!
Once you enter the bear ranch, it is a small shop. You can take the cable car after buying the ticket next to the shop!
On the cable car, I also saw a cable car specially equipped with dried fish, which is probably food for the raging people.
Buy small biscuits to feed the big bears. In order to eat the biscuits, the bears sell cute and fight fakes...
After having a curry meal in the restaurant, I visited the Bear Museum.
Going to the end of the pasture, you will see a lot of thatched houses, as if you have come to another world, very suitable for taking pictures!
I saw the beauty of the sea and sky along the way! Although this attraction is a bit naive compared to other sightseeing spots in Japan, and even not very playable, it is still very interesting to be able to experience different activities by jumping in the snow~
After leaving the ranch, continue to take the cable car back. You can go to the store in the bear ranch and buy some souvenirs. There are many raccoons who say...
On the return trip, you can stroll around the hot spring street, eat snacks, and play gashapon~

attractions.name: Noboribetsu Date Jidai Mura
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Hokkaido, Noboribetsu, Noboribetsu Date Jidai Mura
reviews: Samurai village. Pretty awesome and kitschy at the same time.

The time village of denbeida, a very beautiful and original village, is very beautiful and worth seeing to understand this place, to see the beautiful and different scenery to let you feel the beauty and difference here,

When you enter Shidai Village, you will see many wooden buildings such as civilian residential areas full of Edo flavor and luxurious and magnificent samurai residences, which are said to have been copied after researching the times. There are also ninja houses, various rides and many exciting and interesting performances, such as experiencing the ninja’s "Blowing Arrows". It took my boss's energy, but I still missed the goal at all. …And the "old people" in Edo costumes are walking on the street. Visitors can also take photos with them, experience Japanese tea ceremony, Edo period food, etc.

This place can be played for a day [sneak laugh] The buildings here are modeled after the Edo period. It seems to be back in the Edo period. There are samurai, ninjas, and oiran, various cosplays, and the whole streetscape. They are all restored through textual research, and the buildings have a sense of age

A theme park reflecting the customs of the Edo period, including houses, streets, restaurants, theaters, temples, etc. It is worth seeing ninja fighting performances and oiran plays, which can give you a better experience of that era. Apart from that, there is a haunted house. The Thousand Cat Temple seems ordinary, and you only know the mystery when you enter.

attractions.name: Oyunuma Pond
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Hokkaido, Noboribetsu, Oyunuma Pond
reviews: The area is volcanic, rich in geothermal and precipitation, which makes the hot springs, known as the "Japan's first soup", the hot spring resort on the island. On either side of the hot spring street, a variety of hot spring hotels and shops, many of the goods in the shops are related to ghosts. Walking around the town, you can see many sculptures of ghosts and various festivals in different seasons.
The scenery in the place of Dayuzhao, Hokkaido, is very busy and beautiful, and in the autumn, you can see the beautiful 🍁 maple leaves and the clear springs in the lake. It is very refreshing.
Great natural engineer, I really impressed you! ! ! ! !

Oyunuma-located near Jigokudani. It was originally the exit left by the eruption of the volcano. The hot spring water here is hot, more than 100 degrees Celsius, and all the hot spring hotels in Noboribetsu use the spring water here. This is the source of Noboribetsu Onsen. You can experience this natural hot spring at close range. There is a free foot bath for tourists to experience. If you want to enjoy the hot springs in Noboribetsu, you should return to the hotel. Many hotels can experience pure Japanese bathing.

During our trip to Sapporo, we had a pleasant and interesting day at this attraction arranged by Hokkaido Nature Tourism Company. It is worth a try to watch and experience Japanese traditional culture in a historical environment. The performances of the oiran and the samurai are also very interesting, and the restaurants, souvenir shops and toilet facilities are very good, making people feel extremely comfortable.

attractions.name: Noboribetsu Marine Park Nixe
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Hokkaido, Noboribetsu, Noboribetsu Marine Park Nixe
reviews: The Nixe Ocean Park is covered by mist and white snow, like a castle. The winter sun is full of the park. During the stroll, you feel like you are in a fairy tale world. There are different museum areas here, which are very suitable for shooting. A place for beautiful photos or outings.
The tobetsu marine park in Hokkaido is still a very beautiful marine park, the aquarium animals inside is still very many, it is worth to everyone to visit and see, there are large marine life.

It's five to ten minutes walk from Noboribetsu Station. Obvious building. This is an aquarium, not a zoo. There are corresponding performances in different exhibition halls at each time. If you have two hours, you can still come and have a look, and there is no need to come deliberately if time is tight. Here you can have a meal or casual snacks.

Before leaving Noboribetsu, I went to the aquarium. It was only 5 minutes walk from JR station. You can store your suitcases at the place where you can buy tickets, 300 yen a cabinet. Penguin walks twice a day. Compared with the penguin walks at Asahiyama Zoo, the walk here is much shorter. It feels like 5-10 minutes is over. The penguins at Asahiyama Zoo walk about 40 minutes each time, so you can enjoy watching. In addition to the penguins, I also watched the dolphin show. The child was drawn to interact with the dolphins. The impression was quite deep. In addition, I saw a lot of fish and animals that I hadn't seen before. Although it is a small aquarium, it is still a bit tiring to walk around. Compared with Asahiyama Zoo, Asahiyama is definitely better, but if you have a lot of children in Noboribetsu, it is still worth experiencing.

It’s very close to Noboribetsu Station. Ctrip directly buys the ticket and prints it out. Now you can directly exchange the ticket to enter the park. The scenic area is not big, but it is very delicate. The most fun is the penguin walk. The staff leads a group of penguins leisurely Walking on the ground, the naive look is too cute!

attractions.name: Sengen Park
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Hokkaido, Noboribetsu, Sengen Park
reviews: Quanyuan Park is still very worth going to the Chongduo Park in Hokkaido. The hotel hot springs in the hotel are not really fun, and the park is still very beautiful, a touch of cold in winter.

In order to get back to the bottom, I will go in the morning and evening... The bathroom of the room has never been used haha... It takes courage to soak in the outdoor swimming pool in winter. It feels great to soak in the hot spring while watching the snow scene!
There are so many choices for the buffet breakfast, but I have no choice but to lose my appetite during the two nights in Noboribetsu... After a little taste, the taste is still ok. If you want to eat in the room, you need to book in advance, we didn't make an appointment, but my husband still likes to go to the restaurant to eat what he likes, because there are too many choices for dinner! The seafood is very fresh!
The hotel has a bus to Sapporo, remember to book in advance, be sure to board the bus at the departure time, don't be late!

At the entrance of Noboribetsu Onsen Street, opposite the Daiichi Taki Main Building, there is a Sengen Park. The intermittent hot springs are sprayed from time to time. They are very hot and hot. They are separated by fences and cannot be approached. They are almost like boiling water. They are extremely hot. There are 9 different colored sticks on the open space. These are the golden sticks used by the "Yuguishen" who guards 9 different hot springs, adding a weirdness to the hell town of Noboribetsu.

Quanyuan Park is a small park, it can't be considered a scenic spot. It’s a few steps from the first Taki main building to here. If you have enough time, you can walk around. It’s very comfortable to walk out after soaking in the hot spring.

Go down to the hot spring street, the Quanyuan Park on the street, the park is very small, just a small yard, there is a small wellhead, spring water erupts every 3 hours. There are several symbolic ghosts in Quanyuan Park and Hot Spring Street. This pair is a ghost image of love, and this one is a stool. Ghosts who read books, pray for qualified ghosts. A ghost who prays for recovery from disasters and diseases. The ghosts in Noboribetsu are not hideous, but cute.

attractions.name: Yuzawa Shrine
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Hokkaido, Noboribetsu, Yuzawa Shrine
reviews: Yuzawa Jinja shrine is a shrine with many kinds in Japan, and it is the same as the traditional culture, and it worships its own omikami, and Amaterasu omikami is the most worshipped omikami, but this Koji is different from Tokyo.

Yuzawa Shrine is right next to the Daiichi Taki Honkan, and you will surely pass on the way to Jigokudani. According to legend, it was founded by Takimoto Kinzo, the founder of the Daiichi Taki Honkan in 1858. Going through the red torii, all the way up the stairs, you will reach Yuzawa Shrine at the end. The shrine is enshrined by the Emperor Oshin, and Takimoto Kinzo is also a god of worship under the name "Takigawa No Yumoto." There is a monument to Takimoto Kinzo on the side.

Stopped by on the way to Jigokudani, right next to the park. The scenery of the shrine is pretty good, but there is no need to go there specially. Maybe it was earlier, and the shrine did not open. The Omori bought in the shrine is very interesting. It's probably autumn, so the scenery is very good. Hokkaido in October is really beautiful! The smoke of Jigokudani can be seen in the nearby creek, and you can reach Jigokudani with a few more steps. (Hell Valley is worth a visit) Yes, I recommend Hokkaido limited corn juice, which is available in vending machines and supermarkets!

A shrine outside Jigokudani is relatively small, but very delicate, with two straight escalators going up to the gate, much like a scene in anime. Climbing up the high stairs, Yuzawa Shrine is the quietest place in Noboribetsu.

Compared to the shrines and temples we saw in Kyoto and other places, it is not so popular. A particularly quiet shrine is certainly not a tourist hotspot. After soaking in the hot springs, you are attracted to walk out.

attractions.name: Noboribetsu Primeval Forest
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Hokkaido, Noboribetsu, Noboribetsu Primeval Forest
reviews:
Stay in the first Takimoto main hotel including breakfast and dinner.
For dinner, enjoy the buffet in the primeval forest on the third floor, and you can enter from 5:30 to 7 in the evening.
The buffet area is very large, with a wide range of varieties, basically all local specialties of Hokkaido. The dining area is also very spacious.
Crab legs and sashimi are all you can eat, but you have to line up to get food~
On the first day, I was sick and couldn't eat it. I felt that I missed hundreds of millions!

It’s a very beautiful place. Before we went to the hot springs, we went to the virgin forest. It was lush and green, the air was good, and the scenery was quite good. It was a bit tired to go to the hot springs after walking for a while. Couldn't be better

If you come to Noboribetsu to soak in the hot springs, the virgin forest is also worth a trip. There are many plants in the forest. It can be said that there are big trees everywhere, the air is particularly good, and there are many hot springs.

From Jigokudani to Oyunuma and then to the natural foot bath, you will walk through the forest trails. In fact, we should not go deep into the forest. We just walked on the edge. There are not so strong trees. Although the woods are dense, the trees are still small and very thin. However, the oxygen polyphenols in the forest are indeed very strong, and the air has a slight sulphur smell, more of the smell of fresh soil and leaves. The path to the natural foot bath is not very easy. Don't think about going to soak your feet after a while, just wear a double pinch and drag it over.

After visiting a small road along the Jigokudani Valley, it is full of wild fun and soil. For the two legs that have just completed 42K, the downhill road is not shaky but also very sour. The air here is fresh and the green vegetation is lush in the late summer. There are also dense mushrooms draped on the trees. There is really a kind that is willing to stay for a long time and can't go. Nongfushanquan can't go away for a lifetime....Hahaha Winter is another style, a frozen path. It's slippery, but the natural free foot bath is definitely another fun. After 5 minutes of soaking, the whole person is warmed up, and it is strong

attractions.name: Noboribetsu Onsen Flower Tunnel
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Hokkaido, Noboribetsu, Noboribetsu Onsen Flower Tunnel
reviews: Because I mainly went to see the flower fields and hot springs, I didn’t see the cherry blossoms when I went to the Sakura Road, and I didn’t see the snow scenery, but the scenery is also good, the building is beautiful, and the weather is not too hot. of.

It’s a very beautiful cherry blossom road. I don’t know if I will be told that I admire foreigners, but I think the feeling of viewing cherry blossoms in Japan is different. It may be due to the soil and climate. I think Japanese cherry blossoms are more beautiful.
What month is the cherry blossom festival in Hokkaido? Can I see it if I plan to go 4-22? Which city in Hokkaido has it?
The rows of cherry blossoms on both sides are so beautiful. If you visit here in spring, you must come here.

The cherry blossoms were gone when we went, there were only a few trees left by the residents on the roadside. So I can only give a general comment. I hope I can have a chance to see the cherry blossoms in full bloom next time.

attractions.name: Ōwakudani
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Kanagawa, Ashigarashimo, Hakone, Ōwakudani
reviews: Here is the most popular place to visit in Hakone. Instead of seducing the visitors with the exquisite sight of greenery like any other area in Hakone, Owakudani Valley provides a bizarre attraction of surface manifestations of Geothermal System like sulphur fumaroles, hot springs, and boiling spring. Besides that, Owakudani Station is connected to few other interesting attractions around Hakone like some hiking trails, ropeaway rides, one of which leads to Lake Ashiko and its sightseeing cruise. Moreover, it’s a place of Hakone Geomuseum and big souvenir. All good reasons to be attracted to.

Hakone two-day tour, I bought a package ticket in the visitor center, a fairly cost-effective choice, just swipe the ticket in Hakone throughout the trip, ok! Various transportation, cable car, small train, cruise ship, bus, casual ride, the road is less big wakudani is a must-kick place, the earth heat is flying in the sky, eat a black hot spring egg, overlook Mount Fuji, Xiaohong banner 🚩 even if plugged in

The source of Hakone hot spring, also known as the Great Hell, is a crater site formed by the eruption of volcanoes more than 3,000 years ago. Because of the high sulfur content, hot springs here can not be directly bubbled, can enjoy sulfur steam and hot springs, when the weather can look out on Mount Fuji.

Owakudani is a product of geothermal activity, remind everyone that this volcano has not stopped cooking... The overall gas effect is similar to Noboribetsu Jigokudani. The air is filled with the smell of hydrogen sulfide common in volcanic areas. The famous hot spring boiled eggs, and the egg shell will be Boil black, no internal changes. The tour is generally through the famous Hakone Tozan Railway, changing the cable car, and overlooking the smoky old mountain pass in the air. After getting off the cable car at Owakudani Station, you can walk up close for a few minutes (note that the gas is irritating).
Owakudani is often not open, everyone has to calculate the time.

attractions.name: Lake Ashi (Ashinoko)
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Kanagawa, Ashigarashimo, Hakone, Lake Ashi (Ashinoko)
attractions.address: Kanagawa Prefecture Ashigarashimo-gun Hakone machi Hakone Machi
reviews: very nice trip
You can go on a pirate ship across this lake, very nice views! You are meant to be able to see Mt Fuji, but it''s still worth the trip even if you don''t.

The scenery here is so beautiful, it is a must-visit when in Hakone. A tour of the lake is taken by ferry during which you learn the history behind the lake. The lake was formed from a previous volcanic eruption, so it's a crater lake, which is interesting. On clear days you'll see Mount Fuji and various shrines. Even if it's not clear it's still an enjoyable lake cruise.

The local bus climbs up the mountain and then down to Lake Ashi. A must visit for the views of Mount Fuji set against the lake. A tori gate on the far shore adds to the beauty of the view. A park along the lakeshore allows you to get some height for added vistas but it was closed when we went.
Lake Ashi is beautiful, especially when the fog is rolling in. Take a boat ride across the lake or one of the gondolas up the side of the mountain. Beautiful!

attractions.name: Hakone Shrine / Kuzuryu Shrine Singu
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Kanagawa, Ashigarashimo, Hakone, Hakone Shrine / Kuzuryu Shrine Singu
reviews: Set on the shore of Ashi in the town of Hakone, this shrine has amazing views in all kinds of weather. The cedar-lined paths are very relaxing. I've never seen this shrine that crowded, which is nice. Very peaceful. Make sure to bring your camera as these are iconic Hakone views!
From Hakone Yumoto station by bus Hakone Tozan Bus it takes 35 minutes or from Moto-Hakone harbour by walk only few minutes. The road is lined with lanterns. The shrine is still open and is free.

Hakone Jinja Shrine is at the foot of Hakone Mountain, is a very old shrine, in the Kanto region also has a high status. See this ancient tree, feel the age, it is said that there are 800 old trees on both sides of the pilgrimage road.

Hakone Shrine has a long history and may be worse than other large shrines in terms of the scale of construction, but the scenery is far ahead of its peers... The first time you check in is Lake Torii, you will definitely notice this when you visit Lake Ashinoko in fine weather. The red color is the dense forest in the Hakone Mountains. It is said that many trees are more than 800 years old. It is refreshing to walk on the path of worship when the weather is good.

One of the recommended places is mainly in a deep mountain and old forest, and there is a large lake in front, and a red place can be seen from a distance. In fact, I am not particularly interested in shrines, but the air inside is very fresh.

attractions.name: Venetian Glass Museum
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Kanagawa, Ashigarashimo, Hakone, Venetian Glass Museum
attractions.address: 940-48 Sengokuhara, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa Prefecture
reviews: The glass forest museum has many kinds of glass products, big and small, we happened to meet the glass insect exhibition, the craft is very beautiful. If you have the Kamakura Hakone Travel Ticket to buy tickets is a discount, if you are going to the Glass Mori and Little Prince Museum, it is recommended to buy a package ticket more appropriate.

Located in the beautiful Hakone Mountains, the Glass Art Museum is an attraction that meets the needs of modern tourists to check in... But it is difficult to take good photos, after all, glass does not match your automatic aperture. The artworks displayed in the gallery are mainly Venetian glass products from centuries ago, as well as landscapes made by modern makers combined with optical means, together with European-style retro buildings, which are gorgeous and elegant.

One of Hakone’s favorite places, I will definitely go if I get the chance. It's very close to the Little Prince Museum, you can walk there. Originally, my ancestors didn't want to go in at the door, but after I called in, they couldn't move their legs anymore. Step by step, plants, crystals, and European-style cottages are integrated, and the whole garden is shining in the sun. My daughter was five years old and had been shopping inside for a long time and she was very happy. As expected, daughters of every grade like sparkling things. If you go to Hakone, let's make arrangements to walk. There is a small garden below. You have to go down a flight of stairs. If you have enough time, you can sit in the cafe for a long time. It is definitely an Internet celebrity cafe in the mountains.

It's as beautiful as a dream, and it's a princess to pick a sunny day. The exquisite foreign style of the Japanese. There is a handsome and nice middle-aged shop manager in the museum shop. He feels that his welcome to Chinese customers is very sincere. There will be concerts on time, and the restaurant will have the right food and good food. It's worth going.

The Glass Forest Art Museum in Hakone is magnificent and worth visiting! As soon as we entered, it was just like a fairy tale world. The sun was so beautiful that it twinkled and twinkled, and we were able to stroll in it for a day without wanting to come out. I have never seen such a wonderful glass exhibition. The overall layout of the moving line has a winding path and progresses step by step. This part of our domestic art museum is still a virgin land. Japanese art museums and art galleries are really the best in Asia.

attractions.name: The Little Prince Museum
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Kanagawa, Ashigarashimo, Hakone, The Little Prince Museum
attractions.address: 909 Sengokuhara, Hakone, Ashigarashimo District, Kanagawa Prefecture
reviews: The entrance fee is 1600¥ and the tour is quite fast. I like the book but the museum is more about learning about Saint Exupery's life and having nice place to take pictures. the decor looks like old "France" but you can tell it needs a bit of renewal.  you can get discounts with Hakone Pass or if you buy multiple tickets to other museum in Hakone.

A  little bit of France in the heart of Japan! The museum is well worth a visit just to admire the recreation of French architecture and culture. If you're a Antoine De Saint-Exupery fan, this should be on your "must see" list. The museum contains a number of artifacts from the author and it is really well presented (although descriptions are in Japanese only). Make sure to stop in the cafe for some cute desserts!

One of the sweetest places ever, so sincere and thoughtful. Plus informative, well kept, beautiful grounds, worth an excursion. They go all out here to bring things to life. The docent tours are wonderful, even if you don't speak Japanese. It's mostly a tribute to how the sad adventurous life of the book's author, Antoine de Saint-Exupéry, led him to write one of the world's great parables. An inspiration whether you grew up with the book or you've never heard of it.
It is the good place for bringing the kids to here.

The Princess Museum is the only museum in the world with the theme of Princess. The streets are very French, with outdoor gardens, Lyon streets, exhibition rooms and St. Ethebury's Church. There are also flowers and figures familiar to the Princess. Revisit the scenes. There are restaurants, coffee shops and souvenir shops. Those who like the story of Little Prince or want to take a beautiful photo are recommended to visit the Little Prince Museum to experience the 1940s French style.

attractions.name: The Hakone Open-Air Museum
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Kanagawa, Ashigarashimo, Hakone, The Hakone Open-Air Museum
reviews: This museum is one of the best sculpture museums I have ever seen. The setting is beautiful and the range of artists is amazing, featuring over 120 different ones. A few of the installations are great for children as they are interactive and allow then to climb on them. Be sure to soak your feet in the citrus-infused stream! Don't bother paying to rent a towel, just dry off in the sun.

One of most popular and most visited museums in Hakone which is covered in Hakone Free Pass. Hakone Open Air Museum is an unique and interesting museum which exhibits various modern sculptures in a huge open space. Using the natural beauty of Hakone makes this open space is exciting enough to pay a visit, especially on a shiny day. The museum also has few indoor spaces that exhibit any other artworks. The artworks of Picasso are one of the museum prominent collections. A right place for leisure and education.

“Toshiko Horiuchi MacAdam’s crocheted playscapes, which have gone viral, have organic shapes and eye-popping colors; like something out of a Dr. Seuss book,” says Playscapes blogger Paige Johnson. “They are a unique way to experience an artwork...through play.” MacAdam’s Woods of Net at the Open-Air Museum is no exception. Knit entirely by hand, the playground allows children to crawl in, swing on, and jump through the vibrant netting. The work itself is sheltered by a Lincoln Log–esque pavilion, providing visitors a break from both the outdoor elements and the more adult-oriented exhibits at the museum.

What a gem! An amazing collection of sculptures by international artists placed in magnificent outdoor setting and surrounded by mountain views! It is definitely worth a visit, especially if you are in Hakone/Mt. Fuji area.  This was opened in 1969 as the first open-air museum in Japan. Besides outdoor sculptures, there are also indoor exhibition halls – one of them, Picasso Pavilion, has a collection of works by Picasso (pottery, paintings, sculptures). There are interesting places for children to play, as well as stained glass tower to climb. You can easily spend a few hours here – walk around, take pictures, eat lunch at a restaurant, and end your visit with a hot spring foot bath.
MUST GO HERE! It's like Burning Man.

attractions.name: Hakone Gora Park
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Kanagawa, Ashigarashimo, Hakone, Hakone Gora Park
reviews: The train ride is scenic. The Hydrania flowers were lovely. The soba resturant and mochi resturant were delicious. The train winds in a zig zag pattern up the mountainous area. The temperature was nice and cool, around 17-20 degrees. I recomend taking your time and stopping at train stops along the route to Gora to sightsee the area. Though after 5pm it may be hard to find some place to eat.

If Gora Park is not so famous in the city, it would be great to have such a European-style park in the mountains of Hakone... The flower fountain is surrounded by the mountains, and the strange rocks and strange trees take the path as the axis. It’s a must-go stop for the tram to go up the mountain. It’s also good to pass by the park. If you just look at the best spots, it’s no regrets to skip this place and go directly to the cable car to Lake Ashinoko.

A small Japanese-style courtyard was found in Gora Park in Hakone, with a hidden gate and fence. There was no signboard introduction at the door, so I pushed the door gently and walked in. There was a small sign that stood temporarily in the courtyard. This small courtyard was a tea garden where the owner used to serve tea. The history of this hut is more than a hundred years old. To visit the front hut, you can walk into the lower part of the porch, take off your shoes and enter the porch, and you will see a notice of 350 yen tea fee per person, and someone will welcome you from the inside. For less than a cup of coffee, you can enjoy tea in a hut that has been around for more than 100 years, and it’s not bad to experience Japanese service. Refreshment services are also provided in many Japanese parks, such as the ancient building Shugetsujeong in Kagawa Kuribayashi Park. The price is reasonable and not more expensive than a cup of coffee.

It's already afternoon here because of the time, so I went out with friends casually. Personally, I went to the pottery experience workshop and it was quite interesting, but I didn't plan to try it when other people were not interested. . The shops in the park are a bit uncharacteristic. In addition, there is a botanical garden and an insect garden. It feels like a place with better facilities than scenery.

Hakone Gora Park is a French-style rock garden built at the foot of Soun Mountain. It was opened in 1914 and was the first French-style garden developed by Japanese tourism. This symmetrical western garden park with a fountain as the center covers an area of 36,000 square meters, and the park is paved with a walking path made of natural rocks. It blooms all year round. Hakone is a very popular park in Japan. In summer or Christmas, you can see modeling lights or night-lighting installations. It is one of the few parks that are suitable for play throughout the year. In addition to fountains and flower beds, there are three botanical gardens in the park. They are: the wide "Bougainvillea Pavilion" with exotic flowers and plants and a southern atmosphere; the "Tropical Plant Pavilion" with tropical plants such as rubber and banana trees as the theme. There is also the "Tropical Vanilla Museum" where about 70 types of tropical herbs are gathered. There are cherry blossom trees near Qiangyuan Park, which is famous for its azaleas. In addition, in Gora Park, there are handicraft workshops where you can experience pottery and glass blowing, and there are places where you can easily experience the tea ceremony in Japan, such as the Baiyundong Tea Garden. In the "Baiyundong Tea Garden" tea room, visitors can also taste Japanese matcha and Japanese sweets.

attractions.name: Hakone Ropeway
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Kanagawa, Ashigarashimo, Hakone, Hakone Ropeway
reviews: This literally took our breath away as we breached the hillside on the ropeway and saw Mount Fuji in front of us! What a special way to view the mountain. Cheap and easy to use.

Hakone is located in the southwest of Kanagawa Prefecture, 90 kilometers away from Tokyo. It is a hot spring and health resort in Japan. The Hakone Tozan Cable Car is one of the seven modes of transportation in the Hakone area (Hakone Tozan Line, Hakone Tozan Bus, Hakone Tozan Cable Car, Hakone Sky Rope, Hakone Pirate Ship, Odakyu Hakone Express Bus, Numazu Tozan Tokai Bus), and you can use Hakone Travel pass.

Friends who come to play must buy the Hakone free pass, which is really a bargain! ! All kinds of traffic just sit! Tram, mountain bus, mountain cable car, aerial cable car, pirate sightseeing boat, to Hakone is basically to enjoy the scenery on these vehicles. Going to Owakudani to see the smoke of the volcanic crater and eat black eggs is a must-have place for everyone who comes to Hakone!

I have been to Hakone several times. The hotel is located near the Sengokuhara Ropeway Station. The Hakone Ropeway is the main means of transportation. The Hakone Freepass can be used for free. The scenery along the way is so beautiful that you can overlook Mount Fuji from far and near, and feel the special landforms of Owakudani. When the weather is good, the blue sky and white clouds are very beautiful.

The most interesting thing about free travel in Hakone is to use the Hakone Free Pass to take various transportations. The cable car is very good. Owakudani Station is very large. Usually everyone takes the romantic train from Shinjuku, Tokyo. It is basically lunch time. Click here to relax, have a delicious lunch and visit Owakudani Valley
