reviews: ot much more I can say, other than how lovely the views were. The queues can get fairly long but like everything else in Japan they are orderly and move quickly.
这个小火车游览起来很方便，夏天6-7月路边会开满紫阳花，在花丛中穿梭美极了，路上会路过很多公园美术馆，下车不远就可以游览，大师作品哦。

I have been to Hakone several times. The hotel is located near the Sengokuhara Ropeway Station. The Hakone Ropeway is the main means of transportation. The Hakone Freepass can be used for free. The scenery along the way is so beautiful that you can overlook Mount Fuji from far and near, and feel the special landforms of Owakudani. When the weather is good, the blue sky and white clouds are very beautiful.

Standing behind the driver's glass door in the first carriage, looking at the railroad tracks meandering and circling forward, the signal stations on the mountain roads are widely distributed, and it feels that every cable car stop is a landscape with tourists going up and down. The seat on the car is a major feature. The surface of the chair is warm, and it looks like there is a heating system underneath.

Hakone’s cable car is also a tourist attraction worth visiting. He is a cable car from Soun Station to the top of Hakone Mountain. This section of the cable car is probably built with Swiss technology. There is also a clock presented by Switzerland on the platform. The scenery along the mountain is very beautiful while sitting in the car.

attractions.name: Pamukkale Thermal Pools
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Turkey, Aegean Region Turkey, Pamukkale, Pamukkale Thermal Pools
reviews: Turkey is very cold, Pamukkale is also very cold, but in Pamukkale’s hot spring pools, it’s okay to take off your shoes and barefoot. The spring water is very warm and it’s very comfortable to step on, but it’s still a bit cold when you come out to wear your shoes.

The white limestone and the Turkish blue water are really a rare beauty. However, these thermal pools are actually not hot, and it is very cool to step in. However, it is really painful to step on the limestone with bare feet! You must know how to choose shallow textures and It is more comfortable to walk in densely. A real natural hot spring.

Went with friends and family a few days ago. This should be the best attraction in Turkey. In the cold winter, warm water flows under your feet, and the hot spring pool is the best. scenery is beautiful. No shoes are allowed to enter the swimming pool. So please bring spare clothes and towels to dry yourself. Really natural hot spring.

If you are traveling, it will be very busy. Usually everyone starts from the top of the mountain, so it is very busy. We walked up from the lower entrance. The lower pool was very empty and warm, so you can take good pictures and relax yourself. Really natural hot spring.

Pamukkale-a name too familiar to my ears, I have been looking forward to it for too long. The water color of Pamukkale’s hot springs is an opaque, high-brightness sky blue infused with milk into the sky with clouds. recommend!

attractions.name: Hierapolis
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Turkey, Aegean Region Turkey, Pamukkale, Hierapolis
reviews: The great baths were constructed with huge stone blocks without the use of cement and consisted of various closed or open sections linked together. There are deep niches in the inner section,including the bath, library, and gymnasium.

The ancient Roman ruins in Hierapolis are listed on the World Heritage List, including the theater tombs and some thermal baths. It inherits the Greek style, the main street is one kilometer long, and it is extremely comfortable to walk on the ancient road with wormwood on both sides, blowing the wind of the wilderness. The most important thing is the ancient Roman theater, which is very large in scale and suitable for taking pictures. It is amazing.

Hierapolis, also translated as Hiye Apolis, is an ancient city ruins. In Pamukkale, it was caught in a rainstorm that was rare in a few days and was trapped for an entire hour, but after getting through it, good photos were still taken.

The interior is still very large, or the same sentence: if you have plenty of time or are studying history and art, you can stay for a while. There is also a ruins museum inside. If you know less about this area, you can actually arrange 2 hours. After visiting the main attractions. Historical monuments, my favorite.

The ruins of the ancient city closely connected to Pamukkale is an abandoned city-state in Greece. Tickets are included in Pamukkale. Not many people know about it. Those who like historical sites can take a good look. Sheila is Hera. Liss is the meaning of the city. You can see the ruins of the arena, baths and other ruined walls. The atmospheric amphitheater is also a testament to the glory of the year.

attractions.name: Hierapolis Archaeology Museum
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Turkey, Aegean Region Turkey, Pamukkale, Hierapolis Archaeology Museum
reviews: The various cultural relics unearthed there are basically preserved in this archeological museum. The museum is also divided into two parts: open-air and indoor. Of course, all of them have come here. You must come to this museum to appreciate it.

The Archaeological Museum is right next to the ruins. The whole place is not big, so it won't take two hours to visit together. It is recommended that everyone should take a look, because the good things have been moved in.

Don't miss this place. Although it is called a museum, it is actually an archaeological shed, but there are all kinds of great artworks and cultural relics unearthed from this site, which is very worth seeing.

This museum is not big, but it is all the essence, because the visit to Pamukkale may be over in half a day, so you can come to this museum to have a look, it will take about half an hour to finish the tour.
The construction of this museum is very simple, you can even call it a cultural relics showroom, but you can indeed see a lot of ancient Greek and Roman relics in this place.

attractions.name: Hells of Beppu
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Oita, Beppu, Hells of Beppu
reviews: First, 98℃ Experience is the title party, this temperature is not experienced 😂 Next 98℃ is true, here the hot spring temperature of the source of sea water is 98℃. The reason it's called hell is because long ago the hot steam, hot mud, hot water that poured out of the ground was so inaccessible that it was called hell. Japan is a country with earthquakes, so many hot springs come in the same way. Beppu has the world's second largest geothermal system, so there are eight hell hot springs. The most famous eight hot springs are the sea hell and blood pool hell, and the sea hell is designated by the Japanese national scenic spots, in fact, two hells in one place. At the entrance, there is a large pool, which uses geothermal planting of the great ghost lotus, the annual Galan basin festival, is the biggest time of the great ghost lotus, the children can even experience standing on it. Finally ～ is ～ everyone is too much...

Iron wheel hot spring area, the blood pool hell, tornado hell is located more north 2.5km place. - Using the hot boiled eggs in hell, only 5 or 6 minutes, a basket of fresh eggs will be cooked, and with a faint sulfur smell, this hot spring eggs also called black jade, is the famous production of hell.

Haihell is called "Haihell" because it was formed after the eruption of Tsurumiyama volcano 1200 years ago. The spring temperature is 98℃. The biggest feature is that the hot spring here is beautifully azure blue, like the blue sea.
Beppu has many famous tourist attractions, Beppu Hell is one of them, many tourists not far from the name of the city, here to punch in the picture, everyone to see it!
Beppu hell is a very famous tourist attraction, many tourists not far from the name of the coming, here to punch in the picture, everyone to see it!

attractions.name: Beppu Onsen
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Oita, Beppu, Beppu Onsen
reviews: Beppu is rich in geothermal resources, and hell is very famous. The hot springs, which are cooler than hell, are suitable for soaking. In addition to the high water temperature, the hot springs contain different mineral elements, showing various colors, and some of them will turn up the mud, so it has the name of hell. The characteristics of hell are reflected in the hot springs for everyone to soak after cooling down. The most representative one is called Beppu Batang.

The most famous hot spring in Beppu is the local ornamental hot spring-Beppu Hell. In addition, the number of hot springs in Beppu is also very large. The number of hot spring hotels and public hot spring baths is even far greater than that of Kusatsu Hot Springs in Kita Kanto, which is ranked second in Japan. For tourists who come to Beppu for a hot spring vacation, Japanese natives must have many foreign tourists, which shows its high quality and high cost performance.

Beppu is located in the northeastern part of Kyushu, Japan. It belongs to a small town under Oita Prefecture. Its rich geothermal resources are second to none in Japan and in the world. Oita Prefecture was once known as the number one hot spring prefecture in Japan. The hell of Beppu is very famous. Japanese people like to call the hot spring eruption "hell." The steaming sound of boiling and the hot hot spring water are very familiar to the residents of Kitakyushu.

A famous hot spring sanctuary! For me, what I like is her quietness. When we went to Japan, it was just after the New Year and there were not many people. Coincidentally, I ran into a Korean and a Japanese, and the scenery was great!

Beppu Hot Spring Resort, the whole city is everywhere with hot spring hot air ～ Experience the open air at the hotel, that is called a cool steam in hell し The iron wheel of the workshop ate hot spring steam, not only to steam themselves, but also to clean their own dishes, the taste is called an unparalleled! When you are in the position, you can take off your shoes and soak your feet at any time. ～

attractions.name: Umi Jigoku
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Oita, Beppu, Umi Jigoku
reviews: Sea Hell is one of the most memorable sights of Beppu tour, as a travel frog game lover, to Beppu tour, will definitely go to the sea Hell punch. The blue spring water is like the color of the sea, white smoke is insignificant, steam rising, like a fairyland. There are many valuable water lilies in the scenic area, you can also soak in foot bath hot springs.

The sea hell is the most famous and popular attraction in the beppu hell landscape, the area of the sea hell is larger than other hells, there are many lotus on the water, is one of the characteristics of the sea hell. The geothermal phenomenon of Beppu is still more prominent, the sea hell around the blazing heat, shocking.

Beppu is a quiet little city, a city shrouded in the vapors of thousands of hot springs, with a faint smell of sulfur in the air. I'm not bored even by a day in the streets and beach parks near my home.

Sea Hell is the first stop of the tour of the hell of most tourists Beppu, and the most anticipated one. The sea hell area is very large, need to reserve the longest time, besides the blue spring must punch in the memory, there is a small greenhouse exhibition hall must also see, there are very precious water lily varieties.

#3018.03 九州天空城之别府# In the previous fire travel frog mobile phone tour, one of the attractions that the frog son has visited is the sea hell. There are buses from Satoshi JR Beppu Station or Beppu University Station. You can buy a one-day bus ticket at Beppu Station, which is more cost-effective. Seeing the frog son traveling alone and traveling with friends, he has been to Hell 3 or 4 times. How can you not come and have a look. The sea hell is also the most beautiful among the eight hells. I took a photo of the same style as the frog son, and he was standing by the fishing rod in the sea hell. The bait was not the bait, but the hot spring egg. The hot spring is the color of Tiffany blue, the blue is transparent, and bursts of hot spring smoke are looming with the wind direction. After walking around the sea hell hot spring, you can climb to a point above and overlook the whole sea hell. There is also a small shrine next to it, which can also be visited. For the first time, I feel that "hell" can be so beautiful! No wonder the frog son lingered.

attractions.name: Takegawara Hot Spring
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Oita, Beppu, Takegawara Hot Spring
reviews: The old building is cool but quite honestly I didn't understand the sand bath. It wasn't really hot enough to do anything and you are wrapped up in the yukata. Besides this, there is one other place do a sand bath which is outside. And for 1,000 yen, I'm not sure it's worth the price.

Takegawara Hot Spring had a bamboo roof in 1879, which is where its name originated, ‘bamboo tile’. The bamboo has since been replaced by tiles, but the style of this bathhouse is still very old fashion and authentic. The tubs may seem a bit less elegant, but you will feel like you're sitting in a piece of history.

Beppu is a home of hot springs, bamboo tile hot spring is one of the representative hot springs of Beppu, and more important is the price of good and cheap, only need a dozen yuan, can experience the world-class hot springs. A bubble, is very comfortable. The bamboo tile hot spring is located in a small alley, but inside there are other holes.

Beppu, famous for its hot spring industry in Oita Prefecture, has more than 200 public hot springs in the entire city ♨️. Next to the hotel is the 140-year-old bamboo tile hot spring built in 1879. Although it is a well-known hot spring in Beppu, the bath is very cheap. Adults only need 100 yen (RMB). 6 yuan)

Bamboo tile hot spring is located not far from the long-distance bus terminal of Beppu City. There is a famous Beppu hot spring street, there are many hot spring hotels, one family is connected to one, there are many restaurants and izakayas. The main function of the bamboo tile hot spring is to moisturize the skin. The weakly acidic spring water is quite effective in curing dry skin. After soaking, the skin becomes smooth.

attractions.name: Beppu Park
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Oita, Beppu, Beppu Park
reviews: Beppu is most famous for its hot spring inns and hell landscapes. Tourists from all over the world come for this. In fact, Beppu Park is also very beautiful, and it is a scenic spot worth spending half a day to visit. Located in the center of the city, the transportation is very convenient, with many lines of buses going directly. Many cherry trees and various flowers are planted in the park.

Some comments say that Beppu Park is along the coast, and this person must have never been to Beppu Park! Beppu Park is in the Muro City of Beppu. I saw Beppu Park on the way back to the hotel by bus after visiting the Hells of Beppu. The bus has been walking along the mountain road halfway up the mountain for a long time, passing by Beppu Park, it is really beautiful when the cherry blossoms are in full bloom in early spring!

Beppu Park, the green environment is really good, so the air here is also very good. The hot springs are the second largest in the world and nature is amazing! ! ! Beppu's intermittent hot springs! Second only to Yellowstone National Park in the United States, among which the sea hell is the most worth seeing

Beppu Park is a medium-sized free urban park, and it is also an excellent place for local citizens and tourists to exercise and relax. There are many cherry trees planted in the park, and the cherry blossoms bloom very early. In February, you can see a crimson.

When we were traveling in Beppu, we bought a one-day pass for the Kamui Bus. We accidentally discovered Beppu Park and got off the bus to take a tour. We unexpectedly discovered that the park is very small, exquisite, beautiful, and full of gardens. The cherry blossoms are in full bloom, a crimson.

attractions.name: Oniyama Jigoku
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Oita, Beppu, Oniyama Jigoku
reviews: Ghost Mountain Hell is also one of the eight hells. You can visit it with a package ticket. The color of the hot spring is green, earth color, and the hell with smoke. As if you walk into the sauna, the temperature actually reaches 99.1 degrees. It is completely possible to cook food with it. It is a contribution to the human race that many crocodiles are fed by the hot springs.

Ghost mountain hell in the hell of Beppu, may not be very famous, the area is relatively small, but there are many points to see, and the kitchen hell is very close, there are small exhibition rooms inside the scenic area, also worth to see.

Ghost Mountain Hell is the smallest among the eight hells in Beppu, and it is also the one with the smallest landscape. It is mainly a small artificial crocodile farm. The temperature of the hot spring water is about 100 degrees Celsius, with steaming steam and light smoke. It is amazing that crocodiles can be farmed in this environment.

Ghost Mountain Hell, also known as Crocodile Hell, has been raising crocodiles with hot spring water since the Taisho era. There are about 70 or 80 now. Now they are all kept in captivity, with tall railings erected next to them, and hot springs. In fact, the crocodile is really ugly, but the crocodile plush toys sold in Ghost Mountain Hell are really cute!

Ghost Mountain Hell is one of the eight hells in Beppu, because in addition to the natural viewing hot springs, there are also many crocodile farms. The crocodile garden has also become a scene of Beppu hell. The Guishan Hell is not large, and the main project is to watch crocodile.

attractions.name: Oniishibozu Jigoku
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Oita, Beppu, Oniishibozu Jigoku
reviews: The ghost stone in the eight hells in Beppu unique characteristics, beside the hell there is a business can be for tourists to soak hot springs, very special. The ghost stone in the hell is beautiful, the color of water is very special, the mineral in nature formed a strange landscape.

The sea hell is next to the ghost stones, is also one of the eight hells of Beppu, it is like mud water, some like cement color, has been bubble, next to the mountain road also has a large steam, indicating that the geological activity under the land is quite flat.

Personally, I think this hell is average among the eight sceneries of hell. Maybe I am not very interested in crocodiles, but I still like to see the big pond. But if you like crocodiles, you can see a lot here.

Beppu Hell Hot Spring is located in Beppu Prefecture in the central part of Oita Prefecture, Japan. The eight hell hot springs are the most famous. The origin of the name "Hell" comes from the special geographical phenomenon of Iron Wheel and Guichuan. Fangzhu means monk, and ghost stone is a place name, which can be understood as ghost stone monk hell.

Onishibo Hell is one of the eight great hells in Beppu that shocked me the most. The boiling lime mud gurgled out of the water, and steam encircled the entire park. It did not look like a human world, but more like a mythical world.

attractions.name: Chinoike Jigoku
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Oita, Beppu, Chinoike Jigoku
reviews: Each of the eight hot springs in Beppu has its own characteristics. They are named according to the color and shape of the hot springs. The sea hell is blue, while the blood hell is the red pool. On the pool surface under the sun, white smoke is flowing, accompanied by thick smoke. The smell of sulfur wafts in the wind... Don’t forget to buy a box of special ointments that can only be bought here to go to athlete’s foot, treat eczema, etc. [Victory]

The blood pond hell is the most special among the eight great hells of Beppu, and it impresses many tourists because of its special color and high-value hell landscape. The rust red color of the hot spring water is very recognizable.

The blood pond hell is the most unforgettable one of the eight hells in Beppu. The hot spring water of the hell contains iron elements, so it appears rusty red. There is also a free foot bath at the entrance of the blood pond hell. The trace minerals in it can treat skin diseases, which is worth trying.

When you visit the sea hell in Beppu, you can buy bliss buns, and when you visit the blood pond hell, you can buy blood pond ointment. These are the specialty products of Beppu hell. The blood pool hot spring is very spectacular, and the blood pool ointment has the curative effect of the blood pool hot spring.

Among the eight great hells of Beppu, the hot spring water contains different minerals, so different colors appear. The sea hell is a moving sea blue, and the blood pool hell is blood red and red rust. The blood pool hell is particularly attractive because of its special color.

attractions.name: Yufuin Hot Springs
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Oita, Yufuin, Yufuin Hot Springs
reviews: The town of cloth courtyard is beautiful as the legendary place, beautiful environment, quiet and quiet, stream water, birds and flowers, like a dream. There are also enjoy the endless local special food, exquisite and delicious, the hot spring town is famous, you can relax in the soup.

Yufuin Hot Spring Town is located in Oita Prefecture, Kitakyushu, Japan. The name is derived from the merger of Fuin and Yuping Village, and it is called "Yufuin". It is said that the number of hot springs here is the second largest in Japan, and the hot springs gush out. Ranked third in terms of volume, the spring water is transparent and almost no smell. Yufuin Hot Spring Town has a prosperous number of hot spring hotels at various price points. There is also a bustling commercial center Yunoppa Street, where you can go shopping and are a good place for vacation and leisure.

Yufuin is the most memorable town during my trip to Kitakyushu. Yufuin is known for its unique hot spring resources, so it is also called Yufuin. The town is very prosperous and relatively commercial, but fortunately the commercial atmosphere does not destroy the beautiful natural scenery of the town, which is very rare.

My friend confirmed the itinerary. I bought JPpass from Kumamoto for two different trains. Once I arrived in the town, I liked it very much. The air is very fresh and the small buildings are very flavorful. The town is famous for its hot springs. There are many hotels, B&Bs all have their own hot springs, so you can relax in the evening. The town is also a famous tourist attraction. It’s nice to have a small lake with the reflection of the sunset. There are also small shops to buy local specialties. There are also restaurants and snack bars that are delicious and good for shopping. It is a very relaxing and relaxing place. Stay for one night.

My family and I have been to many second- and third-tier cities in Japan and small towns around the city, and it is particularly unforgettable for Yufuin Hot Spring Town. Not only because it has world-class hot spring resources, but also because of the leisure and comfort of small town life and the beautiful and warm natural scenery.

attractions.name: Hobbit Village
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, New Zealand, Waikato, Matamata-Piako District, Matamata, Hobbit Village
attractions.address: 501 Buckland Rd, Hinuera, Matamata 3472, New Zealand
reviews: The Hobbit Village was a Hobbiton Movie Set which is significant location used for The Lord of the Rings film trilogy and The Hobbit film trilogy.It is situated on a family run farm about 8 kilometres (5.0 mi) west of Hinuera and 10 kilometres (6.2 mi) southwest of Matamata, in Waikato, New Zealand, and is now a Tolkien tourism destination, offering a guided tour of the set.
If you're a fan of the story, its a must see place when bmvisiting NZ. Interesting tour, fun facts along the way and the free drink at the green dragon was a nice touch.

About 3 hours away driving from Auckland, Hobbiton is an absolutely beautiful attraction. Kinds under 8 years old enter for free and adults are NZD 75 each including drink at the end of the tour.If you're a fan of Lord of the Rings this is the place to come. If you're not, still very interesting to explore this outdoor set.
Aplaceverycute.

The northern island of new zealand ring kings, hobbit village, a lovely hobbit dwarfs home, the roof of the green trees are natural growth for many years. The Blue Springs, about an hour's drive from Hobbit Village, is so beautiful, cloudy and there is no blue sky, otherwise the Dwarf House and Blue Springs will be even more beautiful

attractions.name: Matamata Visitor Information Centre - International Terminal
Matamata
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, New Zealand, Auckland, Auckland, Matamata
reviews: Follow a professional guide to the small town of Mata, where the movies "Lord of the Rings" and "The Hobbit" were filmed, and explore the secrets of the two world blockbusters. The "The Hobbit" series of films was released in the United States on December 14, 2012. It tells the story of the hobbit Bilbo Baggins, who was introduced by the wizard Gandalf and joined a team of 13 dwarves to start an adventure to a lone mountain...

A welcoming town, famous for the movie "The Hobbit", and the town has become lively. There are not only a visitor center that looks like a hobbit cave house, but also various shops containing movie elements. There is also a bus to Hobbit Village. It is a small town born out of movies and a small town full of fun.
Coming here is like entering a fairy tale world.

There are only a few thousand people in the small town of Mata. Many houses are empty. Some small villas can be seen planting a lot of flowers and plants. There are also many locals playing here.
[Scenery] The scenery here is beautiful
【Interesting】Highly interesting.

The small town of Matamata with a population of several thousand must have thousands of times the number of tourists every year, and this is all because of the movie. Even if you haven't watched this movie, you will be attracted by the unique cave house.

attractions.name: Blue Springs
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, New Zealand, Bay of Plenty, Rotorua, Blue Springs
attractions.address: Off White Road, with upstream access fromLeslie Road, Putaruru. The downstream entranceis just past Leslie Road, and theBlue
reviews: Motorola’s Blue Spring is definitely a beautiful and suffocating place. A crooked spring here is sky blue and very clear. The water plants under the spring float with the stream of the stream, as if you have come to a fairyland. , It is really intoxicating.

Blue Spring│Pure and beautiful New Zealand’s "Little Jiuzhai" Blue Spring Blue Spring, a small place and not a small name, is the largest source of pure water in New Zealand. The water quality of more than 70% of the canned water in New Zealand is super clean, and the water temperature is maintained all year round 11 ℃ The scenic spot is quiet and pure. It is called the "Little Jiuzhai" scenic trail in New Zealand for about 5 kilometers. It is the best place for hiking, oxygen inhalation, and lung washing. Personal evaluation: Although it is a "Little Jiuzhai", it is of course incomparable to the authentic Jiuzhaigou Ha. But it is small and exquisite. The clear and blue spring water really makes people intoxicated and without noise. It is very quiet (the genuine Jiuzhaigou is always crowded with people). It is very suitable for picking a sunny morning, come here to appreciate the scenery, exercise and physical activity. Detailed address: Leslie Rd, South Waikato 3483 Traffic guide: It is recommended to drive by yourself. It’s a 2-hour drive from downtown Auckland. It’s more cost-effective to check in with other attractions, such as Hobbit Village. Opening hours: All-day tickets: trouble. Estimated duration: 2 hours. Practical tips1⃣️There is no trash can on the trail, so yes If you want to keep the garbage, go back to the entrance and there is a trash can to throw away, so be sure to bring a larger bag to temporarily store empty water bottles and other garbage. I really despise the behavior of littering. ❗2⃣️The whole trail takes almost two hours. You can walk through the inside, there are some steep places and stairs, it is better to wear flat and comfortable shoes. 3⃣️If you just want to check in here quickly, if you have a low budget or lack of physical strength, you can enter from the south entrance and turn back to the Blue Spring LOOK OUT platform. The most beautiful scenery will not be missed. 4⃣️ Sunglasses are essential for sun protection. Take a bottle of water on the way to do a good job of water supply, there are no shops along the way.

Blue Springs is a very beautiful place in Rotorua. About 40 minutes drive from Rotorua, you can reach the place where the signs are on the Google map. It takes about an hour and a half to complete the whole walk. There are two entrances and exits. The Blue Spring is closer to one of the entrances, but the whole is not big and each has its own characteristics. It is recommended that you can use three for a round trip. About hours

Blue Spring is located near Putaruru, New Zealand, 45 minutes' drive from Hamilton. It is commonly known as "Little Jiuzhai" in New Zealand. One of the purest water sources in the world. The spring water here comes from the Mamaku Plateau plateau. It takes 50 to 100 years to pass through layers of filtration to reach the surface, so the spring water is extremely pure and clear and presents a breathtaking blue color.

Known as Little Jiuzhaigou, it is a natural attraction that does not need to buy tickets. It is not as crowded as domestic attractions. There will be a little more people on good weekends or holidays. The spring water is crystal clear and the underwater scenery is very beautiful. It is a good place to hike.

attractions.name: Agrodome
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, New Zealand, Bay of Plenty, Rotorua, Agrodome
attractions.address: 141 Western Rd, Ngongotaha, Rotorua 3010, New Zealand
reviews: Animal husbandry is a pillar industry in New Zealand. Pastures and farms abound in New Zealand. Agora Farm in Rotorua is New Zealand's largest tourist farm integrating animal husbandry and tourism. The most eye-catching thing is the rural scenery. On the pasture, there are green grass, flocks of cattle and sheep, or alone ~ leisurely and contented; in the orchard, fruit trees are lined up with bent branches ~ fruitful; deep in the farm, there are several management staff’s residences in Wan The green bushes reveal a little red top~ it adds a bit of elegance. The most impressive is the comprehensive travel services. The farm has a large area, and you need to take a sightseeing car when visiting. The sightseeing car pulled by a large tractor is unique to the scenic spot and has become a unique landscape. The farm has mostly Chinese tourists, and many guides and narrators who are fluent in Chinese are arranged to lead the crowd together. The atmosphere of a foreign country and the feeling of being at home~ It's so good! The most fascinating thing is the close contact with animals. The farm has opened up several areas, allowing tourists to have close contact with animals, the most eye-catching alpaca, which is hard to see in China. Countless alpacas, unique body shapes, elegant gait, cute looks, embarrassing looks, and fluffy feel, make people laugh.
A shortwave car is on the way, and the alpaca with spitting is fed, and the car is fed to them.

The Agrodome Farm in Rotorua is a very large farm with herds of New Zealand sheep. They are all very cute. Everyone can participate in the shearing activities here. Shearing the wool by yourself is really a very interesting and happy thing. In addition, you can buy authentic wool products here at low prices. It is definitely worth buying and owning.
A great view, beautiful scenery, fresh air, natural scenery, wide view, fun, and grass mud horses close contact, very fun, cost-effective.

There are many farms in New Zealand, and Egordon is one of the most representative ones. Tourists usually go around in the pasture area and watch their regular sheep shearing performance. If you are interested, you can take their tractor and go to the swamp. It would be more interesting to look over there, but unfortunately I don't have enough time to make it.

attractions.name: Te Puia
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, New Zealand, Bay of Plenty, Rotorua, Te Puia
reviews: The Maori are the aboriginals of New Zealand and the earliest aborigines of this land. Rotorua is a gathering place for Maori people. There are many Maori cultural villages in the Rotorua area. Through numerous Maori-style buildings and sculptures, as well as geothermal fountains that can be seen everywhere, visitors are shown the long history and culture of the Maori people and the unique geothermal landscape of Rotorua. The Te Puia Maori Cultural Village, located on the south side of Lake Rotorua, is the one with the richest resources, the most comprehensive displays, and the most popular. Walk into the cultural village with strong ethnic style. In the solemn conference hall, sonorous and charming Maori songs and dances are performed; on the spacious promenade, colorful and unique Maori sculptures are displayed; the reconstructed living area is scattered In the old, simple and durable aboriginal dwellings and storage rooms; in the small kiwi exhibition hall, a few lazy birds pacing among the gloomy grass~ It is a blessing to see and gain insight.
There are a lot of Maori cultural displays and the geothermal heat is smoking

This attraction is special! We watched inside for a day, the scenery is beautiful! The performance also has a special Maori culture! From the photos we uploaded, we can see that the scenic area is particularly large. Rotorua is the best place to go
Very nice small theme park with Maori cultural performances and geothermal landscape

Rotorua’s Maori Cultural Village is a tourist and cultural village with very Maori cultural characteristics. All the buildings here have Maori cultural characteristics. At the same time, you can also taste Maori delicacies and watch their singing and dancing performances. To visit their way of life is really full of wild beauty, and it is worth a visit.

attractions.name: Hamilton Gardens
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, New Zealand, Waikato, Hamilton, Hamilton Gardens
attractions.address: Hungerford Crescent, SH1 (Off Cobham Drive), Hamilton
reviews: Hamilton Garden is a large-scale European-style garden in Hamilton. The scenery here is very beautiful, and the design of the garden can be comparable to the European royal garden. It is colorful throughout the year. There are all kinds of beautiful fountains in the garden, neatly manicured trees, and statues of different styles. It really makes people feel special and noble. It is worth coming to appreciate it.

Hamilton Gardens is a very large multinational style garden. It is divided into several parks, divided into more than a dozen garden themes such as European garden area, Southeast Asian garden area, Japanese garden area, Chinese garden area, etc. It is really that each area has the characteristics of each country, like entering an Expo Garden. It's worth seeing and admiring.

Its theme is to express the history, background and meaning of gardens, and convey to people the concept of garden design and garden art through five groups of different styles of garden collections, just like a garden museum, rich and full of vitality.
Hamilton Gardens is a surprise place. There are many different areas, various garden styles of Renaissance, Japan, India, and it is very suitable for taking beautiful portrait photos

The beauty is too beautiful, just like the painting, only here can you feel the real peace. The Chinese garden is the most distinctive in it, using the Jiangnan garden style. Standing there, if there is a misty rain, you will feel like you are in the south.

attractions.name: Skyline Rotorua
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, New Zealand, Bay of Plenty, Rotorua, Skyline Rotorua
attractions.address: 178 Fairy Springs Road, PO BOX 2353Rotorua, New Zealand
reviews: Skyline Rotorua found in the heart of New Zealand's scenic volcanic wonderland, this is where the luging adventure all began in 1985. Skyline Luge has three tracks of differing skill levels winding through beautiful forest.Ride the Skyline Gondola to the top complex to begin your Luge adventure. Select from one of three exciting Luge trails and take off downhill on your Luge cart through twists and turns to a backdrop of dramatic scenery and down through our Redwood forest.Once at the bottom, ride the Luge chairlift back to the top of the track.

Ride the Rotorua Sky Gondola to the halfway point of Mount Ngongtaha at an altitude of 487 meters. As the cable car climbs, the city of Rotorua in New Zealand's North Island and the beautiful Lake Rotorua have a panoramic view. The Sky Gondola here is the same company as the Sky Gondola in Queenstown, South Island, so it is no stranger. From the viewpoint of landscape, Queenstown is definitely better than Rotorua, but Rotorua has its own specialties. After reaching the top, there is still the Sky Gondola Restaurant, which tastes great! In addition to the cable car, the amusement project also has scooters, which are divided into slow, intermediate and sprint paths, with a total length of 5 kilometers.

Rotorua is a great place with great views! I like the beauty of nature. I recommend Solitaire Lodge. The hotel is located by the lake, the view is super nice, the rooms are also very good, the service is attentive, the Michelin star chef, I really did not disappoint, the whole experience is particularly good, you can also arrange a boat to go fishing 🎣🎣Like a fairyland on earth
Overall great views, especially after going up high. Small fares
The scenery is good, interesting and fun, and the experience is very good,

attractions.name: Government Gardens
attractions.loc_tags: Oceania, New Zealand, Bay of Plenty, Rotorua, Government Gardens
reviews: The Government Gardens, located in the center of Rotorua, is Rotorua's most eye-catching landmark. Elegant and atmospheric building. Deep in the large lawn of the garden is the Rotorua Museum of History and Art. Built in 1908, the building has a spire with red tiles and yellow walls. The floor is not high and the width is very wide. It combines Tudor architectural style and Victorian architectural style. The buildings with great architectural aesthetics, close-up and distant view, left and right shot, are all beautiful photos. Quiet and beautiful garden. The wide lawn, green grass, surrounded by benches; the quiet garden, blooming flowers, hidden in the depths of delicate buildings and sculptures. Citizens and tourists, some are strolling, some are in a daze, and some are clocking in.

The place is small but very distinctive. It is full of flowers all the year round, which is especially suitable for taking pictures. The sunset is especially beautiful. Many locals come here to exercise, and then there are various tourists to pat and pat. Rotorua is not too big in total, basically it is a landmark, and all of them are down when you walk around the city. According to the news, this is the area with the worst security and highest crime rate in New Zealand. Is it because it is a Maori settlement, but it still looks peaceful.

Rotorua Government Garden is located in front of the city hall. It is a very large garden square. Flowers bloom here in all seasons, especially in autumn. Beautiful tulips adorn the place very charming. In addition, there is a musical fountain. When the music sounds, the fountain dances up and down with the rhythm of the music, attracting many tourists to stop and watch.

The Rotorua Government Garden is located in front of the City Hall. It is a huge lawn. In the middle of the lawn is a man-made musical fountain, which will perform at a fixed time every day. This is also the absolute city center of Rotorua. You must visit it.

The Rotorua Government Garden is a large green area in the center of Rotorua. A public garden has an information center, museums, and many very good walks along the lake. The Government Garden is a small corner of Rotorua deep into Lake Rotorua. Rotorua is a famous geothermal city in northern New Zealand. The air in the city is filled with a faint smell of sulfur, which is very characteristic. , There are many tourists, basically a city supported by tourism

attractions.name: Seville Cathedral
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Spain, Andalusia, Province of Sevilla, Area Metropolitana de Sevilla, Sevilla, Seville Cathedral
attractions.open_status: Monday: 11:00-15:30, Tuesday-Saturday: 11:00-17:00, Sunday: 14:30-18:00. Note: Special holiday opening hours will be adjusted
attractions.address: Av. de la Constitución, s/n, 41004 Sevilla
reviews: Seville Cathedral is a Roman Catholic cathedral in Serville. It is the largest Gothic and the third-largest church in the world. It was registered in 1987 by UNESCO as a world Heritage Site.
A must visit if you're in Seville. Tickets includes La Giralda tower climb
Huge historic building with the grave of Christopher Kolumbus as one of the highlights

Sevilla cathedral is the Vatican st Peter''s cathedral, st. Paul''s cathedral in London one of the world''s three cathedral. 101 meters of the clock tower of the church is Spain, once the most famous of the high-rise building for centuries, in the human world heritage in 1987, but when we went to the clock tower, we can''t climb the tower. In addition to a collection of art treasures in the cathedral, Columbus''s coffin since back to Spain from Cuba in 1898, was buried in the church of Columbus''s tomb.
Third largest Gothic cathedral in the world. Take time to walk up the tower to get an amazing view of the city.  Book tickets online in advance.

attractions.name: Real Alcázar de Sevilla
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Spain, Andalusia, Province of Sevilla, Area Metropolitana de Sevilla, Sevilla, Real Alcázar de Sevilla
attractions.open_status: October - March of the following year: Monday - Sunday 9:30-17:00; April - September: Monday - Sunday 9:30-19:00.
attractions.address: Patio de Banderas, s / n, 41004 Sevilla
reviews: its incredible the amount of detail this place has, it amuses tou on every corner on every hall ok every door frame. amazing and totally worth visiting
beautiful ancient and modern city

In Spanish castle Alcazar mean, real is the meaning of the royal family, so the real Alcazar is royal castle, namely the king''s palace. Suggested that this article and El Real Alcazar DE Sevilla entry to merge. Personally think that this is the best attractions, sevilla suggest a variety of some time to appreciate. Want to save money can on Monday afternoon, free time, can only visit for 1 hour.

The palace of the Caliph, the famous landmark of Cordoba, was left over from the reign of the Iberian peninsula, estimated to have a half-million inhabitants in the tenth century and was once the largest city in Western Europe. Standing on the roof of the palace, still can see the scale of the year.

I was in Seville on the second day to arrange a visit to the Royal Palace. I reminded that you must buy tickets online in advance to make an appointment. Because this attraction is so popular, there are so many people buying tickets at the gate, so you can go around in line. Those who buy tickets in advance have a special channel, and they will let you in according to the appointment time. This multi-style Seville Palace really has too many attractions worth visiting slowly, and there are many popular scenes, it is worth spending most of the day to see, it is recommended to go early.

attractions.name: Plaza de España
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Spain, Andalusia, Province of Sevilla, Area Metropolitana de Sevilla, Sevilla, Plaza de España
attractions.address: Av de Isabel la Católica, 41004 Sevilla
reviews: The thing I love about Architecture is that it is free to appreciate, most of the time. La plaza de España is beautiful and was also the location for some of the Star Wars movies.
This was a hit with our friends and family to visit here. The architectural style is beautiful and must visit when you came first time.

Is this the most beatiful Square in the World? Surely is one of the biggest and most known (it was a set for Star Wars). Every province in Spain has his own beatiful azulejo. Every time I go I look at all of them to pick my favourites and every time I came up with a different choice
Wonderfull palace and park. Owesome for riding with the family!
This place literally took my breath away, pictures won't capture the beauty of the place. This is a must see in Seville, make sure you come once during the day and once during the night!

attractions.name: Tower of Gold
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Spain, Andalusia, Province of Sevilla, Area Metropolitana de Sevilla, Sevilla, Tower of Gold
attractions.address: Paseo de Cristóbal Colón, s / n, 41001 Seville
reviews: Torre del Oro is a dodecagonal military watchtower in Seville, built by the Almonad dynasty in order to control acess to Seville via the Guadalquivir river.
It shines a true gold hue at Sunset and being next to the river, is part of the prettiest views in Seville.

The background of the gold tower is located in the river is a lot of postcards,, not any relationship with gold. Bundled free two-day shipping on Monday, after registration can be free to visit. Mainly some navigation display of the appliance, and outlook mouth we can see the distant scenery. Around the tower climb a circle, not tired, each level has the exhibits, can visit as we go along. A layer of selling souvenirs. The highest top part of a layer of can''t go up, but have also been overlooking the distant attractions such as the cathedral, at no cost is worth visiting.
Just like the Torre de la Plata, the "Tower of Gold" was built in the Almohad dynasty as a military watchtower.
One of the best Seville attractions. I enjoyed this place a little bit too much, and I would love to come back.

attractions.name: Plaza de toros de la Real Maestranza de Caballería de Sevilla
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Spain, Andalusia, Province of Sevilla, Area Metropolitana de Sevilla, Sevilla, Plaza de toros de la Real Maestranza de Caballería de Sevilla
attractions.open_status: November - March 9:30-19:00, April - October 9:30-21:00, closed on December 25. Good Friday and Bullfighting Day 9:30-15:00, there is a special time, see the official website.
reviews: Don''t know how many matador who had died in here, most of them are very young. Can''t understand why the spaniards love, perhaps history makes this country has experienced too much aggression against plunder the civil war. This way of fighting bull fighting, show the strength and skill, to stimulate the original of the Spanish for long wild, wild fiercely fight fight, like flamenco comes from life sorrow, actually in the expression of anger

We happened to meet is said to be a famous bullfighting is to attend the show, so a lot of ticket prices more expensive than usual, vaguely remember seem to more than 30 European one, and is not a good seat. Their ticket prices are set according to the stand location, also points to the east to the west, we sat in the east, because it is almost 4, 5 PM, so is the location of the western, but performance is wonderful. On the way to the show, we see a lot of people with a cotton pad and newspaper, also don''t know is why at the beginning, there just know, this is standard, often a bullfight mat is mat on the stone bench, newspapers can be used to shade and fan.

Bull fighting is generally in 4-10 months, winter is no bullfighting performance. There is a museum inside the ring, with painting collections, historical items display and other exhibition halls, so that people can understand the traditional Spanish sport in all directions.
Very interesting bullfight, but it’s too cruel

The entrance building of the bullring is very unique, you will not miss it when you pass by, a bit like a embarrassing expression. The red and white meeting is particularly dazzling under the blue sky, and you will see many passers-by posing for pictures at the door.

There is a special team leader to explain in it, the tickets are not cheap, but it is still worth experiencing, although I personally don't agree with the somewhat cruel ancient sport of bullfighting.

attractions.name: Santa Cruz
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Spain, Andalusia, Province of Sevilla, Area Metropolitana de Sevilla, Sevilla, Santa Cruz
reviews: From the North-East of the palace walk about 200 meters, is a bustling downtown hinterland - holy cross area (Barrio Santa Cruz), sevilla''s most interesting pubs, restaurants and shops are concentrated in the alleyway of the chickens, well-preserved house and street view, full flavor of of primitive simplicity of the middle ages. Come here, please slow down and drink a cup of coffee, write a postcard, under the shadows of mottled taste belongs to seville, languid is lazy afternoon.
The Old Jewish Quarter, the old town of Seville, began in the 15th century, with many nobles moving there, built magnificent palaces and beautiful mansions, retaining an quaint atmosphere.
[Scenery] Very beautiful and lively [Interesting] Interesting and cute [Price ratio] Relatively high

An area next to the Royal Palace of Seville, there are many carriages next to it, it is recommended to take a ride, from here to the Plaza de España, passing by a Maria Luisa Park, the green coverage is very good, and I walked here in hot weather It's actually a bit cool. No one in the Holy Cross area should dislike it. Even the trees on the roadside are so distinctive.

The Santa Croce area is located in the center of Seville. It is surrounded by the walls of the ancient palace. It is composed of very narrow alleys and alleys. It is the old city of Seville and the old Jewish quarter. Every alley here is narrow, high, and intricate, but they are all unique. Don't worry about not getting out of the maze-like small intestines, basically every one can go through the main road.

attractions.name: Museum of Flamenco Dance
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Spain, Andalusia, Province of Sevilla, Area Metropolitana de Sevilla, Sevilla, Museum of Flamenco Dance
reviews: Barcelona has seen flamenco performances for several years and it is still the best place. There is a big stage, great food, seats to see everyone, a great view, and the most important thing is that these best dancers perform their best. The boss here continues to absorb the best rising stars in Flamenco. If you really want to see the flamenco show, the Carmen show is the best.

Flamenco originated from Arabic dance. To see flamenco, you have to go to the tavern in Seville. We did not visit the museum and bought the tickets for the performance directly, the price was 20 euros. Tickets for the day have been sold out, and you can only buy tickets for the next day. The important thing must be said three times. Be sure to grab a seat in advance. The seat is first-come-first-served, seat-grab, seat-grab, seat-grab, at least half an hour. In order to watch the sunset in Plaza de España, we could only be there 20 minutes early, and there were almost no seats left. We could only find a few seats in the last row on the side. If there is any performance that makes me want to watch a few games without wanting to go, it is undoubtedly flamenco. Every dance step of the dancer will step on the heart of the audience, and every swing of the arm is a show of strength and beauty. Watching the flamenco show up close is really exciting. For half a month in Spain, the most memorable thing is this flamenco.

If you want to sit at the front, please arrive early. They suggested 20 minutes in advance, but on the day we watched the show, we took up a seat 45 minutes earlier and found a very good position. Although there was only one seat in the front row and one in the back, the four of us could only sit separately. The dancers performed very well and were full of enthusiasm.

A museum with a lot of content-set aside an hour to visit. The performance itself is wonderful! The guitarist is one of the best I have ever heard. Both male and female singers are outstanding. But dancing...wow! We are sitting in front, so we can clearly see the footwork. The passion of the dancers and the intensity of the dance steps are so amazing.

Worth a visit. The dancers show powerful artwork with high, sad and proud dance. Enjoyed it very much and felt unique. I don't really like the soft dance so this is especially suitable for me and has a sense of history. I was also very surprised by the age of the dancers - not having a bit of experience, it should not be out of context! Would love to come back to see the show again!

attractions.name: Metropol Parasol
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Spain, Andalusia, Province of Sevilla, Area Metropolitana de Sevilla, Sevilla, Metropol Parasol
reviews: It's a must in the city. Beautiful sights of the whole city rooftops and iconic buildings. Also, it's the world's biggest wood structure! :D
Really cool sculpture / building with a walkway across the top offering great views of Seville!

I didn't know what to expect coming here, the tour guide just told us its a large wooden structure. This is tho a must visit in Sevilla! It's 3 or 5 Euro to get to the top however it does include a tapa or a drink at on of the restaurants around the area. Come during Sunset or Night time to see this beautiful city light up!

Upon hearing about the Metropol Parasol I knew it was something I had to go and see with my own eyes. I was intrigued by the descriptions I heard of this wooden 'mushroom' shaped structure. Don't make the mistake I did and not realise that you can actually go up and inside the structure for a few euros, giving you some great views over Seville. Interesting fact - it may or may not be the largest wooden structure in the world (apparently this is up for debate).
For some reason, it's not on all the tourist map, but it's gorgeous. in order to go up, you must go down first, and the view is spectacular.

attractions.name: Torre Giralda
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Spain, Andalusia, Province of Sevilla, Area Metropolitana de Sevilla, Sevilla, Torre Giralda
attractions.address: Avenida La Constitucion S/N, 41001 Seville, Spain
reviews: One of sevilla''s landmarks, no matter in which position of the city can see the 97.5 m high building. This tower is by the islamists amor adriano family host built in the 12th century, with rich islamic style, 28 tower clock can still use graceful tone for sevilla residents tell the time.
The tower is a circular ramp with more than 30 floors and a viewing platform of more than 70 meters, with panoramic views of Seville. Each turn has windows to look out.

At the top of the Seville Cathedral, this bell tower called Giralda is 104 meters high. It is a landmark of Seville and can be seen from almost every angle of the ancient city.
You can climb to the top of the tower on foot from the inside of the church. The summit route is sloped, so it is not difficult. After climbing, you can overlook the entire old town of Seville. What needs special reminder is that after ascending to the top, pay attention to the church bell ringing on the hour. The sudden loud noise above the head is really scary.

This should be the best place to see Serbia. One of the landmarks of Seville, the city of Seville has a panoramic view! The slightly weathered stone sculptures on the wall seem to speak silently about the glory of the empire!

The Giralda Tower, which is nearly 100 meters high, is a landmark of Seville and can be seen anywhere in the city. The Islamic style of the tower is due to the fact that the tower was built by the Amoad family, who are Muslims. There are 28 big clocks on the top of the tower, which can tell the time with a beautiful tone. You can climb to the tower through a ramp where the king used to ride horses around, and you can enjoy a panoramic view of the city of Seville. There are many carriages actively attracting tourists in the alleys on the back of the church.

attractions.name: Parque de María Luisa
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Spain, Andalusia, Province of Sevilla, Area Metropolitana de Sevilla, Sevilla, Parque de María Luisa
attractions.address: Paseo de las Delicias, s/n, 41013 Sevilla, Spain
reviews: This is one of my favorite places in all of Spain. The park itself is massive and you can spend hours strolling about finding new corners and fountains to enjoy. Perfect for an afternoon, picnic, romantic walk, or just to get out of the house. There are also bars throughout that provide the perfect backdrop for a drink.
This Moorish-styled park is a must for anyone who loves nature, monuments, fountains and ponds.

This beautiful green space in the center of the historic city is a great place to take a break from sight seeing. The gardens are lush and well maintained, and you aren't far from most of the major attractions.
Really liked the pond and the ducks. Perfect place if you're in the mood for relaxing, reading a book or just going for a walk.
i like this city. This is wonderful park where you can spend half day

attractions.name: Belém Tower
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Portugal, Grande Lisboa, Lisbon, Belém Tower
attractions.open_status: October - May 10:00-17:30, last admission time 17:00; May - September 10:00-18:30, last admission time 17:00, Monday, January 1 It is closed on Sunday, Easter Sunday, May 1, June 13 and December 25.
reviews: Walking alongside the Tejo river, especially evening time, cannot be more beautiful. A pleasant seabreeze and the sundown will leave a very deep impressions in everyone.
Full of stories behind this tower~ I enjoy walking around the area~ beasutiful sight to see the sunset. Must see while in Lisbon Portugal.
The tower, a five-story fortification built entirely of marble, has been for 500 years, and stands as a port of Lisbon as the goddess of liberty, which is in and out of New York.

Located on the north bank of the Tejo River, one of the landmarks of Portugal, the symbol of Lisbon, is a world heritage site. The tower is a historical fortification, used as a customs, telegraph station, lighthouse, prison, is a Manuaier style building, entry into the tower requires tickets, walking under the tower has a unique flavor.

This tower not only witnessed the glorious history of Portugal, but also brought tourists from all over the world with its unique architecture and its special location. It was used as a customs, telegraph station, even lighthouse, and was the starting point for navigators in the great voyage age.

attractions.name: Monument to the Discoveries
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Portugal, Grande Lisboa, Lisbon, Monument to the Discoveries
reviews: Built in 1960 to commemorate the 500th anniversary of the death of Prince Henry, the monument is engraved with the statue of Henry and 80 other sailors, Columbus ranked fourth, decades before Magellan.

The monument to the voyage is a symbol of Portugal, built to commemorate the 500th anniversary of the death of the navigator Prince Henry, and the appearance of the ship with a huge sail, with Henry and his assistant, Gamal, standing at the bow. The monument square of the Tonglu Monument, not far from the 4.25 bridge, lets the Portuguese people in the great voyage times brilliant.
The size of the memorial sign is huge, reflecting the history of the great voyage age.
The monument is built on the beach and it is spectacular. Like 👍.
The scenery is pleasant and it is on the beach, especially suitable for strolling around in the sea breeze, but it is best to learn about the historical background first!

attractions.name: Jerónimos Monastery
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Portugal, Grande Lisboa, Lisbon, Jerónimos Monastery
attractions.open_status: October to May : 10:00-17:30 ; May to September 10:00-18:30. Closed: Mondays and 1 January, Easter Sunday, 1 May, 13 June and 25 December.
reviews: "One of the seven wonders of Portugal, this life must go", the most prominent monument in Lisbon, Portugal, is not only magnificent, but also very ornate carvings and decorations, listed as the world's 10 most beautiful churches, one of the seven wonders of Portugal, Also a must see when visiting Lisbon, Portugal! The Jeronimos Monastery is located opposite the Navigation Monument and is a great building complex from a distance, first of all amazing at its size, the monastery is connected to the church on the right side, stretching over 300 meters from the legendary Tatsu! In 1983, the Jeronimos Monastery, along with the Belem Tower, was registered as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. Walking into the monastery's gorgeous South Gate, the tour was set anti-clockwise, and saw numerous statues, wall decorations and minarets on the walls. The arches, triangles and arcs contain Manuel elements everywhere. There are scenes from the birth of Jesus, such as the statues of the saints as Manuel I, the Virgin Mary, the saint Jerome, and St John. The interior of the monastery also uses a lot of gold looted from Brazil, which is glittering and glittering. Many important people in history have also slept here, such as the greatest poetic soul of Portugal, Carmons, explorer Visco ． Da ． Gamma. There are many stories about the monastery, and of course, don't forget, the famous Portuguese egg tart was invented by the nuns of the monastery. The Jeronimos Abbey is a perfect combination of Gothic and Renaissance, considered by later generations as the treasure of Manuel-style architecture, the only thing in history that can not be copied; it is also given important religious and political meaning, this life must go! Tourist Tips:) The Jeronimos Monastery Address: Praçado Império1400-206Lisboa; Tickets: 10 euros for adults; 12 euros for a combined ticket (including the Belem Tower); Free opening on the first Sunday of each month; If there is a plan to visit the Belem Tower after visiting the monastery, you can buy a combined ticket, and the price is affordable, and you have saved the trouble of queuing at the Belem Tower; Opening hours: October - May 10:00-17:30, May - September 10:00-18:30; Stop visitors half an hour before closing; Closed time: Monday, January 1, May 1, Easter and Christmas. Traffic: 1. With group; 2. Self-driving; 3. Take the tram 15E or bus 201, 714 until the Belém-Jerónimos station. Travel route guide: The Jeronimos Monastery - Empire Square - Belem Eggs Shop - Discoverer Monument - Belem Tower (the above attractions are very close, walking distance). If you are too exposed, there are volunteers at the door to give visitors scarves, please remember to return when you go out; After visiting the monastery, don't miss the nearby Centennial Belem Eggs Shop.

Impressive views of the city and the towers make an impressive backdrop.  Cafe, complete with wandering peacocks on site, or grab a glass of wine while strolling along admiring the view.

attractions.name: Rossio Square
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Portugal, Grande Lisboa, Lisbon, Rossio Square
reviews: We can only tour ride to visit this place. This is one of popular square in Lisbon.

Rossio Square is the popular name of the Pedro IV Square (Portuguese: Praça de D. Pedro IV). It is located in the Pombaline Downtown of Lisbon and has been one of its main squares since the Middle Ages. It has been the setting of popular revolts and celebrations, bullfights and executions, and is now a preferred meeting place of Lisbon natives and tourists alike.
Easily accessible train station. If you want to go to Sintra, trains depart from here frequently.

The Palace of Estaus, the seat of the Inquisition was built on the north side of the square  and the Rossio was frequently used as setting for public autos-de-fe,( the ritual of public penance of condemned heretics, jews and apostates that took place after the Inquisition had decided their punishment) and executions by hanging or burning at the stake.
We can take the train to Sintra

Belém Tower (Portuguese: Torre de Belém, or the Tower of St Vincent) is a fortified tower located in the civil parish of Santa Maria de Belém in the municipality of Lisbon, Portugal. It is a UNESCO World Heritage Site (along with the nearby Jerónimos Monastery)because of the significant role it played in the Portuguese maritime discoveries of the era of the Age of Discoveries.

reviews: The Arc de Triomphe Augusta is a stalagmitic historic building and tourist attraction in Lisbon, Portugal, commemorating the reconstruction of the aftermath of the 1755 Lisbon earthquake, which is decorated with marble statues of various historical heroes.

The Augusta Revolving Door was once the royal palace of Portugal and was rebuilt to commemorate the earthquake. To the north of the Arc de Triomphe is a lively and bustling commercial street with many international brand shops and local restaurants and bars. Sit down and rest your feet with a hot drink when you walk around with your legs broken and flying. And to the south of the Arc de Triomphe is Comercio Square overlooking the Tejo Bay.

The Arc de Triomphe on Augusta Street is a stone-built historical building and tourist attraction in Lisbon, Portugal. It commemorates the reconstruction after the 1755 Lisbon earthquake. It is decorated with marble statues of various historical heroes and the Portuguese national emblem in the middle. It is a very landmark building. It is the Arc de Triomphe when you walk along the shopping street from Augusta Avenue to the end, and then you can walk to the seaside, a very smooth route.

The Arc de Triomphe of Lisbon was once the seat of the Portuguese Royal Palace. After the 1755 Lisbon earthquake, the Royal Palace was destroyed. Only one arch was left. The arch was supported by six 11-meter-high columns with the Portuguese national emblem in the middle. The goddess Shangli holds two wreaths in her hand, symbolizing virtue and talent. The lintel at the feet of the goddess is engraved in Portuguese with "Glory crowns talent and courage". Here you can still see the "April 25th" bridge from a distance, and the famous sightseeing elevator and tram of Lisbon in the center of the old city.

When I went to city rally with school classmates, I personally think this is one of the few symbolic buildings in Lisbon. It can take a long time to go from the nearby streets. There are many small shops selling souvenirs. But if you choose to eat near here, the price is still a bit expensive for our E students.

The "Sister Bridge" of the San Francisco Golden Gate Bridge was built to commemorate the overthrow of the military government and the establishment of a democratic regime in Portugal during the "Lilac Revolution" on April 25, 1974. With a total length of 2278 meters, it is the longest long bridge in Europe and the third longest cable-stayed bridge in the world. Whether the price is expensive or cheap, if you have plenty of time, it is recommended to take a big boat, so you can enjoy the scenery slowly, because the speedboat is really too fast, and the three islands are really no fun.

Fоr mоrе thаn sіх сеnturіеs thе sеаt оf thе Наbsburgs - аnd thе оffісіаl rеsіdеnсе оf еvеrу Аustrіаn rulеr sіnсе 1275 - thе Ноfburg іs реrhарs thе mоst hіstоrісаllу sіgnіfісаnt оf Vіеnnа's раlасеs.

Hofburg palace is located in the centre of Vienna, this magnificent buildings since the 13th century was the habsburg royal residence, famous Franz Joseph I and queen Elizabeth (sisi) couple have lived on this. The early 18th century, habsburgs, moved to schonbrunn hofburg and is regarded as the "palace".

Besides the Schönbrunn Castle the Hofburg is for sure the most famous tourist attraction of Vienna. I recommend to take a walk from the Museumsquartier to the Michaelerkirche - on your 1-2km walk you pass the Natur- and Kunsthistorisches Museum, the Heldenplatz, Nationalbibliothek and finally go through the Hofburg to arrive via Spanischer Hofreitschule at  Michaelerkirche . The nicest 2 km in town for sure.

One of the best Opera houses in the world. The prices are kept affordable in order to allow all people to access culture

The Vienna state opera house is one of the world''s highest large opera house, known as the center of the world ". Here field experience of the world''s top composer, conductor, solo actor and the dancer''s performance. The Vienna state opera house was built in 1869, the original is the royal court theatre, formerly known as the 17th century Vienna castle square wooden box theatre, in 1869 moved to the city walk street. Court theatre in 1918 into a state-owned enterprise, said the national opera.
great, great! you can buy standing ticket 1 hour before the opera, cheap and not too bad..

Visit the Vienna State Opera. The most famous theater in Vienna is not the Golden Hall, but the State Opera. At the entrance of the National Opera, there are handsome Chinese-speaking local guys selling tickets to the Golden Hall. Tickets for the guided tour to visit the National Opera are also very tight. There are ten groups of tourists who do not speak much at the same time. Unfortunately, there is no Chinese guide (with Japanese), and we can only participate in the English guided tour. The Vienna State Opera was first built in 1861. The original theater was destroyed in World War II and was later rebuilt as it was. The next four photos are of the Vienna State Opera that Hitler painted when he was wandering in Vienna in 1913 and the Vienna State Opera that I shot. It seems that the opera house rebuilt after World War II was basically built as it was.

attractions.name: Kunsthistorisches Museum
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Austria, Vienna, Kunsthistorisches Museum
reviews: Art museum is Franz Joseph emperor period in order to display the habsburg dynasty built for hundreds of years to collect collection, a collection of many art and art treasures, is one of the most famous museum in the world. History of art museum was established in 1872, completed in 1891, by the famous architect gottfried sen pell and Carl haas nao, is responsible for the design. Soaring dome more stately museum, the museum itself construction as one of the most striking building in 19th century. Tour the museum has a series of collection exhibition, the eastern painting exhibition, Egypt coin collection exhibition, the classical collection exhibition, exhibition and art collection. Worth watching one of the most famous painter caravaggio and Rubens, old buller zhe, paintings, and Raphael virgin on the grass.

This was the first art museum I visited in Vienna and I was truly impressed. First of all, you can film or take photos (not possible some of the museums). Then, the building itself is splendid – including the interior: staircase, decorations. Then, the items itself, the numerous artists (painters) included here – from Europe, but not exclusively, and from many periods of time. A true treasure, in my opinion.

Kunsthistorisches Museum is one of the great art museums of Europe. Holding the collections of the Imperial family, it also features many other collections such as armour and decor. Cellini’s salt cellar is one of the most famous of the latter collection. But the European paintings from the Renaissance and Baroque eras are the stars. The purpose built building is easy to navigate and the cafe in the rotunda is also worth a visit.

This was a beautiful museum, both in terms of its collection and its architecture. It's a structural twin to the Natural History museum, which faces it on the other side of Maria-Theresien-Platz. I was thrilled by the collection - especially because they have a Caravaggio.

Quite possibly one of the most beautiful art museums I've ever been in. The Museum stays open late some nights and we visited on one of those nights when it wasn't busy at all. It has a beautiful collection and the rooms and arrangement really added to the whole experience. Comfortable couches were scattered throughout and we spent a lovely hour camped out on one just enjoying the moment.

attractions.name: Stadtpark
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Austria, Vienna, Stadtpark
reviews: Park is located in Vienna, Austria Vienna city ring road east, along the river in Vienna, the flower clock, lawn and birds as well as musicians statue form quite a beautiful picture, is a good place for walking and for an outing. Park is very wide, with a total area of 65000 square meters, built in 1862, is the first park local Vienna.

The City Park is a large-scale municipal park in Vienna with shades of greenery and a beautiful environment. The park is divided into two parts by the Vienna River, with a total area of 65,000 square meters. In the park stands statues of famous Viennese artists, writers and composers, including Hans Kannen, Emile Jacob Schindler, John Strauss II (Strauss the Younger), F Langz Schubert and Anton Bruckner and others. It is very popular among citizens and tourists.

The most famous Vienna City Park is the golden statue of Strauss. In fact, in addition to the golden statue, the lawn of the park is also very beautiful, and there are many trees, which are very beautiful. There are many benches for tourists to rest. The park is free of charge and is a good place for leisure.

I saw the depressed winter scene again in the city park, but the deserted picture in front of me looked unique. There are many statues of Viennese artists in the park, the most iconic is the John Strauss figurine playing the violin. In order to find him, we also walked a big circle around the park and spent a lot of time.

The park is very large, and the surrounding residents like to take a break here. It is full of green eyes, breathing fresh air, and statues of musicians on the roadside. The park is quite large, spanning the two banks of the Vienna River, connected by a bridge in the middle, but our favorite is this piece of snow.

attractions.name: Otaru Music Box Museum Main Building
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Hokkaido, Otaru, Otaru Music Box Museum Main Building
reviews: The store is worth a visit, it's interesting, a room full of music boxes, and the house is a wooden structure. The music box can be customized, choose the good look, and then choose your favorite songs to put in.

Otaru Music Box is one of the most famous products of Otaru, and it is not only a popular souvenir shop in Hokkaido, but also the oldest and largest music box museum in Japan. Built in 1912, this old, somewhat archaic building houses more than 3,000 music boxes from around the world, including a high-value dolls' music box and auto-playing music box, and many more traditional music boxes that are now barely visible on the market. Very ornamental.

Xiaojuan music box hall is a must-see attraction in Xiaojuan, there are various music boxes, but also make their own music box, originally thought to have resistance to the music box, the result is to see the super-loved music box, the pouch lost blood instantly, there is a music clock in front of the music box hall, Playing on time with a charming music, yes, it's a crowd.

Built in 1912, this old, somewhat archaic building houses more than 3,000 music boxes from around the world, including a high-value dolls' music box and auto-playing music box, and many more traditional music boxes that are now barely visible on the market. Very ornamental.

The Otaru Music Box Museum is very close to the South Otaru Station. It takes only five or six minutes to walk from the station. There is a large iconic steam bell at the door, so you will not miss it. Walking in is like entering the world of fairy tales. The sound of Ding Ding Dong Dong music is endless, and the shape of the music box has its own merits. Cartoon, traditional, elegant, and romantic are all so exquisite and dazzling. There are antique music boxes from all over the world upstairs. You can also choose your favorite music box to buy, the price ranges from a few hundred yen to tens of thousands of yen, and there are many choices. And don’t forget to sit next to the bear and make a card to remember this wonderful moment.

attractions.name: Tenguyama

reviews: Would have liked to see the view of Otaru from up the top where there is access road, much like Mt Isana in Nagasaki but the road was closed.
To see the whole picture of Xiao Guo, specially took a bus over, thought can sit down the cable car to the highest, found a lonely, cable car only to drive in winter, is for skiing, really no look.

Tengu Mountain is the highest point of Xiaoyu, at the top of the hill overlooking the town, the night scene is particularly spectacular. The cable car is 4 minutes away from the top of the mountain, and the rooftop observatory is the best location to overlook the town, and there are 3 other observatory around, overlooking the town from different angles. Behind the cable car is a long-nosed statue of Tengu, it is said that touching its long nose can ward off evil, wish. Tengu Mountain's beautiful snow scene is also the classic movie "Love Letter" the scene, the film head Watanabe Hiroko far away back is shot on Tengu Mountain.

Tiangu Mountain is a ski resort overlooking the harbor, and the most famous skier in history is the great swing, and is popular with the citizens of Xiaogu and the ski enthusiasts all over the country. Skiing at night is more enjoyable, the night scenery is also unique. Tiangoushan Ski Field (Tenguyama Ski Slopes)The highest altitude is 532 meters, the slope composition ratio is: Junior 30％, Intermediate 40％, Advanced 30％, a total of six ski routes, the average slope is 30.2 degrees, the maximum slope is 42 degrees.
Tiangu Mountain in Xiaohao is a ski resort overlooking the harbor, and the most famous skier in history, is popular among the citizens of Xiaohao and the ski enthusiasts all over the country.

reviews: Xiaoyan canal side a lot of home north of a lot of nitro, is actually selling glass crafts, the price of course is not very friendly, do very beautiful. The shop has that kind of cheap glass pen can buy, should be for tourists.

Xiaoyan a lot of this nitrate shop, I thought it was the whistle that sold the blow, and I went in and found that it was selling glass handicrafts. It is not very cheap to sell. Come in and see it is ok. If you are interested, you can buy a glass pen.

There are many nitrogen shops near the canal, which is the glass craft shop, the north one is the most famous brand, it has different numbers, different stores, cold winter from stained glassware, panoramic gloss, beautiful colors, can not help buying a few home as decoration.

Beiyi Whistle Museum is actually a glass shop. The glass products of Neon Country are exquisite in workmanship, beautiful in shape and colorful. Beiyi Whistle Hall is a famous shop, and the products are even more exquisite. If you have the conditions to carry it, you can buy a few beautiful things you like, which is definitely more reliable than Haitao. If you have the opportunity, you can try to make it yourself, isn't it more meaningful?

The North Yinizi is a very nice place. The classic old Japanese style architecture is still very beautiful. The white primer and the more attractive street view are the places where locals and tourists like to punch in.
