attractions.name: Otaru Taishou Glass Palace
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Hokkaido, Otaru, Otaru Taishou Glass Palace
reviews: Can see thousands types of music box which made by various pattern and materials such as glasses, wood and porcelain.  Although the prices are expensive but many people like to buy it home for gifts.
many kinds of music box and can even DIY own music box

Upon entering the museum, one is enchanted by the music box tunes that fill the air of vast hall that contains thousands, THOUSANDS of music boxes.  On the ground floor, the music boxes are mainly for sale, while on the second floor, both museum pieces and for sale items are on display.  It is ok to touch and turn the dials of the delicate boxes....but need to take care.  This museum / store sure could bring smile to everyone who enters.

Taisho nitrose hall is a glass shop that has been converted from a stone warehouse. It not only displays and sells unique and beautiful glass crafts, but also participates in glass making experience. The Taisho Period (1912 years - 1926 years) was a period in which many excellent works were produced in the history of glass manufacturing in Japan, and many works were combined with the western style of the Art Nouveau movement.

Taisho Glass Museum-located in Otaru Street, where the whole street is covered with glass coffins. In Japan, the tube glass shop is called the glass shop. The Taisho Whistle Store is a relatively large store, and it has a certain reputation and scale in the local area. It is also a representative of this street whistle store. The Taisho era was the most prosperous period of Japanese glass crafts. Taisho Whistle Store Inherit the traditional craftsmanship. Today this shop is a whistle shop that integrates glass history, glass workshops, boutique exhibitions, and handcraft experience.

attractions.name: Warehouse District
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Hokkaido, Otaru, Warehouse District
attractions.open_status: It is roughly 11:00-22:00, and each store is different.
reviews: To be honest, I'm here for Takara Kashiwabara. As a 19-year-old fan of Kassy, I always have to come to the pilgrimage filming location of "Love Letter"! My husband accompanies me to Funamizaka to take a photo. After leaving Otaru Station, just follow the main force! Turning straight ahead, you will reach the Otaru Canal~ Walking along the river all the way, all kinds of must-see attractions, food, and shopping shops are all together. There are so many people on the Otaru Canal! There are also many tour groups. You must choose an angle to take pictures, otherwise everyone... I saw so many cute snowmen along the way and couldn't help but take a group photo~ After lunch, go to Funaban! It’s not far from Otaru Station, so we will return to Sapporo after checking in. What is Rokkatei? I don’t like to eat it. When I go to the store, I don’t even have the desire to buy it. Japanese desserts really vary from person to person. I like letao! There are leTAO shops everywhere, just enter one of them. You can only eat strawberry rolls, so delicious! There is also delicious ice cream~ so satisfying! The seafood dong is so fresh. But the day I went there, I had a bad appetite. I could only watch my husband eat it... Otaru was colder than Sapporo, and the snow was thicker. Remember to wear snow claws, otherwise you will fall, especially near the Otaru Canal. Funamizaka has a lot of people taking pictures, most of them are Chinese and Korean. I also encountered low-quality, four girls holding hands in the middle of the road to take pictures, regardless of the local car driving, but also drunk... Otaru is a tourist city, souvenirs are not recommended, but music boxes are acceptable.

Hokkaido is notoriously not like demolition of old buildings. It is estimated that it is related to the cold environment, complex terrain, and small population. After all, big cities will only sell every inch of land and historical sites will be demolished when they are useless. The Otaru Canal is a well-known landscape. The main reason is that it is really good-looking, and the second is the bonus of film and television dramas. It is normal to change the abandoned warehouse to the scenic spot. It is not surprising that there is Hakodate Kanemori warehouse in front of it, and Otaru also changed to a canal warehouse.

Walking along the Otaru Canal is the most romantic and relaxing thing to come to Otaru. There are a little more than 1 km of walking trails along the river, opposite to the nostalgic warehouses. After coal was discovered in Sapporo in 1873, Otaru had become an important export port for coal. Therefore, warehouses were built next to the canal. However, the storage function of these warehouses has disappeared, and some have been converted into riverside restaurants and small The most beautiful scenery along the town canal.

Otaru should be considered a very popular city. In order to go to Otaru, I read the love letter specially. Otaru in the movie is really beautiful.
But if there is no snow, Otaru is really ordinary, and winter is really beautiful.

The warehouse is renovated in a very classical place. Many of the small things here are also very simple. The warehouse group can also see a lot of fun little things. It is suitable for family members to visit here. There are many warehouse groups. Resources can also be felt.

attractions.name: Otaru Steam Clock
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Hokkaido, Otaru, Otaru Steam Clock
reviews: The Otaru Steam Clock is located in the city center by the sea, facing the famous Otaru Music Box Museum, there are many European-style cottages nearby, and there are many desserts and gift shops on the street, which is very exciting. The steam clock is said to be made by Canada and is the world's largest watch of its kind. It is worth waiting to listen to the steam whistle music that can be played through steam.

The steam clock is also a very interesting place. The steam can often see the eruption of smoke. The structure of this huge clock is also very beautiful. The structure of the whole area is also very unique. I like some of them here. Design to visit.

Otaru is the romantic capital, and the Japanese-European style attracts many tourists. There are few steam clocks in the world, and one of them is located at the crossroads of fairy tales, at the entrance of Otaru Music Box Hall. It is in harmony with the architectural style of Music Box Hall, attracting countless tourists to take photos. It's a pity that when I came here, I just glanced quickly, not on the hour, and didn't hear the hour and the graceful music.

Searching for Ctrip's review "Steam Clock", I found that there are two options, one is in Canada and the other is in Otaru. In fact, these two steam clocks can be said to be the same model. This one from Otaru was also made by Canadian watchmakers. It is made of bronze and is 5.5 meters high and 1 meter wide. It is said that the music will be played every 15 minutes, but we go in and out and always miss the time it plays, so it is not clear whether it is pleasing or not. In the music box hall inside, there is also a mini version of the steam bell music box on sale.

The famous steam clock is at the entrance of Otaru Music Box Hall. If you walk from Minami Otaru Station, it will be closer. We walked all the way from Otaru Canal, Whistle Hall, LeTAO, and finally to the Music Box Hall. At this time the snow was very heavy and it was already dark. If it is daytime, or on a sunny day, such a building should be beautiful. This is one of the few remaining steam clocks in the world, with a sense of history and significance. The steam clock will beep on the hour, and there will be wisps of steam from the top of the head, which is very interesting, but unfortunately there is no time to take it, the snow is too big to hold the camera. I think I will definitely come to Otaru to make up for my regrets.

attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Hokkaido, Otaru, Asari
reviews: Chaoli is a county town under Otaru City, Hokkaido, a quiet coastal village, full of simple and quiet beauty. Looking inside, the scenery is very beautiful, if you don't rush to the road, get off at JR Chaoli Station, the sea outside the platform, go to the seaside blowing wind, the mood will be very comfortable.

Chaoli is a county in the Hokkaido area, a beautiful town facing the sea, the scenery is especially beautiful, this winter by the seaside city let people unconsciously look forward to looking forward,

Asari is a stop from JR to Otaru. I saw many descriptions of it in the guide, so I stopped and got off the car to have a look. It is indeed suitable for tourists living in a metropolis to appreciate the scenery, especially in winter when it snows. That kind of cold beauty, the waves hit the rocks to make your heart temporarily calm.

It is a very beautiful place to enjoy the scenery of the mountains. You can also see a lot of nice natural scenery here. Many of the scenery in the whole area are very suitable. Some locals who come here are also in an endless stream. Oh.

Asari is a county seat under Otaru City, Hokkaido, a quiet coastal village full of simple and tranquil beauty. Facing the sea inward, the scenery is very beautiful. Here you can see snow in winter, and the blue water and ice and snow complement each other.

attractions.name: Otaru Snow Light Path
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Hokkaido, Otaru, Otaru Snow Light Path
reviews: When you come to Hokkaido to play, you have gone to Otaru Yun. Many tourists and local Japanese will come here to pick up the scenery and take pictures. The river is very beautiful at night. It is very romantic.

This road is very famous. If you come to Otaru, you will come here. Movie love letters are also taken here. I came during the day and didn't see the lights turned on. If I stay for a long time, I can come to see it at night.

The Otaru Snow Lantern Festival, the annual seasonal event in Otaru, realizes all this by carefully lighting every candle by citizens and volunteers. It is said that nearly 500 volunteers participate in this activity every year. They need to make snow lantern shells, light every candle every evening before dark, and recycle them after the activity. They need to patrol to discover that they have been blown by the wind. Extinguished candle. On the one hand, it takes care of the snow lanterns, on the other hand, it also provides tourists with sightseeing consultation, taking pictures and other services. These volunteers are not only local Japanese residents in Otaru, but also enthusiastic people from other countries. If you have time and want to participate more in local activities, you can apply to be a volunteer in advance, or join a tour group guided by a volunteer. Before the start of the daily Otaru Snow Lantern Road activity, volunteer guides (persons qualified as Otaru guides) will lead a tour of the main venue and surrounding townscapes and historical buildings. Visitors can learn about the birth of the Snow Lantern Road and see the process of making snow lanterns by volunteers. Specific information can be found on the website of Otaru Snow Lantern Festival.

A good place with beautiful scenery. Many of the landscapes here are especially hungry. Snow Lantern Road is also more suitable for visiting in winter. The feeling here is also pretty good in snowy weather. It is very nice to come here to enjoy the scenery of.

Snow Lantern Road is the most beautiful in winter, with heavy snow flying in the sky and European-style houses, especially romantic. Like the ones we came here in the summer, they were a bit more ordinary. But it’s nice to go around

The museum is filled with so many interesting pieces of artwork, it's nice to just walk around and try to understand what they all mean. The sculptures and oil paintings are my favorite exhibits.

There are several museums, one of the world's most famous parks, and was built to commemorate the 400th anniversary of the founding of São Paulo.

It is said that the ten most beautiful urban parks in the world, Ibirapuera Park is among the top three. All this seems familiar. Today's São Paulo is certainly the beginning of winter, but it is filled with the warm breath of summer morning, and the fresh smell of grass permeates all around. Standing on the shore, closing your eyes, breathing the mixed taste of lake water, air and sunlight, letting you go freely, this is a beautiful day. attractions.name: Elbphilharmonie Hamburg
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Germany, Hamburg, Hamburg, Elbphilharmonie Hamburg
attractions.address: Platz der Deutschen Einheit 1, 20457 Hamburg, Germany
reviews: Stunning concert and performance venue. We were surprised to learn that tickets are very inexpensive. We saw a lovely piano recital for about 12 euros a ticket.

This peculiar looking, partially glass, building in the HafenCity will probably draw your curiosity, and it has a slightly amusing history. It is a concert hall built on top of an old warehouse, giving it the infamously odd appearance. The construction of this building has cost Hamburg a lot of money and time! Which is why to some people from Hamburg the building is something to ridicule, or view with distain! It doesn't officially open until 2017, but whilst you're exploring the HafenCity stop to look at the controversial building and see if you think it was worth all the money it cost to build.

The Elbphilharmonie doesn’t officially open until January 2017, but if you are anywhere near the harbor you won’t be able to miss it, and you should walk down to the Elbe to get a glimpse of it at least. Built from an old warehouse, the new design by Swiss architects has an impressive façade and wave-like roof. Inside will eventually be two concert halls, a hotel and apartments. If you fall in love with it, and are a classical music fan, tickets for the opening concerts are already on sale. If you are reading this after January 2017, the Elbphilharmonie directors are planning an ambition lineup of soloists and orchestras from around the world, putting a modern touch on classical music. Concert series, festivals and experimental musical fun will play out.

The Elbe Philharmonic Hall is a very famous concert hall in Germany. The buildings here are very distinctive with the design characteristics of modern architecture. The facilities inside are also very advanced and the acoustics are quite good. The male colleagues can accommodate more than 3000 people. Appreciating music is really beautiful.
Still a new architectural model-Hamburg's fantastic "Elbphilharmonie Concert Hall" Adapted redesigned Architecture Wonder- Elbphilharmonie Hamburg

attractions.name: Tsurugaoka Hachimangu
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Kanagawa, Kamakura, Tsurugaoka Hachimangu
reviews: Tsuruoka Hachimangu Shrine is a popular temple of Shintoism with a characteristic Japanese belief system. The overall structure is similar to other shrines. The main body has a history of more than 800 years. The temple has a history of nearly a thousand years. It was built by Genji, a military family of the Heian Dynasty, to deify himself invincibly. The main god of worship is the God of War, Emperor Yingjin. The shrine is located in Kamakura, very close to the Big Buddha scenic spot. Usually one-day trips will come together. It is worth mentioning that after the completion of this temple, the Genji was blessed to establish the Kamakura Shogunate, so Very effective.

Yawata Ko in Kamakura, Tokyo is a very famous attraction, every time you go to Tokyo, you have to visit it. There are many tourists on that street. There are shops and restaurants on both sides, where you can buy different tourist souvenirs.

⛰[Attraction Guide] Small spot in Kamakura-Tsuruoka Hachimangu Shrine

💗Recommendation reason:

It is one of the three big Hachiman Shrines, and the chief sacrificial gods are the Hachiman three gods: Emperor Yingshen, God of Bisar, and Empress of Shen Gong.

They were stopped before they got to the palace, but found out that they were doing some ritual, especially orthodox, and very serious: one by one, they walked over at the corresponding pace and movement. All of us have to wait for them to pass before letting us go on their way.

The dance hall leading to the main palace is a place where dances are performed in the palace. The "Dance of Silence" performed at the Kamakura Festival held in April every year is worth seeing.

The dance hall is a place where dance music and folk wedding ceremonies are held. According to legend, before the establishment of the dance hall, the beloved concubine of the tragic military commander Gen Yoshitsune Jingyuqian was the place where Gen Yoshitsune performed the dance, but the poems she danced and sang were aimed at Gen Yoshitsune.

Believers and tourists from all over the country stepped up religiously and orderly to visit the patron saint, the god of war and the god of war in the Hachiman Palace.
 
There were real ceremonies on that day, and people were forbidden to enter. Only by showing some kind of invitation can you enter.


📌Little Tips:

Tsuruoka Hachimangu Shrine was the center of faith for the guardian deity of the samurai in the Middle Ages, and it is still the symbol of Kamakura today. Founded in 1063, the first general of the Kamakura shogun, Gen Yoshito, used to set up a division here and defeated the enemy Hei clan.

🌟Highlights and features:

1⃣️The "dedication" at the entrance is very shocking (the various colorful chrysanthemums placed here are carefully cultivated by local Japanese residents at home and sent to this dedication shrine).

The Komachi Street that goes out of the palace gate leads to the east exit of Kamakura Station. On both sides of the road, there are rows of shops selling special snacks such as dumplings and pancakes, and souvenirs of Kamakura.

In the middle of the street, there is a tree-lined road one section higher than the driveway, and on both sides there are traditional stone lamps from Japanese shrines, and a large red torii gate is built at the beginning of the road. Visitors and visitors to the shrine can leisurely walk to the shrine through this straight tree-lined road. The straight path in front of the shrine is called Duan Ge.

2⃣️Ichi no Torii is a stone Myojin Torii, made of Mikage Stone (granite) from Inujima, Bizen Country, 8.5m high and 92cm in diameter.

📍Detailed address:

After walking this road, we arrived at Kamakura Station.

Tsuruoka Hachimangu Shrine (つるおかはちまんぐう) is a shrine located in Kamakura City, Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan. The Middle Ages is the center of faith for the guardian deity of the samurai and remains a symbol of Kamakura. It is about 10 minutes walk from Kamakura Station. Free to the outside world. The main attractions are Komachi Street (a road that runs north-south on the west side of Wakamiya Oro which extends straight from Tsuruoka Hachimangu Shrine, where there are local specialty food shops such as natto, handicraft shops such as Kamakura sculptures, and restaurants), Ichino Torii (stone Myojin Torii), Duan Ge (a high sidewalk made of earth rammed with sakura trees and azaleas planted on both sides of the road), Maiden (a place where dance music and weddings in front of the gods are held), Hongu (enshrines The main sacrifices are to the three gods Hachiman: Emperor Yingshen, God of Bimai, Empress of Shen Gong), etc. There are many people praying in the main hall, and the side hall displays several different styles of sedan chairs. There is a larger lake outside Hachimangu Shrine, where many seagulls and pigeons gather. The Hachimangu Shrine itself is not too big, and the building itself is not particularly prominent, but the natural scenery and historical sites such as the Kamakura Shogunate and Uesugi Kenshin are worth checking out for those who like history.

Every year during the cherry blossom season, cherry blossoms bloom in the shrine, and a sea of pink flowers can be seen from a distance. Going further into it is a big pond with cherry blossoms on the bank and cherry blossoms in the water. There are cherry blossoms everywhere, so beautiful. It's so beautiful.

attractions.name: Kotokuin Great Buddhaof Kamakura
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Kanagawa, Kamakura, Kotokuin Great Buddhaof Kamakura
attractions.open_status: 8:00 to 17:30 (until 17:00 from October to March). Statue Interior: 8:00 to 16:30.
reviews: The fate of the Great Buddha and Kamakura, one of Japan's three great Buddhas, was often marred. The main body of the building, which was made of wood, was completed in six years. But after three years, it was destroyed by a typhoon. So, in 1253 began to recast the bronze seated Buddha statue, dedicated to the Great Buddha Hall. And the Great Buddha Hall also experienced many typhoons, fire damage, and again and again re-repair. But finally in 1498, due to the inverted water, the entire hall washed away. From then on, the Buddha statue has been open-air worship until now. Kamakura Buddha, high 11.5 meters, the interior is hollow structure, can be entered from the bottom of the Buddha statue. After entering, you can find that there are many traces of repairs inside the Buddha statue. On the left side of the statue, there are striking large grass shoes, about a meter long. I heard that children in Ibaraki Prefecture weave offerings to the Buddha. No wonder Masaoka Koki (a famous Japanese writer) writes haiku such as "fire にけず rain にも decay ちぬ Kamakura のはだかは Chang hui かも" (fire burns but does not destroy, rain drenches and does not decay, Kamakura open-air Buddha, perhaps eternal Buddha) to praise it.

Kamakura is a famous tourist spot in Japan, and the Big Buddha is the number one attraction. The body of the Buddha is made of bronze, and the hollow can be entered for worship (the symbolic incense is about 1 yuan). The Buddha statue has a history of more than 700 years. When it was built, a palace was placed, but the building was repeatedly destroyed by natural disasters. Therefore, this big Buddha has been sitting in the open air since the Hongzhi period of the Ming Dynasty. Now it has been immortal for hundreds of years. It is said that the Buddha pole under the snow scene Beauty, it's a pity that I didn't see it.

The Great Buddha of Kamakura in Japan is famous all over the world, and it is a must-see attraction in Japan. The Great Buddha of Kamakura is very big, and you can go inside to see it. Tickets are not very expensive, it is worth to see

The bronze statue of the Great Buddha of Kamakura, cast in 1252
Was originally housed in a wooden temple
It has been open in the open air for more than 700 years

The Big Buddha is located in the courtyard of Gaodeyuan
The background is breathtaking mountain forest

Statue is very tall
Up to 13 meters

Kamakura is 48 km from Tokyo
It’s a short walk from the train station to the Big Buddha

It only costs a little bit
Visitors can enter the statue~

I think it’s totally worth seeing. Of course, I’ve heard from my friends that if I have seen the Leshan Giant Buddha or the Longmen Grottoes, the Kamakura Giant Buddha is nothing short of them. I’m glad I haven’t been to these two places. The Cangda Buddha is still very shocking, after all, the height of the Buddha with the pedestal is 13.35 meters. The inside of the Big Buddha is a hollow structure that can be accessed from behind.

attractions.name: Komachi Dori
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Kanagawa, Kamakura, Komachi Dori
reviews: Kamakura Kosaka Dori street is the most famous shopping street in Kamakura. It is a shopping street for young people who come to Kamakura to visit, not only for the most authentic snacks and food, but also for beautiful trinkets and souvenirs. At Otaru Tong Commercial Street, you can enjoy the most friendly and characteristic service of the Japanese.

Kamakura has a lot of food and ice cream. Although sometimes the shop is very busy, but when you taste delicious, you will feel very tasty. Some food can be made by yourself, which is very interesting.

Eat, drink and hang out on the street! Commodity prices are very cheap, see the right likes to buy, hurry up! Here I have eaten a good time octopus burn! This is octopus burn! I want to eat enough to go back to China!

Adjacent to Tsuruoka Hachimangu Shrine, it is a small but crowded commercial street, but it is too fun.
In addition to the snacks and souvenirs found in various commercial streets, there are 3 pet cafes on Komachi Street: Cat Coffee, Shiba Inu Coffee and Owl Coffee. What the hell is Owl Coffee? Regardless, anyway, one at a time.

Shiba Inu, as the "national dog" of Japan, is deeply loved by the Japanese people. Dou Shiba is smart and cute. Its size is only half the size of a standard Shiba Inu. Anyway, it is a word: Super cute! Zhang Dou Chai’s poster attracted...Is it really good for you guys ❓I’m a person who is going to check-in attractions, how can I be caught by a dog ❓anyway, an hour later, I’m already at this Dou Chai coffee shop The detailed address of the pavilion: Kamakura Store: Kanagawa Prefecture, Kamakura City, Kamakura City, 1 Chome 6-4 Hamaru Raffa, Level 2, Traffic Guide: Kamakura Station Exit Plaza on the left front. Or Kamakura Tsurugang Hachimangu Shrine, turn right to the end and turn left. ⏰Business hours: Weekdays 10:00-17:30, holidays 10:00-18:30　　 Tickets: 30 minutes per session, 880 yen for adults (a drink included), and 580 yen for children aged 4-12 (a drink included) , And under 3 years old is free. Expected play time: Recommended index: Feature 1⃣The Shiba Inu in this cafe are all made of bean firewood. There will be about 10 bean firewood in the shop, wearing scarves of different colors, walking freely in the store. Interact with customers. 2⃣️Beverages are self-selected on the beverage machine, and there are dozens of soft drink coffees, and there are probably dozens of them, but when 30 minutes are precious, customers are not very caring about the drinks. 3⃣️Located on the famous commercial street Komachi in Kamakura, go shopping It’s not enough to eat and play for a day. Practical tips1⃣️Admission guide: ①Buy the ticket of the day first ②Tell the clerk when you want to enter the venue (usually wait about an hour) ③Be present with a small ticket at the scheduled time ④Enjoy the Shiba Inu Short and precious happy hour 2⃣️In order to ensure the safety of dogs and customers, there are also a bunch of rules to follow in the store: ① Take off your shoes and disinfect your hands when entering the Cafe. ②Beverage cups should be covered frequently to avoid tipping over. ③You can touch the dogs, but you can't pick them up. If Dou Chai crawls to your feet, it's okay to let them stay on. But in order to avoid injury to the dog, do not force the dog. ④Photographs and videos can be taken, but flashing lights are not allowed, so as not to scare Dou Chai or affect other guests. In addition, Japanese people pay great attention to privacy. If you post photos on the Internet, you should try to avoid taking other guests' faces. If you do, you should also mosaic them first. ⑤In order to prevent dogs from eating by mistake, no food or drink can be brought into the venue, let alone smoking. 3⃣There is a cafe where you can slap cats not far from the Dou Shiba cafe, hey, Kamakura Komachi Street, you are really enough, and let people not go back and then we went in again...

attractions.name: Hase-dera Temple
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Kanagawa, Kamakura, Hase-dera Temple
attractions.open_status: 8:00 to 17:30 (until 17:00 from October to February). Admission ends 30 minutes before closing.
reviews: Hase Temple in Kamakura, Japan is particularly beautiful, with mountains, waters, and gardens. Every time I go to Japan, I have to visit it. Around April, the trees are still full of different flowers, which are particularly beautiful, and they are must-see places for tourists.

Reasons for recommendation: The largest wooden Buddha statue in Japan is enshrined, and there are also Japanese-style courtyards with small bridges and flowing water in the scenic area and an excellent location with mountains and sea behind. If there is only one temple in Kamakura, I recommend Hase Temple. After passing the small bridge and flowing water, you can climb up the steps to the main hall. The eleven-faced Guanyin statue enshrined in the main hall has a high status in Japan. The hiking trail behind the main hall must not be missed. You must climb to the highest viewpoint, and you can see the beautiful scenery of the crescent-shaped Shonan coast.

Jangko Temple is near the Great Buddha of Kamakura. It is a bit larger and has a small hill. You can see the distant view from up, which is very beautiful. There are many different flowers and fishes playing in the water. The environment is good.

Hasedera in Kamakura.
It is said that there are more than 200 kinds of hydrangea, which is called hydrangea in China! In fact, it was introduced into Japan from China. Japan's gardening level is very high, and more than 200 kinds of hydrangea have been improved.

Japanese called AJISAI Chinese characters: hydrangea, and later in China, hydrangea was also called hydrangea. It is actually a flower, but there are many kinds. The hydrangea of Hase Temple is also one of the best in Japan. It has its own variety and the color is very rare aqua blue.

It is said that plants grown in alkaline soil will become pink, purple, and aqua. Acid soil will become white, so the local soil quality is also very important.

[Scenery] The exquisiteness of the Japanese-style courtyard is particularly characteristic in rainy weather. The hiking trails are very quiet, with hydrangea planted all over the mountains. It must be beautiful when it comes to flowering
[Fun] You can see the courtyard, you can visit, and you can climb to overlook the entire city and the Shonan coast
[Value for money] The scale of the temple is moderate, not tired

attractions.name: Shonan Beach
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Kanagawa, Kamakura, Shonan Beach
reviews: they are taken by close to Shichirigahama coast (七里ヶ浜)!! Around there have many sick cafes ;)) i love cafes so i often have lunch there!! you can eat good foods to see ocean view x))) you will love it if you love the ocean<3 summer time is the BEST

The Shonan coast is one of the most beautiful coastlines in Japan. It is also the way where Kaede Rukawa goes to school in "Slam Dunk". It is also a location for many seaside scenes. When the weather is clear, you can overlook Mount Fuji. It is also a paradise for surfers and sailing lovers.

The summer on the Shonan coast is lively. People come here to escape the heat, play in the water, and surf. In winter, the coast here is not inferior. The setting sun of Mount Fuji is very clear, and the surfing warriors are still in the cold wind and icy waves. Churn

The coastline is long and the waves are slightly turbulent. You can see many surfers bravely stand on the board again and again, fall off, and stand up again. Blowing the sea breeze and stepping on the waves, our gentle play is also very comfortable.

Kamakura, a coastal city just an hour from Shinjuku, Tokyo, seems to have an infinite magic. It's not just a tourist attraction from all over the world, but a favorite resort for Tokyo and Yokohama. Surfing, watching the sea, watching the flowers, sardines cover rice, the fireworks convention at sea... There, everywhere with youth related things. Kamakura does not seem to be old, forever young, always let people want to love. Love Kamakura, but also thanks to the "Sea Street Diary" by Yuhe Zhi. It is said that Yukazu Eji made a year of intermittent shooting in Kamakura to capture the essence of the original work, and concentrated the four seasons in the 126 minutes film. Last winter, while staying in a wine house with friends, I announced my retirement plan: if I hadn't found someone at 40, I would have to use all my savings to buy a house in Kamakura and wake up every day in the sound of the waves and sleep in them. I love Kamakura not because it has the most beautiful coastline in Japan, nor because it is the fixed summer background of the Japanese opera and the sunshade, but because it is a unique smell, it is a reassuring, youth is around the smell, mixed with the salty taste of the sea, And the good smell of soap on the teenagers. Take Enoden once, look at Kamakura on the 100-year train. If you live in Tokyo, it is better to get up early and take the Odakyu line from Shinjuku Station. Take Enoden at Fujisawa Station. The intimate Japanese are prepared for the patients with "Kamakura poisoning syndrome". "Odakyu Enoshima Kamakura 1 Day Tour Ticket", can be round-trip to Shinjuku and Fujisawa, and can be boarded and dropped at Enoshima unlimited times. You can buy it at Shinjuku Station, lazy people must. Enoshima has a history of 100 years, the line is close to the South Shonan coast, from Fujisawa City through Enoshima to Kamakura, and the route 15 stations. Four stations parallel to the coastline, and about half the railway lines can see the sea directly. When the slow-moving trams pass through residential areas, another rail, and caves, a blue sea is introduced to the eye at the next corner. Put down the camera, and try to engrave the pictures you see into your mind. This moment, it is worth tears. Go to the heart, do a lonely foodie Jiangzhi electric sit to Long Valley Station, go to the seaside direction about 10 minutes, you can find this invincible sea view of the mind. After a long morning, you are hungry? So why don't you settle down for lunch here? It's the restaurant where Yasumi Nagazawa and Kentaro Higuchi date in the Sea Street Diary. The owner said that since the movie was released, there have been many pilgrimage fans, and I like the restaurant very much. But the boss didn't make it a selling point. His words were: "The guest eats all the food, is to me the best reward." And then I scratched my head embarrassedly, this hair longer than I have a swarthy black man, so looked more adorable. I ordered the curry-and-rice package with chilled peach wine, the soft-boiled curry was melted, the grocery was made with unnamed beans, the crisp bites, and the baked eggplant was delicious, and the onion soup was delicious with creamy aroma. So if you happen to be in Kamakura, be sure to have a meal and enjoy this mundane moment. Go to the blissful temple, also don't forget to see the purple flower friend hear I am in Kamakura, told me to replace her to go to the blissful temple station, because her favorite Japanese drama "the penultimate love" the hero every day will go to work in blissful temple to take the electric. If you like watching Japanese dramas and shadows as much as I do, you'll love this tiny station. The name of the station comes from a temple called the temple, less than 100 meters from the station. When I went to the temple, the purple flowers were not all in full bloom, only a few. The trees in the temple grew very well, the sun through the dense branches and leaves scattered down the floor, forming a beautiful spot, I seemed to approach the mist forest, the wind blowing through the leaves of the "crypton" sound clearly heard, as if in the ear. Later I went to Kamakura, and friends on the way to the moonyard, also saw the blooming purple Yang flower, purple Yang flower is not hated the rain season only thought. Going to the seaside, Kamakura has the most beautiful coastline in Japan. Here I saw the golden sunset. The coastline is very clean and the ecological environment is good. There are also many places to sit and watch the sunset, steps and so on. Can you find a place better for love than here? I don't think so.

attractions.name: Enoshima Electric Railway
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Kanagawa, Kamakura, Enoshima Electric Railway
attractions.address: 1-1-1, Komachi, Kamakura-shi (next to the green window at the east exit of JR Kamakura Station)
reviews: The most beautiful tram 🚃Enoden~ As a tram that runs along the coast, the scenery in itself is already attractive enough, not to mention that Enoden will pass through Shichirihama along the way, Yubihama, Kamakura High School, Ezhi Important attractions such as islands, so Enoden has become a must-have place to come to Kamakura. Whether you board the train from Kamakura Station or Fujisawa Station (the departure stations on both sides), it is recommended that you buy the Enoden one-day unlimited ride ticket. The price of 300 yen is very suitable, so that everyone can pass through a station or Just get off the bus and visit the scenic spots, and it is especially recommended that you bring a small book. Every station of Jiangzhidian will have a seal, as shown in Figure 13, the name of this station, very distinctive, seal control and favorites

[Scenery] The Shonan coast has beautiful scenery. Filming locations for movies, TV series, and anime. Before going, you can see "Haijie Diary", "Slam Dunk" or something
[Fun] Enoden travels through the downtown area of Kamakura, connecting the main attractions of the city. Kekrakuji Temple, Hase Temple, Kamakura Great Buddha, Kamakura High School are all along the Enoden Line. In front of Kamakura High School, there are so many tourists that affect traffic
[Value for money] It is strongly recommended to buy a one-day pass of Jiang Sanden, which is super cost-effective.

Enoden is a section of the tram line from Fujisawa to Kamakura. There are several movies and animations on this tram line. The classic trams will shuttle between the exquisite houses and the beautiful seaside. Each site is worth stopping to enjoy the beautiful scenery and customs that are worth remembering.

It is no exaggeration to say that if there is no Enoden, the taste of Kamakura will be greatly reduced~Enoden, starting at Fujisawa Station, passing by are all familiar place names in film and television dramas, such as: Enoshima, Kamakura Universities, Enkaku Temple, and along the Shonan Coast. The design of the carriage is also very cute, dark green, light green and ocher green... as if the years are driving over, or swaying or whizzing away, passing through the mountains and seas that are not magnificent but beautiful enough and exquisite enough for civilians...

The route information was dazzling. I lived near Ginza, and I finally chose Tokyo Shimbashi to take the JR to Kamakura, 800 yen per person one way. It is very convenient to buy tickets at the same station and exchange for Enorail. I plan to only go to the front station of the university, and the one way per person is 260 yen. No one sells tickets at the front station of the university, and the return ticket is paid back to Kamakura Station. Simply explain, the staff will immediately understand. To Jiang Zhi Tie, you will not be unfamiliar with Slam Dunk. The old tram, the most beautiful tram, often appears inside. The appearance of Jiangzhi Railway is very distinctive. The carriages of several carriages are of different colors, quite cute, and the driving route is also very magical. One will drive in a residential area, very close to the house, and another will drive on the seaside road. The familiar picture comes out. Do you have! It is estimated that the two-way trains are shared by the section of the railway at Gaoxueqian Station. On the return journey, the ride was reversed and I took the ride to Enoshima Station.

attractions.name: Meigetsu-in
attractions.loc_tags: Asia, Japan, Kanagawa, Kamakura, Meigetsu-in
reviews: When the hydrangea was in bloom, many people in Mingyueyuan lined up all the way to the train track. Yuyu arrived at about 9 o'clock and was already queued to the train track. From there, it took about an hour to buy tickets at the entrance. Tickets are probably the most expensive in Kamakura. It costs 500 yen. After one hour in line, it takes about 45 minutes to go inside. It takes about 45 minutes. The cost is beautiful, but Meigetsuin is not big, but overall it is worth visiting. From Kamakura Station, you can take a bus bound for Ofune or Kamakura. The fare is 180 yuan and get off at Meigetsuin Station. You can also take JR to Kita Kamakura Station and walk for 10 minutes.

On the way to Kamakura and Enoshima, I accidentally discovered beautiful spots. Although there are many people, it still can't erase the beautiful scenery of blooming flowers! If you have a plan in this direction, you might as well take the time to take a look! Very beautiful.

Very beautiful Japanese garden. If you come here, you must visit it. This time we went to the hydrangea blooming season. It was very beautiful. The whole landscape of Mingyueyuan is very beautiful. Those who love photography must not miss this attraction! Beautiful!

Normally, Mingyueyuan looks at the window of awakening. Legend has it that it is enlightening to watch the scenery outside the window all year round. I don't think it's mediocre, but in the hydrangea season, the courtyard is full of flowers of various colors. A paradise like a flower. To see hydrangea, it is recommended to go on weekdays and cloudy days, as there will be a lot of people on rest days (although there are many working days).

We leaned on the wooden boards of the Japanese-style house and saw that the fun in the garden was full of water features. It turns out that rainy and sunny days have different fun, and we are full of joy. Thank you for every day, Japanese style, beautiful.

attractions.name: Santa Maria del Fiore
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Italy, Tuscany, Florence, Santa Maria del Fiore
reviews: One of the most amazing Cathedral I had the chance to visit. There is so much details and attention put in the place you'll never be disappointed. The ceiling is breathtaking and the size of the monument is huge. If you are in Florence you HAVE to walk inside and enjoy this historical place.
Amazing sights along with a lively street scene. Incredible detail and fine art.
A different view of this cathedral. I wanted to expose the reds and greens against the whites. These colors are part of most churches in Italy as they represent Faith, Hope, and Charity.
A beautiful church with the amazing dome.  Be prepared for a line.  It is mostly quiet inside, but a bit crowded.
Beautiful church in the heart of Florence. Entrance is free, though the lines can be long. Really long.

attractions.name: Uffizi Gallery
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Italy, Tuscany, Florence, Uffizi Gallery
reviews: Buy your tickets in advance! I heard someone saying they had waited 2 hours before going in! Go early to enjoy viewing everything you can. Definietly worth visiting, and don't forget to take picures of the river while your upstairs, and the dome.

I was stunned by the paintings and sculptures in this museum. From Michaelangelo and Raffaello and da Vinci, you can see the magnificent works of several artists dating back to hundreds of years ago. The lines however can be long on peak times so it’s better to book the tickets in advance if you can!

A beautiful museum that we were able to see by chance! Our Airbnb host told us unless we booked way in advance, we would never get in. Well, we walked up about 2 hours before closing and there was zero line. We walked right in and saw everything we wanted. Also, there are great views from this museum. Don’t forget to look out the windows!

Whenever I am overwhelmed by uncertainties that seem troubling, I tell myself: Have a little Faith. And here at Uffizi, I met the goddess of Faith, one of the Seven Virtues (Faith, Hope, Charity, Temperance, Prudence, Fortitude, and Justice) by Botticelli and Pollaiolo.
This is a wonderful museum with some of the most beautiful works of art in the world. It's a must ! You need to book ahead of time if you don't want to queue up (call (+39) 055294883).

attractions.name: Ponte Vecchio
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Italy, Tuscany, Florence, Ponte Vecchio
reviews: one of the most suggestive place in florence, timeless and breathtaking at anytime lf the day.

An iconic and beautiful bridge that everyone should se one day. It gets very crowded during the day, but if you go bright and early in the morning, you will have it all to yourself. The morning light is absolutely gorgeous on the river too!

This iconic bridge is chock full of jewelry stores from end to end. It appears that every tourist in Florence feels the need to cross it, so even on a rainy day you can hardly move. The best view of the bridge is to go to the next bridge on the river and take your photos posing with the bridge in the background.
One  of the oldest bridge in the world,Unusual bridge full of shops of florentine hand made"gioielli"(golden,silver etc,)
Good looking bridge, a lot of beautiful accessorize on the bridge. Good icecream on the ends!

attractions.name: Piazza della Signoria
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Italy, Tuscany, Florence, Piazza della Signoria
reviews: Because the front field of the Church of Santa Maria del Fiore is very small, this square is the largest crowd distribution center in the city center. And it is not just a European square, it is simply an open-air sculpture hall, with many treasures here.

The central square of Florence is a treasure house of art. There are many sculptures in the open-air pavilion. There are many cafes on the first floor of the building on the other side. The Palace of the Lords is here, overlooking the city.

The Plaza Mayor is famous for the many famous sculptures placed on the square, including the Neptune Fountain, Parsius, Hercules and Centaur, and the equestrian statue of Cosimo Medici in the center of the square.
There are many brides and grooms here to hold a ceremony, the atmosphere is good, even we are all happy. The town hall is full of happiness.

The Plaza Mayor of Florence is considered to be one of the most beautiful squares in Italy because of its exquisite buildings. On the square, Bartolomio Amanati and his assistants made the "Poseidon Fountain". The statue is erected on a high base in the middle of the octagonal fountain. The base is decorated with the mythical figure Skula locked in chains. And Charybdis.

attractions.name: Academy Of Florence Art Gallery
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Italy, Tuscany, Florence, Academy Of Florence Art Gallery
reviews: The birthplace of the Renaissance, the art of the real many.

The Academy Art Museum is relatively small compared to many other famous art museums, especially compared to the Uffizi next door, but the fare is a little bit more, all because of the great statues here. There are mostly sculptures here, and some benches are for quiet. enjoy.

The Florence Academy of Fine Arts has become a holy place in the hearts of artists, scholars, tourists, and students all over the world because of its collection of the David statue of Michelangelo, the great Renaissance master. The visitor flow around the statue of David will not be less for a moment, but it is still much better than the visit to the Mona Lisa at the Louvre. After watching David up close, there are other sculptures by Michelangelo in the Academy Art Museum, some of which are like unfinished works, but actually present a scene of a desire to break through.

The classical music, the classical instrument museum is great, there are Stradivaris violins hundreds of years ago. But the museum queue was too long. I came in October and saved a lot of time because I had a Florence card. If you have visited more than 5-6 museums or churches, you can buy a Florence card.

The Florence Academy of Fine Arts collects Michelangelo’s David Statue. One of the boastful male nude statues in the history of Western art. Experience this vigorous creation in an all-round way (Pictures 1 to 5). Picture 6-7 is the exhibition of other sculptures collected by the Academy. Picture 8 For the tombs of Galileo and Michelangelo in the Basilica of Santa Croce, the statue of Dante in front of the Basilica of Santa Croce.

attractions.name: Basilica di Santa Croce
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Italy, Tuscany, Florence, Basilica di Santa Croce
attractions.open_status: Monday-Saturday 9:30-17:00, Sunday and other holy days (January 6, August 15, November 1, December 8) 14:00-17:00, ticket office 17 :00 is closed.
reviews: The Basilica of Santa Croce is a Franciscan Church, and some say that St. Francis, himself, was involved in the construction process. Construction of this Church began in the late 13th century and the Church was finally consecrated by the Pope in the early 15th century. I was overwhelmed by the splendor and beauty of this Church.  How many Churches have you visited that had the frescoes of the great Giotto, or the reliefs of Donatello?! While in Firenze, this Church should be on everyone's bucket list to visit.
One of many impressive churches in the city of Florence. This one is a little less massive and ornate than some of the others but beautiful non the less.
One of the churches in Florence, with a square out in front with plenty of things to buy. Plenty of places to explore near here as well.
Pretty little church that is a little more off the beaten path than others in Florence.

Santa Croce is also a typical church in Florence, with white as the background and the green facade as a pattern of painted colors. The square of this church should be the largest in the city, so it is very upright.

attractions.name: Campanile di Giotto
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Italy, Tuscany, Florence, Campanile di Giotto
attractions.open_status: Generally, it is 8:15-19:00, and the time may be changed due to special events. The weekly schedule of the official website is subject to change.
attractions.address: Piazza del Duomo, 50122 Firenze FI, Italy
reviews: very beautiful and colourful! reminded me of the sagrima familia from Spain. The line to get in to the catherdral is very long but worth it! and its free!

We bought a package which included climbing this bell tower and cathedral in the same day. Well worth the climb. The views are breathtaking if you can reach the top. Seeing the different sections of the inside are interesting also.
A serious amount of steps, I believe over 450. View are fantastic over the roof tops of Florence.
Quite a steep climb, so be sure you're up to it first. Great view of the Duomo.

15€. Yes, they make you walk all the way up and they still charge you for it! ☺Once your at the top, the view makes it all worth it! Don't leave Firenze without visit the Campanile. The ticket also allows entrance to the Cupola and the Museo del Duomo.

attractions.name: Palazzo Vecchio
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Italy, Tuscany, Florence, Palazzo Vecchio
attractions.open_status: Thu 9:00 AM - 2:00 PM, Fri - Wed 9:00 AM - 7:00 PM
reviews: Great places for pictures! There were 2 couples taking wedding pictures all around the plaza. Make sure to do some research beforehand for places.to eat since there are so many to choose from.
In this square you can find a replica of Michelangelo's David. Interestingly, the "real" David stood on this very spot for 400 years before they realized its importance and it was moved inside.
one of the many important monuments,suggestedThe offices of the comune di Firenze are there

Palazzo Vecchio is located in Piazza della Signoria and is the seat of the Commune. It represents the best synthesis of 14th-century civilian architecture and one of the most popular civic buildings in the world.Originally called "Palazzo dei Priori", it became the "Palazzo della Signoria" in the 15th century, named after the main body of the Florentine Republic; in 1540 it became a Palazzo Ducale, when Duke Cosimo I de 'Medici made his residence; finally, the Old name assumed it after 1565 when Duke Cosimo's court moved to the "new" Palazzo Pitti.From 1865 to 1871 was the seat of the Parliament of the Kingdom of Italy, while today it houses the Mayor of Florence and various municipal offices. There is also a museum where you can visit the magnificent rooms where Agnolo Bronzino, Ghirlandaio and Giorgio Vasari worked, and where Michelangelo Buonarroti, Donatello, Verrocchio's works are exhibited.
Beautiful must-see palazzo in Florence for art and history lovers.

attractions.name: Palazzo Pitti
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Italy, Tuscany, Florence, Palazzo Pitti
attractions.open_status: Palatine Art Gallery + Modern Art Museum Coupon: 8:15-18:50 (Tuesday-Sunday), stop selling tickets at 18:05, clearing off at 18:30, Monday, January 1, May 1 Closed on December 25th; Boboli Garden + Costume Museum + Silver Museum + Porcelain Museum: 8:15-16:30 (November - February), 8:15-17:30 (3 Month), 8:15-18:30 (April, May, September, October), 8:15-17:30 (October), 8:15-19:30 (June, July, August), stop the entrance 1 hour before closing, and close on the first Monday, January 1, May 1 and December 25 of the month; the Grotta Buontalenti cave in the garden is to be accompanied by a special person. The opening hours are: 11:00, 13:00, 15:00 (all year), another increase of 16:00 in March-September, and an additional 17:00 in April-September
reviews: One of the top attractions in Florence. Be sure to consider a visit here as it's full of different galleries.
Besides the beautiful gardens of the palace known as Boboli this palace walks you through all that is reflective of the time and it's opulence.
Pitti Palace was the residence of the Medici family. Inside there are museums and the magnificent Boboli garden

My favourite palazzo in Florence. If you're an art fan, do not skip the art galleries, there are some nice treats.Come walking from Uffizi, cross the postcard Ponte Vecchio, walk until you get to the palazzo. Afterwards have a stroll in the gardens, then take the bus back to the other river bank. There is one close to the palazzo gates that leaves you on Santa Croce.

When I'm overwhelmed by paintings and sculpture, I head to the Costume Gallery here, which displays 300 years of marvelous Italian creations--from 18th century principessa gowns to outrageously chic 1950s dresses.

reviews: Nice place to visit, historical and beautiful. But  be careful with scammers with pigeons, don'tlet them take picture of you.
It's an interesting place,  though I didn't have a chance to get inside,  maybe it's under reconstruction.

Lenin''s tomb, Moscow''s famous buildings. Located in the west side of red square, built by the red granite and black feldspar. Proletarian revolutionary teacher Lenin''s body that is placed in the crystal inside the building, covered with the Soviet union the national flag. , the lights of the face and hands were made by special according to clear and serene. In 1994, Lenin''s tomb, the United Nations educational, scientific and cultural organization has identified as "the history of the world cultural heritage".

The large stone mausoleum of the Soviet leader is located in the Red Square. Well worth the visit. It is free but usually you will need to queue up. You are not allowed to take photos. Outside the mausoleum is the Garden of Heroes with the graves of Stalin and other famous Russian figures.

Lenins mausoleum is a must visit when in Moscow. Lenins persevered body still lays inside the mausoleum, but probably not for long. Come here early as lines get long and it closes everyday at 1pm! The visit is totally free and worth it to see one of the most important people in Russia's history.

State Lenin Musiem located in the centre of Moscow on the Red Square. The oldest Musiem in Russia. This is a complex of sight seeing places nearby
A wonderful museum for connoisseurs of classical art and history. I recommend it for those over 40 years old.  Or those who are interested in the history of Russia.

attractions.name: Victory Park
attractions.loc_tags: Europe, Russia, Moscow region, Moscow, Victory Park
reviews: Moscow victory square, covers an area of 1350 square km, completed in May 1995, due to the memorial method against the sith war victory of the 50th anniversary of the victory square in Moscow, is the Russian people to once war memorial, with they pray for peace. Victory in the north side of the square is a set of large fountain, a long row with two rows of the graceful mushrooms of the fountain pool, for visitors to enjoy. As opposed to a fountain in the victory of the south of the square is always hagia georgi, golden dome, symbol of the holy white metope, meticulous relief, in the azure sky, exceptionally beautiful, simple and elegant appearance, has become a kind of natural beauty

In Victory Square, people nowadays simply don't know that victory was hard-won at that time. At that time, Moscow concentrated three tank armies with more than one million soldiers to Germany. One thousand seven hundred tanks, two thousand planes.

The Victory Park is very large, and it can be reached directly by subway or bus. Our tourist bus parked the car far, and then walked directly to the square through the underground passage.

The park contains the Arc de Triomphe, Victory Square, and the monument. The area is very large. It takes 15-20 minutes to walk from the Arc de Triomphe to the monument. Because we have to take the train to St. Petersburg at night, we almost use a trot to visit in the Victory Park.

As the sun sets, the entire Victory Square is orange, which is very beautiful, and the photos are also very beautiful.

The park was first built to commemorate the victory of the Anti-Fascist War, and now it serves more leisure activities for citizens, with fountains, flower stands, and deck chairs. There is a large exhibition stand in the middle of the square. Movies are being played. Many young people are comfortable lying on the lazy sofa.

Moscow City was built to commemorate the victory of the Anti-Fascist War in World War II. The five-star building on the side of the square is the Anti-Fascist War Memorial, which echoes the Victory Column on the square and forms an important landscape on the square.

It was built to commemorate the victory of the Anti-Fascist War, the Victory Pillar on the square. It is made of granite and passed more than 140 meters, representing more than 1,400 days of the Great Patriotic War. It is very spectacular.

attractions.name: Pyramid of the Sun
attractions.loc_tags: North America, Mexico, State of Mexico, San Juan Teotihuacan, Pyramid of the Sun
attractions.address: 55800 San Juan Teotihuacán, State of Mexico
reviews: At approximately 213' in height, it is the third largest pyramid in the world!  After walking a lengthy path to reach the base of this pyramid, you can then climb the nearly 250 stairs to the top!  It offers a great view of the ruins and the Pyramid of the Moon.

My friend, Gloria, told me that this was the last year to climb the Pyramid of the Sun, so I agreed right away to go to Mexico City. We booked a tour (through Trip Advisor) with transportation to and from our hotel with a lunch included. It was almost 500 steps up in high altitude. I took my time and stopped along the way. It sure was an accomplishment!
Pyramid of the sun was built in the 2nd century AD. It was a place of the gods and it's the third largest pyramid in the world which stands over 230 feet.
Dramatic and thrilling, these pyramids are incredible to see and are an essential part of a great Mexico City experience.

The history of Teotihuacan dates back to around 150 BCE when it was a large Aztec settlement. As other settlements in the area diminished, it continued to flourish and became the religious and economic center. Today is one of the most frequently visited archaeological sites in the world and is composed of 2 ancient pyramids. The site is impressive for its scale, both in the size of the Pyramid of the Sun (the third largest pyramid in the world at 215 feet) and the majesty of the Calle de los Muertos, or the Street of the Dead, which was originally 4km long and surrounded by temples, palaces, and platforms. By car it takes about 45 minutes to reach from the city center.

attractions.name: Mexico City Cathedral
attractions.loc_tags: North America, Mexico, Federal District, Mexico City, Mexico City Cathedral
attractions.address: Constitution Square, Centro, Cuauhtémoc, Federal District, Mexico City
reviews: You really feel the extraordinary architecture and organ sound that touch you. The view inside and outside the church is very real, you will see it is built on the Mayan temple. There are also government-organized guides serving customers. There are some vendors on the more neat side of the lobby and if you want to buy some souvenirs at the church take pesos and don't accept dollars or Canadian dollars. It is really a great attraction

The Mexico City Cathedral is located on the Constitution Square in Mexico City. The view from a distance is very magnificent, and the decoration is magnificent and exquisite. However, due to the settlement of the stratum here, it seems that there are some cracks and tilts inside. This does not affect the largest and oldest Catholic church on the American continent, but adds to the charm of his visit.

The Metropolitan Cathedral of Mexico City is located on the north side of the Pillar Square and is one of the largest and most historic churches in Mexico City. When I went there, I caught up with internal activities, and I ran three times before reaching the innermost point. It is said that the bricks used in the church came from a large temple not far away. After the Spanish invaded, the temple was demolished to build this church.

Mexico City Cathedral is a 300-year-old Spanish church building. His exterior walls are beautifully carved, and the interior decoration is very luxurious and splendid. He is the largest church in Mexico City, and every day many devout believers come to pray, very solemn.

The main church of Mexico City, located next to the Constitution Square, is the largest in North America, with a style similar to that of the southern Spanish church, with a splendid main hall and a large side hall. We also happened to meet a group of nuns to visit.

attractions.name: Palacio Nacional
attractions.loc_tags: North America, Mexico, Federal District, Mexico City, Palacio Nacional
reviews: The National Palace is another great free attraction, definitely a must to see the masterpieces of Diego Rivera's frescoes. The second floor terrace area shows in chronological order from the arrival of the Pyrenees to the grandeur of the revolutionary period.

Mexico National Palace (Presidential Palace)
📍Location: Located in the northeast corner of Constitution Square in Mexico City.
🚆Means of transportation: Take the subway to Zocalo and get off at Syntagma Station (By the way, it is worth mentioning that the signs of the subway station are various patterns, even if you are not familiar with the place, you will never get off the wrong station.)
🚧Opening hours: Tuesday～Sunday 9:00～17:00, closed on Monday
🎫Ticket:🆓free
As long as valid documents (passports for tourists) are mortgaged, you can enter and visit for free.
⚠️Recommended visiting time: 2～3 hours
⚱️Recommendation reason:
🔹The National Palace has witnessed several regime changes in Mexico City, and the current president still works here. Except for rooms with closed doors, most rooms can be visited at will. Maybe which closed door is the president's office?
🔸In this presidential palace, you can see many statues and portraits in eye-catching places. This is the Mexican national hero Benito Juárez. Not only the Mexicans, but the American people also respect and adore this patriot.
🔹Mexican national treasure painter Diego Rivera (Frida Carlo's husband) painted a huge picture of Mexican history on the wall of the central courtyard has also become a highlight here. Of course, because of Rivera, the face of the female painter Frida is often seen inadvertently during the visit.
📝Travel tips:
🔺The gate is on the north side of the presidential palace, and you need to send packages when you enter. Many people only need to hold one passport.
🔺All signs of the Presidential Palace are in Spanish. Remember to download a real-time translation software.
🔺The traces of the Swiss Aztecs have disappeared, mainly Spanish-style buildings, but the interior layout of many rooms is still displayed in the original state as much as possible, which can be regarded as a reproduction of the original scene.
🔺In addition to the courtyard, there is also a museum. The exhibits on display are also worth seeing.

It occupies one side of Zócalo Square, a long row of palaces that visitors will see as soon as they come to the square. The original site here was Aztec Palace, the Spanish demolished it and built another palace. After Mexico became independent in 1821, it was used as the presidential residence, and it is still the office of the president and the Ministry of Finance. There are a number of large murals in the palace, all of which were created by the world-famous Mexican artist Diego Rivera. These murals occupies many corridors and stairs in the palace, vividly depicting the history of Mexico, including the ancient civilization, the Spanish invasion and the war of independence, very interesting.

The National Palace in Mexico City has large murals created by the famous painter Diago Rivera. This mural completely describes the development history of Mexico, from the Mayan civilization, to the Spanish colonial period, and to the current independence. It is really very vivid, and you must come and visit this greatness. Masterpiece.

On the east side of the Plaza de Constitution, Mexico City, is the National Palace, where you can see its long walls. Entry to the National Palace requires security checks for passports, so you have to wait in line. The attractions include the former president's memorial, the national history museum, the most famous giant mural in Diego Rivera, and the small tropical botanical garden in the national palace courtyard.

reviews: A good place to go

As you can see, the old church is all tilted, so mass is held in the new church (the wedding ceremony is being held on the day).

The Basilica of Our Lady of Guadalupe is listed as a Catholic wonder of the world. It is located at the foot of the Sacred Mountain of Tepeac, not far from the Mexican metropolitan area. It is a group of buildings built on the hillside. Moreover, the Madonna of Guadalupe on the altar can be seen from any angle. The most precious objects in the church are the statue of Our Lady of Guadalupe hanging on the wall in the middle of the altar and the crown on the statue of Our Lady.

The church in the northeast of Mexico City is not far from the North Bus Station. You can consider visiting the Pyramid of the Sun and Moon. Although it is far from the city center, it is strongly recommended not to miss it. Both the appearance and the internal layout are very different from the general churches, and it is said that this church is also very famous inside the Catholic Church.

It is a modern city people's paradise, with a beautiful landscape and natural scenery. The park is conveniently located only 40 minutes drive from Shenzhen International Airport and Railway Station. It is the only eco-tourism scenic spot in Shenzhen that combines dining, guest room, hot springs and recreational activities.

Very good to see and very good to walk around, the whole environment is very good, like this style of the attractions, I personally think it is quite suitable for the weekend holiday with the whole family to walk here, very good.

The hot spring is in the scenic area, and the overall environment is quite good. After soaking, you can walk around in the scenic area. The water temperature is right, and there is a thermometer beside the pool, which will display the temperature for easy selection. There are also a variety of traditional Chinese medicine therapy pools, massages, saunas, and rest rooms.

Mingyu idyllic mountains and clear waters, mountains and water around, known as small Guilin. Here the bamboo around the shore, farmhouse decoration, the wooden bridge across, rice ears, farmers, children, the shepherds, beautiful scenery, beautiful and elegant, very rich in the south country idyllic flavor. [Rose]

reviews: lovely place who are looking for seaside life , food and hotels are cheap

not bad but its also cost you money. I dont like this place dor this. the beach is nit so big. the place is not also so interesting. if you visited 大梅沙 , i think then you shouldnt visit 小梅沙， but comparing both- 大梅沙 is crowdy because its free. if you wanna feel the sea with fun and peace 小梅沙 us for you then

Xiaomeisha Resort is a long beach in the eastern part of Shenzhen City, Yantian, Guangdong Province, known as the "Eastern Hawaii". It is surrounded by three green mountains, a blue sea, a crescent-like beach inlaid between the blue sky and the blue waves. Xiaomeisha environment is elegant, the air is fresh, beautiful mountains and water adds a lot of spirits to Xiaomeisha, generous nature has made her into the ideal city people's seaside resort. Oncoming sea breeze, let you enjoy the comfort of the holiday, is a good place for the holiday.

The resort ticket is 50 yuan, if not for a holiday, it is not worth it. The scenery is good, and the beach is beautiful. There are many people in the peak season, you can swim and sun on the beach. However, you can enjoy the beautiful scenery by taking the path, you don't have to buy tickets.

Xiaomeisha has a nice view, pleasant scenery, comfortable temperature, and it feels very good. It is suitable for bringing children to play on the beach. The sand is very fine and soft. Looking at the sea, it is interesting and cost-effective, not bad!
